abandon oneself to	<font color=blue size=4>abandon oneself to</font>\n<br>give oneself up completely to a feeling or desire 放任；纵情；（感情）陷于；沉溺于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He abandoned himself to grief. 他陷于悲伤之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never abandon yourself to despair. 切勿自暴自弃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You mustn't abandon yourself to pleasures. 你不该一味享乐。</font>\n
abide by	<font color=blue size=4>abide by</font>\n<br>1. be faithful to; obey; keep to; adhere to 严守；遵守；坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you join the club, you must abide by its rules. 你参加这个俱乐部就得遵守其规章。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect him to abide by his decision to help us. 我希望他能坚持他帮助我们的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Both sides should strictly abide by the contract. 双方应恪守本合同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Californians and New Englanders abide by the same federal laws. 加利福尼亚人和新英格兰人遵守同样的联邦法律。</font>\n<br>2. fulfil 履行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having made our decision, we must abide by it. 我们既已作出决定，就应该照着办。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will abide by her promise. 她会履行诺言的。</font>\n<br>3. suffer the consequences of 承担…的后果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You two will have to abide by the inevitable. 你们两个人不得不承受那无可幸免的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he'd abide by all possible consequences. 他说他将承担一切可能的后果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must abide by the results of your mistakes. 你必须承担由你的错误所造成的后果。</font>\n
a bit	<font color=blue size=4>a bit</font>\n<br>1. rather 相当地；有点（用作状语）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am a bit tired. 我有点累了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She calmed down a bit. 她冷静一点了。</font>\n<br>2. not at all; not in the least（用于否定句中）一点不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't care a bit about the matter. 他一点儿也没把这件事放在心上。</font>\n
a bit of	<font color=blue size=4>a bit of</font>\n<br>a small piece or amount of 少量的；少许的（常用于修饰不可数名词）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She gave me a bit of good advice. 她给了我一些好的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know a bit of Spanish. 我懂一点西班牙语。</font>\n
a bit of a	<font color=blue size=4>a bit of a</font>\n<br>to some degree 有点；稍有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a bit of a thief. 他有点贼头贼脑的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man is a bit of a scholar. 那个年轻人有点学者派头。</font>\n
abound in/with	<font color=blue size=4>abound in/with</font>\n<br>1. exist in plenty 盛产；富于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lake abounds in fish. 湖里鱼很多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The district abounds with mineral deposits. 这地区的矿藏很丰富。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That region abounds with rain all the year round. 那个地区终年多雨。</font>\n<br>2. be full of 充满着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book abounds in printing mistakes. 该书中印刷错误比比皆是。</font>\n
above all	<font color=blue size=4>above all</font>\n<br>1. especially; before everything else 尤其\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He loves music, and above all classical music. 他喜欢音乐，尤其是古典音乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never waste anything, but above all never waste time. 任何东西都不可浪费，尤其不可浪费时间。</font>\n<br>2. most important of all 最重要的是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In choosing the curtains for a room, you should consider the weight, its pattern—but its colour above all. 在挑选窗帘时，要考虑布料的质地、轻重、图案，但最重要的是颜色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I should like to rent a house, modern, comfortable, above all in a quiet neighbourhood. 我想租一幢现代化的舒适的房子，最重要的是环境要幽静。</font>\n
above suspicion	<font color=blue size=4>above suspicion</font>\n<br>beyond doubt 无可置疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His conduct is above suspicion. 他的行为是无可置疑的。</font>\n
abreast of	<font color=blue size=4>abreast of</font>\n<br>knowing all the time the most recent facts 了解最新信息；跟上最新发展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should be abreast of the time. 我们应跟上时代的发展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The reporter must keep abreast of new developments. 记者必须跟上最新发展。</font>\n
absent from	<font color=blue size=4>absent from</font>\n<br>not present 缺席；未到场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was absent from the meeting yesterday. 她昨天未出席会议。</font>\n
absolve from	<font color=blue size=4>absolve from</font>\n<br>declare sb. free from (guilt, blame, duty) 解除；赦免；开脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is absolved from the crime. 他被赦免了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager absolved him from an obligation. 经理免除了他一项责任。</font>\n
absorbed in	<font color=blue size=4>absorbed in</font>\n<br>giving all one's attention to 沉湎于；全神贯注于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time passes quickly when you are absorbed in reading a good book. 当你沉醉于阅读一本好书时，时间会过得很快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so absorbed in his work that he didn't see me. 他全神贯注于工作之中，没有看到我。</font>\n
absorb into	<font color=blue size=4>absorb into</font>\n<br>take in 吸收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many intellectuals have been absorbed into the Party. 许多知识分子被吸收入党了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Animals absorb foods into their bodies. 动物将食物吸收进体内。</font>\n
abstain from	<font color=blue size=4>abstain from</font>\n<br>prevent oneself from doing sth. 避免；避开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His family have always abstained from drinking. 他一家人从来不喝酒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leader asked his workers to abstain from voting. 那位领导人要求工人们放弃选举。</font>\n
abstract from	<font color=blue size=4>abstract from</font>\n<br>take sth. out of sth. else; separate 提取；抽出；摘录…的要点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The article was abstracted from a longer book. 这篇文章是一本厚书的提要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Scientists can abstract precious medicines from some ordinary plants. 科学家们可以从一些普通的植物中提取珍贵的药品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is known to all that metal can be abstracted from ore. 众所周知，金属能从矿石中提炼出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief abstracted the purse from her pocket. 这小偷从她的衣袋中偷走了钱包。</font>\n
abundant in	<font color=blue size=4>abundant in</font>\n<br>having a great quantity of; having more than enough 大量的；丰富的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>China covers a vast territory and is abundant in natural resources. 中国地域辽阔，资源丰富。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ocean floor near the continents is abundant in mineral and oil deposits. 靠近大陆的海底矿藏和石油藏量丰富。</font>\n
accede to	<font color=blue size=4>accede to</font>\n<br>1. give approval to (a request, agreement, an application, etc.) 同意；批准；应允（要求、请求、申请等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are ready to accede to your request for further information. 你们如果还需要数据，我们乐于随时提供。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not accede to my request. 她不曾答应我的请求。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My application was acceded to. 我的申请获得了批准。</font>\n<br>2. follow sb. and take (a position) ; enter upon (an office) 接任；就职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Last week she acceded to the mayor. 上星期她就任市长。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prince acceded to the throne. 这位王子继承了王位。</font>\n<br>3. join (a party, an agreement, a country, etc.) 加入；参加（党派、协议、国家等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have acceded to the Party. 他们入党了。</font>\n
accept as	<font color=blue size=4>accept as</font>\n<br>believe that (sb. or sth.) is (what he／she／it is claimed to be) 承认；认可；同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I accept this statement as truth. 我认为这个论断是正确的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The king accepted the man as his son. 国王承认那人是他的儿子。</font>\n
according as	<font color=blue size=4>according as</font>\n<br>in a manner that depends upon 依照；根据（后接从句）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may take an oral or written exam according as you prefer. 你可根据你的喜爱进行口头或笔头考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One may succeed according as one has ideal and will power. 人的成功全在于理想和意志。</font>\n
according to	<font color=blue size=4>according to</font>\n<br>1. in accordance with 根据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>According to his uncle, the boy is a goodfornothing. 据男孩的叔父说，他是个无用之人。</font>\n<br>2. in agreement with; corresponding to 依据；依照；与…相符（后接名词）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must be prepared to modify our plans according to any new circumstances that may arise. 我们务必准备根据可能出现的新情况改变计划。</font>\n
accord with	<font color=blue size=4>accord with</font>\n<br>match; be in agreement with 一致；符合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That does not accord with what you said yesterday. 那件事和你昨天说的不一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he did doesn't accord with what he said. 他言行不一。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It also accords with the general law of development of things. 这也符合事物发展的普遍规律。</font>\n
account for	<font color=blue size=4>account for</font>\n<br>1. explain; give a reason for 解释；说明…的原因\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How do you account for the accident? 你如何解释这次事故的原因？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We asked him to account for his conduct. 我们要他对自己的行为加以解释。</font>\n<br>2. give a statement to show how money or goods have been dealt with 说明（钱等的）用途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to account for losing such a large sum of money. 丢了这么一大笔钱，你务必解释清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must account for every cent we spent. 我们花掉的每一分钱，都要有个交代。</font>\n<br>3. be responsible for 负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The librarian has to account for each book in his charge. 图书管理员应对所管的每一本书负责。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to account for the misprints in the article. 你必须对文章中的印刷错误负责。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will take him 20 years in prison to account for such a terrible crime. 他犯有严重罪行，将在监狱中监禁20年。</font>\n<br>4. occupy; amount to（数量）占；共计达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In that country, the production of raw materials accounts for a considerable proportion of the national economy. 在那个国家，原材料生产在国民经济中占相当大的比重。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>League members account for the majority of the students in the class. 团员占这个班学生的大多数。</font>\n
accuse of	<font color=blue size=4>accuse of</font>\n<br>blame; say that sb. is guilty of; charge sb. with breaking the law 谴责；控告\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We accusea him of having broken his promise. 我们指责他没有遵守诺言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She accused her brother of stealing the jewels. 她指控弟弟偷了珠宝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was accused of treason. 他被指控有叛国罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everybody knows he was wrongly accused of. 谁都知道他受到诬告。</font>\n
accustomed to	<font color=blue size=4>accustomed to</font>\n<br>used to; being in the habit of 习惯于（to 后面接名词、动名词或动词原形）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is accustomed to working hard. 他工作很努力，已经成习惯了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She isn't accustomed to public speaking. 她不太习惯在公开场合讲话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was not accustomed to leave home during the winter. 她过去不习惯冬天离家。</font>\n
a couple of	<font color=blue size=4>a couple of</font>\n<br>1. two 二个\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll come back in a couple of weeks. 我两周后就回来。</font>\n<br>2. several 几个\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's have a couple of drinks. 我们喝几杯吧。</font>\n
acquaint with	<font color=blue size=4>acquaint with</font>\n<br>1. make familiar with 熟悉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We acquainted him with our plan. 我们将计划告诉了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should acquaint yourself with the facts before making a decision. 在作出一项决定之前要熟悉各种情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These books acquaint Chinese readers with the ancient cultures of these lands. 这些书帮助中国读者了解这些地区的古代文化。</font>\n<br>2. make sb. know 认识；知道\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am not acquainted with the lady. 我与这位女士不相识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He quickly got acquainted with his new duties. 他很快地熟悉了新工作。</font>\n
acquit of	<font color=blue size=4>acquit of</font>\n<br>declare that sb. is not guilty of doing wrong 宣告…无罪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They acquitted him of murder. 他们宣布他没犯谋杀罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man was acquitted of the crime. 那个年轻人被宣判无罪。</font>\n
act as	<font color=blue size=4>act as</font>\n<br>1. do the work of; serve as 当作；充当\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A trained dog can act as a guide to a blind person. 一条经过训练的狗可以给盲人当向导。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of tea act as an aid to digestion. 这种茶助消化。</font>\n<br>2. play the role of 担任…的角色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of his friends acted as the gobetween. 他的一个朋友充当了中间人的角色。</font>\n
act for	<font color=blue size=4>act for</font>\n<br>serve as an agent of; represent 代理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will act for the chairman on the matter. 他将代理主席处理这件事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since Mr. Wang fell ill, his son has been acting for him in all his affairs. 因王先生生病，他的儿子一直代他处理一切事务。</font>\n
act on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>act on/upon</font>\n<br>1. exert influence on 产生影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine acted on his fever at once. 这种药很快使他退烧了。</font>\n<br>2. follow; behave according to 遵照（行事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She acted on the doctor's advice. 她遵医嘱行事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should act upon this letter at once, or it will be too late. 你应该马上按这封信的意思去做，不然就会太晚了。</font>\n
act up to	<font color=blue size=4>act up to</font>\n<br>put into practice; behave in such a way that one's actions are in accord with (expectations, a promise, one's reputation, etc.) 按照（期望、诺言、自己的声誉等）行事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you say means very little unless you act up to it. 你要是说而不做，你的话就没有多大意思了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you'll act up to the good advice they've given you. 我希望你能按照他们给你出的好主意办。</font>\n
addicted to	<font color=blue size=4>addicted to</font>\n<br>1. very much interested in 沉溺于；醉心于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice is addicted to music. 艾丽斯酷爱音乐。</font>\n<br>2. having increasing need of (esp. taking drugs) （吸毒等）成瘾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He became addicted to the drug. 他吸毒成瘾。</font>\n
add on	<font color=blue size=4>add on</font>\n<br>add as an extra or extras 追加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please add these names on to your list? 请把这几个名字补加到你的名单里好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Add the other items on at the bottom of the page. 把别的项目加在这页的下端。</font>\n
address oneself to	<font color=blue size=4>address oneself to</font>\n<br>1. work at; be busy with 着手（致力于）做；忙于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time we addressed ourselves to the business in hand. 是动手做我们手上事情的时候了。</font>\n<br>2. speak to; talk to 向…讲话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president addressed himself to the public on TV. 总统向公众发表电视讲话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We addressed ourselves to the dean that we were eager to work in Tibet. 我们对系主任说，我们盼着去西藏工作。</font>\n
add to	<font color=blue size=4>add to</font>\n<br>make greater; increase 增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can add another room to the house. 这所房子我们还可以加盖一个房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two added to five makes seven. 2加5等于7。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This adds to their difficulties. 这增加了他们的困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't want to add to your troubles. 我不想给你增加麻烦。</font>\n
add up	<font color=blue size=4>add up</font>\n<br>1. put together 加起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Add these figures up and see what the total is. 把这些数字加起来，看看总数是多少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The numbers wouldn't add up. 这些数字加起来与总数不符。</font>\n<br>2. assess; help 估计；权衡；有所帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They added up all the advantages and disadvantages and tried to come to a decision. 他们权衡了所有的利弊得失，试图做出决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doing morning exercise every day will add up. 天天做早操有益于健康。</font>\n<br>3. make sense; present a reasonable picture 有意义；合情合理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His excuse just doesn't add up. 他的借口简直没有道理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing he does seems to add up. 他的所作所为似乎没有意义。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His story didn't add up. 他的故事不合情理。</font>\n
add up to	<font color=blue size=4>add up to</font>\n<br>1. amount to; make a total of 合计，总共\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money he spent added up to more than ＄ 1, 000. 他花的钱合计超过了1000美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bills add up to exactly ￡1, 000. 这些账单加起来正好1000英镑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Eight and ten add up to eighteen. 8加10等于18。</font>\n<br>2. mean; signify 意味着；意思是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The evidence all adds up to a case of murder. 全部证据都表明这是一件谋杀案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain, the mosquitoes and the crowded cabin all added up to a spoiled vacation. 下雨、蚊子和拥挤的小屋，意味着这假期过得糟透了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His long answer just adds up to a refusal. 他的冗长的回答实际上意味着拒绝。</font>\n
adhere to	<font color=blue size=4>adhere to</font>\n<br>1. stick to 粘住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wet clothes adhere to the skin. 湿衣服会贴在身上。</font>\n<br>2. follow steadily; be faithful to 坚持；忠实于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They adhered to the original plan of climbing the mountain in spite of the bad weather. 尽管天气恶劣，他们还是坚持原先的登山计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mass line must be adhered to. 一定要坚持走群众路线。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He resolutely adhered to what he had said at the meeting; he had not changed his mind anyway. 他坚持他在会上说过的话，一点也没改变主意。</font>\n
adjust to	<font color=blue size=4>adjust to</font>\n<br>1. become used to 适应于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't adjust easily to the life in North China. 他不容易适应中国北方的生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will have to adjust herself to new conditions. 她必须使自己适应新的环境。</font>\n<br>2. change sth. to fit 调整；调节\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can adjust the belt to the size you want. 你可以根据自己的需要调整安全带。</font>\n
admit of	<font color=blue size=4>admit of</font>\n<br>leave room for 容许；有…的余地；有…可能\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This work admits of no delay. 这件工作不得延误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This admits of no excuse. 这是不容辩解的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This regulation does not admit of our doing that. 按规定我们不能这样做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your problems did not really admit of any solution. 你的问题真是没有解决的可能。</font>\n
admit to	<font color=blue size=4>admit to</font>\n<br>1. allow to enter 许可入场（入会、入学等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to pass the professional examinations to be admitted to the society. 要加入这个学会你得经过专业考试。</font>\n<br>2. tell the truth about; confess to 承认\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She admitted to being easily annoyed. 她承认自己易生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man admitted to stealing the money. 那个年轻人承认偷了钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He admitted to taking these goods without paying for them. 他承认他拿了这些东西没有付钱。</font>\n
adopt as	<font color=blue size=4>adopt as</font>\n<br>take (sb. , esp. a child) into one's family as a relation 收养\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The family have adopted three children as their own. 这个家庭已经收养了3个孩子。</font>\n
advance on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>advance on/upon</font>\n<br>threaten by moving towards 逼近；靠近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy advanced on Rome, and at last conquered it. 敌军向罗马城逼近，最后攻陷了它。</font>\n
adverse to	<font color=blue size=4>adverse to</font>\n<br>1. unfavourable to 对…不利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The judgement was adverse to the plaintiff. 判决不利于原告。</font>\n<br>2. contrary to 与…相反\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His opinion is adverse to mine. 他的观点同我的相反。</font>\n
advise about/on	<font color=blue size=4>advise about/on</font>\n<br>give sb. advice about; give advice to 劝告；向…提意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doctors advise about many things other than medicine. 除了用药之外，医生还劝告人们注意许多别的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Experienced sailors will advise you about sailing in this weather. 有经验的水手会对如何在这种天气行船给你提出忠告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you advised on making our plan? 你对我们制定计划提过什么建议吗？</font>\n
advise of	<font color=blue size=4>advise of</font>\n<br>give information or warning about 告诉；提醒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll advise you of her coming and going. 我会告诉你她的行踪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company has advised the drivers of the thick mists on the mountains. 公司提醒驾驶员注意山上的大雾。</font>\n
afraid of	<font color=blue size=4>afraid of</font>\n<br>fearful of 担心；害怕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is afraid of hurting her feelings. 他怕伤她的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was probably afraid of embarrassing me. 他可能不愿使我难堪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This young man is afraid of nothing. 这个年轻人什么也不怕。</font>\n
afraid to	<font color=blue size=4>afraid to</font>\n<br>worried; filled with apprehension 不敢；因害怕会有…结果而不敢做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is very much afraid to go out alone at night. 他很害怕晚上一个人出去。</font>\n
after a fashion	<font color=blue size=4>after a fashion</font>\n<br>a little; not very well 勉强；马马虎虎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can speak Russian after a fashion. 她勉强能讲点俄语。</font>\n
after all	<font color=blue size=4>after all</font>\n<br>1. everything being considered 毕竟；总之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After all, he is your father. 他毕竟是你的父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't get discouraged by setbacks; we are new to the work after all. 别因挫折而灰心，这工作对我们来说毕竟还是新的。</font>\n<br>2. nevertheless; in spite of what has happened 到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hasn't finished the work, but, after all, he is a very busy man. 他还没有完成那项工作，但说到底他是一个很忙的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She failed after all. 她到底还是失败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob thought he couldn't go to the party because he had too much homework, but he went after all. 虽然鲍勃因有太多的家庭作业而认为不能参加聚会，但他终于还是去了。</font>\n
again and again	<font color=blue size=4>again and again</font>\n<br>repeatedly 一再\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I advised him again and again not to do it. 我再三劝告他不要做那件事。</font>\n
against a rainy day	<font color=blue size=4>against a rainy day</font>\n<br>in anticipation of, and as a provision for, some event that is expected to occur in the future 未雨绸缪；以备不时之需\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must save up some money against a rainy day. 我们必须积蓄一些钱以备不时之需。</font>\n
against one's will	<font color=blue size=4>against one's will</font>\n<br>contrary to one's desires or wishes; unwillingly 不情愿地；勉强地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was married against his will. 他违心地结了婚。</font>\n
a great deal	<font color=blue size=4>a great deal</font>\n<br>a very large amount 很多东西（情况、事情）；很多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have learneu a great deal from you. 我向你学到了许多东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It has rained a great deal recently. 最近雨水很多。</font>\n
a great/good deal of	<font color=blue size=4>a great/good deal of</font>\n<br>much; a large amount of 许多的；大量的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spent a great deal of time in writing the book. 他写这本书花了大量的时间。</font>\n
a great/good many	<font color=blue size=4>a great/good many</font>\n<br>many 很多的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have known each other for a great many years. 他们相识已经有许多年了。</font>\n
agree on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>agree on/upon</font>\n<br>1. have the same opinion about 就…取得相同的意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Musicians rarely agree on the way a piece of music should be played. 对于一支曲子应该怎样演奏，音乐家们很少有相同的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two sides agreed on a cease fire. 双方达成了停火协议。</font>\n<br>2. decide on 决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We agreed on leaving there the next day. 我们一致同意第 2天离开那里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've agreed on fighting the evil in society. 我们决定同社会上的邪恶作斗争。</font>\n
agree to	<font color=blue size=4>agree to</font>\n<br>approve; say “yes”to; consent 同意；赞同；接受（想法、计划、建议等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you agree to my plan? 你赞同我的计划吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee has agreed to his arrangement. 委员会已同意了他的安排。</font>\n
agree with	<font color=blue size=4>agree with</font>\n<br>1. have the same opinion as; approve of 同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't agree with you on this matter. 在这个问题上我不同意你的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't agree with a single word that you have said. 你刚才说的话，我一点也不赞成。</font>\n<br>2. suit; be good for 适合；适宜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The climate there does not agree with her. 那里的气候对她不适宜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rich food doesn't agree with her. 油腻的食品不合她的胃口。</font>\n<br>3. coincide with; be the same as 相一致；相等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bill does not agree with your estimate. 账单与你原来的估计不符。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His explanation agrees with the facts. 他的解释同事实是相符的。</font>\n<br>4. approve of 赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't agree with people drinking brandy all day long. 我不赞成人们成天喝白兰地。</font>\n
aim at	<font color=blue size=4>aim at</font>\n<br>1. point or direct (gun, etc.) towards 瞄准；对准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The marksman aimed at the centre of the target. 射手瞄准了靶心。</font>\n<br>2. make an effort towards; try to gain 立志要；目的在于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He aimed at becoming a professor. 他立志要当一名教授。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This dictionary aims at explaining the most common mistakes in word use. 本词典旨在解释用词上最常见的错误。</font>\n
aim for	<font color=blue size=4>aim for</font>\n<br>have as the ultimate objective 以…为最终目的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This year they are aiming for 250million yuan. 今年他们的目标是2亿5千万元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We aim for the completion of the task by the end of the year. 我们的最终目的是到今年年底完成这项任务。</font>\n
alert to	<font color=blue size=4>alert to</font>\n<br>warn sb. about 使警觉；提醒某人注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must alert the people to the dangers facing our country. 我们必须提醒人民注意国家所面临的危险。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must alert them to the need to solve these problems. 我们必须提醒他们有必要解决这些问题。</font>\n
alive to	<font color=blue size=4>alive to</font>\n<br>1. knowing about 感觉到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is alive to the dangers of the work. 他清楚地知道这件工作的危险性。</font>\n<br>2. sensitive to 对…敏感\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is alive to the consequences. 他对这些结果很敏感。</font>\n
all alone	<font color=blue size=4>all alone</font>\n<br>1. by oneself; independently 自己；独立地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has completed the task all alow. 他独立完成了这项任务。</font>\n<br>2. being the only one; without others 独自地；孤零零地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The small cabin stands on the hillside all alone. 那房子孤零零地座落在山坡上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sat in her room reading all alone. 她独自坐在房里看书。</font>\n
all along	<font color=blue size=4>all along</font>\n<br>1. for the whole length of 一路；沿途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We saw green hills and forests all along the way. 沿途所见，皆是青青的小山和森林。</font>\n<br>2. all the time; from the beginning 一直；自始至终\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager said he suspected the man of stealing the paper all along. 经理说他一直都怀疑是那个人偷了文件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've been nice to me all along, and I appreciate it very much. 您一贯对我好，我非常感激。</font>\n
all asleep	<font color=blue size=4>all asleep</font>\n<br>pass gently into sleep 入睡；睡熟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They both stretched their weary limbs, and fell fast asleep. 他们俩伸开疲倦的腿睡着了。</font>\n
all at once	<font color=blue size=4>all at once</font>\n<br>1. all of a sudden; suddenly; unexpectedly 突然；出乎预料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All at once they found themselves surrounded by the enemy. 他们突然发现自己被敌人包围了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All at once she decided she wasn't going. She didn't explain why. 她突然决定不去了，她没有讲明理由。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All at once we heard a shot and the soldier fell to the ground. 突然我们听到枪声，接着士兵就倒下去了。</font>\n<br>2. at the same time; together 同时；一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he heard the news, he was happy and sad all at once and didn't know what to do. 听到这消息，他悲喜交集，不知所措。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She couldn't tell them more about the accident. Everything just seemed to have happened all at once. 她不可能向他们讲述更多的事情，一切都似乎是同时发生的。</font>\n<br>3. without delay 马上；即刻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We just can't decide such an important thing all at once. 我们只是不能马上决定这样一件重要的事情。</font>\n
all but	<font color=blue size=4>all but</font>\n<br>1. all except 除…外；都\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All but three of the girls have passed the examination. 除了 3个女生，其余的学生都通过了考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shipwrecked people were rescued all but one. 船只失事，遇难者除一人以外全部得救。</font>\n<br>2. almost; very nearly 几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was all but bankrupt and couldn't help us. 他几乎破产了，不能帮助我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was all but run over by the car. 那女孩差点被那辆小汽车压过去。</font>\n
all down on	<font color=blue size=4>all down on</font>\n<br>fail to fulfil; fail (in a job, etc.) 没有完成；在（工作等）中失败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has fallen down on the job. 他工作失败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has fallen down so often on her promises that I no longer believe a word she says. 她常常违背自己的诺言，以致于我对她的话一句也不相信了。</font>\n
all ears/eyes	<font color=blue size=4>all ears/eyes</font>\n<br>attentive (by listening or looking closely) 全神贯注地倾听（注视）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now children, I want you to be all ears in class. 孩子们，我要求你们在课堂上专心听讲。</font>\n
all in	<font color=blue size=4>all in</font>\n<br>exhausted 疲惫不堪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were all in after a whole day's work. 工作了一整天，他们都精疲力竭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When night comes, I am all in. 夜幕来临，我精疲力竭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was all in at the end of the race. 他跑到终点时已精疲力竭。</font>\n
all in all	<font color=blue size=4>all in all</font>\n<br>1. all things considered; as a whole 就整体来说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All in all this is a good film. 总的说来，这是一部很好的电影。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All in all, it was a pleasant cruise today. 总之，今天的水上旅行是愉快的。</font>\n<br>2. the main object of love and devotion 最心爱的人；最珍重的物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The daughter was all in all to him. 女儿是他的掌上明珠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Music was his all in all. 他最喜欢的就是音乐。</font>\n<br>3. the most important or decisive matter 最重要的东西\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Money is all in all to her. 金钱对她来说是最重要的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Grammar is not all in all in learning a foreign language. 在外语学习中，语法并不是头等重要的。</font>\n
all of a sudden	<font color=blue size=4>all of a sudden</font>\n<br>quickly, without advance warning 突然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It started out to be a beautiful day. Then, all of a sudden, it became cloudy and began to rain. 开始，天气晴朗。后来，突然多云而且开始下雨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of a sudden a man burst out of the building, and made off down the road. 突然，一个人从大楼里冲出来，沿着大路逃跑。</font>\n
all out of	<font color=blue size=4>all out of</font>\n<br>1.drop out of 从…掉下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three baby birds fell out of the nest. 3只幼鸟从窝中掉了下来。</font>\n<br>2. cease to enjoy 失去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the language grows, new words are introduced and many words have fallen out of use. 随着语言的发展，新词不断被采用，而许多词不断被废弃。</font>\n<br>3. give up; cease to practice 放弃；不实行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bad habits are easy to fall into but not so easy to fall out of. 坏的习惯养成容易而改掉难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now the Chinese people have fallen out of wearing long gowns.现在中国人已经不穿长袍了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to fall out of smoking on account of his baby's health. 考虑到他孩子的健康，他不得不戒掉抽烟这个习惯。</font>\n
allow for	<font color=blue size=4>allow for</font>\n<br>1. take into consideration; make concession for 考虑到；体谅到；对…让步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to allow for the boy's age. 你应该体谅到孩子的年龄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Allowing for bad weather, we should set off at once. 考虑到天气不好，我们应该马上动身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company will allow for extra expenditure next year. 公司将考虑到明年的额外开支。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better start earlier; you should allow for traffic delays. 你们还是早些出发为好，要考虑到路上交通会有耽搁。</font>\n<br>2. provide for; have room for; Permit 供给；允许\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must allow an hour for the meeting. 我们必须留出一小时来开会。</font>\n
allow of	<font color=blue size=4>allow of</font>\n<br>admit of giving the possiblility of 容许；容得；有…可能\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The facts allow of no other explanation. 事实不容曲解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His weakened condition would not allow of his being sent to town. 他身体虚弱，已不可能把他送进城了。</font>\n
all round	<font color=blue size=4>all round</font>\n<br>1. on all sldes; in every direction 在…周围；到处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was foggy all round. 四周都是浓雾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From all round we heard the laughter of children. 我们到处都听见孩子们的笑声。</font>\n<br>2. wholly; on every side 全部\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're good all round. I haven't any criticism. 你全都很好，我对你没有任何批评意见。</font>\n
all the more	<font color=blue size=4>all the more</font>\n<br>to an even greater degree 更；格外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He loved his wife and children, but he loved his country all the more. 他爱妻子儿女，但是他更爱祖国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know you find the subject difficult, but that is all the more reason why yod should work hard at it. 我知道你感到这门学科困难，但这就是你更加应该努力钻研它的理由。</font>\n
all the same	<font color=blue size=4>all the same</font>\n<br>1. of no difference 一样地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's all the same to me whether he comes or not. 他来不来对我都无所谓。</font>\n<br>2. nevertheless 仍然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A heavy snow was falling, but we got there in time all the same. 当时正下大雪，但我们还是准时到了那里。</font>\n
allude to	<font color=blue size=4>allude to</font>\n<br>refer indirectly or directly to 间接或直接地说到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We looked at each other wondering whom he was alluding to. 我们互相看看，不知道他指的是谁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He alluded to his difficulties with his motherinlaw. 他向岳母婉转地说起他的困难。</font>\n<br>along with together with 与…一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl went to the cinema along with her mother. 那个女孩同母亲一起去看电影。</font>\n
a long way off	<font color=blue size=4>a long way off</font>\n<br>1. at a long distance 相距很远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town is a long way off. 那个城市在很远的地方。</font>\n<br>2. far in the future（在时间上）离现在远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Christmas is still a long way off. 圣诞节还早着呢。</font>\n<br>3. far from 远非\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The novel is a long way off perfection. 这部小说远非完美之作。</font>\n
a lot	<font color=blue size=4>a lot</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel a lot better today. 我今天感到好多了。</font>\n
a lot of	<font color=blue size=4>a lot of</font>\n<br>lots of; many or much 大量的；许多的（后接可数名词或不可数名词）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wasted a lot of time in those years. 那些年他浪费了很多时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I bought a lot of valuable books in the secondhand bookstore. 我在那家旧书店里买了许多很有价值的书。</font>\n
amazed at	<font color=blue size=4>amazed at</font>\n<br>surprised very much at 吃惊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was amazed at seeing him there. 在那里看到他，使我感到吃惊。</font>\n
amount to	<font color=blue size=4>amount to</font>\n<br>1. make a total of 总计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The total income amounts to ＄5, 000. 总收入合计5000美元。</font>\n<br>2. signify; mean equal to 表示；有重要性；等于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her words amount to a refusal. 她的话等于拒绝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he said amounted to very little. 他说的话无关紧要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His suggestion amounts to saying that there is still room for improvement in the work. 他的建议意味着这件工作尚有改进的余地。</font>\n<br>3. achieve success; develop into 有成就；发展为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think such a man can amount to much. 我认为这样一个人不会有什么作为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he goes on like this, he will never amount to anything. 如果他一味这样下去，将一事无成。</font>\n
angry at/about	<font color=blue size=4>angry at/about</font>\n<br>filled with anger at sth. 对（某事）生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The father was angry at what his son had done. 父亲对儿子的所作所为非常恼火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was angry about missing the film at the cinema. 没看成影院的那场电影，我很生气。</font>\n<br>angry with filled with anger with sb. 对（某人）生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She won't be angry with me. 她不会对我生气的。</font>\n
answer back	<font color=blue size=4>answer back</font>\n<br>reply rudely 回嘴；顶嘴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't answer back like that. 别那样顶嘴！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child often answered his grandmother back. 这孩子经常与祖母顶嘴。</font>\n
answer for	<font color=blue size=4>answer for</font>\n<br>1. be responsible for; take the responsibility for 对…负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must answer for any missing articles after the party. 你必须对聚会后遗失的任何物品负责。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Parents should answer for their children's behaviour. 父母应对自己孩子的行为负责。</font>\n<br>2. guarantee 保证；担保\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can answer for his honesty. 我可以保证他是诚实的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will answer for the truth of his statements. 我担保他说的话是真实的。</font>\n<br>3. be punished or blamed for 因…而受罚；因…而受责备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will have to answer for his crimes. 他必须因他的罪行而受到惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someday you will answer for your foolish behaviour. 总有一天你将因你的愚蠢行为而受到惩罚。</font>\n<br>4. serve for 起…作用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That night the table answered for a bed for me. 那天晚上那张桌子成了我的床。</font>\n<br>5. speak for 代表…讲话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop answering for John, let him speak. 不要替约翰说，让他自己讲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't answer for the other members of the committee. 我不能代表其他委员的意见。</font>\n
answer to	<font color=blue size=4>answer to</font>\n<br>1. correspond to; be in accordance with 符合；相符；一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all hope that the result will answer to our expectation. 我们都希望结果和我们预料的一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That answers precisely to our needs. 那正符合我们的需要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man answering to the police description was arrested in London last night. 那个与警察描述的特征相符的人，昨晚已在伦敦被捕。</font>\n<br>2. be responsible to 对…负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll have to answer to me if any harm comes to these children. 要是这些孩子受到什么伤害，我将唯你是问。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he was ready to answer to those who worked under his direction. 他说他愿意对在他领导下工作的人负责。</font>\n<br>3. respond to; reply to 对…做出反应；听从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The illness doesn't answer to medical treatment. 这病治疗无效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Young people should answer to the nation's call to go where they are most needed. 青年人应该听从国家号召，到最需要的地方去。</font>\n
answer up to	<font color=blue size=4>answer up to</font>\n<br>1. respond to 对…做出反应；响应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We answered up to the appeal quickly. 我们迅速响应了这个呼吁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the roll call, the men answered up to their names. 点名时，士兵们应答迅速。</font>\n<br>2. have a ready reply to 对…对答如流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy answered up to all the questions except two. 除了两个问题外，这个孩子对答如流。</font>\n
anxious about	<font color=blue size=4>anxious about</font>\n<br>worrying about 担心；担忧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is anxious about his daughter being out so late at night. 他为女儿晚上这么晚在外面而担心。</font>\n
anxious for	<font color=blue size=4>anxious for</font>\n<br>desiring eagerly 渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is anxious for a better job. 他渴望找到更好的工作。</font>\n
anything but	<font color=blue size=4>anything but</font>\n<br>by no means; certainly not 决不；并非\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The task was anything but easy. 这工作决不容易。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many large cities are anything but beautiful. 许多大城市一点也不美。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will do anything but that. 她决不做那件事。</font>\n
apart from	<font color=blue size=4>apart from</font>\n<br>1. besides 除…以外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Apart from these two books, he has written some plays and film scripts, 除了这两本书外，他还写了一些剧本和电影脚本。</font>\n<br>2. independent of; without 与…分开；离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack stood apart from his father. 杰克不同他父亲站在一起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There can be no knowledge apart from practice. 离开了实践，就没有知识。</font>\n<br>3. except for; with the exception of 撇开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Apart from that, all goes well. 撇开那一点，一切顺利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your composition is good, apart from some spelling mistakes. 你的作文写得很好，只是有几处拼写错误。</font>\n
appeal to	<font color=blue size=4>appeal to</font>\n<br>1. ask for a reconsidered judgement 上诉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He appealed to the Supreme Court. 他向最高法院上诉。</font>\n<br>2. attract; seem good to 有感染力；有吸引力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Does this piece of music appeal to you? 你喜欢这首乐曲吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your argument appeals to us. 你的论点使我们很感兴趣。</font>\n<br>3. look for support in sth. 求助于；诉诸于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They appealed to arms to settle the disturbance in the city. 他们诉诸武力来解决这个城市的动乱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government appealed to the people for support. 政府呼吁人们给予支持。</font>\n<br>4. make an earnest request of 向…提出恳求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They appealed to him to abandon the idea. 他们请求他放弃这个想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner appealed to the judge for mercy. 罪犯向法官恳求宽大处理。</font>\n
apply for	<font color=blue size=4>apply for</font>\n<br>make a formal request for sth. 请求；申请（工作等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people have applied for the job. 许多人都申请这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The local government a applied for immediate relief. 地方政府请求紧急救济。</font>\n<br>apply oneself to devote oneself to; make oneself work hard at 致力于；努力于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must apply yourself to the job you have to do. 你务必要努力干好你份内的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He applied himself to the study of American literature. 他专心研究美国文学。</font>\n
apply to	<font color=blue size=4>apply to</font>\n<br>1. make a formal request to sb. or an organization 向某人或某机构提出请求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall apply to the manager for an increase in pay. 我将请求经理给我增加工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has applied to the American Consulate for visa. 她已向美国领事馆申请签证。</font>\n<br>2. be fit for; be suitable for 适用于；适合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>School regulations apply to every student. 校规适用于每个学生。</font>\n<br>3. bring or put into use 实施；应用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should apply theory to practice. 我们应该把理论应用于实际。</font>\n
approve of	<font color=blue size=4>approve of</font>\n<br>1. agree to; give consent to 允许\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father did not approve of his marriage to Mary. 父亲不准他同玛丽结婚。</font>\n<br>2. like; be in favour of 赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We cordially approved of this project. 我们衷心赞成这项研究计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I approve of what he said and what he did. 对于他的言行我表示赞成。</font>\n
approximate to	<font color=blue size=4>approximate to</font>\n<br>come very near to 近似；接近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His account of what happened approximated to the truth though there were some small errors. 虽然有些小的出入，他对这件事的叙述还是接近事实真相的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The yearly output approximates to 600, 000 tons. 年产量接近 60万吨。</font>\n
argue about/over	<font color=blue size=4>argue about/over</font>\n<br>discuss; quarrel about 争论；争辩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are always arguing about unimportant matters. 他们总是为一些小事争论不休。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My students argued over the ocrrectness of the answer. 我的学生们互相争论着答案的正确性。</font>\n
argue against	<font color=blue size=4>argue against</font>\n<br>express an opinion against 反驳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The next speaker will argue against this plan. 下一个演讲者将会反驳这项计划。</font>\n
argue away	<font color=blue size=4>argue away</font>\n<br>1. argue continuously 连续争论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They sometimes argue away for hours. 他们有时一争论就是几小时。</font>\n<br>2. dismiss with a plausible argument 以似是而非的理由驳回；不考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to argue the matter away. 他想方设法要把这件事辩解过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't argue away this problem. 你不能不考虑这个问题。</font>\n
argue down	<font color=blue size=4>argue down</font>\n<br>defeat sb. in an argument 驳倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker was wellinformed, but I argued him down at last. 演讲者博闻强记，但是我最终把他驳倒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They argued him down fiercely. 他们经过激烈的辩论把他说得哑口无言。</font>\n
argue for	<font color=blue size=4>argue for</font>\n<br>debate in favour of; give reasons in support of 为…争辩；支持；赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll try to argue the matter for you, but he's very obstinate. 在这个问题上我会为你说话的，但他却是个固执的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is necessary that we should argue the problem for them. 我们有必要为他们辩论这件事。</font>\n
argue out	<font color=blue size=4>argue out</font>\n<br>talk about sth. thoroughly until a decision is reached 深入地辩论某事，直到辩出结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee argued the matter out, and at last agreed to take no action. 委员会深入地研究了此事，最后决定不采取行动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They intend to argue the whole problem out tomorrow night. 他们打算在明天晚上把整个问题辩出个结果来。</font>\n
argue out of	<font color=blue size=4>argue out of</font>\n<br>persuade sb. agamst doing sth. by showing reasons 说服某人不要做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The parents argued their son out of leaving his present job. 父母说服儿子不要放弃目前的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was argued out of his opposition. 他被说服得不再反对了。</font>\n
arise from/out of	<font color=blue size=4>arise from/out of</font>\n<br>result from 由…而引起；由…而产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country's present difficulties arise from the shortage of petroleum. 这个国家当前的困境是由石油短缺而造成的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trouble arose out of the policy of racial segregation. 这场乱子是由种族隔离政策所引起的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We argued her out of acting in haste. 我们劝她不要匆忙行事。</font>\n
armed with	<font color=blue size=4>armed with</font>\n<br>supplied with 以…武器；装备有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers were armed with guns and beyonets. 士兵们都带着刺刀和枪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The politician was armed with many facts and figures. 这位政治家掌握了大量的事实和数据。</font>\n
arm in arm	<font color=blue size=4>arm in arm</font>\n<br> (of two persons) walking side by side, with the arm of one round that of the other（二人）挽臂而行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They walked down the street arm in arm. 他们挽着臂沿街走去。</font>\n
arrange for	<font color=blue size=4>arrange for</font>\n<br>make a plan about sth. for sb. 安排；准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have arranged for the photographer to take some pictures of the ceremony. 我已经安排摄影师为典礼拍些照片。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who has arranged for the concert? 谁组织了这次音乐会？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've arranged for a car to pick them up at the station. 我已安排了一辆车去车站接他们。</font>\n
arrive at	<font color=blue size=4>arrive at</font>\n<br>1. reach a place, usually small 到达（一般比较小的地方）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They arrived at the air port just before the plane took off. 飞机临起飞前，他们才赶到了机场。</font>\n<br>2. reach sth. such as a decision or conclusion 达成、作出（决定、结论等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After many hours'discussion, the committee arrived at the decision. 经过许多小时的讨论，委员会作出了决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish they would arrive at some conclusion. 我希望他们能得出某种结论。</font>\n<br>as a matter of course naturally 当然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is, as a matter of course, on my side. 他当然站在我这边了。</font>\n
as a matter of fact	<font color=blue size=4>as a matter of fact</font>\n<br>in reality; to speak the truth 事实上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As a matter of fact, I have never heard of him. 事实上，我从没有听说过他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has, as a matter of fact, no real convictions. 他实际上并没有真正的信念。</font>\n
as a result	<font color=blue size=4>as a result</font>\n<br>therefore; consequently 因此；结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As a result he remained unknown and lived away from his family for more than 20 years. 结果，他隐姓埋名，远离家人达20多年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He refused to have medical attention in the early stages of his complaint, and as a result he became seriously ill. 他在得病初期拒绝接受治疗，结果病情严重恶化。</font>\n
as a rule	<font color=blue size=4>as a rule</font>\n<br>generally; customarily 通常；一般\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As a rule, he gets up at five o'clock and does morning exercises in the park. 他通常5点起床，在公园里做早操。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does he come as a rule? 通常他什么时候来？</font>\n
as a whole	<font color=blue size=4>as a whole</font>\n<br>all together; not taken separately; in general 就整体而言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should view things as a whole. 我们应该全面地看问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speech had to be considered as a whole. 应该从整体来考虑这篇讲话。</font>\n
as follows	<font color=blue size=4>as follows</font>\n<br>as written or stated next 如下；如此\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The regulations are as follows. 规定如下。</font>\n
as for	<font color=blue size=4>as for</font>\n<br>concerning; with regard to 至于；就…而言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As for that man, he is not qualified for the job at all. 至于那人，他干这项工作根本不称职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He likes summer, but as for me, I like winter much better. 他喜欢夏天，但是对我来说，我则更喜欢冬天。</font>\n
as good as	<font color=blue size=4>as good as</font>\n<br>1. the same as 同…一样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is as good as dead. 他像死了一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wellmaintained TV set looks as good as new. 这部保养良好的电视机看上去跟新的一样。</font>\n<br>2. practically; almost 实际上；几乎是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he did has as good as shown that he is dishonest. 他的行为实际上表明他是个不诚实的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This means that the dollar is as good as devalued. 这意味着美元实际上已经贬值。</font>\n
ashamed of	<font color=blue size=4>ashamed of</font>\n<br>feeling shame because of 因…感到羞耻或不好意思\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should be ashamed of your behaviour. 你应该为自己的行为而感到羞耻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm ashamed of myself for having given you so much trouble. 给你添了这么多麻烦，真不好意思。</font>\n
a short cut	<font color=blue size=4>a short cut</font>\n<br>a quicker and more direct way 近路；快捷方式\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They took a short cut through the fields. 他们走快捷方式穿过田野。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no short cut to success ex cept by diligence. 成功没有快捷方式，唯在勤勉。</font>\n
aside from	<font color=blue size=4>aside from</font>\n<br>excepting; except for 除…之外（没有）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Aside from his meagre salary, he has no other resources to fall back on. 除了那一点微薄的薪水，他没有别的可靠财源。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Aside from being fun and good exercise, swimming is a very useful skill. 除了是乐趣和有益的锻炼以外，游泳还是一种很有用的技能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is aside from our present aims to devote too much time to this question. 若在这个问题上花费过多的时间，那就偏离了我们当前的目标。</font>\n
as if/though	<font color=blue size=4>as if/though</font>\n<br>as it would be if 似乎；好像（后面的从句一般用虚拟语气）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He behaves as if he were mad. 他的举动好像发了疯似的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She looks as though she had seen a ghost. 她那样子看上去就像见了鬼似的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talks as if he knew all about it. 他说话的口气好像他全部已经知道了。</font>\n
as it is	<font color=blue size=4>as it is</font>\n<br>1. really; in reality 事实上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We hoped that things would get better, but as it is, they are getting worse. 我们本希望情况会好转的，但是事实上，现在情况正在恶化。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seemed to be around fifty, but as it was, he was over sixty. 他看上去只有 50岁左右，但事实上他已经60多岁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As it is, he is a noblehearted man with profound thinking. 事实上，他是一个心灵高尚，思想深刻的人。</font>\n<br>2. without changes or improvements (used after the word it modifies) 照原来的样子（位于被修饰词之后）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leave it as it is. 听其自然。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's good enough as it is. 照现在这个样子已经很不错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They agree to buy the house just as it is. 他们同意照房子原状买下来。</font>\n
as it were	<font color=blue size=4>as it were</font>\n<br>1. in a manner; as if it really were 宛如；似乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her mother is, as it were, her friend. 她的母亲好像就是她的朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is, as it were, a walking dictionary. 他仿佛是部活字典。</font>\n<br>2. so to speak 可以说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Books are, as it were, his life. 书可以说就是他的生命。</font>\n
ask about	<font color=blue size=4>ask about</font>\n<br>request information concerning 询问情况；打听消息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director is asking about the two papers you promised to write. 主任在询问关于你答应要写的两篇论文的情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The reporters have been asking about the missing child all day. 记者们整天都在打听那个失踪孩子的消息。</font>\n
ask after	<font color=blue size=4>ask after</font>\n<br>enquire about sb. 's health 问候；探问（某人的健康）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked after his father. 他探问父亲的健康情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She asked after you and the children. 她向你和孩子们问好。</font>\n
ask for	<font color=blue size=4>ask for</font>\n<br>1. request; ask to be given 请求；向…要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are asking for an increase in pay. 工人在请求增加工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She asked for time to think all this over. 她要求给她时间把这一切仔细想一想。</font>\n<br>2. demand; ask to see 要求（见）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Here's a gentleman asking for the manager. 这里有位先生要求见经理。</font>\n<br>3. run the risk of sth. 招惹；自找（麻烦）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is foolish to behave in that way; he is asking for trouble. 他那样做是愚蠢的，是自找麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had been teasing the dog for weeks, and I'm not surprised it bit her—she certainly asked for it. 她好几个星期一直在逗弄那条狗，那狗咬了她并不奇怪，这是自作自受。</font>\n
ask of	<font color=blue size=4>ask of</font>\n<br>request sth. from sb. 向…询问；请求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would like to ask a favour of you. 我想请你帮个忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's not too much to ask of you to wash your own clothes. 请你把自己的衣服洗一下，这要求并不过份。</font>\n
ask off	<font color=blue size=4>ask off</font>\n<br>ask for leave 请假\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are not allowed to ask off. 不准你请假。</font>\n
as many	<font color=blue size=4>as many</font>\n<br>the same number as 和…一样多的；和…同样数目的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I waited for seven minutes; they seemed to me as many hours. 我等候了7分钟，但对我来说，就像等了7个小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made six mistakes in as many paragraphs. 他在6段里错了6处。</font>\n
as much	<font color=blue size=4>as much</font>\n<br>the same; exactly that 同样；那样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you lose your way? I thought as much when you were late in coming. 你迷路了吗？你来迟了，我就料想你迷路了。</font>\n
as regards	<font color=blue size=4>as regards</font>\n<br>with reference to; concerning 关于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As regards attending the meeting, I haven't decided yet. 关于那个会议，我还没有决定是否参加。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was always secretive as regards his family. 关于他的家庭情况，他总是守口如瓶。</font>\n
assent to	<font color=blue size=4>assent to</font>\n<br>agree to 同意；赞同（正式）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Queen assented to the new law. 女王赞同新的法律。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher will never assent to our playing football in the street. 老师决不会同意我们在街上踢足球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee assented to our proposals. 委员会同意了我们的提议。</font>\n
assign to	<font color=blue size=4>assign to</font>\n<br>1. give sb. duties 委派；指派\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Soon they assigned him to a new post. 不久他们把他派到一个新的岗位上去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been assigned to an important post. 他已被委派到一个重要的岗位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The defence of the oil installation had been assigned to my regiment. 我团被指派守卫该石油设施。</font>\n<br>2. provide; set aside for 分配；把…分给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The room is assigned to Mr. Wang. 这个房间是分给王先生的。</font>\n
assist in	<font color=blue size=4>assist in</font>\n<br>help with 在…方面帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is very grateful to her husband, who assisted in preparing the book. 她非常感激自己的丈夫，因为正是在他的帮助下，这本书才得以问世。</font>\n
associate with	<font color=blue size=4>associate with</font>\n<br>1. find a connection between; join together in mind 把…与…联系起来；联想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I always associate the smell of these flowers with my childhood. 闻到这些花香，我就会联想到童年时代。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We naturally associate the name of Darwin with the doctrine of evolution. 我们很自然地把达尔文的名字与进化论联系在一起。</font>\n<br>2. keep company with 与…交往；与…合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He won't have his son associate with dishonest boys. 他不准儿子同不诚实的男孩交往。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are ready to associate themselves with us in an enterprise. 他们乐于跟我们合作办企业。</font>\n
as/so far as	<font color=blue size=4>as/so far as</font>\n<br>1. to the extent of 就…而论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As far as I know, the building will be completed at the end of the year. 据我所知，这幢大楼将在年底完工。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As far as my knowledge is concerned, there is no such word in Chinese. 据我所知，汉字中没有这样一个字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So far as our desire is concerned, we don't want you to go there. 就我们的愿望而言，我们不愿你到那儿去。</font>\n<br>2. to the distance that 远至\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They walked as far as the foot of the hill. 他们一直走到山脚下。</font>\n
as/so long as	<font color=blue size=4>as/so long as</font>\n<br>1. if; provided that 只要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As long as we unite and help each other, no one can conquer us. 只要我们团结互助，谁也不能征服我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shall never enter this house as long as I live in it. 只要我还住在这里，就决不允许你进屋。</font>\n<br>2. since; because; considering that 既然；因为；由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As long as you are going to town anyway, you can do something for me. 既然你一定要进城，你就可以帮我办点事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As long as we've driven this far, we might as well go on. 既然我们已经驶得这么远了，就不妨继续往前驶。</font>\n
as soon as	<font color=blue size=4>as soon as</font>\n<br>immediately; the moment 一…就…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll write to you as soon as I get to Beijing. 我一到北京就给你写信。</font>\n
as such	<font color=blue size=4>as such</font>\n<br>in that form or kind; as indicated above 以那种方式；如上所说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a good man, and will be treated as such. 他是个好人，会受到善待。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a brilliant scholar and is everywhere recognized as such. 他是一位有才华的学者，处处都为人们所公认。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is a child, and must be regarded as such. 她是个孩子，必须当成孩子来看待。</font>\n
assure of	<font color=blue size=4>assure of</font>\n<br>make sb. certain about 使…放心；使…确信；向…保证\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He assured me of his final success. 他使我确信，最后他会取得成功的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can assure you of my full support for your plan. 我向你保证，一定全力支持你的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor assured the young father of his baby's safety. 医生肯定地向这位年轻的父亲说孩子的病是能治好的。</font>\n
as the saying goes	<font color=blue size=4>as the saying goes</font>\n<br>as the saying is 俗话说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“All is not gold that glitters, ”as the saying goes. 俗话说得好, “闪光的并不都是金子。”</font>\n
as to	<font color=blue size=4>as to</font>\n<br>1. concerning; with regard to 至于（后接名词位于句首）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As to Jack, I believe he wouldn't have said anything like that. 至于杰克，我相信他不会那么说的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As to your final grade, that depends on your final examination. 至于你的总成绩，那要根据你的期末考试而定。</font>\n<br>2. in connection with 关于（后接句子）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have not decided yet as to who will be in charge of the project. 关于谁将负责这项工程，他们还没有作出决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told me to phone him as to when I would leave. 至于我什么时候离开，他让我打电话告诉他。</font>\n
as usual	<font color=blue size=4>as usual</font>\n<br>as always; customarily 照常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On Sundays he gats up early as usual. 星期天他照常起得很早。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would go home, as usual, for Christmas. 跟往常一样，我将回家过圣诞节。</font>\n
as well	<font color=blue size=4>as well</font>\n<br>in addition; also; too 也；一样地；依然（位于句尾）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am going to Paris and my brother is going as well. 我要到巴黎去，我弟弟也去。</font>\n
as well as	<font color=blue size=4>as well as</font>\n<br>in addition to, besides 和；同；既…又\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went to the party as well as his sister. 他和他妹妹都出席了晚会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was kind as well as sensible. 他既懂道理又善良。</font>\n
as yet	<font color=blue size=4>as yet</font>\n<br>so far; up to now 到现在；迄今（常用于否定句中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have received no answer from him as yet. 迄今我们还没有收到他的答复。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has not come as yet. 她到现在还没来。</font>\n
at a disadvantage	<font color=blue size=4>at a disadvantage</font>\n<br>in an unfavourable position 处境不利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not speak English two years ago, which put him at a disadvantage in America. 他两年前不会说英语，这使他当时在美国处于不利地位。</font>\n
at a distance	<font color=blue size=4>at a distance</font>\n<br>站开一点；离开一些距离；在远处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The picture looks better at a distance. 这幅画远看更好些。</font>\n
at all	<font color=blue size=4>at all</font>\n<br>1. in any way; thoroughly 全然地；在各方面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't agree with you at all. 我完全不同意你的看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was nothing to worry about at all. 完全没有什么可担心的。</font>\n<br>2. in the least; to the least extent or degree 任何；最轻程度地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you feel ill at all? 你感到有任何不适吗？</font>\n<br>3. for any reason 究竟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you know at all? 你究竟知道不知道？</font>\n
at all costs	<font color=blue size=4>at all costs</font>\n<br>at any cost; regardless of obstacles 无论如何；不顾一切\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will attain his goal at all costs. 他将不惜一切代价达到目的。</font>\n
at all events	<font color=blue size=4>at all events</font>\n<br>certainly; in any case 一定；无论如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At all events I'll go to see her someday. 有朝一日，我无论如何会去看她的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It may rain tomorrow, but we are going home at all events. 明天可能下雨，但无论如何我们还是要回家。</font>\n
at all risks	<font color=blue size=4>at all risks</font>\n<br>at any risk 甘冒一切危险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have to explode the bridge at all risks. 他们必须冒一切危险炸掉那座桥。</font>\n
at a loss	<font color=blue size=4>at a loss</font>\n<br>1. confused; puzzled; without any idea 迷惑不解；不知所措的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was at a loss what to do. 他不知所措。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good salesman is mever at a loss for words. 一个优秀的推销员总是不会词穷的。</font>\n<br>2. in a state of uncertainty 犹豫不决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is at a loss whether going out with them or staying at home alone. 是同他们一道出去还是一个人留在家里，她拿不定主意。</font>\n<br>3. at a price lower than the original cost 亏本的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sold his house at a loss. 他亏本出售他的房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It can only sell at a loss. 这东西只能亏本出售。</font>\n
at any price	<font color=blue size=4>at any price</font>\n<br>whatever it may cost 无论代价如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He won't sell these books at any price. 无论给多少钱他都不会把这些书卖掉。</font>\n
at any rate	<font color=blue size=4>at any rate</font>\n<br>in any case; whatever happens 无论怎样；无论如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At any rate we'll leave when it stops raining. 无论如何，雨停了我们就要动身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It isn't much of a car, but at any rate it was not expensive. 这不是一辆很好的车，但不管怎样它很便宜。</font>\n
at a/one word	<font color=blue size=4>at a/one word</font>\n<br>immediately 立刻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor must be sent for at a word. 必须马上去请医生。</font>\n
at a time	<font color=blue size=4>at a time</font>\n<br>on each occasion 一次\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They learn 30 words and a passage at a time. 他们一次学30个单词和一篇短文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He checked them off one at a time as they came in. 当他们进来时，他对他们逐个检查。</font>\n
at call	<font color=blue size=4>at call</font>\n<br>ready for use 随时支取；随时可用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money de posited in this bank is at call. 存在这家银行里的钱可以随时支取。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The taxi is at call. 出租车随叫随到。</font>\n
at ease	<font color=blue size=4>at ease</font>\n<br>1. without worry or nervousness; comfortable 安适；自在；自如\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mind was never at ease from the first day he got married. 从结婚的第一天起，他心里就没有平静过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the doctor's visit, the patient felt more at ease. 经医生出诊看过后，病人感觉舒服多了。</font>\n<br>2. having facility or readiness 才思敏捷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is quite at ease in speaking English. 她英文说得十分流畅。</font>\n
at fault	<font color=blue size=4>at fault</font>\n<br>in the wrong; mistaken 出错\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If my memory is not at fault, you are Mr. Smith. 要是我没记错的话，你就是史密斯先生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is at fault in the car crash? 这次撞车是谁的过错？</font>\n
at first	<font color=blue size=4>at first</font>\n<br>at the beginning; originally 起初\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first, she was ill at ease, but in a few minutes she felt relaxed. 起初她有点不自在，可是几分钟后她就感觉轻松了。</font>\n
at first glance	<font color=blue size=4>at first glance</font>\n<br>taking a quick look at 一瞥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He saw at first glance that she was filled with anger. 他一眼就看出她在生气。</font>\n
at first hand	<font color=blue size=4>at first hand</font>\n<br>directly 直接地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got the information at first hand from the ambassador. 他是直接从大使那里得到这消息的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been to China to study conditions there at first hand. 他曾多到中国直接研究那里的情况。</font>\n
at first sight	<font color=blue size=4>at first sight</font>\n<br>after a first quick look; when first seen 乍一看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first sight, the problem seemed insoluble. 乍看起来，这问题似乎无法解决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell in love with her at first sight. 他对她一见钟情。</font>\n
at hand	<font color=blue size=4>at hand</font>\n<br>1. coming soon; almost here 即将到来；为期不远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Midautumn Festival is at hand. 中秋节快要到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wished more than ever to have his father at hand. 他比任何时候都希望父亲就在他跟前。</font>\n<br>2. easy to reach; nearby 近在手边；在近处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is very convenient to have a dictionary at hand when reading. 阅读时手头有一本词典是很方便的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives close at hand. 他住得很近。</font>\n
at heart	<font color=blue size=4>at heart</font>\n<br>1. in reality; basically 实际上；基本上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems polite, but he's dishonest at heart. 他似乎很有礼貌，但实际上是个不诚实的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His manners are cold, but he is at heart a kind man. 他的言谈举止有些冷淡，但实际上他心地善良。</font>\n<br>2. deep down 在内心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has your interests at heart. 她常把你的利益放在心上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not at heart want to do it. 她心里并不想做那件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sick at heart. 我心中苦闷。</font>\n
at home	<font color=blue size=4>at home</font>\n<br>1. in the house; in the place where one lives or comes from 在家；在家乡；在国内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's no one at home. 家里没人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very famous at home and abroad. 他在国内外都很有名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Americans abroad are protected by the government like Americans at home. 海外的美国人如同在国内一样，受到政府的保护。</font>\n<br>2. comfortable; at ease 安逸；自在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She feels at home. 她觉得很自如，象在家里一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please make yourself at home. 请随便一些。</font>\n<br>3. familiar; skillful 熟悉；精通\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you be at home driving a truck? 你开卡车内行吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom has read many books about physics and is at home in that subject. 汤姆读过很多关于物理学的书，因此他精通这门学科。</font>\n
at intervals	<font color=blue size=4>at intervals</font>\n<br>1. now and then 不时地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The music came from the building at intervals. 音乐声从楼里不时传来。</font>\n<br>2. happening regularly after equal periods of time or appearing at equal distance（时间、距离）间隔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trees are planted at intervals of six feet. 每隔6英尺栽一棵树。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leaders should come to hear the masses'views at intervals. 领导们应常常来听听群众的意见。</font>\n
at issue	<font color=blue size=4>at issue</font>\n<br>1. under consideration; in dispute 在争论中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The point at issue is who is best qualified for the post. 争论之焦点是谁担任这项工作最称职。</font>\n<br>2. in disagreement 不和；意见不一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The father is at issue with his son. 父子意见不和。</font>\n
at large	<font color=blue size=4>at large</font>\n<br>1. free; not confined; at liberty 自由地；未被捕；逍遥法外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminal is still at large. 那个罪犯依然逍遥法外。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside. 在宁静的乡村里有一只危险的野兽依然肆意逍遥，想起来未免令人忐忑不安。</font>\n<br>2. as a whole; altogether 普遍的；一般的；整体的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country at large is hoping for political and economic reforms. 全国人民普遍希望进行政治和经济改革。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was elected congressman at large. 他被全体选民选为议员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All peoples at large are for peace. 各国民众全都赞成和平。</font>\n<br>3. fully; completely 详尽地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please explain the passage at large. 请详细地讲解这篇短文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no time to discuss the subject at large at this meeting. 这次会上，我们没有时间充分讨论这个问题。</font>\n
