at last	<font color=blue size=4>at last</font>\n<br>finally; in the end 最后；最终\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At last they climbed over the mountain. 他们终于翻过了这座大山。</font>\n
at least	<font color=blue size=4>at least</font>\n<br>anyhow; at the lowest estimate 至少；起码\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dictionary costs at least yuan. 这本词典至少要花50元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had not seen him for at least a week. 我至少有一周没看见他了。</font>\n
at length	<font color=blue size=4>at length</font>\n<br>1. finally; at last 最后；终于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeded at length. 他终于成功了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At length there was a step forward in the negotiations. 谈判终于有了进展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came at length. 他终于来了。</font>\n<br>2. in great detail 详尽地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two foreign ministers discussed the situation in this area at great length. 两位外长详细讨论了这一地区的局势。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher explained the text at length, 教师详细地解释了课文。</font>\n
at liberty	<font color=blue size=4>at liberty</font>\n<br>1. at leisure; unoccupied 闲着；无事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be at liberty after midday. 我午后有空。</font>\n<br>2. free; unconfined 不受约束；有行动或处理某事的自由\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are at liberty to use the laboratory. 你可以自由地使用这个实验室。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoners were set at liberty. 犯人被释放了。</font>\n
at once	<font color=blue size=4>at once</font>\n<br>1. very soon; immediately 立刻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The telegram must be sent at once. 电报必须立即发出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I recognized him at once. 我立刻就认出了他。</font>\n<br>2. both; equally 同样；兼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is at once a statesman and a writer. 他既是一位政治家，也是一位作家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was at once happy and sad. 他悲喜交集。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book is at once interesting and instructive. 这本书既有趣又有教育意义。</font>\n
at one's best	<font color=blue size=4>at one's best</font>\n<br>in one's best state 在最佳状态；在全盛时期\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is at his best with friends. 他同朋友们在一起时最开心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The peach blossoms are at their best now. 桃花正在盛开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is at her best in the morning. 她早上情绪最佳。</font>\n
at one's elbow	<font color=blue size=4>at one's elbow</font>\n<br>close by; very near at hand 在手边；在手旁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having our own kitchen has one advantage; everything is at our elbow. 有一间我们自己的厨房就有好处，每样东西都近在手边。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always keeps an encyclopedia at his elbow for reference. 他手边总是放着一本百科全书，以备参考。</font>\n
at (one's) leisure	<font color=blue size=4>at (one's) leisure</font>\n<br>when one has free time 在空余之时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am quite at leisure if you want me to do anything for you. 你要是需要我帮忙，我完全有空。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please look through the manuscript at you leisure. 请在闲暇的时候把这份稿子看一下。</font>\n
at one's peril	<font color=blue size=4>at one's peril</font>\n<br>at one's own risk 自行冒险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Touch that at your peril. The parcel contains high explosives. 你碰它就要自负后果。包裹里装有烈性炸药。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made the experiment at his peril. 他冒险做这个试验。</font>\n
at one's wit's end	<font color=blue size=4>at one's wit's end</font>\n<br>not knowing what to do next; quite at a loss 不知所措；智穷技尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldier was at his wit's end when facing the danger. 面对危险，那个士兵不知如何是好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had approached every friend and acquaintance for help in vain and he was at his wit's end. 他曾向每位朋友和熟人求助，但毫无结果，那时他真是一筹莫展。</font>\n
at one time	<font color=blue size=4>at one time</font>\n<br>once 曾经；在某一时间（常指过去）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of wine was very popular at one time, but now it is considered too strong. 这种酒曾经很受欢迎，但是现在被认为度数太高了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At one time we met frequently. 曾经有一个时期我们经常会面。</font>\n
at/on sight	<font color=blue size=4>at/on sight</font>\n<br>as soon as seen or shown 一见（就）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He shot the enemy officer at sight. 他一看见那个敌军官就把他击毙了。</font>\n
at/on/upon the point of	<font color=blue size=4>at/on/upon the point of</font>\n<br>at the moment of; just before 正在…之时；就在…之际\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told his son the secret at the point of death. 他在临死前把秘密告诉了儿子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was on the point of asking who he was, when he told me his name. 我正要问他是谁时，他把他的名字告诉了我。</font>\n
at peace	<font color=blue size=4>at peace</font>\n<br>in harmony; in a state of friendship or quiet 处于和平（和睦）状态；处于平静状态\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If only the world were at peace. 全世界都和睦相处就好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are fortunately at peace with all the world today. 我们今天有幸能和世界各国和平共处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After taking the medicine, she felt at peace with herself. 吃过药之后，她感到平静多了。</font>\n
at present	<font color=blue size=4>at present</font>\n<br>now; during this period of time 现在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At present he is a professor of physics. 他现在是物理学教授。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't think of any fit person just at present. 我现在一下想不出什么适合的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't need any more at present. 现在我们不再需要什么了。</font>\n
at random	<font color=blue size=4>at random</font>\n<br>aimlessly; without any plan 胡乱地；漫无目的地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked questions at random. 他胡乱问些问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took a book at random off the shelf. 他随意从书架上拿下一本书。</font>\n
at rest	<font color=blue size=4>at rest</font>\n<br>1. not moving 静止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sea is at rest. 大海很平静。</font>\n<br>2. quiet 安静\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl is never really at rest. 那个女孩总是手脚不停。</font>\n<br>3. settled 解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question is now at rest. 问题现已解决。</font>\n
at sb's command	<font color=blue size=4>at sb's command</font>\n<br>1. ready to obey sb. 听从某人的命令\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog went for the man at its master's command. 主子一声令下，狗就向那人扑去。</font>\n<br>2. at sb. 's service 受某人支配\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has a large vocabulary at her command. 她掌握大量的词汇。</font>\n
at sb's convenience	<font color=blue size=4>at sb's convenience</font>\n<br>at the time that doesn't give sb. trouble 在某人方便的时候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please come at your convenience. 请在你方便的时候来。</font>\n
at sb 's disposal	<font color=blue size=4>at sb 's disposal</font>\n<br>available to use freely 可以自由支配（使用）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After twenty hours of classes each week, the students have a lot of free time at their disposal. 每周上20节课之后，学生们有大量自由支配的时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack put his car at her disposal. 杰克的车她可随便使用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money is at the disposal of the committee. 这笔钱由委员会自由支配。</font>\n
at sb's heels	<font color=blue size=4>at sb's heels</font>\n<br>near; following closely 紧跟在…后面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He kept at my heels. 他紧紧跟着我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Famine often follows at the heels of war. 战争之后常常跟着饥荒。</font>\n
at sb's mercy	<font color=blue size=4>at sb's mercy</font>\n<br>subject to sb. 's power or control 受某人支配或控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is now at your mercy. 他现在由你控制。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship was at the mercy of wind and waves in the storm. 在风暴中，那条船任凭风浪吹打。</font>\n
at sb's service	<font color=blue size=4>at sb's service</font>\n<br>ready for sb. 's use or command 听任某人使用；听任某人差遣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am at your service at any time. 我随时为你效劳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My bike is at your service. 我的自行车你随便用好了。</font>\n
at sea	<font color=blue size=4>at sea</font>\n<br>1. on the open sea 在海上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship spent 40 days at sea. 这条船在海上航行了40天。</font>\n<br>2. lost in mind; not understanding; puzzled; not knowing what to do 茫然；迷惑；不知所措\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are still all at sea. He is an outandout scoundrel. 你还蒙在鼓里，他是一个十足的流氓。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The job was new to him, and for a few days he was all at sea. 他刚开始干这活，有好几天他都糊里胡涂的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is quite at sea as to what measures should be taken to settle the problem. 他全然不知该采取什么措施来解决这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was quite at sea in regard to that matter. 说到那件事，她实在茫然。</font>\n
at stake	<font color=blue size=4>at stake</font>\n<br>at risk; in danger; in a position to be lost or gained 胜败未定；处于成败（存亡、输赢）关头；在危险中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The life of the wounded pilot is at stake, 受伤的飞行员生死未卜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put all his money at stake in this business. 他孤注一掷，把钱全部投在这项经营上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My honor is at stake, so I cannot let the matter rest. 这危及我的名誉，所以我不能不管。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The team played hard because the championship was at stake. 这支球队打得非常卖力，因为冠军赛已进入决定性的阶段。</font>\n
at table	<font color=blue size=4>at table</font>\n<br>having a meal 在吃饭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were at table when I called. 我拜访时，他们正在吃饭。</font>\n
attach to	<font color=blue size=4>attach to</font>\n<br>1. fasten or join (one thing to another); be part of 粘上；贴上；附属于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please attach the sample to the letter. 请随信附上样品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Attach the handle to the box. 把这个把手装在盒子上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This hospital is attached to a medical college. 这家医院附属于一个医学院。</font>\n<br>2. belong to ; be attribute to 属于；归于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No suspicion can be attached to the accountant. 没有理由怀疑这位会计。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The main credit for the success of the test attaches to the thoroughness in their work. 这次试验之所以成功，主要归功于他们工作中一丝不苟的精神。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No blame attaches to him for the accident. 责任不在他身上。</font>\n<br>3. join 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He attached himself to the group of climbers. 他加入了爬山者的行列。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He attached himself to the Party. 他入党了。</font>\n<br>4. consider to have (importance, etc.) 认为有（重要性）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you attach much importance to what he says? 你认为他说的话重要吗？</font>\n<br>5. be appointed to another unit for special duties 任命；被派遣到另一单位担任特定任务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Last week he was attached to chief manager. 上星期他被任命为总经理。</font>\n<br>6. be bound to by love or affection 深爱；依恋\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is deeply attached to her young brother. 她深深地爱她的小弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is foolishly attached to old customs. 他愚蠢地沿习着旧习俗。</font>\n
attend on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>attend on/upon</font>\n<br>1. act as a servant for 侍候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president is attended on by many followers and guards. 总统身边有许多随从和卫士。</font>\n<br>2. give personal help to 照料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lisa has been attending on her sick mother for years. 莉萨多年来一直侍候在生病的母亲身旁。</font>\n<br>3. follow as a result 是…的必然结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Success usually attends on one's efforts. 成功是努力的结果。</font>\n
attend to	<font color=blue size=4>attend to</font>\n<br>1. give attention to 注意；专心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please attend to what I'll tell you. 请注意我要讲的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He attended to his business. 他专心于他的事务。</font>\n<br>2. give help to ; take care of;deal with 照料；护理；处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have a lot of things to attend to. 我有许多事情要处理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please attend to the child when I am off to work? 我上班时，你照看一下这孩子，好吗？</font>\n
at the beginning	<font color=blue size=4>at the beginning</font>\n<br>at the starting point of 在…开头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They sang a song at the beginning of the meeting. 会议开始时他们唱了一首歌。</font>\n
at (the) best	<font color=blue size=4>at (the) best</font>\n<br>1. at the maximum 至多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At best, they can cover only half the journey this week. 他们这个星期至多只能走完一半的路程。</font>\n<br>2. in the most favourable case 充其量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can give you one hundred dollars at best. 我充其量只能给你100美元。</font>\n
at the conclusion of	<font color=blue size=4>at the conclusion of</font>\n<br>at the end of 在…结束时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went home at the conclusion of the ceremony. 典礼一结束她就回家了。</font>\n
at the cost of	<font color=blue size=4>at the cost of</font>\n<br>at the expense of 以…为代价；以…为牺牲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeded only at the cost of his health. 他成功了，但身体却垮了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He saved the lives of his friends at the cost of his own. 他牺牲自己而挽救了朋友的生命。</font>\n
at the expense of	<font color=blue size=4>at the expense of</font>\n<br>1. with the loss of; at the sacrifice of 失去；牺牲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He devoted his time to football at the expense of his studies. 他全然不顾学习，把全部时间都用于踢球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He became a brilliant scholar, but only at the expense of his health. 他成了一个卓越的学者，却牺牲了自己的健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't try to benefit at the expense of others. 不要干损人利已的事。</font>\n<br>2. at the cost of 花费；支付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were all entertained at the director's expense. 我们全由导演请客。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They built the railroad at the expense of two hundred million dollars. 他们花了2亿美元修筑这条铁路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been at the expense of her education. 他一直支付她的教育经费。</font>\n
at the foot of	<font color=blue size=4>at the foot of</font>\n<br>at the bottom of 在…底部（脚下）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A temple stands at the foot of the mountain. 山脚下有一座寺庙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>See explanatory notes at the foot of this page. 参看本页下端的注解。</font>\n
at (the) latest	<font color=blue size=4>at (the) latest</font>\n<br>and no later 最迟；至迟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must be there by 10 at (the) latest. 我们必须最迟10点钟赶到那里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a few days at (the) latest I will return. 我最多几天就返回。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will give you a definite answer on Friday at the latest. 我最迟在星期五给你确切的答复。</font>\n
at the moment	<font color=blue size=4>at the moment</font>\n<br>1. at the present time; now 此刻；目前（用于现在时态中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know the address well enough, but I can't think of it at the moment. 我清楚地记得这个地址，可是这会儿怎么也想不起来了。</font>\n<br>2. then 那时；那一刻（用于过去时态中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was busy at the moment. 我那时很忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was willing to lend him the book, but I hadn't it with me at the moment. 我是愿意借给他那本书的，可是当时书不在我手边。</font>\n
at (the) most	<font color=blue size=4>at (the) most</font>\n<br>not more than 至多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is at most 30 years old. 他至多30岁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a minor offense at most. 那顶多也不过是个小错。</font>\n
at the rate of	<font color=blue size=4>at the rate of</font>\n<br>1. at the speed of 以…的速度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car was running at the rate of 100 kmph. 汽车以100公里的时速行驶。</font>\n<br>2. at a charge or payment fixed according to a standard scale 以…的比率；以…的价格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I bought the oranges at the rate of seven jiao a jin. 我以7角钱一斤的价格买了这些桔子。</font>\n
at the right time	<font color=blue size=4>at the right time</font>\n<br>at the proper or suitable time 在适当的时候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must learn to do the right thing at the right time. 应该学会在适当的时候做适当的事情。</font>\n
at the risk of	<font color=blue size=4>at the risk of</font>\n<br>with the danger of; with the possibility of (loss, etc.) 冒…之险；不顾…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was determined to get there even at the risk of his life. 他决心到那里去，即使是冒生命危险也在所不惜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the risk of being bankrupt, he invested all his money in the company. 冒着破产的危险，他把所有的钱都投到公司去了。</font>\n
at the same time	<font color=blue size=4>at the same time</font>\n<br>1. at the same moment; together 同时；一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know he is untrustful, but at the same time, I must admit he is a good worker. 我知道，他不可信。但是同时我必须承认他是个好工人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't all speak at the same time. 大家不要同时说话。</font>\n<br>2. in spite of the fact; even though; however 尽管如此；虽然；但是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will cost a lot of money. At the same time, I think we shall need it and it will certainly be useful. 这将花费好多钱，但是我认为我们需要它而且它一定会有用途的。</font>\n
at the sight of	<font color=blue size=4>at the sight of</font>\n<br>on seeing 一看到…就\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy ran towards his mother at the sight of a dog. 那个男孩一看见狗就朝母亲跑去。</font>\n
at (the) worst	<font color=blue size=4>at (the) worst</font>\n<br>even in the worst circumstances 坏到极点；作为最坏的可能性\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll lose some money at worst. 我们至多损失一些钱罢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She keeps cheerful, even when things are at their worst. 即使在最糟的情况下，她也保持心情愉快。</font>\n
at times	<font color=blue size=4>at times</font>\n<br>sometimes; occasionally 间或；有时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At times I saw her walking alone by the lake. 我有时看到她独自在湖边散步。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At times I make mistakes when I speak English. 我说英语有时有错。</font>\n
attribute to	<font color=blue size=4>attribute to</font>\n<br>1. believe sth. to be the result of 认为是…的缘故；归于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack attributed his success to hard work. 杰克认为自己的成功来自于刻苦努力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He attributes his good health to careful living. 他的健壮的体魄归因于他注意妥善安排生活。</font>\n<br>2. believe sth. to have been written by 认为…为某人所作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poem is usually attributed to Li Bai. 这首诗通常被认为是李白的作品。</font>\n
at war	<font color=blue size=4>at war</font>\n<br>in the state of armed struggle 在交战中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two countries were at war for 8 years. 这两个国家打了 8年仗。</font>\n
at will	<font color=blue size=4>at will</font>\n<br>as one pleases or likes 随意地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Gone for ever are the days when imperialism could trample small nations under foot at will. 帝国主义任意把小国踩在脚下的日子已一去不复返了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one can do anything at will. 谁也不能为所欲为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He comes and goes at will. 他来去自由。</font>\n
at work	<font color=blue size=4>at work</font>\n<br>working; engaged in 在工作；从事于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is at work on a new book. 他在写一本新书。</font>\n
avail oneself of	<font color=blue size=4>avail oneself of</font>\n<br>give oneself the use or advantage of 利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should avail yourself of every chance to improve your spoken English. 你应当利用一切机会提高英语口语水平。</font>\n
avenge of	<font color=blue size=4>avenge of</font>\n<br>repay a crime by punishing 报复；复仇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The King was avenged of his father's murder. 国王报了杀父之仇。</font>\n
avenge on	<font color=blue size=4>avenge on</font>\n<br>set or take vengeance for 为（某人）向（某人）报复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The King avenged his father on his uncle. 国王向叔父报了杀父之仇。</font>\n
average out	<font color=blue size=4>average out</font>\n<br>1. reach an average 达到某一平均数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His taxes may average out at about one quarter of his income. 他的税可能平均达到他收入的四分之一左右。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their working hours average out at 40 per week. 他们每周的工作时间平均达到40小时。</font>\n<br>2. make or calculate the average of 算出平均数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They averaged out the unmbers and got the result 25. 他们算了这些数的平均数，结果是25。</font>\n
awake to	<font color=blue size=4>awake to</font>\n<br>begin to understand; become watchful about 认识；明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must awake to the dangers facing our country. 我们必须认识到国家所面临的危难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must awake to the fact that failure is the mother of success. 你必须明白失败是成功之母。</font>\n
aware of	<font color=blue size=4>aware of</font>\n<br>conscious of 知道；意识到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not aware of the fact that life is hard. 他不知道生活是艰难的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was not aware of his having done wrong. 他没意识到他做错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Presently she became aware of footsteps hurrying after her. 过了一会她发觉身后有脚步声匆忙追来。</font>\n
back and forth	<font color=blue size=4>back and forth</font>\n<br>backwards and forwards; to and from; up and down 来来回回地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She walked back and forth on the path. 她在小径上来回走着。</font>\n
back away	<font color=blue size=4>back away</font>\n<br>draw back ; move backwards 后退；移开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd backed away to let the queen's carriage pass through. 人群退开了，好让女王的车子过去。</font>\n
back down	<font color=blue size=4>back down</font>\n<br>1. descend backwards 背朝后下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He backed down carefully, while I held the ladder for him. 我给他扶梯子，他小心地爬下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car at the top of the slope backed slowly down. 坡顶上的那辆汽车慢慢地退下来。</font>\n<br>2. give away; yield 放弃；让步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He backed down and accepted our proposal. 他放弃了原有想法，接受了我们的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trade union expects the management to back down. 工会希望资方能够让步。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was too proud to back down and admit mistakes. 他傲气十足，不肯让步和承认错误。</font>\n
back out	<font color=blue size=4>back out</font>\n<br>1. withdraw from an agreement or contract 撤回协议或契约；退出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you back out from the contract, you will have to pay a large sum of money to the company. 如果你违背协议，就得向公司支付一大笔钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She backed out of her engagement. 她不履行婚约。</font>\n<br>2. fail to fulfil sth. such as a promise or obligation 食言；收回承担的责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He agreed to lend me the money, but backed out later. 他答应借钱给我的，可是后来变卦了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the last minute, John backed out and refused to go with us. 最后一分钟时，约翰变卦了，不同意和我们一起去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He backed out because there was not much profit in this undertaking. 由于这项事业效益不大，他中途退出了。</font>\n
back up	<font color=blue size=4>back up</font>\n<br>1. drive or move backwards 倒车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to back his car up because the mountain path was too narrow. 由于山路太窄，他不得不把车子倒了回来。</font>\n<br>2. support 支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you will back me up in this argument. 我希望在这场争论中你能支持我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nobody backed her up when she protested against the decision. 当她反对这项决定时，没人支持她。</font>\n<br>3. block; hold up 阻塞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vehicles were backed up because of the accident. 车辆因交通事故受阻了。</font>\n
badly off	<font color=blue size=4>badly off</font>\n<br>poor; short of 贫穷；缺少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My family was badly off in those days. 在那些日子里，我家很穷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school is now badly off for experienced teachers. 这所学校现在缺少有经验的教师。</font>\n
bang away	<font color=blue size=4>bang away</font>\n<br>shoot continuously 连续射击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers were banging away at the target. 士兵们不停地向靶子射击。</font>\n
bang into	<font color=blue size=4>bang into</font>\n<br>1. collide with 碰撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He banged into a bus on the street. 他在大街上撞到一辆公共汽车上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus banged into a wall. 汽车猛撞到墙上。</font>\n<br>2. meet by chance 偶然相遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't expect to bang into him again. 我没有想到能再次碰到他。</font>\n
bank on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>bank on/upon</font>\n<br>depend on; expect 依靠；指望；依赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll bank on your support. 我们将依靠你的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bank on others to help you out of trouble. 不要指望别人帮助你摆脱困境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are banking on the team to do its best in the championship game. 我们指望这个队在锦标赛中全力以赴。</font>\n
bargain away	<font color=blue size=4>bargain away</font>\n<br>1. continue talking about a price 讨价还价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Women like to bargain away in the market. 妇女们喜欢在市场上讨价还价。</font>\n<br>2. allow sth. to be sold or lost (at a low price) for sth. of little vaLue; lose through bargaining 为获取某物廉价出售；通过讨价还价而失掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was foolish of them to bargain away a vast area of their territory for a sum of money. 为了一笔钱，他们竟轻易地放弃了大片领土，真是太蠢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bargained away his property. 他贱卖了自己的财产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have bargained away all hope of success. 他们因讨价还价而丧失了所有成功的希望。</font>\n
bargain for	<font color=blue size=4>bargain for</font>\n<br>1. try to get sth. at a low price 想廉价把…弄到手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man spent hours bargaining for a valuable painting. 那人花了好几个小时讨价还价，想把一幅珍贵的绘画弄到手。</font>\n<br>2. expect; anticipate 期望；预料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She found that the trouble she was put to was more than she had bargained for. 她发现所遇到的麻烦比预料的还多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't bargain for what happened. 我并未预料到所发生的事情。</font>\n
base on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>base on/upon</font>\n<br>establish on ; rest on 把…建立在；以…为基础\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One should always base one's opinion on facts. 人们说话应以事实为根据。</font>\n
be about to	<font color=blue size=4>be about to</font>\n<br>be on the point of; be ready to 即将；就要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were about to leave when you telephoned. 你打电话来时，我们正要动身。</font>\n
bear down	<font color=blue size=4>bear down</font>\n<br>1. weigh heavily upon 负重；压垮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy load seemed to bear the old man down. 这重担似乎要把老人压垮了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This responsibility bears down on him. 这个责任沉重地压在他的肩上。</font>\n<br>2. defeat 战胜；击败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His determined efforts at last bore down all his opponents. 他坚韧不拔，终于战胜了所有对手。</font>\n<br>3. strive harder; intensify one's effort 加紧努力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is bearing down in her studies to win a scholarship. 为了获得奖学金，她正发奋学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver bore down with all his strength to control the car when the wheels slipped. 当轮子打滑时，司机竭尽全力去控制住汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must bear down to keep our unbeaten record intact. 我们必须努力保持不败的记录。</font>\n
bear in mind	<font color=blue size=4>bear in mind</font>\n<br>remember; consider 记住；考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must bear in mind that contradictions exist everywhere. 应当记住，矛盾是普遍存在的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should bear our family in mind when we make our decisions. 我们作决定时必须考虑到家庭。</font>\n
bear on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>bear on/upon</font>\n<br>1. have some connection with; be related to 与…有关；涉及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These were vital decisions that bore on the happiness of everybody. 这些是关系到每一个人幸福的重要决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How does his remark bear on the matter? 他的话同这件事有什么关系？</font>\n<br>2. affect sb. (usu. in a bad way) 对…有影响；对…施加压力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shortage of oil bears on the life of the people. 石油短缺影响了人民生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to bring some pressure to bear on him. 我们必须对他加点压力。</font>\n
bear out	<font color=blue size=4>bear out</font>\n<br>prove or support the truth of 证实；证明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you say bears out my argument. 你的话证实了我的论点的正确性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I tell the judge that I am innocent, can you bear me out? 要是我告诉法官我是无辜的，你能为我作证吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you will bear out what I tell you. 我希望你能证实我告诉你的话。</font>\n
bear resemblance to	<font color=blue size=4>bear resemblance to</font>\n<br>be somewhat like 与…相象\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bears same resemblance to his father. 他有些象他的父亲。</font>\n
bear up	<font color=blue size=4>bear up</font>\n<br>1. have courage; not lose heart （在困难情况下）坚强；不气馁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She bore up well against that trouble. 她坚强地度过了那次难关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She bears up in face of difficulties. 在困难面前她不气馁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young girl bore up well after her failure of first jumps. 在几次试跳失败之后，那位姑娘表现得十分坚强。</font>\n<br>2. support sb. in time of trouble （在困难时）帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He couldn't have liced through the crisis without John to bear him up. 要是没有约翰的帮助，他是很难度过那次难关的。</font>\n<br>3. remain strong without being broken 支撑得住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bridge will bear up well under a tank. 即使一辆坦克开上去，这座桥也能承受得了。</font>\n
bear with	<font color=blue size=4>bear with</font>\n<br>show patience towards; tolerate 容忍；忍耐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is hard to bear with criticism. 耐心听取批评是件不容易的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't bear with faultfinding people. 他不能容忍吹毛求疵的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's no bearing with such rude fellows. 对这些粗鲁的家伙决不宽容。</font>\n
beat about/around the bush	<font color=blue size=4>beat about/around the bush</font>\n<br>refuse to come to the point when speaking about a subject 讲话绕圈子；不着正题\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't beat about the bush. Come straight to the point. 不要绕圈子，直截了当地说吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Instead of answering my question he began to beat about the bush. 他不回答我的问题而是在不着边际地兜圈子。</font>\n
beat down	<font color=blue size=4>beat down</font>\n<br>1. force or persuade sb. to lower his price 迫使或劝说（某人）降价；还价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first he asked for fifty pounds, but I beat him down to fortyfive. 起初他要50镑，后来我把价杀到45镑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can we beat down the price? 我们能还价吗？</font>\n<br>2. crush; pour down 摧毁；倾泻于；照射\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All their defenses were beaten down by the tanks. 他们所有的防御工事都被坦克摧毁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy rain beat down the crops. 大雨倾盆，猛打着庄稼。</font>\n<br>3. shine brightly or hotly 烈日照射\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In summer the sun beats down on the roof, so that the upper rooms become unbearably hot. 夏天烈日直射屋顶，因此楼上的房间酷热难忍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowds stood there for over an hour, with the sun beating down on them. 群众站在那里一个多小时，烈日一直照在他们身上。</font>\n<br>4. deject 使沮丧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was thoroughly beaten down and wretched. 他十分沮丧和痛苦。</font>\n
beat up	<font color=blue size=4>beat up</font>\n<br>1. beat severely 痛打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told the police that he had been beaten up by two masked men. 他告诉警察说两个蒙面人把他痛打了一顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They not only robbed the man of his money, but beat him up. 他们不仅抢了那人的钱，而且还把他毒打了一顿。</font>\n<br>2. mix thoroughly 搅拌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She beat up me egg in the flour. 她把鸡蛋同面粉搅拌匀。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is beating up cream. 他正在搅拌奶油。</font>\n<br>3. go against the wind 逆风而行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship was beating up the channel. 船在海峡里逆风而行。</font>\n<br>4. seek eagerly; gather together 热切地寻找；召集\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to beat up some support for the campaign she was leading. 她努力为自己所领导的运动寻求支持。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They will do their best to beat up customers for their company. 他们将尽力为其公司招徕生意。</font>\n<br>5. disturb as by a sudden visit 惊扰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't beat up the rabbit. 不要惊跑那只兔子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy were unaware of our closing in until two shots beat them up. 敌人没有觉察到我们已经逼近，直到两声枪响震惊了他们。</font>\n
be broke	<font color=blue size=4>be broke</font>\n<br>be without money 没有钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He couldn't take his sister to the movie last night for the simple reason that he was broke. 他昨晚不能带他妹妹去看电影，原因很简单，他没有钱。</font>\n
because of	<font color=blue size=4>because of</font>\n<br>as a result of; by reason of 因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They didn't climb the mountain because of the rain. 因为下雨他们没有爬山。</font>\n
become of	<font color=blue size=4>become of</font>\n<br>happen to; be the fate of 遭遇；结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What will become of you if you continue such conduct? 你要是继续这样干下去，会有什么结局呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What is to become of me if you go away? 要是你走了，我怎么办呢？</font>\n
be down for	<font color=blue size=4>be down for</font>\n<br>have one's name down in a register for 在名册中登记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is down for promotion. 他已列入晋级名单。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are down for a new council house. 我们已登记了市建房屋。</font>\n
be for	<font color=blue size=4>be for</font>\n<br>1. be in favour of 赞成；拥护\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm for the Conservatives, but she's for the Socialists. 我拥护保守党人，但她却拥护社会党人。</font>\n<br>2. be going to ; be heading for 要去；动身去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm for the hills this year. 今年我要到山区去。</font>\n
before long	<font color=blue size=4>before long</font>\n<br>soon 不久；很快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before long, it will be a new year. 新的一年很快就要到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book will be published before long. 这本书不久就要出版了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope to hear from you before long. 我希望不久就能收到你的信。</font>\n
beg for	<font color=blue size=4>beg for</font>\n<br>1. ask humbly for 乞怜；乞讨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man went from house to house, begging for food. 老人挨家乞食。</font>\n<br>2. make an urgent request for 请求；恳求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wounded soldier begged for mercy. 那个伤兵恳求宽恕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He would rather starve to death than shamelessly beg for his life. 他宁愿饿死也不无耻求饶。</font>\n
begin with	<font color=blue size=4>begin with</font>\n<br>start with; continue from 由…开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first word of a sentence should begin with a capital letter. 句子的第一个词应以大写字母开头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll ask you to read the poen, beginning with Jane. 现在我要请你们读这首诗，从简开始。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Begin with this one and do the others afterwards. 先做这个，然后再做其他。</font>\n
beg off	<font color=blue size=4>beg off</font>\n<br>ask to be excused; ask that sb. may be excused or forgiven 恳求免除惩罚或责任；为某人求情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He promised to go with us, but he has since begged off. 他本来答应跟我们同往，但此后却借故推辞了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Headmaster means to punish him, but my father is going to try to beg him off. 校长打算处罚他，但我父亲将竭力恳求免除对他处分。</font>\n
behind schedule	<font color=blue size=4>behind schedule</font>\n<br>later or slower than planned or expected 比计划（预料）要晚（慢）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train was in an hour behind schedule. 火车误点一小时到达。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are behind schedule in building the library. 他们建造这座图书馆的进度比预定的要慢。</font>\n
behind the scenes/curtain	<font color=blue size=4>behind the scenes/curtain</font>\n<br>out of sight; secretly 在幕后；秘密地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The treaty was signed behind the scenes. 这项协议是秘密签订的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The real work of the conference is being done behind the curtain. 这次会议的实际工作正在幕后进行。</font>\n
behind the times	<font color=blue size=4>behind the times</font>\n<br>oldfashioned; not uptodate or modern 过时；落伍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Keller is a good teacher but he's behind the times. No one uses those methods anymore. 凯勒是一个好教师，但是他已经落后了。已经没有人用他的那些方法了。</font>\n
behind time	<font color=blue size=4>behind time</font>\n<br>late; after the stated time 迟；在规定时间之后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus was twenty minutes behind time. 汽车晚点20分钟。</font>\n
be in for	<font color=blue size=4>be in for</font>\n<br>1. enter for 参加（竞争）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will be in for the match. 他将参加这场比赛。</font>\n<br>2. be due for; be in line for 必定会遇到（遭到）；即将获得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll be in for trouble if you don't take my advice. 如果不听我的劝告，你非遇到麻烦不可。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in for promotion. 他即将获得晋升。</font>\n
be in on	<font color=blue size=4>be in on</font>\n<br>be party to; be fully involved in 参与；完全卷入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in on the whole sordid business. 他参与了整个这场肮脏的勾当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were de finitely in on the consiracy. 他们肯定完全参与了这一阴谋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sure she's in on their plans. 我肯定她跟他们同谋。</font>\n
be in with	<font color=blue size=4>be in with</font>\n<br>be in favour with; be friendly with 得某人欢心；与某人友好相处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in with her at the moment. 他现在深得她的欢心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's well in with those people. 她跟那些人友好相处。</font>\n
believe in	<font color=blue size=4>believe in</font>\n<br>1. consider sth. to be true; have faith or trust in 相信…是真的；信赖；信仰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Christians believe in God. 基督徒信仰上帝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't believe in him. 我不信任他。</font>\n<br>2. favour; support the idea of 赞成；支持；主张\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His parents don't believe in sending him to school too early. 他的父母不主张太早送他上学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He believes very strongly in female emancipation. 他坚决主张妇女解放。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I believe in keeping early hours. 我相信早睡早起有好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She believes in plenty of fresh air and exercise. 他相信大量的新鲜空气和锻炼有好处。</font>\n
belong to	<font color=blue size=4>belong to</font>\n<br>1. be the property of 属于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All power in China belongs to the people. 在中国一切权力属于人民。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This old musical instrument has belonged to our family for a long time. 我们家拥有这个古老的乐器已有很长时间了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In our country, land doesn't belong to any individual. 在我们国家，土地不属于任何私人所有。</font>\n<br>2. be a member of; be connected with 为…的成员；同…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people of different political views belong to the club. 这个俱乐部里汇集了许多政治观点不同的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Over ninetenths of the inhabitants there belong to the Han nationality? 那儿十分之九以上的居民属于汉族。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know to which team he belongs. 我不知道他是哪个队的成员。</font>\n
bend on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>bend on/upon</font>\n<br>set one's mind on; have as a fixed purpose 致力于；专注于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was bent on becoming a musician. 他决心当一名音乐家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack used to be bent on chemistry as a profession. 杰克曾经专攻化学。</font>\n
bend over	<font color=blue size=4>bend over</font>\n<br>1. lean towards 俯向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor bent over the sick child. 医生弯腰看那生病的孩子。</font>\n<br>2. be turned over 翻转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bend over the pages. 不要卷折书页。</font>\n
beneficial to	<font color=blue size=4>beneficial to</font>\n<br>helpful to; useful to 有益于；有利于（通常后接非生物性名词）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Economic reform is beneficial to the development of our country. 经济改革对我国发展有利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not all medicines are beneficial to health. 不是所有的药都对身体有益。</font>\n
benefit from/by	<font color=blue size=4>benefit from/by</font>\n<br>gain advantage, pleasure or profit from 从…得到好处；从…受益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have benefited a lot from the trip. 这次旅行使我受益匪浅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I believe you'll benefit from your further study. 我相信你会从这次进修中学到许多东西的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient will benefit by a few day's rest. 病人休息几天就会好一些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't seem to have benefited by the treatment. 这种治疗看来对他没有效。</font>\n
be off	<font color=blue size=4>be off</font>\n<br>1. go away; leave 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Smith has been off to Paris. 史密斯先生已经离开去巴黎了。</font>\n<br>2. be cancelled 被取消\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trip was off because of the bad weather. 这次旅行因天气不好而被取消了。</font>\n<br>3. stay away from work; finish work 下班；完工；休假\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is off work at eight o'clock tonight. 他今晚8点钟下班。</font>\n<br>4. have gone bad 变坏；变质\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meat is off. Don't eat it. 肉变质了，不要再吃了。</font>\n<br>5. have become loose 松开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's a button off your coar. 你的外衣掉了一个扣子。</font>\n<br>6. be prevented from eating, etc. 戒某种食品\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been off alcohol since his illness. 他自病后就戒酒了。</font>\n<br>7. dislike 厌恶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm off eggs just now; I ate so many last week. 我现在厌恶鸡蛋，上周吃得太多了。</font>\n
beside oneself with	<font color=blue size=4>beside oneself with</font>\n<br>at the end of one's control…得发狂；…得要命\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was beside herself with joy when she got the letter. 收到那封信，她欣喜若狂，高兴得要命。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was beside himself with grief. 他极度悲伤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane has been almost beside herself with toothache, but she will not go to a dentist. 简牙痛得要命，可她就是不去看牙医。</font>\n
beside the point/mark/question	<font color=blue size=4>beside the point/mark/question</font>\n<br>having nothing to do with 离题；与本题无关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That question was beside the mark and need not be answered. 那个问题与本题无关，没有必要回答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you have said is beside the point. 你所说的与题无关。</font>\n
bet on	<font color=blue size=4>bet on</font>\n<br>risk money on the result of 为…打赌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is going to bet on the white horse. 他要在那匹白马身上下赌注。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bet me ten dollars on John's coming. 他认为约翰会来，与我赌10美元。</font>\n
better off	<font color=blue size=4>better off</font>\n<br>richer; happier; in a more favorable position 更富有；更愉快；状况更好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will be bettrer off in your new job. 你会更适应新的工作环境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Chinese people are better off today than in the past. 现在，中国人民的生活比过去好多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she got home she was not much better off. 当她到家的时候，她并没有好转的感觉。</font>\n
between ourselves	<font color=blue size=4>between ourselves</font>\n<br>in confidence; between you and me 只限于你我之间；不可外传\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What we say here is between ourselves. 我们在这里所说的话不可对他人说。</font>\n
beware of	<font color=blue size=4>beware of</font>\n<br>be on one's guard against; be careful of 当心；小心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Beware of pickpockets when you go shopping. 买东西时要当心扒手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should beware of repeating the same mistakes. 你应当注意不要犯同样的错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must beware of hasty generalizations. 你必须注意避免作出轻率结论。</font>\n
beyond description	<font color=blue size=4>beyond description</font>\n<br>wonderfully good; not possible to describe 难以形容的；难以描述的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grand sight of the Yellow Mountain is beyond description. 黄山的美景非笔墨所能描述。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The film is dull beyond description. 这部电影单调极了。</font>\n
beyond doubt	<font color=blue size=4>beyond doubt</font>\n<br>doubtless 无疑的；一定的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Beyond doubt, he is the best student in the class. 他无疑是全班最好的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's beyond doubt that we can overcome all these difficulties under the leadership of our Party. 毫无疑问，在党的领导下，我们能战胜所有这些困难。</font>\n
beyond one's means	<font color=blue size=4>beyond one's means</font>\n<br>more than one can afford 非财力所及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't live beyond your means. 过日子不要超出自己财力所及的范围。</font>\n
beyond sb's power	<font color=blue size=4>beyond sb's power</font>\n<br>out of sb. 's reach 是某人力所不及的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is beyond his power to get the work done within a week. 他无法在一周内完成这项工作。</font>\n
beyond/without question	<font color=blue size=4>beyond/without question</font>\n<br>not to be doubted or disputed 毫无疑问；没有争论的余地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This university is beyond question one of the best in China. 这所大学无疑是中国最好的大学之一。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His drawing is without question the best in the class. 他的画无疑是班上最好的。</font>\n
beyond words	<font color=blue size=4>beyond words</font>\n<br>incapable of being expressed 无法用语言表达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grief is beyond words. 悲哀难以用言语表达。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His kindness is beyond words. 他的仁慈是无法形容的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was touched beyond words. 他感动得无法用言语来表达。</font>\n
bid farewell to	<font color=blue size=4>bid farewell to</font>\n<br>say goodbye to 向…告别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She bade farewell to her relatives and friends. 她向亲友们告别。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In bidding farewell to him, we requested him to convey our profound feelings to the American people. 在向他告别时，我们请他转达我们对美国人民的深厚感情。</font>\n
big shot	<font color=blue size=4>big shot</font>\n<br>important person 重要人物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My friend thinks he's a big shot because he has some responsibilities in the mayor's office. 我朋友因为在市长办公室负点责就自认为是个重要人物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The world is full of people who think that they are big shots, but few ever get into the history books. 世界上许许多多的人自认为是重要人物，但是很少一部分人被写入历史书中。</font>\n
bind over	<font color=blue size=4>bind over</font>\n<br>compel legally to do sth. 使…保证做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two men were bound over to keep the peace. 这两个人被勒令守法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The magistrate said, “I shall bind you over to keep the peace. ”地方法官说：“我要你遵纪守法。”</font>\n
bind up	<font color=blue size=4>bind up</font>\n<br>1. wrap about 捆扎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She expertly bound up the wound. 她娴熟地把伤口包了起来。</font>\n<br>2. be closely connected with 同…密切相关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her life is bound up in yours now. 现在她的生活同你密不可分。</font>\n<br>3. be absorbed in 沉缅于；专心干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is completely bound up in the book he is writing. 他正潜心写那本书。</font>\n<br>4. heal 治好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Consolation will bind up her broken heart. 安慰将会抚平她受伤的心灵。</font>\n

bite the bullet	<font color=blue size=4>bite the bullet</font>\n<br>suffer sth. unpleasant bravely 勇敢地忍受；忍辱负重\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government called the people to bite the bullet and rebuild their homes. 政府号召人民忍受巨大痛苦重建家园。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will bite the bullet and make personal sacrifices. 他将忍受巨大的痛苦，作出个人牺牲。</font>\n
black and white	<font color=blue size=4>black and white</font>\n<br>1. in writing 书面记下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We asked the dealer to put down the details of the sale in black and white. 我们要求商人把成交的详细项目写下来。</font>\n<br>2. showing the pictures in black, white and grey, without additional colours 未着色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She likes the picture in black and white. 她喜欢那幅墨水画。</font>\n
black out	<font color=blue size=4>black out</font>\n<br>1. darken by putting out or dimming lights so that no light is seen from outside 使灯光熄灭（或暗下来）；实行灯火管制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city was blacked out during the air raid. 空袭期间，全城都实行了灯火管制。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the war we had to black out all our windows. 在战争期间我们不得不把所有的窗户遮暗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory was blacked out due to power failure. 这家工厂由于停电一片漆黑。</font>\n<br>2. cover (esp. with ink) so as to hide completely; cut out 涂掉；删去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better black out that word. 你最好把那个字涂掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In wartime, they often blacked out all news, or gave out false news. 在战争期间，他们常封锁消息或者发布假新闻。</font>\n<br>3. lose consciousness; lose one's memory 失去知觉；暂时失去记忆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the accident he blacked out and couldn't remember what happened. 事故之后，他晕倒了，记不起发生了什么事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It had been a hard and tiring day, and she suddenly blacked out. 一整天辛苦疲劳后，她突然昏倒了。</font>\n<br>4. cause silence or jam (radio transmission) 封锁或干扰广播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy hoped to black out our radio transmission. 敌人想干扰我们电台的广播。</font>\n<br>blame for consider sb. responsible for; find fault with sb. 因…责备（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver blamed the cyclist for the accident. 司机把这次事故归咎于那个骑车人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager blamed the office boy for losing the key. 经理责备勤务员丢了钥匙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accountant was blamed for the mistake. 会计因有错误而受责备。</font>\n
blame on	<font color=blue size=4>blame on</font>\n<br>place the guilt for (sth. wrong) on (sb.); lay the blame on 把责任推到（某人）身上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't blame it on him, but on me. 别怪他，怪我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blame his failure on the teacher. 他把他的失败归咎于老师。</font>\n
blank out	<font color=blue size=4>blank out</font>\n<br>1. cross out 删掉；划掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The editor blanked out several passages from the article. 编辑将文章中的几个段落删掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This entry is to be blanked out. 这一条目该划掉。</font>\n<br>2. fade; become confused or abstracted 渐渐消失；变得胡涂或心不在焉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I did not go to sleep until the noise in the street blanked out. 街上没有响声以后，我才睡着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His memory blanks out when he gets excited. 他一兴奋就什么也记不得了。</font>\n
blast off	<font color=blue size=4>blast off</font>\n<br>1. raise or remove by an explosion 爆炸；炸毁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The explosin blasted the roof off. 炮弹把房顶炸飞了。</font>\n<br>2. (of a space vehicle) rise into space（火箭，导弹）发射；升空\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The jet fighters blasted off from the deck of the aircraft carrier. 喷气式战斗机从航空母舰的甲板上起飞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The missile will blast off at 10 a.m. local time. 这枚导弹将在当地时间上午10点发射。</font>\n<br>3. show ill temper towards sb. 对某人发脾气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I entered the room he was blasting off. 我进屋时他正在大发雷霆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss blasted off at the staff for poor business. 由于生意不好，老板向雇员们发火。</font>\n
bless with	<font color=blue size=4>bless with</font>\n<br>give a special gift to; favor with 赐福于；使有幸得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>May God bless you with success！愿上帝保佑你成功！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has not been rich, but he has always been blessed with good health. 他不是个富人，但却拥有健壮的身体。</font>\n
blind to	<font color=blue size=4>blind to</font>\n<br>unable to know 对…一无所知；看不见；不知晓\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Man is often blind to his own faults. 人们对自己的弱点往往视而不见。</font>\n
block in	<font color=blue size=4>block in</font>\n<br>1. enclose with blocks; surround 堵塞；包围\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The space has been blocked in. 这块场地被堵塞了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The harbour was completely blocked in by heavy masses of ice. 港口为大量冰块所封冻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car has been blocked in by all those lorries. 这辆小车被那些卡车堵住了。</font>\n<br>2. make a rough sketch or plan of the general arrangement (of objects in a drawing, etc.) 画略图；草拟计划\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The draughtsman rapidly blocked in his idea. 制图员很快把他的计划画出草图。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have blocked in a plan for their wheat production next year. 他们已为下年度的小麦生产拟订了一份计划。</font>\n
block out	<font color=blue size=4>block out</font>\n<br>1. mark out in blocks 标示街区\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The area has been blocked out, and building will begin soon. 这个地区的建筑图纸已经画好，不久就要施工。</font>\n<br>2. stop from getting through 阻止通过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That wall blocks out all the light. 那堵墙挡住全部光线。</font>\n<br>3. stretch out roughly without details; plan 画出…的草图；写出…提纲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's blocked out an outline for his essay. 他已经写好了论文提纲。</font>\n
block up	<font color=blue size=4>block up</font>\n<br>fill up; close up 积满；堵塞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This pipe is blocked up; there is a piece of wool in it. 这根管子被堵塞了，有一片毛织物在里面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The traffic is very heavy, and has begun to block up the streets. 交通极为繁忙，街道开始堵塞了。</font>\n
blossom out	<font color=blue size=4>blossom out</font>\n<br>1. come out in blossom 开花\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fruit trees have blossomed out beautifully. 这些果树花开得很美。</font>\n<br>2. develop 发展；成长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blossomed out as a firstrate athlete. 他锻炼成为第一流的运动员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has blossomed out into a lovely young woman. 她已长成一个可爱的年轻女子。</font>\n
blow away	<font color=blue size=4>blow away</font>\n<br> (of the wind) cause to move 吹走；吹跑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wind was so strong that people were nearly blown away. 风刮得很大，几乎把人都卷走了。</font>\n
blow down	<font color=blue size=4>blow down</font>\n<br>cause to fall by blowing; knock down 吹倒；摧毁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lamppost was blown down by the gale last night. 昨晚电线杆被狂风吹倒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm blew down many trees. 这场风暴刮倒了许多树。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building was blown down during the war. 这幢大楼是在战争中被炸毁的。</font>\n
blow off	<font color=blue size=4>blow off</font>\n<br>remove by explosion or force of wind 吹掉；炸掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wind blew off the roots of many trees. 大风把许多树连根拔掉。</font>\n
blow out	<font color=blue size=4>blow out</font>\n<br>1. explode and stop functioning; burst (said generally of tires) 爆炸；爆裂（通常指轮胎）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't pump too much air into the tire, otherwise you blow it out. 气别打得太足，否则轮胎会炸掉的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We arrived late because the front tire blew out on the way. 我们迟到了，因为车的前胎在路上爆了。</font>\n<br>2. stop burning by blowing 吹熄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She blew out the candle. 她吹灭了蜡烛。</font>\n<br>3. stop blowing（风）停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm blew itself out after five days. 5天后，暴风雨停了。</font>\n<br>4. (cause a fuse, a bulb, etc. to) melt（使保险丝、灯泡等）烧断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A short circuit suddenly blew out the fuse. 短路突然把保险丝烧断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An abnormally high lightning current blew out many television sets in the high building. 一股超强的闪电电流烧坏了这座高层建筑内的许多电视机。</font>\n
blow over	<font color=blue size=4>blow over</font>\n<br>1. pass; vanish 结束；（麻烦、不和等）消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole affair has caused a lot of trouble, but after it's blown over, no one will talk about it any more. 那件事引起了很多纠纷，但过后便没人再提它了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I believe your troubles will soon blow over. 我相信你的困难不久就会克服掉的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had frequent quarrels, but they soon blew over. 他们之间常有争吵，但一下子就过去了。</font>\n<br>2. stop blowiug（风）息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm has blown over. 暴风雨停了。</font>\n
blow up	<font color=blue size=4>blow up</font>\n<br>1. destroy by explosion 炸毁；爆炸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were thousands of passengers in the train when it blew up. 那列火车爆炸时，上面有几千名乘客。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy blew up all the bridges in this area. 敌人炸毁了这个地区所有的桥梁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A chemical factory blew up in the city yesterday. 昨天，这个城里的一家化工厂发生了爆炸。</font>\n<br>2. become suddenly angry 突然发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blew up at me when I told him that I couldn't do it. 当我告诉他我不能做这件事时，他对我大发雷霆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry I blew up at you this morning. 很抱歉，今天上午我跟你发了脾气。</font>\n<br>3. fill with air; inflate 打气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have these tires blown up. 我要给这些轮胎打打气。</font>\n<br>4. exaggerate; inflate 夸大；吹嘘；吹捧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This whole affair has been blown up. 整个这件事已经被夸大了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't blow this thing up more than necessary. 别过分夸大这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blows up his boss with flattery. 他对他的老板阿谀奉承。</font>\n<br>5. increase in size; enlarge 放大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These prints would look very good blown up. 这些图片放大后会非常好看。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has blown the print up. 他已经放大了这张像片。</font>\n<br>6. scold scverely 怒斥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The headmaster blew the boys up about the broken window. 校长斥责这些孩子打坏了窗户。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss blew Mary up for being late without a good excuse. 由于玛丽迟到，又没有适当的理由，老板把她训了一顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher blew him up for not doing his homework. 老师严厉地批评他未做家庭作业。</font>\n
blow upon	<font color=blue size=4>blow upon</font>\n<br>inform against; betray; impair the value of 告发；出卖；使…受损害；使…丢脸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blew upon his comrades. 他出卖了同志。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her reputation is blown upon. 她威性扫地。</font>\n
blunder away	<font color=blue size=4>blunder away</font>\n<br>move unsteadily or confusedly away; waste or lose…by mismanaging or carelessness 踉跄地或慌忙地离去；由于管理不善或粗心而浪费或失去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She came up to guide him when he was blundering away. 他踉踉跄跄地离开时，她上前为他引路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To blunder away state property is a grave crime. 浪费国家财产是极大的犯罪。</font>\n
blunder on	<font color=blue size=4>blunder on</font>\n<br>come upon by chance; stumble upon 偶然碰到；发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have blundered upon the trail of a gang of criminals. 他们偶然发现一伙罪犯的行踪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blundered on the book at a secondhand bookstore last Sunday. 上星期天，他无意中在一家旧书店发现了这本书。</font>\n
blunder out	<font color=blue size=4>blunder out</font>\n<br>utter stupidly, confusedly or thoughtlessly 无意中说出；糊里胡涂地说出；不加思索地说出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He blundered out an excuse. 他胡乱地编造了一个借口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She blundered out an apology. 她随口说声道歉。</font>\n
board in	<font color=blue size=4>board in</font>\n<br>enclose or seal with boards; take one's meals at the place where one lives 用板封闭；在住宿处搭伙\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The entrance has been boarded in. 入口处用板堵住了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Smith has a bedroom in his house and boards in. 史密斯先生在他家寄宿也在他家吃饭。</font>\n
board out	<font color=blue size=4>board out</font>\n<br>take one's meal away from the place where one lives 在外用膳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys are boarded out when their parents are abroad. 孩子们在父母出国期间在外用膳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some of the teachers and staff members board out. 有些住在学校的教职工在外搭伙。</font>\n
boast of/about	<font color=blue size=4>boast of/about</font>\n<br>talk proudly about 自夸；炫耀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always boasts of his learning. 他常常夸耀自己的学识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A wise man never boasts of his knowledge. 聪明人从不自夸有学问。</font>\n
boil down	<font color=blue size=4>boil down</font>\n<br>1. be reduced by boiling 煮浓\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These apples will soon boil down to jelly. 这些苹果不久就会煮成果酱了。</font>\n<br>2. be reduced to its real meaning; mean; summarise 意味着；归结为；使缩短\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can boil down the story to a few sentences. 你可以用几句话来概括这个故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What the foreign minister said boiled down to the rejection of the proposal. 外交部长的话意味着拒绝这项建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole discussion boils down to the question of whether the government should fix prices. 整个讨论归结到政府是否应当规定价格。</font>\n
boil over	<font color=blue size=4>boil over</font>\n<br>overflow by boiling 煮沸溢出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Turn off the gas. The milk is boiling over. 关上煤气，牛奶溢出来了。</font>\n
book down	<font color=blue size=4>book down</font>\n<br>register 登记下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every sum of money paid or received must be booked down immediately. 支出或收入的每一笔款都必须立即记账。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Detailed items of all the goods to be shipped have to be booked down. 待运货物的细目必须登记下来。</font>\n

born of	<font color=blue size=4>born of</font>\n<br>owing origin to; owing existence to 出身于；源于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was born of Russiaon parents. 她的父母是俄国人。</font>\n
bottle up	<font color=blue size=4>bottle up</font>\n<br>1. restrain (anger, feeling, etc.) 抑制（愤怒、感情等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no understanding person to talk to, so he bottled up his unhappy feelings. 既然没有可以相互理解的人谈心里话，他只好把不悦之情闷在心里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tension in the family is caused by everyone bottling up their feelings. 家庭的紧张关系是因为大家把不悦之情闷在心里所造成的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bottle it up; speak out. 不要闷在心里，都说出来。</font>\n<br>2. entrap; enclose 使陷入困境；包围\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our warships bottled up the enemy fleet in the harbour. 我们的舰队把敌舰封锁在港内。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy was bottled up like turtles in a jar. 敌人被围困得象瓮中之鳖。</font>\n
bound for	<font color=blue size=4>bound for</font>\n<br>1. going in the direction of 开往；驶向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship is bound for Wuhan. 这船是开往武汉的。</font>\n<br>2. intending to go to 准备到…去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where are they bound for? 他们要到哪里去？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are bound for Northeast China to clear the wild land. 他们正准备去东北开垦荒原。</font>\n
bound to	<font color=blue size=4>bound to</font>\n<br>1. under the obligation; obliged 有义务的；受到约束的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are bound to help them overcome the difficulties. 我们有义务帮助他们克服困难。</font>\n<br>2. sure to; determined to 一定的；决心要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you bound to stay at the office so late? 你必须在办公室呆到这么晚吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl is bound to win a prize medal. 这女孩决心要获得奖章。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Under the leadership of the Party, the Chinese people are bound to win the victory. 在党的领导下，中国人民必定取得胜利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is bound to succeed in doing the experiment. 他一定会试验成功。</font>\n<br>3. destined for 驶往\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stood on the seaside, watching the ships bound to distant lands. 她站在海边，目送船舶驶向遥远的国度。</font>\n
bound up in	<font color=blue size=4>bound up in</font>\n<br>busy with; deeply concerned with 热心于；关注于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are bound up in the difficult task. 他们的全部身心都投入这项艰难的工作中了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is bound up in his wife and children. 他埋头于自己的小家庭。</font>\n
bound up with	<font color=blue size=4>bound up with</font>\n<br>have a very close connection with 同…密切相关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The affair was bound up with their interests. 这件事同他们的利益密切相关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The welfare of the individual is bound up with the welfare of the community. 个人福利与社会福利息息相关。</font>\n
bow down	<font color=blue size=4>bow down</font>\n<br>1. weigh down; cause sth. to bend 压弯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The apple tree is bowed down with the weight of its fruit. 果实累累，压弯了苹果树。</font>\n<br>2. cause sb. to suffer 使…遭受；使…受折磨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On hearing of her father's death she was bowed down with grief. 接到父亲去世的噩耗，她悲痛万分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was bowed down with troubles. 他困难重重，精神不振。</font>\n<br>3. admit defeat; give way; make sb. yield to 认输；低头；使某人屈服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has always refused to bow down to tyranny, wealth or power. 他从来没有向暴政、财富或权力低过头。</font>\n
bow out	<font color=blue size=4>bow out</font>\n<br>dissociate; disengage 放弃；退出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He decided to bow out now instead of fighting to keep his position. 他决定放弃这个职位，而不再为之奋斗下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bowed out of the semifinals when he hurt his leg. 他的一条腿受了伤，退出了半决赛。</font>\n
bow to	<font color=blue size=4>bow to</font>\n<br>1. bend at the waist in a humble manner 向…鞠躬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the people in the court bowed to the queen when she entered. 女王进来时，宫中所有的人都向她鞠躬致意。</font>\n<br>2. obey; comply with; be defeated in a contest 服从；屈从；败于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will bow to the decision of the committee though I disagree with it. 我虽然不同意委员会作出的决定，但我还是会服从的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bowed to his opponents in the semifinals. 他在半决赛中败于对手。</font>\n
break away	<font color=blue size=4>break away</font>\n<br>1. come apart; come into pieces 破裂；裂开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wings of the plane broke away in midair, so the plane crashed. 机翼在半空中裂开，所以飞机失事了。</font>\n<br>2. escape; rebel 逃跑；反叛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminal broke away from the policemen. 罪犯从警察手中逃走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I imagine he will try to break away. 我想他会设法逃跑。</font>\n<br>3. end one's connection with 脱离（社团、政党等）；断绝关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The state has broken away from the union. 这个州已经脱离了联邦政府。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke away from his family and went abroad. 他与家庭断绝了关系，到国外去了。</font>\n<br>4. get rid of; abandon 放弃；解除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should break away from such bad habits. 你应该改掉这样的坏习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must break away from convention and adopt as many advanced techniques as possible. 我们必须打破常规，尽量采用先进技术。</font>\n
break down	<font color=blue size=4>break down</font>\n<br>1. destroy; reduce sth. to pieces 毁掉；打破\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police broke the door down. 警察破门而入。</font>\n<br>2. crush; defeat 镇压；制服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They broke down all opposition. 他们压倒了所有的对手。</font>\n<br>3. stop functioning (generally of motors and similar mechanical objects) 坏了；出毛病（尤指发动机、机器等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car broke down on the way to the airport. 车子在去机场的路上抛锚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lift broke down, so we had to walk up the stairs. 电梯坏了，我们只好走上楼去。</font>\n<br>4. fail to carry out (plans, negotiations, etc.); come to nothing 失败（指无结果中断计划、谈判等）；坚持不下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan was good, but it broke down, because people were unwilling to cooperate. 计划是好的，但由于人们不愿合作，还是失败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect the negotiations to break down soon. 我预料谈判不久就会中断。</font>\n<br>5. burst into tears; lose control 禁不住痛哭；（身体、精神）垮了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he heard his sentence, the man broke dewn. 听到判决，那人不禁号啕大哭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your health will break down if you work too hard. 太劳累的话，你身体会垮的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to cope with the everincreasing burden of his work, but finally he broke down and had to take a complete rest. 他设法应付日益加重的工作负担，但最后身体垮了，不得不全休。</font>\n<br>6. separate into parts; take apart; analyse 分解；分析\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Water can be broken down into hydrogen and oxygen. 水可以分解为氢和氧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want you to break this data down. 我想请你分析一下这个资料。</font>\n
break/eat one's word	<font color=blue size=4>break/eat one's word</font>\n<br>go back on one's word; fail to fulfil a promise or obligation 食言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man who often breaks his word is one not to be trusted. 一个常常食言的人是不可信赖的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't believe him; he always breaks his word. 不要相信他，他总是食言。</font>\n
break in	<font color=blue size=4>break in</font>\n<br>1. enter by force, usn. unlawfully 闯入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A thief broke in during the night and stole all his money. 盗贼夜间闯了进来，偷走了他所有的钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many students broke in the door of the burning laboratory. 许多学生破门进入失火的实验室。</font>\n<br>2. interrupt 插嘴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't break in when your teacher is speaking. 当你的老师说话的时候不要插嘴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While I was explaining my point of view, he broke in to argue with me. 正当我在解释我的观点时，他插进来和我争论。</font>\n<br>3. train; tame 训练\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse has been well broken in. 这匹马受过良好的训练。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That PLA man is much noted for his skill in breaking in horses. 那个解放军战士以善于驯马而出名。</font>\n<br>4. help adjust; adjust through usage sth. which is new and stiff 使适应新工作；使新物品逐渐合用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll give you an easy job just to break you in to the work. 先让你干点容易的事情，以便适应工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our new teachers are breaking in well. 我们的新教师正在逐渐适应工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is broken in to the new work. 他已经适应了新的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These new shoes are hurting me. I'll be glad when they are broken in. 这双新鞋穿上紧脚不舒服，等穿到合脚时我会很高兴的。</font>\n
break into	<font color=blue size=4>break into</font>\n<br>1. divide 分成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice broke the chocolate into pieces, one for each person. 艾丽斯把巧克力分成小块，每人一块。</font>\n<br>2. enter by force 闯入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman found that the house had been broken into and a quantity of jewellery stolen. 警察发现有人闯入室内，盗走一批珠宝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves planned to break into the bank. 小偷预谋闯进这家银行。</font>\n<br>3. burst into; begin suddenly 突然…起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack broke into laughter. 杰克突然大笑起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At this point even the interpreter broke into weeping. 到这时连翻译都哭泣起来了。</font>\n<br>4. interrupt 打断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't break into their conversation; they are discussing something important. 不要打断他们的谈话，他们正在讨论重要的事情。</font>\n<br>5. open and consume (sth. in reserve); occupy 启开和动用（储存物品）；侵占；占用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has broken into the money he has saved for long. 他已动用他长期积蓄的钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were so hungry that they couldn't help breaking into their emergency supplies of food and water. 他们饿极了，不得不动用应急食物和饮水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't take on any extra work; my spare time has been broken into far too much as it is. 我不能再承担任何额外的工作，就现在这样我的业余时间已经占用得过多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Housework has broken into a lot of my time. 家务事已占用了我很多时间。</font>\n
break loose	<font color=blue size=4>break loose</font>\n<br>escape; become free or loose 摆脱；脱开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminal broke loose from the police and ran into the woods. 罪犯挣脱警察，逃进了树林。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the storm, the boat broke loose from its mooring. 刮风暴时，船脱开了缆绳。</font>\n
break off	<font color=blue size=4>break off</font>\n<br>1. separate by breaking 弄碎；折掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke off a piece of chocolate and offered it to me. 他掰开一块巧克力递给了我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke off a branch and gave it to me. 他折了一根树枝，把它递给了我。</font>\n<br>2.
