(relationship, agreement) end or terminate suddenly（关系、协议等）突然结束；解除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two countries broke off their relations last month. 这两个国家上个月中断了外交关系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Unfortunately the negotiations have been broken off and are not expected to be resumed. 不幸的是，谈判已中断，而且不能指望再恢复了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl broke off her engagement last week. 这个女孩上周解除了婚约。</font>\n<br>3. stop speaking; cease suddenly 中止（谈话）；突然停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to break off our discussion because it was getting late. 时间晚了，我们不得不中断讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack broke off telling the story to answer the telephone. 杰克中断了正在讲的故事，去接一个电话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The conference broke off at noon. 中午休会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill broke off in the middle of his speech because of shouts of protest from the audience. 彼尔在听众的一片抗议声中中断了发言。</font>\n<br>4. stop working for a short time 工间休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's break off for ten minutes. 我们休息10分钟吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole cast broke off for coffee in the middle of the rehearsal. 在排练当中全体演员休息了一会喝咖啡。</font>\n<br>5. abandon; interrupt 放弃；打断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor advised him to break off smoking. 医生劝他戒烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her intrusion broke off our conversation. 她闯进来打断了我们的谈话。</font>\n
break out	<font color=blue size=4>break out</font>\n<br>1. occur suddenly 爆发；（突然）发生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Second World War broke out in September, 1939. 第二次世界大战于1939年9月爆发。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A fire broke out in this hotel last night. 昨晚这家旅馆发生了火灾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The economic crisis broke out first in the United States. 经济危机首先在美国爆发。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fighting has broken out on the border and is expected to continue until a settlement is reached. 战斗在边界打响了，预料会继续下去直到问题得到解决。</font>\n<br>2. escape 逃脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three prisoners have broken out this week and are on the run. 本周有3名囚犯越狱逃跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spent several months in a Nazi concentration camp before he broke out. 他在纳粹集中营里关了几个月后逃了出来。</font>\n<br>3. show sudden violence in speech or behaviour（言语或行为）突然激烈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole meeting broke out in cheers. 整个会场爆发出阵阵欢呼声。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She broke out in tears. 她突然哭了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke out：“That is not so！”他猛然吼道：“并不是这么回事。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is liable to break out into furious passions. 他很容易暴跳如雷。</font>\n
break through	<font color=blue size=4>break through</font>\n<br>1. break a way through; overcome 突破；冲破；克服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The allied forces soon broke through the enemy's defence line. 联军很快就突破了敌人的防线。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers have managed to break through. 战士们已设法突围。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We broke through countless enemy encirclements and blockades until we finally reached northern Shanxi. 我们突破了敌人无数次的包围和封锁，最后到达了陕北。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All difficulties can be broken through. 一切困难都能战胜。</font>\n<br>2. achieve sth. mew; make a discovery of a new and important kind 取得某种新成就；作出重大发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nuclear physicists claimed to have broken through in several new aspects of the nature of the atom. 核物理学家们宣称，在有关原子本质的几个新方面已有重大突破。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Scientists hope to break through soon in their fight against heart disease. 科学家们希望不久在治疗心脏病方面有所突破。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He failed many times but he finally broke through to find a successful polio vaccine. 他失败了许多次，但最终成功地发现了预防小儿麻痹症的疫苗。</font>\n<br>3. make an appearance 出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A little later the sun broke through the clouds. 一会儿太阳就钻出了云层。</font>\n
break up	<font color=blue size=4>break up</font>\n<br>1. smash to pieces; divide into small pieces 打破；弄碎；拆开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She broke up the glass in her search for money. 她在找钱时把玻璃打碎了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can break up that stone with his hand. 他用手能打碎那块石头。</font>\n<br>2. end for a holiday（学校期终）放假\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys will break up for the Christmas vacation next week. 孩子们下周放圣诞假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does the school break up for the summer holidays? 学校什么时候放暑假？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We break up on July 25th. 我们7月25日放假。</font>\n<br>3. end; stop 结束；停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party broke up at midnight. 晚会在午夜结束。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What time is the meeting expected to break up? 会议可望在几点钟结束？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke up the fight between the two gangs. 他制止了两伙人打架。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A fight started in that street last night, so the police were called in to break it up. 昨晚在那条马路上发生了一起斗殴事件，人们把警察叫来制止。</font>\n<br>4. become weak; upset completely （指人）身体衰弱；完全搅乱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He may break up under all these troubles. 遇到这么多麻烦，他可能会垮下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This trouble has really broken him up. 这件麻烦事确实使他心烦意乱。</font>\n<br>5. lose or destroy spirit or selfcontrol 精神崩溃（常用于被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was all broken up after her daughter's death, and did not go out of the house for two months. 她在女儿死后精神崩溃了，有两个月没有出家门。</font>\n<br>6. stop being friends; separate 绝交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary and John were good friends, but then they had a quarrel and broke up. 玛丽和约翰原来是好朋友，但后来吵了一架便绝交了。</font>\n
break with	<font color=blue size=4>break with</font>\n<br>1. cease one's association or friendship 同…断绝关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He advised her to break with her boyfriend. 他劝她和她的男友断绝关系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He broke with his former friends when he became rich. 当他成了有钱人时，就同以前的朋友断绝了关系。</font>\n<br>2. discontinue a practice or a habit 放弃（行为、习惯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not easy for the old to break with their old ideas. 老年人放弃旧观点是不容易的。</font>\n
breathe out	<font color=blue size=4>breathe out</font>\n<br>1. exhale; emit by breathing 呼气；呼出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He breathed out. 他呼了口气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He breathed out whisky fumes. 他呼出一股威士忌酒气。</font>\n<br>2. whisper 低声说出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He breathed out the secret. 他低声地说出了这个秘密。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He breathed out their names just before he died. 他临死前低声说出了他们的名字。</font>\n
bridge over	<font color=blue size=4>bridge over</font>\n<br>overcome; link with a bridge 克服；度过；搭桥通车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This sum of money is sure to bridge over their difficulties. 这笔钱肯定会帮助他们度过难关的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The river has been bridged over. 河上已架起了桥。</font>\n
brighten up	<font color=blue size=4>brighten up</font>\n<br>1. become bright or brighter 放晴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sky brightened up after the storm passed. 暴风雨过后，天空放晴了。</font>\n<br>2. make more cheerful or lively 使…愉快；使…增辉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His face brightened up. 他脸上露出了喜色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They brightened the party up with music and dancing. 他们的歌舞活跃了晚会的气氛。</font>\n
bring about	<font color=blue size=4>bring about</font>\n<br>produce; cause to arise or happen 产生；导致；促成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many new changes will be brought about in China's industry. 中国的工业将产生许多新的变化。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I offered to act as mediator and try to bring about a reconciliation between the two parties. 我自愿担任调解人，试图使争执双方和解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accident was brought about by John's carelessness. 这场事故是由于约翰的粗心造成的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy spring rains brought about the flood. 特大的春雨造成了这场水灾。</font>\n
bring along	<font color=blue size=4>bring along</font>\n<br>carry 带着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you bring your gun along with you? We'll perhaps go hunting. 你为什么不把枪带来？我们也许会去打猎的。</font>\n
bring around/round	<font color=blue size=4>bring around/round</font>\n<br>1. persuade sb. to change his opinion 劝告某人改变主意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first he stuct to his own opinion stubbornly but we brought him around to our way of thinking. 开始他顽固地坚持自己的意见，但最后我们使他接受了我们的思路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must bring them around to our point of view. 我们必须劝告他们接受我们的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a strike situation, workers try to bring the management around to their view by refusing to work. 罢工时，工人们企图通过拒绝上班来迫使资方接受他们的要求。</font>\n<br>2. bring sb. to an agreed place 带某人到（约定的场所）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought the visitors around to the exhibition hall. 他把参观者带到了展览厅。</font>\n<br>3. cause to recover from fainting or illness 使苏醒；使复原\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two girls fainted in the heat but we soon brought them around. 有两个女孩因中暑昏过去了，可是我们很快便使她们恢复了知觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor brought the man round shortly after the accident. 医生在事故发生后不久就使那人苏醒过来了。</font>\n<br>4. direct (a conversation or discussion) to one's favourite subject 把（话题或讨论）引向自己爱好的题目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By talking about the Women's Day he managed to bring the conversation around to the women's liberation movement. 谈到妇女节时，他就把话题转到妇女解放运动上来了。</font>\n
bring back	<font color=blue size=4>bring back</font>\n<br>1. return 送还；归还；退还\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These books must be brought back within a week. 这些书必须在一周内送还。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't like the dress you bought, you can always bring it back. 如果你不喜欢你买的衣服，你随时都可以退回来。</font>\n<br>2. recall; bring to mind 回想起；记起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The smell of the flower brings back her memories. 花香唤起了她对往事的回忆。</font>\n
bring down	<font color=blue size=4>bring down</font>\n<br>1. reduce; make low 减少（价格）；使跌落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After much hard bargaining he brought the trader down to ＄100for the carpet. 经过激烈的讨价还价之后，他使卖主的地毯降到100美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some countries demand to bring down the price of petroleum. 一些国家要求降低石油价格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sellers at last agreed to bring down the prices by 5%. 卖方最终同意降低5%的价格出售。</font>\n<br>2. defeat; cause to come down 推翻；击落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The opposition party planned to bring the government down. 反对党谋划推翻政府。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This scandal could well bring him down. 这件丑事很有可能使他垮台。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought down 9 enemy aircraft during the Korean War. 在朝鲜战场上他击落了9架敌机。</font>\n<br>3. cause to be in low spirits; dePress; deflate 使情绪低落；使沮丧；使泄气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The temporary setback seemed to have brought them down completely. 暂时的挫折似乎使他们完全失去了信心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even the failure did not bring him down. 甚至失败也没有使他沮丧。</font>\n
bring forth	<font color=blue size=4>bring forth</font>\n<br>1. produce 生产；产生；提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His vegetable garden brings forth a great number of watermelons every year. 他的菜园里每年生产大量的西瓜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought forth a new plan, just as unworkable as the old one. 他提出了一个新计划，跟老计划一样行不通。</font>\n<br>2. give rise to 引起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Idleness and luxury bring forth poverty and want. 懒惰和奢侈导致贫困和匮乏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Polluted water might bring forth a host of diseases. 污染的水可能会引起许多疾病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His carelessness brought forth an accident. 他的粗心大意惹出了意外事故。</font>\n<br>3. reveal 泄露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bring forth the secret. 切勿泄露这个秘密。</font>\n
bring forward	<font color=blue size=4>bring forward</font>\n<br>1. introduce; propose 提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She brought forward a new proposal. 她提出了一项新的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The matter will be brought forward at the next meeting. 这个问题将在下次会上提出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have brought forward a plan to reform the curricula of our department. 他们提出了一个改革我系课程设置的计划。</font>\n<br>2. advance in time 提前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have brought the meetingforward to this Friday. 他们已把会议提前到本周五召开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This warm weather will bring the crops forward. 这种暖和的天气会促使庄稼早熟。</font>\n
bring home to	<font color=blue size=4>bring home to</font>\n<br>make realize; persuade sb. to believe 使明白；使相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must bring home to John where the difficulties lie. 你必须使约翰认识到困难所在。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Its importance has been brought home to me very strongly. 我已非常深刻地认识到它的重要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should bring home to the public mind the practical importance of practising economy. 我们应使公众清楚地认识到勤俭节约的重要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can we bring home to him the seriousness of his conduct? 我们怎样才能使他清楚地认识到他的行为所导致的严重后果呢？</font>\n
bring in	<font color=blue size=4>bring in</font>\n<br>1. gather (crop) 收（庄稼）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmers are busy bringing in the wheat. 农民们正忙着收小麦。</font>\n<br>2. introduce 引入，引进（话题、风尚等）；提出（法案）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newcomers bring in new customs and new habits. 新来者带来新风俗、新习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've brought in experts to advise on the scheme. 他们请来了专家当该项目的顾问。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government has brought in a bill to deal with the matter. 政府通过了一项法案来处理那个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to bring in some outside help or you will never get the job finished in time. 你必须借助一些外来的帮助，否则是不能按时完成这项工作的。</font>\n<br>3. give a verdict 判决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The jury brought him in guilty. 陪审团判他有罪。</font>\n<br>4. yield (a profit) 赚；赢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In addition to his salary, he has investments which bring in about five hundred pounds a year. 除了工资外，他的投资每年还有大约500英镑的红利。</font>\n
bring into being	<font color=blue size=4>bring into being</font>\n<br>cause to be produced 使产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Reforms have brought great social and economic changes into being. 改革带来了社会和经济的巨大变化。</font>\n
bring into focus	<font color=blue size=4>bring into focus</font>\n<br>make very clear 讲清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We touched on too many topics, so the group leader brought all of them into focus by summarizing our discussion. 我们谈及了许多话题，因此组长通过总结把所有讨论的问题谈清楚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new government of that country is too disorganized to bring its problems into focus and slove them. 那个国家的新政府组织能力太差，根本不能把它的问题搞清楚并且解决好。</font>\n
bring into force	<font color=blue size=4>bring into force</font>\n<br>cause sth. such as law to begin to operate 使生效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new law will be brought into force from July. 新的法律将从7月开始生效。</font>\n
bring into play	<font color=blue size=4>bring into play</font>\n<br>make use of; bring…into action 发挥作用；调动（积极性）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now we have every opportunity to bring our talents into full play. 现在我们有各种机会来发挥我们的才能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought all his strength into play to move the rock. 他使出全身力气来搬走那块石头。</font>\n
bring into the open	<font color=blue size=4>bring into the open</font>\n<br>reveal; expose (a secret) 揭露；揭示；公布于众\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police investigation brought the crime into the open. 警察的调查揭露了犯罪事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The husband brought his feelings about their marriage into the open. 丈夫公布了他对于他们婚事的看法。</font>\n
bring off	<font color=blue size=4>bring off</font>\n<br>1. carry away; rescue 运走；救出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They brought off all the fishermen on board a sinking boat floating adrift in the sea. 他们把飘浮在海上的一艘沉船上的渔民全部救了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lifeboat brought off most of the crew. 救生船抢救出了大部分船员。</font>\n<br>2. succeed in; complete successfully 成功地完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought the deal off in a spectacular way. 他惊人地完成了这项交易。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've brought it off at last. I am glad you have passed the test. 你总算圆满地把它结束了，我很高兴你能通过这次考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan will probably encounter a great deal of opposition, but with tactics and patience I think we'll be able to bring it off. 这项计划可能遭到许多反对，但是凭着机智和耐心，我想我们会成功的。</font>\n
bring on	<font color=blue size=4>bring on</font>\n<br>1. cause to arise or occur; cause to develop or advance 引起；发生；使发展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Living in damp surroundings may bring on rheumatism. 生活在潮湿的环境里会引发风湿病的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has brought all the trouble on himself. 麻烦都是他自找的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain helped to bring on the crops. 这场雨有助于农作物的生长。</font>\n<br>2. serve (food) up; introduce (usu. on a stage) 端上（饭菜等）；介绍（通常在舞台上）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'll bring on our lunch right away. 她马上把午饭端上来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought on the guest speaker to the audience. 他向听众介绍了请来的演讲人。</font>\n
bring out	<font color=blue size=4>bring out</font>\n<br>1. reveal clearly; present; bring to light; develop 暴露；显露；发展，发挥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Difficulties can bring out a person's best qualities. 艰难困苦方能显示出一个人的优秀质量。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher helped to bring out the meaning of the poem. 教师帮助阐释这首诗的含义。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of work brings out the best in him. 这种工作最能发挥他的才干。</font>\n<br>2. publish; produce or sell 出版；发行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They try to bring out one new book each month. 他们争取每月出版一本新书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An old college friend of mine has brought out a book on English poetry. 我大学期间的一位老朋友出版了一本英文诗歌方面的书。</font>\n<br>3. produce 生产\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are bringing out a new brand of soap powder next month. 他们要在下月投放市场一种新牌洗衣粉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory is bringing out a new type of recorder. 这家工厂正在生产一种新型录音机。</font>\n
bring over	<font color=blue size=4>bring over</font>\n<br>1. cause (sb.) to come with one 带某人来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has just brought her family over from Shanghai. 她刚把她一家从上海接来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was brought over from China to Japan. 它是从中国传入日本的。</font>\n<br>2. convert (sb.) to a different way of thinking, to a cause, etc. 使某人改变想法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With some difficulty, I brought my son over to my way of thinking. 经过一番努力，我终于使我儿子同意我的看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most of his classmates were brought over to support him. 他的大部分同班同学已被争取过来支持他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried their best to bring the engineer over to their side. 他们竭尽全力把工程师争取到他们这边来了。</font>\n
bring through	<font color=blue size=4>bring through</font>\n<br>save (sb.); conduct safely through 使（某人）脱险；使安全结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sure the doctor will bring him through. 我相信医生一定会使他脱离险境的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The peasants have brought all the newly transplanted seedlings through. 农民已使所有这些刚插的秧苗成活了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was courage and confidence that brought us through the crisis. 是勇气和信心使我们度过了困境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brought his party through without accidents. 他顺利地结束了他的聚会，没有发生任何意外事故。</font>\n
bring to	<font color=blue size=4>bring to</font>\n<br>1. restore to consciousness 苏醒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They threw some cold water over her head to bring her to. 他们在她头上撒了一些冷水使她苏醒过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I once brought a fellow to that was drowned. 我有一次曾经把一个溺水的人救活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will soon be brought to. 他会很快被救醒过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor has brought him to by artificial respiration. 医生用人工呼吸使他恢复了知觉。</font>\n<br>2. bring (a ship) to a stop 使（船）停下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship was finally brought to after a stormy voyage. 船在暴风雨中航行了一段时间后终于停了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sailors brought their ship to by dropping the anchor. 水手们抛锚停船。</font>\n
bring to an end	<font color=blue size=4>bring to an end</font>\n<br>end; conclude 使…结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher brought the discussion to an end. 老师中止了这场讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope we'll bring our quarrel to an end as soon as possible. 我希望我们尽快结束这场争吵。</font>\n
bring to light	<font color=blue size=4>bring to light</font>\n<br>disclose; reveal 暴露出；揭发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trial brought to light many unknown details of the crime. 这次审讯揭露了许多未被人发现的与这罪行有关的细节。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After several months'investigation, the special committee brought to light some facts unknown to the outside world. 经过数月的调查，特别委员会揭露了一些鲜为人知的事实。</font>\n
bring under	<font color=blue size=4>bring under</font>\n<br>1. gain control of; defeat 控制；压制；镇压\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firemen soon brought the fire under control. 消防队不久就把大火扑灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those who opposed his wishes were brought under. 所有违背他意愿的人都遭到了镇压。</font>\n<br>2. include in 包括在内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your suggestions can be brought under four headings. 你的建议可包括在4个标题内。</font>\n
bring up	<font color=blue size=4>bring up</font>\n<br>1. raise from childhood; educate 抚育；教育\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must train and bring up millions of successors to out revolutionary cause. 我们必须培养和造就千百万革命事业的接班人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That child is very badly brought up. 那孩子的教养很差。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His father believed in bringing him up the hard way. 他父亲主张对他管教要严。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The couple brought up many children of the martyrs. 这对夫妇养育了许多烈士的后代。</font>\n<br>2. mention or present for attention or consideration 提出（让人注意或考虑）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your suggestion will be brought up at the mext meeting. 你的建议将在下次会议上提出来讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the course of study they brought up many questions. 在学习过程中他们提出了很多问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please bring your plan up at the meeting. 请将你的计划在会上提出来。</font>\n<br>3. cause to stop 使…停下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain was able to bring the ship up just before it hit a huge rock. 在即将撞上巨石的关头，船长把船停了下来。</font>\n<br>4. vomit 呕吐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Martin has been bringing up all morning. 马丁整个早上都在呕吐。</font>\n
brush aside	<font color=blue size=4>brush aside</font>\n<br>put away from; treat lightly; ignore; refuse to consider 扫除（障碍）；漠视；轻视；不予理睬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brushed all obstacles aside on his way forward. 他扫除了前进道路上的一切障碍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She brushed aside all difficulties and in the end succeeded. 她藐视一切困难，最后终于成功了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Brushing aside all opposition, he put the matter to a vote. 他不顾一切反对意见，把那件事付诸表决了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like being brushed aside like this. 我不喜欢让人家这样瞧不起。</font>\n
brush away	<font color=blue size=4>brush away</font>\n<br>treat as neither important nor desirable 既不重视也不觉得称心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brushed the whole business away. 他对整个事情不予理会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't just brush away our opinions. 你不能这样置我们的意见而不顾。</font>\n
brush off	<font color=blue size=4>brush off</font>\n<br>1. remove with a brush; disappear or come off as a result of being brushed 刷去；刷落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She brushed off the dust on her shoes. 她刷去鞋子上的灰尘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry, the dirt will brush off easily. 别着急，这脏东西很容易刷掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brushed the hairs off. 她把身上的头发刷去了。</font>\n<br>2. reject; dismiss curtly; not take seriously 拒绝；毫不客气地把…打发走；对…不在乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brushed off all our suggestions. 他拒绝了我们所有的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I invited him to watch an opera with me yesterday, but he brushed me off. 昨天我邀请他同我一起去看戏，但是他毫不客气地拒绝了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't expect her to brush us off like this. 我没有料到她会这样拒绝我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cut his finger but he brushed it off and kept on working. 他划破了手指，但他若无其事地继续工作。</font>\n
brush over	<font color=blue size=4>brush over</font>\n<br>1. brush fully 全刷；刷遍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I brushed the coat over. 我把大衣全刷了一下。</font>\n<br>2. treat lightly; almost ignore 轻率对待；几乎忽视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He brushed over the details of the policy. 他忽视了政策的细节。</font>\n
brush up against	<font color=blue size=4>brush up against</font>\n<br>1. encounter 碰到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has brushed up against trouble. 他碰到了麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She never loses heart when she brushes up against setbacks. 她遭受挫折时从不灰心。</font>\n<br>2. touch lightly 轻轻触到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I brushed up against her unintentionally. 我无意间轻轻碰了她。</font>\n
brush up (on) 	<font color=blue size=4>brush up (on) </font>\n<br>1. review (a skill, knowledge) one has learned in the past 重新学习；复习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have to brush up my English before I go abroad. 出国前我要温习一下英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he had to brush up on his history before the examination. 他说他得在考试前复习历史。</font>\n<br>2. make clean or bright with a brush 刷净；擦亮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your boots should be brushed up a bit. 你的长统靴该搽搽亮。</font>\n
bubble over	<font color=blue size=4>bubble over</font>\n<br>be so filled with sth. as to be unable to restrain it from escaping 洋溢；抑制不住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She came back bubbling over with new ideas. 她带着满脑子的新想法回来了。</font>\n
build in	<font color=blue size=4>build in</font>\n<br>enclose in; fix in (in a permanent way) 嵌入；（永久）固定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cupboards are built in to the walls of the house. 橱柜镶在屋子里的墙上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not difficult to build wardrobes in if you want them. 你想把衣柜镶在墙里，那并不难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Yesterday he bought a transistor radio with an aerial built in. 昨天他买了一架带天线的半导体收音机。</font>\n
build on	<font color=blue size=4>build on</font>\n<br>1. look to; rely on 依靠；依赖；指望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll build on your support. 我将依靠你的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't build too much on his promise. 不要过多地指望他的许诺。</font>\n<br>2. bottom on; be on the basis of 以…为基础\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must develop our national economy by building on the development of agriculture. 我们必须在发展农业的基础上，发展国民经济。</font>\n<br>3. add on as a new part 加建一个新的部分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can build an extension on later if you want one. 如果你想要，我们以后可以扩建一间房子。</font>\n
build up	<font color=blue size=4>build up</font>\n<br>1. increase in power and number; develop; make stronger, establish. 发展；使强大；建立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been building up their military strength. 他们一直在发展军事力量。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy are building up their offensive capacity along the border. 敌人正在边界一带增强他们的进攻能力。</font>\n<br>2. amass; accumulate gradually 聚积\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tension is building up in this area. 这个地区的局势日趋紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Clouds are building up over the sea. 在海面上空，聚集着一片乌云。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has built up quite a fortune in that business. 他从那项经营中积累了一大笔钱。</font>\n<br>3. restore sb. 's strength or physique after an illness; develop 恢复健康；发育\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every morning he spends 45 minutes doing physical exercises to build up his health. 每天早晨他花45分钟锻炼身体，以增强体质。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has built up a remarkable physique by following these exercises. 他通过这些锻炼练出了非常健康的体格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Good food builds up the body. 好食品能促进健康。</font>\n<br>4. acquire; increase in fame 取得；使…逐渐出名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has built up his reputation. 他使自己逐渐出了名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have built that boy up into a leading singer. 他们已把那个男孩培养成了主要歌手。</font>\n
bump into	<font color=blue size=4>bump into</font>\n<br>1. meet by chance 偶然遇到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I bumped into an old friend in town today. 我今天在城里偶然碰到了一位老朋友。</font>\n<br>2. strike or knock against violently 猛击，猛撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bumped into a wall as he hurried along not watching his steps. 他匆匆赶路，不小心撞在一堵墙上。</font>\n
burn away	<font color=blue size=4>burn away</font>\n<br>continue burning 不断地燃烧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The forest fire burned away for days. 森林大火一连烧了好多天。</font>\n
burn down	<font color=blue size=4>burn down</font>\n<br>1. burn completely 把…烧成平地；烧掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building was burned down last week. 这幢大楼是上周烧毁的。</font>\n<br>2. lose heat or burn less brightly as the fuel is used up 渐渐烧完；燃料燃尽；火力减弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire has burned down; get some more coal please. 火不旺了，再添点煤吧。</font>\n
burn out	<font color=blue size=4>burn out</font>\n<br>1. destroy by burning 烧掉（家、店、财产等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire burned out his shop and left him deep in debt. 火烧掉了他的商店，使他负债累累。</font>\n<br>2. (electrical equipment) stop functioning; become useless 烧坏（电灯泡、电器）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The electric light bulb is burnt out. 电灯泡烧坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are no lights in the house. Perhaps a fuse has burned out. 屋里没灯，可能是保险丝烧坏了。</font>\n<br>3. die; burn to an end（炉火等）烧尽；燃完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The oil lamp has burned out. 煤油灯的油燃尽了。</font>\n<br>4. wear out or cause to wear out through overwork 因工作过度等而垮下；精疲力尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll burn yourself out if you go on working at this rate. 如果你继续这样干下去的话，你的身体会垮掉的。</font>\n<br>5. (anger, etc.) disappear（怒气等）消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their anger seems to have burned out. 他们的愤怒似乎已经平息。</font>\n
burn up	<font color=blue size=4>burn up</font>\n<br>1. burst into flames again; burn brightly 烧起来；旺起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire burned up when she added some wood. 她添了一些木柴，火就烧得旺起来了。</font>\n<br>2. make angry 激怒；使…恼火\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His behaviour really burns me up. 他的行为真使我恼火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was burnt up about the matter. 他为这件事大发雷霆。</font>\n<br>3. burn completely; consume entirely 烧完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire burned up a number of valuable manuscripts. 那场火烧掉了一批珍贵的手稿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house burned up before the firemen got there. 消防队员到达前，房子已烧光了。</font>\n
burst in	<font color=blue size=4>burst in</font>\n<br>1. break in; smash in 闯入；破门而入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police burst in and told everyone to stand still. 警察闯了进来，叫大家站着不动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had to burst the door in because they had lost the key. 他们丢了钥匙，只好破门而入。</font>\n<br>2. interrupt 打断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father told his son not to burst in while adults are talking. 父亲叫他儿子不要打断大人的谈话。</font>\n<br>3. appear suddenly 突然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll be bursting in upon us at any moment. 他会随时突然出现在我们面前。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were talking about him when he burst in. 我们正谈到他时，他突然来了。</font>\n
burst into	<font color=blue size=4>burst into</font>\n<br>1. enter suddenly; smash into 闯入；破门而入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police burst into the room. 警察突然闯进了房间。</font>\n<br>2. begin suddenly 突然开始；突然…起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience burst into applause. 观众突然报以热烈的掌声。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary burst into laughter. 玛丽突然大笑起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sad story made the girl burst into tears. 悲惨的故事使那女孩突然哭起来。</font>\n
burst out	<font color=blue size=4>burst out</font>\n<br>begin doing sth. suddenly 突然…起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was quiet when John suddenly burst out laughing. 大家都很安静，突然约翰大笑起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every time she thought about him she burst out crying. 每当想起他，她就会突然哭起来。</font>\n
bury oneself in	<font color=blue size=4>bury oneself in</font>\n<br>1. give all one's attention to; be lost in 沉湎于；埋头于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll have to bury yourself in your studies if you want to pass the entrance examinations. 要想通过入学考试，你必须埋头读书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He busied himself in the garden. 他忙着在花园里干活。</font>\n<br>2. hide in a place 隐居；隐藏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old poet buried himself in the countryside. 老诗人隐居在乡间。</font>\n
busy with/at/over	<font color=blue size=4>busy with/at/over</font>\n<br>busy working; having much to do 忙于干…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was busy with／over／at his work. 他忙着干他的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was busy day and night with her research work. 她日夜忙着做她的研究工作。</font>\n
but for	<font color=blue size=4>but for</font>\n<br>without; if it were not for 要不是；如果没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>But for his help, I should not have succeeded. 如果没有他的帮助，我是不会成功的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should have gone for a spring outing but for the bad weather. 要不是天气不好，我们会去春游的。</font>\n
buy off	<font color=blue size=4>buy off</font>\n<br>bribe 贿赂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminal tried to buy off the policemen. 那个罪犯试图贿赂警察。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like the way they are trying to buy me off—there must be something suspicious going on. 我不喜欢他们这样想方设法买通我，其中定有某种可疑之事。</font>\n
buy out	<font color=blue size=4>buy out</font>\n<br>pay sb. in order to get his property; buy a business from sb. 买下…产权\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bigger company bought out all the shareholders of two smaller ones. 这家大公司买下了两家小公司的所有股份。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can sell his interest in that business any time because Mr. Smith will gladly buy him out. 他随时都可以把他在那个公司的股份卖掉，因为史密斯先生很乐意把他的股份买下。</font>\n
buy over	<font color=blue size=4>buy over</font>\n<br>\n<br>bribe; win over by paying money 收买\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was quite mistaken if he thought he could buy me over. 如果他认为他可以收买我，那就大错特错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to think he can buy us over very cheaply. 他们似乎认为可以轻易地收买我们。</font>\n
buy up	<font color=blue size=4>buy up</font>\n<br>obtain by buying as widely as possible 全买；尽可以多地买进；囤积\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speculators are trying to buy up the supplies of raw materials. 投机商正在大肆囤积原材料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been buying up all available land. 他们一直在买所有能买到的地皮。</font>\n
buzz off	<font color=blue size=4>buzz off</font>\n<br>go away; hurry away; ring off on the phone 走开；匆匆离去；挂断电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Buzz off！I am sick of you. 我讨厌你，快走开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After she said this, she buzzed off. 说完这句话，她就把电话挂断了。</font>\n
by accident	<font color=blue size=4>by accident</font>\n<br>by chance; accidentally; unexpectedly 偶然地；意外地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Columbus discovered America by accident. 哥伦布偶然发现了新大陆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I met her by accident in the street. 我在街上偶然碰到了她。</font>\n
by all means	<font color=blue size=4>by all means</font>\n<br>1. of course; certainly; definitely 当然；必定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I said I would come straight to the point. “By all means, ”he replied. 我说，我想要直截了当地谈。“当然可以, ”他回答道。</font>\n<br>2. trying every means possible; at all costs 竭力；务必；无论如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will try to get the work done by all means. 他会竭尽全力完成那件工作的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt that he should by all means warn his friend. 他感到他无论如何要警告他的朋友。</font>\n
by all odds	<font color=blue size=4>by all odds</font>\n<br>without question 无疑地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By all odds we should win the game, because the other team is so weak. 毫无疑问，我们应该赢这场比赛，因为对方太弱了。</font>\n
by and by	<font color=blue size=4>by and by</font>\n<br>soon; before long 不久\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Things are bound to get better by and by. 情况不久就会好起来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy said he would do his homework by and by. 这男孩说他一会儿就做作业。</font>\n
by and large	<font color=blue size=4>by and large</font>\n<br>on the whole; in general 总的说来；大体上说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By and large, your suggestion is a good one. 总的说来，你的建议是好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By and large, you'll live longer if you try to be more easygoing about life. 大体上可以说，如果你对待生活能宽容随和的话，你就会活得长一些。</font>\n
by any means	<font color=blue size=4>by any means</font>\n<br>in any way possible 无论用什么办法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would attend the seminar by any means. 他说他无论如何也要参加这次学术讨论会。</font>\n
by chance	<font color=blue size=4>by chance</font>\n<br>by accident; unexpectedly 偶然地；意外地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It happened by chance. 这是偶然发生的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The apple fell by chance on Bobby's head. 苹果碰巧掉在鲍比的头上。</font>\n
by comparison	<font color=blue size=4>by comparison</font>\n<br>compared with 相比较\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This film is a greater success than that one by comparison. 相比之下，这部电影比那部更为成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This one is really cheaper by comparison. 相比之下，这个确实便宜。</font>\n
by day	<font color=blue size=4>by day</font>\n<br>during the day 白天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He works in the factory by day and writes at home by night. 他白天在工厂上班，晚上在家写作。</font>\n
by degrees	<font color=blue size=4>by degrees</font>\n<br>gradually; step by step 逐渐地；慢慢地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The days are getting colder by degrees. 天气渐渐冷起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their friendship grew by degryees into love. 他们的友谊逐渐发展为爱情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We gained our experience by degrees. 我们的经验是逐渐获得的。</font>\n
by design	<font color=blue size=4>by design</font>\n<br>on purpose; as planned 故意地；有意地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know whether he did it by accident or design. She told me that he did it by design. 我不知道他做这事是偶然的还是故意的，她说他是故意的。</font>\n
by dint of	<font color=blue size=4>by dint of</font>\n<br>through; as a result of 通过；用…办法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country boy succeeded by dint of persistent efforts. 那个农村孩子经过坚韧不拔的努力而获得成功。</font>\n
by express	<font color=blue size=4>by express</font>\n<br>by rapid method of conveyance 快件邮寄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sent a letter by express. 她用快件寄了一封信。</font>\n
by far	<font color=blue size=4>by far</font>\n<br>1. evidently; clearly 明显地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is by far the best student in this class. 他显然是这个班里最优秀的学生。</font>\n<br>2. by a large amount or degree; very much 甚为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Books are by far the most lasting products of human effort. 书籍是人类最持久的财富。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The second half of his voyage was by far the more dangerous part, during which he sailed round the treacherous Cape Horn. 这后半航程更为艰险，在此期间，他绕过了险情四伏的合恩角。</font>\n
by fits and starts	<font color=blue size=4>by fits and starts</font>\n<br>irregularly; at intervals; without steady application 断断续续地；不持久地；无恒心地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will never get anywhere if you study just by fits and starts. 如果你断断续续地学习，你将一事无成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He failed to get a fixed job, but went here and there working by fits and starts. 他只是断断续续地一会儿在这儿干，一会又在那儿干，从没有一份固定的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing great can be done by fits and starts. 没有恒心，任何大事都不可能干出来。</font>\n
by force	<font color=blue size=4>by force</font>\n<br>compelling; by violent means 强迫；用暴力争取\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police took his property by force. 警察抢走了他的财产。</font>\n
by half	<font color=blue size=4>by half</font>\n<br>very 十分地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is clever by half. 他十分聪明。</font>\n
by halves	<font color=blue size=4>by halves</font>\n<br>imcompletely; imperfectly 不完全地；不完善地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We do nothing by halves. 我们做事从不半途而废。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He does everything by halves. 他做事总是敷衍了事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The habit of doing things by halves would make you accomplish nothing all your life. 半心半意地做事会使你终身一事无成。</font>\n
by hand	<font color=blue size=4>by hand</font>\n<br>1. using one's own hand rather than some form of machinery 手工做的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The peasants use tractors to pull the plough and milk their cows by hand. 农民用拖拉机耕田，用手挤奶。</font>\n<br>2. personally 亲自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The letter should be delivered by hand. 此信必须由专人送去。</font>\n
by heart	<font color=blue size=4>by heart</font>\n<br>by memory 记住；背会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can learn 100 new words by heart in one hour. 他一小时能背100个单词。</font>\n
by land	<font color=blue size=4>by land</font>\n<br>by a land route 由陆路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Do you know whether she went to Shanghai by land or sea? ”“By land, ”he replied. 你知道她是由陆路还是海路去上海的？“陆路, ”他回答说。</font>\n
by leaps and bounds	<font color=blue size=4>by leaps and bounds</font>\n<br>with long steps; very rapidly 跃进；突飞猛进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In recent years our university's enrollments have been going up by leaps and bounds. 近年来我们学校的招生一直在猛增。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made progress in English by leaps and bounds. 他在英语学习上取得了飞快的进步。</font>\n
by lot	<font color=blue size=4>by lot</font>\n<br>by a chance procedure 由抽签决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The study groups were divided by lot. 学习小组是以抽签的方式划分的。</font>\n
by means of	<font color=blue size=4>by means of</font>\n<br>with the help of; by using sth. or some method 利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He recovered by means of seaair and seabathing. 他通过呼吸海边的空气和洗海水浴恢复了健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They succeeded by means of perseverance. 他们依靠坚持而成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief entered the house by means of a ladder. 小偷用一个梯子进了房间。</font>\n
by mistake	<font color=blue size=4>by mistake</font>\n<br>unintentionally; as a result of misjudgement or carelessness 错误地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took his book by mistake. 我错拿了他的书。</font>\n
by name	<font color=blue size=4>by name</font>\n<br>using name or names 就名字；凭名字\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I still can't call every student in the class by name. 我还叫不出这个班每个学生的名字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I only know him by name. 我只是听说过他的名字。</font>\n
by nature	<font color=blue size=4>by nature</font>\n<br>arising from one's nature 天生地；天性\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is by nature kind and generous. 他是个天生仁慈和宽宏大量的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is narrowminded by nature. 她天生小心眼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That man is proud by mature. 那人天生骄傲。</font>\n
by no means	<font color=blue size=4>by no means</font>\n<br>\n<br>in no way; not at all; of course not 决不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our government adheres to the principle that we will by no means be the first to use nuclear weapons. 我国政府坚持在任何情况下决不首先使用核武器的原则。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am by no means interested in the work. 我对这件工作一点也不感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will by no means lend you the money. 他决不会把钱借给你的。</font>\n
by oneself	<font color=blue size=4>by oneself</font>\n<br>without help; alone 独自地；单独地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She felt very sad and lonely by herself. 她独自一人感到忧伤寂寞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He painted the door by himself. 他自己把门漆好了。</font>\n
by the day	<font color=blue size=4>by the day</font>\n<br>according to the number of days given to work 按日（计工等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are paid not by the day but by the month. 他们是按月而不是按天计酬的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The secretary works so hard that her working time can hardly be counted by the day. 这位秘书工作十分努力，她的工作时间很难按天数来计算。</font>\n
by the way	<font color=blue size=4>by the way</font>\n<br>incidentally; in passing 顺便提一下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By the way, what was she doing when you saw her this morning? 顺便问一下，你今天上午看见她时她在干什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By the way, have you seen Harry recently? 顺便问一下，你最近见到哈利了吗？</font>\n
by turns	<font color=blue size=4>by turns</font>\n<br>one after another; in order 轮流；按顺序\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two brothers looked after their sick mother by turns. 兄弟俩轮流照看生病的母亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was laughing and crying by turns for nearly half an hour. 她一会儿哭，一会儿笑，差不多有半个小时。</font>\n
by/under the name of	<font color=blue size=4>by/under the name of</font>\n<br>having the name 名叫；以…名义\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She works in the business by the name of Philips Electronics Company. 她在一家名叫菲利普电器公司的企业工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man writes under the name of Xue Song. 那个青年以雪松这个笔名写作。</font>\n
by virtue of	<font color=blue size=4>by virtue of</font>\n<br>because of; by reason of 因为；由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rose high in society by virtue of his talent and learning. 他因其才华和学识而飞黄腾达。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was promoted by virtue of his abilities. 他凭他的能力而获得了提升。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They won the day, but only by virtue of hard fighting. 他们完全是靠艰苦奋斗才获胜的。</font>\n
by way of	<font color=blue size=4>by way of</font>\n<br>1. via 经由\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went to Canada by way of Shanghai. 她经过上海去加拿大。</font>\n<br>2. as a kind of; in the way of 当作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said something by way of greeting. 他说了几句话表示欢迎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I offered her a pair of shoes by way of thanks. 我送她一双鞋以表谢意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By way of a present, he sent her a lovely cat and its small house. 作为礼物，他送给她一只可爱的小猫以及它住的小屋。</font>\n
calculate on	<font color=blue size=4>calculate on</font>\n<br>count on 指望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can we calculate on their help? 我们能指望他们的帮助吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We cannot calculate on having fine weather for the sports meeting. 我们不能指望有好天气开运动会。</font>\n
call at	<font color=blue size=4>call at</font>\n<br>1. pay a visit to (a place) 拜访（某场所）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We called at our new, neighbor's house last week. 我们上周去新来的邻居家里拜访。</font>\n<br>2. (of a ship) stop for a short time at（船）短暂停靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train calls at every station. 这列火车每站都停。</font>\n
call back	<font color=blue size=4>call back</font>\n<br>1. make return 召回；使…回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was called back from his holiday to handle the problem. 他从度假中被召回来处理这个问题。</font>\n<br>2. remember 记起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't call his name back. 我记不起他的名字了。</font>\n<br>3. phone back 回电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll call you back when I get more information. 一旦我得到更多的情况，我就给你回电话。</font>\n
call down	<font color=blue size=4>call down</font>\n<br>1. scold; reprimand 斥责某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director called Jim down for being late again. 主任训斥吉姆又来迟了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother called the child down for walking into the room with muddy shoes. 妈妈训斥这孩子穿着沾满泥的鞋子走进房间。</font>\n<br>2. summon, as from God; ask for 祈求（天恩）；使降临\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man called down curses on the head of those who killed his son. 老人祈求上帝降祸于那些杀害他儿子的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you do that, you'll be calling the indignation of the masses down upon yourself. 你那样做，将激起群众对你的愤慨。</font>\n
call for	<font color=blue size=4>call for</font>\n<br>1. demand; ask for 要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man sat down and called for some beer. 那人坐下来，要了一些啤酒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is a problem that calls for immediate solution. 这是个要求立即解决的问题。</font>\n<br>2. go to pick up; collect 去接（某人）；去取（某物）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll call for you at eight o'clock. 我8点钟去接你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grocer's boy calls every Monday for orders. 杂货店的服务员每周一来取定货单。</font>\n<br>3. require 需要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The present situation calls for rapid action by the government. 当前的局势需要政府迅速采取措施。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Success in school calls for much hard work. 在学校的成功需要付出大量的辛勤工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work calls for endurance and patience. 这工作需要忍耐和耐心。</font>\n
call forth	<font color=blue size=4>call forth</font>\n<br>1. cause to be seen; be the cause of 唤起；引发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Trouble can call forth a person's best qualities. 逆境能显示一个人的英雄本色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Oppression always calls forth the power of resistance. 压迫总是激起反抗。</font>\n<br>2. produce and use; bring into play 产生并使用；发挥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a situation that called forth all his initiative and courage. 正是这一形势使他的积极性和勇气全部激发出来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to call forth all your energy. 你必须全力以赴。</font>\n
call in	<font color=blue size=4>call in</font>\n<br>1. invite; send for 邀请\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided to call in a doctor because the child was not any better. 他们决定请个医生来，因为那孩子一点不见好转。</font>\n<br>2. pay a short visit; call at sb. 's house 拜访某人的家\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I may call in some time this coming Sunday. Will you be home? 我可能这个星期天的某时候来拜访你，你会在家吗？</font>\n<br>3. ask to come indoors 要…进来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Call the children in now; it's getting dark outside. 外面天快黑了，叫孩子们进来吧。</font>\n<br>4. require to be brought in; order the return of 要求归还\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The library is calling in all outstanding books. 图书馆要求归还所有久借不还的图书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bank has begun to call its money in. 银行已开始要求偿清贷款。</font>\n
call names	<font color=blue size=4>call names</font>\n<br>use ugly or unkind words when speaking to sb. 骂人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child was punished by the teacher for calling names. 那个小孩因骂人而受到老师的惩罚。</font>\n
call off	<font color=blue size=4>call off</font>\n<br>1. abandon; cancel 取消\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He phoned her and called the appointment off. 他打电话给她取消了约会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The press conference was called off. 记者招待会不举行了。</font>\n<br>2. cause to keep away 叫开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog threatened me until its master called it off. 那条狗想咬我，后来主人把它唤开了。</font>\n<br>3. divert (one's mind, etc.); order to stop doing (sth.) 把（思想）转移开；命令…停止做（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chief inspector called his men off. 检查官命令他的随从停止搜查。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is engaged in his studies and nothing can call off his attention. 他正在专心地学习，什么事情也不能叫他分心。</font>\n
call on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>call on/upon</font>\n<br>1. visit sb. formally either socially or on business 拜访某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll call on you very shortly. 我们不久就会去拜访你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The deputies called upon the mayor to invite his cooperation in their work. 代表们拜访了市长，请他在工作上给予合作。</font>\n<br>2. ask; invite; make a demand on; appeal to sb. to do sth. 要求；请求；号召\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government called on the people to practise economy. 政府号召人们厉行节约。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to call upon the parents to help us educate the teenagers. 我们必须呼吁家长协助我们教育青少年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Chairman called on Mr. Brown to speak at the meeting. 主席请求布朗先生在会上发言。</font>\n
call out	<font color=blue size=4>call out</font>\n<br>1. shout loudly 大声叫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy on the watch started calling out when he saw somebody approaching stealthily. 放哨的小男孩看到有人偷偷地走过来，就大声地叫喊起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane called out her boyfriend's name when she saw him across the street. 简隔街看见男朋友时，就大声喊他。</font>\n<br>2. summon away from one's home or place of work 召集；召来；请来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the firemen in the city were called out to fight the big fire. 城里所有的消防队员都被召集来扑灭那场大火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doctors are often called out in the middle of the night. 医生们常常在午夜被请去出诊。</font>\n<br>3. summon to strike; order or bring into action 号召罢工；唤起或命令…行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trade union officials have called their members out (on strike) . 工会号召全员罢工。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire brigade was called out twice yesterday. 昨天消防队出动两次。</font>\n
call the roll	<font color=blue size=4>call the roll</font>\n<br>call the names on a certain list 点名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dean usually calls the roll before the meeting begins. 系主任通常在开会前点名。</font>\n
call to mind	<font color=blue size=4>call to mind</font>\n<br>cause sb. to remember 使想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The film calls to mind what happened in my hometown ten years ago. 这部电影使我想起了10年前我家乡所发生的事情。</font>\n
call up	<font color=blue size=4>call up</font>\n<br>1. waken 唤醒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please call me up at four tomorrow morning. 请在明天早晨4点钟把我喊醒。</font>\n<br>2. telephone 给…打电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did anyone call me up while I was out? 我不在时有人打电话给我吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll call you up when I need your help. 需要你帮助时，我会给你打电话的。</font>\n<br>3. order to join the armed forces 征召…入伍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the war, all the young people were called up to fight on the battlefield. 战争期间，所有的年轻人都被征召参战。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got his callup papers yesterday. 他昨天接到征召入伍通知书。</font>\n<br>4. bring to sb. 's mind 想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This picture called up memories of our class trip. 这张照片使我们想起我们班的那次旅行。</font>\n<br>5. summon before an authority; put forward for consideration 传讯；提出…供考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the witnesses were called up when the trial began. 审讯开始时，所有证人都被传到庭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The design has been called up. 这个设计方案已被提出议论过了。</font>\n
call…in/into question	<font color=blue size=4>call…in/into question</font>\n<br>declare that one has doubt about 对…提出怀疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several people called in question the truth of his story. 一些人对他的话持怀疑态度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This soldier's courage has never been called into question. 这位士兵的勇气从未受到过怀疑。</font>\n
calm down	<font color=blue size=4>calm down</font>\n<br>become calm 镇定下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Calm yourself down; there's nothing to worry about. 沉着些，没有什么值得担忧的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tempest seems to be calming down. 暴风雨似乎正在平息下来。</font>\n
can but	<font color=blue size=4>can but</font>\n<br>can only 只好；只能（后接动词原形）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can but do it by himself. 他只好一个人干了。</font>\n
cancel out	<font color=blue size=4>cancel out</font>\n<br>1. delete 消去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should cancel out all the noughts. 你应该消去所有的零。</font>\n<br>2. neutralize 抵消\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The extra payment has cancelled out all his debts. 那笔额外收入把他所有的债务都抵消了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These two arguments actually cancel each other out. 那两个论点实际上互相抵消。</font>\n
cannot but	<font color=blue size=4>cannot but</font>\n<br>cannot keep from; cannot avoid 禁不住；不得不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man cannot but pity that poorly dressed old man. 这个年轻人禁不住对那个穿着破旧的老人怜悯起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We could not but stop at the foot of a hill because the road was too slippery. 由于路太滑，我们不得不在一座山脚下停了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot but admit the truth of your remarks, although they go against my interests. 虽然你的话对我不利，但我不得不承认你所讲的是事实。</font>\n
cannot help	<font color=blue size=4>cannot help</font>\n<br>can't avoid doing sth.;have no control over 不得不，禁不住（与cannot but 同义，但help 后要接动名词, but 后接动词原形）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We cannot help admiring his learning. 我们不得不佩服他的学识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After hearing the joke, we cannot help laughing. 听到这个笑话，我们禁不住大笑起来。</font>\n
cannot…too	<font color=blue size=4>cannot…too</font>\n<br>impossible for a certain state or action to be more than what should be or to be beyond what is desirable 无论怎样也不过分\n<br>You cannot be too careful. 你越小心越好。（你无论怎么小心也不为过分。）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man cannot have too many friends. 朋友越多越好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bad habit cannot be got rid of too soon. 这个坏习惯改得越早越好。</font>\n
capable of	<font color=blue size=4>capable of</font>\n<br>1. having the ability or power for 有能力干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack is a man capable of judging art. 杰克是一个有艺术判断力的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is capable of any crime. 他什么坏事都能干得出来。</font>\n<br>2. ready for; open to（指事物、情况）能…的；可以…的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The situation is capable of improvement. 这种状况是可以改变的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That't capable of being understood. 那是可以被理解的。</font>\n
capitalize on	<font color=blue size=4>capitalize on</font>\n<br>take advantage of; profit by 利用；从…中得益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's important to capitalize on your opponent's mistake to win the game. 利用你对手的弱点来赢这场比赛是很重要的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Corrupt officials in old China used to capitalize on natural calamities. 旧中国的贪官污吏往往利用自然灾害大发横财。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always capitalizes on every opportunity that comes his way. 他总是利用一切有利于自己的机会。</font>\n
care about	<font color=blue size=4>care about</font>\n<br>1. be interested in; have or feel concern for 对…感兴趣；关心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't care about your opinion. 我对你的观点不感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She thinks only of herself; she doesn't care ahout other people. 她只顾自己，不顾别人。</font>\n<br>2. be worried about; mind 对…担心；介意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't you care about losing your job? 你难道不担心失去工作吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I care nothing about the matter. 我对这事毫不介意。</font>\n
care for	<font color=blue size=4>care for</font>\n<br>1. like; be fond of 喜爱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doesn't care for that colour. 她不喜欢那种颜色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not care for him. 她不喜欢他。</font>\n<br>2. take care of; look after 照顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As an orphan, he is cared for by the local authorities. 他是个孤儿，受到当地政府的照顾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spent years caring for his sick mother. 他数年中一直在照顾生病的母亲。</font>\n<br>3. have regard for; trouble about 尊重；重视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I do care for what my teacher says. 我的确尊重老师说的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cares only for himself. 他只考虑自己。</font>\n
carry away	<font color=blue size=4>carry away</font>\n<br>1. take something away; remove 带走；冲走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The flood has carried away the bridge. 洪水把桥冲走了。</font>\n<br>2. excite; cause to lose self control 使…着迷，使…失去自制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take your time and think carefully—don't get carried away. 别着急，仔细想想，不要鬼迷心窍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be carried away by success. 不要被胜利冲昏头脑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole crowd were quite carried away by the young singer's performance. 那位青年歌手的演唱深深地打动了所有的听众。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scenic beauty has carried her away. 美景使她陶醉了。</font>\n
carry forward	<font color=blue size=4>carry forward</font>\n<br>1. be advanced 被推动；发扬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should carry forward the fine revolutionary tradition of plain living and hard struggle. 我们应该发扬艰苦奋斗的优良传统。</font>\n<br>2. pass forward to a new balance sheet 将账目结转次栏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money was carried forward to the next month. 这笔钱被转至下月帐上。</font>\n
carry off	<font color=blue size=4>carry off</font>\n<br>1. take by force 抢走；拐走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thieves carried off the farmer's sheep during the night. 小偷在夜里劫走了那个农民的羊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gerrillas broke into the armoury, and carried off 22 rifles. 游击队冲进了武器库，夺走了22支步枪。</font>\n<br>2. perform; execute 进行；扮演\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The piano piece is difficult to carry off. 这首钢琴曲不容易演奏。</font>\n<br>3. win; succeed in winning 赢；获得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was a great success at school, and carried off all the prizes. 他在学校成绩突出，各种奖品都让他拿到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His horse carried off the first prize at the race. 他的马在比赛中获得头奖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think he will manage to carry off the honours. 我认为他能争取到这种荣誉。</font>\n<br>4. kill; cause the death of 杀害；造成…的死亡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was carried off by a heart attack. 她因心脏病突发而死。</font>\n<br>5. deal with successfull or easily 成功地应付；巧妙地对付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was an embarrassing situation, but they carried it off well. 这是一个尴尬的场面，但是他们成功地应付过去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think she carried it off well, considering her age. 按她的年龄，我觉得她应付得很不错了。</font>\n
carry on	<font color=blue size=4>carry on</font>\n<br>1. continue; maintain 继续；保持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must try to carry on our work in spite of difficulties. 我们必须不顾困难，把工作继续下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect my son to carry on the family tradition. 我希望我儿子能保持家庭传统。</font>\n<br>2. conduct (a business, a conversation, etc.); follow 经营；进行（生意、谈话等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two cities have been carrying on trade for years. 这两个城市进行贸易已经多年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is difficult to carry on a conversation with all this noise around us. 周围很吵闹，要在这里谈话很困难。</font>\n<br>3. behave in an excited or anxious manner; behave wildly 吵吵闹闹；行动失常；恶作剧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children have been carrying on all morning. 孩子们整个上午都在闹着玩。</font>\n
carry out	<font color=blue size=4>carry out</font>\n<br>fulfil; accomplish; perform 实行；履行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He carried out the plan without difficulty. 他毫无困难地实施了那项计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is often easier to make plans than to carry them out. 常常是订计划容易，执行计划难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect her to carry out her obligations. 我期待她履行她的义务。</font>\n
carry over	<font color=blue size=4>carry over</font>\n<br>1. move to a later date 延期\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert will have to be carried over till next week because the singer is ill. 因歌唱演员生病，音乐会不得不推延到下周举行。</font>\n<br>2. last; carry forward (continue in another place or time) 延续；在另一地方或另一时间继续下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The habit carries over from his childhood. 这种习惯是从他童年时代延续下来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The writing carries over on to the next page. 这篇作品转接下页。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please carry the report over on to another page? 请把报告续到另一页纸上好吗？</font>\n<br>3. transport from one place to another; transfer… from one column, page, or book to another 从一地运到另一地；把…转到（次栏、页、册上）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tobacco was carried over from the West to China. 烟草是从西方传入中国的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He carried the money over to the next month. 他把钱过到下月份。</font>\n<br>4. win to one's side 把…争取到自己这边来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We did our best to carry him over and at last succeeded. 我们尽力争取他，终于成功了。</font>\n
carry through	<font color=blue size=4>carry through</font>\n<br>1. complete in spite of difficulties（努力）完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is determined to carry all his plans through. 他决心完成所有的计划。</font>\n<br>2. help survive; continue to the end 使度过困难；支持到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only his courage carried him through. 是勇气使他度过了难关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Perseverance will carry a man through. 毅力能使人克服种种困难。</font>\n
cash in on	<font color=blue size=4>cash in on</font>\n<br>take advantage of or profit from 趁机利用；靠…赚钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's cash in on the fine autumn day and go into the country. 我们利用这个晴朗的秋日，到乡间去玩玩吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't try to cash in on the fact that he likes you. 你不该利用他喜欢你这一点找便宜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This big oil company attempted to cash in on the energy crisis. 这家大石油公司企图从能源危机中发财。</font>\n
cast about for	<font color=blue size=4>cast about for</font>\n<br>search anxiously about 急于寻求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner is casting about for a way of escape. 那个囚徒正急着找逃路。</font>\n
cast aside	<font color=blue size=4>cast aside</font>\n<br>discard; throw away 置…而不顾；抛弃；去掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't just cast people aside like old clothes. 你不能象抛弃旧衣服那样扔下别人不管。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cast aside all illusions and go into the battle. 丢掉幻想，投入战斗。</font>\n
cast away	<font color=blue size=4>cast away</font>\n<br>1. throw away 丢掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They cast away the equipment they would not need. 他们扔掉了他们不再需要的设备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cast away an advantage. 他失去了优势。</font>\n<br>2. wreck (a ship) （船）遇难；使（船）失事（常用被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new ship was cast away during the storm. 这条新船在暴风雨中沉没。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good many ships have been cast away in the Arctic Ocean. 在北冰洋，曾有许多船只失事。</font>\n
cast back	<font color=blue size=4>cast back</font>\n<br>look back; direct to the past 回顾；回忆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We cast back to our working together on the army farm in the Northeast. 我们回忆起我们一道在东北军垦农场劳动的情景。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cast back his mind to the earlier days. 他回忆起先前的日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They cast their thoughts back to happier times. 他们回想起较为快乐的日子。</font>\n
cast down	<font color=blue size=4>cast down</font>\n<br>1. demoralize; discourage; be lower in spirits 沮丧；泄气；气馁（常用于被动结构或作表语）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The proud will be cast down. 骄者必败。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In making scientific experiments, we should not be cast down by temporary setbacks. 进行科学实验时，我们不要因暂时挫折而垂头丧气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was cast down at the news of her aunt's death. 听到她姑妈去世的消息，她情绪很低。</font>\n<br>2. throw down; lower 放低；使放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She cast her eyes down shyly. 她羞怯地垂下目光。</font>\n
cast out	<font color=blue size=4>cast out</font>\n<br>drive out; expel 赶出；逐出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The members of the association did not like his behaviour, so they cast him out. 协会会员们不喜欢他的行为，所以就把他开除了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was cast out from our country. 他被驱逐出我们国家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having repeatedly broken the rules of the game, they were both cast out from the football club. 他们两人踢足球时经常犯规，已被开除出足球俱乐部。</font>\n
cast up	<font color=blue size=4>cast up</font>\n<br>1. add up; calculate 加起来；计算\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accounts have to be cast up at the end of each day. 每天工作结束时，必须结账。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to cast up the whole complicated thing. 他尽力盘算这件复杂的事情。</font>\n<br>2. refer to constantly in reproach 一再埋怨地提起；以责备的口吻常常提起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's been casting that up at me all the time. 她为了那件事老是埋怨我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always casts up at her the fact that she crashed the car. 他总是责备她弄坏了汽车。</font>\n
catch at	<font color=blue size=4>catch at</font>\n<br>try to hold or use 试图抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A businessman will catch any chance of making a profit. 经商的人会抓住任何赚钱的机会。</font>\n
catch cold	<font color=blue size=4>catch cold</font>\n<br>be sick with a cold 感冒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She caught cold and had a severe headache. 她感冒了，头痛得厉害。</font>\n
catch fire	<font color=blue size=4>catch fire</font>\n<br>start to burn 燃烧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dry grass catches fire easily. 干草容易着火。</font>\n
catch/get a glimpse of	<font color=blue size=4>catch/get a glimpse of</font>\n<br>get a quick view of 瞥见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran past the window and caught a glimpse of Mary standing by the door. 他从窗外跑过去，瞥见玛丽在门旁站着。</font>\n
catch on	<font color=blue size=4>catch on</font>\n<br>1. become popular; be done or used by many people 流行；受欢迎；被很多人接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This novel caught on well. 这本小说深受欢迎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a nice tune and will catch on quickly. 这首曲子很好，不久就会流行开来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If only the idea could catch on, we should be able to make quite a lot of money out of it. 但愿这个主意被采纳，那么我们就能从中赚一大笔钱。</font>\n<br>2. finally understand; grasp the point of 理解；明白；领会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After two hours of trying to learn the new game, he caught on. 这种游戏，他学了两小时才明白是怎么回事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't catch on to what you had implied. 他没有理解你话中隐含的意思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lady repeated her question several times but I still couldn't catch on. 那位女士把她的问题重复了好几遍，但是我还是没听懂。</font>\n<br>3. fasten accidentally on; catch; grab 挂住；抓住\n<br>My coat caught on a mail and tore. 我的上衣挂住了一根钉子，撕破\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl kept catching on to her mother's hand. 这个小女孩一直抓住她妈妈的手。</font>\n
catch one's breath	<font color=blue size=4>catch one's breath</font>\n<br>1. breathe in suddenly with fear or surprise; rest and get back normal breathing 因恐惧或兴奋而屏住呼吸；喘气以恢复正常呼吸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story is full of surprises which cause the reader to catch his breath. 这个故事充满了惊险情节，使读者紧张得透不过气来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After running to the bus stop we sat down to catch our breath. 我们跑到车站后坐下来喘气。</font>\n<br>2. relax for a moment 放松一下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a day's work they sat down over tea to catch their breath. 工作一天后，他们坐下来喝茶放松一下。</font>\n
catch sb's eye	<font color=blue size=4>catch sb's eye</font>\n<br>attract sb. 's attention 引人注目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dress in the window caught her eye when she passed the store, 橱窗里的服装吸引了她。</font>\n
catch sight of	<font color=blue size=4>catch sight of</font>\n<br>see for a moment; get a glimpse of 看见；发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I caught sight of her getting on the bus when I came out of the bookstore. 我从书店出来时看见她上了公共汽车。</font>\n
