catch up	<font color=blue size=4>catch up</font>\n<br>1. succeed in pursuing; overtake; follow and finally reach 赶上；追上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better drive faster, beacuse the others are catching up quickly. 你最好快点开，别人很快就会赶上来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go on ahead; I'll catch you up in a few minutes. 你前面走，我将在几分钟内赶上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was a tenmile chase before the thieves were caught up by the police car. 追了10英里，警察的车子才赶上盗窃犯。</font>\n<br>2. seize hurriedly; take or pick up suddenly; be dragged into 突然拿起；匆忙抓住；被抱进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He caught up the ball as it rolled along and threw it back. 当球向前滚动时，他急忙抓了起来就向后投去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He caught up a stick and struck out at that man. 他急忙抓起一根木棍向那人打去。</font>\n<br>3. capture or trap ... in a situation; concern or interest very much 俘获；卷进；非常关心或极感兴趣（常与in 连用在被动结构中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His clothing was caught up in the machine. 他的衣服被卷进了机器中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He regretted having been caught up in the affair. 他后悔当初卷进了这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was so caught up in the movie that I forgot the time. 我对这部电影入了迷，以至于连时间都忘了。</font>\n<br>4. adopt 采用；借用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These phrases were caught up and immediately became popular. 这些短语已被采用而且很快就流行了。</font>\n<br>5. provide with the latest information 提供…最新消息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They caught us up on what's happening at the front. 他们把前线的最新消息告诉了我们。</font>\n<br>6. follow and understand 听懂；理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They can't catch up what the foreign guest said. 他们听不懂外宾讲的话。</font>\n
catch up with/to	<font color=blue size=4>catch up with/to</font>\n<br>1. come level with; overtake 赶上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have a long way to go to catch up with the advanced countries. 要赶上先进国家，我们还有漫长的路要走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is working hard to catch up to the others after missing a month. 缺席了一个月后，他在努力赶上别人。</font>\n<br>2. have the expected ill effect or result on; arrest 对…产生预期的坏影响和结果；逮捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Excessive drinking and smoking will catch up on you. 过度地抽烟喝酒，将会给你带来恶果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves had gone ten miles before the police caught up with them. 窃贼跑了10里之后警察才抓住他。</font>\n
certain of	<font color=blue size=4>certain of</font>\n<br>sure of 确信；自信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is certain of winning the game. 他确信会赢得这场比赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt quite certain of success. 他对成功胸有成竹。</font>\n
chance on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>chance on/upon</font>\n<br>come across unexpectedly; meet by accident 偶然发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I chanced on him last week for the first time in years. 上周我几年来第1次碰到了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I chanced upon the book in a small bookstore. 我在一家小书店偶然发现了这本书。</font>\n
change hands	<font color=blue size=4>change hands</font>\n<br>change ownership（财产等）转手；易手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That shop has changed hands no less than three times during the past three years. 在过去3年里，这商店至少转手3次了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house has changed hands again. 这幢房子又换了主人。</font>\n
change one's mind	<font color=blue size=4>change one's mind</font>\n<br>alter one's plan or opinion 改变计划（主意）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has changed her mind and decided to become a musician. 她改变了主意，决定当一名音乐家。</font>\n
charge for	<font color=blue size=4>charge for</font>\n<br>ask sb. a price for sth. 要价；收费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How much does the hotel charge for a room? 这家旅馆每个房间要多少钱？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He charged us 100 yuan for this used bicycle. 对于这部旧自行车，他向我们要价100元。</font>\n
charge off	<font color=blue size=4>charge off</font>\n<br>1. write off as an expense or loss 把…作为消耗或损失注销\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The debt was finally charged off after his death. 债务最后在他死后被注销了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The store owner charged off all of the last season's stock of suits. 店主把上季度所有库存服装当作损耗处理了。</font>\n<br>2. attribute 归因于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't charge off your mistake to inexperience. 你不能把错误归咎于缺乏经验。</font>\n
charge to	<font color=blue size=4>charge to</font>\n<br>1. record sth. to sb. 's debt 把帐记在某人名下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't forget to charge the money to my account. 不要忘了把钱记在我的帐上。</font>\n<br>2. lay blame on 归咎于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager charged the failure to his negligence. 经理将失败归咎于他的疏忽。</font>\n
charge with	<font color=blue size=4>charge with</font>\n<br>1. declare that sb. is guilty of 指控\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Charles was charged with neglecting his duty. 查尔斯被指控玩忽职守。</font>\n<br>2. entrust sb. with 赋予（…责任）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is charged with fulfilling these duties? 谁负责完成这些任务？</font>\n
check in	<font color=blue size=4>check in</font>\n<br>1. register in a hotel; report one's arrival 在旅馆登记住宿；报到；签到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you checked in at the hotel yet? 你在旅馆登记住宿了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to check in at the office building at 8. 我们必须在8点到办公楼签到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The friends we had invited did not check in until Saturday. 我们邀请的朋友直到星期六才到达。</font>\n<br>2. receive sth. back and make a record of it 收回；注消；收到登记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I put the books on the library desk, and the librarian checked them in. 我把书放在图书馆的柜台上，图书管理员验收了这些书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're supposed to check our luggage in before 8：00. 我们应在8点钟前交运行李。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can check your suitcases in at the desk. 你们可以把箱子寄存在服务台。</font>\n
check off	<font color=blue size=4>check off</font>\n<br>1. check up; put a mark beside sth. to show that it has been counted 清点；核对；验讫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher checked off each pupil as he got on the bus. 老师一上车，就清点学生人数。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check off these lists again. 请把这些清单再核对一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She checked off the names she wanted to invite。她在要邀请的人员名字上做了记号。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check off these parcels before they are despatched. 在发送这些包裹前请打上查讫记号。</font>\n<br>2. go off duty 下班\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We check off at six p.m. daily. 我们每天下午6点下班。</font>\n<br>3. deduct (union dues) from a worker's paycheck 从工资中扣除（工会费）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My dues were checked off every month. 我的工会费每月从工资中扣除。</font>\n
check on	<font color=blue size=4>check on</font>\n<br>inspect; verify 核实；检查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better check on this story before we print it. 在印刷之前我们最好把这个情况核实一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll check on the plane before it leaves. 飞机起飞前我们要进行检查。</font>\n
check out	<font color=blue size=4>check out</font>\n<br>1. pay the bill and leave 结账离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Guests must check out before noon, or they will be charged for the day. 客人必须在中午前结账离开，否则将付全日费用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We headed directly for the airport after we have checked out of the hotel. 我们付了旅馆费以后，就直接去飞机场了。</font>\n<br>2. confirm by carefully checking 检验无误；核实\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you check out these names and numbers, please? 请检验一下姓名和号码好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accountant checked out the bills and found them OK. 会计查对了账单，发现正确无误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check out each room to see if it is fit for a guest. 请检查每个房间看看是否适合客人住。</font>\n<br>3. leave; resign; assist departure of 离开；离职；辞职；帮助…离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he checked out, I was appointed his successor. 他离职后，我被指定去接替他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were checked out two hours ago. 两小时前，有人帮助他们离开了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The airline has checked their luggage out. 航空公司已给他们办了行李托运。</font>\n<br>4. give or lend and make a record of it 发给或借出并登记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I checked out this book from the library in the morning. 我今天早上在图书馆借了这本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss checked out the tools to the workmen as they came to work. 工人们来上班时，老板把工具发给他们并作了登记。</font>\n<br>5. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid he's just checked out. 恐怕他刚刚去世。</font>\n
check over	<font color=blue size=4>check over</font>\n<br>inspect carefully 仔细检查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He checked over the names on the list to ensure that everything was correct. 他仔细检查了名单上的姓名，以便确认一切准确无误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check over the plane before it leaves. 起飞前请检查飞机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Check your test paper over again. 再仔细检查一下你的考卷。</font>\n
check up	<font color=blue size=4>check up</font>\n<br>examine; make inquires about; investigate 检查；核对；调查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check up your papers carefully before you hand them in. 交卷以前请仔细检查一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll ask the doctor to check me up. 我要请医生给我做一下检查。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please check up the facts before you write the report. 在写报告之前请把事实核对一下。</font>\n
check with	<font color=blue size=4>check with</font>\n<br>1. accord with 与…符合；与…核对无误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Does this report check with your investigation? 这篇报告与你的调查相符吗？</font>\n<br>2. confer or discuss with 与…商议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better check with your father before you make the final decision. 在作出决定之前，你最好同你父亲商量一下。</font>\n
cheer on	<font color=blue size=4>cheer on</font>\n<br>encourage; encourage with cheers or shouts 鼓励；用欢呼或叫喊为…鼓劲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach is good at cheering the athletes on when they meet with difficulties. 这位教练很善于在运动员遇到困难时鼓励他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We kept cheering on both teams. 我们不断为双方加油。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd cheered the runners on as they started on the last lap of the race. 当赛跑运动员进入赛程的最后一圈时，人群为他们喝彩加油。</font>\n
cheer up	<font color=blue size=4>cheer up</font>\n<br>1. become happier; inspire 高兴起来；振作起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cheer up！Your troubles will soon be over. 振作起来吧！你的困难不久就会过去的。</font>\n<br>2. make more cheerful 使欢乐；使高兴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to cheer them up with funny stories. 他想讲些滑稽的故事使他们开心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of your return to this country has cheered me up no end. 你要回国的消息使我振奋不已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the people cheered up at the good news that our country has successfully launched a manned satellite. 全国人民欢呼我国成功地发射了一枚载人卫星。</font>\n
chime in	<font color=blue size=4>chime in</font>\n<br>1. join in singing 跟着唱起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The singer asked the audience to chime in. 这位歌手请大家跟着一起唱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole group chimed in on the chorus. 全组的人都参加合唱。</font>\n<br>2. express agreement; break into a conversation 同意；插话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so interested in our discussion that he chimed in from time to time. 他对我们的讨论非常感兴趣，不时地插话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I thought you'd chime in. 我想你会同意的。</font>\n
chime in with	<font color=blue size=4>chime in with</font>\n<br>harmonize with; agree; go well together 与…符合一致；附和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should have your own viewpoint. Don't always chime in with others'opinion. 你应该有你自己的观点，不要附和别人的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think your plans will chime in with mine. 我想你的计划会同我的一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When father suggested going to the beach for the vacation, the whole family chimed in with the idea. 当父亲提议去海滨度假时，全家欣然同意。</font>\n
chime with	<font color=blue size=4>chime with</font>\n<br>harmonize with; chime in with 与…协调一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The holiday music should chime with our feelings. 假日音乐应该和我们的心情和谐一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those blue curtains will chime with the carpet. 这些蓝色的窗帘会同地毯的颜色协调。</font>\n
choke down	<font color=blue size=4>choke down</font>\n<br>1. swallow with difficulty（困难地）咽下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim hated the food but choked it down out of politeness. 吉姆并不喜欢那食物，但他还是出于礼貌把它吃了下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>2. accept with difficulty Jack choked down the manager's rudeness because otherwise he might lose his job. 杰克强忍了经理的粗野无礼，不然的话，他可能会失业的。</font>\n
clean out	<font color=blue size=4>clean out</font>\n<br>1. tidy or clean thoroughly; get rid of 使洁净；清除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She asked the children to clean out their drawers. 她要孩子们把抽屉清理干净。</font>\n<br>2. render bankrupt; leave sb. without money 使破产；使…失去钱财\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hasn't got a penny. He is quite cleaned out. 他一文不名，完全破产了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We played cards and he cleaned me out. 我们玩了纸牌，他把我的钱全赢去了。</font>\n
clean up	<font color=blue size=4>clean up</font>\n<br>1. clean thoroughly 打扫干净；整理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had to clean up the room after the children's party. 孩子们的晚会结束后，她要把房间收拾一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are cleaning up the mess. 他们在打扫这堆乱七八糟的东西。</font>\n<br>2. wash and make oneself presentable 梳洗；打扮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She often spends a lot of timecleaning herself up every morning. 她每天早上往往要花大量时间梳洗打扮。</font>\n<br>3. make a lot of money 赚大钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His friend has cleaned up in the stock market. 他的朋友在股市上赚了一大笔钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company cleaned up in real estate. 这家公司做房地产生意赚了很多钱。</font>\n<br>4. eliminate (enemy forces, etc.); root out (a social evil, etc.) 消灭（敌军等）；根除（社会弊端等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leave a few men behind to clean up the last of the enemy positions. 留下一些士兵来摧毁敌人的最后阵地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So long as capitalism exists, corruption can never be cleaned up. 只要资本主义存在，贪污现象就不可能消除干净。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mayor has decided to clean up the city. 市长已下决心整顿市容。</font>\n
clear away	<font color=blue size=4>clear away</font>\n<br>remove completely 清除；驱散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must clear away such ideas among ourselves. 我们必须消除我们中间的这些想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police cleared the crowd away. 警察把人群驱散了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please clear away the dinner things. 请把餐具撤去。</font>\n
clear of	<font color=blue size=4>clear of</font>\n<br>remove; overcome 清除；消除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's clear the pavement of snow. 咱们把人行道上的积雪清除掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is now clear of all business difficulties. 他现在已扫清了生意中的一切障碍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried to clear him of his suspicion. 他们设法消除他的疑心。</font>\n
clear off	<font color=blue size=4>clear off</font>\n<br>1. disappear 消散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mist cleared off when the sun rose. 太阳升起来后雾气就消散了。</font>\n<br>2. pay completely 还清债务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am glad to have cleared off all the debts. 还清了债务，我很高兴。</font>\n<br>3. remove; dispose of 清理；处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop decided to clear off the summer clothes when the winter fashions arrived. 冬令时装上市时，商店决定把夏季服装处理掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please clear the books off the table. 请把书从桌上拿开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Clear off the things in this cupboard, please. 请把碗橱里的东西清理出去。</font>\n<br>4. finish 完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He must clear off the work before he goes on a holiday. 他去度假前必须把工作完成。</font>\n<br>5. grow bright 放晴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sky will clear off in the afternoon. 下午天会放晴的。</font>\n<br>6. leave; go away 走开；离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am busy; clear off quickly. 我很忙，快走开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the police appeared, the thieves cleared off. 警察来时，那些小偷溜走了。</font>\n
clear out	<font color=blue size=4>clear out</font>\n<br>1. get rid of 处理掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When are you going to clear all that rubbish out of the green house? 你们准备什么时候把所有的垃圾从温室中清理出去？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has cleared out all the rat holes around the house. 他把房子周围的鼠洞都清除掉了。</font>\n<br>2. leave 离开；出港\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship cleared out at midnight. 那条船是在午夜起航的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man cleared out without paying his room rent. 那个人没有付房钱就离开了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves took the jewels and then cleared out. 窃贼抢了珠宝后逃之夭夭。</font>\n
clear up	<font color=blue size=4>clear up</font>\n<br>1. improve or brighten; become clear 转晴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope it will clear up tomorrow. 我希望明天天能放晴。</font>\n<br>2. find an answer to; make plain 解释；使明白；消除（误会、疑虑等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scientists have been trying to clear up the mystery. 科学家们一直试图揭开这个谜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher cleared up the harder parts of the passage. 老师解释了文章中较难的部分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police hope to clear the matter up quickly. 警察希望迅速查清这件事情。</font>\n<br>3. tidy up; collect together and carry away (rubbish, etc.) 整理；集中并运走（垃圾）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I spent nearly an hour clearing up the room after the children's party. 孩子们的晚会结束后，我花了近一个小时整理房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the fete is over all the litter will have to be cleared up. 在游园会结束后，一定要清理掉那些乱丢的废物。</font>\n<br>4. cure 治好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pills cleared up his stomach trouble. 药丸治好了他的胃病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine will soon clear up your bad cold. 这药很快就会治好你的重感冒。</font>\n<br>5. solve; finish 解决；完成工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The difficulty has been cleared up. 困难已经解决了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now that the matter has been cleared up we can go on to consider the next point. 既然那个问题已经解决，我们可以接着考虑下一步了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've lots of work to clear up by the weekend. 周末前我有大量工作要完成。</font>\n
clever at	<font color=blue size=4>clever at</font>\n<br>skillful in doing 擅长于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is clever at solving mathematical problems. 她擅长解答数学问题。</font>\n
cling to	<font color=blue size=4>cling to</font>\n<br>1. hold tight to; try to keep; stick to 抓住；固守；紧贴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child clung to its mother. 那孩子紧贴着母亲。</font>\n<br>2. remain faithful; hold on to 忠于；坚持不放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people still cling to the old customs and beliefs. 许多人仍然固守旧习惯和信仰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That idea has been proved wrong. Why do you still cling to it? 那种观点已被证明是错误的，你为什么还要坚持？</font>\n
close down	<font color=blue size=4>close down</font>\n<br>1. cease doing business; stop operating 关门；停业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little shop on the street corner has closed down. 街角上的那家小店已经停业了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory closed down for Christmas. 为了过圣诞节，那家工厂暂时停产。</font>\n<br>2. stop broadcasting 停止广播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The station is now closiug down and we wish you all good night. 节目到此结束，祝大家晚安。</font>\n
close down on	<font color=blue size=4>close down on</font>\n<br>put a stern curb on 严厉取缔；镇压\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Gambling must be closed down on. 必须严厉取缔赌博。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Close down on the drug traffic！禁止贩毒！</font>\n
close in	<font color=blue size=4>close in</font>\n<br>approach 接近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Evening is closing in. 夜幕降临。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They wanted the boat to reach shore before the fog closed in. 他们要求船在大雾降临前到岸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The militiamen gradually closed in on the besieged enemy agents. 民兵渐渐地逼近被包围的敌特分子。</font>\n
close to	<font color=blue size=4>close to</font>\n<br>1. very near 在…附近；接近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is a swimming pool close to my house. 我家附近有个游泳池。</font>\n<br>2. almost 几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is close to tears. 她几乎哭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy came close to falling off the high wall. 那孩子差点从高墙上掉下来。</font>\n
close up	<font color=blue size=4>close up</font>\n<br>1. block or shut; seal 堵住；封住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The opening in the wall has now been closed up. 墙上的洞被堵住了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must close up the old well. It's too dangerous. 我们必须把这口旧井封起来，它太危险了。</font>\n<br>2. heal up; close completely 愈合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry. Your wound is closing up nicely. 不要担心，你的伤口愈合得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of ointment will help to close up your burns. 这种药膏会有助于你烧伤伤口的愈合。</font>\n<br>3. shut up 停业；关闭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Business declined to such an extent that the store closed up last month. 生意清淡到这个地步，那家商店上个月只好关门大吉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop is closing up. I must ask you to leave. 商店就要关门了，我只好请你们离开。</font>\n<br>4. come or bring closer together in a line or lines 把队伍靠紧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sergeant told the men to close up their ranks. 军士命令士兵把队伍排紧些。</font>\n
coincide with	<font color=blue size=4>coincide with</font>\n<br>be in agreement with; be in harmony with 与…一致；与…相符\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their opinions coincide with ours. 他们的意见和我们的意见一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My religious beliefs don't coincide with his. 我的宗教信仰与他的不同。</font>\n
colour up	<font color=blue size=4>colour up</font>\n<br>1. turn red in the face 脸红\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary coloured up when she heard her boyfriend's name mentioned. 听到有人提起男朋友的名字，玛丽脸红了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I complimented her, she coloured up a bit and said it was nothing really. 我夸奖她时，她有点脸红，说那实际上不值得一提。</font>\n<br>2. exaggerate 夸大，渲染\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some journalists like to colour their stories up with lurid details of people's private lives. 有些记者喜欢渲染人们私生活的一些俗艳故事细节。</font>\n
come about	<font color=blue size=4>come about</font>\n<br>1. (of a ship or wind) change direction 转向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was so stormy that the ship had to come about and head for the harbour. 风浪太大，船不得不调转航向，朝港口驶去。</font>\n<br>2. happen; occur 发生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did it come about that the man is dismissed? 那个人被解雇了，怎么回事？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The argument came about because they were talking about politics. 争论是因为他们谈论到政治而引起的。</font>\n
come across	<font color=blue size=4>come across</font>\n<br>1. cross a road, bridge, etc. 穿过（路、桥等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't come across the street when there is heavy traffic. 车子多的时候不要过街。</font>\n<br>2. find or meet by chance 偶然发现或碰到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I came across this old photograph when looking for a book yesterday. 我昨天找书的时候，偶然发现了这张早年的照片。</font>\n<br>3. arise in mind 浮现在脑海中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It came across my mind that I had met her before. 我记得以前曾见过她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good idea came across my mind. 我的脑海中有了一个好主意。</font>\n<br>4. give or do what is demanded or requested 提供所要求的东西；交出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They'll come across a sum of money. 他们将提供一笔钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The robber told the girl to come across with her purse. 强盗要那女孩交出钱包。</font>\n<br>5. succeed in producing a desired effect; be understood and received well by others 起到预期的效果；被理解；效果好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker spoke for a long time but I am afraid his meaning did not come across. 那位演讲人讲了很久，但是他的意思恐怕没有人会理解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your speech came across very well; everyone understands your opinion now. 你的发言清楚明了，现在大家都理解你的观点了。</font>\n
come along	<font color=blue size=4>come along</font>\n<br>1. pass; arrive 经过；过来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just then a bus came along, so we got on and rode home. 正在那时一辆公共汽车过来，我们就乘车回家了。</font>\n<br>2. hurry up 赶快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come along, children, or we'll be late！快点，孩子们，不然就迟到了。</font>\n<br>3. advance; improve 进展；进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son has begun to come along very well in French since the new teacher was appointed. 自从新老师派来以后，我儿子的法语进步很快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His work is coming along well. 他的工作进展情况很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His father was coming along well after the operation. 他父亲手术后身体恢复挺好。</font>\n<br>4. accompany 同…一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please come along with me? 你同我一起去好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John wants to come along with us to the movie. 约翰想和我们一道去看电影。</font>\n
come around/round	<font color=blue size=4>come around/round</font>\n<br>1. regain consciousness; recover from ill temper; get back health 苏醒；恢复理智；恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl fainted, but she came around after an injection. 那个女孩昏了过去，但是打了一针后就醒了过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't scold the boy; he will come around in time. 不要责骂孩子，到时候他的坏脾气会改的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You need not worry. This patient will come around very soon. 你不必担心，这位病人很快即可痊愈。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After this muchneeded rain my flowers will come around again. 下了这场及时雨，我的花会重新恢复生机的。</font>\n<br>2. change one's opinion 改变主意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry. The chairman will soon come around to our opinion. 不要担心，主席很快就会转而同意我们的看法的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's opposed to our ideas at present, but in time he'll come around. 约翰目前反对我们的意见，不过到时他会改变看法的。</font>\n<br>3. happen or appear again and again in regular order 定期出现；到来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Midautumn Festival will come around soon. 中秋节不久就要来临。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Evening shift for each member of the staff comes around every ten days. 所有职员每10天轮流值一次晚班。</font>\n<br>4. pay a visit 拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you come around and see us in the evening? 为什么不在晚间过来看看我们呢？</font>\n
come at	<font color=blue size=4>come at</font>\n<br>1. obtain; reach 获取；得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Put the food where he can't come at it. 把食物放在他拿不到的地方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you come at the result of the experiment? 你是怎样得到这实验结果的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've been looking for that article, but I can't come at it anywhere. 我一直在找那篇文章，但无论哪里也找不到。</font>\n<br>2. attack 向…进攻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man came at her with a knife. 那男人用刀威逼她。</font>\n<br>3. understand; discover 理解；发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is often difficult to come at the true facts. 弄清楚事实真相往往是困难的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sense of an unfamiliar word is hard to come at. 一个不熟悉的词的含义是很难理解的。</font>\n
come back	<font color=blue size=4>come back</font>\n<br>1. return; recall 回来；回想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll come back in two hours. 我两小时后就回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their names are all coming back to me now. 我渐渐想起了他们的名字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scene comes back to my mind. 那情景又浮现在我的脑海中。</font>\n<br>2. return to a former state; return to life, consciousness or vitality, etc. 恢复原状；复活；恢复知觉；恢复活力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible for him to come back soon. 要他早日恢复健康是不可能的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little girl came back a few minutes after she fainted. 小女孩昏迷几分钟后醒过来了。</font>\n<br>3. become fashionable or popular again 重新流行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Short skirts are coming back. 短裙又开始流行起来。</font>\n<br>4. reply forcefully; retort 强烈回答；答辩；反驳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When accused of theft, he came back with a stinging counteraccusation. 别人指责他盗窃，他反咬人一口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came back with a strong protest against their false charge. 他对他们的诬告提出强烈的抗议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lawyer came back sharply in defence of his client. 这个律师为保护当事人进行了有力的辩护。</font>\n
come between	<font color=blue size=4>come between</font>\n<br>1. interfere in the affairs of 干预…之间的事情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to come between the quarrelling men. 他设法干预吵架人之间的争端。</font>\n<br>2. separate; cause trouble between …分开；在…之间制造麻烦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He suddenly realized that a misunderstanding had come between them. 他突然意识到一种误解使他们之间产生了隔阂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His motherinlaw came to live in his home, and as time passed she came between him and his wife. 他的岳母住在他家，随着时间的推移，她使他与他妻子之间产生了矛盾。</font>\n
come by	<font color=blue size=4>come by</font>\n<br>obtain; acquire 获得；得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you come by that beautiful landscape painting? 你是怎样弄到那张漂亮的风景画的？</font>\n
come down	<font color=blue size=4>come down</font>\n<br>1. fall; drop 倒塌；（树）倒下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several trees came down in last night's storm. 昨晚的风暴刮倒了几棵树。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building came down in the storm. 这幢楼在暴风雨中倒塌了。</font>\n<br>2. descend; land 下来；下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Five of the enemy planes came down in the battle. 在战斗中有5架敌机被打了下来。</font>\n<br>3. lessen; be reduced 降低；减少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her weight has come down again. 她的体重又减轻了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child's temperature came down in the morning. 孩子的体温在早晨降下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The price of beer is coming down soon. 啤酒的价格很快就要下跌。</font>\n<br>4. be given or left to people who are younger or come later 传给；流传下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl's necklace had come down to her from her grandmother. 这女孩的项链是她祖母传下来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The custom has come down in our area for two centuries. 这种风俗在本地区流传有两个世纪了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This house has come down from father to son for eight generations. 这幢房子代代相传已达8代。</font>\n<br>5. lose social rank 失掉社会地位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am fraid the family has come down in the world lately. 我担心这个家庭的社会地位最近已在下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The elderly gentleman plainly has come down in the world. 这位老绅士显然是已经败落破产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is coming down in my opinion. 他在我心目中的地位已下降。</font>\n<br>6. provide money, often as a gift; make a gift of money 出钱；捐款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't expect him to come down generously. 我们并不指望他会慷慨解囊。</font>\n<br>7. decide to give support 决定给予支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am determined to come down in favour of Jim. 我决心支持吉姆。</font>\n<br>8. be forced to (by poverty) to do sth. humiliating（因贫穷）被迫做屈辱的事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has come down to begging. 他已沦为乞丐。</font>\n
come down on	<font color=blue size=4>come down on</font>\n<br>1. punish 惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The court will come down on whoever commits crimes. 法庭会惩罚任何犯罪的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government intends to come down heavily on tax evaders. 政府打算严惩偷漏税者。</font>\n<br>2. scold; blame 责备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager came down on him for being late. 经理责备他来迟了。</font>\n<br>3. attack 进攻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy came down on the town during the night. 敌人在夜间进攻了这座小城。</font>\n
come down with	<font color=blue size=4>come down with</font>\n<br>1. be taken ill with 病倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack has come down with a bad cold. 杰克患了重感冒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many children in the kindergarten came down with the flu. 幼儿园的许多孩子都患了流行性感冒。</font>\n<br>2. provide money; pay out 捐钱；付出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll come down with a large sum. 他将捐一笔巨款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How much did she come down with? 她出了多少钱？</font>\n
come/fall short of	<font color=blue size=4>come/fall short of</font>\n<br>be less than; not good enough for 少于；不及；未达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech came short of my expectation. 他的演说有负于我的期望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her monthly income falls short of her needs. 她的月收入不够用。</font>\n
come first	<font color=blue size=4>come first</font>\n<br>win a competition 得第1名；夺冠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She came first in the English oral test. 她在英语口语考试中获第1名。</font>\n
come forward	<font color=blue size=4>come forward</font>\n<br>step forward; move to the front; offer oneself; present oneself 站出来；自告奋勇；主动提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Then the dean came forward and shook hands with all the representatives. 接着，教务长走上前来，同所有的代表一一握手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has come forward with an offer of help. 他主动提出帮忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police want witnesses of the incident to come forward and help them with their inquiries. 警察希望事故目击者能站出来协助他们调查。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When his home was badly damaged in the storm many soldiers came forward to help him repair it. 当他家房子在暴风雨中遭到严重损坏时，许多战士主动来帮助他维修。</font>\n
come from	<font color=blue size=4>come from</font>\n<br>arrive from; have one's origin in; result from 来自；源于；产生；结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What results do you expect to come from all these activities? 你期望这些活动产生什么结果？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What country does he come from? 他是哪国人？</font>\n
come home to	<font color=blue size=4>come home to</font>\n<br>reach; make a person comprehend 了解；明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The truth will come home to him at last. 他最终会了解事情真相的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It eventually came home to the people that the war would be long and bloody. 人们最终认识到，这场战争将是长期而残酷的。</font>\n
come in	<font color=blue size=4>come in</font>\n<br>1. enter; arrive; start 进入；到达；开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When did the train come in? 火车何时到达？</font>\n<br>2. become seasonable 上市；到成熟季节\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Watermelons will come in soon. 西瓜不久就会上市了。</font>\n<br>3. take a place in a competition （比赛）获得…名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came in third in the singing competition. 他在歌咏比赛中得了第3名。</font>\n<br>4. become fashionable 流行；时髦；时兴起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When did the fashion for short skirts come in? 什么时候时兴穿短裙的？</font>\n<br>5. be elected to power; gain power 上台；执政\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The socialists came in at the last election. 社会党人在最近选举中当选。</font>\n<br>6. rise (of the tide) （潮水）升涨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tide is coming in. 正在涨潮。</font>\n<br>7. have one's place or work; serve a purpose 起作用；做一份工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I understand the scheme perfectly, but I don't see where I come in. 我完全了解这个计划，但是我不知道我能起什么作用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't throw these old newspapers away; they may come in for something or other. 不要把旧报纸扔掉，它们可能会有某种用处的。</font>\n<br>8. be received as income 收入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The family has ＄5, 000 coming in monthly. 这个家庭每月收入5000美元。</font>\n<br>9. exist; be present 存在；出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where does the joke come in? 好笑在什么地方？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's where the trouble comes in. 麻烦就出在这里。</font>\n
come in contact with	<font color=blue size=4>come in contact with</font>\n<br>have connection with; meet or mingle with 与…有联系；与…接触\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He comes in contact with people from all walks of life in his work. 他在工作中同各界人士都有接触。</font>\n
come in for	<font color=blue size=4>come in for</font>\n<br>receive; suffer 得到；受到；遭受；遭到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His conduct came in for a lot of criticism. 他的行为遭到了许多批评。</font>\n
come into	<font color=blue size=4>come into</font>\n<br>1. enter; join 进入；参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good idea has just come into my mind. 我刚想了一个好主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Trees will come into leaf soon. 树不久就要吐绿了。</font>\n<br>2. receive as income; receive as inheritance 得到收入；继承（财产）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When did he come into possession of those rare books? 他什么时侯得到那些珍本的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has come into a lot of money from his uncle's estate. 他从叔父的房产中继承了一大笔钱。</font>\n<br>3. begin to be in a state or activity 进入某种状态\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>New laws to control rising prices have recently come into force. 控制物价上涨的新法律最近生效了。</font>\n
come near to	<font color=blue size=4>come near to</font>\n<br>get close to 几乎；差一点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came near to falling off the tree. 他差一点从树上掉下来。</font>\n
come of	<font color=blue size=4>come of</font>\n<br>1. descend from 出身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She comes of a good family stock. 她出身良家。</font>\n<br>2. happen to; result from 由…引起；产生结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's what comes of disobeying the instructions. 那就是不遵守操作规程的结果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What has come of the pupil who kept failing his examinations? 那个考试一直不及格的学生现在怎样了？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Skill comes of practice. 实践出技术。</font>\n

come off	<font color=blue size=4>come off</font>\n<br>1. fall; cease being joined to 脱落；从…离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This button has just come off. 这颗钮扣是刚掉的。</font>\n<br>2. take place as planned 举行；进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tennis finals will come off tomorrow. 网球决赛明天进行。</font>\n<br>3. succeed 成功；实现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The attempt isn't likely to come off. 这种尝试不大可能成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm glad everything has come off so nicely. 我很高兴一切进行得这样好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If this method doesn't come off, we shall have to think of another. 假如这个办法行不通，我们只好另想办法。</font>\n<br>4. have a result; turn out to be 结果是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She came off badly in the match. 她在比赛中成绩不佳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day came off, though it had drizzled early in the morning. 虽然那天早上下着毛毛雨，后来却转晴了。</font>\n
come on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>come on/upon</font>\n<br>1. discover by chance; meet accidentally 偶然发现；偶遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I came on this paper in the readingroom. 我在阅览室里偶然发现了这篇论文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I came on an old friend that day when I visited the club. 那天我去俱乐部时，意外地碰到了一位老朋友。</font>\n<br>2. happen to seize or have an effect on 开始…起来；袭来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fear came upon him as he stood in the empty house. 他站在空荡荡的房子里，一种恐惧感袭上心头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A desire to do the experiment again came on him. 他产生了再次做实验的念头。</font>\n<br>3. return to the memory of 回忆起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Suddenly it came on me that I had seen her before. 我突然想起曾在哪里见过她。</font>\n<br>4. follow; develop; make progress 跟着来；成长；进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll go first; please come on soon. 我先走，请你马上就来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His business came on splendidly. 他的生意十分兴旺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are your potatoes coming on? 你的土豆长势如何？</font>\n<br>5. (used as an imperative expression) indicating encouragement, request（用于表示祈使句）表示鼓励、恳求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come on. Try it again！来呀，再试一回！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come on. They are waiting. 赶快，他们在等着呢。</font>\n<br>6. (law) be brought forward for discussion and judgement（法律）提出讨论或审讯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The case will soon come on for trial. 这案子很快就要开审。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His case comes on this afternoon. 今天下午审理他的案子。</font>\n<br>7. (theatre) appear on the stage 登台；出场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Next the comedians came on and gave a marvelous performance. 然后是喜剧演员上场，表演得棒极了。</font>\n<br>8. begin by degree 逐渐开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Night is coming on. 天渐渐黑了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rain came on just before daybreak. 天快亮时开始下起雨来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It came on to rain after midnight. 午夜后开始下雨。</font>\n
come out	<font color=blue size=4>come out</font>\n<br>1. move outside; emerge; appear 出来；出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun came out from behind the clouds late in the afternoon. 傍晚时分，太阳从云层后面露了出来。</font>\n<br>2. open into full bloom (of flowers) 开花\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some flowers have begun to come out in early spring. 早春时节，有些花已经开放了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The roses will come out next week. 玫瑰下周就要开花。</font>\n<br>3. become clear or known; be discovered 明了；被获知；被发现；披露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The truth will come out at the enquiry. 调查一下，真相就会大白的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The secret will finally come out. 这个秘密终究要被人知道的。</font>\n<br>4. be published 被出版\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does the new book come out? 这本书何时出版？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Communist Manifesto first came out in 1848. 《共产党宣言》于1848年首次发表。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That magazine comes out once a month. 那个杂志每月出一期。</font>\n<br>5. reach a result 结果是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please tell me how the voting came out. 请告诉我选举结果如何。</font>\n<br>6. reach a total; amount to a sum 总计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The total income comes out at 5, 000yuan. 总收入达5000元。</font>\n<br>7. go on strike 罢工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When their demands were rejected by their boss, the workers again came out. 工人们的合理要求被拒绝后，又举行了罢工。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men have come out (on strike) for more pay. 人们为增加工资而罢工。</font>\n<br>8. (stains, etc.) fade; vanish; disappear（污迹等）褪去；去掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think these stains are going to come out. 我想这些污迹是洗不掉的。</font>\n<br>9. (a photo, etc.) be developed （照片等）洗出来；照出来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always comes out well in photography. 他照像总是很上像。</font>\n<br>\n<br>come out with\n<br>1. put forward (a proposal, suggestion, etc.); make a statement; say 提出（建议等）；说出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was silence for a few minutes, then he came out with a very good suggestion. 冷场了几分钟后他提出了非常好的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After some hesitation he came out with the truth. 他犹豫了一阵子后说出了事情的真相。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He often comes out with funny ideas. 他常常提出一些有趣的想法。</font>\n<br>2. put on the market; publish 投放市场；出版\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company has come out with three new models. 那家公司已向市场投放3种新型号的产品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are going to come out with a great, new, dictionary next year. 明年他们将出版一本大型的新词典。</font>\n
come over	<font color=blue size=4>come over</font>\n<br>1. come from a distance; pass overhead or above 从远处来；从…上经过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came over from North America last week, just to see us. 他上周从北美专程来看我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's very noisy here because planes are coming over all the time. 这儿嗓音很大，因为老是有飞机从头上飞过。</font>\n<br>2. change sides or opinions 改变立场或意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How would you like to come over to us? You could double your salary within a year. 你愿不愿到我们这儿来？一年内你的工资就会加倍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a long debate they all came over to our side. 经过长时间的辩论，他们全站到我们这一边来了。</font>\n<br>3. come from the other side of, as across a road to pay a visit 随便来访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You really must come over sometime and have dinner with us. 你该抽时间过来跟我们一起吃顿饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come over anytime; we're always in. 什么时候来玩都行，我们一直在家。</font>\n<br>4. suddenly feel (queer, funny and dizzy) 感到（奇怪、有趣、头晕等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She came over all dizzy just now. 她刚才一阵头昏眼花。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I came over ill, so I had to lie down. 我感到不舒服，因此我不得不躺下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A fit of dizziness came over me. 我突然感到一阵头晕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A feeling of shame came over her face. 她脸上掠过一阵羞愧的神情。</font>\n<br>5. be heard or seen on radio or TV 收看；收听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The programmes came over very well on my TV set. 我的电视机收看效果很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech on the radio came over very well. 他的广播讲话听得很清楚。</font>\n<br>6. cheat or fool (sb.) 欺骗或愚弄（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't come over me with his story. 他那套鬼话骗不了我。</font>\n
come round/around	<font color=blue size=4>come round/around</font>\n<br>1. drop in; pay a visit 顺便拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come round when you have time. 有空来玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be free to see you if you come round this evening. 如果你今天晚上来玩，我将有空见你。</font>\n<br>2. regain consciousness; get well from sickness 恢复知觉；恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The unconscious man slowly began to come round. 那个失去知觉的男人慢慢苏醒了过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has had a severe illness, but she is coming round again. 她生了一场重病，但现在好起来了。</font>\n<br>3. change in opinion 改变看法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I used to believe otherwise, but now I've come round to your point of view. 以前我并不这样想，但现在我已转而同意你的观点了。</font>\n<br>4. recover from ill temper, etc. 冷静下来（不再耍脾气）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't scold the boy. He'll come round in time. 不要责骂这个男孩，他终会平静下来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom came round when Dick told him the whole story. 当狄克把事情的全部经过讲出来之后，汤姆变得心平气和了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On second thoughts he will forget his anger and come round. 再想一想，他就会气平怒息的。</font>\n<br>5. happen or appear again and in regular order 有规律地出现；到来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Christmas will soon come round. 圣诞节不久就要来临了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Well, the holidays have come round again. 好了，假期又来到了。</font>\n
come through	<font color=blue size=4>come through</font>\n<br>1. survive; recover; live in spite of danger or difficulty 活下来；经历（灾难、危险）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mother came through a serious illness. 他妈妈生了一场重病脱险了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not many men in that company came through the battle. 在那场战斗中，那个连活下来的人不多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has come through all kinds of difficulties. 他经历过各种各样的困难。</font>\n<br>2. pass through 透出；透过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain is coming through the roof. 屋顶漏雨。</font>\n<br>3. succeed 成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her plan has come through. 她的计划成功了。</font>\n<br>4. arrive (by telephone, etc.) （经电话、无线电等）传来；到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your posting has just come through; it's Shanghai. 你的调令刚到，地点是上海。</font>\n
come to	<font color=blue size=4>come to</font>\n<br>1. amount to; reach 共计；总数为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bill comes to ten million dollars. 预算总计1000万美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The amounts you have spent will come to a large sum. 你花去的钱将是一个大数目。</font>\n<br>2. regain consciousness; recover from ill temper and become happy again 恢复知觉；重新愉快起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor applied some medicine and he began to come to. 医生用药后，他开始恢复知觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will come to soon after the operation. 手术后不久他就会醒来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father was in a very bad temper this morning, but he had come to by dinner time. 上午父亲情绪极坏，但是到吃晚饭时他又高兴起来了。</font>\n<br>3. succeed in 得到…结果；有出息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy has no character. He will never come to much. 这个男孩没有个性，将来不会有大的作为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go on like this, you will come to nothing. 如果你继续这样下去，你将一事无成。</font>\n<br>4. speak of 谈到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school has good teachers, but when it comes to buildings, it is poor. 这个学校的师资力量很强，但是论建筑物，却很差。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When it comes to mathematics, I'm completely at sea. 说到数学，我完全是门外汉。</font>\n<br>5. arrive at as a result; result in 达成；结果是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Then they came to an agreement. 接着，他们达成了协议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It comes to the same thing. 结果都一样。</font>\n<br>6. signify; become realized by 意味着；意思是；开始被…所认识\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you say comes to this: you don't agree with us. 你说的无非是你不同意我们的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert didn't come to our expectations. 音乐会没有我们期望的那么好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What your explanation comes to is that you can't accept our invitation. 你的解释无非是说你不能接受我们的邀请。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a flash the truth came to me. 突然间我明白了事情真相。</font>\n
come to an end	<font color=blue size=4>come to an end</font>\n<br>end; terminate 结束；终止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting didn't come to an end until midnight. 会议直到午夜才结束。</font>\n
come to pass	<font color=blue size=4>come to pass</font>\n<br>happen; become real 发生；实现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know if his promise will come to pass. 我不知道他的许诺能否兑现。</font>\n
come to terms	<font color=blue size=4>come to terms</font>\n<br>reach an agreement 达成协议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two hostile countries should come to terms with each other. 这两个敌对国应该达成协议。</font>\n
come to the point	<font color=blue size=4>come to the point</font>\n<br>talk about the subject directly; make one's meaning clear 直截了当地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you come to the point on the matter? 这事你为什么不直截了当地说呢？</font>\n
come true	<font color=blue size=4>come true</font>\n<br>prove to be true or correct 实现；证实\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His dream of becoming a university teacher has come true. 他当一名大学教师的梦想实现了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What the newspaper said about the weather for today has come true. 报纸上关于今天天气的报道已经被证实了。</font>\n
come up	<font color=blue size=4>come up</font>\n<br>1. happen; arise 发生；出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect something to come up soon. 我预料不久就会发生什么事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll let you know if anything comes up. 如果发生什么事的话，我会让你知道的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many question came up about the quality of the project. 关于产品质量的许多问题已经出现。</font>\n<br>2. move near; approach 走近；靠近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could hear footsteps coming up behind me. 我听见身后的脚步声越来越近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came up and introdued himself. 他走上前来并作了自我介绍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Christmas is coming up soon. 圣诞节即将来临。</font>\n<br>3. begin to grow 生长；长出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The flowers should be coming up now it is spring. 春天到了，花儿该开放了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The seeds I sowed last week haven't come up yet. 上星期我播下的种子还没有发芽呢。</font>\n<br>4. rise in society or rank 地位提高\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was born poor, and came up the hard way. 他出身贫寒，通过坚韧不拔的努力而获成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That politician has come up in my opinion since I heard his last speech. 自从我上次听了那位政治家的演说之后，他在我心目中的地位已有所提高。</font>\n<br>5. be brought up for discussion; be mentioned 被提出讨论；提及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question hasn't come up yet. 这个问题还没有被提出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When important questions come up, the members often lose their dignified ways and shout at each other. 重要的问题一被提出来，议员们常常是失去了他们庄严的风度，互相争吵起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His name came up whenever the matter of nuclear energy was discussed. 每当讨论核能问题时，人们总会提他的名字。</font>\n<br>6. enter a university as a student 进大学读书\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came up last year to study Modern History. 他去年进大学读现代史。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When they first come up, most students are impressed by the freedom of university life as compared with the restrictions they have known at school. 刚进大学时，与在中学时代所受的约束相比，大多数学生对较为自由的大学生活有了深刻的印象。</font>\n<br>7. be transported 运送\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All our supplies have to come up by this railway. 我们所有的生活用品都得靠这条铁路运送。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We destroyed the railway line to prevent the supplies from coming up to the enemy camp. 为了切断给敌军兵营的给养运输，我们破坏了铁路。</font>\n
come up against	<font color=blue size=4>come up against</font>\n<br>meet (difficulties, opposition) 遭到；应付（困难）；和…相抵触\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers on strike came up against their employer's unwillingness to pay high wages. 罢工的工人们与不愿给他们增加工资的雇主相对抗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may come up against a bit of opposition. 你可能会遭到一些反对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came up against the headmaster, and eventually had to leave. 他跟校长发生矛盾，最后只好离开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When they were dealing with the case, they came up against a series of obstacles. 当他们在审理这个案子的时候，遇到了一系列的障碍。</font>\n
come up to	<font color=blue size=4>come up to</font>\n<br>1. move near; approach; reach the height of 接近；向…走来；达到…高度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man came up to me and asked for a match. 一个男人向我走来，要求点个火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water is coming up to the bank. 水涨到与河岸相平了。</font>\n<br>2. equal; reach 相当；达到；与…匹敌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your work did not come up to the expected standard. 你的工作没有达到预期的标准。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will come up to our expectations in his new job. 他在新的工作中不会辜负我们的期望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This picture does not come up to the one you showed me yesterday. 这幅画没有你昨天给我看的那一幅好。</font>\n<br>3. have the expected ill effect or result on 对…产生预期的坏结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Excessive drinking and smoking will come up to him. 过量地喝酒抽烟，他是要吃苦头的。</font>\n
come up with	<font color=blue size=4>come up with</font>\n<br>1. offer; produce 提供；提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you can come up with a better plan than this. 我希望你能提出比这更好的计划来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked who could come up with a good solution to this problem. 老师问谁能提出一个解决这个问题的好办法。</font>\n<br>2. overtake; come level with 赶上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll have to work hard to come up with other companies. 我们必须勤奋工作，以便赶上别的公司。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she came up with them, she saw that they had sat down and were going through the contents of the bag. 当她追上他们的时后，她发现他们已经坐下并且正在翻包里的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go slowly so that they can come up with us. 我们走慢点，好让他们赶上来。</font>\n
come what may	<font color=blue size=4>come what may</font>\n<br>no matter what happens 不论发生什么事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come what may, we'll stand together and help each other. 不论发生什么事情，我们都将站在一起，互相支持。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have decided to get a college education, come what may. 我决定无论如何要去上大学。</font>\n
comment on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>comment on/upon</font>\n<br>express one's opinion about 评论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They will ask the Prime Minister to comment on the new foreign policy of the government. 他们将请首相阐述一下新的对外政策。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher commented favourably upon his ability. 老师对他的能力加以称赞。</font>\n
commit oneself to	<font color=blue size=4>commit oneself to</font>\n<br>1. be devoted to 献身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He committed himself to working for peace all through his life. 他一生献身于和平事业。</font>\n<br>2. hold oneself to a promise or duty 使承担义务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has committed herself to helping me when necessary. 她已答应在必要的时候帮助我。</font>\n
commit to	<font color=blue size=4>commit to</font>\n<br>1. send 把…交托给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was committed to the care of her grandmother. 那个女孩被托付给祖母照看。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The woman was committed to a hospital for mad people. 那妇女被送进了疯人院。</font>\n<br>2. entrust 把…付诸于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She committed the evil books to the flames. 她把那些坏书付之一炬。</font>\n<br>3. sentence sb. to 把…判处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They committed the criminal to prison. 他们把罪犯投进了监狱。</font>\n
communicate with	<font color=blue size=4>communicate with</font>\n<br>1. send a message to; share or exchange opinions, news, information, etc. 与…交往；与…保持通讯联系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The army fighting on the battlefield communicated with the headquarters every minute. 作战部队同司令部时刻保持着通讯联系。</font>\n<br>2. join; connect 与…相联\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our school library communicates with a park by means of a gate. 我们的校图书馆同一个公园有门相通。</font>\n
comparable with/to	<font color=blue size=4>comparable with/to</font>\n<br>worthy of comparison; capable of bearing comparison with 可与…相比的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This mountain is not comparable with the Yellow Mountain in Anhui Province. 这座山同安徽的黄山是不能比的。</font>\n
compare to	<font color=blue size=4>compare to</font>\n<br>regard as similar or equal to; be likened to 把…比作；与…相当（常就两者之间相似的方面进行比拟）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Life is often compared to a voyage. 人生常被比作航程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Books are often compared to friends. 书籍常常被比喻为朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can compare her poetry to the greatest poems of the presend century. 我们可以把她的诗同本世纪最伟大的诗篇相提并论。</font>\n
compare with	<font color=blue size=4>compare with</font>\n<br>examine to find things that are the same or different 比较（异或同）；同类之间进行具体的比较；对照\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can not be compared with Shakespeare as a writer of tragedies. 作为一个悲剧作家，他无法和莎士比亚相比。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can compare your writing with the model writing on page 85. 你可以把自己的作文同第85页的范文作一比较。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you compare this with that, you'll find they are very much alike. 如果把这个与那个比较一下，你会发现它们非常相似。</font>\n
compete with	<font color=blue size=4>compete with</font>\n<br>be in competition with; enter intocontest with 与…竞争\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This firm is too small to compete with the transnational corporation. 这家公司太小了，竞争不过跨国公司。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now China can compete with other countries. 现在中国可以和其它国家竞争。</font>\n
complain about	<font color=blue size=4>complain about</font>\n<br>find fault with; utter sth. unfavourable about 抱怨；埋怨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students are always complaining about the bad food. 学生总是抱怨伙食不好。</font>\n
complain of	<font color=blue size=4>complain of</font>\n<br>state that one is suffering from 诉说；诉苦；抱怨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have nothing to complain of. 我没有什么好埋怨的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Blake is complaining of a headache again. 布莱克说自己又患头痛病了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient complained of abdominal pain. 病人主诉腹痛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Workers complain to the boss of their overwork. 因为工作过度，工人向老板诉苦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The goods complained of were immediately exchanged by the manager. 经理立即把买主抱怨的商品换了。</font>\n
comply with	<font color=blue size=4>comply with</font>\n<br>be faithful to; obey; abide by 遵照；服从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you join the society, you must comply with its rules. 如果参加这个协会，就必须遵守其规章制度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She promised to comply with my request. 她答应按我的要求办。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll comply with what's been agreed upon. 我们将遵照已经商定的协议办。</font>\n

conceal from	<font color=blue size=4>conceal from</font>\n<br>hide from; keep secret from 隐藏；隐瞒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't conceal your guilt from the police. 你不能向警察隐瞒你的罪行。</font>\n
conceive of	<font color=blue size=4>conceive of</font>\n<br>1. imagine; form the idea of 设想；构想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible to conceive of anything better. 想象不出更好的东西了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The modern child finds it difficult to conceive of a time when there was no radio or TV. 现代的儿童觉得很难想象过去没有收音机和电视机的时代是什么样子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is difficult to conceive of his doing such a thing. 很难想象他会干出这样的事情。</font>\n<br>2. consider 考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her father wouldn't conceive of her going to London at her age. 她父亲不愿意考虑她这个年龄就去伦敦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We refuse to conceive of such a solution to our problem. 我们拒绝考虑采取那样的办法来解决我们的问题。</font>\n
concentrate on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>concentrate on/upon</font>\n<br>direct one's thought to; fix one's attention on 把思想集中于；全神贯注于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must concentrate on developing our foreign trade and commerce. 我们必须把注意力集中在发展我们的对外贸易上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please be quiet, the children are concentrating on their homework. 请安静，孩子们正在专心做家庭作业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't concentrate more on your work you'll be dismissed. 假如你不更加专心地工作，你将被解雇。</font>\n
concerned about/over/for	<font color=blue size=4>concerned about/over/for</font>\n<br>giving one's attention to; worrying about 关心；担心；挂念\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is very much concerned about his son's future. 他非常关心儿子的前途。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was genuinely concerned over our financial difficulties. 他真心实意地关心我们的经济困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are all concerned for the boy's safety. 他们都很担心孩子的安全。</font>\n
concerned with	<font color=blue size=4>concerned with</font>\n<br>1. having relation with 与…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am not concerned with such things. 我同这些事无关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The researches are concerned with alpha rays. 这些研究都是关于阿尔法射线的。</font>\n<br>2. giving one's attention to; worrying about 关心；担心；忧虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must be concerned with the people's wellbeing. 我们必须关心群众生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is deeply concerned with our health problem. 她非常关心我们的健康问题。</font>\n

confer on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>confer on/upon</font>\n<br>1. talk together, esp. to try to reach agreement 商讨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are conferring on the question of reducing prices. 他们正在就降低物价的问题进行磋商。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They conferred on the best way of paying off the debt quickly. 他们商议迅速偿还债务的最好办法。</font>\n<br>2. bestow 授予\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Queen conferred a title on the brave sailor. 女王为那个勇敢的水手授衔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The university conferred on him the title of LLD. 该大学授予他法学博士称号。</font>\n
confide in	<font color=blue size=4>confide in</font>\n<br>1. trust; believe in 相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can confide in me, my dear. Your affair will be kept private. 你可以信任我，亲爱的，你的事情我会保密的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why should I not confide in those that have been so kind to me? 为什么我不该信赖那些一直待我这样好的人呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I confided in your good judgement. 我坚信你有良好的判断力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you confide in my ability to finish the work on time? 你相信我有按时完成工作的能力吗？</font>\n<br>2. share secrets and intimate matters with 向…吐露秘密；讲心里话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her heart was breaking, and she had no one to confide in. 她伤心欲绝，而且又没有人可以倾诉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Modern girls seldom confide in their mother. 现代女孩子很少向母亲吐露心事。</font>\n
