confide to	<font color=blue size=4>confide to</font>\n<br>1. give to the care of 托…照管；委托\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He confided his child to the care of his neighbour. 他把他孩子托邻居照看。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better confide your jewels to the bank. 你最好把珠宝托银行代管。</font>\n<br>2. tell as a secret; tell secrets to 吐露（秘密）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She confided her secret to her best friend. 她把秘密告诉了最亲密的朋友。</font>\n
confine to	<font color=blue size=4>confine to</font>\n<br>limit to 限制在…内；使闭门不出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Confine your remarks to the subject of the meeting. 讲话内容不要超过会议主题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lecture is confined to economic management. 讲座的内容局限在经济管理方面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was confined to bed by illness. 她卧病在床。</font>\n
conform to	<font color=blue size=4>conform to</font>\n<br>1. be in agreement with 与…相符\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All parts of superstructure which do not conform to the form to the economic base must be trans formed. 要改革。一切不适应经济基础的上层建筑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he has done does not conform to the interests of the people. 他所做的不符合人民的利益。</font>\n<br>2. obey; act in accordance with 遵从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must conform to the laws of the country. 我们必须遵守国家的法律。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All students must conform to the rules. 所有学生都必须遵守校规。</font>\n
confront with	<font color=blue size=4>confront with</font>\n<br>bring face to face; cause to meet 使面对；遭遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fearless hunters dare to confront with the fiercest animals. 无畏的猎手敢于面对最凶残的野兽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were confronted with a lot of difficulties in their research work. 他们在研究工作中遇到了许多困难。</font>\n
congratulate on	<font color=blue size=4>congratulate on</font>\n<br>express one's pleasure about; feel pleased with 祝贺；庆祝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole family congratulated Jack on coming out first the maths contest. 全家人都祝贺杰克在数学竞赛中获得第1名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I congratulate you on your marriage. 恭贺新婚之喜。</font>\n
conjure up	<font color=blue size=4>conjure up</font>\n<br>1. cause to appear as if from nothing, or as a picture in the mind 使人脑海中浮现出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people claim to be able to conjure up the spirit of the dead. 某些人宣称他们能够让死者的灵魂显现。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These faded photographs conjure up memories of my childhood. 这些褪色的照片使我回忆起儿童时代的情景。</font>\n<br>2. make appear by conjuring or magic 用魔术变出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The magician conjured up a white rabbit. 魔术师变出来一只白兔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He conjured up a whole meal in a jiffy. 他一眨眼工夫就变出了一桌饭菜。</font>\n
conscious of	<font color=blue size=4>conscious of</font>\n<br>aware of 意识到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was not conscious of having offended him. 我没有意识到得罪了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not conscious of his shortcomings. 他没有意识到自己的弱点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was conscious of being watched by the enemy. 他意识到自己正被敌人盯梢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am quite conscious of his innocence. 我很清楚他是无辜的。</font>\n
consent to	<font color=blue size=4>consent to</font>\n<br>give permission or approval to 同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gladly consented to the extension of a loan. 他很乐意地同意延长贷款偿还期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will her mother consent to her marrying Simon? 她母亲同意她同西蒙结婚吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot consent to what you ask. 我不能答应你的请求。</font>\n
consistent with	<font color=blue size=4>consistent with</font>\n<br>in agreement with 和…一致；始终如一\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story is not consistent with the facts. 这个报道与事实不符。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His behaviour is consistent with his teaching. 他的行为与他的教诲是一致的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His action is always consistent with his words. 他始终言行一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His conduct in the affair was not consistent with his usual politeness and gentleness. 他在这件事上的所做所为同他素日的温文尔雅很不一致。</font>\n
consist in	<font color=blue size=4>consist in</font>\n<br>be found in; depend upon 在于；取决于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The beauty of the picture consists in its balance of colours. 这幅画的美在于其色彩的协调。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our happiness consists in doing something valuable for society. 我们的幸福就在于为社会做些有价值的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The true wealth does not consist in what we have, but in what we are. 真正的财富不是我们拥有的财产，而是我们自身的价值。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Communist spirit consists in wholehearted devotion to public interests. 共产主义精神在于一心为公。</font>\n
consist of	<font color=blue size=4>consist of</font>\n<br>be made up of; be composed of 由…组成；包括\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Carbon dioxide consists of carbon and oxygen. 二氧化碳由碳和氧组成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Man consists of soul and body. 人由灵魂和肉体组成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The society consists of 30 members. 这个协会有30个会员组成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One year consists of 365 days. 一年有365天。</font>\n
consist with	<font color=blue size=4>consist with</font>\n<br>match; suit; be equal to 与…相符；符合；相容\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His actions consist with his promises. 他言行如一。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Health does not consist with selfindulgence. 健康和放纵是不相容的。</font>\n
consult with	<font color=blue size=4>consult with</font>\n<br>exchange opinions, information, etc. with 咨询；请教；打听…的情况\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President consulted with his cabinet members before delivering the speech to the public. 总统在向公众发表演说之前，同内阁成员进行了磋商。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We consulted with the teachers and rapidly drew up a teaching plan. 我们和老师们商量了一下，迅速制定了教学计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Consult with your parents before you decide. 决定之前先和你父母商量一下。</font>\n
contemptuous of	<font color=blue size=4>contemptuous of</font>\n<br>showing or feeling contempt; scornful 瞧不起；轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should not be contem ptuous of the poor. 你不应该瞧不起穷人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Snobs are usually contem ptuous of people they feel to be beneath them. 势利者通常瞧不起他们认为在他们之下的人。</font>\n
contend with	<font color=blue size=4>contend with</font>\n<br>1. handle; deal with; manage 处理；应付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are many difficulties for the students to contend with. 困难太多，学生难以应付。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is a difficult woman to contend with. 她是一个难以应付的女人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy frost is the greatest enemy the fruitgrowers have to contend with. 严霜是果农必须对付的最大危害。</font>\n<br>2. be in rivalry or competition with; struggle with 和…争夺；竞争；与…作斗争\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our football team is contending with one from the next town for championship. 我们的足球队正和邻镇的足球队争夺冠军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must contend with difficulties. 我们必须与困难作斗争。</font>\n
content with	<font color=blue size=4>content with</font>\n<br>1. satisfied with; happy with 对…满意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you content with your present job? 你对目前的工作满意吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should be content with what you have. 你应该对你拥有的一切感到满足了。</font>\n<br>2. satisfy with 对…感到满足\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As there's no butter we shall have to content ourselves with dry bread. 既然没有黄油，我们只好吃干面包了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd never content ourselves with book knowledge only. 我们永远不能满足于仅有的那么一点书本知识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't go abroad this year, so we'll have to content ourselves with a holiday in London. 今年我们不能出国，所以只好在伦敦度假了。</font>\n
contrary to	<font color=blue size=4>contrary to</font>\n<br>in opposition to; against 与…相反；违反\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The result is contrary to our expectation. 结果与我们的预料相反。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Contrary to his parents'advice, he dropped his study and went to sea. 他不顾父母的劝告，放弃了学业，当水手去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This has turned out contrary to my expectation. 这个事情的结果与我的愿望相反。</font>\n
contribute to	<font color=blue size=4>contribute to</font>\n<br>1. give (money or time) to; supply (written materials) to 捐（款）；把（时间）投入；投（稿）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is an honour to be invited to contribute to your literature magazine. 能应邀为你们的文学杂志写稿我感到非常荣幸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He offered to contribute to the Red Cross. 他主动向红十字会捐款。</font>\n<br>2. help to bring about; have a share in 贡献；有助于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All these factors contributed to his success. 所有这些因素促使他成功了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fresh air and exercise can contribute to good health. 新鲜空气和运动有助于健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This conference will contribute to the cause of opposing hegemonism. 这次会议将有助于反霸事业。</font>\n
convert into	<font color=blue size=4>convert into</font>\n<br>change sth. into 使…变成；变为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Does electricity convert easily into other forms of power? 电转变成其它能量容易吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A poet can convert ordinary words into a meaningful and effective piece of writing. 诗人能够把普通的词汇化为意味深长而又动人的诗篇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He converted his francs into dollars. 他将法郎兑换成美元。</font>\n
convict of	<font color=blue size=4>convict of</font>\n<br>declare to be guilty of 宣判…有罪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man was convicted of robbery. 那人被判盗窃罪。</font>\n
convince of	<font color=blue size=4>convince of</font>\n<br>persuade sb. to believe the truth of; make sb. feel sure of 使…相信；说服…相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We convinced the students of the necessity of engaging in social activities. 我们说服学生相信从事社会活动的必要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't convince him of his mistake. 我无法说服他认识错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall easily convince you of his innocence. 我能很容易地使你相信他是无罪的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are convinced of the righteousness of our cause. 我们坚信我们的事业是正义的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leaders are convinced of the importance of education. 领导们相信教育的重要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is now convinced of the truth of the report. 他现在相信这报告是真实的。</font>\n
cook up	<font color=blue size=4>cook up</font>\n<br>1. prepare by cooking quickly 匆匆烹调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She cooked up an omelette and chips when he arrived unexpectedly. 当他出乎意料地到来时，她很快就做好了一个炒鸡蛋和油煎土豆片。</font>\n<br>2. invent; devise; concoct 造出；想出；捏造；虚构\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The absentee cooked up some excuse about being ill. 那位缺席者编造了一个有病的借口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like cooking up stories just to help you out of a difficult situation. 我不愿为你摆脱困境而虚构事实。</font>\n
cool down	<font color=blue size=4>cool down</font>\n<br>1. become cool 变冷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soup has cooled down. 汤凉了。</font>\n<br>2. become calmer or less excited 冷静下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I won't talk to her until she has cooled down. 她冷静下来我才会同她谈。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The situation has cooled down a lot since yesterday. 形势从昨天起已平静了许多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cooled the situation down by offering mediation between the disputing parties. 他主动提出在争执双方斡旋，从而使形势缓和。</font>\n<br>3. become less attracted or enthusiastic 对…冷淡（尤用于比喻）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their friendship seems to have cooled down. 他们的友谊似乎已经冷淡了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His affection for her gradually cooled down. 他对她的爱情逐渐冷淡了。</font>\n
cope with	<font color=blue size=4>cope with</font>\n<br>1. find a way to deal with; manage successfully 处理；有效地对付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't cope with such a pile of work this week. 我本周处理不了这么一大堆工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mayor should take steps to cope with the holiday rush. 市长应采取措施解决假日食宿交通繁忙的问题。</font>\n<br>2. match 与…相匹敌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can't cope with him in maths. 她在数学方面不如他。</font>\n
correspond to	<font color=blue size=4>correspond to</font>\n<br>match; be equal to; be similar to 相当；相称；相似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In this firm, the manager corresponds to the general in the army. 在这家公司里，经理相当于军队里的将军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Find a word in your mother tongue which corresponds to the English word“noble”. 从你的母语中找到一个同英语“noble”相对应的词。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>American Congress corresponds to British Parliament. 美国的国会相当于英国的议会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His expenses do not correspond to his income. 他的花费与他的收入不相称。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her answer corresponds to my expectation. 她的回答如我所料。</font>\n
correspond with	<font color=blue size=4>correspond with</font>\n<br>1. write letters to and receive letters from; exchange letters 与…通信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is still corresponding with his former girlfriend. 他现在仍同他从前的女友通信。</font>\n<br>2. be in agreement with; be in harmony with 与…相符；与…调和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The picture does not crrespond with the description the witness has given. 这张照片与目击者所描述的不符。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His actions do not correspond with his words. 他言行不一。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her white hat and shoes correspond with her white dress. 她的白帽、白鞋和她的白色衣服十分协调。</font>\n
count for	<font color=blue size=4>count for</font>\n<br>be worth; be of importance 有价值；有重要性\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to count for quite a lot in the firm. 他在公司内似乎举足轻重。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In our factory, quality counts for as much as quantity. 在我们厂里，质量和数量同等重要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dam project counted for much in promoting agricultural production in our county. 这个水坝工程对发展我县农业生产起很大作用。</font>\n
count in	<font color=blue size=4>count in</font>\n<br>include 包括\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you are going out for a picnic, please count me in. 如果你们出去野餐的话，请把我也算进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you counted in those who are absent? 你把缺席的人也算进去了吗？</font>\n
count off	<font color=blue size=4>count off</font>\n<br>1. count aloud from one end of a line of men to the other 报数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers counted off from right to left. 战士们从右向左报数。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Count off！（口令）报数！</font>\n<br>2. select 挑选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He counted off three men to help with the job. 他选出了3个人来帮助做这件事。</font>\n
count on	<font color=blue size=4>count on</font>\n<br>depend on; trust 依靠；信赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can count on Mr. Li. He will never fail you. 你可以依靠李先生，他决不会让你失望的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The team was counting on me to win the race. 运动队指望我赢这场赛跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't count on going abroad this summer; we may not have enough money. 别指望今年夏天能出国，我们可能钱不够。</font>\n
count out	<font color=blue size=4>count out</font>\n<br>1. count one by one 一个一个地数出（数目）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss is counting out his money. 老板正在数钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old lady counted out fifteen penceand passed it to the salesgirl. 那老太太慢吞吞地数了15便士给女店员。</font>\n<br>2. exclude 排除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can count me out of your plan. 你们的计划可以不把我包括进去。</font>\n
count up	<font color=blue size=4>count up</font>\n<br>enumerate; count; find the total of 清点；数；算出…的总数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They began to count up their losses after the battle. 他们在战役之后清点伤亡损失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please count up all the days that he has been absent and let me know the result. 请把他缺席的天数加起来并把结果告诉我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Count up to ten before you open your eyes. 数到10再睁开眼睛。</font>\n
cover in	<font color=blue size=4>cover in</font>\n<br>fill up; complete the covering of 填满；装好…顶或盖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have covered in the whole market. 他们给整个商场盖上了一个顶篷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We decided to cover in the passage between the main building and the annex. 我们决定在主楼和建筑物之间的过道上加盖屋顶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With everybody helping, they had the ditch covered in in no time. 由于大家帮忙，他们一下子就把那条沟填满了。</font>\n
cover up	<font color=blue size=4>cover up</font>\n<br>1. cover completely; protect with clothing, etc. 盖严；用衣服等把…裹起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He covered the child up with a blanket. 他用一条毯子把孩子盖严。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's very cold outside and you should cover up warmly. 外面很冷，你要穿暖和些。</font>\n<br>2. hide sth. wrong or bad 掩盖；掩饰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lies cannot cover up facts. 谎言掩盖不了事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No pretty words can cover up its aggressive acts. 漂亮的言辞掩盖不了它的侵略行径。</font>\n

crave for	<font color=blue size=4>crave for</font>\n<br>1. have a strong desire for 渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The oppressed crave for freedom and happiness. 被压迫者渴望自由和幸福。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He claimed to be a democrat, but secretly he craved for absolute authority. 他自称是民主主义者，但暗中却渴望得到绝对的权力。</font>\n<br>2. ask forcefully for 恳求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Kneeling before the king, the prisoner craved for mercy. 罪犯跪在国王面前，请求宽恕。</font>\n
crazy about	<font color=blue size=4>crazy about</font>\n<br>very fond of or interested in 非常喜欢；对…入迷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was crazy about his son. 他非常喜欢儿子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is crazy about modern music. 她对现代音乐入了迷。</font>\n
crop up	<font color=blue size=4>crop up</font>\n<br>arise; happen unexpectedly; be mentioned 被提到；突然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some difficult questions cropped up at this point. 这时出现了一些难题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee may be recalled before the appointed date if any urgent business crops up. 如果出现紧急事宜，委员会可以在预定的日期之前召开会议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The subject cropped up in the course of conversation. 谈话时无意中说到了这个题目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His name kept cropping up in the newspaper. 报上不断提到他的名字。</font>\n
cross out/off	<font color=blue size=4>cross out/off</font>\n<br>cancel, often by marking with crosses 删除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She crossed the phrase out and wrote in another. 她把那个词组删掉，另写了一个。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher crossed out several words in my composition. 老师划掉了我作文里的几个词。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They crossed off his name from the list. 他们把他的名字从名单上划掉了。</font>\n
crowded with	<font color=blue size=4>crowded with</font>\n<br>full of; filled with 充满；拥挤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop is crowded with customers. 商店里顾客盈门。</font>\n
crush down	<font color=blue size=4>crush down</font>\n<br>destroy completely by using force; suppress forcibly 镇压（下去）；压倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cruel king crushed down any sign of opposition from the people. 残酷的国王对人民的任何反抗行为都加以镇压。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The more the reactionaries tried to crush down mass movements, the more determined the people became. 反动派越是镇压群众运动，人民就变得越坚定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is likely that she will be crushed down by the bad news. 很可能她会被这可悲的消息压垮。</font>\n
crush up	<font color=blue size=4>crush up</font>\n<br>reduce to powder; squeeze up into a ball 把…弄成粉末\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The nurse crushed up the table to give it to the baby. 护士把药片碾碎后喂婴儿吃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After reading the letter, the man crushed it up and threw it into a dustpen. 读完信后，那人把它捏成一团扔到畚箕中去了。</font>\n
cry down	<font color=blue size=4>cry down</font>\n<br>1. silence sb. by shouting 大声喊以使…静下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before he was halfway through his speech, the crowd cried him down. 他才讲到一半，公众就把他哄下了台。</font>\n<br>2. depreciate 贬低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The critic cried down the book. 那位评论家贬低那本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cried down everyone except the rich and the powerful. 除了有钱有势的人，他什么人都瞧不起。</font>\n
cry for	<font color=blue size=4>cry for</font>\n<br>1. express a desire for by weeping or shouting 哭着要；嚷着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child is crying for some more sweets. 那孩子哭着要再吃一些糖果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The strikers cried for a raise of pay. 罢工者叫喊着要求增加工资。</font>\n<br>2. need very much; be in pressing need of 急需；要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crops are crying for rain. 庄稼急需雨水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The housing problem in this citycried for immediate solution. 该城市的住房问题急待解决。</font>\n
cry off	<font color=blue size=4>cry off</font>\n<br>call off; withdraw from (an agreement or undertaking) 取消；撤回（协议或任务）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had intended to go but I cried off at the last minute. 我本来要去的，但是最后一分钟打消了这个念头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cried off this research project and left his friends in great difficulty. 他撒手不管这个研究项目，使他的朋友们陷入困境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John was going to help us, but he cried off. 约翰本来要帮助我们的，但是他没有履行诺言。</font>\n
cry out	<font color=blue size=4>cry out</font>\n<br>1. shout loudly 大声喊叫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the boys and girls saw so many yellow handkerchiefs, they cried out with delight. 当男孩女孩看见这么多黄手帕时，他们高兴地喊了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wounded soldier cried out in pain. 伤兵痛苦地喊叫着。</font>\n<br>2. be in great need 急需（后接动词不定式）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car is crying out to be repaired. 这部车子急待维修。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The business is just crying out for some capital. 这笔生意正急需本钱。</font>\n
cry out against	<font color=blue size=4>cry out against</font>\n<br>complain loudly; protest strongly 大声抱怨；强烈抗议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are crying out against their being maltreated by the factory owner. 工人们强烈抗议工厂的老板对他们的虐待。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people are crying out against the new rule. 许多人正在强烈抗议这项新的规则。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The people are crying out against this injustice. 人民正在大声疾呼反对这不公正的行为。</font>\n
cry over	<font color=blue size=4>cry over</font>\n<br>weep because of; grieve about 因…而哭泣；因…感到悲痛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man was crying over his misfortune. 那人为自己的不幸而哭泣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't cry over spilt milk. 不要作无益的后悔。</font>\n
cure of	<font color=blue size=4>cure of</font>\n<br>1. bring sb. back to health 使（人）恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is cured of her heart trouble. 她的心脏病已经治好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doctors are now able to cure people of many diseases which in former times would have killed them. 医生现在能够治好许多从前致人死命的疾病。</font>\n<br>2. get rid of (bad habit, etc.) 去除；根除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you help to cure her son of his bad habits? 你能帮助改掉她儿子的坏习惯吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No medicine can cure a man of discontent. 没有药能消除一个人的不满。</font>\n
curl up	<font color=blue size=4>curl up</font>\n<br>form into a curved shape; rise in a curled shape 卷曲；盘旋上升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The snake curled up in the grass. 蛇卷曲在草丛中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smoke can be seen curling up in the clear sky. 烟在晴空中袅袅上升。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pages of the book have curled up from constant use. 由于经常使用，这书页都卷起来了。</font>\n
cut across	<font color=blue size=4>cut across</font>\n<br>1. go a short way; take a short cut across 走快捷方式；抄近路穿过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They didn't want to walk to the corner and turn, so they cut across the lane to the bus stop. 他们不想走到街道的拐角处拐弯而是穿过小巷到了汽车站。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can gain time if we cut across this field. 如果我们抄近路从这田野横穿过去，就可以赢得时间。</font>\n<br>2. interrupt 打断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her loud voice cut across their conversation. 她的高嗓门打断了我们的谈话。</font>\n<br>3. contradict; be opposite to 跟…相抵触；与…背道而驰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman's decision cuts across the opinion of the whole committee. 主席的决定与委员会全体成员的意见背道而驰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't wish to press my suggestion if it woulh cut across anything you have in mind. 如果我的建议违背你的想法的话，我不打算强迫你接受。</font>\n
cut a figure	<font color=blue size=4>cut a figure</font>\n<br>give a good impression of; make oneself conspicuous in the hope of being admired 出风头；炫耀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shouting and waving, he cut a figure at the head of the procession. 他走在队伍前头，又是喊叫，又是招手，出尽了风头。</font>\n
cut back	<font color=blue size=4>cut back</font>\n<br>1. return quickly 迅速返回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cut back through the woods to where he had been standing before. 他急速穿过树林回到原先一直站立的地方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wounded soldier recovered and cut back to his unit. 这位伤兵养好了伤，很快就归队了。</font>\n<br>2. make shorter by cutting 剪短\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor cut the cloth back. 裁缝把布剪短了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have cut the roses back in order to improve their growth. 为了使玫瑰长得更好，我们已经修剪了枝干。</font>\n<br>3. reduce in quantity or amount 削减；压缩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The only way to do that is to cut back expenses. 做到这一点的唯一办法就是减少开支。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the big job was finished, the builder cut back the number of men working for him. 那项大工程完工之后，建筑商便裁减了工人的人数。</font>\n
cut down	<font color=blue size=4>cut down</font>\n<br>1. make sth. fall by cutting 砍倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many big trees along the road have been cut down for building houses. 路旁的许多大树都被砍掉建房了。</font>\n<br>2. reduce; lessen 削减；降低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This factory's production has been cut down. 这家工厂的生产减少了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Strenuous efforts have been made to cut down government expenses to a desirable level. 政府已尽力把开支削减到了一个理想的水平。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the end, I cut the dealer down by another＄ 5.00. 最后我使商贩把价格又减少了5美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are doing all they can to cut down the accident rate. 工人们正在尽一切努力降低事故率。</font>\n<br>3. deprive of life or health (by disease, etc.) 因疾病等夺去生命\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man was cut down in his primeof manhood by a pneumonia. 那人因患肺炎而英年早逝。</font>\n<br>4. destroy (an argument) 驳倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His arguments are very easy to cut down. 他的论点很容易被驳倒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so eloquent that he cut down the finest orator. 他非常能言善辩，驳倒了最好的演说家。</font>\n<br>5. reduce the size of (clothes, etc.) 改小或缩短（衣服等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor is cutting down my dress. 裁缝正在把我的衣服改小。</font>\n
cut down on	<font color=blue size=4>cut down on</font>\n<br>cut back on; reduce 减少；削减\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor asked him to cut down on smoking. 医生叫他少抽烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must cut down on the amount of carbohydrates you eat if you want to get slim. 如果你想变得苗条，必须减少你的吃糖量。</font>\n
cut in	<font color=blue size=4>cut in</font>\n<br>1. interrupt; intervene; interpose 插嘴（后不带宾语）；干涉；插入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always cuts in when other people are talking. 别人谈话时她总要插嘴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The telephone operator cut in and said that I had already spoken 3minutes. 总机插话说我已经通了3分钟的话了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think I ought to cut in on what they are doing. 我想我应该干预他们的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was stopped when he tried to cut in on the queue. 他想插队时被人阻止了。</font>\n<br>2. enter sharply into the path of another 超车；抢先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were driving peacefully along the road when a police car cut in, forcing us to slow down. 我们的车子在平稳地向前行驶，突然一辆警车超了上来，迫使我们减慢了速度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Accidents are often caused by drivers who try to cut in. 司机超车抢先常常造成意外事故。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police car cut in ahead of the escaping robber. 警车拦截了那个逃跑的强盗。</font>\n<br>3. include; absorb 包括；吸收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would like to be cut in on this project. 我想加入这个项目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“If you contribute ＄ 1, 000, we'll cut you in, ”the chairman of the charity committee said to Mrs. Robinson. “如果你捐助1000美元，我们就吸收你入会。”慈善委员会主席对鲁滨逊太太说。</font>\n
cut into	<font color=blue size=4>cut into</font>\n<br>1. interrupt sth. (such as conversation) 打断；插嘴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't cut into the conversation but waited till they had finished speaking. 她并没有打断他们的谈话而是一直等到他们谈完为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is impolite of you to cut into the discussion in this way. 你这样打断别人的讨论是不礼貌的。</font>\n<br>2. reduce; use part of (sth. such as money, time) unwillingly from 减少；很不乐意地从…用去一部分（如钱、时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“But that would cut into cut into our profit, ”he said. 他说：“那样会减少我们的利润。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No doubt the extra work to be assigned you will cut into your sparetime. 毫无疑问，安排给你的额外工作将会减少你的业余时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This plan of yours cuts into our schedule rather badly. 你们的这个计划在我们的日程表里占去很多时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall have to cut into my savings to pay for the holiday. 我将不得不从我的储蓄里拿出一部分钱来作为假期里的开支。</font>\n
cut off	<font color=blue size=4>cut off</font>\n<br>1. disconnect (the supply of water or electricity); interrupt; turn off 切断（水、电）；中断；关掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their water supply was cut off. 他们的水源被切断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All communications are cut off. 一切交通都被切断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The telephone operator cut us off before we had finished our conversation. 我们还没有谈完，电话就被总机接线员切断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman will cut a speaker off if he talks too long. 如果发言人讲得太长，主席会打断他的发言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The motor was cut off as soon as something seemed to be wrong with it. 一旦发现发动机似乎有点毛病，就立即把它关掉。</font>\n<br>2. remove by cutting the ends 切下来；剪下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They cut off the heads of their captives. 他们把俘虏的头砍了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rope is two feet longer than we needed, so we cut off the extra length. 绳子比我们需要的长两英尺，因此我们把多余的给剪下来了。</font>\n<br>3. isolate; make lonely 孤立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy soldiers were cut off from their headquarters. 敌军同总部的联系被切断，成了孤军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The flood cut the villagers from the rest of the world. 洪水切断了村民们与外界的联系。</font>\n<br>4. disinherit 剥夺继承权\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has cut his son off without a penny. 他取消了儿子的继承权，一便士也不给。</font>\n
cut out	<font color=blue size=4>cut out</font>\n<br>1. remove by cutting 剪下；剪裁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She cut out the photograph from the paper. 她从报纸上把照片剪了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The affected tissue was cut out from his leg. 他腿部有病的组织被切除了。</font>\n<br>2. miss out; omit 删除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better cut out that sentence. 你最好把那个句子删掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's cut out the unimportant details. 我们把不重要的细节删掉吧。</font>\n<br>3. refrain from; stop doing sth. 戒掉；停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has decided to cut out smoking and drinking. 他已经决定戒掉烟酒。</font>\n<br>4. outrival; replace 胜过；取代；把…排挤掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new supermarket will cut all the small shops out. 这家新超级市场将会把这些小店全都挤垮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has managed to cut out his rival and marry the girl. 他终于挤掉了竞争者而娶了那个姑娘。</font>\n<br>5. stop operating suddenly and unexpectedly 出乎预料地突然停止运转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As our engine suddenly cut out in the way we had to walk. 因为发动机在半路上突然出了毛病，我们只好下车步行。</font>\n<br>6. shape sth. by cutting 裁剪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor cut out my coat very well. 裁缝把我的上衣裁得很好。</font>\n
cut out for/cut out to be	<font color=blue size=4>cut out for/cut out to be</font>\n<br>be naturally wellsuited for; have talent for; fit for 天生地适合做；有…的天才\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I doubt whether John is cut out for a doctor. 我怀疑约翰是否适合当医生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think she's cut out to be a nurse. 我认为她适合当护士。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sure he'd make a good journalist; he seems to be cut out for the job. 我相信他会成为一个出色的新闻记者，他似乎有这方面的天才。</font>\n
cut short	<font color=blue size=4>cut short</font>\n<br>1. stop or interrupt suddenly 突然停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their conversation was cut short by the telephone ringing. 他们的谈话被电话铃声打断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was about to go on talking when his mother cut him short. 他正要继续讲下去，他妈妈打断了他。</font>\n<br>2. make shorter 停止；缩短\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll have to cut our visit short, as we want to get back before dark. 我们必须缩短访问时间，因为天黑前还得赶回去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His life was cut short by cancer. 癌症过早地结束了他的生命。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you anything more to say, please cut it short as your time is nearly up. 如果你还有什么要说的话，请简短一些，因为你的时间已经快到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll cut a long story short. 我就长话短说吧。</font>\n
cut up	<font color=blue size=4>cut up</font>\n<br>1. cut into small pieces 切碎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please cut the apple up into equal pieces. 请把苹果切成大小相同的块。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cook was cutting up the meat for making jiaozi. 厨师正在切肉包饺子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor cut up a large piece of cloth to make one shirt for me and two for my son. 裁缝把一大块布裁开给我做一件衬衣，给我儿子做两件。</font>\n<br>2. wound 受伤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her face was badly cut up in the car crash. 她的面部在车祸中严重受伤。</font>\n<br>3. cause suffering to hurt the feeling of; upset 使痛心；使难过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was very cut up about her father's death. 她父亲的去世使她悲痛万分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was badly cut up when his girlfriend gave him back his ring. 当女朋友还给他戒指时，这男孩非常伤心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no need to be so cut up at not succeeding this time. 不必因这次没成功就这样难过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This news has cut him up. 这消息使他心烦意乱。</font>\n<br>4. attack; criticize 攻击；批评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His book was severely cut up by the critics. 他的书遭到评论家的严厉批评。</font>\n<br>5. behave in a comic, boisterous or unruly manner 行为滑稽；吵吵闹闹；不守规矩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys cut up when the old folks were away. 大人一走开，孩子们就开始胡闹起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the party they cut up and broke the chairs. 他们在晚会上胡闹并把椅子弄坏了。</font>\n<br>6. destroy or severely damage 严重破坏；毁坏；受伤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The machine guns cut up the enemy like knives. 机关枪象刀子一样切入敌军心脏摧毁了敌军。</font>\n
damp down	<font color=blue size=4>damp down</font>\n<br>1. make (a fire) burn more slowly 减弱（火势）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She damped the fire down for the night. 她把炉火封上过夜。</font>\n<br>2. make sad or dull 使沮丧；使扫兴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing could damp down his spirits. 任何事情都不能破坏他的兴致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Difficulties and failures did not damp down his enthusiasm. 困难和失败都没有挫伤他的积极性。</font>\n<br>3. diminish 减少；缩小\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Inflation is being damped down. 通货膨涨的势头正在被抑制。</font>\n
dam up	<font color=blue size=4>dam up</font>\n<br>1. seal with a dam; hold back by means of a dam 筑坝拦水\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have dammed up the valley and built a reservoir. 他们已经在山谷里筑了坝，建造了水库。</font>\n<br>2. hold back; restrain (a feeling, etc.) 抑制（感情等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She not only did her best to dam up her sorrows, but went in for her work even more energetically than ever before. 她不仅竭力抑制内心的悲痛，而且以更加充沛的精力投入了工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dammed up his fury until he could no longer remain silent. 他一直到忍无可忍时才大发雷霆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should do our best to dam up inflation. 我们应尽一切努力来制止通货膨涨。</font>\n
dash down	<font color=blue size=4>dash down</font>\n<br>1. throw down voilently 猛摔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dashed the cup down in his anger. 他一怒之下摔了茶杯。</font>\n<br>2. move quickly down or along 沿着…飞奔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horses dashed down the hill. 这些马从山上飞奔而下。</font>\n
dash off	<font color=blue size=4>dash off</font>\n<br>1. hurry away; rush off violently 匆匆离去；猛冲而去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has dashed off to London on an urgent business. 他因急事匆忙赶往伦敦去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must dash off now. 我必须立刻离开。</font>\n<br>2. write or draw very quickly 匆忙完成；草就\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dashed off the article before supper. 他在晚饭前匆忙完成了这篇文章。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I just dash off a letter to him. 我要给他赶写一封信。</font>\n
date from/date back to	<font color=blue size=4>date from/date back to</font>\n<br>1. have existed since; go back to; trace back to 始于（某一历史时期）；源于；追溯到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Insurance dates from the 17th century. 保险始于17世纪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The castle dates back to the 14th century. 这城堡建于14世纪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The custom dates back to the time of the Roman Empire. 这种风俗可以回溯到古罗马时期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The traditional friendship between our two peoples dates back to ancient days. 我们两国人民之间的传统友谊可以追溯到遥远的过去。</font>\n<br>2. be addressed from a place（信）由某处寄出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The letter dates from New York. 这封信是从纽约寄来的。</font>\n
dawn on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>dawn on/upon</font>\n<br>become gradually known to 逐渐明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It dawned upon us that he was unwilling to help. 我们逐渐明白了，他是不愿意帮助的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It suddenly dawned on her that her youth was gone. 她突然意识到，自己的青春时光已经一去不复返了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The truth finally dawned on him. 他终于开始明白事情真相了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The idea suddenly dawned upon me. 我突然想到了那个念头。</font>\n
day after day	<font color=blue size=4>day after day</font>\n<br>every day 日复一日；每天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has to work from morning till night day after day. 他每天不得不从早干到晚。</font>\n
day by day	<font color=blue size=4>day by day</font>\n<br>day after day; each day 每天；一天天地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Day by day, he seems to grow a little stronger. 他似乎一天一天地长强壮起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather is getting warmer and warmer day by day. 天气一天一天地变暖和了。</font>\n
day in and day out	<font color=blue size=4>day in and day out</font>\n<br>day after day; continuously 日复一日地；每天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Day in and day out he gave the same excuse for his laziness. 他日复一日地以同样的借口为他的懒惰开脱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I dislike my neighbours because day in and day out they play their stereo loudly. 我不喜欢我的邻居，因为他们每天把音响开得声音很大。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always works day in and day out in one week, so Sundays are the only free days he has. 他一周内不停地工作，因此只有星期日才有空。</font>\n
deal in	<font color=blue size=4>deal in</font>\n<br>1. trade in; buy and sell 做买卖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new shop deals in woolen goods. 这家新商店经营毛织品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The garage deals in gasoline, machine oil, tires, etc. 这家汽车修理厂经销汽油、机油和车胎等商品。</font>\n<br>2. be engaged in; be busy with 从事；忙于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She deals in foreign affairs. 她从事外交活动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She deals in gossip and slander. 她常搬弄是非和造谣中伤。</font>\n
deal with	<font color=blue size=4>deal with</font>\n<br>1. treat; take actions about; be concerned with 处理；对付；论述；涉及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man is hard to deal with. 这个人很难对付。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is becoming increasingly difficult to deal with the problems of traffic in big cities. 对付大城市的交通问题变得日益困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His latest work deals with the Second World War. 他的新书的内容是关于第二次世界大战。</font>\n<br>2. have a relationship with sb. , esp. in business matters 与…有来往；与…有生意来往\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been dealing with this shop for twenty years. 他同这家商店打了20年交道。</font>\n
decide against	<font color=blue size=4>decide against</font>\n<br>make a decision not in favour of 决定不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have decided against going far away in summer vacation. 暑假我决定不出远门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government has decided against increasing taxes. 政府决定不增加税款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The court decided the case against the plaintiff. 那法院的判决对原告不利。</font>\n
decide on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>decide on/upon</font>\n<br>make a choice or decision after consideration 经考虑后选定或决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee has decided on the prizewinning students. 委员会已经选定了获奖的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't decide on important matters too quickly. 重要的事情不要匆忙做决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided upon adjourning the session. 他们决定休会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as they decided on the plan, they took action. 他们一旦确定了计划就立即行动。</font>\n
deck out/up	<font color=blue size=4>deck out/up</font>\n<br>decorate; dress 装饰；打扮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's all decked out and ready to go. 她已打扮好，准备出门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The park was decked up with banners and coloured lights. 公园里装饰了旗帜和彩灯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the Spring Festival children are decked out in their finest clothes. 春节孩子们都穿上了最漂亮的衣服。</font>\n
declare off	<font color=blue size=4>declare off</font>\n<br>make a formal announcement to break off; withdraw from a promise, etc. 宣布取消；取消允诺等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Unfortunately, their engagement was declared off. 很遗憾，他们的婚约已宣布解除。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What a pity they declared off the agreement they had come to only after great effort. 太遗憾了，他们经过努力达成的协议被宣布无效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The match was declared off. 比赛取消了。</font>\n
dedicate to	<font color=blue size=4>dedicate to</font>\n<br>1. give oneself completely to 献身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She dedicated her life to the cause of education. 她把毕生的精力献给了教育事业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dedicated all his life to the liberation and prosperity of the Chinese nation. 他把一生都献给了中华民族的解放和富强。</font>\n<br>2. write in honour of 将书题献给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The writer dedicated the book to her father. 作者谨以此书献给她父亲。</font>\n
deduce from	<font color=blue size=4>deduce from</font>\n<br>arrive at (knowledge, a theory, etc.) by reasoning 推理；推想；演绎出（知识理论）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can deduce the development of a culture from archaeological remains. 我们可以根据古迹推断出一种文化的发展。</font>\n
defer to	<font color=blue size=4>defer to</font>\n<br>yield to; show reapect towards 顺从；尊敬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall defer to your advice, which has always been helpful. 我将遵从你的建议，它总是很有帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all defer to him in these matters. 这类事情上我们都听他的意见。</font>\n
deliberate on/over/upon	<font color=blue size=4>deliberate on/over/upon</font>\n<br>consider; think over carefully 仔细考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are still deliberating over the matter. 我们仍在仔细考虑这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have deliberated on your proposal. 我们对你的建议已经仔细考虑了。</font>\n
delight in	<font color=blue size=4>delight in</font>\n<br>take great pleasure in 喜爱；取乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary delights in her new house. 玛丽非常喜爱她的新居。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always delights in doing good. 他总喜欢做好事。</font>\n
deliver over/up	<font color=blue size=4>deliver over/up</font>\n<br>hand over 移交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The former secretary delivered all the files over to his successor. 前任秘书把所有的公文箱移交给他的接班人了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's delivering over the post now. 他正在办理移交手续。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We delivered the thief over to the police. 我们把小偷交给了警察。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief delivered himself up to the police. 那个小偷向警察自首。</font>\n
deny oneself	<font color=blue size=4>deny oneself</font>\n<br>be unselfish in not having sth. 克己；自律；放弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By denying herself, Mother gave the children a good education. 母亲含辛茹苦，使孩子们受到良好的教育。</font>\n
depart from	<font color=blue size=4>depart from</font>\n<br>1. leave; die 离开；去世\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus departs from Nanjing at 6：00 in the morning. 汽车早上6点从南京开出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mother departed from life last month. 他的母亲上个月去世了。</font>\n<br>2. act in a different way from; deviate from 违反；不合；偏离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What she did departed from what she said. 她做的与说的对不上号。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your composition departed from the main theme. 你的作文偏离主题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They applied the new method which departed from the old one in many respects and achieved desirable results. 他们采用了一种新方法，与旧方法在许多方面不一样，因而取得了预想的结果。</font>\n
dependent on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>dependent on/upon</font>\n<br>depending on; relying on 依赖；依靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Promotion is dependent upon your record of success. 晋级的依据是你的业绩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am not dependent on my parents for money. 我在经济上不依靠父母。</font>\n
depend on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>depend on/upon</font>\n<br>1. rely on; rest upon 依靠；依赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She depended entirely on her father. 她完全靠她父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His success depends chiefly on himself. 他的成功主要靠他自己。</font>\n<br>2. vary according to; be influenced or decided by 视…而定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whether the game will be played depends on the weather. 比赛是否举行要视天气而定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The development of things depends fundamentally on internal causes. 事物的发展基本上是由内因决定的。</font>\n
deprive of	<font color=blue size=4>deprive of</font>\n<br>cause to be without 剥夺；夺去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't deprive her of her rights. 你不能剥夺她的权利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner was deprived of the right to defend himself. 那名囚徒被剥夺了为自己辩护的权利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many children are deprived of good education simply because they are born in remote villages. 许多孩子没有受到良好的教育，只是因为他们出生在偏僻的乡村。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The failure deprived the physician of his popularity. 失败使那位医生名誉扫地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lung cancer deprived him of his life. 肺癌夺去了他的生命。</font>\n
derive from	<font color=blue size=4>derive from</font>\n<br>1. get from 从…得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We derive happiness from good health. 有健康的身体就能得到幸福。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She derives great pleasure from reading. 她从阅读中得到许多乐趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't find any substitutes for the personal satisfaction derived from work. 我从工作中得到的自我满足是无法用其它东西来替代的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can derive the meaning from the context. 我们能从上下文推出含意。</font>\n<br>2. have its origin in; come from 起源于；出自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The word“grammar”is derived from ancient Greek. 英语“grammar”这个词源于古希腊文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These raisins derive from Xinjiang and taste delicious. 这些葡萄干产自新疆，味道很美。</font>\n
descend from	<font color=blue size=4>descend from</font>\n<br>1. go or come down from 从…下来；传下来；遗传\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He descended from the tower. 他从塔上下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ring has descended from her grandmother. 这枚戒指是她祖母传下来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sword descends from the Tang dynasty. 这把剑是从唐朝传下来的。</font>\n<br>2. have one's family origin in; originate from 是…的后裔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He claimed to have descended from the royal family. 他自称是王族之后。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>According to the Bible, we have all descended from Adam. 按照《圣经》上的说法，我们都是亚当的后裔。</font>\n
descend on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>descend on/upon</font>\n<br>attack suddenly; visit unexpectedly 突然拜访；突然袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thieves descended on the travellers and took their money. 盗贼出其不意地袭击旅行者，抢走了他们的钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy descended upon the village at midnight. 敌人在午夜突然袭击了这个小村庄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My two old friends descended on me at Christmas. 我的两个老朋友在圣诞节突然来看望我。</font>\n
desirous of	<font color=blue size=4>desirous of</font>\n<br>having a desire for 渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is desirous of comfort and understanding. 她渴望安慰和理解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is desirous of fame and gain. 他追求名和利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is desirous of obtaining a position in the management. 他渴望在经理部谋得一个职位。</font>\n
despair of	<font color=blue size=4>despair of</font>\n<br>1. be without hope of 绝望；丧失信心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't despair of success; where there is a will, there is a way. 别对成功悲观失望，有志者事竟成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He despaired of winning the game. 他丧失了赢得这场比赛的信心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient's life was despaired of. 这个病人没有救活的希望。</font>\n<br>2. feel very anxious about 非常担忧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She despairs of her son. 她为她儿子担心。</font>\n
destined for	<font color=blue size=4>destined for</font>\n<br>1. intended for 预定；指定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book is destined for the firstyear students. 这本书是指定给一年级学生读的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That room is destined for the reception of foreign visitors. 那间房被指定作为接待外宾用。</font>\n<br>2. bound for; headed for （船等）开往\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship is destined for Hong Kong. 这艘船开往香港。</font>\n
destitute of	<font color=blue size=4>destitute of</font>\n<br>lacking in; without 无；缺乏…的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cruel ruler was destitute of human feeling. 那个暴君毫无人性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He found himself destitute of all means of subsistence. 他发现自己缺乏任何谋生的手段。</font>\n
detrimental to	<font color=blue size=4>detrimental to</font>\n<br>harmful to; causing damage to 对…有害\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lack of sleep is detrimental to one's health. 睡眠不足有害健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Overwork is detrimental to one's health. 过度劳累对健康有害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your criticism could prove detrimental to his success. 你的批评对他的成功可能不利。</font>\n
devote to	<font color=blue size=4>devote to</font>\n<br>give (oneself, one's time, etc.) freely to; dedicate to 致力于；献身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has devoted herself to the medical science. 她一直致力于医学研究。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young doctor devoted himself to helping the poor and the sick. 这位年轻的医生致力于帮助穷人和病人。</font>\n
die away	<font color=blue size=4>die away</font>\n<br> (of sound, wind, light) become weaker or fainter until it ceases 渐渐消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The noise of the plane died away in the distance. 飞机的声音渐渐地在远方消逝了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sound of the music died away. 音乐声渐渐消失了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The colors of the sunset died away. 落日的余晖消失了。</font>\n
die down	<font color=blue size=4>die down</font>\n<br>become more quiet; decrease; lose force; lessen in intensity 减弱；逐渐消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The loud music died down after the police came. 警察来后，吵闹的音乐声变小了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My anger at him has died down since he apologized to me. 他向我道了歉，我对他的气也就消了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The room seemed warm enough so we let the fire die down. 这房间似乎够暖和了，因此我们把火弄小了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After John left, the party died down. 约翰走后，晚会的气氛就减弱了。</font>\n
die from	<font color=blue size=4>die from</font>\n<br>die owing to (a wound, weakness, etc.) 死于（负伤，衰弱等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man died from the snake's biting. 那人死于蛇咬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldier died from the serious wounds. 那个士兵严重受伤而死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse died from overwork. 那匹马累死了。</font>\n
die of	<font color=blue size=4>die of</font>\n<br>die because of (illness, hunger, grief, etc.) 因（疾病、饥饿、悲伤等）而死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She died of cancer two years ago. 她两年前死于癌症。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Of what disease did the man die? 那个人死于何病？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a severe winter, many wild animals can die of hunger. 在寒冷的冬天，许多野生动物可能会饿死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She died of grief soon after her husband's death. 丈夫去世后不久，她因过度悲伤而死去了。</font>\n
die off	<font color=blue size=4>die off</font>\n<br>1. (a group of living things) die one by one 相继死去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chickens are all dying off from the disease. 小鸡一个个地病死了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leaves of this plant are dying off. 这植物的叶子正在凋落。</font>\n<br>2. become extinct 绝种\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It would be a pity if these birds are allowed just to die off. 如果让这些鸟绝种，那就太可惜了。</font>\n
die out	<font color=blue size=4>die out</font>\n<br>cease to exist; disappear gradually and completely 灭绝；消亡；渐渐完全消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many old customs are gradually dying out. 许多旧习俗正在日渐消失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If too many of these rare animals are killed, their kind will die out. 这种稀有动物如遭大规模的捕杀就可能灭绝。</font>\n
different from/than	<font color=blue size=4>different from/than</font>\n<br>unlike; not of the same kind as 和…有区别；与…不同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This novel is different from that one in both style and content. 无论在文体或内容方面，这部小说和那部小说都不同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is very different from her sister. 她与她妹妹大不一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is different from what he was ten years ago. 他已不再是10年前的他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How different life today is than what it was fifty years ago！今天的生活与50年前的生活多么不一样啊！</font>\n
differ from	<font color=blue size=4>differ from</font>\n<br>1. be different from 与…不同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The orange differs from the potato in nearly every way. 桔子和土豆几乎在各方面都不相同。</font>\n<br>2. disagree with 与…意见不同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I differ from him on/about the matter. 我在这个问题上同他意见不一致。</font>\n
dig in	<font color=blue size=4>dig in</font>\n<br>1. work hard; begin to work 勤勉工作；努力干；开始干起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son dug in and finished his homework very quickly. 我儿子很认真，很快就把家庭作业做完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you expect to finish all this work in two hours, you'd better dig in. 如果你想在两小时之内完成这项工作，就得马上干起来。</font>\n<br>2. begin eating with appetite 津津有味地开始吃起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys dug in ravenously. 男孩们开始狼吞虎咽地吃起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dinner's ready. Dig in, everybody！晚餐已准备好了，大家吃吧！</font>\n<br>3. protect oneself by digging a trench, etc. ; cover by digging 挖壕沟等以藏身；把…埋在土里\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company commander ordered his soldiers to dig themselves in. 连长命令战士们挖战壕，以便掩蔽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers have dug in along the river. 士兵们沿河边挖了战壕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dig this chemical in and crops will grow faster. 把这化肥埋进土壤里，庄稼就会长得更快。</font>\n<br>4. establish oneself firmly in a position, etc. 巩固自己的地位等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been working in this department for ten years and he's pretty well dug himself in. 他在这个系工作已经10年了，已经站稳了脚跟。</font>\n<br>5. stick to one's own idea 坚持自己的意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When facts have shown that you are mistaken, you mustn't dig in. 当事实已经证明你错了，你就不应该再坚持自己的意见。</font>\n
dig into	<font color=blue size=4>dig into</font>\n<br>1. eat heartily; eat with appetite 痛快地吃；大吃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were so hungry that as soon as supper was served, they dug into it hungrily. 他们饿极了，晚饭一端上桌，他们就狼吞虎咽地大吃起来。</font>\n<br>2. delve into; investigate thoroughly 努力钻研；彻底调查研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he digs into a problem he does not give up until he gets to the bottom. 他要是钻研一个问题，就非弄个水落石出不可。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The detectives are digging into this whole business. 侦探们正在彻底地调查整个事件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is digging into Chinese history. 他正研究中国历史。</font>\n<br>3. apply oneself to 集中精力做；全力以赴地干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They dug into their work with a will. 他们全力以赴地工作。</font>\n<br>4. make inroads on (savings, etc.) 侵占；动用（积蓄等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were forced to dig into savings to pay their current debts. 他们被迫动用存款偿付债务。</font>\n
dig out	<font color=blue size=4>dig out</font>\n<br>1. remove by digging; discover by digging 挖走；发掘出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gardener dug out the weeds. 园林工人铲除了杂草。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are digging out a large ancient tomb. 他们正在发掘一座古墓。</font>\n<br>2. make bg digging 挖；掘成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are digging out a tunnel. 他们正在挖一条地道。</font>\n<br>3. release; rescue by digging 通过挖掘救出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was buried under the avalanche and had to be dug out. 他被埋在雪堆中，必须把他救出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rescuers managed to dig out the trapped miners. 救护人员设法挖出了困在矿下的工人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people are still being dug out of the ruins of the building. 人们仍在挖掘压在建筑物废墟里的一些人。</font>\n<br>4. find out; obtain 发现；取得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Through investigation they have dug out all the facts. 通过调查，他们已弄清了所有事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where on earth did yod dig out these old clothes? 你究意是从哪儿翻到这些旧衣服的？</font>\n
dig up	<font color=blue size=4>dig up</font>\n<br>1. bring to light by digging what has been buried or hidden 因挖掘而发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An old Greek statue was dug up here last month. 上个月这里挖出了一座古希腊雕像。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The archaeologists have dug up a remarkable collection of historical relics. 考古工作者发掘出一大批历史文物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These relics were dug up last year. 这些文物是去年出土的。</font>\n<br>2. make a money contribution 出钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all dug up to keep the poor on relief last month. 上个月我们大家都出钱救济穷人。</font>\n<br>3. find or get sth. with some effort 发现；找到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl dug up some useful material for her English composition. 这女孩为写她的英文作文找到了一些有用的数据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspaper loves to dig up scandals. 报纸喜欢揭露丑闻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always manages to dig up a fresh excuse for being late. 他总能为他的迟到找到这样那样的新借口。</font>\n<br>4. break up (land) by digging; remove from the ground by digging 翻土；自地上挖掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are digging up land for a new garden. 他们正在翻土建一个新花园。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They want to dig these trees up to make the street wider. 他们想把这些树挖掉拓宽街道。</font>\n
dilate on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>dilate on/upon</font>\n<br>speak or write comprehensively about 详述（说或写）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there were time, I could dilate upon this subject. 假如有时间，我会对此题目加以详述的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctors are dilating on the rare case. 大夫们正在讨论这个罕见的病例。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher dilated on this sentence structure in class. 老师在班上对这个句子结构详细讲解了。</font>\n
dip into	<font color=blue size=4>dip into</font>\n<br>read or study for a short time or without much attention 浏览；稍加研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have only dipped into the book but I find quite interesting. 我只是浏览了一下这本书，不过我发现它相当有趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some books are to be read seriously, others to be dipped into. 有些书要认真阅读，另一些书浏览一下就行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've only dipped into ancient history. 我对古代史仅仅有点粗浅的研究。</font>\n
disappointed about/at/in	<font color=blue size=4>disappointed about/at/in</font>\n<br>unhappy at sth.;not seeing hopes come true 对某事感到失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt very much disappointed at his failure to pass the examination. 他对考试不及格感到非常沮丧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you looking so disappointed about? 什么事使你显得如此失望？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were disappointed in our hopes. 我们的希望落空了。</font>\n
disappointed with	<font color=blue size=4>disappointed with</font>\n<br>unhappy／unsatisfied with sb. or sth. 对某人或某事感到失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is quite disappointed with his secretary. 他对他的秘书感到很失望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am very disappointed with my new bicycle. 我对我的新自行车感到很失望。</font>\n
disapprove of	<font color=blue size=4>disapprove of</font>\n<br>1. refuse to agree to 不赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack's father disapproved of his marriage to Jane. 杰克的父亲不赞成他与简的婚姻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I disapprove of your method. 我不赞成你的方法。</font>\n<br>2. dislike 不喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I disapprove of his way of dealing with others. 我不喜欢他的处世方法。</font>\n
discharge from	<font color=blue size=4>discharge from</font>\n<br>send away or allow to leave 使免除；使解脱；使离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since you were caught helping the thieves, I have no choice but to discharge you from my service. 既然你被抓住助贼盗物，我就不得不将你开除了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her father was discharged from the hospital three weeks after the operation. 他父亲手术后3个月就出院了。</font>\n<br>discourage from try to prevent sb. from doing sth. by persuading him that it is not a good idea, or by making it seem difficult 劝阻；使不敢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father discouraged him from gambling. 父亲劝他不要赌博。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing can discourage him from attaining his goal. 什么也不能阻止他去实现自己的目标。</font>\n
discriminate against	<font color=blue size=4>discriminate against</font>\n<br>treat unfairly, as less important or worthy 歧视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is unjust and unlawful to discriminate against people of other races. 歧视别的种族是不公正的，不合法的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Laws do not discriminate against anyone. 法律面前人人平等。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have no right to discriminate against him. 你没有权利歧视他。</font>\n
discriminate from	<font color=blue size=4>discriminate from</font>\n<br>tell from; distinguish 把…同…区分开来；辨别；区分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some children can't discriminate good books from bad ones. 一些孩子不能辨别好书和坏书。</font>\n
disgusted with/at	<font color=blue size=4>disgusted with/at</font>\n<br>having a strong feeling of dislike for 厌恶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am completely disgusted with his rude behaviour and affectation. 我非常厌恶他的粗野和做作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were disgusted at what we heard and saw here. 我们对这里的所见所闻感到厌恶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are disgusted with bribery and corruption. 我们厌恶行贿和腐败。</font>\n
dish out	<font color=blue size=4>dish out</font>\n<br>1. serve out in a dish or dishes 用盘上菜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is busy dishing out food to the guests. 她正忙着给客人们端饭菜。</font>\n<br>2. distribute; provide 分配；提供\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government dishes out payments to people without jobs. 政府给失业的人发钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher dished out the new books to the students in class. 老师在课堂上给学生发新书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The corrupt politician dished out titles and honours to his friends and supporters, many of whom were quite undeserving. 那个腐败的政客给他的朋友和支持者封官许愿，他们当中有许多人根本就不配。</font>\n
dish up	<font color=blue size=4>dish up</font>\n<br>1. serve up in a dish 用盘子端上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She dished up a roast turkey. 她端上一盘烤火鸡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The food was dished up when the guests arrived. 客人来时，饭菜都盛好端上来了。</font>\n<br>2. prepare; serve up facts, arguments 准备并提出事实等论据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dished up a lot of useful facts and figures. 他提供了许多有用的事实和数据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can dish up the story in a humorous way. 她能幽默地把这故事讲得娓娓动听。</font>\n
dismiss from	<font color=blue size=4>dismiss from</font>\n<br>make sb. leave; send away from one's employment 解雇；解职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The officer was dismissed from the service for neglect of duty. 这位官员因玩忽职守而被撤职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The clerk was dismissed from the factory for stealing bikes. 那个职员因偷盗自行车被工厂开除了。</font>\n
dispense with	<font color=blue size=4>dispense with</font>\n<br>1. choose to do without 不用；无需\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can dispense with his help. 我们不需要他的帮助。</font>\n<br>2. get rid of 免除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's dispense with all the formalities and begin our meeting at once. 让我们免去繁文褥节，立即开会吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The conveyer belt has enabled the workers to dispense with the lifting of the parts by hand. 传送带解除了工人们用手工传送零件之苦。</font>\n
disposed to	<font color=blue size=4>disposed to</font>\n<br>having a tendency to; inclined to 易于；有…倾向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some children are disposed to tell lies. 有些孩子会说谎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am disposed to agree with her. 我倾向于同意她的观点。</font>\n
dispose of	<font color=blue size=4>dispose of</font>\n<br>1. sell 卖掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have too much furniture; let's dispose of the old chairs. 我们家具太多了，把这些旧椅子卖掉吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He disposed of his house for100, 000 yuan. 他以10万人民币的价格卖掉了房子。</font>\n<br>2. get rid of; throw away 处理掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please dispose of the waste paper. 请把这些废纸处理掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor asked him to drink plenty of water to dispose of the sideeffects of the medicine. 医生要他多喝水以去掉药物的副作用。</font>\n<br>3. eat or drink until it is finished 吃光；喝光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children disposed of all the food their mother had prepared for them. 孩子们把母亲所准备的食物都吃光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He disposed of 10 dishes and 5bottles of beer in a very short time. 他很快就吃完了10盘菜，喝完了5瓶啤酒。</font>\n<br>4. handle; deal with; settle 处理；解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee disposed of all its business in an hour. 委员会在一小时内就把所有事情处理完毕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He disposed of all the difficulties and succeeded at last. 他排除了所有的困难，最后终于成功了。</font>\n

distinguish from	<font color=blue size=4>distinguish from</font>\n<br>1. tell one thing from another 辨别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Elephants are distinguished from other animals by their long noses. 大象同其它动物的区别之处是象的鼻子长。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must learn to distinguish friends from enemies. 我们要学会分清敌我。</font>\n<br>2. show the difference between 区别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't distinguish right from wrong. 他是非不明。</font>\n

do away with	<font color=blue size=4>do away with</font>\n<br>1. abolish; get rid of; put an end to 废除；去掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teachers want to do away with cheating in the school. 老师们想在学校里消灭作弊现象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have done away with the old laws. 他们废除了旧法律。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you do away with your bad habit? 你能改掉坏习惯吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must do away with all manifestations of disunity. 我们一定要消除一切不团结的现象。</font>\n<br>2. murder 谋杀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is said that they will do away with him by poisoning him. 据说他们会用毒药把他干掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did away with his enemies. 他杀死了他的敌人。</font>\n
do for	<font color=blue size=4>do for</font>\n<br>1. be suitable for 适合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coat will do for Alice. 这种上衣艾丽丝穿合适。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You won't do for a teacher. 你不适合当教师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These shoes won't do for mountainclimbing. 这种鞋子爬山不行。</font>\n<br>2. serve the purpose of 用作；充任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The box will have to do for a desk until the furniture arrives. 家具来到之前，这个箱子就得当作书桌用了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This place will do for a gymnasium. 这个地方可以做体育馆用。</font>\n<br>3. care for; attend to 照料；帮…做事；替…管家\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Black has been doing for the manager for ten years. 布莱克夫人为经理料理家务已经10年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Wang did for me during my illness. 我生病时王太太照应我。</font>\n<br>4. kill; murder; destroy 杀死；杀害\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said that he would do for the policeman when he got out of prison. 他说他出狱后要干掉那个警察。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry received a blow on the head that I thought had done for him. 亨利头上挨了一下子，我想这下子已经送了他的命。</font>\n<br>5. ruin; finish off; destroy 破坏；毁掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The severe storm did for most of the farm buildings. 猛烈的风暴摧毁了大部分农舍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our team is done for. 我们的队完蛋了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My camera is almost done for. 我的照相机差不多坏了。</font>\n<br>6. wear out entirely 极其疲乏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the end of a long day's hard work I'm just about done for. 苦干一整天下来，我几乎累垮了。</font>\n<br>7. manage to solve or obtain 设法解决或得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you do for food during your camping trip? 你们野营时是怎样设法弄到食物的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What will you do for water while you're crossing the desert? 你们穿越沙漠时将如何解决水的问题呢？</font>\n
do in	<font color=blue size=4>do in</font>\n<br>1. murder; kill; cheat 谋杀；杀死；欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her neighbour tried to do himself in by taking poison. 她的邻居企图服毒自杀。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminals have done in the old man. 罪犯们已把那个老人杀害了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to do her in, but luckily she escaped. 他企图害死她，但她很幸运地脱险了。</font>\n<br>2. exhausted; destroyed 精疲力竭；搞坏；毁坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse was done in after the race. 那匹马在竞赛后已精疲力竭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt done in after a long day's hard work. 苦干了一整天我感到疲惫不堪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This hard work did them in. 干这么重的活，他们累坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His business was done in by a big fire. 他的商行给一场大火烧毁了。</font>\n
do justice to	<font color=blue size=4>do justice to</font>\n<br>1. treat in a fair way; show the true value of 公平对待；公正地评判\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should do justice to everyone. 我们应该公正地对待每个人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To do him justice, he has done something valuable for the Chinese revolution. 公平地说，他为中国革命做过一些有价值的工作。</font>\n<br>2. be very much alike 酷似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The photograph does justice to her. 这幅照片极象她。</font>\n<br>3. eat to one's full 饱餐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children did justice to the good dishes. 菜不错，孩子们饱餐了一顿。</font>\n
