do over	<font color=blue size=4>do over</font>\n<br>1. do again; repeat 重做；重复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The secretary did the work poorly, so her boss told her to do it over. 秘书把这工作做得太差，因此老板要她重做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please do over yesterday's assignment. 请把昨天的作业重做一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do your homework over; it is full of mistakes. 把家庭作业重做一遍，错误太多了。</font>\n<br>2. renovate; redecorate 装修；重新装饰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't like the colour of the wall, you'd better do the room over. 如果你不喜欢墙壁的颜色，你最好把房间再刷一次。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The redecorating company did my whole house over. 装修公司把我的家重新装修了一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After being done over, the room really looks much nicer. 房间重新装饰后，确实变得好看多了。</font>\n
do sba good turn	<font color=blue size=4>do sba good turn</font>\n<br>be helpful to sb.;perform a good deed to sb. 对（某人）有帮助；对（某人）做一件好事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They did him a good turn by lending him the money during the crisis. 他们在危机中把钱借给他，帮了他大忙。</font>\n<br>do (sb.) good／do good to (sb.) be beneficial to sb. 对（某人）有益处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Outdoor sports will do you good. 室外运动对你健康有益。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know what good that would do? 我不明白那样有什么好处？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine does good to your headache. 这种药对治疗你的头痛很有用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What good would it do to blame others? 埋怨别人有什么好处？</font>\n<br>do (sb.) harm／do harm to (sb.) cause injury 对（某人）有害\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A few drinks will do you no harm. 稍微喝几杯对你不会有害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leave it alone for a time, talking about it may do harm. 把这事搁一段时间，现在谈论这事没有好处。</font>\n

double up	<font color=blue size=4>double up</font>\n<br>1. fold as in half 折迭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mat is too thick to double up. 床垫太厚了，迭不起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doubled the blanket up. 她迭起了毯子。</font>\n<br>2. bend, as with pain, laughter, etc. （疼得或笑得）弯腰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They doubled up with laughter. 他们笑得直不起腰来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The impact of the blow doubled him up. 这一拳打得他弯了腰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was hit by the baseball and doubled up with pain. 他被棒球打中，痛得直不起腰来。</font>\n<br>3. share one room 在一个房间共同生活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“You two will have to double up tonight. ”“We don't mind doubling up. ”“今晚你们俩只好挤在一起住了。”“我们不在乎挤在一起。”</font>\n<br>4. hurry up 快跑，赶快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come on, you fellows. Double up. 来吧，伙计们，赶快。</font>\n
doubt about/of	<font color=blue size=4>doubt about/of</font>\n<br>have doubts about 对…表示怀疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I doubt the truth of this report. 我怀疑这项报告的真实性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no reason to doubt of his honesty. 没有理由怀疑他的诚实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They never doubted of their eventual victory though they were prepared for setbacks. 虽然他们有现实遭受挫折的思想准备，但从不怀疑，他们将取得最后的胜利。</font>\n
doubtful about/of	<font color=blue size=4>doubtful about/of</font>\n<br>full of doubt 对…怀疑；不能肯定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am doubtful of the news. 我怀疑那个消息的可靠性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you doubtful of success? 你对成功有怀疑吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel doubtful about whether to go. 是否要去，我犹豫不决。</font>\n
do up	<font color=blue size=4>do up</font>\n<br>1. fasten 扎牢；扣住；扣钮扣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did up the dress. 她扣好衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please help me do up the knot. 请帮我把这个结打好。</font>\n<br>2. wrap up; pack up 包装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The books have been done up in brown paper. 这些书已经用牛皮纸包好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do up these papers and lock them in the safe. 把这些文件包装起来，锁进保险柜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please do these things up for me. 请帮我把这些东西包一包。</font>\n<br>3. repair; improve; renovate; put in better condition 维修；装修；收拾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll have to do up the old house next summer. 我们明年夏天得维修那座旧房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house needs doing up. 这房子需要修缮一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's do up this room first！我们先收拾这个房间吧！</font>\n<br>4. make oneself more beautiful 打扮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has done herself up for the party. 她把自己打扮了一番，准备参加聚会。</font>\n<br>5. wash and press 洗熨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please do up my clothes? 你给我熨一下衣服好吗？</font>\n<br>6. exhaust; make tired 疲惫不堪（多用于被动结构）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had been chairman of the meeting for five hours. He was very done up. 他主持了5个小时的会议，非常累。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were all done up after a whole day's work. 一天工作下来，他们都感到疲惫不堪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was completely done up after walking so many miles. 走了这么远的路，他简直累坏了。</font>\n
do with	<font color=blue size=4>do with</font>\n<br>1. treat; deal with 对付；处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher didn't know what to do with the naughty pupil. 教师不知道该怎样对待那个顽皮的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What will you do with these imported goods? 你们准备如何处理这些进口货？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play was terrible; half the actors didn't know what to do with their hands. 这个戏糟透了，一半的演员不知道手往哪里放。</font>\n<br>2. make do; be content with; manage with 对付用；对…满意；将就着；凑合用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will just have to do with what I've got. 我只能将就着用我现有的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you do with 500 yuan this school term? 500元钱这学期你够用吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't have tea. Can you do with a glass of water? 我们没有茶，你能凑合着喝杯水吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We couldn't afford fish, so we had to do with meat. 我们买不起鱼，只好将就吃点肉。</font>\n<br>3. tolerate; endure; put up with 容忍，忍受（跟can 或could 的否定式连用）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I just can't do with those boastful people. 我受不了那些爱吹牛的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He couldn't do with waiting any longer, so he left. 他不能忍受再等下去，因此走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't do with such carelessness. 我们不能容忍这样的粗枝大叶。</font>\n<br>4. find useful or helpful; need; want; be glad to have 需要；乐于接受（跟can 或could 搭配）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a day's hard work, he could do with a bath and a good meal. 辛苦工作了一天后，他需要洗个澡并美餐一顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Oh, I could do with a cup of tea. 哦，我想喝杯茶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your coat could do with a clean. 你的大衣需要洗一洗了。</font>\n<br>5. work with; be acquainted with 跟…打交道；相处（跟have 搭配）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't have anything to do with those people. 你不要跟那些人相处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has to do with computers. 他得跟计算器打交道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have got nothing to do with the matter. 我跟这件事一点关系也没有。</font>\n<br>6. finish 做完；干完；与…绝交（通常与have 或be 连用）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have／Are you done with the book I lent you? 我借给你的书看完了没有？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wanted to be done with it as soon as possible. 我想尽快了结这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told me that he had done with those people. 他告诉我他已不和那些人来往了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hitler, having done with his last meal, fetched Eva Braun for another and final farewell to his most intimate collaborators. 希特勒吃罢最后一餐，带着爱娃•勃劳恩，与他最密切的合作者再一次作最后告别。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have done with cigarettes. 我已经戒烟了。</font>\n
do without	<font color=blue size=4>do without</font>\n<br>manage without 没有…也行；不用…也可以\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't like it, you can just do without. 你不喜欢它可以不用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there's no suger for our coffee, we'll do without. 如果咖啡里没有糖，我们也行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can do without your advice, thank you. 谢谢你，我不需要你的劝告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one can do without sleep for very long. 没有人能长时间不睡觉。</font>\n
down on	<font color=blue size=4>down on</font>\n<br>1. angry with 对…生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father was down on him for not having passed the exam. 父亲对他考试不及格很生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director was down on Jack for being careless in his work. 杰克因工作粗心而受到主任的指责。</font>\n<br>2. opposed to 反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is down on the suggestion. 他反对这项建议。</font>\n
down with	<font color=blue size=4>down with</font>\n<br>1. ill with 患病\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't come to class because she was down with a cold. 她因患感冒而没来上课。</font>\n<br>2. get rid of 打倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Down with the laws that have kept us slaves. 打倒使我们一直当奴隶的法律。</font>\n
doze off	<font color=blue size=4>doze off</font>\n<br>fall asleep or partly asleep unintentionally 打瞌睡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man dozed off by the fire. 老人在火炉旁打瞌睡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lecture was so long and boring that most students dozed off. 演讲又长又枯燥无味以致于许多学生都打瞌睡了。</font>\n
draft out	<font color=blue size=4>draft out</font>\n<br>write out a preliminary version 起草\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drafted out his letter of resignation. 他起草了一份辞职报告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you draft out a plan for us? 你能替我们草拟一份方案吗？</font>\n
drag down	<font color=blue size=4>drag down</font>\n<br>1. make weak 使衰弱；使拖垮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His illness is dragging him down. 他的病正在把他拖垮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gambler not only destroyed himself but also dragged his family down. 赌博不仅毁了他自己而且也把他的家庭给拖垮了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The high fever has been dragging him down. 高烧使他感到虚弱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you marry that man, he'll drag you down. 如果你嫁给那个人，他会把你给毁了。</font>\n<br>2. pull down 把…拉下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief was dragged down from the platform by the students. 学生们把小偷从台上拉了下来。</font>\n
drag in	<font color=blue size=4>drag in</font>\n<br>introduce sth. unconnected with the main subject; introduce with an effort 插入讨论；硬把…拉扯进来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't drag in things that are irrelevent to the topic under discussion. 不要把与讨论无关的内容硬扯进来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whenever anyone mentions travel, she dragged in the trip to Canada she took two years ago. 不论什么时候谁谈到旅游她都要把她两年前去加拿大的旅行硬扯进来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why must you always drag this subject in when we are talking? 在我们谈话时你为什么总是把这个问题硬牵扯进来？</font>\n
drag off	<font color=blue size=4>drag off</font>\n<br>lead sb. against his will 强拉（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no good dragging your father off to the theater since he doesn't appreciate the opera. 既然你父亲不喜欢歌剧，硬拉他去戏院也没什么好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dragged off by my friend to the dance in the afternoon, I had to sit up till midnight, writing the paper. 因为下午被我朋友强拉去跳舞，所以我只好熬夜写论文。</font>\n
drag on	<font color=blue size=4>drag on</font>\n<br>last an unpleasantly long time 枯燥地拖延时间；过得很慢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert dragged on slowly for three hours. 音乐会拖延了3小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should speed up our negotiations; they have been dragging on far too long. 他们拖的时间太长了，我们得加快谈判进程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting dragged on for more than six hours. 会议拖拖拉拉开了6个多小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time drags on when you have nothing to do. 当你无事可做时，时间就过得很慢。</font>\n
drag out	<font color=blue size=4>drag out</font>\n<br>protract unduly or tediously 无缘无故地或令人讨厌地延长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dragged out his lecture until no one was listening. 他的演讲拖得太长，大家都不想听了。</font>\n
drag up	<font color=blue size=4>drag up</font>\n<br>1. pull up 把…拔出来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried every possible means to drag up the trees by the roots. 他们想尽了一切办法把这些树连根拔起。</font>\n<br>2. raise (a child) badly 把孩子胡乱拉扯大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These children seem to have been dragged up rather than brought up. 这些孩子看来是胡乱拉扯大的，没有很好地扶养。</font>\n<br>3. introduce unpleasantly 不愉快地牵扯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Must you drag up all these old scandals? 你非要把过去的这些丑事牵扯进来吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Instead of dragging up their past disputes, the two parties achieved unity through criticism and selfcriticism. 双方不是纠缠历史旧帐，而是通过批评和自我批评加强了团结。</font>\n
draw away	<font color=blue size=4>draw away</font>\n<br>1. move off; pull away 离开；拉开；引走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car drew away as we approached. 当我们走近时，车开走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The arrival of the teacher drew away the children from their play. 老师来了，孩子们不做游戏了。</font>\n<br>2. move ahead; move away from one's opponent in a race, etc. 跑到前头；在赛跑中跑到对手前面并与之拉开距离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man ran faster and faster and at last he started to draw away from others. 这位老人跑得越来越快，终于超过别人并且拉开了距离。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car was faster and soon drew away. 小车速度比较快，一会儿就跑到前面去了。</font>\n<br>3. isolate oneself 孤立自己\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has drawn away lately and we can't find out why. 她近来不跟人们来往，我们也搞不清是什么原因。</font>\n
draw back	<font color=blue size=4>draw back</font>\n<br>1. move backwards; withdraw 后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd drew back to let the firemen through. 人群向后退去，给消防队员让出一条路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children drew back from the dog when it barked at them. 孩子们当狗冲着他们叫的时候退了回来。</font>\n<br>2. be unwilling to fulfill 不愿履行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firm has drawn back from its promise. 这家公司收回了承诺。</font>\n
draw down	<font color=blue size=4>draw down</font>\n<br>1. pull down 拉下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sunlight is too strong; you'd better draw down the blinds. 阳光太强了，你最好拉下百叶窗。</font>\n<br>2. be the cause of 招致；惹起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His behaviour drew down a storm of protest from the workers. 他的行为招致了工人们的强烈抗议。</font>\n<br>3. expend 消耗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The purchasing of arms considerably drew down the country's gold reserves. 购买军备花了那个国家的大量黄金储备。</font>\n
draw forth	<font color=blue size=4>draw forth</font>\n<br>call forth 唤起；博得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An urgent need may draw forth one's latent abilities. 在紧急情况下一个人的潜在的才能会充分地发挥出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their performance drew forth applause from the audience. 他们的表演博得了观众的掌声。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her bitter cxperience drew forth people's great sympathy for her. 她的悲伤经历引起了人们的同情。</font>\n
draw in	<font color=blue size=4>draw in</font>\n<br>1. arrive; come into the station 到达；进站\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As we reached the station, the train was just drawing in. 我们到达车站时，列车刚好进站。</font>\n<br>2. bring in; attract to participate in or join; induce to enter 吸引；吸引参加；引诱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This play is drawing in large crowds every night. 这戏每天晚上都吸引着大量观众。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must draw in the broad masses to take part in the work. 我们必须吸引广大群众来参加这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner pleaded that he was drawn in to the commission of the crime. 囚犯辩解说他是受人引诱而犯罪的。</font>\n<br>3. pull in; breathe in 收进；吸入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fisherman drew in the net. 渔民把网收进来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drew in some fresh air. 他吸进一些新鲜空气。</font>\n<br>4. (the days) become shorter; be more economical（白天）变短；紧缩开支\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The days are drawing in as winter approaches. 冬季来临了，白昼渐渐变短了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must draw in a bit, although essential expenditure should not be cut. 虽然必要的开支不能削减，但是我们还是要稍为节约点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm getting short of money. I'll draw in my expenditure. 我的钱快用完了，我得要紧缩开支。</font>\n
draw on	<font color=blue size=4>draw on</font>\n<br>1. come near in time; gradually approach 接近；临近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Winter is drawing on. 冬天来临了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fateful date drew on. 决定命运的日子临近了。</font>\n<br>2. put on 穿上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Help her draw on these boots. It's raining outside. 帮她穿上靴子，外面在下雨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hastily John drew on his trousers and rushed out into the street. 约翰匆匆忙忙穿上裤子，向街上冲去。</font>\n<br>3. make use of (money, etc.); take or use as a source 利用；动用（钱等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company can draw on their vast reserves to pay for the project. 公司可以动用其雄厚的储备金来支付该工程的费用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We mustn't draw on our savings. 我们不可挪用我们的积蓄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A writer has to draw on his imagination and experience. 作家必须要利用自己的想象力和经历进行创作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She kept drawing on her bank account to such an extent that the bank soon notified her that she was overdrawn. 她不断从银行取款，不久银行就通知她透支了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fat reserves are like bank accounts to be drawn on in the winter when food supplies are limited. 脂肪储备如同银行里的存款，供冬天食物来源有限时支取使用。</font>\n<br>4. encourage; induce or make sb. continue on his course 鼓励；诱使某人继续…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Chen encouraged his students to draw on their speeches freely. 陈教授鼓励他的学生们继续自由地演讲下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She drew him on to tell her about what had happened. 她鼓励他说出所发生的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The feeling that he was near his destination drew him on. 他感到目的地在望，这鼓励他继续前进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drew the monkey on till he brought it into a trap. 他引诱猴子直到使它掉进了陷阱。</font>\n
draw out	<font color=blue size=4>draw out</font>\n<br>1. take out; pull out 取出；拉出；掏出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She drew out her wallet. 她掏出了钱包。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drew out a revolver from his pocket and aimed it at the policeman. 他从口袋里掏出一把手枪，向警察瞄准。</font>\n<br>2. prolong or stretch 拖长；拉长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director drew out his speech to almost two hours. 主任洋洋洒洒讲了将近2小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This meeting has been drawn out long enough. 这次会议拖得够长的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The singer draws her notes out too much. 唱歌者把调子拖得太长了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He heated the mental and drew it out into a long wire. 他将那金属烧热，并把它拉成一根长的金属丝。</font>\n<br>3. (of days) become longer（指白天）变长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the approach of spring the days begin to draw out quite noticeably. 随着春天来临，白天开始很明显地变长了。</font>\n<br>4. work out; formulate 拟定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee has drawn out a plan for the building of the city. 委员会已经拟定了一个城市建设规划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am drawing out a teaching plan. 我正在起草一份教学计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The general drew out his plan of action. 将军拟定了他的作战计划。</font>\n<br>5. encourage or cause to speak 鼓励或使某人说出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was very shy, but we managed to draw her out and make her tell us her fiance's name. 这女孩很害羞，但我们还是设法使她说出了未婚夫的名字。</font>\n<br>6. (a train) move away from the platform（火车）出站\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We missed the train by about a minute; it was drawing out just as we arrived on the platform. 我们大约晚了一分钟而误了火车，我们赶到月台时，火车刚刚出站。</font>\n<br>7. take money from a place of deposit 提取存款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She drew some money out from the bank to buy a bicycle for his son. 她从银行取出一些钱，给儿子买自行车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They drew their savings out before they went on holiday. 他们在度假前取出了存款。</font>\n<br>8. develop; make known or seen 阐述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher drew out the meaning of the poem to his students. 教师给学生们阐述这首诗的意义。</font>\n
draw sb's attention to	<font color=blue size=4>draw sb's attention to</font>\n<br>direct sb. 's attention to 引起…注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher was not wrong to draw the child's attention to the errors in spelling, but he should have centred on the child's ideas in composition. 这位老师要孩子注意拼写错误并不错，但是他应该把注意力集中在孩子在作文里所表达的思想上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drew my attention to a point I had overlooked. 他提醒我注意我所忽略的一点。</font>\n
draw to a close	<font color=blue size=4>draw to a close</font>\n<br>come to an end 结束；终了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The summer term is coming to a close. 夏季的这一学期就要结束了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day drew to a close. 这一天就要过去了。</font>\n
draw to/towards	<font color=blue size=4>draw to/towards</font>\n<br>1. attract towards 吸引\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has something in his character that draws people to him. 他身上有一种吸引人的东西。</font>\n<br>2. approach; come near 临近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day was drawing towards evening. 天色渐近黄昏。</font>\n
draw up	<font color=blue size=4>draw up</font>\n<br>1. prepare; compose; draft (a legal paper, contract, treaty, agreement, etc.) 草拟；制定（合同、协议等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lawyer has drawn up the agreement. 律师制订了协议书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two countries drew up a peace treaty after the war ended. 战争结束后两国签订了和平条约。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have drawn up a contract. 他们已经草拟了一份合同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan drawn up by the Party committee has been adopted at the meeting. 党委制定的计划已经在会上通过了。</font>\n<br>2. (a vehicle) come to a stop（车子）停下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police drew up outside the house. 警察在房子外面停了车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A car drew up, and a smartly dressed woman got out. 小轿车停下了，一个打扮入时的妇女下了车。</font>\n<br>3. (of troops, etc.) bring into regular order; set in line (usu. passive) （军队等）使排列整齐；列队（通常用被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole company were drawn up, prepared for battle. 全连已列好阵势，准备战斗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The troops were drawn up, ready for inspection. 士兵们站好了队，准备接受检阅。</font>\n<br>4. bring near; pull up (on to the shore, etc.) 使靠近；拖近；靠岸等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Draw up your chair and let's have a chat. 把椅子拉过来，我们聊聊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boat was drawn up. 船靠岸了。</font>\n
dream away	<font color=blue size=4>dream away</font>\n<br>pass one's time idly 虚度光阴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She dreams the time away. 她虚度时光。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go on like this, when you get old you'll regret for dreaming your life away. 如果你继续这样，当你年老时，你会因虚度年华而悔恨。</font>\n
dream of	<font color=blue size=4>dream of</font>\n<br>1. think of or imagine 想到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy dreams of becoming a pilot. 那男孩一心想当飞行员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I never dreamed of meeting you here. 我真想不到能在这儿见到你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have achieved what our forefathers never even dreamed of. 我们已经取得了我们的祖先连想都没有想过的成就。</font>\n<br>2. have a dream about 梦见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I dreamed of my hometown last night. 我昨天梦见了我的老家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you ever dream of me? 你梦见过我吗？</font>\n<br>3. have hopes for sth.;wish for sth. 希望；渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For centuries man dreamed of achieving vertical flight. 几个世纪以来，人类一直渴望达到垂直飞行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Scientists now have wonderful drugs of which no one could have drcamed years ago. 科学家现在已经掌握了几年前没有人能梦想到的灵丹妙药。</font>\n
dream up	<font color=blue size=4>dream up</font>\n<br>make up; think up; think of in imagination 构思；想出；虚构\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where did you dream up that idea? 你从哪儿想出那个主意来的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is good at dreaming up a plan which is almost impossible to be carried out. 他善于空想一个几乎总是不可能实现的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can always dream up some new reasons for not doing anything unpleasant. 她总能编出不做令人不愉快的事情的新理由。</font>\n
dress up	<font color=blue size=4>dress up</font>\n<br>1. dress formally; put on smart clothes 盛装；穿上漂亮的衣服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girls all dressed up to take part in the evening party. 姑娘们全都打扮起来去参加晚会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you going to dress up for the party? 你准备盛装赴会吗？</font>\n<br>2. make sth. or sb. seem different; disguise 化装；乔装；伪装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was dressed up to represent a flowerseller. 她把自己化装成一个卖花姑娘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoners escaped by dressing up as guards. 囚犯们伪装成哨兵逃跑了。</font>\n<br>3. improve; make sth. seem better or more important 改进；使某物看上去更好或更重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This scheme should be dressed up to look more attractive. 这个计划应该改进一下，使其更有吸引力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A fresh coat of paint will dress up the old house. 刷层新油漆会使这房子旧貌换新颜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your proposal is fine. Dress it up a bit and then send it to the committee. 你的建议不错，修改一下再交给委员会。</font>\n
drink away	<font color=blue size=4>drink away</font>\n<br>1. drink continuously 不停地喝酒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the hotel, the old man was drinking away for hours. 这位老人在旅馆里一连喝了几个小时的酒。</font>\n<br>2. relieve by taking alcoholic drink 饮酒消愁解闷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't drink your sorrow away. 借酒消愁愁更愁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to drink the memory away. 他力图借饮酒来忘却这件事。</font>\n<br>3. waste (money, time, etc.) by drinking alcohol 把（钱、时间等）浪费在饮酒上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom drank the whole of his father's fortune away. 汤姆喝光了他父亲的家当。</font>\n
drink in	<font color=blue size=4>drink in</font>\n<br>1. take in; absorb 吸收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is plenty of nitrogen in the air but it cannot be drunk in directly by the plants. 空气中有大量的氮，但是植物不能直接吸收。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thirsty plants drank in the welcome rain. 干旱的庄稼吮吸着喜人的雨水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although they are old, they drink in knowledge as young students. 虽然他们已经上了年纪，但是他们象年轻学生一样如饥似渴地吸取知识。</font>\n<br>2. listen with attention to 全神贯注地倾听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy drank in every word of the sailor's story of his adventures. 这男孩全神贯注地倾听那水手讲的冒险故事的每一句话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whenever there's any gossip in the neighbourhood, Mrs Green drinks it all in and spreads it as fast as she can. 无论什么时候，只要街坊四邻有什么闲话，格林太太总是全神贯注地听着，然后又尽可能快地张扬出去。</font>\n<br>3. take pleasure in giving one's attention to (e. g. a sight) 陶醉于；欣赏（景色等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stood on top of the hill, drinking in the beautiful view. 我们站在小山之巅，欣赏这美丽的景色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their thirsty ears drank in the delicious music. 他们如痴似醉地倾听那优美动听的音乐。</font>\n
drink to	<font color=blue size=4>drink to</font>\n<br>honour sb. with a drink 为…祝酒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's drink to the health of the host. 让我们举杯祝主人健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I propose that we drink to our success. 我提议为我们的成功而干杯。</font>\n
drive at	<font color=blue size=4>drive at</font>\n<br>try or want to say; hint at 用意所在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know what you are driving at. 我不知道你意图何在。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students didn't make out what the teacher was driving at. 学生们没有弄明白老师的意图。</font>\n
drive away	<font color=blue size=4>drive away</font>\n<br>1. leave in a vehicle 乘车离去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy began to cry when his parents drove away. 父母开车离去时，那个男孩子哭了。</font>\n<br>2. make go away 驱走；驱散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can't drive away her feelings of sadness. 她驱散不了心头的悲哀。</font>\n
drive away at	<font color=blue size=4>drive away at</font>\n<br>work very hard at (one's work, etc.) 努力做（工作等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are driving away at this subject. 我们正在埋头研究这个课题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is still driving away at the dictionary. 他仍在孜孜不倦地编那本词典。</font>\n
drive back	<font color=blue size=4>drive back</font>\n<br>force sb. to go back 击退；使…回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers drove back the enemy five times in a day. 战士们一天打退了敌人的5次进攻。</font>\n
drive crazy	<font color=blue size=4>drive crazy</font>\n<br>cause sb. to become mad 使…陷于精神错乱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This endless loud music is driving me crazy. 这种无休止的噪声音乐快让我发疯了。</font>\n
drive home to	<font color=blue size=4>drive home to</font>\n<br>force sb. to believe or see 使…相信或了解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must drive home to Jack where the present difficulties lie. 你必须使杰克清楚地认识到当前的困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't drive home to us his point. 他不能向我们透彻地阐述自己的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Advertisers keep repeating the name of the product in order to drive the message home. 做广告的人不断地重复产品的名字以便让人们听清楚他们的广告内容。</font>\n
drop across	<font color=blue size=4>drop across</font>\n<br>1. pay a causal visit; come across to visit 串门；随便拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs Barton lives on the other side of the road. She often drops across to have coffee with us. 巴顿太太住在马路那边。她经常来串门和我们一起喝咖啡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On my way back from school I'll drop across at my friend's home. 放学回来的路上，我要顺便去我朋友家看看。</font>\n<br>2. bring 带来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll drop the book across to you this evening. 今晚我把那本书给你带来。</font>\n
drop away	<font color=blue size=4>drop away</font>\n<br>get away; become less 走掉；减少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a tedious lecture. The listeners dropped away one by one. 演讲冗长乏味，听众一个个都走掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The attendance has dropped away in recent months. 最近几个月的出勤率下降了。</font>\n
drop back	<font color=blue size=4>drop back</font>\n<br>1. fall back in position 落后；地位倒退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've dropped back in work. 我的工作落后了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has dropped back to fifth in his class. 他在班上的名次已经退到第5名。</font>\n<br>2. lessen 减少；减轻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The unemployment figures dropped back last month. 上月的失业人数下降了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the medicine took effect, the symptoms dropped back. 随着药物的作用，症状减轻了。</font>\n<br>3. move or step backwards; retreat 退后；撤退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy dropped back before our army's attack. 我军还没有发动进攻，敌军就撤退了。</font>\n
drop down	<font color=blue size=4>drop down</font>\n<br>1. descend or fall quickly 下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The temperature has dropped down. 气温已经下降了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She dropped down into an armchair, exhausted. 他精疲力尽，一下倒在扶手椅里。</font>\n<br>2. lower oneself quickly 俯身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The peasants dropped down on their knees in front of the temple. 那些农民在寺庙前跪了下来。</font>\n
drop in	<font color=blue size=4>drop in</font>\n<br>visit unexpectedly; pay a visit to sb. without telling him beforehand 顺便拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some friends dropped in to tea. 几位朋友顺便来喝茶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were just sitting down to dinner when my friend dropped in. 我们刚坐下吃晚饭，突然我朋友来了。</font>\n
drop in on	<font color=blue size=4>drop in on</font>\n<br>call on or visit sb. unexpectedly 顺便拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you are ever in our neighbourhood, be sure to drop in on us. 如果你到我们这个地区来，一定要来我们这儿玩玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't we drop in on her and find out how she is doing? 我们何不进去坐坐，顺便看看她干得怎么样？</font>\n
drop off	<font color=blue size=4>drop off</font>\n<br>1. fall off 掉下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My top button has dropped off and I can't find it. 我最上面的钮扣掉了，找不到了。</font>\n<br>2. become fewer or less; decline 减少；下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The number of students has been dropping off recently. 近来学生人数减少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sales have been dropping off badly. 销售额下降得厉害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Attendance at football matches has dropped off since the coming of television. 自有电视以来，到现场观看足球比赛的人就减少了。</font>\n<br>3. fall asleep 睡着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was just dropping off when the telephone rang. 我刚要睡着，突然电话铃响了。</font>\n<br>4. let sb. get down from a vehicle; set down 让某人下车；放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where do you want me to drop you off? 你要我在哪儿让你下车？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom dropped me off at the postoffice and I've walked the rest of the way. 汤姆让我在邮局下了车，剩下的路我就步行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would drop the parcel off at the post office. 他说他要在邮局寄一个包裹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can drop the laundry off on my way to work. 我可以在上班的路上把要洗的东西送掉。</font>\n
drop out	<font color=blue size=4>drop out</font>\n<br>leave; cease to attend 离去；不出席\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A few had even dropped out, but nearly half of these had returned to graduate. 少数人甚至已辍学，但近一半的人又返校以求毕业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has dropped out of society. 她已经退出社交界。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Peter saw that he hadn't a chance, he dropped out of the race. 彼得看出他没有获胜的机会时，就退出了比赛。</font>\n
drop (sb) a line	<font color=blue size=4>drop (sb) a line</font>\n<br>write briefly to sb. 给（某人）写封短信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as I get to the United States, I'll drop you a line. 一到美国，我就给你写封短信来。</font>\n
drop to one's knees	<font color=blue size=4>drop to one's knees</font>\n<br>kneel down 跪下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man dropped to his knees, begging for mercy. 那人跪了下来，请求宽恕。</font>\n
dry off	<font color=blue size=4>dry off</font>\n<br> (cause to) become dry 变干；弄干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dry yourself off thoroughly after swimming, or you might catch cold. 游泳之后要把身体擦干，否则可能感冒。</font>\n
dry out	<font color=blue size=4>dry out</font>\n<br>become very dry 变干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't use this wood, because it is not dried out. 我们不能用这木头，因为它还没有干透。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know when the ground will dry out. 我不知道地面何时才能干？</font>\n
dry up	<font color=blue size=4>dry up</font>\n<br>1. become completely dry 干涸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lake has dried up. 那湖干涸了。</font>\n<br>2. lose inspiration; fail to produce words; stop talking（灵感）枯竭；忘词；说不出话来；停止说话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His power of invention will never dry up. 他的创造力永远也不会枯竭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play was good, but one of the actors was nervous and dried up twice in the second act. 戏演得不错，但是有个演员太紧张了，在第2幕里有两次忘了台词。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker suddenly dried up in the middle of his speech. 演讲者在讲话中间突然说不出话来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dry up！Don't say any more！住嘴，别再说了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I won't dry up; I must say something about it. 我不会不说话的，我一定得对这件事发表意见。</font>\n
due to	<font color=blue size=4>due to</font>\n<br>1. caused by; because of; owing to; thanks to 由于；因为；由…造成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accident was due to careless driving. 这场车祸是粗心驾驶造成的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What would you say inflation is mainly due to? 你认为通货膨胀的主要原因是什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He arrived late due to the storm. 他由于暴风雨而来迟了。</font>\n<br>2. attributable to 归于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His success was largely due to his hard work. 他的成功在很大程度上归功于他的辛勤劳动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The credit is due to you. 荣誉应该归于你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Respect is die to older people. 年长者应受到尊敬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first place is due to the chairman. 首席应给主席。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What is the amount due to you? 欠你多少钱？</font>\n<br>3. expected or scheduled to arrive or be ready; supposed to do 预期的；应到的；预定的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train is due to pull in at 5：30a.m.火车预定早上5点半到达。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Smith is due to give us a lecture at eight tomorrow morning. 史密斯教授预定明天上午8点给我们演讲。</font>\n
dwell on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>dwell on/upon</font>\n<br>1. think, often too much about sth. esp. troublesome;worry over sth. 老是想着（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don'dwell on thoughts that annoy you. 别老想着使你烦恼的事。</font>\n<br>2. speak or write at length about Sth. 详述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher was always dwelling on the boy's faullts. 老师总在数落这个男孩的过失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't dwell too much on the subject. 这个题目不要讲得太详细。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker dwelled on traffic safety in his talk. 演讲者详述了交通安全问题。</font>\n
earn/make a living	<font color=blue size=4>earn/make a living</font>\n<br>get what is necessary for life 谋生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Industrious as he is, he can barely earn a living. 他尽管勤勉也只能勉强维持生活。</font>\n
ease in	<font color=blue size=4>ease in</font>\n<br>1. be accustomed gradually 逐渐适应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don ' tworry！You'll be eased in to the new job. 不要担心！你会渐渐适应新工作的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is gradually eased in to the weather here. 他慢慢地适应了这里的气候。</font>\n<br>2. move or place sth. carefully into a position 小心地把某物移入或放入某一位置\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He eased the bolt in carefully. 他小心地插上插销。</font>\n
ease of	<font color=blue size=4>ease of</font>\n<br>relieve of 缓解；减轻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This medicine will ease you of your pain. 这种药会缓解你的疼痛。</font>\n
ease off	<font color=blue size=4>ease off</font>\n<br>1. remove gently 小心翼翼地取下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The nurse eased the bandoge off. 护士轻轻地揭掉绷带。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He eased the stamp off. 他小心翼翼地取下那张邮票。</font>\n<br>2. become less tense or troublesome 缓和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain should ease off before midday. 这雨到中午会变小。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>According to the weather forecast, the storm will ease off. 根据天气预报，风暴会渐渐平息下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the injection his pain began to ease off. 打针后，他的疼痛开始减轻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tension eased off slowly when the two sides began negotiations. 谈判开始时，双方的紧张局势就慢慢缓和下来了。</font>\n
ease up	<font color=blue size=4>ease up</font>\n<br>1. be relieved from pain 解除痛苦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A doctor's duty is to ease up patients. 医生的职责是解除病人的痛苦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pain began to ease up after she was grven a sedative. 给她用了止痛剂后，疼痛轻多了。</font>\n<br>2. become less tense; relax 缓和；轻松；放松\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The situation should ease up now that the two sides are prepared to talk. 既然双方在准备谈判，局势应该缓和了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be glad when the pressure of work has eased up a little. I'm far too busy at the moment. 如果工作压力减轻一点，我会很高兴的，现在我太忙了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She refused to ease up the least bit, even if she was already tired. 虽然她已累极了，但她丝毫不肯放松自己的工作。</font>\n<br>3. slow down;decelerate 放慢；减、速\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ease up, we're going too fast！慢点，我们走得太快了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The machine eased up. 这机器的速度减慢了。</font>\n<br>4. move along (usu. to make space for sb. else) 移动（常指为别人让出座位）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They eased up a bit to make room for those without seats. 他们移动了一下，腾出地方给没有座位的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wonder if you could ease up a little as there are severla people without seats. 有好几个人没有座位，不知你们是否可以挪一挪让出点座位来。</font>\n
eat at	<font color=blue size=4>eat at</font>\n<br>disturb 打扰；使烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What ate at her was not what you had said but something else. 使她烦恼的事不是你所说的，而是其它事情。</font>\n
eat away	<font color=blue size=4>eat away</font>\n<br>1. destroy gradually（逐渐）腐蚀；消耗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The acid has been eating away the sides ofthe container. 酸侵蚀了容器的壁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cancer ate away the healthy flesh. 癌症侵蚀了健康的肌体。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our money was eaten away by inflation. 我们钱都被通货膨胀吞蚀了。</font>\n<br>2. eat continuously 连续不断地吃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been eating away for more than three hours.他们一直吃了3个多小时。</font>\n
eat in	<font color=blue size=4>eat in</font>\n<br>eat at home 在家吃饭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are we eating in tonight? 今晚我们在家吃饭吗？</font>\n
eat one's words	<font color=blue size=4>eat one's words</font>\n<br>admit one has been wrong in sth. one has said 收回自己说过的话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dick insisted the United States was larger than China but he had to eat his words when Beth showed him his map. 狄克坚持说美国比中国大，但当贝思给他看地图时，他不得不收回他的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't boast too much. You will be forced to eat your words one day. 不要吹得太厉害，总有一天你不得不收回你说的话。</font>\n
eat out	<font color=blue size=4>eat out</font>\n<br>1. eat in a restaurant instead of at home 在餐馆吃饭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once in a while we eat out. 我们时而在外面饭店用餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We need a babysitter tonight, because we are eating out. 今晚我们需要一个看孩子的，因为我们要在外面吃饭。</font>\n<br>2. rust; rot or be destroyed 使生锈；使腐烂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rust has eaten out the sword. 剑已经生锈了。</font>\n
eat up	<font color=blue size=4>eat up</font>\n<br>1. finish eating; eat all of 吃光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make sure the children eat their vegetables up！一定要让孩子们把蔬菜吃光。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After working all afternoon, we quickly ate up all of the dinner.我们整整干了一个下午以后，一会儿就把饭吃光了。</font>\n<br>2. use all of; consume 用完；消耗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Extravagance ate up his inheritance. 奢侈的生活耗尽了他继承的遗产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The central heating eats up a lot of electricity. 暖气耗费大量的电力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Idle talk had eaten up the hour before they knew it. 闲谈不知不觉地把他们的时间都耗掉了。</font>\n<br>3. destroy as if by eating; distress 毁坏；使苦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mountain flood ate up many buildings. 山洪冲毁了许多建筑物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's been eating him up lately? 近来他为什么一直在苦恼？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy and monotonous job ate him up. 繁重而单调的工作使他苦恼烦闷。</font>\n
ebb away	<font color=blue size=4>ebb away</font>\n<br>1. flow away from a given position 从一处流掉；消退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tide ebbed away. 潮水退了。</font>\n<br>2. fade away 渐渐衰弱下去；逐渐衰退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Feeling himself ebbing away, the old man knew that his days were numbered and called for a lawyer to make a will. 这位老人感到身体越来越不行了，他意识到他活在世上的日子是屈指可数了，就请来了律师，立了遗嘱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her enthusiasm slowly ebbed away. 她的热情慢慢地没了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old woman felt her strength ebbing away. 这位老妇人感到体力渐渐不行了。</font>\n
ebb back	<font color=blue size=4>ebb back</font>\n<br>return; revive 回复；复活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the encouragement of the teacher, his confidence ebbed back again. 在老师的鼓舞下，他又恢复了信心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our hopes ebbed back. 我们又有希望了。</font>\n
edapt to	<font color=blue size=4>edapt to</font>\n<br>make suitable; become used to 使适应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must adapt ourselves to the changed conditions. 我们必须使自己适应改变了的环境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must adapt our thinking to the new circumstances. 我们必须使自己的思想适应新的情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is difficult to adapt to sudden changes of temperature. 要适应突然变化的气温是很难的。</font>\n
edge on	<font color=blue size=4>edge on</font>\n<br>urge on 怂恿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy committed the crime partly because he was edged on by others. 这男孩犯罪部分是因为受他人怂恿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl edged her boy friend on to buy a colour TV camera. 这女孩怂恿她的男友买彩色电视摄像机。</font>\n
edge out	<font color=blue size=4>edge out</font>\n<br>1. displace 取代\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Colour TV sets are gradually edging out black and white ones. 彩电正在逐渐取代黑白电视机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Imported cars from Japan are edging out American cars.从日本进口的汽车正在取代美国的汽车。</font>\n<br>2. supplant; defeat or surpass by a small margin 排挤掉；险胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That forceful young woman edged out the forner chairman and is now chairman herself. 那位年轻的女强人逐渐挤掉了前任主席，现在她自己当上了主席。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the last election they succeeded in edging their opponents out by a small margin. 在最近的一次选举中，他们以微弱的多数票挤掉了对手。</font>\n
egg on	<font color=blue size=4>egg on</font>\n<br>encourage; induce 鼓励；怂恿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop egging him on to drink more！He has had enough. 别再给他劝酒了！他已喝得够多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ogged him on to fight those boys. 他们怂恿他跟那些男孩打架。</font>\n
either…or	<font color=blue size=4>either…or</font>\n<br>one or the other of the two 或…或；不是…就是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please either come in or go out. Don't stand there in the doorway. 要么进来要么出去，不要站在门口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He must be either mad or drunk. 他不是疯了，就是喝醉了。</font>\n
elaborate on	<font color=blue size=4>elaborate on</font>\n<br>explain in detail (a plan, a theory, etc.) 详细说明（计划、理论等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is going to elaborate on his design. 他将对他的设计作详细的说明。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The physicist is asked to elaborate on his theory. 这位物理学家被邀请详细解释他的理论。</font>\n
elative to	<font color=blue size=4>elative to</font>\n<br>1. on the subject of; about 关于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you any information relative to the effect of penicillin on mice? 你有关于青霉素对老鼠产生效应方面的数据吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please tell us the facts relative to the accident. 请告诉我们与这次事故有关的情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said nothing relative to his plans about returning. 他没有谈到关于他回来的计划。</font>\n<br>2. in comparison with 与…相比较\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Relative to the size of an ant, a blade of grass is as tall as a tree. 与蚂蚁相比，一根草简直有一棵树那么高。</font>\n
eligible for	<font color=blue size=4>eligible for</font>\n<br>having the right qualifications 有…资格的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you eligible for free medical treatment? 你有免费医疗的资格吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone who can speak French is eligible for membership in this club. 任何会讲法语的人都有资格加入这个俱乐部。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pupils must pass in all subjects to be eligible for school teams. 全部功课及格的学生才有资格参加校队。</font>\n
embark on	<font color=blue size=4>embark on</font>\n<br>1. go aboard (a shiP, an airplane, etc.) 上（船、飞机等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He embarked on a ship for America yesterday evening.他昨天晚上乘船去了美国。</font>\n<br>2. engage in 着手；从事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city has embarked on a program of reshaping its streets and roads. 这个城市已着手进行将街道和公路重新规划的项目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are embarking on the policy of economic development. 他们正在执行发展经济的政策。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having embarked on this course, they had to stick to it. 他们既然已经走上了这条路，只好走到底。</font>\n
encroach on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>encroach on/upon</font>\n<br>1. intrude on (property, etc.); go beyond what is right or natural or desirable 侵犯；侵占（财产等）；超出正常范围；侵入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We will never allow anybody to encroach upon China'sterritorial integrity and sovereignty. 中国的领土和主权绝不允许任何人侵犯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The army must never encroach upon the people's interests. 军队绝不能损害人民的利益。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never do anything to encroach upon the interests of others for your own good. 绝不要做任何损人利己的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to encroach on your time, but I really need your help. 很抱歉占用你的时间，但是我确实需要你的帮助。</font>\n<br>2. erode 侵蚀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sea is encroaching upon the land. 海水侵蚀着陆地。</font>\n
end in	<font color=blue size=4>end in</font>\n<br>result in; have sth. as its end 以…告终；结果是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting ended in disorder. 会议在一片混乱中结束。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't take pains, your dream will end in bubbles. 如果你不努力，你的愿望就会成泡影。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After full 12 months the Long March ended in triumph. 经过整整12个月，长征胜利结束了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That affair will end in his dismissal. 那件事将以他的除名而告终。</font>\n
end off	<font color=blue size=4>end off</font>\n<br>bring to an end; finish 结束；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This civil case ended off unexpectedly. 这件民事诉讼案的结果出乎人们的预料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ended off the off the meeting with a song. 他们唱了一首歌结束了会议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We ended the work off with a flourish. 我们积极地完成了工作。</font>\n
endowed with	<font color=blue size=4>endowed with</font>\n<br>born with 赋有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane is endowed with many talents. 简多才多艺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was endowed with the spirit of selfsacrifice.他富有自我牺牲精神。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is endowed with beauty and intelligence. 她天生美丽聪明。</font>\n<br>engage for guarantee; promise 保证；允诺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can engage for nothing but his honesty. 我只能对他的诚实担保。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's all I can engage for. 我所能担保的仅此而已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your demand is more than I can engage for. 你的要求我无法答应。</font>\n
end up	<font color=blue size=4>end up</font>\n<br>1. reach a final situation; die;be killed 终结；死；被杀死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gangster ended up in the electric chair. 那个歹徒最后被送上电椅处死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The runaway prisoner ended up in a river. 那个逃犯最后死在一条河里。</font>\n<br>2. come to an end; finish by 结束；以…结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't slow down, you'll end up in hospital.你要是不减速，你会被送进医院的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She ended up her speech with a short poem. 她朗诵了一首短诗结束了她的演讲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Despite his strenuous efforts, he ended up unsuccessfully after all. 尽管他付出了艰苦的努力，可最后还是没有成功。</font>\n
engaged in	<font color=blue size=4>engaged in</font>\n<br>busy with; occupied in 忙于；从事于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The diligent student engaged himself in concentrated study. 那位勤奋的学生一直在专心地学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The employer engaged his new workers in hard labor. 这位雇主让他的新工人一直不停地干艰苦的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is an experienced teacher, for she has engaged in teaching for thirty years. 她是一位有经验的教师，因为她从事教学已经30年了。</font>\n
engage with	<font color=blue size=4>engage with</font>\n<br>1. attack (the enemy); enter into conflict with 攻击；与…交战\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our army engaged with the enemy at the first light of day. 天一破晓，我军就同敌人交了火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's very likely that the two countries will engage with each other. 很可能这两个国家要发生冲突。</font>\n<br>2. connect with sth. as in machinery（机器）啮合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engine has stopped because the different parts of the motor are not engaging with one another properly. 由于各零件彼此啮合欠佳，发动机停了。</font>\n<br>3. be busy dealing with 忙于应付；忙于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most of my time is engaged with theedaytoday work in the office. 我的大部分时间都是在办公室处理日常事务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At present he is engaged with the revision of his book. 目前他正忙于修订他那本书。</font>\n
enjoy oneself	<font color=blue size=4>enjoy oneself</font>\n<br>have a good time 玩得快乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you enjoy yourself during the winter vacation? 寒假你玩得痛快吗？</font>\n
enlarge on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>enlarge on/upon</font>\n<br>say or write more about (a point, a matter, etc.) 进一步详述（观点、事情等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I need not enlarge upon this matter, because you all know my views. 我不需要详述此事，因为你们都知道我的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman asked him. to enlarge on his suggestions. 主席请他进一步叙述他的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children wanted him to enlarge on what he had said about the umidentified flying objects.孩子们要他详细讲解他所说的飞碟问题。</font>\n
enter for	<font color=blue size=4>enter for</font>\n<br>put one's name down for (a contest, an exam, etc.) 报名参加（竞赛、考试等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How many students entered for the competiion? 多少学生报名参加比赛？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the students in Band 4 have entered for College English Test Band 4. 所有 4级的学生都报名参加了大学英语4级考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want to enter for high iump. 我想报名参加跳高比赛。</font>\n
enter into	<font color=blue size=4>enter into</font>\n<br>1. come or go in; begin (correspondence, conversations, negotiations, etc.) 进入；开始（书信、谈话、谈判等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shortly after graduation from college, he entered into business. 大学毕业后不久他就进入了商界。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two old men entered into a long discussion. 这两位老人开始了长时间的讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They entered into negotiations with their business rivals. 他们开始跟业务上的对手进行谈判。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At that time he entered into correspondence with an American for im provement in the English language. 那时候他开始同一位美国人通信以提高英语水平。</font>\n<br>2.relate in detail; begin to consider; examine 详述；开始考虑；研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Without entering into all the advantages and disadvantages, we can see that the plan is feasible. 尽管没有详述优缺点，我们也看得出这个计划是可行的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't enter into details at present. 我们目前还不能讨论细节。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's enter into an elaborate investigation. 让我们开始详细调查吧。</font>\n<br>3. take part in 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A catalyst changes the speed of chemical reaction without entering into it. 催化剂能改变化学反应的速度而不参加反应。</font>\n<br>4. form a part; be part of 成为…一部分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Oxygen enters into many compound bodies. 氧是许多化合物的组成部分。</font>\n<br>5. sympathize with; understand; comprehend 同情；理解；深知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can enter into your feeling at the loss of your father. 我能理解你失去父亲后的心情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not enter into my mood. 她不体谅我的心情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of us have come from developing countries, so we can enter into one another's feelings and views. 我们都来自发展中国家，因此能理解彼此的感情和观点。</font>\n<br>6. come into a state of 进入…状态\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actress acted very well because she has entered into the feelings of her part. 这位女演员表演得很好，因为她已经进入了角色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country has entered into a state of war. 这国家已经进入战争状态。</font>\n
enter on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>enter on/upon</font>\n<br>1. begin (an age, a career, a term of office, etc.) 开始（一个时代、生涯、新职务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our country has entered, on a new period. 我们国家已进入一个新时期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the splendid wedding party, the new couple entered on a new stage of their life. 在隆重而壮观的婚礼以后，这对新婚夫妇开始进入了生活的新阶段。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt proud when he entered on the duties of his new appointment. 当他开始担任新职务时，他感到很自豪。</font>\n<br>2. begin to consider; begin to deal with 开始考虑；开始研讨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's enter upon the question. 我们开始讨论这个问题吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once we enter on a question, we should not easily give it up. 一旦我们研究某个问题，就不要轻易放过它。</font>\n<br>3. take possession of 得到；占有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She entered upon a large property. 她获得了一大笔财产。</font>\n
enter up	<font color=blue size=4>enter up</font>\n<br>record; write down 登记；写下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager told the accountant to enter up the sales for the past month. 经理要会计把上个月的销售登记入账。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is very im portant that every sale of a dangerous poison should be entered up at the time of sale. 每卖出一件危险的毒品都必须在卖时登记下来，这很重要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please enter up your name and address in the register? 请在这本登记簿上登记你的名字和地址，好吗？</font>\n

essential to	<font color=blue size=4>essential to</font>\n<br>necessary to 为…不可缺少的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Water is essential to the growth of crops. 水是庄稼生长所不可缺少的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hard work and perseverance are essential to success.努力工作和持之以恒是成功所不可少的。</font>\n
even if/though	<font color=blue size=4>even if/though</font>\n<br>although 即使…也\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I won't mind even if he doesn't come. 即使他不来，我也不介意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I won't lose heart even if I don't succeed. 即使是失败，我也不灰心。</font>\n
even out	<font color=blue size=4>even out</font>\n<br>1. make (a surface, etc.) even or smooth 使（表面等）平坦或光滑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are busy evening out the surface of the road. 工人们正忙着平整路面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the building of the bridge was finished, the workers began evening out the ground of the construction site. 当桥梁建造完工时，工人们开始平整建筑工地的路面。</font>\n<br>2.stabilize 稳定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is expected that prices will even out next year. 预料明年的物价会稳定。</font>\n<br>3. equalize; make regular or equitable 使平均；使均衡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll pay this time and yod pay next time; it'll even out in the long run. 这次我付，下次你付，最后还是平摊了。</font>\n
even up	<font color=blue size=4>even up</font>\n<br>equalize; make (accounts, etc.) balanced; make equal 平均；使（账目等）平衡；使…成为平局\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>According to the contract, the two parties should even up accounts with each other. 根据合同，双方的收支账目应该相等。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you give him an apple you must give his brother one to even things up. 你要是给他一个苹果，就也得给他弟弟一个，这样才公平。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two teams evened up their score. 这两队打成平局。</font>\n
