every now and then	<font color=blue size=4>every now and then</font>\n<br>from time to time; occasionally 不时；时常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every now and then I like to walk along the beach and forget my problems. 我常常喜欢沿着海滩散步，忘记我的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I meet him every now and then on the street. 我时常在街上碰见他。</font>\n
every other	<font color=blue size=4>every other</font>\n<br>1. alternate 每隔一（个）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have English lessons every other day. 我们每隔一天上一次英语课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I go there every other week. 每隔一周我去那儿一趟。</font>\n<br>2. all others 所有其他的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom was early; every other boy was late. 汤姆来得早，而其他男孩一个个都迟到了。</font>\n
every so often	<font color=blue size=4>every so often</font>\n<br>once in a while; occasionally 时时；常常\n<br>I no longer see him regularly, but every so often he drops in at my office. 我\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>不再定期看到他，但他不时来办公室看看我。</font>\n
excel at/in	<font color=blue size=4>excel at/in</font>\n<br>be very good at 优于；擅长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He excelled at tennis as a young boy. 他在少年时就擅长网球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>David excels in history. 戴维的历史成绩最好。</font>\n
except for	<font color=blue size=4>except for</font>\n<br>if…be excludd; with the exception of 除去…以外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your composition is good, except for some spelling mistakes. 你的作文写得不错，只是有几处拼写错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This translation is very well done, except for afew inaccuracies. 这篇译文很不错，只有几处译得还不够确切。</font>\n
exchange for	<font color=blue size=4>exchange for</font>\n<br>give one thing and receive another thing for it 交换\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to exchange this dress for one of a larger size.我想把这件衣服换成一件尺寸大点儿的。</font>\n
exclusive of	<font color=blue size=4>exclusive of</font>\n<br>not including 不包括在内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship had a crew of 57, exclusive of officers. 这船上有 57名水手，高级船员除外。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book costs two pounds, exclusive of postage. 除邮资以外，这本书价值两英镑。</font>\n
excuse for	<font color=blue size=4>excuse for</font>\n<br>forgive sb.for 因…而原谅（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will excuse me for not recognizing you at once.请原谅我没有一下子把你认出来。</font>\n
excuse from	<font color=blue size=4>excuse from</font>\n<br>make free from 免除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had been excused from military service on account of shortsightedness. 他因近视而免服兵役。</font>\n
exempt from	<font color=blue size=4>exempt from</font>\n<br>make free from 免除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old age pensioners should be exempt from taxation. 领取养老金的人应免除征税。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Being very small can exempt a man from military service. 年岁很小可以免除服兵役。</font>\n
expect of	<font color=blue size=4>expect of</font>\n<br>anticipate 期待；希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole family expects great things of him. 全家人对他抱以很大期望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Parents usually expect too much of their children. 父母往往都对子女寄予太多希望。</font>\n
expose to	<font color=blue size=4>expose to</font>\n<br>1. leave uncovered or unprotected 暴露于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do not expose it to the sun. 此物谨防日晒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To stay warm in cold weather, coldblooded animals must expose themselves to a source of warmth such as direct sunlight. 冷血动物在寒冷的气温下要保暖，必须把自己暴露在阳光这样的温源下。</font>\n<br>2.make known 揭露（出来）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must expose this shameful activity to the newspaper. 我们必须将这可耻勾当公诸报端。</font>\n
expressive of	<font color=blue size=4>expressive of</font>\n<br>serving to express 表示的；表现的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His look was expressive of gratitude. 他流露出感激之情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A baby's cry may be expressive of hunger or pain. 婴儿的哭啼可能表示饥饿或疼痛。</font>\n
face out	<font color=blue size=4>face out</font>\n<br>opposc or deal with bravely 勇敢地对付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He faced the matter out in spite of severe questioning. 哪怕有严厉的责问，他也会勇敢地对待这一问题。</font>\n
face to face	<font color=blue size=4>face to face</font>\n<br>\n<br>with one's face looking toward the face of another person; together 面对面；在一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They sat face to face with each other without a word. 他们面对面坐在一起无话可谈。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to avoid meeting the boss those days, but happened to run into him face to face on the stairs. 那些天他努力回避老板，但却无意中在楼梯上面对面碰上了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The church and the school stand face to face across the street. 教堂和街对面的学校相对而立。</font>\n
face up to	<font color=blue size=4>face up to</font>\n<br>face sth. difficult withcourage and determination 不畏缩；勇于正视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must face up to our responsibilities and not to try to get out of them. 我们必须勇于承担责任而不是逃避责任。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The greater our achievements, the more we'd face up to our mistakes. 我们的成绩越大，越要正视缺点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He just can't face up to the fact that he's too old to work any more. 他就是不能接受自己已经老了不能再继续工作这个事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She faced up to the problem with courage and foresight. 她勇敢而有远见地面对这个问题。</font>\n
face with	<font color=blue size=4>face with</font>\n<br>make sb. meet sth. bad or difficult 面临遭遇；碰到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Faced with the evidence, he confessed himself guilty. 面对证据，他承认有罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scientist was faced with many unknown factors.那位科学家遇到了许多未知的因素。</font>\n
fade away	<font color=blue size=4>fade away</font>\n<br>become gradually fainter; disappear slowly; lose one's strength 逐渐减弱；慢慢消失；衰弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sound of cheering faded away in the distance. 欢呼声在远处渐渐消失了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They watched the airplane fading away into the mist. 他们看着飞机消失在云雾中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She became ill and slowly faded away. 她生了病，身体便慢慢地衰弱下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man is just fading away.那个老人的身体在渐渐衰弱。</font>\n<br>2. retreat or vanish quietly 悄悄地离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He faded away quietly and we never saw him again. 他悄悄地溜掉了，我们再也没有看到他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is an expert at fading away away when he isn't needed. 他很善于在不需要他的时候悄悄地走开。</font>\n
fag out	<font color=blue size=4>fag out</font>\n<br>tired out; exhausted completely 使…劳累；使…极度疲劳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This work will fag me out. 这个工作会使我精疲力尽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm really fagged out. 我实在太累了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was already fagged out when he climbed half way up the mountain. 爬到半山腰的时候，他已经累得精疲力尽了。</font>\n
fall about	<font color=blue size=4>fall about</font>\n<br>laugh hysterically 狂笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were falling about. 他们在狂笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We fell about when we saw his funny gestures. 我们看到他那滑稽的动作不禁捧腹大笑。</font>\n
fall apart	<font color=blue size=4>fall apart</font>\n<br>1.break in pieces without force being used 破裂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This cup just fell apart in my hands. 这杯子在我手中破裂了。</font>\n<br>2.end in failure 崩溃；倒台\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With all these increasing costs, the business could fall apart.由于成本增加，这家商行可能倒闭。</font>\n<br>3. separate in a relationship 关系破裂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We used to be good friends, but fell apart about a year ago. 我们过去是好友，可是大约一年前，关系破裂了。</font>\n
fall away	<font color=blue size=4>fall away</font>\n<br>1.diminish; decline 减少；; 衰落；减弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wind fell away and all was calm. 风变小了，周围一片寂静。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The number of people coming to the club has fallen away a lot. 来俱乐部的人数大大减少了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Attendances are falling away steadily. 出勤率在逐渐下降。</font>\n<br>2. go away; vanish 离开；消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All his old friends fell away from him. 老朋友们都疏远了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old customs have fallen away into disuse. 这些旧风俗已经废弃了。</font>\n<br>3. fall out and down; drop away 脱落；落掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Flowers are falling away. 花在凋谢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The stones have fallen away from the side of the house. 房子侧面的石头脱落了。</font>\n<br>4. decay; betray 变质；背叛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Atrue revolutionary should never fall away in time of danger. 一个真正的革命者在危急时刻绝不应该背叛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Meat is kept from falling away in cold storage. 肉放进冷藏库以防变质。</font>\n<br>5. move back;retreat 返回；撤回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell back in surprise. 他被吓得往后退缩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Badly beaten, the enemy had to fall back in disorder. 敌军被打得一败涂地，乱成一团向后撤退。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the enemy advanced, we fell back. 敌人进攻时我们就后退。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience fell back into silence. 观众又静了下来。</font>\n<br>fall back on／upon 1. rely on; turn to sb. for help 依赖；求助于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doctors sometimes fall back on old cures when modern medicine does not work. 当现代药物不管用时，医生有时依靠古老的医疗方法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's good to have a friend to fall back on.有个可依靠的朋友是很好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the big bills for his wife's hospital care came, he was glad he had money in the bank to fall back on. 当他收到妻子的一大笔住院费的账单时，他因为银行里有一笔钱而感到欣慰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can always fall back upon Bill when we are in difficulties if we can't get anyone else. 遇到困难时，如果找不到别人，我们随时都可以求助于比尔。</font>\n<br>2.go back to 回过来再谈；重提\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must fall back on what you said at the meeting. 你必须回过来把会上讲的再说一遍。</font>\n
fall behind	<font color=blue size=4>fall behind</font>\n<br>fail to keep up 落后；跟不上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John fell behind in his studies and finally had to leave school. 约翰学习跟不上，最后只好退学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To be promoted or to fall behind is not a matter of salary but even more a matter of selfrespect. 升职或者落后不仅仅是薪金的问题，更重要的是自尊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't want to fall behind in my studies. 在学习上我不想落伍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Diligence helps one to go forward, where as laziness makes one fall behind. 勤奋使人上进，懒惰使人落后。</font>\n
fall for	<font color=blue size=4>fall for</font>\n<br>1. accept as true; be cheated by 信以为真；受骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You didn't fall for his sad story about his sick wife and children, did you? He told that to everyone just to get sympathy！你没被他那套关于病妻弱子的鬼话所骗吧？他编造给大家听的目的只是为了得到同情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fall for his tricks！不要轻信他的伎俩！</font>\n<br>2. become keen on; fall in love with 热心于；迷恋；爱上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fell for him in a big way. 她非常喜欢他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell for her at first sight. 他对她一见钟情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My wife always falls for the most expensive dresses in the shop！我妻子总是迷恋商店里最昂贵的衣服。</font>\n
fall in	<font color=blue size=4>fall in</font>\n<br>1. fall into sth. accidentally; drop into 掉入；跌入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child was near the river and I was afraid he would fall in. 孩子在河边，我怕他会掉进河里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plunged into the lake to rescue the child who'd fallen in. 他跳进湖去救那个落水的孩子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water's deep here. Mind you don't fall in. 这里水深，当心别跌进去。</font>\n<br>2. sink inwards 凹进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Because of long illness his eyes fell in. 由于长期生病，他的眼睛向里凹陷。</font>\n<br>3. agree 同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once the chairman had stated his decision, the rest of the committee fell in. 主席一宣布决定，委员会的其余成员都表示同意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made a very good suggestion at the meeting and we fell in immediately.他在会上提出了一个非常好的建议，我们立即同意了。</font>\n<br>4. (of a debt) become payable; expire（债务）到期；满期\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city's debts fall in at the end of this year and the council are worried about paying them. 市府的公债年底到期，市政会正为如何偿还这笔债务发愁呢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lease of the land has fallen in. 土地的租期满了。</font>\n<br>5. get into line; form ranks 站队；集合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ordered the men to fall in. 他命令士兵集合。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At eight o'clock the students fell in. 8点钟学生们集合。</font>\n
fall in for	<font color=blue size=4>fall in for</font>\n<br>come in for; get 受到；得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't think he would fall in for the major share of the blame.他认为他不会是受到主要指责的对象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach fell in for most of the blame when his team lost the game. 比赛失败后，该队教练受到的指责最多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl fell in for some sympathy when she was attacked by that gangster. 这女孩受到歹徒袭击时，得到了人们的同情。</font>\n
fall in love	<font color=blue size=4>fall in love</font>\n<br>begin to love 爱上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fell in love when they were students in high school. 他们在中学时就互相爱上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've fallen in love with your beautiful house. 我已经爱上了你那漂亮的房子。</font>\n
fall into	<font color=blue size=4>fall into</font>\n<br>1. come down from a higher place 落入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child fell into the lake and had to be pulled out. 小孩落入湖中，必须把他拉上来。</font>\n<br>2. flow into 流入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The river falls into the sea. 这条河流入大海。</font>\n<br>3. form; acquire 养成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let children fall into bad habits. 不要让孩子养成坏习惯。</font>\n<br>4. begin 开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell into a quarrel with his classmate. 他与同学吵了起来。</font>\n<br>5. be divisible into 分成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His book falls into four chapters. 他的书分成4章。</font>\n<br>6. belong to 属于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Things of a kind come together, people of a mind fall into the same group. 物以类聚，人以群分。</font>\n<br>7. pass into (a certain state, etc.) 进入（某种状态）；陷入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was so tired that she fell into a doze in the armchair. 她十分疲劳，以致于在扶手椅里睡着了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company has fallen into extreme difficulties due to the economic depression.这家公司由于经济萧条，陷入了困境。</font>\n
fall in upon	<font color=blue size=4>fall in upon</font>\n<br>1. come upon unexpectedly 意外遇到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I fell in upon of my old classmates on my way home.在我回家的路上我遇到了一位老同学。</font>\n<br>2. visit by chance 顺便访问\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are welcome to fall in upon us at any time you like. 你什么时候来玩，我们都欢迎。</font>\n
fall in with	<font color=blue size=4>fall in with</font>\n<br>1. meet sb. by chance 偶遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On our trip we fell in with some interesting people.在这次旅行中我们遇见了一些有趣的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We fell in with some French tourists from the same hotel. 我们结识了住在同一旅馆的几位法国旅游者。</font>\n<br>2. join; associate oneself with 同…合伙；联合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has fallen in with some strange people. 他跟一些奇怪的人勾搭上了。</font>\n<br>3.rejoin 重返\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he recovered, the soldier fell in with his company. 这战士一恢复健康，就回连队去了。</font>\n<br>4. accept; agree with 接受；同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have decided to fall in with your plan. 我已决定接受你的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will fall in with any suggestion that involves eating and drinking. 他对任何关于吃喝方面的建议都会接受的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fell in with my views at once. 她立即同意了我的观点。</font>\n<br>5. coincide with; match 与…协调；相称\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The colour of your coat doesn't seem to fall in with your complexion. 你的上衣的颜色与你的肤色不协调。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The idea you put to us fell in exactly with what we our ourselves had in mind.你提出的主意正好与我们头脑里想的一样。</font>\n
fall off	<font color=blue size=4>fall off</font>\n<br>1. fall from 跌落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you are learning to ride a bicycle, you often fall off. 学骑自行车时，经常会摔下来。</font>\n<br>2. decline in number; lessen in intensity 数量下降；削减\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Attendance at church has fallen off this summer. 今夏去教堂的人已减少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our sales have fallen off seriously during the past six months. 我们的销售额在过去的6个月中猛减了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The number of passengers fell off slightly in January. 一月份乘客数量略有减少。</font>\n<br>3.decrease; decline in quality 降低；衰退；质量下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their enthusiasm seems to be falling off a bit. 他们的热情似乎小了一点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His support has greatly fallen off. 他的支持明显减少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The service in this restaurant has been falling off for a long time. 这个饭店的服务质量长时间来一直在下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your cooking is falling off. 你的烹饪技术越来越不行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The quality of the products of this factory has fallen off. 这个工厂的产品质量已经下降。</font>\n
fall on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>fall on/upon</font>\n<br>1. descend on; drop on; befall 落在；落到…身上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Snow has fallen on the mountains all night. 山上彻夜降了雪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tears fell on the letter she was reading. 眼泪滴在她正念的那封信上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the expenses fell on me. 所有开销均由我付。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The responsibility of defending the country falls on all the people. 保卫祖国，人人有责。</font>\n<br>2. attack; go and fight with 进攻；袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fell on the enemy vigorously. 他们向敌人发起了猛烈的进攻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gangsters fell on her from behind the building. 歹徒从大楼的后面向她袭击。</font>\n<br>3. come to pass on or occur on (a certain day) 适逢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>National Day falls on a Sunday this year. 今年国庆节适逢一个星期日。</font>\n<br>4. chance upon 偶然碰到；偶然发现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm lucky to have fallen upon you.碰到你，真幸运。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His gaze fell upon a small party of men moving up the hillside. 他突然看到一小群人向山坡上走去。</font>\n<br>5. meet with (misfortune, disaster, etc.); encounter 遭遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has fallen on hard times. 他遭到了不幸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't lose heart even though she fell on a bad setback. 虽然她遭到严重的挫折，但她仍不灰心。</font>\n
fall out	<font color=blue size=4>fall out</font>\n<br>1. fall accidentally 脱落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As she picked up the envelope,a key fell out. 她拾起信封又掉了钥匙。</font>\n<br>2. be carried away as waste 排除（废物）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dirty water falls out through a pipe into the sea. 污水经管道排入大海。</font>\n<br>3. quarrel 吵架；闹纠纷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most married people fallout over money. 多数已结婚的人为金钱而闹纠纷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's always falling out with her nerghbour. 她老是和邻居吵架。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't get angry！ I don't want to fall out with you.别发火！我不想跟你吵架。</font>\n<br>4. come to pass; happen 结果是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>ThingS fell out well. 事情的结果很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry！Things will fall out all right in the end. 别着急！事情到头来会好转的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It fell out as we expected. 结果正如我们所料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything has fallen out splendidly. 一切进展很好。</font>\n<br>5. leave the ranks or a parade; dismiss from the ranks 离队；原地解散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was told to fall out. 他被叫出队列。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fall out！就地解散！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although all of them were exhausted, not a single man fell out. 虽然他们大家都很疲劳，但是没有一个人掉队。</font>\n<br>6. withdraw (from a group of people who are engaged together on some activity) 撤出；退出（一伙人所从事的某种活动）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nine people were working on the project, but two had to fall out because of illness.原来有9个人接这个项目，但是有两人因病不得不退出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two of the team have fallen out, and I don't know who can replace them. 已经有两名队员退出，我不知道谁能接替他们。</font>\n
fall short	<font color=blue size=4>fall short</font>\n<br>1. be insufficient 不足\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The supply is falling short. 供给不足。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rope fell short.绳子不够长。</font>\n<br>2. fail to measure up to 达不到（目标）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The performance they offered fell short of my hopes. 他们的表演有负我的希望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The novel fell short of my expectation. 这本小说达不到我的愿望。</font>\n
fall through	<font color=blue size=4>fall through</font>\n<br>1. descend accidentally through 掉进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy fell through the ice and was drowned.这个男孩掉入冰水中淹死了。</font>\n<br>2. fail to be completed, fail to occur 失败；不执行；落空\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If your new agreement falls through, the workers in your company will go on strike. 如果你们的新协议不落实，贵公司的工人就要罢工了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope the plan doesn't fall through a second time owing to lack of funds. 我不希望这项计划因缺少资金再次落空。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are going on a picnic tomorrow, unless it falls through because of the weather. 我们明天要去野餐，除非天气不好去不成。</font>\n
familiar to	<font color=blue size=4>familiar to</font>\n<br>well known to 为…所熟知的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>English is familiar to him.英语是他的熟门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The facts are familiar to me. 这些事实对我来说是熟悉的。</font>\n
familiar with	<font color=blue size=4>familiar with</font>\n<br>1. wellacquainted with 对…了解的；对…熟悉的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is familiar with English. 他通晓英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am familiar with the facts.我了解这些事实。</font>\n<br>2. very friendly; close 亲热，热呼；顺便\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss made himself much too familiar with the girl. 老板对这位姑娘过分亲热了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be too familiar with him; he's a dishonest man. 不要同他太亲近了，他不是个老实人。</font>\n<br>famous for known widely for; having fame for 以…著名（称）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town is famous for its hot springs. 该镇以温泉著称。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is famous for his honesty, 他以诚实而出名。</font>\n
far and away	<font color=blue size=4>far and away</font>\n<br>by a large degree; verg much 大大地；无疑地；最\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is far and away the best book on the subject. 这本书无疑是有关这个主题的最好的一本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is far and away the better bargain. 这无疑是一笔较为合算的交易。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fish was far and away the biggest ever caught in the lake. 这是从这个湖中曾经捕捉到的最大的一条鱼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the moment, he is far and away the best table tennis player in our country. 他无疑是我国目前最佳的乒乓球手。</font>\n
far and wide/near	<font color=blue size=4>far and wide/near</font>\n<br>far places and near places; everywhere 远近；到处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From far and near, people moved towards the same spot to attend his funeral. 人们从四面八方赶到同一个地方来参加他的葬礼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His students are scattered for and wide. 他桃李满天下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of victory spread far and wide. 胜利的消息传到了四面八方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The superiorty of our goos is known far and near. 我们货物的优越性远近驰名。</font>\n
far cry	<font color=blue size=4>far cry</font>\n<br>different 截然不同；毫无关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hislast statement a far cry from his first story. 他最后的话与最初的叙述简直风马牛不相干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first automobile could run, but a was a for cry from a modern car. 最早发明的汽车虽能跑，但与目前的汽车相比，有天壤之别。</font>\n<br>That, s an interesting picture, but it's a far cry from great art. 那是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>一幅有趣的画，但还远远算不上是一件伟大的艺术品。</font>\n
far from	<font color=blue size=4>far from</font>\n<br>1. a long way off 远离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The railway station is far from here. 火车站离这里很远。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shanghai is not far from here.上海离这儿不远。</font>\n<br>2. by on means; not at all 远远不；完全不；非但不…反而\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The present situation is far from satisfactory though some progress has been made. 虽然取得了某些进展，但现在的形势距离称心如意还差得远。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His explanation was far from satis factory. 他的解释一点儿也不令人满意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are confronted with arduous tasks and our experience is far from adequate. 我们面临的工作很艰巨，而且我们的经验还很不够。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Far from praising him, I'll criticize him. 我非但不表扬他，反而要批评他。</font>\n
farm out	<font color=blue size=4>farm out</font>\n<br>1. send away to be done; rent out 请他人代劳；招人承包；出租\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher had too many test papers to read, so she farmed out half of them to a friend. 我们老师须批改的试卷太多，所以她分出一半请朋友帮忙批阅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work has been farmed out to various people. 这个活儿包给了许多人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Landlords in old China farmed out their land to their tenants and lived in luxury off the rents. 在旧中国地主把土地出租给佃农，靠收租过着奢侈的生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They may farm out production of the machine parts to other factories. 他们可以让别的工厂承包一些机器零件的生产。</font>\n<br>2. send away to be taken care of 送请他人照料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While mother was sick, the children were farmed out to relatives. 在母亲生病期间，孩子们被送请亲戚照顾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The woman was kind to those children who were farmed out to her. 那女人对寄养在她家的孩子关怀备至。</font>\n<br>3. send a player to a league where the quality of play is lower 把球员送到水平较低的球队去锻炼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The player was farmed out to Rochester to gain experience. 这个队员被派到罗彻斯特队以获取比赛经验。</font>\n<br>4. exhausted for farming 地力耗尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This land has been farmed out. 这块地（因种植过多）地力已耗尽。</font>\n
far off	<font color=blue size=4>far off</font>\n<br>1. distant; remote（距离）遥远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house is far off. 那所房子在远处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't see clearly the peak of the mountain far off.我们看不清远处的山峰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As we sailed along, we could see the light house far off. 我们航行时，远远就能看到灯塔。</font>\n<br>2. far in the future（时间上）离现在远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>May Day is not far off. 五一节快到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her departure was not far off. 她的行期快到了。</font>\n
fasten down	<font color=blue size=4>fasten down</font>\n<br>1. fix firmly in place 扎牢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to fasten the lid down with nails. 你必须用钉子把盖子钉牢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The windows have been fastened down. 窗户都已扣牢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fastened down the collar of his coat. 他扣紧了大衣领子。</font>\n<br>2. make sb. give a decision 使（某人）下决心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fasten him down to a date? 你能使他确定一个日期吗？</font>\n
fasten off	<font color=blue size=4>fasten off</font>\n<br>finish fastening 打结；结牢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fasten the thread off with a knot. 把线打个结扎牢。</font>\n
fasten on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>fasten on/upon</font>\n<br>1. attach oneself to a person (usu. to the annoyance of the person concerned) 缠住某人（通常引人讨厌）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I object to being fastened on in that way. 我反对那样被纠缠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our unpleasant neighbour fastened herself on me throughout the party. 那位令人讨厌的邻居整个晚会一直缠着我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No sooner had I got in the door than my son came and fastened himself upon me. 我刚一进门，我儿子就来缠住我。</font>\n<br>2. attach responsibility (blame, a fault, a crime, etc.) to a person 将责任（过失、错误、罪行等）加在某人头上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone must have broken the plate, but why fasten on me? 一定是有人把盘子打碎了，但是为什么把责任推到我身上？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why do you fasten such a nickname on me? 你为什么把这个外号强加在我身上？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried to fasten the responsibility for the accident on me, but luckily I could produce witnesses to prove that I was not at fault. 他们企图把事故的责任加到我的头上，幸而我能举出证据来证明我是没有过错的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It looks as if the blame has been fastened on an innocent person.好象错误已经加到一个无辜者头上了。</font>\n<br>3. hold on to ; adopt quickly 坚持；抓住不放；迅速采纳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fasten upon his idea so uncritically. 别那样不加批判地接受他的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fastened upon the idea of going to London. 她采纳了去伦敦的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fastened upon his suggestion as an excuse for her actions. 她抓住他的建议当做她行动的借口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once he's fastened on an idea, you can't get him to change his mind. 他一旦坚持某种看法，你就休想叫他改变主张。</font>\n<br>4. concentrate on;focus one's attention on 集中注意力于；集中于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fasten upon what I am saying. 注意听我说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone's eyes fastened on the little girl in the middle of the stage. 大家的目光集中在舞台中央的那位小姑娘身上。</font>\n
fat chance	<font color=blue size=4>fat chance</font>\n<br>little or no possibility; almost no chance 不太可能；机会很少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've never been so busy in the office. You've got a fat chance for a vacation now. 我们办公室从来没有这么忙过，你现在很难有机会休假了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With tickets for that show sold out for two weeks in advance, we have a fat chance of getting anything for tonight. 这场戏的戏票两星期前就卖光了，我们今天晚上买到票的机会很小。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A high school team would have a fat chance of beating a strong college team. 一个中学生队不太可能击败实力强的大学生队。</font>\n
fathom out	<font color=blue size=4>fathom out</font>\n<br>try to discover or devise (an explanation, etc.) 寻找解释；找出原因；计算出；推测出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't tell me the answer; let me try to fathom it out for myself. 别告诉我答案，让我自己设法解答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The problem was so difficult that it took several days to fathom out an answer. 那道题太难，解了好几天才找出答案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I just can't fathom out his intentions. 我就是揣摩不透他的意图。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fathom out where he's gone? 你能猜出他到那儿去了吗？</font>\n<br>favo (u) r with do sth. for sb. as a favour 为（某人）特意做（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Green will now favour us with a song. 格林先生将为我们献上一首歌。</font>\n
fatten up	<font color=blue size=4>fatten up</font>\n<br>give a person or animal plenty to eat, causing him or it to gain weight 长肥；养壮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pigs are being fattened up for market. 这些猪正在被催肥待售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is fattening up the ducks. 她正在把鸭子养肥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm trying to fatten him up as fast as I can. 我在努力尽快把他养得壮实些。</font>\n
fawn on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>fawn on/upon</font>\n<br>flatter slavishly; ingratiate oneself with 奉承；讨好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One should neither fawn upon those above him nor scorn those below him. 人决不可媚上骄下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fawns upon anyone with influence. 谁有影响力，她就巴结谁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like Toby, as he always fawns on the rich. 我不喜欢托比，因为他老是向有钱人献殷勤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't try to win his support in that way, he hates to be fawned on. 不要试图用那个办法赢得他的支持，他讨厌别人奉承他。</font>\n
fear for	<font color=blue size=4>fear for</font>\n<br>worry about 为…担心；害怕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All mothers fear for their children when they first leave home. 天下母亲都为初次离家的孩子担心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor said, “There's no need to fear for him. He is going to get well. ”医生说：“不必为他担忧，他的病会好的。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We feared for his health. 我们为他的健康而担忧。</font>\n
feast one's eyes on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>feast one's eyes on/upon</font>\n<br>look at and enjoy very much 饱眼福；很是欣赏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Foreign visitors feasted their eyes on the beautiful scenery in Hangzhou. 外宾们饱览杭州的秀丽风景。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He feasted his eyes on the beautiful painting. 他很欣赏这幅美丽的画。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They feasted their eyes on the ancient structures in this city. 他们用赞美的眼光观赏了这座城市的古老建筑。</font>\n
feather in one's cap	<font color=blue size=4>feather in one's cap</font>\n<br>sth. to be proud of; an honor 值得骄傲的事；荣誉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a feather in his cap to win first prize. 他赢得一等奖，真是件值得骄傲的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It'll be a feather in your cap if you can get an interview with him. 你如果能见到他，那将是件值得骄傲的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is no small feather in a man's cap if he has been no worse than his neighbours. 一个人如果不比周围人差，那是一件很值得骄傲的事。</font>\n
feather one's nest	<font color=blue size=4>feather one's nest</font>\n<br>1. use for yourself money and power, esp. from a public office 营私；饱私囊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He used his position and in fluence to feather his nest. 他利用自己的地位和权势谋取私利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She may do something for you, but she'll be feathering her own nest at the same time. 她会为你做些好事，但同时她会从中捞些好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before liberation, many officials feathered their nests through corruption. 解放前，许多官吏通过贪污中饱私囊。</font>\n<br>2. make one's home pleasant and comfortable; decorate one's house 装饰家庭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Furniture stores welcome young couples who want to feather their nests. 家俱店很欢迎想装饰房屋的年轻夫妇光临。</font>\n
fed up with	<font color=blue size=4>fed up with</font>\n<br>bored with; at the end of one's patience; tired; depressed 受够了；厌烦；对…厌倦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People get fed up with anyone who brags all the time. 人们讨厌老是自吹自擂的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am fed up with his laziness and carelessness. 我受够了他的懒惰和粗心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are fed up with his grumbling. 我们已经听厌了他的牢骚怪话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm fed up with this weather, it's time we had some sunshine. 我对这种天气极其厌倦，该出太阳了。</font>\n
feed back	<font color=blue size=4>feed back</font>\n<br>1. return as feedback 反馈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Teachers should attach importance to what is feeding back from the students. 教师们应该对从学生处反馈来的信息给予重视。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher found that nothing was feeding back to him from his students. 这位教师发觉学生们对他的讲解毫无反应。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The computer feeds back everything you need to know. 计算器反馈你所需要了解的一切事情。</font>\n<br>2. affect or modify the process that brought it about 影响或修改原过程，反过来对原过程起促进作用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lot of ideas are feeding back from the applied science into the pure science. 应用科学的许多概念反过来对理论科学起着促进作用。</font>\n
feed off	<font color=blue size=4>feed off</font>\n<br>1. eat one's food from (a place, a dish, etc.) 从…取得食物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guests sat crosslegged around a low table and fed off a big plate. 客人们围着一张矮桌子盘腿而坐，吃大盘子里的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pigs fed off the same trough. 这些猪在一个食槽里吃食。</font>\n<br>2. use as a source or supplier of food, materials, energy, etc. 以…为食物、材料、能量等的来源\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These little bears feed off the leaves of this special tree. 这些小熊以这种特殊的树叶为食。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When fresh food and water are not available, the camel can feed off its hum. 当得不到新鲜食物和水时，骆驼能以驼峰为养料的来源。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To avoid a power cut, they decided to feed off an alternative generator. 为了防止停电，他们决定靠备用发电机发电。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some bigger newspapers feed off reports in smaller papers. 一些大报常采用小报的新闻报道。</font>\n
feed on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>feed on/upon</font>\n<br>1. live on; take as food 以…为食物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cattle feed chiefly on grass. 牛主要以草为食。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What do you feed your dog on? 你用什么喂你的狗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We feed our dogs on fresh meat. 我们用新鲜的肉喂狗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of employment and feeds on a friend. 他失业了，靠朋友生活。</font>\n<br>2. become nourished, satisfied or strengthened from; consume or utilize from 从…得到供养、满足、增强；以…为能源\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His convictions feed on determination. 由于有了决心，他的信心增强了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The eye feeds on beautiful objects. 美景悦目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gas turbine feeds on the fuel it pumps. 燃气轮机以它抽入的燃料为能源。</font>\n
feed up	<font color=blue size=4>feed up</font>\n<br>give sb. plenty of good, nourishing food in order to build up his body 给某人足够的营养食物以增进健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fed him up on the best food she could get. 她尽可能地给他补养。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are very weak after your illness, so we'll have to feed you up. 病后你很虚弱，我们得让你补养起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must feed up to grow stronger. 你必须吃点有营养的食物使身体长得更强壮些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your child looks too thin; he needs feeding up. 你的孩子看上去太瘦了，他需要加强营养。</font>\n
feel at home	<font color=blue size=4>feel at home</font>\n<br>feel comfortable 感到很舒畅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had a good time by the sea during the holidays. Everybody felt quite at home there. 我们假期里在海滨玩得很痛快，每个人都感到舒畅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you feel at home if you are on board a ship? 如果在船上，你感到舒服吗？</font>\n
feel for	<font color=blue size=4>feel for</font>\n<br>1. pity; sympathize with 同情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel for that poor widow. 我同情那可怜的寡妇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's easy to feel for people in need; it's harder to bring youself to do something practical about it. 对有困难的人表示同情是容易的，但要自己为些做点实际的事情就不那么容易了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all felt for the parents on the loss of their only child. 我们对那死去独子的父母深表同情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt for her in her sorrow. 他同情她的痛苦。</font>\n<br>2. search for sth. with the hands 用手摸索\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt for the book in the dark room, but could not find it. 我在没有灯光的房间里摸着找书，但未能找到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the fog he felt for the kerb with his walkingstick. 他在雾中用手杖试探路边的镶边石。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She felt along the wall for the door. 她沿着墙在摸门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old woman felt in her pocket for the piece of paper on which her son had written down the address. 那位老妇人在口袋里摸一张纸条，上面有她儿子写下的地址。</font>\n
feel/know in one's bones	<font color=blue size=4>feel/know in one's bones</font>\n<br>sense or suspect that sth. is the case 预感；猜想；觉得会；确信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel it in my bones that they will never get along well together. 我预感到他们永远不会相处得好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know in my bones that God will protect us. 我相信上帝一定会保佑我们的。</font>\n
feel like	<font color=blue size=4>feel like</font>\n<br>1. seem like to the touch 摸起来如同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This new manmade material feels like real leather. 这种新的人造材料摸起来如同真皮革。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm holding something that feels like a potato. 我拿着一个摸上去像土豆的东西。</font>\n<br>2. feel as if one is 感觉象是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt like a fool at that moment. 我那一会儿好像是个呆子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt like an idiot when I answered wrong. 当我答错时，我自觉像是个白痴。</font>\n<br>3. be inclined to; have the desire to 想要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you feel like a swim? 你想游泳吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel like taking a walk. Would you like to go with me? 我想去散散步，你愿和我一起去吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt like laughing at the joke. 听了这个笑话，我想笑。</font>\n
feel like a million (dollars) 	<font color=blue size=4>feel like a million (dollars) </font>\n<br>be in the best of health and spirits 精神旺盛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a headache yesterday but feels like a million dollars today. 他昨天还头痛，但今天却感到精神很好。</font>\n
feel out	<font color=blue size=4>feel out</font>\n<br>talk or act carefully with sb. and find what he thinks 试探；摸清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's feel out the situation first before we take any definite steps. 我们先把情况摸清，再采取具体措施。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The best thing to do is to feel out where he stands before we broach the subject with him. 在和他商量这个问题以前，我们最好先摸清楚他的意见究竟如何。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first the boxers felt each other out. 拳击赛一开始，拳击手各自小心试探对方的实力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John felt out his father about letting him have the car yesterday evening. 昨天晚上约翰试探他父亲，看他是否能把车借给他。</font>\n
feel up to/feel equal to	<font color=blue size=4>feel up to/feel equal to</font>\n<br>feel able to; feel capable of (undertaking) 觉得能够担任；感到有能力做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm so tired that I don't feel up to going shopping today. 我很疲劳，今天不能去买东西了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you feel up to going to the theater after your recent illness? 你最近刚好，有精神去看戏吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't feel equal to the task. 他感到自己担当不了这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a person who never feels up to a challenging position, so we can not count on him. 他是一个永远也不能担负起具有挑战性工作的人，因此我们不能依靠他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can go on now if you feel up to it. 如果你觉得能干，我们就继续下去。</font>\n
feel with	<font color=blue size=4>feel with</font>\n<br>sympathize with 同情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole nation feels with the families of those who were drowned in the great floods. 全国都对遭受洪水灾害的家庭表示同情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We feel with her when her parents died. 她父母双亡时，我们都同情她。</font>\n
feet on the ground	<font color=blue size=4>feet on the ground</font>\n<br>an understanding of what can be done; sensible idea 实事求是；脚踏实地；明智的想法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John has his feet on the ground; he knows he cannot learn everything at once. 约翰是实事求是的，他知道他不能一下子把什么都学会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ted dreams of sudden riches, but Henry keeps his feet on the ground and expects to work for his money. 泰德梦想当暴发户，但亨利知道必须脚踏实地靠工作来赚钱。</font>\n
fence in	<font color=blue size=4>fence in</font>\n<br>1. enclose with a fence 用栅栏围起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fenced in his land. 他在自己的土地周围围起了栅栏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have fenced the garden in. 我们已将花园用栅栏围起来了。</font>\n<br>2. keep sb. from doing what he or she would like to do (usu. used in the passive) 限制或约束某人的自由（通常用被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary felt fenced in because her father would not let her drive a car or have dates with boys. 玛丽感到很不自由，因为她父亲阻止她开车或与男朋友约会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel fenced in by all these restrictions. 我觉得受限制太多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt fenced in by his ninetofive daily routine. 他感到早上9点到下午5点的例行公事，对他来说是一种约束。</font>\n
fence with	<font color=blue size=4>fence with</font>\n<br>talk with sb. to give skillful answers or arguments against sb. 敏答巧辩；搪塞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The governor was an expert at fencing with reporters at press conferences. 州长在记者招待会上很善于回避记者的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are very angry at his just fencing with our criticism. 他一味地对我们的批评进行搪塞，使我们很恼火。</font>\n
fend for oneself	<font color=blue size=4>fend for oneself</font>\n<br>feed oneself without outside assistance 独立谋生；照顾自己\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old couple have no one to do the washing and heavy cleaning; they have to fend for themselves. 这对老夫妇无人帮他们清洗打扫，他们只能自己照顾自己。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An orphan in the old society, he was left to fend for himself. 他在旧社会是个孤儿，全靠自己谋生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having depended on his aunt formany years, he finally decided to leave her home and fend for himself. 多年来他一直依靠姑母生活，后来他终于决定离开她家独自谋生。</font>\n
fend off	<font color=blue size=4>fend off</font>\n<br>ward off; keep off 躲开；挡回；避开；回避\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fended off the blow with his arm. 他用胳膊挡回了打击。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker fended off the diffi cult questions. 演讲者回避了难题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not the kind of person to fend off difficulties. 他决不是那种见了困难就躲开的人。</font>\n
ferret/smell out	<font color=blue size=4>ferret/smell out</font>\n<br>find or discover by diligent searching 找出；探出；搜出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The murderer was ferreted out. 凶手被查获了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John ferreted out the answer to the question in the library. 约翰在图书馆找到了问题的答案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where did you ferret out my book? I lost it long ago. 你从哪儿找到我这本书的？它已丢失好长时间了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane smelled out the boy's secret hiding place in the woods. 简发现了这男孩在树林里的秘密隐藏处。</font>\n
fetch up	<font color=blue size=4>fetch up</font>\n<br>1. eventually arrive (in a place) 到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all fetched up simultaneously at the same spot. 我们是在同时到达同一地点的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When did you fetch up in Nanjing? 你是什么时候到达南京的？</font>\n<br>2. come to a halt 突然停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car suddenly fetched up in front of our building. 那辆车突然在我们楼前停了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was fetched up short by the red light. 他突然被红灯挡住停下。</font>\n<br>3. make up (lost time, etc.) 弥补（失去的时间等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have been playing for two days in the week; I'll redouble my efforts to fetch up the lost time. 本周我已经玩了两天，我将加倍努力把失去的时间补上。</font>\n<br>4. vomit 呕吐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's very unwell and fetches up all he eats. 他病得不轻，吃什么吐什么。</font>\n<br>5. recall 回忆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He often fetches up his interesting life in his childhood. 他常常回忆他儿童时代的有趣的生活。</font>\n<br>6. raise; bring up 抚养；养大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fetched up two or phans. 她抚养了两个孤儿。</font>\n
few and far between	<font color=blue size=4>few and far between</font>\n<br>not many; few and scattered 稀少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Places where you can get water are few and far between in the desert. 在沙漠里你能得到水的地方是太少了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His holidays are few and far be tween. 他的假日真是太少了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Houses are few and far between in this area. 这个地区的房屋稀少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People who will work as hard as Thomas A. Edison are few and far between. 像托马斯•爱迪生那样勤奋工作的人很少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before the nineteenth century, scientists with an interest in the sea were few and far between. 十九世纪以前，对海洋感兴趣的科学家太少了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He resigned from the firm because promotions were few and far between. 他辞去了公司的差事，因为晋升的机会太少了。</font>\n
fiddle about/around	<font color=blue size=4>fiddle about/around</font>\n<br>spend time playing; act idly 虚度年华；鬼混\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go to college, you must work, not fiddle about. 如果你要上大学，就得努力，不要鬼混。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't stand there fiddling about, go on with your job. 不要站在那儿混时间，继续去干你的活吧！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you get on with your work, instead of just fiddling about? 你干吗不干事而在那儿鬼混？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop fiddling about with that radio set and listen to me. 别摆弄那台收音机浪费时间，听我讲话。</font>\n
fight against	<font color=blue size=4>fight against</font>\n<br>engage in war against; contend with; oppose 对…作战；与…斗争；反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Great Britain fought with France against Germany. 英国与法国并肩抵抗德国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has many temptations to fight against. 她必须抵抗许多诱惑。</font>\n
fight back/down	<font color=blue size=4>fight back/down</font>\n<br>struggle to control; suppress; hold in check 努力抑制；压服；克服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fought back her tears as she said goodbye. 她告别时抑制住了泪水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fought down her excitement and went on with her work. 她极力克制自己的激动，继续干工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firemen fought down the flames at last. 消防队员终于控制了火势。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fought down his anxiety. 他忍住急躁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to fight down her terror. 她尽力控制自己的恐惧感。</font>\n
fight it out	<font color=blue size=4>fight it out</font>\n<br>fight to the end; resolve or settle by fighting 决一雌雄；辩个明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fought it out with knives. 他们刀刃相见，决一雌雄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's not a good way to fight a dispute out. 决一雌雄来解决纷争，这不是一个好办法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no other course open to us but to fight it out. 我们除了打到底，别无出路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had better fight this thing out. 我们最好把这个问题辩个明白。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are determined to fight it out come what may. 不管怎么样，我们决心干到底，决一胜负。</font>\n
fight off	<font color=blue size=4>fight off</font>\n<br>1. defeat in a fight; repel 击退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fought off three men who attacked him. 他打退了3个袭击他的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our troops have fought the invaders off. 我们的部队已击退了侵略者。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boat's crew fought off the attack of the octopus. 船上水手们击退了大章鱼的袭击。</font>\n<br>2. drive away with effort 赶走；努力摆脱；驱除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although the girl tried to fight him off, in the end she was caught by him. 虽然这女孩努力摆脱他，但最后还是让他抓住了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fought off her drowsiness and went on with her reading. 她尽力驱赶睡意，继续读书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can fight off a cold by taking aspirin. 我们可以服用阿斯匹林来治疗感冒。</font>\n
fight one's way out	<font color=blue size=4>fight one's way out</font>\n<br>struggle to leave 打开一条生路；杀出一条活路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having been surrounded by the enemy, we must fight our way out. 我们已被敌人包围，必须杀出一条活路。</font>\n
figure on	<font color=blue size=4>figure on</font>\n<br>1. depend on; count on 依赖；指望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't figure on the weather being fine for your garden party. 不要指望花园聚会有好天气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was figuring on your support. 我指望你的支持。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can figure on him to be on time. 我们能指望他按时来。</font>\n<br>2. expect 打算；期待；估计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you figure on success, you stand a better chance of winning. 如果你想成功，你就有了取胜的较大可能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We figured on his coming and he came. 我们估计他要来，他真来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was something we had not figured on. 这是我们料想不到的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We did not figure on having so many people at the picnic. 我们没有料到会有这么多人参加野餐。</font>\n
figure out	<font color=blue size=4>figure out</font>\n<br>1. calculate; work out; estimate 计算（出）；估计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It would be difficult to figure out the losses at this time. 目前很难对损失作出估计。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't figure out how much money I owe them. 我算不出欠他们多少钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have figured out most carefully the time and the materials needed to complete the job. 我已经很仔细地算出了完成这项工作所需的时间和材料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He couldn't figure out the last problem on the arithmetic test. 他解不出算术考试卷上的最后一道题。</font>\n<br>2. understand with difficulty 理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't figure out what he was hinting at. 我不理解他的用意何在。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's difficult to figure out why she said those things at the meeting. 很难理解她为什么要在会上讲那些事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you figured out how to succeed without trying? 你有没有想出怎样才能不试而能成功？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish I could figure out how their 168minds work. 我要是能摸透他们的心事就好了。</font>\n
figure up	<font color=blue size=4>figure up</font>\n<br>reach or make a total of an amount; total 总计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you'll figure up exactly how much I owe you, I'll pay you right away. 如果你能算出我欠你多少，我马上就付给你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ask the waiter to figure our bill up; we want to go. 请服务员结账，我们要走了。</font>\n
fill in	<font color=blue size=4>fill in</font>\n<br>1. fill completely 填满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workman dug a hole, mended the pipe, and then filled the hole in again. 这位工人挖了一个洞，修好了管道，又将洞填了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ruts must be filled in so that traffic can pass. 这些车辙必须填平，以便车辆能够通过。</font>\n<br>2. write what is necessary on sth. such as a paper 填写\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You got the date wrong when you were filling in the check. 你填写支票时，把日期弄错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you get the application form, fill it in. 当你拿到申请表时，要填好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fill in your name and address here. 在这里写上你的姓名和地址。</font>\n<br>3. pass time 消磨时光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How am I going to fill in this afternoon now that he's not coming? 既然他不来，今天下午我该怎么度过呢？</font>\n<br>4. act as a replacement for; substitute 暂时代替\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't go to the meeting. Will you fill in for me? 我无法参加那个会，你能代替我去吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While our teacher was ill, Mr. Wang filled in for him. 当我们的老师生病时，王先生来代替了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll fill in if absolutely necessary. 如果绝对有必要，我来补缺。</font>\n<br>5. provide in full 详尽提供\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fill in the details for us? 你能向我们提供详细情况吗？</font>\n
fill one's shoes	<font color=blue size=4>fill one's shoes</font>\n<br>substitute satisfactorily for; take the place of sb. and do as well 成功地代替\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Jack got hurt, the coach had nobody to fill his shoes. 杰克受伤时，教练找不到能代替他的好球员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will be difficult to find someone to fill the old professor's shoes. 要找个能胜任的人来替代这位老教授的工作是很困难的。</font>\n
fill out	<font color=blue size=4>fill out</font>\n<br>1. complete sth. such as blanks, forms, etc. 填写（空格、表格等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please fill out the answers to the following questions. 请填写下述问题的答案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she applied for her passport, Grace had to fill out a half dozen different forms. 格蕾丝申请护照时得填写许多表格。</font>\n<br>2. (cause to) grow fatter（使）长胖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John stopped growing taller last year, and now he's filling out. 约翰去年不再长高了，而现在正在长胖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby has filled out a lot under the care of the nursery. 这婴儿在托儿所的照料下长胖了许多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have filled out a lot since I last saw you. 自我上一次看到你以后，你胖多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was pale and thin after her sickness, but in a few months she filled out. 这女孩病后面黄肌瘦，但几个月后又长胖了。</font>\n<br>3. make fuller, more substantial by adding material 充实；增补\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chief editor said they'll publish your paper if you can just fill it out a little. 主编说，只要你把论文内容稍加充实，他们就刊登。</font>\n
fill the bill	<font color=blue size=4>fill the bill</font>\n<br>be just what is needed; be good enough for sth. 正合需要；合乎条件\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With regard to putting him up for the summer, our cottage will just fiff the bill. 关于给他安排暑假的住处问题，我们的小别墅正适合他的需要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss was worried about hiring a deaf boy, but after he tried Tom out for a few weeks, he said that Tom filled the bill. 老板担心雇用一个耳聋的孩子，但试用汤姆几个星期以后，他说汤姆正符合他的条件。</font>\n
fill up	<font color=blue size=4>fill up</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) become completely full（使）装满；客满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lake is filling up after the heavy rain. 大雨之后湖水涨满。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please fill up the tank. 请把油箱装满。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She filled his glass up a second time. 她第2次给他斟满了杯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the theatres were quickly filling up. 所有的剧院很快客满了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vacancy in the office must be filled up. 办公室的空缺必须补充。</font>\n<br>2. complete sth. such as blanks, forms, etc. 填写（空格、表格等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want you to fill up this form according to my instructions. 我想让你按我的指示填写这张表格。</font>\n
fill…in on	<font color=blue size=4>fill…in on</font>\n<br>inform in full; give current information about 向某人详尽告知；介绍最新情况\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I missed the meeting. Fill me in on what happened. 我没有去开会。请告诉我发生了什么事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would someone please fill me in on this point? 请哪一位给我详细讲讲这一点，好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please fill me in on what's been happening while I've been away. 请把我不在时所发生的情况详细告诉我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The assistant filled his boss in on the details of the conference. 助理把会议的详细情况向老板作了汇报。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President had his advisor fill him in on the latest development in the financial crisis. 总统要他的顾问向他通报财政危机的最新发展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the new employee doesn't know about his duties, fill him in. 如果新的雇员不知道自己的职责，就要告诉他。</font>\n
find fault with	<font color=blue size=4>find fault with</font>\n<br>criticize unfavorably; speak badly about 吹毛求疵；对…不满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have no reason to find fault with him. 你无理对他挑剔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's reasonable to find fault with anyone who tries to lead you on. 对骗你的人感到不满是合理的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some persons are prone to find fault with others when they should be blaming themselves. 有些人当他们应当责备自己的时候却对别人吹毛求疵。</font>\n

's eyes appear favourable to sb. and be well received by him 获得某人的好感；得宠于某人；（建议等）被某人接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He found favour in the eyes of many people. 他获得很多人的好感。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This textbook quickly found favour with the students. 这本教科书很快获得了学生的好评。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This was obviously a reasonable suggestion; it didn't, however, find favour with your employer. 很明显，这是一个合情合理的建议，但是你的雇主却没有接受。</font>\n
find it in one's heart/find it in oneself	<font color=blue size=4>find it in one's heart/find it in oneself</font>\n<br>be able or willing because of one's nature 忍心；情愿（常用于否定和疑问句中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not find it in his heart to tell her about her mother's death. 他不忍心告诉她关于她母亲的死讯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't find it in my heart to refuse. 我不忍心拒绝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can I find it in my heart to disappoint the children? 我怎么忍心让孩子们失望呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He cannot find it in himself to condemn a mother who stole bread for a hungry child. 他不忍心判决一个由于孩子饥饿而偷面包的母亲有罪。</font>\n
find oneself	<font color=blue size=4>find oneself</font>\n<br>find out what one is fitted for and succeeds in that 发现自己适合某种工作；发现才能所在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary tried severak lines of work, but at last found herself as a teacher. 玛丽尝试过几种行业，但最后发现自己最适合当教师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sometimes young people move around a long time from job to job before they find themselves. 有时年轻人要花许多时间尝试各种工作以后才发现适合自己干的工作。</font>\n
find out	<font color=blue size=4>find out</font>\n<br>1. discover; learn 发现；查出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher was very angry when he found out that the student had been cheating. 老师发现那个学生作弊极为气愤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as all the facts have been found out, we can begin to formulate a theory. 全部事实一经查明，我们就能着手提出一个意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will find out all his secrets. 她将发现他所有的秘密。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The burglars were trying to find out how to open the safe. 夜盗想发现怎样打开保险柜。</font>\n<br>2. make enquiries about 打听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you try to find out when the trains leave? 请设法打听一下火车发车的时间好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you find out Mr Johnson's address for me? 你能帮我查一下约翰逊先生的地址吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please ring him up and find out about the plans for the summar vacation. 请给他打个电话，问问他打算如何度暑假。</font>\n
finish off/up	<font color=blue size=4>finish off/up</font>\n<br>1. end quickly; bring or come to an end; eat or drink up completely 结束；完成；吃光；喝光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He finished the work off yesterday. 他昨天把工作干完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting finished off with a prayer. 会议最后以祈祷而结束。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's finish off the wine. 我们把这些酒喝光吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can finish off with a glass of brandy. 我们最后来一杯白兰地就结束吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's finish up everything on the table. 让我们把桌上的东西全吃光吧。</font>\n<br>2. kill; destroy 毁掉；杀掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They finished off the criminal. 他们杀掉了那个罪犯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her illness last year nearly finished her off. 去年她那一场病差点送了她的命。</font>\n
fire away	<font color=blue size=4>fire away</font>\n<br>1. say what you have to say without further delay 赶快讲（多用于祈使句）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now, we are all ready to listen to your story, so fire away. 现在我们都准备听你讲故事，你快讲吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All right, fire away with your questions. 好吧，你就开始提问吧。</font>\n<br>2. continue firing 连续射击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our soldiers were firing away at the enemy. 我们的士兵连续向敌人射击。</font>\n
fire off	<font color=blue size=4>fire off</font>\n<br> (a series of questions, accusations, etc.) make them rapidly 一连提出（一系列的问题，责难等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No sooner had the speaker finished than a person in the audience fired off many questions at him. 演讲者刚讲完，一个听众一连向他提了许多问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His answers were fired off even more quickly than the questions had been. 他一个问题接一个问题地回答，其速度比提问者还要快。</font>\n
fire up	<font color=blue size=4>fire up</font>\n<br>become suddenly angry 突然发怒；突然发火\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fire up like that. No one meant to hurt your feelings. 不要这样发火，谁也没有要存心伤害你的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fired up as soon as he saw me. 他一看见我就发火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This old lady fires up at the least thing. 这老太太为一点小事就会发火。</font>\n
first and foremost	<font color=blue size=4>first and foremost</font>\n<br>as the first and principal thing 首先；最主要的是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our experiments are in comformity with the physical law, first and foremost with the Theory of Relativity. 我们的实验是符合自然法则的，首先是符合相对论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>First and foremost, we have to consider the morality of the enterprise. 首先，我们应当考虑企业的道德问题。</font>\n<br>He who would be a good student must, first and foremost, study hard. 想当好学生，先要努力学\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>First and foremost, the refugees needed food. 最重要的是，难民们需要食物。</font>\n
first and last	<font color=blue size=4>first and last</font>\n<br>1. all the time 始终；一直\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was first and last a school teacher. 她一直是名教师。</font>\n<br>2. most noticeably; chiefly 主要地；总的说来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He joined the army because first and last he wanted to help his country. 他参军的目的主要是为了报效祖国。</font>\n<br>3. totally 总共\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>First and last, that boy's education has cost＄ 4, 000. 那孩子的教育费用总共已花了4000美元。</font>\n
first of all	<font color=blue size=4>first of all</font>\n<br>before anything else 首先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One will be judged by one's speech first of all. 首先，察其言而知其人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you want to speak good English, you should first of all listen to good English as often as possible. 如果想英语说得好，首先应当尽可能地经常听好的英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Firt of all, let's read the new words. 首先，让我们读生词。</font>\n
first or last	<font color=blue size=4>first or last</font>\n<br>at one time or another 迟早\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may as well do this now, for you will have to do it first or last. 这件事你最好现在做，因为迟早你总得做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may do it first or last; I'm sure he doesn't care as long as you do it. 那件事你早做迟做都可以；我相信，只要你做，他是不会在乎早晚的。</font>\n
fish for	<font color=blue size=4>fish for</font>\n<br>1. try to get or to find out sth. by hinting or in a roundabout way 寻找；刺探；转弯抹角地得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Despite his pleasant manners, I suspected he was fishing for in formation about the decision made at the Board meeting. 尽管他态度愉快，我怀疑他在探听董事会上所做的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be taken in by his charm; he's fishing for an invitation to the big party. 不要被他的花言巧语所骗，他无非是想捞取盛大宴会的请贴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always fishing for compliments. 他总是想让别人恭维他。</font>\n<br>2. search for; search for underwater 搜寻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is fishing for pearls. 他正在采集珍珠。</font>\n
fish out	<font color=blue size=4>fish out</font>\n<br>1. bring out like a fish 打捞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl fell into the river and the soldier fished her out. 女孩掉进河里时，那位战士把她救上来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This river is in danger of being fished out. 这河里的鱼有被捕光的危险。</font>\n<br>2. bring out; draw or pull out 掏出；拉出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor old man fished out several coins from his pocket. 那个可怜的老人从口袋里掏出几个硬币。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fished out a bunch of keys from her handbag. 她从手提包里掏出一串钥匙来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fishing out his pipe, he filled it and puffed at it without a word. 他掏出烟斗，装满烟丝，一言不发地抽了起来。</font>\n
fish out of water	<font color=blue size=4>fish out of water</font>\n<br>a person who is out of his proper place in life; someone who doesn't fit in 如鱼离水；感到生疏；不自在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was the only girl at the party not in a formal dress and she felt like a fish out of water. 她在晚会上是唯一没有穿礼服的女孩，因此觉得很不自在。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A new boy feels like a fish out of water when he first goes to school. 新学童初上学时，总是感到很不习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he was away from his colleagues, he felt like a fish out of water. 离开了他的同事们，他感到如鱼离水一样，感到生疏。</font>\n
fit as a fiddle	<font color=blue size=4>fit as a fiddle</font>\n<br>in very good health 十分健康；精力旺盛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man is more than 80 years old but fit as a fiddle. 这位老人已经80多岁了，但仍身体健康，精神很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Li rested at home for a few weeks after his operation; now he is fit as a fiddle. 李教授手术后在家休息了几周，现在他精神很好。</font>\n
fit for	<font color=blue size=4>fit for</font>\n<br>suited for 对…合适的；有资格胜任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such a boat is fit only for a calm sea. 这种船只适于在风平浪静的海上航行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This meal is not fit for me. 这种饭不适合我吃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in poor health; he is not fit for heavy work. 他身体不好，不适合做重活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What kind of work are you fit for? 你适合做哪种工作？</font>\n
fit in	<font color=blue size=4>fit in</font>\n<br>1. find space for sth. 安排（地方）；放进；为某物腾出空间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was so much furniture in the room that it became impossible to fit any more in. 这个房间放了那么多家俱，不能再放进什么东西了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Somehow she managed to fit everything in the suitcase. 她设法把全部东西都装入箱子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you manage to fit this small table in somewhere? 你能设法找个地方放这张小桌子吗？</font>\n<br>2. find time for sb. 为某人腾出时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although I'm very busy, I'll try to fit in a game of tennis at the weekend. 尽管我很忙，本周末我打算安排打一场网球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope the hairdresser can fit me in today. 我希望理发师今天能给我安排个时间（理发）。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are still two patients to be fitted in this afternoon. 今天下午还有两位病人需要安排治疗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our director can't fit in any more visits this week. 本周我们主任已再没时间接待来访者了。</font>\n<br>3. adjust well to one's surroundings; live in harmony 适应环境；相处融洽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doesn't fit in here, I'm afraid. 我担心她在这儿不适应。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Brought up in a big city, he found it quite difficult to fit in in the countryside. 由于在城市长大，他发现他很难适应农村的环境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fitted in well with his room mates. 他和同房间的人处得很融洽。</font>\n
fit in with	<font color=blue size=4>fit in with</font>\n<br>1. accord; harmonize; coincide 符合；一致；协调；适应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This information does not fit in with what I was told yesterday. 这消息和我昨天听到的不一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The expectations may not fit in with the results. 估计与结果可能不相符。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must fit our plan in with yours. 我们的计划得和你们的一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your ideas fit in with mine. 你的想法和我的是一致的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our literature and art must fit in with our socialist economic base. 我们的文学艺术必须和我国的社会主义经济基础相适应。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our office fits in beautifully with its surroundings. 我们的办公室跟周围的环境很协调，显得很漂亮。</font>\n<br>2. cooperate; get on with 合作；和…相处得好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to fit in with the others, but it was difficult. 她力求与别人配合，但很难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For years, he has fitted in well with his neighbours. 多年来，他一直和邻居相处得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are you fitting in with your new colleagues in your new job? 你在新的工作岗位上与新的同事合得来吗？</font>\n
fit out	<font color=blue size=4>fit out</font>\n<br>equip 装备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship has been fitted out with a new engine. 那船已安装了一个新的发动机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must fit the expedition out with the best equipment. 我们必须给考察队最好的装备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is quite expensive nowadays to fit a child out with all he needs when he is going away to school. 如今，当孩子离家上学时，为他准备所需的各种物品，花费是相当可观的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hotel was fitted out in the latest style of comfort. 这家旅馆有舒适的最新设备。</font>\n
fit up	<font color=blue size=4>fit up</font>\n<br>1. fit together and place in position; install 固定；安装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took us about half an hour to fit up the apparatus. 我们花了半小时左右安装了这个设备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new machine has been fitted up for a trial. 这部新机器装配好了，准备试机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The carpenter fitted up the wall cupboards. 木匠装好了壁橱。</font>\n<br>2. equip to serve a specific purpose 为一定目的而布置；装置；配备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We fitted up one of the bedrooms as a study. 我们将其中一间卧室布置成书房。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A shed at the back of the house was fitted up as a workshop. 屋子后面的一间工棚被改成了一个车间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are to fit up that school with every modern convenience. 他们用一切现代化设备来装备那个学校。</font>\n<br>3. supply sb.
