's needs; supply with necessaries 供给；供给…必需物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His parents helped to fit him up for a long journey. 他父母帮他准备长途旅行用的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Could you fit me up with a new bike? 你能给我配备一部新自行车吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John needs fitting up with a new hearingaid. 约翰需要买一只新助听器。</font>\n
fix on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>fix on/upon</font>\n<br>1. make sth. stay firmly in place on 固定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tail is fixed on the model plane with nails, so it can't come off. 尾部用钉子固定在飞机模型上，这样就不会脱落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fix this lid on? It keeps coming off. 你能把这盖子安上吗？它总掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please fix on a new zip for me; the old one's broken. 请替我装付新拉链，那付旧的坏了。</font>\n<br>2. choose; select 选定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've fixed on starting tomorrow. 我们选定明天出发。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The date for the meeting has not yet been fixed upon. 开会日期尚未决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fixed on me to do the work. 他们选我做这工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What makes you fix upon that book? 你怎么会决定采用那本书的？</font>\n<br>3. determined on 决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim seems fixed on going abroad for his holiday. 吉姆看来已决定出国度假。</font>\n<br>4. direct (one's eyes or attention) steadily at; focus one's gaze or attention on 凝视；专心于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary kept her attention fixed upon the speaker. 玛丽始终注意演讲者。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fixed his eyes on me. 他注视着我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fixed her affection on him. 她钟情于他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My father often told me to fix my attention on what I was doing. 我父亲常常要我专心于我所做的事情。</font>\n<br>5. settle responsibility (authorship, blame, etc.) 判定责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crime was fixed on him. 他被判有罪。</font>\n
fix up	<font color=blue size=4>fix up</font>\n<br>1. arrange; make arrangements for 安排；为…作好安排\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's fix up to have a picnic together. 我们一起来安排一次野餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's fix up a time that suits everybody. 让我们安排一个对所有人都合适的时间吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have fixed up about the bus for next Saturday. 下星期六用公共汽车的事我已安排好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've fixed up to go out tonight. 我们已经安排今晚出门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I fixed up to go abroad for a holiday. 我安排出国度假。</font>\n<br>2. fit or put up; install 安装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A screen was fixed up to protect the spectators from the wind and rain. 安装了一个篷子使观众免于风吹雨淋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim has fixed up a workbench in his garden. 吉姆在花园里安装了一个工作台。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fixed up a temporary platform on the square. 他们在广场搭起了一个临时的演讲台。</font>\n<br>3. supply sb. 's needs 供给；供应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we can fix you up with what you want. 我想我们能供应你所需要的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fix me up with a new bulb for the headlight of my car? 你能给我一个车前灯的新灯泡吗？</font>\n<br>4. provide lodging for 为某人安排住处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we can fix you up for the night. 我想我们能安排你们今晚的住处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hotel attendants fixed up the tired travellers for the night. 旅馆的服务员为疲乏的旅客们安顿了住处。</font>\n<br>5. provide an opportunity or work for 为…提供机会或工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fixed me up with this job. 他们给我安排了这个工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you apply at the office, I'm sure they can fix you up with a job. 如果你到办事处申请，我相信他们会为你安排一个工作的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you fix me up with a parttime job? 你能给我安排一份业余工作吗？</font>\n<br>6. dress up; dress carefully 打扮；注意衣着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>De I have to fix up to go to their house? 我要衣冠整齐才能到他们家里去吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fixed herself up for the festival as neatly as she could. 为了过节，她把自己尽量打扮得漂漂亮亮的。</font>\n<br>7. set in order; arrange properly 整理；收拾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please fix your room up in the morning. 请在早上把你的屋子整理好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better tidy up your desk a bit and have all the drawers fixed up. 你最好整理一下你的书桌，把所有的抽屉都收拾一下。</font>\n<br>8. repair 修理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are having our old house fixed up. 我们正请人修理旧房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll fix up my car. 我要修理我的车子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The motor needs fixing up. 这部发动机需要修理了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old machine was fixed up and put to work again. 那台旧机器已修好，又开始运转了。</font>\n<br>9. attend to. 处理；照料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That dentist will fix your teeth up. 牙医会把你的牙补好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you get into trouble, the counselor will try to fix you up. 假如你有麻烦，律师会为你处理的。</font>\n<br>10. restore sb. from ill health; cure 使某人恢复健康；治愈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A few days'rest will fix you up. 休息几天就会使你恢复健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor fixed her up fine. 医生把她的病治好了。</font>\n<br>11. solve; arrange a settlement of; bring to a conclusion 解决；使结束；议定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've fixed up their differences. 他们已经解决了他们的分歧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A contract has been fixed up. 一份契约已经议定好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are trying hard to fix up their disputes. 我们正在努力解决他们之间的争执。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have fixed the matter up now. 他们现在已经解决了这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried in vain to fix up their differences. 他们试图解决他们的矛盾，但没有成功。</font>\n
flame out	<font color=blue size=4>flame out</font>\n<br>1. burst out in flames; flare out 突然冒出火焰；闪亮；突然闪耀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire flamed out instantly. 火立刻烧了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A beacon flamed out against the night sky. 灯塔在夜空下闪闪发光。</font>\n<br>2. break out into anger 勃然大怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You need not flame out so much. 你不必这样大发雷霆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His anger flamed out at the sight. 见此情景，他勃然大怒。</font>\n
flame up	<font color=blue size=4>flame up</font>\n<br>1. 2. ＝flame out 3. blush violently; glow 面孔发红\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was so shy that she would flame up when she saw a stranger. 这女孩很害羞，见到陌生人脸就红。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Colour flamed up in her cheeks. 她面颊发红了。</font>\n
flare up	<font color=blue size=4>flare up</font>\n<br>1. suddenly begin to burn more brightly or fiercely 突然烧起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire flared up again and then died. 火又突然燃烧起来，而后又熄灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When they put a burning match to the oil, it flared up. 他们把点燃的火柴放在油里，油一下就烧了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bonfire flared up as I poured petrol on to it. 我倒上汽油，那篝火便熊熊燃烧起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy bomber flared up when it was hit by antiaircraft artillery. 敌人那架轰炸机被高射炮击中，顿时燃烧了起来。</font>\n<br>2. burst into a sudden rage 突然发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His temper flared up when he heard how much money had been spent. 当他听到花钱的数目时，他突然发脾气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mayor flared up at the reporter's remark. 市长对记者的报道勃然大怒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The minute he mentioned her name, she flared up again. 他一提到她的名字，她又突然发怒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's no need for you to flare up at such a slight thing. 为了这点小事你大可不必发怒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I meant no harm by my remark, but she flared up at me as though I had insulted her. 我的话并没有恶意，可是她却对我大发其火，仿佛我侮辱了她似的。</font>\n<br>3. begin again suddenly, esp. for a short time after a quiet time; reach a more violent state 突然发作；突然复发；突然加剧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His arthritis flared up sometimes. 他的关节炎有时会突然发作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Late at night, my stomach trouble flared up again. 深夜，我的胃病又突然复发了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Feeling had risen so high that it seemed that a quarrel might flare up at any minute. 情绪已经非常激动，看来随时都有可能爆发一场争吵。</font>\n
flash back	<font color=blue size=4>flash back</font>\n<br>return or revert briefly to an earlier point in the story 倒叙；闪回故事中的某一主要情节\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The film suddenly flashed back to the hero's youth. 电影突然闪回到了男主角的青年时代。</font>\n
flash forward	<font color=blue size=4>flash forward</font>\n<br>move briefly to a later point in a story 提前叙述故事情节\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The film flashed forward to the death of the soldiers. 电影提前表现了战士们的牺牲。</font>\n
flash in the pan	<font color=blue size=4>flash in the pan</font>\n<br>a person or thing that starts out well but does not continue 昙花一现的人物；虎头蛇尾；短暂的成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary got 100 on the first test in arithmetic but it was just a flash in the pan because she later failed several times in arithmetic. 玛丽第一次算术考试得了100分，但只是昙花一现，因为后来几次算术考试都不及格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They won the first match, but it was only a flash in the pan, they lost all the other games. 他们赢了第1场比赛，可是好景不长，后面几场比赛全输了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was indeed popular for a short time, but he didn't last long, just a flash in the pan. 他的确红了一阵子，但好景不长，只不过是昙花一现而已。</font>\n
flash out	<font color=blue size=4>flash out</font>\n<br>1. speak in a sudden outburst of passion 情绪突然激动地说话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She flashed out at Martin：“Do you really believe that no one has any idea what's going to happen? ”她突然激动地对马丁说：“你真相信没有人想到要发生什么事情吗？”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She couldn't help flashing out at such a rude remark. 听了这种粗鲁无礼的话，她不禁勃然大怒。</font>\n<br>2. appear like a sudden bright light 突然发出闪光；闪亮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lightning flashed out from the black clouds. 乌云中电光闪闪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lights flashed out and night became day. 灯光闪烁，黑夜变得亮如白昼。</font>\n<br>3. appear or flash very quickly 很快地出现或闪现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With a pocket calculator, the exact answer flashes out as soon as one presses four buttons. 有了袖珍计算器，按下4个按钮，准确的答案就立即出现了。</font>\n
flatter oneself	<font color=blue size=4>flatter oneself</font>\n<br>feel assured; be sure of one's own talent or skill; be highly confident 自信；敢说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can flatter myself that my judgement is usually correct. 我可以自信地说我的判断通常是正确的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I flatter myself I can do it. 我自信我能做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She flatters herself that she is a better swimmer than he is. 她确信她的游泳技术比他高明。</font>\n
flesh and blood	<font color=blue size=4>flesh and blood</font>\n<br>1. a close relative; close relatives 骨肉；亲人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To my surprise, she gave me such an answer; she is my own flesh and blood. 令我大吃一惊，她竟这样回答我，她还是我的亲人呢！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was the old man's own flesh and blood. 这女孩是老人的亲骨肉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The people in Taiwan are our own flesh and blood. 台湾人民是我们的骨肉同胞。</font>\n<br>2. the appearance of being real or alive 真实感；活生生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The author doesn't give his characters any flesh and blood. 这位作家笔下的人物没有真实感。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a flesh and blood performance. 这是一次真实的演出。</font>\n<br>3. the human body 血肉之躯；普通人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before child labor laws, small children often had to work 50to 60hours a week in factories. It was more than flesh and blood could bear. 在儿童劳工法出现之前，童工在工厂里一个星期常常要工作50到60小时，这不是血肉之驱所能忍受的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is known that there are certain things which flesh and blood cannot bear. 人人都晓得，有一些事情是血肉之躯所不能忍受的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is flesh and blood, and has weaknesses like everyone else. 他同任何人一样，也是个有血有肉的普通人，也有他的不足之处。</font>\n
flesh out	<font color=blue size=4>flesh out</font>\n<br>1. fill or fatten; add to; make fuller, bigger or longer 使充实；增加；加多；加大；加长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This story isn't detailed enough; it needs to be fleshed out. 这个故事不够详细，还需要充实一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fleshed out his argument with solid facts. 他用确凿的事实来充实自己的论点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The author fleshed out his story by adding more about his war experience. 这位作家将他的战争经历更多地加进了这个故事，使故事更充实了。</font>\n<br>2. become heavier; put on weight or flesh 长肥；发胖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She lost weight after her illness but is beginning to flesh out again. 她病后瘦了，但现在又开始发胖了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That pig is fleshing out well. 那头猪正在迅速长膘。</font>\n
fling off	<font color=blue size=4>fling off</font>\n<br>1. leave abruptly; depart hastily 突然离开；急匆匆地离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She flung off in a fury. 她怒气冲冲地跑掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He flung off without saying a single word. 他一声不吭气呼呼地走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy slammed the door and flung off to school. 这孩子砰地一声把门关上，就往学校跑去。</font>\n<br>2. produce casually; give utterance or expression to (a compliment, a tune, etc.) casually 偶然发出；漫不经心地发出（赞美的话、曲调等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He just flung off a remark about getting a new job. 他偶然谈起要找一份新的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She flung off a merry tune. 她随意地哼出愉快的调子。</font>\n<br>3. discard; rid oneself of 丢弃；摆脱；甩开（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you manage to fling off your pursuer? 你是怎样设法甩掉追你的人的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has decided to fling off all restraints. 她已决定摆脱所有的限制。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish I could fling off all these petty considerations. 我要是能摆脱这些杂念该多好。</font>\n
fling up	<font color=blue size=4>fling up</font>\n<br>1. give up; resign from 放弃；辞去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talked to me of flinging up the design of building a new house. 他跟我谈到要放弃盖新房子的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel like flinging it all up. 我想全部都放弃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He says he'll fling up the whole thing if they don't give him more money. 他说如果他们不多给钱，他就把整个事情都辞掉。</font>\n
fly high	<font color=blue size=4>fly high</font>\n<br>feel very happy; feel joyful 心神荡漾；心花怒放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack was flying high after histeam won the game. 杰克的球队获胜后，他高兴得不得了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was flying high when this reversal occurred, and now he's in low spirits again. 正当他情绪高昂时，受到了挫折，现在他又灰心丧气了。</font>\n
fly into	<font color=blue size=4>fly into</font>\n<br>suddenly develop or exhibit 突然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He flew into a rage when he heardthe news. 他听到这一消息很生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fly into a temper with me ！别跟我发脾气！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students in Class Two flew into raptures when their team won the game. 二班的球队获胜时，全班学生欣喜若狂。</font>\n
fly out	<font color=blue size=4>fly out</font>\n<br>1. rush out suddenly 冲出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A cry of “Fire” was raised and all the people flew out of the house. 失火的叫喊声一起，所有的人都冲出室外。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As I was passing the gate, a dog flew out at me. 当我走过大门口时，一只狗向我冲来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children flew out to see the parade. 孩子们奔出去看游行队伍。</font>\n<br>2. burst into a passion 发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I tried to calm him down when he flew out at me. 他对我大发脾气时，我设法使他平静下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fly out into a rage. 不要发脾气。</font>\n<br>3. go out in an aircraft; carry out in an aircraft 乘飞机外出；用飞机把…运走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The commander flew out to join his troops at the front. 指挥官乘飞机到前线部队去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The in jured in the earthquakestricken area were quickly flown out for medical treatment. 地震灾区的伤员们被迅速空运出去进行治疗。</font>\n
fob off	<font color=blue size=4>fob off</font>\n<br>1. get sth. false or inferior accepted as good or real; trick or deceive sb. into buying or accepting 以假货或次货骗人；欺骗某人购买或接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Actually the foreign stamps displayed in the window were of very little value, but he had found that they could be fobbed off upon children. 说实在的，橱窗里展出的外国邮票并没有什么价值，但他发现那些邮票却可以拿来哄骗小孩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The peddler fobbed off pieces of glass as diamonds. 这小贩鱼目混珠，以玻璃充当钻石骗人。</font>\n<br>2. put aside ; not really answer but get rid of 丢在一边；置之不理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her little brother asked where she was going, but she fobbed him off with an excuse. 她弟弟问她去哪里，但她却借故不答。</font>\n<br>3. put sb. off by deception or trickery 用欺骗、诡计打发某人；搪塞某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to fob us off with the excuse that he had been ill, and so had overlooked the matter. 他企图以病为借口欺骗我们，说因为生病才忽略了这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the creditors demanded their money, they were fobbed off with a promise to pay them when he received his rents at the end of the month. 当债主们来索钱时，他以月底拿到租钱就付款的谎言搪塞他们。</font>\n
focus on	<font color=blue size=4>focus on</font>\n<br>1. aim (light) directly onto 把（光）在…上聚成焦点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you focus bright sunlight on dry wood with a magnifying glass, it will start burning . 用放大镜把强阳光聚焦到干柴上，干柴就会燃烧起来。</font>\n<br>2. direct one's thoughts firmly on 思想集中到…上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must focus our attention the question of reducing costs. 我们必须把注意力集中到降低成本这个问题上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience focused its attention on the speaker. 听众把注意力都集中在演讲者身上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She focused her mind on her lessons. 她把她的心思都集中在学习上。</font>\n<br>3. have as its main point of interest 重点是；中心是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This year our meeting focuses on the question of children's rights. 今年，我们的会议中心议题是儿童的权益。</font>\n
fold up	<font color=blue size=4>fold up</font>\n<br>1. end in failure;go bankrupt;close up 以失败而告终；破产；倒闭；停止营业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The business folded up. 买卖失败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In an economic crisis, smaller enterprises are usually among the first to fold up. 小的企业在经济危机中往往最先倒闭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most of his amibitious schemes folded up on him. 他的野心勃勃的计划大部分都玻产了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new restaurant folded up in less than a year. 这家新开的饭馆不到一年就关门了。</font>\n<br>2. suffer moral or spiritual collapse 垮掉；精神崩溃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't fold up when her only son died. She kept on working even harder. 当她的独生子死去时，她并没有精神崩溃，相反更加努力地继续工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He folded up when the prosecutor discredited his story. 当检察官不相信他的陈述时，他精神崩溃了。</font>\n<br>3. collapse with mirth or pain（因高兴或疼痛）坍下来（笑得要命，痛得要命等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From the moment the clown appeared on stage, the audience folded up in their seats. 这个小丑一上场，观众们就坐在椅子上笑得前俯后仰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pain in her stomach was so sharp that she folded up. 她的胃疼得她连腰都直不起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He folded up with laughter. 他笑弯了腰。</font>\n<br>3. make smaller by folding 迭小\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She folded up the papers. 她迭起了报纸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fold up your clothes tidily, please. 请把你的衣服迭整齐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you fold up the garden chairs and put them in the storeroom? 你能把花房里的折迭椅迭起来放入储藏室去吗？</font>\n<br>4. collapse;break down 坍塌；倒塌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sat down on the chair, but it suddenly folded up under him. 他往椅子上一坐，但是突然那椅倒塌下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The table folded up under the heavy weight. 这张桌子因上面放的东西太重而倒塌了。</font>\n
follow on	<font color=blue size=4>follow on</font>\n<br>1. continue to follow 继续下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is determined to follow on despite every difficulty. 他决心不顾困难，继续干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be back in ten minutes. Meanwhile, you just follow on. 我过10分钟回来，你们接着干下去就是了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In our broadcast, fifteen minutes of music will follow on the news reports. 在我们的广播里，新闻报道以后，紧接着就是15分钟的音乐节目。</font>\n<br>2. continue;follow after an interval 停过一段时间再继续下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall follow on from where he left off. 我们将从他停下来的地方接下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The later books follow on from the earlier ones. 后出的书接续前面出的书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go first, and we'll follow on after a short rest. 你先去，我们稍微休息一会儿就来。</font>\n<br>3. (specifically theatre) come on after（主要用于戏剧）在…之后上场；接着上场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He goes on first and then you follow him on. 他先上场，你接着上。</font>\n
follow out	<font color=blue size=4>follow out</font>\n<br>1. do fully; carry out; finish 贯彻执行；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy followed out the instructions and made a fine model plane. 这男孩按照说明书完成了一个模型飞机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you have formed a plan you must follow it out. 计划订出之后，你就必须贯彻执行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's imperative that you follow out the doctor't directions. 你必须遵照医嘱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They followed out their orders to the letter. 他们不折不扣地执行命令。</font>\n<br>2. keep working at sth. until it is finished; follow to the end or to a conclusion 对…寻根究底；把…搞个水落石出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The student followed out all the index references in the encyclopedia until he found what he wanted to know. 这位学生查遍百科全书内所有的索引，最后终于找到了他所想要的数据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>case, we ought to follow out all the leads. 要把这个案件搞个水落石出，我们就应该把所有的线索都调查清楚。</font>\n
follow through	<font color=blue size=4>follow through</font>\n<br>finish a movement that one has started; continue an action to its natural ending 继续完；坚持到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To initiate a thing takes courage; to follow it through requires perseverance. 创始一件事情需要勇气，把它坚持下去则需要毅力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Richard is determined to follow his plan through. 理查德德决心把自己的计划贯彻到底。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Follow the argument through to its logical conclusion. 把这个论点的研究坚持下去，直到得出合乎逻辑的结论。</font>\n
follow up	<font color=blue size=4>follow up</font>\n<br>1. seek further details about 对…仔细调查；把…追查到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They followed the matter up until they got results. 他们追查此事，直到得出结果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The editor thinks that this story is worth following up . 编辑认为这个情况值得跟踪报道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Follow up these clues and analyse them carefully. 抓住这些线索加以仔细分析。</font>\n<br>2. chase or follow closely and without giving up 紧随不舍；跟踪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Indians followed up the wounded buffalo until it fell dead. 那位印第安人紧跟着受伤的野牛直至其死亡为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They followed the criminal up like a shadow and arrested him at his lodging. 他们形影不离地跟踪那个罪犯，并在他住所逮捕了他。</font>\n<br>3. reinforce; make (an action) \n<br>more successful by doing sth. more 加强；用进一步的行动来加强…的效果；再接再厉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We followed up our victory by attacking the enemy on all fronts. 我们乘胜向敌人全面进攻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They followed up the programme with another just as good. 他们接着表演另一个同样好的节目来充实演出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor followed up Billy's operation with Xrays and special exercises to make his foot stronger. 医生对比利手术后又继续以爱克斯光以及特别的物理治疗使他的脚能够好转。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't rest on your laurels; follow up your success and strive for greater contributions to the people. 不要吃老本，要发扬成绩，争取为人民作出更大的贡献。</font>\n<br>4. folllow (an action, etc.) with a similar or related act; continue a process already begun 继续以某个相同的或有关的行动干下去；继续已开始的行动；继承\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The series is to be followed up by another programme of a similar theme. 在这个系列节目后还有一个跟这个主题相近的节目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker followed up with figures. 演讲者接着列举了数字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will be well for us to follow up what our predecessors have done. 我们把前人所创立的功业继承下去，这是一件好事。</font>\n
fond of	<font color=blue size=4>fond of</font>\n<br>liking 喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice is fond of modern music. 爱丽斯喜欢现代音乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm fond of listening to detective stories. 我喜欢听侦探故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is fond of pldy than of work. 他爱玩不爱工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man is fond of fishing. 这老人喜欢钓鱼。</font>\n
fool about/around	<font color=blue size=4>fool about/around</font>\n<br>1. spend time idly or aimlessly; waste time 虚度光阴；无所事事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spends so much time fooling around that he never accomplishes anything. 他虚度光阴大多，所以一事无成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fooled around too much with minor details. 他们在次要的细节上浪费了太多的时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told the students not to fool about, but to get down to work. 老师嘱咐学生们不要虚度光阴，要认真学习。</font>\n<br>2. play and joke;spend time foolishly with little result; trifle 干蠢事；胡闹；鬼混；玩弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is capable, but he fools around too much. 他很能干，但是他蠢事干得太多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The monitor told his classmates not to fool about in the classroom while they should be reviewing their lessons. 班长叫同学们在应当复习功课的时候不要在教室里胡闹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone knows he's been fooling around with some girl at the office. 人人都知道他一直在办公室与某个姑娘鬼混。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fool around with the knife, you may cut yourself. 不要玩弄刀，会划破皮的。</font>\n
fool away	<font color=blue size=4>fool away</font>\n<br>waste foolishly 白白浪费；挥霍光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Paul failed history because he fooled away his time instead of studying. 保尔因白白浪费时间不读书，所以历史考试不及格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man won a lot of money, but he soon fooled it away and was poor again. 这人赢了一大笔钱，但不久挥霍得干干净净再度穷困。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fooled away his week's allowance in two days. 他两天内就把他一个星期的津贴挥霍掉了。</font>\n
fool with	<font color=blue size=4>fool with</font>\n<br>1. handle or play with idly or carelessly 瞎弄；玩弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't fool with my papers; you may get them out of order. 不要翻弄我的论文，你会弄乱的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog has a vicious temper ; you had better not fool with him. 那条狗脾气很坏，你最好不要乱逗它。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was hurt while fooling with a loaded gun. 那男孩子是在摆弄一支装有子弹的枪时受伤的。</font>\n<br>2. contend or fight without serious intent with; toy with 不认真地和…竞争或斗争；和…戏耍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boxing champion fooled with his opponent for six rounds and then knocked him out. 这位拳击冠军耍了他的对手6个回合，然后把他击败了。</font>\n
foot in the door	<font color=blue size=4>foot in the door</font>\n<br>the first step toward getting or doing sth; a start toward success 第一步；开始；通向成功的开端\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let Jane get her foot in the door by joining the club or soon she'll want to be president. 不要让简有参加俱乐部的机会，否则不久她就想当主任。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These connections would at best enable him only to get his foot in the door. 这些人事关系最多只能帮助他取得初步的成功罢了。</font>\n
foot the bill	<font color=blue size=4>foot the bill</font>\n<br>pay all the expenses incurred 负担费用；付款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Order what you like, I'll foot the bill. 订购你喜欢的东西，我来付款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to foot the bill for his son's extravagance. 他不得不付他儿子挥霍的款项。</font>\n
for a certainty/for certain	<font color=blue size=4>for a certainty/for certain</font>\n<br>for sure; without doubt 确定地；无疑地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Iknow it for a certainty that he'll get a promotion. 我的确知道他将被提升。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know for a certainty that he came from Shanghai. 我确实知道他来自上海。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He left town a week ago, I know this for a certainty. 他一星期前离开了这个城市，这一点我确实知道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you know it for certain? 你对这件事肯定知道吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could not say for certain that he was wrong. 我不能断然地说他错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know for certain that he has come. 我确实知道他来了。</font>\n
for a change	<font color=blue size=4>for a change</font>\n<br>for variety 换换花样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am tired of watching television every night. Let's go to a movie for a change. 每天晚上看电视我都厌了，我们去看场电影换换口味吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've always gone to Shanghai by train; let's go by boat this time for a change. 我们以往去上海总是乘火车，这次我们换个方法，乘船去吧。</font>\n
for all	<font color=blue size=4>for all</font>\n<br>despite; in spite of 虽然；尽管\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all his wealth, he is still unhappy. 他虽有钱，却还是不幸福。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all his knowledge and experience, he is not conceited. 尽管他有丰富的知识和经验，可他并不自满。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all your persuasion, he will not change his mind. 不管你怎么劝说，他不会改变主意的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all you say, Istill like him. 尽管你这样说，我还是喜欢他。</font>\n
for all I care	<font color=blue size=4>for all I care</font>\n<br>having nothing to do with me 与我无关；我不管；不在乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all I care, you can leave whenever you want to. 你愿什么时候走就什么时候走，与我无关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all I care, you can throw it away. 你可以把它扔掉，我不在乎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He may go to the devil for all I care. 他可以去死，我不管。</font>\n
for all I know	<font color=blue size=4>for all I know</font>\n<br>1. to my knowledge 就我所知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He may be in Africa for all I know. 就我所知，他可能在非洲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all I know, he may have already left for school. 就我所知，他可能已经上学去了。</font>\n<br>2. (used like a negative) indicating that the speaker does not know at all（表示否定）不知道；不在乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all I know, you might be in Boston. 我不知道你们会在波士顿。</font>\n
for all that	<font color=blue size=4>for all that</font>\n<br>in spite of what has been said, done, etc. 虽然如此；尽管这样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For all that he can't be admitted as a member of the club. 虽然如此，他不能被接收成为俱乐部的一员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers were very tired but they continued their march for all that. 战士们很累了，尽管如此，他们还是继续行军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everybody thought him guilty, but for all that he was innocent . 每个人都以为他有罪，尽管如此，他是清白的。</font>\n
for all the world	<font color=blue size=4>for all the world</font>\n<br>1. for anything; for any price 无论如何；无论何价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would not change places with him for all the world. 我无论如何不和他换位子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I told him that I would not change my mind for all the world. 我告诉他，我无论如何也不会改变主意的。</font>\n<br>2. just exactly 的确；完全\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby is for all the world like its father. 这婴儿完全像他的父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You look for all the world like the nurse in our hospital. 你看上去非常象我们医院里的一位护士。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This case looks for all the world like the one we just concluded. 这个案件跟我们刚才了结的那个案件完全相同。</font>\n
for a moment/minute	<font color=blue size=4>for a moment/minute</font>\n<br>for a very short period of time 一会儿；片刻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She hesitated for a moment and tears appeared in her eyes. 她踌躇片刻，泪水从眼中涌了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I did not lose my presence of mind for a moment. 我一会儿也没有失去冷静。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Won't you come in for a moment? 你不进来坐一会儿吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not for a moment do I doubt that I'll pass the exam. 我丝毫不怀疑我会通过这次考试。</font>\n
for a song	<font color=blue size=4>for a song</font>\n<br>at a low price ; for a bargain price;cheaply 低价；廉价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sold the invention for a song but its buyers are the ones who get rich. 他廉价卖出了新发明，买主却发了大财。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now watermelons flood the market and can be bought everywhere for a song. 现在市场上到处是西瓜，在哪儿都可以很便宜地买到。</font>\n
for a time	<font color=blue size=4>for a time</font>\n<br>temporarily; for a certain period 一时地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This method was used for a time, but it is no use now . 这个方法曾被用于一时，但现在已不用了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys stayed with their uncle for a time. 孩子们有一段时间曾和他们的叔叔住在一起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't remember his name for a time. 我一时想不起他的名字了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was for a time a professor at Cambridge. 他一度是剑桥大学的教授。</font>\n
for a while	<font color=blue size=4>for a while</font>\n<br>for a period of time 暂时；片刻；一会儿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wait for a little while, as I shallbe back in a few minutes. 等一会儿，因为我马上就回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's rest for a while. 让我们休息一会儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you lay that difficult math problem aside for a while ？你为什么不把那道数学难题暂时放一边呢？</font>\n
force on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>force on/upon</font>\n<br>compelto accept 逼迫做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't force food on children. 你不要强令孩子吃东西。</font>\n
foreign to	<font color=blue size=4>foreign to</font>\n<br>not belonging to or suitable for; unconnected with 非…所有的；不适于；与…无关的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sitting still all day is foreign to a healthy boy's nature. 终日静坐不符合健康男孩的性格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your argument is foreign to the question. 你的争论与题无关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your idea is completely foreign to my principle. 你的意见一点也不适合我的原则。</font>\n
for ever	<font color=blue size=4>for ever</font>\n<br>eternally 永远地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will be faith ful to you for ever. 我将永远忠于你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Truth will live for ever. 真理永存。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has decided to give up smoking for ever. 他决心永远戒烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His name should also live for ever. 他的名字亦将永垂不朽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will remain unchanged for ever. 这一辈也变不了。</font>\n
for example/for instance	<font color=blue size=4>for example/for instance</font>\n<br>as an example; as proof; to give an example or illustration 例如；举例说明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many great men have risen from poverty, Lincoln and Edison, for example. 许多伟人出身贫寒，例如林肯和爱迪生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In physics, for example, “ to do work”means to move matter through a distance by a force. 例如，在物理方面, “作功”意味着用一个力把一个物体移动一段距离。</font>\n
for fear	<font color=blue size=4>for fear</font>\n<br>because of fear, in order to avoid or prevent 免得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He works hard for fear of failing. 为防止失败，他工作很努力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She hurried back to school for fear of missing too many classes. 为了避免缺课太多，她赶忙回到学校。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She won't go up in an airplane for fear of an accident. 她因为怕出事故不想乘飞机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She worried for fear that the child zcmrtrtw for fear that the child would be hurt. 她担心孩子受伤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked very fast for fear he should be late. 他走得很快生怕迟到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I daren't tell you what he did for fear (that) he should be angry with me. 我不敢告诉你他所做的事，怕他对我发脾气。</font>\n
for free	<font color=blue size=4>for free</font>\n<br>without having to pay; free 免费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hey, you guys, look at this balloon！They're for free down at the new store. 喂，你们来看这个气球，这是那家新开的商店免费供应的。</font>\n
for good/for good and all	<font color=blue size=4>for good/for good and all</font>\n<br>forever; permanently 永远地；一劳永逸地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He says that he is leaving the country for good . 他说他此次出国将永不回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the drunken driving arrest, Mr. Green quit drinking for good. 酒后驾车被抓起来以后，格林先生就永远戒酒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hoped that the repairs would stop the leak for good. 他希望修理后能一劳永逸不再漏水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a communist society exploitation and oppression will be done away with for good and all. 在共产主义社会中剥削和压迫将永远被废除。</font>\n
for good measure	<font color=blue size=4>for good measure</font>\n<br>as sth. more added to what is expoeted or needed ; as an extra 附加的；额外的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sold me the car at a cheap price and included the radio for good measure. 他廉价将车卖给我，而且还另赠送了收音机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sold me the house at a cheap price and threw in some of the furniture for good measure. 他廉价把房子卖给了我，还奉送了一些家俱。</font>\n
for goodness' sake	<font color=blue size=4>for goodness' sake</font>\n<br>an exclamation suggesting impatience 请看在老天爷面上；务请；千万\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For goodness'sake, don't give up your experiment. 千万不要放弃你的实验。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For goodness' sake, don't tell the news to anybody. 千万不要把此消息告诉别人。</font>\n
for keeps	<font color=blue size=4>for keeps</font>\n<br>1. permanently 永远地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you like the book, you can have it for keeps. 你如果喜欢这本书，就尽管留着用吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This time I am giving it to you for keeps. 这次我把它永远送给你了。</font>\n<br>2. for the winner to keep 归优胜者所有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They played the game for keeps. 他们玩这种游戏是为了赌输赢。</font>\n<br>3. seriously; not just for fun 严肃的；不是开玩笑的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is not a joke, it's for keeps. 这不是开玩笑，而是严肃的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman knew that the robber was trying to shoot him for keeps. 警察知道抢劫者不是开玩笑，而是真的要开枪杀死他。</font>\n
fork over/out/up	<font color=blue size=4>fork over/out/up</font>\n<br>pay; pay out 交出；付出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to fork over fifty dollars to have the car repaired. 他必须付50美元才能修理车子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was unwilling to fork out a penny more . 她一个子儿也不愿意多出。</font>\n
for lack of	<font color=blue size=4>for lack of</font>\n<br>for want of; owing to shortage of 因缺少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plants died for lack of water. 植物因缺水而旱死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The project was abandoned forlack of funds. 这计划因缺乏资金而放弃了。</font>\n
for love or money	<font color=blue size=4>for love or money</font>\n<br>for anything; for any price 不惜任何代价；不管一切（常用于否定句中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't give him my dog for love or money. 我怎么也不会把狗给他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will not go there , not for love or money. 我不会去那儿，无论如何都不会去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is a temperance hotel, and spirits are not to be had for love or money. 那是一家禁酒旅馆，酒是绝对喝不到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss asked his secretary to get a stateroom for love or money. 老板要他的秘书不惜一切代价要搞到一间包厢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the war you couldn't get an apartment in this city for love or money. 战争期间，在这个城市里你无论如何也找不到一套房房间。</font>\n
for my part	<font color=blue size=4>for my part</font>\n<br>as far as I am concerned 至于我；就我而论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can go with them if you like, but for my part I prefer to stay at home. 你愿意去就跟他们一道去，至于我，倒宁可呆在家里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For my part I should like to have a little music just now . 对我来说，这会儿我很想听一些音乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know how the rest of you feel, but for my part, Ido not think it is feasible. 我不知道诸位有何感觉，至于我，我不相信这可以做到。</font>\n
for nothing	<font color=blue size=4>for nothing</font>\n<br>without payment 无代价地；白费；无缘无故\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They quarrelled for nothing. 他们不为什么事情就吵架了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I got it for nothing. 我免费得到这东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have not studied English for nothing. 我没有白学了英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have come all the way for nothing. 我远道而来，毫无收获。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was not for nothing that he spent three years studying the subject. 他花了3年时间，研究这门学科，不是没有结果的。</font>\n
for now	<font color=blue size=4>for now</font>\n<br>temporarily 暂时地；目前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For now, I'll have to stay at home because of my injured leg, but soon I'll be up and about as usual. 因为腿摔坏了，我只好暂时呆在家里，但是不久我就会康复，象往常一样出去活动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although I have second thoughts about your plan, I'll accept it for now. 虽然我对你的计划有想法，但是目前我还是接受的。</font>\n
for oneself	<font color=blue size=4>for oneself</font>\n<br>without the help of others; inde pendently 自力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are some things one can't do for oneself. 有些事情，不是一个人所能独立做到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must judge for yourself, I tell you. 我告诉你，你一定要自己作出判断。</font>\n
for one thing	<font color=blue size=4>for one thing</font>\n<br>for one reason; as one in a list of things 其中之一（原因等）；首先；一则\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher said, “You get a low mark because, for one thing, you did not do your homework. ”老师说：“你的分数很低，其原因之一是因为你没有做作业。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For one thing, I haven't any money; for another, Ihave no time. 一则我没有钱，二则我没有时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've got a lot of things to do before I can leave. For one thing, I've got to drop by the bank to get some money. 我离开以前要做许多事情，其中之一是我必须去银行取点钱。</font>\n
for real	<font color=blue size=4>for real</font>\n<br>real (ly) ; serious (ly) 真的（地）;严肃的（地）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dress rehearsal was over now. This performance was for real. 已经彩排过了。这一次是正式演出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's do our work for real. 让我们认真地工作吧。</font>\n
for sale	<font color=blue size=4>for sale</font>\n<br>on sale 出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've got a new kind of shoes for sale. 他们有一种新式鞋出售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house is not for sale. 此屋不出售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These products are only exhibits and not for sale for the present. 这些产品目前仅供展示，不出售。</font>\n
for short	<font color=blue size=4>for short</font>\n<br>so as to make shorter; as an abbreviation or nickname 简略之；简称\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The American Broadcasting Company is called ABC for short. 美国广播公司简称ABC。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The United States of America is called USA for short, or USA is the short for the United States of America. 美利坚合众国的简称是USA, 或者说USA 是美利坚合众国的缩写。</font>\n
for the benefit of	<font color=blue size=4>for the benefit of</font>\n<br>for the advantage of 为了…利益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher repeated part ofhis previous lecture for the benefit of those who had been absent. 教师为了缺课的学生把上次讲的内容的一部分又重讲了一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was travelling for the benefit of his health. 为了身体健康，他出去旅行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told the story for the benefit of the children. 他讲那个故事是为了孩子们好。</font>\n
for the best	<font color=blue size=4>for the best</font>\n<br>good or best; not bad as thought; lucky; happily 最好；不差；幸运；快乐地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Maybe it's for the best that your team lost; now you know why it's undesirable to get conceited. 也许你们输一次是好的，现在你们该知道为什么不能骄傲了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's parents thought it would be for the best if he stayed out of school for the rest of the year. 约翰的父母认为休学一年比较好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You feel unhappy now because you got sick and couldn't go with your friends, but it will all turn out for the best. 虽然因为生病你不能和你的朋友一起去玩而闷闷不乐，但这对你是会有好处的。</font>\n
for the better	<font color=blue size=4>for the better</font>\n<br>with a better result; for sth. that is better 较佳；好转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor felt that having a few days' rest would be for the better. 医生认为休息几天较好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The world situation is changing for the better. 世界形势日趋好转。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His state of health has changed for the better recently. 近来他的健康状况好转了。</font>\n
for the most part	<font color=blue size=4>for the most part</font>\n<br>in general; mostly; in most cases 大部分；通常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His in formation is , for the most part, reliable. 他的信息多半是可靠的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For the most part his statement is correct. 他说的大部分是正确的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The earth is for the most part covered with water and mountains. 地球的表面大部分是山和水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are for the most part workers. 他们大部分是工人。</font>\n
for the present	<font color=blue size=4>for the present</font>\n<br>temporarily; just now 暂时；目前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are wearied and have to suspend the work for the present. 他们累了，得暂时停止工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm rather busy for the present. 我眼下相当忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For the present we had better wait and see. 目前我们最好还是等等再说。</font>\n
for the purpose of	<font color=blue size=4>for the purpose of</font>\n<br>with the object of; with the intention of 为…目的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For the purpose of building our country into a great socialist state, all of us must work hard. 为了把我国建成一个伟大的社会主义国家，我们一定要努力工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came here for the purpose of collecting material for his research. 他到这里来，目的是为了他的研究搜集资料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has gone abroad for the purpose of studying chemistry. 他已经到国外去学化学了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The yound man jumped into the river for the purpose of saving the drowning child. 那个年轻人跳入河中为的是救落水的孩子。</font>\n
for the sake of	<font color=blue size=4>for the sake of</font>\n<br>for the purpose of; because of 为了；因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must be patient for the sake of peace. 为了和平，我们必须有耐心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For the sake of settling the matter they agreed to compromise. 为了解决这个问题，他们同意妥协。</font>\n
for the time being	<font color=blue size=4>for the time being</font>\n<br>for the present;temporarily 目前；暂时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We really need a new car but for the time being we'll have to continue using the old one . 我们的确需要一部新车，但目前我们还得继续用这部旧车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ihave no time to spare for the time being. 暂时我抽不出时间来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is getting better for the time being. 眼下他身体好些了。</font>\n
for the (whole) world	<font color=blue size=4>for the (whole) world</font>\n<br>on any account 无论如何；不管怎样（用于否定句）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't hurt her feelings for the world. 我决不会伤害她的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't, for the world miss that show . 我无论如何也不会错过那部电影。</font>\n
for the worse	<font color=blue size=4>for the worse</font>\n<br>with a worse result; for sth. that is worse or not as good 恶化；变坏；不如原来好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sick man's condition changed for the worse. 这位病人的病情在恶化。</font>\n
free and easy	<font color=blue size=4>free and easy</font>\n<br>without constraint of manners; unworried 不拘礼的；随便的；不操心的；漫不经心的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Young people tend to have a more free and easy attitude towards life than older people. 青年人比老年人对待生活的态度更加倾向于随便。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you are free and easy with your money , it's because you have a freeandeasy attitude towards life. 如果你对金钱持无所谓的态度，那是因为你对生活的态度比较随便。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack never stays in a joblong. He's always been a very free and easy person. 杰克干一项工作从来干不长，他向来就是个漫不经心的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting went on in a free and easy way. 会议的气氛轻松愉快。</font>\n
free from	<font color=blue size=4>free from</font>\n<br>set sb. or sth. free from; make free 使摆脱；无…的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Young people often try to free themselves from financial dependence on their parents. 年轻人往往力求摆脱在经济上对父母的依赖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are free from any fault because of your carefulness. 因为你小心谨慎，所以一点错也没有。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would like to be free from some of my responsibilities. 我想卸掉我的某些责任。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This article is free from duty. 这种货物是免税的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Iam free from debt now. 现在我不欠债了。</font>\n
free of	<font color=blue size=4>free of</font>\n<br>without; free from; outside of 没有…的；免于；离开；摆脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This area is free of malaria. 这个地区已消灭了疟疾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I got this book free of charge. 我免费得到这本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one can be free of faults. 人无完人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At last she was free of him. 她终于摆脱了他。</font>\n
free with	<font color=blue size=4>free with</font>\n<br>1. using without restraint 乱用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is free with his money. 他乱用钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his article he makes free with the facts. 他在文章中任意歪曲事实。</font>\n<br>2. using liberties with 随便；放肆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't make free with women. 对妇女不可放肆无礼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are too free withthe waitresses. 你对女招待太放肆了。</font>\n
from beginning to end	<font color=blue size=4>from beginning to end</font>\n<br>from first to last 自始至终\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story was interesting from beginning to end. 这个故事从头到尾都很有趣。</font>\n
from day to day	<font color=blue size=4>from day to day</font>\n<br>every day 每天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one knows what will happen from day to day. 谁也拿不准今宵明朝会发生什么事。</font>\n
from hand to hand	<font color=blue size=4>from hand to hand</font>\n<br>from one person to another 一个传一个\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book passed from hand to hand until all of us had read it . 这本书一个传一个地看，大家全看过了。</font>\n<br>from hand to mouth without providing for the future 仅够糊口\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They lived from hand to mouth. 他们吃了上顿没下顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They haven't a cent in the bank, as they have lived from hand to mouth all their lives. 他们在银行里一分钱存款也没有，因为他们一辈子都是现挣现花，仅够糊口。</font>\n<br>from head to foot/from top to toe all over the body 从头到脚；全身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He trembled from head to foot. 他浑身发抖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was dressed in blue from head to foot. 他穿一身蓝衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He eyed her from top to toe. 他从头到脚地看她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was wet with sweat from top to toe. 我从头到脚都汗湿了。</font>\n
from now on	<font color=blue size=4>from now on</font>\n<br>in future; from this time onward 今后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From now on you are free. 今后你获得自由啦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be more careful from now on . 我今后会更加小心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you will , from now on, do more and talk less. 我希望你今后多干活，少说话。</font>\n
from then on	<font color=blue size=4>from then on</font>\n<br>from that time onward 从那时起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From then on he was a teacher. 从那时起他就是一位老师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Li became rich from then on. 李先生从那时起就发财了。</font>\n
from time to time	<font color=blue size=4>from time to time</font>\n<br>at times； (every) now and then;occasionally; once in a while 有时；时时；偶尔；间或\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I see him at the library from time to time. 我有时在图书馆见到他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He called at our home from time to time. 他有时到我们家玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From time to time we invite experts to give lectures in our department . 我们经常请专家来我们系讲课。</font>\n
frown on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>frown on/upon</font>\n<br>regard with disfavour or disapproval; condemn 不喜欢；不赞成；谴责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager frowned on your proposal. 经理不喜欢你的提议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Certain grammatical constructions and idioms that are accepted in America are frowned upon in British English. 在美国得到公认的某些语法结构和习语在英国英语中未得到赞许。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He frowns upon things like that. 他对那样的事情是皱眉头的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doesn't she frown upon that kind of behaviour? 她对那种行为不谴责吗？</font>\n
full of	<font color=blue size=4>full of</font>\n<br>filled with 充满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tube is full of coloured water. 管内盛满带色的水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our future seems to be full of hope. 我们的前途充满了希望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is full of pride. 她充满了自豪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech was ful of jokes. 他的讲话充满了笑料。</font>\n
full of beans	<font color=blue size=4>full of beans</font>\n<br>1. in high spirits 兴致高昂；精神饱满；愉快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The football team was full of beans after winning the tournament. 足球队赢了决赛后兴致高昂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You seem full of beans today; you must have got good marks in the examinations. 你今天精神愉快，一定是考试取得了好成绩。</font>\n<br>2. being foolish and talking nonsense 无稽之谈；胡说八道\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are full of beans;that man isn't 100 years old. 你说那人100岁，简直是无稽之谈。</font>\n
fuss about/around	<font color=blue size=4>fuss about/around</font>\n<br>1. move about or behave in a nervous, excited way 忙乱；紧张不安地来回走动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop fussing about; the taxi will arrive on time, and we shan't miss the train. 别慌，出租车会准时来的，我们不会误火车的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fussed around all the time. 她一直是忙忙乱乱的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop fussing about and sit down. 别瞎忙了，坐下来休息吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has been fussing about since morning, something must be bothering her. 她从早到现在一直局促不安地踱来踱去，肯定有什么心事缠绕着她。</font>\n<br>2. unsettle or irritate sb. by giving too mucn attention to him 过分关心；过分操心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fusses too much about her health; she't always trying some new medicine . 她过分担心她的健康，总是试用一些新药。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She does fuss the children about and always worries about their minor illnesses. 她对孩子过分操心，他们有点小毛病，她就提心吊胆。</font>\n
gabble away	<font color=blue size=4>gabble away</font>\n<br>talk rapidly and possibly indistinctly 急促地不清楚地说个不停；吱吱喳喳地叫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guests at the cocktail party were gabbling away when the clock struck ten. 时钟敲10点时，鸡尾酒会上的客人们还在嘈杂地谈论着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Listen to those foreigners gabbling away. 听那些外国人在叽哩咕噜地说个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The geese were gabbling away furiously. 鹅群嘎嘎直叫。</font>\n
gad about/around	<font color=blue size=4>gad about/around</font>\n<br>go from place to place, usu. for pleasure 闲荡；欢乐地、轻快地游逛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The way Tom gads about, Ican't see how he will ever pass his finals. 汤姆这样闲荡，我看他期终考试怎么也过不了关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They gab about a lot, going to expensive restaurants and shows . 他们下高级馆子，享受高级娱乐，玩得好痛快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son always gads about with his school friends after they have left school. 我儿子放学后总要和他的同学们到处游荡。</font>\n
gain ground	<font color=blue size=4>gain ground</font>\n<br>1. go forward;move ahead 向前；占领阵地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers fought hard and began to gain ground. 战士们奋力作战，开始占领了阵地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rumour is so silly, I don't see how it can gain much ground. 这谣言大荒唐，我相信它不会有市场。</font>\n<br>2. become stronger; make progress; improve 变强壮；取得进展；好转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sick man gained ground after being near death. 这位病人差点死去，现在病情又好转了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Under Lincoln, the Republican party gained ground. 在林肯的领导下，共和党大有进展。</font>\n
gain on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>gain on/upon</font>\n<br>1. draw closer to (sb. or sth. pursued) ; catch up with 逼近；接近；赶上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horsemen were rapidly gaining on their enemy. 骑士们很快就追上了敌人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The runner was catching up with his rival, gaining on him with every step. 那位赛跑运动员正在追赶他的对手，一步步向他逼近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company is gaining upon its rivals in the volume of sales. 这家公司在销售额上快要赶上它的竞争者了。</font>\n<br>2. move further ahead of 跑得比…快；超过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leading group of three continued to gain on the rest of the runners and were soon half a mile clear of them. 领先的3个人继续拉大同其他选手的距离，不久就把他们抛在半英里之后了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The days are gaining on the nights. 白昼正越来越长，黑夜正越来越短。</font>\n<br>3. consume part of; erode 蚕食；侵蚀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Year by year the ocean gained upon the shore, and finally took a toll on the houses that had once been pride of the town. 年复一年海水侵蚀着海岸，终于把这个城市曾一度引以为荣的那些房子冲垮了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Solid embankments have been constructed to prevent the river from gaining on the land. 人们修筑坚固的堤岸，以防止河水对土地的侵蚀。</font>\n
gather round	<font color=blue size=4>gather round</font>\n<br>form a crowd near 聚集在…周围；环绕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A small crowd gathered round the speaker to hear what he had to say. 一小群人围在演讲者周围听他讲什么。</font>\n
gather up	<font color=blue size=4>gather up</font>\n<br>1. collect all one's power fof a strong effort 鼓起勇气；打起精神\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After he had been hit, he got up, gathered himself up and ran off. 他被击倒后又爬了起来，振作一下就跑掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better gather yourself up to try again. 你最好鼓起勇气再试一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gathered up his strength for a hard job. 他集中精力去干一项艰苦的工作。</font>\n<br>2. pick up and place together; accumulate 集拢；收集；概括\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Gathering up his scattered papers, he pushed them into his case. 他将散落的文件收拢起来，放入箱子里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Gathering up the thread of his story, he set about writing. 他收集整理了故事的线索，开始写作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The title best gathers up the subject. 这个标题把问题很好地概括起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We gathered up a great amount of firsthand data. 我们收集了大量的第一手资料。</font>\n

gear down	<font color=blue size=4>gear down</font>\n<br>1. change into a lower gear in order to lose speed 使汽车换慢档；使车辆减速\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Going down a steep grade, the driver geared down the car. 下陡坡时，司机放慢了速度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver geared down as he came into the corner. 司机拐弯时换了慢档。</font>\n<br>2. reduce in force or intensity 减弱；降低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The courses have been geared downto the lower ability of students in the special classes. 对水平较低的特殊班级的学生，已经降低了一些课程的要求。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dosage was geared down to a level which would work on the infected cells but not upset their normal metabolism. 药量减到了一定程度，既能对受感染的细胞起作用，又不影响正常的新陈代谢。</font>\n<br>able for 安排（调节）以适应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Education should be geared to the children's needs and abilities, 教育应与孩子们的需要和能力相适应。</font>\n
gear up	<font color=blue size=4>gear up</font>\n<br>1. change (a car, etc.) into a higher gear 车辆换快速档\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better gear up our car, or we'll be late. 我们最好加快车速，否则要迟到了。</font>\n<br>2. speed up; increase 使加快速度；增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been gearing up production in order to fulfil their task ahead of time. 为了提前完成任务，他们一直在加速生产。</font>\n<br>3. make ready 作好准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you are all geared up for the new sales campaign. 我希望你们都为新的销售活动作好准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He geared himself up for the interview. 他为面试作好了准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our department is gearing up for an increased intake of students. 我们系正准备招收更多的学生。</font>\n
get about	<font color=blue size=4>get about</font>\n<br>1. go or travel from place to place 来往各处；旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People are getting about much more than they used to. 人们比以前旅行多得多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John gets about all over Europe, even though he hasn't got a car. 尽管约翰没有汽车，但他游遍了欧洲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With trains, ships and planes, people can get about much more easily nowadays. 如今有了火车、轮船和飞机，人们往来各处就方便多了。</font>\n<br>2. be able to move again after illness ; walk; go about（病后又能）走动；到处走动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was ill last week, but he is getting about now. 他上周病了，但现在能走动了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old people can't get about very well in the winter weather. 在冬季，老人走路不大方便。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For some months after her accident she had to get about on crutches. 那次事故以后好几个月，她不得不依靠拐杖走路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All this snow and ice makes it difficult for people to get about. 冰天雪地使人难以走动。</font>\n<br>3. (of news, etc.) spread（新闻等）传播开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of his resignation soon got about. 他辞职的消息很快就传开了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story has got about everywhere. 这事传遍了各处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's prevent the rumour from getting about. 让我们防止谣言到处传播。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did the story of her marriage getabout? 她结婚的消息是怎样传开的？</font>\n
get abroad	<font color=blue size=4>get abroad</font>\n<br>1. be able to travel to a foreign country 到国外旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We didn't get abroad for our holiday as usual; we couldn't afford it this year. 我们没有象往年那样出国度假，今年我们拿不出这笔钱。</font>\n<br>2. spread; become widely known 传（播）开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rumor has got abroad. 谣言已经传开了。</font>\n
get across	<font color=blue size=4>get across</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) cross a road, water, etc. （使）通过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Using the new bridge to get across will save people a lot of time. 从新桥上通过可以节省人们大量时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The general had to get his troops across the river. 将军必须把部队带过河去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the traffic lessened, they managed to get across. 车辆减少时，他们设法穿过了马路。</font>\n<br>2. (cause to) become understood or accepted（使）理解；把…讲清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I spoke slowly, but my meaning didn't get across. 我讲得很慢，但我的意思还是没有被理解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The advertisement's basic message gets across very well. 这条广告的基本信息表达得一清二楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He found it difficult to get his American jokes across to an English audience. 他发觉他的美国笑话很难使英国听众发笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher tried to explain the problem but the explanation did not get across to the class. 老师试图把这个问题解释清楚，但是他的解释没有被学生理解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gets across well, doesn't he? 他说的很清楚，是不是？</font>\n<br>3. annoy; offend; form a bad relation with 使生气；触犯；与…搞坏关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They really get across me！他们实在使我生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got across the boss, who made life very difficult for her. 她得罪了老板，老板使她的日子很不好过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These two girls are so different in tem perament that they were bound to get across each other. 这两个女孩的性格相差太悬殊，彼此肯定合不来。</font>\n
get ahead	<font color=blue size=4>get ahead</font>\n<br>1. make progress; succeed 取得进一步成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone can get ahead in life if he or she really tries hard. 任何人只要努力，都能成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are getting ahead well with the project. 我们这个项目进展顺利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is certainly getting ahead in his profession. 他在业务上肯定得心应手。</font>\n<br>2. proceed 进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would like to talk more about that but we must get ahead with other matters. 我想对那个问题多谈谈，但是我们必须进行其它的项目。</font>\n
get ahead of	<font color=blue size=4>get ahead of</font>\n<br>1. obtain a position in front of; get in advance of 走在…前面；领先；提前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only hard work can get you ahead of your competitors. 只有努力工作才能使你走在你的竞争者的前面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car behind wants to get ahead of you. 后面那辆车想起你的车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I told you the end now, I would get ahead of myself in the stors. 我如果把结局现在就告诉你，我将提前结束我的故事。</font>\n<br>2. surpass 胜过；超过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gets ahead of me in mathematics. 他的数学比我好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are sure to get ahead of them in the near future. 我们确信不久就会超过他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom has got ahead of all the others in the class. 汤姆已经胜过了班上所有其他同学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got ahead of me this test. 在这次考试中她的名次在我前面。</font>\n
get along	<font color=blue size=4>get along</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) go forward; move on 进展；继续前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car could hardly get along on the icy surface. 汽车在冰面上难以行驶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sailing boat was getting along fast be fore the wind. 帆船正在顺风飞速前进。</font>\n<br>2. go; depart 走；离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had better get along before the fog gets worse. 我们最好在雾大之前动身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's rather late, and I think I'd better be getting along. 很晚了，我想，我该走了。</font>\n<br>3. proceed; advance; make progress 进行；进展；进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are the builders getting along with your new house? 建筑工人把你的新房盖得如何了？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My work's getting along much better now. 现在我的工作进展得顺利多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are you getting along with your English studies? 你的英语学习进展如何？</font>\n<br>4. manage to live or work 设法过下去；设法干下去；对付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you work hard, you will get along in that job. 假如你努力工作，你就可以继续干下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He managed to get along without much money. 他设法不用多少钱就对付过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Robinsons only have a small pension, but they seem to get along all right. 罗宾逊一家只有很少的年金，但似乎过得还不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry. I'll get along without you. 不要担心，你不在我能对付。</font>\n<br>5. be on good terms; live or work together in a friendly way 相处融洽；合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is hard to get along with. 他这个人很难相处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We get along with them very well. 我们跟他们处得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two brothers don't get along at all. They are very different in character. 这兄弟俩一点也合不来，他们的性格截然不同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The couple got a divorce because they could not get along. 那对夫妇离婚了，因为他们处不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane has such a bad disposition that nobody can get along with her. 简脾气很坏，没有人能和她合得来。</font>\n<br>6. move or convey along 运送；转交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll get the books along to you as soon as I can. 我一定尽快把书给你送去。</font>\n<br>7. advance in age;advance in time; become old or late 上年纪；变老或变暗（常用于进行时态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Grandmother is 78 and getting along. 祖母已78岁，上年纪了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was getting along towards sundown when we left the office. 我们下班时，太阳快下山了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he is getting along, he is still strong and lusty. 他虽然上了年纪，但还是身强力壮。</font>\n<br>8. go away 走开；滚开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get along with you！I don't believe a word of it. 去你的吧！我一点也不信。</font>\n
get around/round	<font color=blue size=4>get around/round</font>\n<br>1. move freely; move about; goto different places; travel 走动；到不同的地方；旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's easy to get round by bus in this city. 这个城市坐公共汽车出门很方便。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary's father really gets around; Monday he was in Washington; Wednesday he was in Chicago, and today he is in New York. 玛丽的父亲真的是到处跑，星期一他在华盛顿，星期三他在芝加哥，而今天他又到了纽约。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bought a bicyle yesterday, and it would make it easy for him to get round. 他昨天买了一辆自行车，这使他来来往往方便了。</font>\n<br>2. become widely known especially by being talked about 传播；散布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news has got around—every body knows about it. 那个消息不径而走，传得人人皆知。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing gets around faster than bad news. 坏消息传得比什么都快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did my secret get around to all my friends so quickly? 我的秘密怎么这么快就传到所有的朋友那儿去了？</font>\n<br>3. get by a trick or flattery from sb. ; persuade sb. to change his opinion 诱惑；哄骗某人以得到某物；说服某人改变主意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let him get round you！ He doesn't deserve your help. 别上他的当！他不值得你去帮他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is so good at getting round him that she'll get the money all right. 她很善于哄骗他，结果能很顺利地把钱搞到手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has a glib tongue; she never fails to get around me by being sweet and complimentary. 她能说会道，总是用甜言蜜语哄得我对她百依百顺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's trying to get round her father to buy her a new car. 她正说服她父亲给她买辆汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should have very little difficulty getting him round to our way of thinking. 要说服他接受我们的想法，不会有多大困难。</font>\n<br>4. find a way of not obeying or doing; escape from 回避；逃避\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's wrong of you to get around the regulation. 你回避规章制度是不对的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is trying to get round paying his taxes. 他在想法逃避纳税。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't get round the issue by making excuses. 你不能制造借口回避这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A clever lawyer might find ways of getting round the clause. 聪明的律师或许有办法回避那个条款。</font>\n<br>5. (cause to) recover from illness； (cause to) come round; restore to consciousness 病后恢复；使恢复；苏醒；使苏醒；恢复知觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Polly's fainted.
