Jane's trying to get her round. 波莉昏过去了。简正在尽力救醒她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new acupuncture treatment got him round. 新针疗法把他的病治好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor got the man round quite quickly after the accident. 事故发生后，医生很快就使那个人恢复了知觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient got round after a blood transfusion. 输血后那个病人醒过来了。</font>\n<br>6. tackle successfully; overcome (a difficulty, an obstacle, etc.) 成功地对付；克服（困难、障碍等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There seems to be no way of getting round the difficulty of keeping prices down. 似乎无法克服要降低价格的困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By relying on the masses can get round all sorts of difficulties. 依靠群众我们就能克服种种困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got around the transportation problem by renting a car. 我们租了一辆汽车，解决了运输问题。</font>\n<br>7. go by a circuitous course 绕道走；绕过障碍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The damaged truck was in the way, but our driver got round somehow. 撞坏的卡车正挡路，但我们的司机想法绕了过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a couple of hours, our car got round to the highway. 过了两个小时，我们的车绕到了高速公路上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get round to the back gate of the university. 让我们绕到学校的后大门去吧。</font>\n<br>8. be socially active 社交活动频繁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is a shy girl; she doesn't get around much. 她是个腼腆的女孩，很少同别人交往。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This professor gets round with many poets and artists. 这位教授跟很多诗人和艺术家交往。</font>\n
get around/round to	<font color=blue size=4>get around/round to</font>\n<br>find the necessary time for; do sth. after putting it off 找时间去做；（为某人某事）腾出时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell Jane I can't get round to her request this afternoon, so she can go home and come back tomorrow afternoon. 你告诉简，我今天下午腾不出时间来考虑她的要求，所以她可以先回家，明天下午再来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I always wanted to wrie, but have never got round to it. 我总想写，但一直没有时间动笔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I haven't been able to get round to looking at your essay yet, but I'll read it this evening. 我一直没能腾出时间来看你的文章，今晚我将拜读一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll get around to washing my car this week. 本周我将腾出时间来洗我的车子。</font>\n
get at	<font color=blue size=4>get at</font>\n<br>l. reach; touch; get hold of 到达；触及；抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better lock up these cups so that the kids cannot get at them. 我们最好把这些杯子锁起来，这样孩子们就够不着了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you get at the book at the top shelf? 你能够得着书架顶层的那本书吗？</font>\n<br>2. acquire knowledge or understading of; find out the meaning; mean; aim at; hint at 知道；领会；发现（意思）；理解意旨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In analysing problems, it is most important to get at the essence of a thing and not be put off by temporary appearance. 分析问题时，最重要的是要抓住事物的本质，不为一时表面现象所迷惑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get at the kernel of the problem. 我们必须抓住问题的核心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are trying to get at him some way or other. 我们在设法了解他的意思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you got at the meaning of this idiom? 你理解这条习惯语的意义吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What the teacher was getting at in this lesson was that it is important to write correctly. 这一课老师的目的是要讲清楚正确写作的重要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't see what you are getting at. 我不明白你的用意是什么。</font>\n<br>3. do harm to 伤害\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cat is on the chair trying to get at the canary. 椅子上的猫正设法伤害这金丝雀。</font>\n<br>4. bribe; influence corruptly and unduly 贿赂；买通\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The defendant's parents got at the judge. 被告的父母贿赂法官。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of the witnesses has been got at. 证人之一已经受了贿赂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone appears to have been trying to get at the jury. 看来有人一直在尽力贿赂陪审员。</font>\n<br>5. find fault with; attack; make insinuations about 批评；挑剔；攻击；讽刺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's always getting at her husband for not helping with the housework. 她总是埋怨丈夫不帮她做家务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No names were mentioned, but we all know who was being got at. 虽然没有点名，但我们都知道批评的是谁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you are always getting at other people, you'll soon make yourself disliked. 如果你总是挑剔别人的毛病，要不了多久人们就会讨厌你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't keep getting at him. He's admitted his mistake and is ready to correct it. 别老是责备他，他已承认错误并准备改正。</font>\n<br>6. set to work on 着手干；开始致力于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the rain stopped, we could get at the garden. 如果雨停了，我们就可以着手干园子里的活了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The project won't take long to finish once we get at it. 一旦动工，这项工程要不了多久就会完工的。</font>\n<br>7. poke fun at 对…开玩笑；嘲笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't try to get at him. He has a bad temper. 不要取笑他，他心情不好。</font>\n
get away	<font color=blue size=4>get away</font>\n<br>1. get loose or get free; escape 挣脱；逃脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary tried to catch a butterfly, but it got away from her. 玛丽设法捉一只蝴蝶，但它挣脱飞走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of the prisoners got away from prison yesterday. 昨天一个囚犯从监狱中逃走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief got away with a lot of money. 小偷偷了一大笔钱逃跑了。</font>\n<br>2. leave 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope to get away next Saturday for at least a week. 我希望从下周六开始至少要离开一周。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They get away from work at five p.m. 他们下午5点下班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guard told me to get away from the door. 卫兵要我离开那门口。</font>\n<br>3. succeed in leaving; go away in order to gain relief from (one's worries, responsibility, excessive work, etc.) 脱身；离开以解脱（自己的苦恼、责任、繁忙的工作等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No matter how he tried, he couldn't get away from his worries. 无论他怎样努力，也无法从烦恼中解脱出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager was so busy that he could not get away from the office. 经理太忙了，一步也离不开办公室。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is such a talker！I couldn't get away from her. 她讲个没完没了，我简直无法脱身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't come because he couldn't get away from his work. 他没有来，因为工作脱不开身。</font>\n<br>4. begin; start 开始；出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The race got away to a fast start. 比赛的选手一开始就很迅速。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got away early in the morning on the first day of our travel. 旅行开始的第一天，我们一清早就动身了。</font>\n
get away with	<font color=blue size=4>get away with</font>\n<br>1. do sth. forbidden or illegal and escape without punishment 做坏事而逃避或不受责备惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not many criminals get away with their crimes. 没有多少罪犯能逃之夭夭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't be rude to everyone and expect to get away with it forever. 你不能对每个人都蛮横无理而且想永远都不会受到惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those who lie and cheat will never get away with it. 那些撒谎和欺骗别人的人决不会逃得过惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Half the excuses she gives are not true, but she always seems to get away with, them. 她的借口一半都是假的，但她似乎总是没有受到责备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is constantly late for work, and yet nothing is ever said to him. I don't know how he gets away with it. 他上班经常迟到，竟然没有人对他说什么。我不知道他怎么会不受到责备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child ought to be punished. You shouldnt't let him get away with telling lies. 应该处罚这孩子，不能让他撒谎而不受惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You mustn't get away with this！这件事，你不该逃脱罪责。</font>\n<br>2. carry off; steal and escape with 携…潜逃；偷走；抢走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief got away with the contents of the safe. 小偷把保险柜里的东西偷走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bandits raided the bank and got away with＄ 100, 000. 暴徒们抢劫了银行，抢走10万美金。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cashier has got away with the takings. 出纳员带着赃款逃跑了。</font>\n<br>3. receive a relatively light or negligible punishment of 受到比较轻微的…惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“As it's a first offence, ”the solicitor said, “I think she'll get away with a fine. ”律师说：“由于这是初犯，我认为她会得到从轻发落，罚款了事。”</font>\n
get back	<font color=blue size=4>get back</font>\n<br>1. return to one's starting point 回来；返回原地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect my wife to get back at about eight tonight. 我盼望我妻子今晚8点回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got back home dead tired. 她回到家里累得要命。</font>\n<br>2. regain 取回；收回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop worrying about the money you lent him. You'll get it back. 不要担心借给他的钱，你会收回的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am unwilling to lend books, be cause it's so difficult to get them back. 我不愿借书出去，因为索还是太难了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't get back your youth once it's gone. 青春一去不复返。</font>\n<br>3. go to a reasonable, sensible distance; stand away 让开；闪开；后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police had great difficulty in making the curious crowd get back and let the ambulance through. 警察费了很大的劲才使那些好奇的人群让开，使救护车开过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get back！ The wall is collapsing. 闪开！墙要倒了。</font>\n<br>4. return sth. or sb. to its or his place 使某物或某人回到原处；还回；送回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took the spring out of the clock, but now he can't get it back. 他把钟里的发条拿了出来，但现在放不进去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you take my son out for a drive, you must promise to get him back before 5. 如果你要开车带我儿子出去玩，你得答应5点之前把他送回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I got the book back before he noticed it was missing. 我把书及时还了回去，免得他以为书丢了。</font>\n
get back at	<font color=blue size=4>get back at</font>\n<br>get even with;give tit for tat to; gain revenge on 对…报复；对…报仇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John played a joke on Henry, and the next day Henry got back at him. 约翰戏弄了亨利，第2天亨利就回报了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The elephant waited many years to get back at the man who fed him red pepper. 这头大象等了许多年报复了喂它红辣椒的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'll get back at him for telling everybody her secret！她将对他进行报复，因为他把她的秘密泄露给了所有的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was wicked of her to spread those lies about him, but it was equally wrong of him to get back at her. 她散布这些谣言来伤害他，固然是恶劣的，但他因此对她进行报复，也同样不对。</font>\n
get back to	<font color=blue size=4>get back to</font>\n<br>resume; return to (work, one's studies, the job in hand, the main point in the argument, etc.) 继续；回到（工作、学习、手中的活、争论的焦点等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was very glad to get back to her studies after her serious illness. 她重病之后又回校学习，感到很高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get back to your plan; what are you going to do next? 咱们再回过头来讨论你的计划，你下一步打算干什么？</font>\n
get behind	<font color=blue size=4>get behind</font>\n<br>1. go or do sth. too slowly 落后；迟缓\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The post office got behind in delivering Christmas mail. 邮局把圣诞邮件送晚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During my illnsss I got behind. in my school work, and now it is difficult to catch up. 当我生病时，我的功课落后了，现在很难赶上。</font>\n<br>2. support; help 支持；赞助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we all get behind Mr. Chen, we can easily elect him to that office. 如果我们都支持陈先生，我们就能很容易地让他当选那个职位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of us should get behind the res olutions adopted at the meeting. 我们大家都应该支持会上通过的决议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got behind him to be our monitor. 我们拥护他当班长。</font>\n<br>3. explain; find out the reason for 解释；找出原因\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police are questioning many witnesses to try and get behind the bank robbery. 警察正在询问许多目击者以设法查清那起银行抢劫案。</font>\n<br>4. fall into arrears; be late in paying 拖欠（款项等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If your payments of rent get be hind, you will be asked to leave. 你若拖欠租金，就得让你搬走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John got behind with the payment on his car and had to surrender it to the garage. 约翰拖欠了汽车付款，只好把车子交回车库。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They often get behind the gas bill. 他们常常拖欠煤气费。</font>\n
get below	<font color=blue size=4>get below</font>\n<br>1. become less than (an amount) 少（低）于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the temperature gets below freezing point, we should take the plants indoors. 假如气温降到零度以下，我们就得把这些花木移入室内。</font>\n<br>2. become worse than a standard 达不到（标准）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your work has been getting below its usual standard recently, so you must improve it. 你的工作近来没有达到通常标准，所以你必须加以改进。</font>\n
get by	<font color=blue size=4>get by</font>\n<br>1. pass 通过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I moved aside to let him get by. 我让到一旁让他过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lorry blocked the pathway, so that we couldn't get by. 一辆卡车把路堵了，我们过不去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please move to the right so he can get by. 请向右移一下，以便让他过去。</font>\n<br>2. succeed by a very narrow margin; reach a standard that is acceptable but not very good 勉强及格；勉强通过或达到标准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't do too well on the examination, but I think I'll get by. 我考的不太好，但我想我会勉强及格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your work will get by, but try to improve it. 你的工作勉强达到标准，但要争取做得更好些。</font>\n<br>3. not to be caught and scolded or punished 躲过；避开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can we get by that guard at the door? 我们怎样才能躲过门口的卫兵呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy got by without answering the teacher's question because a visitor came in. 这位学生没有回答老师的问题，但因为有客来访，所以没有受到批评。</font>\n<br>4. make ends meet 勉强生存\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She gets by on a remarkably small income. 她靠着微薄的收入过活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He once got by on hunting. 他曾一度靠打猎勉强维持生活。</font>\n<br>5. be tolerable; be passable 受得了；过得去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This work will get by, but that's all. 这活还能对付得过去，可也就如此了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The business has fallen off, but we manage to get by somehow. 生意萧条了，可我们还是设法勉强过下去。</font>\n
get/catch hold of	<font color=blue size=4>get/catch hold of</font>\n<br>1. get possesion of;grasp 握有；持有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's dangerous for children to get hold of sharp knives. 孩子拿着尖刀是件危险的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He caught hold of a rope and saved himself. 他抓住一条绳子，救了自己的命。</font>\n<br>2. find 找到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Thompson spent several hours trying to get hold of his lawyer. 汤普森花了几小时想找到他的律师。</font>\n
get down	<font color=blue size=4>get down</font>\n<br>1. descend or bring down（使）下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The stairs were so steep that it was difficult to get the furniture down. 这楼梯太陡，家俱难以搬下楼去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I bumped into Mr. Wang as I got down from the bus. 我下公共汽车时，偶然遇到了王先生。</font>\n<br>2. kill or destroy by shooting（通过射击）击落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They got down two enemy planes. 他们击落两架敌机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hunter got down a number of birds. 猎手打落了一些鸟。</font>\n<br>3. record in writing 记录下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Here is a telephone message I got down for you. 这是我给你记下来的电话留言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get down every word she says. 记下她讲的每句话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked, “Have you got all the sentences down? ”老师问：“你们把所有的句子都记下来了吗？”</font>\n<br>4. become depressed 沮丧；垂头丧气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She soon gets down, but she just as soon recovers her cheer fulness. 她容易灰心丧气，但恢复愉快的心情也很快。</font>\n<br>5. depress sb. or impair sb. 's health 使沮丧；使苦闷或损害健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news certainly got him down. 这条消息肯定使他沮丧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This miserable weather really gets us down. 这鬼天气实在令我们难受。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the end, the long hours of work combined with domestic worries got him down. 长时间的工作以及家事的烦恼终于使他的身体垮了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Difficulties, never get him down. 困难从来压不垮他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not desirable to get down. You should draw lessons from the failure, keep up your spirits and do your work well. 垂头丧气是不可取的，你应该从失败中吸取教训，振作精神，做好工作。</font>\n<br>6. swallow 吞下去；咽下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine was so bitter that she could not get it down. 这药太苦，她吞不下去。</font>\n<br>7. kneel 跪下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It would be better if you got down and begged for mercy. 你最好跪下来求饶。</font>\n
get down to	<font color=blue size=4>get down to</font>\n<br>go to work without waiting or hesitating; resolutely apply oneself to 立即开始工作；致力于（工作、任务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chair person started the meeting promptly at seven o'clock and the committee got right down to business. 会议主持者7点钟准时宣布开会，委员会接着就开始了工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time you got down to some reading or the other students will leave you behind. 现在你该开始学习了，否则其他同学就要把你甩到后面去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That task isn't as difficult as it seems when you really get down to it. 这任务似乎很难，但当你真地做起来，并不是那么困难。</font>\n
get down to brass tacks/get down to cases	<font color=blue size=4>get down to brass tacks/get down to cases</font>\n<br>begin the most important work or business; get started on the most important thing to talk about or know 讨论实质问题；谈论正经事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men talked about little things and then got down to brass tacks. 这些人先谈了一些鸡毛蒜皮的小事，然后就言归正传了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have talked about everything under the sun; now you'd better get down to brass tacks. 你们已经天南海北乱扯了许多，现在最好要谈正经的了。</font>\n
get down to business	<font color=blue size=4>get down to business</font>\n<br>start serious discussion about stb. ; start doing sth. important perhaps after some time has been spent on irrelevant or social talk 开始谈论正事；言归正传（或许是花了一些时间闲谈以后）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two men had a couple of drinks together, talked about their families and their holidays for a while and finally got down to business. 这两个人在一起喝了几杯酒，谈了一些有关家庭和度假的事情以后才谈正事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you don't mind if we get down to business straight away, as I've got to catch the four o'clock train. 我们马上就讨论本题，希望你不要介意，因为我要赶4点钟的火车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get down to business. 让我们着手干正事吧。</font>\n
get even	<font color=blue size=4>get even</font>\n<br>owe nothing 付清；还清欠款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a lot of debts, but in a few years he will get even. 他现在负债累累，但几年后就可还清。</font>\n
get even with	<font color=blue size=4>get even with</font>\n<br>be revenged 报复；算账\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jerry once played a mean trick on John, and now John wants to get even with him. 杰里曾对约翰施了一个卑鄙的诡计，现在约翰要报复他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll get even with you for this sooner or later. 对这个事情我迟早是要跟你算账的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That fellow may think he's smart in cheating us like that, but we'll get even with him yet. 那个家伙那样欺骗了我们，自以为聪明，但是我们要找他算账的。</font>\n
get/have the jump on	<font color=blue size=4>get/have the jump on</font>\n<br>get ahead of; start before others; have an advantage over 占优势；领先；胜过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Lin got the jump on us by seeing the manager before we did. 林先生捷足先登在我们前面会见了经理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let the other students get the jump on you at the beginning of the race. 比赛一开始就不要让其他学生占你的优势。</font>\n
get in	<font color=blue size=4>get in</font>\n<br>1. enter 进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I knew this case would be too small; I can't get all my clothes in. 我早就知道这个箱子太小，不能把我的衣服全都装进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He invited us to get in the car and go for a ride with him. 他请我们上车陪他乘车逛一趟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain can get in through this window. 雨水会从这扇窗户打进来。</font>\n<br>2. join 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been trying for years to get in that club. 他多年来一直都想参加那个俱乐部。</font>\n<br>3. arrive 到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What time does the train from Bei jing get in? 从北京开来的火车何时进站？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train got in on time. 火车正点到达。</font>\n<br>4. buy 买进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get some wine in for the dinner party. 我们必须为晚宴买一些酒。</font>\n<br>5. introduce; say sth. esp. by interrupting sb. else 插话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always gets his favourite story in when he makes a speech. 他在演讲时总要穿插一点他最爱讲的故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talked so fast that I couldn't get a word in. 他讲得太快，我一句话也插不进。</font>\n<br>6. plant; sow 种植；播种\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get next year's potatoes in before it is too late. 我们必须及时地把明年的马铃薯种下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We hope to get the seed in this week. 我们希望本周能把种子播下去。</font>\n<br>7. (cause to) be elected（使）当选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you think the Conservatives will get in? 你认为保守党会当选吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their candidate got in all right. 他们的候选人顺利当选了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He expects to get in at the next election. 他希望在下次选举中当选。</font>\n<br>8. be admitted (to school) 被接受（入学）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've registered our daughter at the new school, but as there's a long waitinglist I don't think she'll get in this year. 我们已经给女儿在那所新学校报了名，但报名的人很多，我想她今年进不去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son got in to the athletic school after a special test. 我儿子通过专门的考试进了那所体育学校。</font>\n<br>9. gain an advantage by being the first or one of the first to do sth. 占上风；占优势；捷足先登\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The supermarket got in first with cutprice cigarettes, so everyone buys them there now. 那家超级市场率先出售减价香烟占了优势，所以现在大家都到那儿去买烟。</font>\n<br>10. collect (taxes, debts, information, etc.) 收集（税款、借款、情报等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should get in all the debts due from the customers by the end of this year. 年底前我们要收回顾客到期未付的所有欠款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company is trying to get in all its outstanding debts. 公司正设法收回全部积欠的债款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That firm went bankrupt because their bad debts couldn't be got in. 那家商行破产了，因为他们无法收回债款。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government gets the taxes in quite efficiently. 政府收税相当有成效。</font>\n<br>11. bring in; gather (crops, a harvest, etc.) 搬入；收进；收获（庄稼等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students in grade two went to the school farm to get in the crops last week. 上周二年级的学生去校农场收割庄稼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you got the washing in? It's starting to rain. 快下雨了，你把洗好的衣服收进来了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got the chairs in from the garden before the rain started. 下雨前他把椅子从园中搬了进来。</font>\n<br>12. summon in 请进来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His temperature's gone down. I don't think it's necessary to get the doctor in. 他的体温已降下来了。我认为没有必要再请医生来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get somebody in to repair the television. 我们必须请人来修理电视机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got the electrician in to check the wiring. 她请来了电工检查线路。</font>\n<br>13. (cause to) be involved in（使）卷入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop gambling at cards or you'll get in debt more and more. 停止赌博，否则你就会在债务里越陷越深。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have got you deep in this matter. 他们已使你深深地卷进了这件事情里了。</font>\n<br>14. bring in as a supply; put in stock 采购生活用品：进货\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always gets the groceries in for the whole week at a time. 她总是一次把一周的付食品买回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll go out to get the coal in. 我将出去买煤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This store has just gotten in a new shipment of furs. 这家商店刚进了一船皮衣服。</font>\n
get inside	<font color=blue size=4>get inside</font>\n<br>1. enter 进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bird has got inside the chimney, and can't get out！一只鸟飞入烟囱，无法出来了。</font>\n<br>2. know; understand 领会；理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only the students and teachers can get inside the feeling of what a school is really like. 只有师生才能体会学校是怎么回事。</font>\n
get into	<font color=blue size=4>get into</font>\n<br>1. enter 进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did the thieves get into the house? 这些窃贼怎么进入室内的？</font>\n<br>2. put on; fit 穿上；适合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As I have gained weight, I can't get into my best suit. 因为体重增加，我无法穿我那件最好的西装。</font>\n<br>3. arrive at 到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship got into the harbour safely. 船平安地驶进了海港。</font>\n<br>4. learn or start 学习；着手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must get into training soon; the cricket season starts next month. 我得马上投入训练，板球季节下个月就开始了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll soon get into the way of doing it. 你很快就能学会做这件事。</font>\n<br>5. fall into or suffer; become a victim of (trouble, difficulty, debt, etc) 陷入（麻烦、困难、债务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's easier to get into debt than to get out of it again. 借债容易还债难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wouldn't take advice, and now he has got into difficulties. 他不听忠告，结果现在陷入困境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How on earth did Mary get herself into such a ridiculous situation? 玛丽究竟是怎样使自己陷入如此荒唐可笑的境地的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I promise never to get into debt again. 我保证今后永不借债。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't make so much noise. You'll get me into trouble. 请不要这么吵闹，你们会使我感到很烦躁。</font>\n<br>6. acquire; develop; get into (a habit, etc.) 养成；染上（习惯等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children got into the bad habit of switching on the television as soon as they came back from school. 孩子们养成了坏习惯，从学校一回来就打开电视机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let yourself get into the bad habit of smoking. 不要让自己染上抽烟的坏习惯。</font>\n<br>7. enter involuntarily; cause sb. to enter a certain emotional state; be affected by 不自觉地陷入或使某人陷入某种精神状态；受…影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When John found that his wife had gone out without waiting for him, he got into a blind fury and smashed the furniture up. 当约翰发现他妻子不等他就外出时，便莫名奇妙地勃然大怒并且砸坏了家俱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't let yourself get into a stew about nothing. It's bad for your blood pressure. 你不应无事自扰，这对你的血压不利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gets into a terrible rage if you just mention money. 你只要一提到钱，他就大怒起来。</font>\n<br>8. (cause to) be elected 当选；使选入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got into Parliament with an overwhelming majority. 他因获得绝大多数票而被选入议会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Conservatives got into office, but with a small majority. 保守党上台了，不过是以微弱多数上台的。</font>\n<br>9. succeed in obtaining; gain possession or control of 获得；赢得；支配\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new measures are fast getting into favour with the students. 这些新举措迅速得到了学生们的拥护。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know what has got into my son. He doesn't come back home until six. 我不知道什么东西使我儿子着了迷，他不到6点不回家。</font>\n
get lost	<font color=blue size=4>get lost</font>\n<br>lose one's direction; become lost 迷途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John got lost in the woods and did not get home until after midnight. 约翰在林中迷了路，下半夜才回到家。</font>\n
get off	<font color=blue size=4>get off</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) leave (a vehicle) （使）下（车）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus driver got the passengers off in time. 公共汽车司机让乘客及时下了车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sue got off the train at the wrong station. 苏下错了火车站。</font>\n<br>2. leave; start 离开；出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got off early and arrived be fore lunch. 我们出发得早，所以午饭前就赶到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plane got off on time. 飞机准时起飞了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got off immediately after breakfast. 早饭后，我们立即就出发了。</font>\n<br>3. clean or remove (a mark, dirt, etc.) 擦去（污渍等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's a dirty mark on the wall that I can't get off. 墙上有个污渍我无法擦掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't get the coffee stains off my shirt. 我无法去掉我衬衫上的咖啡污迹。</font>\n<br>4. tabe off 脱掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mother told him to get his wet clothes off. 他妈妈要他把湿衣服脱掉。</font>\n<br>5. (cause to) leave; not remain on （使）离开；不要停留在…之上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That grass is newly seeded; please get off. 草地刚播种，请走开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Getting children off to school is tiring work. 催促孩子们去上学是件烦人的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got him off on the evening train. 我们送他搭晚车走了。</font>\n<br>6. save; rescue 救出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The last three sailors were got off just before the ship sank. 最后3名水手刚得救船就沉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crew of the stranded yacht were in danger but we got them off, 那艘搁浅帆船上的船员处于危险之中，但我们把他们救出来了。</font>\n<br>7. escape or nearly escape punishment; save from punishment 逃避惩罚；使免遭惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves got off lightly, as the judge was not severe with them. 由于法官对窃贼不那么严厉，他们轻易地就逃避了惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got off with a warning. 他受了一次警告就完事了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The judge got him off, but he wouldn't have got him off so easily if it hadn't been a first offence. 法官从轻发落了他，若不是初犯，他是不会这么轻而易举地放过他的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lawyer got his client off. 律师使他的委托人免遭惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was his youth and inexperience that got him off. 他因年幼无知而受到从宽处理。</font>\n<br>8. escape from; free from 逃避；摆脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one should get off paying his taxes. 任何人都不应逃税。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He managed to get off doing this kind of dirty work. 他设法逃避干这类脏活儿。</font>\n<br>9. escape or nearly escape injury in an accident 在事故中免受伤害或损失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fortunately the two cars didn't crash head on, so Bill got off with nothing worse than a bad fright. 幸好这两部车没有迎头相撞，所以比尔只是受了一场惊吓。</font>\n<br>10. send; go; dispatch by post （把信件等）邮寄出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want to get this package off at once. 我想把这个包裹马上寄走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please get the letter off by the five o'clock post. 请把这些信件通过5点的那趟邮次发出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got the orders off promptly. 我们准时发出了订单。</font>\n<br>11. make a joke 说笑话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lecturer got off one or two very amusing jokes. 演讲者讲了一两个极有趣的笑话。</font>\n<br>12. learn by heart; memorize 背诵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked his students to get off the passage by heart. 老师要学生把这段文章背下来。</font>\n
get off one's chest	<font color=blue size=4>get off one's chest</font>\n<br>release one's true feelings or emotions 倾诉出自己的真实感情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I tried to hold back my real dislike for him, but I finally had to get my true feelings off my chest. 我试图掩饰对他的不喜欢，但我最后还是不得不讲出我的真实感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you get very upset, it's good to get it off your chest. 当你烦躁不安时，把事情讲出来是有好处的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you are worried about some thing, get it off your chest. 如果你有心事，就痛痛快快说出来吧。</font>\n
get off sb's back	<font color=blue size=4>get off sb's back</font>\n<br>stop criticizing or bothering sb. 不再批评或打扰某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get off my back！Don't you see how busy I am? 少罗嗦！你没看见我是多么忙吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can't you get him off my back? 你可不可以叫他不要烦我？</font>\n
get off the ground	<font color=blue size=4>get off the ground</font>\n<br>make a successful beginning; get a good start 开始很成功；顺利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make sure your plan for the party gets off the ground. 一定要使你们办舞会的计划一开始就成功。</font>\n
get on	<font color=blue size=4>get on</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) be placed on top of 登上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get on my shouders and have a look over the fence. 爬上我的肩膀，看看围墙那边。</font>\n<br>2. advance; make progress 进步；进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are getting on nicely with your English. 你的英语进步很大。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid she isn't getting on very well at school. 我担心她在学校的成绩不太好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How's your broken leg getting on ？你那受伤的腿怎么样了？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you get on all right in the exam? 你考试顺利吗？</font>\n<br>3. advance in age or grow older 变老\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His white hair and wrinkles are enough to show that he is getting on. 他的白发和皱纹足以说明他上岁数了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are all getting on, but won't admit it. 他们都在变老，但就是不服老。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your parents are getting on in years; you should take good care of them. 你的父母已经上了年纪，你得好好照顾他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is not very young; she is getting on to middle age. 她不很年轻，快到中年了。</font>\n<br>4. (cause to) take a place on (a horse, bicycle, etc.) or in (a vehi cle) 骑上（马）；上（车等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only one person at a time is allowed to get on the horse. 一次只能让一个人骑上这匹马。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got on her bicycle and cycled off quickly. 她跨上自行车，飞快地骑走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the old lady got on the bus, a young man stood up to offer her his seat. 那位老太太上车后，一位年轻人立刻站了起来给她让坐。</font>\n<br>5. be on good terms 意气相投；相处融洽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They got on with each other very well. 他们彼此相处得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's hard to get on with a suspicious man. 和一个多疑的人相处很难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They get on well at work but not privately. 他们在工作上处得不错，但私人关系不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How do you get on with him? 你跟他相处得怎么样？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We get on extremely well. 我们相处得很融洽。</font>\n<br>6. be on one's way 赶路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must be getting on; I'm late already. 我必须要赶路，我已迟了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better get on while there is still light. 我们最好趁亮赶路。</font>\n<br>7. advance in time; become late （时间）消逝；晚了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time is getting on. Shall we go now? 时间不早了，我们现在走好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's getting on. We'd better go home. 天色渐晚了，我们回家吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's was getting on towards eight o'clock when he came back home. 他到家时已经快8点钟了。</font>\n<br>8. fare; manage 过日子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are you getting on? 你近来日子过得怎样？</font>\n<br>9. continue doing sth. 继续做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't sit there talking; get on with your work. 不要坐在那里聊天，继续干活吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They couldn't get on for lack of materials. 他们由于缺少材料干不下去了。</font>\n<br>10. manage to live or work 设法对付；设法过下去；设法干下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can hardly get on without your support. 没有你的支持我简直干不下去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't get on without money in this world. 在这个世界上没有钱你休想过下去。</font>\n<br>11. put on 穿上；戴上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was cold outside; she got her hat and coat on. 外面很冷，她戴上帽子，穿上外衣。</font>\n<br>12. cause to go forward or make progress 使前进；使进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is an outstanding teacher, good at getting her pupils. 她是位优秀教师，很善于引导学生进步。</font>\n<br>13. achieve success 取得成功；发迹\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is sure to get on in life. 她一定会很有出息。</font>\n<br>14. used as an exclamation of disbelief, surprise, etc. 用作表示惊讶或不相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Guess how far I walked yesterday? ”“Ten miles? ” No, thirty two miles！”“Get on！”“你猜我昨天走了多少路？”“10英里？”“不对, 32英里！”“我不信！”</font>\n
get on for	<font color=blue size=4>get on for</font>\n<br>come near a time or an age 接近…时间或年龄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's getting on for midnight; let's go to bed. 快半夜了，我们睡觉吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Grandfather is getting on for 80. 祖父快要80岁了。</font>\n
get on sb's nerves	<font color=blue size=4>get on sb's nerves</font>\n<br>annoy sb. ; make sb. nervous 使某人不安；使某人烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The noise gets on my nerves. 那声音使我心烦意乱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child got on his parents' nerves by asking too many questions. 那孩子问的问题太多，令他父母心烦。</font>\n
get on to	<font color=blue size=4>get on to</font>\n<br>1. contact; get in touch with (often by telephone or by letter, etc.) 跟…接触或联系（常用电话、信件等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I complained to the shop about the faulty washingmachine, and they said they'd get on to the manufacturers. 我向商店埋怨那台有毛病的洗衣机，商店说，他们将和厂方取得联系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the firestation had been got on to at once, the hotel might have been saved. 如果当时和消防站立刻联系上，这家旅店就不会被烧掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll get on to them straight away and find out what is happening. 我马上就和他们联系，问清楚发生了什么事情。</font>\n<br>2. trace; detect; become aware of (sb. 's presence or activity, etc.) ; succeed in recognizing (dishonesty, deceit, etc.) 查出；侦察；得知（某人的去向或活动）；认破（虚伪性、欺骗性）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police have got on to the murderer at last. 警察终于侦察到了凶手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are beginning to get on to the traitor, at last. 我们终于开始认清了这个叛徒的嘴脸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has tricked them; they will get on to him sooner or later. 他欺骗了他们，他们迟早会识破他的面目的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The militiamen got on to the enemy agent shortly after he arrived in the country and watched his every move. 那个敌特分子刚进入国境，民兵就识破了他，并密切注视他的一举一动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm surprised that he didn't get on to the truth of the matter. 我很奇怪，他没有识破事情的真相。</font>\n<br>3. move from one activity or phase to another 转入另一活动或阶段\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now that we've cleared up those necessary routine matters we can get on to what we've all been looking forward to: Mr. Cowley's report on his visit to Thailand. 既然我们已经干完这些必须完成的日常事务，我们可以转入大家一直盼望的另一活动：听考雷先生有关访问泰国的报告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hate all this theory; when do you think we're going to get on to something useful? 我讨厌这些理论，你看我们什么时候能转而学点有用的东西？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now we'll get on to the next item on the agenda. 现在我们转入讨论下一个议程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't know the answer, leave the first question and get on to the second. 如果你答不上第1题，那就接下去答第2个问题吧。</font>\n<br>4. succeed in understanding; glasp 理解；意识到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although at first driving a car seemed difficult to me, I soon got on to it. 虽然起初我感到开车很困难，但我很快就学会了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It didn't take me long to get on to the seriousness of the situation. 我很快意识到情况的严重性。</font>\n
get on with	<font color=blue size=4>get on with</font>\n<br>1. advance with（事情）进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have got on with the translation as far as the third chapter. 我已经翻译到了第3章。</font>\n<br>2. form a friendly relationship with 与…友好相处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is slowly getting on with his schoolmates. 他正慢慢地和同学们友好相处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new teacher is getting on well with the students. 新教员和学生们相处得很好。</font>\n<br>3. continue with 继续做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't sit there talking; get on with your work. 不要坐在这儿闲谈，继续干活吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get on with it！继续干吧！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Today we'll get on with Lesson Nine. 今天我们继续讲第9课。</font>\n
get out	<font color=blue size=4>get out</font>\n<br>1. leave a car; come or go out 下车；出来；出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I told the bus driver that I wanted to get out at the next stop. 我告诉汽车司机，我要在下一站下车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took his cap and got out. 他拿了帽子出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He decided to get out while there was still time. 他决定趁还有点时间出去一趟。</font>\n<br>2. remove (sth. with an effort); take out 搬掉；去掉；拔掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't get this nail out; it's too tight. 我无法拔出这颗钉子，它太牢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you help me with this wine bottle? I can't get the cork out. 你能帮我打开这个酒瓶吗？我取不出这个木塞子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you get the stain out of your skirt? 你裙子上的污迹弄掉了吗？</font>\n<br>3. escape 逃脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The main pipe burst in the severe cold, and the gas has been getting out. 天太冷了，主管道爆裂，煤气外泄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the fighting broke out, George thought it better to get out before it was too late; so he came back to England. 战斗打响时，乔治认为他还是趁早离开的好，于是他就回到了英国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoners could not find a way to get themselves out. 囚犯们无法找到一条逃生之路。</font>\n<br>4. receive or gain 得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you take part in any performance, you get out as much as you put in. 参加任何工作，你都会得到与投入劳动相应的报酬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In most walks of life you only get out what you put in. 在大部分行业，你只能投入多少得到多少。</font>\n<br>5. print or publish 出版\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim hopes to get his new book out before the end of the year. 吉姆想在年底之前出版他那本新书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When are you getting your next book out? 你的下一本书何时出版呢？</font>\n<br>6. borrow (from a library, etc.) （从图书馆等）借出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've got twelve books out for three months. 我借了12本书，借期为3个月。</font>\n<br>7. leak out; become known unintentionally 漏出来；泄露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did the news of his appointment get out before it was officially made known? 在正式公布之前他的任命消息是怎么泄露的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the secret gets out, there'll be trouble. 如果秘密泄露出去了，那将会有麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let it get out that I knew about it. 不要对别人说我知道那件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Handle with care, or the sulphuric acid may get out. 小心轻放，否则硫酸会泼出来。</font>\n<br>8. calculate; succeed in solving or finding the correct answer 计算成功地解决；解答出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These days, scientists use computers to help them get out the difficult calculations concerning space travel. 科学工作者如今利用计算器帮助他们进行有关宇宙航行的复杂计算。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been trying to get this sum out for half an hour, but he'll have to ask the teacher for help. 他一直在尽力解这道算术题，但还是不得不请教老师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not a single student in the class got the problem out, 班上无一人解出这道题。</font>\n<br>9. speak with difficulty; manage to prouduce（困难地）说出；设法说出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker was so nervous that he could hardly get out more than a sentence. 演讲者紧张得说不出一句完整的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Paul sometimes stutters. He can't get his words out. 保尔说话有时结巴，他无法把意思说清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was so shocked that she couldn't get out a single word. 她感到大为震惊，连一句话也说不出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very embarrassed, but somehow he got the apology out. 他很尴尬，但还是勉强说出了道歉的话。</font>\n<br>10. prepare and present; make ready 编制并提出；准备好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We managed to get the teaching plan out on time. 我们终于及时制定出了教学计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've got out a very interesting scheme. 他们搞出了一个很有趣的方案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll get the car out and we can set off. 他把汽车开出来，我们就可以出发了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got a bed out for her umexpected guest. 她为这位突然来到的客人准备了张床铺。</font>\n<br>11. save 拯救\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house burnt down bat the soldiers managed to ger all the occupants out. 那幢房屋烧毁了，但是战士们把里面所有的人都救出来了。</font>\n
get out of	<font color=blue size=4>get out of</font>\n<br>1. move out of a space, building, etc. 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The door locked accidentally, and I couldn't get out of the bathroom. 门无意中锁上了，结果我无法从浴室里出来。</font>\n<br>2. remove 取出；拔出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you get this nail out of the wall? 你能拔出墙上这颗钉子吗？</font>\n<br>3. descend from (a vehicle) 从（车上）下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They can't get the cases and bags out of the plane faster. 他们无法更快地从飞机上把这些箱子和包裹搬下来。</font>\n<br>4. copy 复制；抄袭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His story isn't original; he got it out of a book. 他讲的故事并不新鲜，他是从一本书上看来的。</font>\n<br>5. escape from 从…逃脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you get out of the country if you don't like it? 既然你不喜欢这个国家，那为什么不离开它呢？</font>\n<br>6. gain from; obtain from 获取\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children are always trying to get more money out of their father. 那些孩子总想从父亲手里多弄到几个钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's nothing to be got out of this book; it's years out of date. 从这本书里得不到什么，它已经过时多年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Unfortunately, I got nothing out of his poor lecture. 糟糕的是，我从他那差劲的讲座中什么也没有学到。</font>\n<br>7. forget or lose sth. such as a habit 忘掉或去除（习惯等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joining a group will help to get you out of the habit. 加入一个小组将有助你改掉这种习惯。</font>\n<br>8. avoid doing sth.;be excused from; evade 避免做某事；逃避；摆脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish I could get out of going to that ceremony. 我希望我能不参加那仪式。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone of us must take turns to wash up; no one will be allowed to get out of it. 我们大家都得轮流洗碗，任何人不得逃避。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is trying to get out of paying his share of the bill. 他试图逃避支付账单上的他的那一份钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have an engagement for tonight, but I will try to get out of it. 我今晚有个约会，但我将设法不去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never try to get out of doing your duty. 不要逃避你的责任。</font>\n<br>get out or bed (on) the wrong side be in a bad mood or temper (from the moment one gets up) （从一起床起）心情不好；发脾气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's the matter with you? You are cursing at everyone this morning. You must have got out of bed on the wrong side. 你怎么啦？一早上你一直在骂人，你一定是心情不好。</font>\n
get out of hand	<font color=blue size=4>get out of hand</font>\n<br>become uncontrollable 难以控制；难以管制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to expand the firm quickly, but his staff did not have enough experience. Production got out of hand and he went bankrupt. 他努力迅速扩大他的公司，但是他的职工们没有足够的经验。生产难以控制，结果他破产了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children got out of hand during my absence. 我不在的时候孩子们不听管教。</font>\n
get over	<font color=blue size=4>get over</font>\n<br>1. pass; cross; move or climb over 越过；爬过；跨过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The smallest boy was unable to get over the wall as fast as the others. 这个最小的男孩翻墙没有其他孩子快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got over the obstacles easily. 他轻松地越过了障碍物。</font>\n<br>2. deal with 处理；解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I see no way of getting over the lack of paper. 我不知道解决纸张短缺的办法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have got over our problems. 我们已经解决了问题。</font>\n<br>3. recover from (surprise, illness, a loss, etc.) （从震惊、疾病、损失等中）恢复过来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It always takes some time to get over the shock of someone's death. 一个人的死亡所引起的震惊总要过一段时间才能恢复。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He soon got over his illness. 他的病很快就好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took me a long time to get over my cold. 经过好长时间，我的感冒才好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We thought Fred would never get over the shock of losing all his money, but he is starting up in business again. 我们以为弗雷德破产后难以恢复元气，可他现在又开张做起生意来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news was a shock to her, but she got over it very soon. 那个消息对她是一个震惊，但她很快就恢复了平静。</font>\n<br>4. come over 过来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll try to get over to see you sometime next week. 下周我要抽空过来拜访你。</font>\n<br>5. overcome (difficulties, etc.) 克服（困难等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get over many difficulties on our way forward. 我们必须克服我们前进道路上的困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can't get over her shyness. 她无法克服她的羞怯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you got over your financial difficulties yet? 你已经克服经济困难了吗？</font>\n<br>6. excuse; tolerate; put up with 原谅；容忍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't get over his rudeness. 我无法容忍他的无礼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't get over, John leaving for Canada without telling us. 约翰去加拿大也不告诉我们一声，我们不能原谅他。</font>\n<br>7. finish; accomplish (a task, etc.) 完成（任务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get that task over. 让我们把那个任务完成吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as you get over all the formalities, you'll be issued your work permit. 手续一办完，你就可以领到工作许可证了。</font>\n<br>8. manage to communicate; convey; make clear 设法传送（感情、思想）；表达清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gets over well when he wants to. 他想说什么，都能表达自如。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to get the main idea over to the audience. 他设法把要点给听众讲清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Wang knows his subject very well, but he's not very good at getting his ideas over to his students. 王教授精通业务，但他不善于把自己的思想向学生表达清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to get it over to us that he meant to come. 他设法给我们传了个信，说他打算来。</font>\n<br>9. cover (a distance) 走完（一段距离）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse got over the distance in ten minutes. 这马在10分钟内跑完了那段路程。</font>\n<br>10. fully believe; appreciate or understand 完全相信；领会或理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The astronaut couldn't get over the fact that in spite of the accident to the spacevehicle he had returned safely to Earth. 那位宇航员不能理解这个事实，尽管宇宙飞船出了毛病，而他却安全地返回到了地球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We really can't get over the speed of Mary's recovery from pneumonia. 我们简直不能相信玛丽的肺炎康复得如此之快。</font>\n<br>11. do sth. necessary but unpleasant 做某件必须做但又是不愉快的事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have to sit for an exam next week; I shall be glad to get it over. 下周我得参加一门考试，考完就高兴了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we must visit your parents today, let's go early and get it over with. 如果我们今天必须看你父母的话，那就早点去，去了就完事了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looked upon the marriage ceremony as a mere formality—something to be got over with as quickly as possible. 他认为结婚典礼只不过是一种仪式，要尽快结束。</font>\n<br>12. prove to be wrong;deny 证明错了；否认\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may say what you like in his defense, but you can't get over the fact that he knew he was doing wrong. 你爱怎么为他辩护都可以，但是你不能否认这个事实：他道他做错了。</font>\n
get rid of	<font color=blue size=4>get rid of</font>\n<br>escape from 摆脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not easy to get rid of a bad habit. 去掉一种坏习惯是很不容易的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't get rid of my cold. 我感冒老不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should get rid of the bad style and keep the good. 我们应该去掉不良作风，保持优良作风。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should get rid of such silly ideas. 你必须去掉这些胡涂观念。</font>\n
get the better of/best of	<font color=blue size=4>get the better of/best of</font>\n<br>win over; beat;defeat 赢得；打败；获胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got the best of it in the contest. 他在比赛中赢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be careful in dealing with him because he will try to get the better of you. 对付他要小心，因为他会设法击败你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He easily got the better of her in that argument. 在那场辩论中他轻而易举地击败了她。</font>\n
get the message/the word	<font color=blue size=4>get the message/the word</font>\n<br>understand clearly what is meant 理解；完全了解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher talked to the students about being on time, and most of them got the message. 老师要学生养成守时的习惯，大部分同学都了解他的意思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Miss Li hinted to her boyfriend that she wanted to break up, but he didn't get the message. 李小姐暗示她的男友要和他分手，但他并没有理解她的意思。</font>\n
get the sack	<font color=blue size=4>get the sack</font>\n<br>1. be fired or dismissed from work 被解雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack got the sack at the factory last week. 杰克上周被工厂解雇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the depression, many workers got the sack. 在不景气的时候，许多工人被解雇了。</font>\n<br>2. be told by one's lover that the relationship is over 与恋人绝交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary gave Sam the sack. 玛丽与山姆断交了。</font>\n
get through	<font color=blue size=4>get through</font>\n<br>1. pass through 通过；穿过；越过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water gets through the house every time it rains. 每逢下雨，这房子都漏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You would wonder how such a large animal could get through such a small hole. 你或许会想这样大的一个动物是怎么通过这么小的一个洞的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got through into the flooded mine and rescued the wounded miners. 他钻进了淹了水的矿井，把受伤的矿工救了出来。</font>\n<br>2. finish or deal with 完成；解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've a pile of papers to get through before the meeting. 会前我有一堆文件要处理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got through his business as quickly as he could. 他尽快完成了他的事务工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My secretary is very quick; she gets through a lot of work in a morning. 我的秘书很利索，她一个早上能干完许多事情。</font>\n<br>3. be successful in; pass an examination or vote（考试）及格；通过考试或表决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I got through the written papers but failed in the oral examination. 我笔试及格，但口试失败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher got them through without any failures. 老师让学生全部通过了考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The candidates didn't all get through. 候选人没有全部通过。</font>\n<br>4. be approved by Parliament, etc; cause (a bill, etc.) to be passed 通过（议案、法案等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bill got through by a margin of five votes. 这议案以5票的微弱多数通过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We hardly had any difficulty in getting the bill through. 我们毫不费劲地就使这项议案通过了。</font>\n<br>5. consume; spend; use up 花完；用完；度过（时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She got through her husband's money in a year. 她一年内就把丈夫的钱全花完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may wonder how so much food could be got through by such a small child. 你会感到奇怪，这样小的孩子怎么能吃掉那么多的食物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He usually gets through his salary by the middle of the month. 他通常半个月就用完了一个月的工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His Sundays were difficult to get through. 他的星期天很难打发。</font>\n<br>6. reach a destination 抵达目的地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If more supplies do not get through in time, thousands of refugees will die. 如果更多的救济品不能及时到达的话，数以千计地难民将要死亡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I started as soon as your message got through to me. 我一接到你的信就立刻动身了。</font>\n<br>7. make contact with sb. (usu. by telephone) 接通（电话）；取得联系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The operator finally got me through. 电话员终于帮我接通了电话。</font>\n<br>8. succeed in surviving 经过…之后仍然活着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient got through another bad winter. 这病人又平安地度过了一个严冬。</font>\n
get through to	<font color=blue size=4>get through to</font>\n<br>1. reach by telephone 接通（电话等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't get through to London; the lines are always busy. 我无法接通伦敦，因为老是占线。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I called you several times yesterday evening but couldn't get through to you. 昨天晚上我给你打了好几次电话，但是都没有打通。</font>\n<br>2. (cause to) be understood by（使）被理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Few teachers can get through to students who don't, want to learn. 教师很难使自己讲的东西被不想学的学生所理解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I explained once again, but I still couldn't get through to him. 我又解释了一遍，但他仍然听不懂。</font>\n<br>3. (esp. in sports) reach (the next stage of a competition) （体育）进入下一比赛阶段\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were so pleased when our team got through to the last part of the competition. 我们队进入了最后一轮比赛，我们很高兴。</font>\n<br>4. arrive successfully 顺利到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news finally got through to us. 这消息终于传到了我们这里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The villagers were cut off by the flood, but the army managed to get supplies through to them. 由于闹水灾，村民们与外界失去了联系，可是军队设法把给养运到他们那里。</font>\n
get to	<font color=blue size=4>get to</font>\n<br>1. arrive at; reach the point of 到达；触及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boat will only get you to the nearest island, and you have to make your own way from there. 这只小船只能把你带到最近的一个岛屿，你得从那儿再自己走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get to the bottom of the matter. 对这个事情我们必须追根究底。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have got to the essence of things. 他们已经触及到了事物的本质。</font>\n<br>2. disappear 消失；不见了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know where my ring has got to; I hope it has not been stolen. 我不知道我的戒指到哪儿去了，但愿不是被偷掉了。</font>\n<br>3. start 着手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get to our work now. 现在我们得开始工作了。</font>\n<br>4. be understood by 被理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've tried to help the troublesome boy, but I can't seem to get to him. 我一直试图帮助这个好惹事的男孩，但我似乎无法被他所理解。</font>\n<br>5. have an effect on the feelings of （对人的情感）产生影响；感动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His sad story really got to me, and I wanted to help him. 他的不幸经历确实使我感动，我想帮助他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think your accusation got to John. 我想你的控告对约翰是有影响的。</font>\n
get together	<font color=blue size=4>get together</font>\n<br>1. collect 搜集\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It'll take me a week to get together all the materials I need for my talk. 搜集我演讲所需要的全部数据得花一周时间。</font>\n<br>2. assemble; bring together; unite 集会；和好；团结\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We get together once a year at Christmas time. 我们每年圣诞节时聚会一次。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary and her husband had a quarrel yesterday, but I got them together at my house, and they made up. 玛丽和她丈夫吵了一架，我把他们在我家劝到一起又和好了。</font>\n<br>3. reach an agreement 达成协议；取得一致意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whether the two great powers will ever get together is impossible to say. 这两个大国能否达成协议还很难说。</font>\n
get up	<font color=blue size=4>get up</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) arise from a bed（使）起床\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please get up at five tomorrow. 明天请5点起床。</font>\n<br>2. stand; rise from one's seat 由（座位等）站起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Few men these days get up to give a lady a seat on a bus. 如今几乎没有几个男士在公共汽车上给女士让座。</font>\n<br>3. organize; plan 组织；筹划\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children are getting up a play for next week. 孩子们正组织下周的演出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The youth club is getting up a concert. 青年俱乐部正在筹备一场音乐会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students have got up another petition against the building of a neclear power station. 学生们又一次组织了抗议建立核电站的请愿活动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our reading club is getting up a picnic for next month. 我们的读书俱乐部正计划下个月的野餐。</font>\n<br>4. move to a higher level 爬高（坡）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hill was so steep that the old car had difficulty getting up. 此山太陡，这辆老车很难爬上去。</font>\n<br>5. rise in position（在地位或职位上）晋升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thompson has got up in the world. 汤普森举世闻名了。</font>\n<br>6. dress up; make beautiful or attractive 打扮；装扮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children were got up in their best ckitges on June 1. 孩子们在6月1日穿上了节日的盛装。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She gets herself up attractively like a girl of twenty. 她打扮得很迷人，象一个20岁的姑娘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They got grand father up as Father Christmas. 他们把爷爷打扮成了圣诞老人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book has been got up very nicely by the designer. 设计师把这本书装帧得非常漂亮。</font>\n<br>7. study; memorize 学习；背熟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I should get up my history for the test tomorrow. 我得背历史准备明天的考试。</font>\n<br>8. stimulate; rouse 激发；激起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His rude manner really got my blood up. 他那无理的态度简直把我的肺都要气炸了。</font>\n
get up against	<font color=blue size=4>get up against</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) stand or move next to（使）靠近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I got up against the window to try to look out. 我走近窗户想往外看。</font>\n<br>2. offend; annoy 冒犯；触怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you don't get up against the director in one of his bad tempers. 我希望你别在主任脾气不好时去冒犯他。</font>\n

get up to	<font color=blue size=4>get up to</font>\n<br>1. reach 达到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The temperature got up to 32℃ by 9 o'clock. 9点钟气温达到32℃。</font>\n<br>2. do (sth. bad) 干（坏事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whatever will the students get up to next? 学生下一步究竟想搞什么名堂？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always gets up to all sorts of tricks. 他总是玩弄各种诡计。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go and see what those boys are getting up to. 去看看那些男孩在捣什么鬼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't get up to any mischief. 不要胡闹。</font>\n<br>3. catch up with; come level with 赶上；达到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope to get up to the required speed for the shorthand exam within the next two months. 我希望在两个月内能达到速记考试所要求的速度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He soon got up to the other students in his class. 他很快就赶上了班上其他学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had just got up to that boat when a strong wind hit us. 我们刚要赶上那条船，就遭到了一股大风的袭击。</font>\n
get what's coming to one	<font color=blue size=4>get what's coming to one</font>\n<br>receive the good or bad that one deserves; get what is due to one; get one's share 善有善报，恶有恶报；得到应得的奖赏或惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the end of the movie the traitor got what was coming to him and was put in jail. 影片结束时，那个叛徒得到了应有的惩罚，被关进了监狱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John didn't think he was getting what was coming to him, so he quit the job in that company. 约翰认为他没有拿到他应得的酬劳，所以他辞掉了那个公司的工作。</font>\n
get wind of	<font color=blue size=4>get wind of</font>\n<br>get news of; hear rumours about 听到风声；获悉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain didn't want the sailors to get wind of where the ship was going. 船长不想让水手们获悉这艘船开往何处。</font>\n
get wise to	<font color=blue size=4>get wise to</font>\n<br>learn about secret; become alert to 得知（秘密）；警觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are getting wise to her tricks now, and it's not easy any more for her to put anything over us. 我们已渐渐识破了她的花招，她不能再轻易地瞒过我们了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are very lazy. If you don't get wise to yourself and start studying, you will fail the course. 你很懒惰，如果你对自己不警觉，还不开始学习的话，你的功课就会不及格。</font>\n
geve in	<font color=blue size=4>geve in</font>\n<br>1. hand in 上交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give your examination papers in when you have finsihed. 做完试卷就交上来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy gave their guns to our soldiers. 敌人向我们的战士交了枪。</font>\n<br>2. offer 提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Names of all students entering for the examination must be given in by March 1. 参加考试的学生名单须在3月1日前提出。</font>\n<br>3. surrender; acknowledge defeat 投降；屈服；认输\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The argument went on for hours as neither side would give in. 辩论持续了好几个小时，因为双方谁也不肯认输。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Completely surrounded by our troops, the enemy finally gave in. 敌人在被我军彻底包围以后，终于投降了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has given in to my views at last. 他们最后接受了我的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't win the game, so you may as well give in. 你赢不了这场比赛，所以还是认输算了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he was ill, he stuck at his work and refused to give in. 虽然有病，但他仍然坚持工作，不肯示弱。</font>\n<br>4. yield to sb. 's desire or wishes; let sb. 's have his own way 让步；迁就；听任（某人的愿望或希望）；让某人为所欲为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Children who are always given in to by their parents soon become spoiled. 被父母一味迁就的孩子很快会被宠坏的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Looking back on it, I wish we hadn't given in so easily. 回过头来看，我后悔我们不该轻易地作了让步。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If your son pleads with you to let him stay at home from school, you mustn't give in to him. 如果你儿子求你允许他呆在家里不去上学，你不能迁就他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the boy proved that he could ride a bicycle safely, his father gave in to him and bought him one. 当这男孩证明他能安全地骑自行车后，他父亲对他作出了让步，给他买了一部自行车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With justice on our side, we will never give in. 正义在我们这边，我们决不让步。</font>\n<br>5. cave in; give away 坍下；支撑不住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The floor will give in if you put the heavy machine on it. 如果你把沉重的机器放在地板上，地板会塌下去的。</font>\n
