give and take	<font color=blue size=4>give and take</font>\n<br>1. compromise; mutual concession 妥协；互相谦让；宽容\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There must be give and take if the negotiations between the two parties are to succeed. 如果双方的协商要想成功的话，他们必须有互相谦让的精神。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Relations between her and her husband would be much more harmonious if only there were a little more give and take. 她和她丈夫之间只要稍微互相谦让一些，关系就会融洽多了。</font>\n<br>2. friendly talking or arguing back and forth; friendly sharing of ideas which may not agree; an exchange of teasing remarks 友善地交换意见；虽然意见不同但友善地保持一致；互相取笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom and Jerry were always arguing, but it was all in the friendly spirit of giveandtake. 汤姆和杰里常常争论，但总是在友好的气氛中进行争论。</font>\n
give away	<font color=blue size=4>give away</font>\n<br>1. give as a present 赠给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave away all his books before death. 他临死前献出了他的全部书籍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave all his possessions away and became a monk. 他把所有的财产都送给了别人，自己出家当了修士。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The millionaire gave all his money away. 这位百万富翁把他所有的钱都捐出来了。</font>\n<br>2. reveal 泄露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't give away our secret. 不要泄露我们的秘密。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They suspected that the secret had been given away by one of their friends. 他们怀疑秘密已被他们的一个朋友所泄露。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's not giving away anything he told her. 他告诉她的事，她一点儿也没有泄露。</font>\n<br>3. betray 出卖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was given away by a traitor. 他被一个叛徒出卖了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nobody knows I've done this, so please don't give me away. 没有人知道我干了这件事，所以请你不要出卖我。</font>\n<br>4. distribute 分发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guest gave away the prizes. 客人分发了礼品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The headmaster gave away the prizes at the sports meeting. 市长在运动会上颁发奖品。</font>\n<br>5. (in a marriage ceremony) lead the bride to the groom's side and give her to him（在婚礼上）把新娘带到新郎身边并交给他\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bride was given away by her father. 新娘由其父亲领着交给了新郎。</font>\n
give back	<font color=blue size=4>give back</font>\n<br>1. return; reflect 返回；反射\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This chamber gives back a marvellous echo. 这个房间能反射一种奇妙的声音。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two opposite mirrors gave back many parallel images. 两面对照的镜子反映出许多相同的形象。</font>\n<br>2. allow to enjoy again (health, freedom, liberty, etc.) 恢复（健康、自由等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was nothing the doctors could do to give me back the use of my legs. 医生已没有办法使我的腿恢复功能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They gave those people back their freedom. 他们恢复了那些人的自由。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Living in the country has given me back my health. 居住在乡村使我恢复了健康。</font>\n<br>3. withdraw from a position or a place; retreat 向后站；后撤；后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd gave back to let the policemen through. 人群向后退让警察走过去。</font>\n
give birth to	<font color=blue size=4>give birth to</font>\n<br>bring forth children 生（孩子）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane's mother has just given birth to twins. 简的妈妈刚刚生了一对双胞胎。</font>\n
give credit (to) 	<font color=blue size=4>give credit (to) </font>\n<br>1. believe that sb. possesses; credit with 相信；信以为真\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Few of us gave credit to his story. 我们中间没什么人相信他讲的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you give credit to his story of what happened? 你对他讲的所发生的事情相信吗？</font>\n<br>2. give recognition, praise, approval（对某事）给予承认、称赞或赞许\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The credit for the success of the English Speech Contest should be given to the teacher who organized it. 成功地组织这次英语演讲的老师应该受到称赞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One must give credit where it is due. 该称赞的就应该称赞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I gave you credit for being more sensible; but you are less sensible than I thought. 我过去赞扬你很懂事，但是我未料到你不象我想象的那样懂事。</font>\n
give ear to	<font color=blue size=4>give ear to</font>\n<br>listen to carefully 倾听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must give ear to what the teacher tells you. 你必须倾听老师对你讲的话。</font>\n
give forth	<font color=blue size=4>give forth</font>\n<br>1. produce and send out (a sound, smell, etc.) 产生；发生（声音等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bell, when struck, gives forth a sound. 钟被敲打时就发出声响。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jasmin gives forth a pleasant fragrance. 茉莉花散发出一种诱人的芳香。</font>\n<br>2. publish; report 发表；公布；传说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has given forth three books in a year. 他在一年之内已发表了3本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Soon after, it was given forth, and believed by many that Hitler was dead. 不久有消息传来，说希特勒已经死去，很多人都相信这个传闻。</font>\n
give/lend an ear to	<font color=blue size=4>give/lend an ear to</font>\n<br>listen to 听；听从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Children should give an ear to their parents'advice. 小孩应该听从父母的劝告。</font>\n
give/lend color to	<font color=blue size=4>give/lend color to</font>\n<br>make sth. seem true or likely（加以渲染）使某事可信、生动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The illustrations he used helped to give colour to his lecture. 他采用的图解使他的演讲大为生动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy's torn clothes gave color to his story of a fight. 这孩子的衣服被撕破，这更使人相信他跟别人打架的故事了。</font>\n
give off	<font color=blue size=4>give off</font>\n<br>release esp. a liquid, gas or smell 散发（液体、气体等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Boiling water gives off steam. 开水产生蒸汽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't shower more often, your body will give off an unpleasant odor. 如果你不经常淋浴，你的身体就会散发出一股难闻的味道。</font>\n
give oneself airs	<font color=blue size=4>give oneself airs</font>\n<br>act proud; act vain 盛气凌人；装腔作势；摆架子；神气活现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John gave himself airs when he won first prize in the English Speech Contest. 约翰在英语演讲赛中获得第1名，便神气活现。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always gives himself airs. 他总是摆架子。</font>\n
give oneself away	<font color=blue size=4>give oneself away</font>\n<br>show guilt; show one has done wrong 泄露罪行；露马脚；现原形\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief gave himself away by spending a lot of money. 小偷大量挥霍钞票而露了马脚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His accent gave himself away. 他的口音暴露了他是哪儿人。</font>\n
give oneself to	<font color=blue size=4>give oneself to</font>\n<br>apply oneself habitually to 专心致力于；迷恋于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give yourself to didigent study and you will certainly succeed. 刻苦钻研，你准能成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has given himself to his work, body and soul. 他一心扑在工作上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has given herself to vicious habits. 她已陷入恶习不能自拔。</font>\n
give oneself up	<font color=blue size=4>give oneself up</font>\n<br>stop hiding or running away; surrender 自首；投案；投降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>News came that the murderer had given himself up. 有消息说，杀人犯已经投案自首了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief gave himself up to the police. 小偷向警方自首了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Thompson hit another car, and his wife told him to give himself up. 汤普森撞到了另一辆车，其妻叫他去投案。</font>\n
give oneself up to	<font color=blue size=4>give oneself up to</font>\n<br>not to hold oneself back from; let oneself enjoy; apply oneself wholly to 纵容；沉溺于；致力于；献身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave himself up to a life of wandering. 他任其一生过着流浪的生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has given himself wholly up to the study of the subject. 他全身心地致力于这门学科的研究。</font>\n
give out	<font color=blue size=4>give out</font>\n<br>1. send out (sound or light, etc.) 产生（声音、光等）；散发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun gives out light and heat to the earth. 太阳给大地以光和热。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Roses give out a sweet smell. 玫瑰花发出芬芳的气息。</font>\n<br>2. distribute 分给；散发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government gives out payments to people out of work. 政府给失业的人发放救济金。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give out the papers ten minutes before the examination. 考前10分钟发试卷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children gave out flowers to the soldiers. 儿童向战士们献了鲜花。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We saw a man giving out leaflets in the street. 我们看到一个人在街上散发传单。</font>\n<br>3. announce; declare; make known 宣布；公布；发表\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has refused to give out any further information on the matter. 他拒绝就这一问题发表任何更多的消息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave out that the mayor had been elected. 他宣布新市长已经选出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of the event was given out over the radio. 关于这个事件的消息已通过电台发布了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was given out that the strikers had decided to return to work, and place their dispute in the hands of their union. 据宣布，罢工者已决定复工，并决定将其争端交给工会解决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The result of the examination will be given out this week. 考试成绩将在本周公布。</font>\n<br>4. be used up; become exhausted 用完；耗尽；力竭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When their ammunition gave out the enemy troops had to surrender. 当弹药用完时，敌军只好投降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His strength gave out after he ran that long distance. 跑完这么一段长距离，他已精疲力竭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had just reached home when the petrol gave out. 我们刚好到家，汽油用光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His patience gave out long ago. 他的耐心早已消磨殆尽。</font>\n<br>5. stop functioning 停止运转；出故障；抛锚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were ten miles from Shanghai when the engine gave out. 我们在离上海还有10英里时，发动机坏了。</font>\n
give over	<font color=blue size=4>give over</font>\n<br>1. stop doing sth. 停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please give over crying. 请不要哭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain lessened gradually and gave over at last. 雨渐渐小下来，终于停了。</font>\n<br>2. hand over; transfer 移交；委托\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The keys were given over to our neighbours during our absence. 外出时，我们把钥匙交给了邻居。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave charge of the office over to his successor. 他将职务移交给他的接班人。</font>\n<br>3. set apart for a particular purpose 腾出；留出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fifth floor is given over to the administrative offices. 5楼留作行政办公室。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The area is now given over to a huge hotel. 这块地现在腾出造一个大饭店。</font>\n<br>4. abandon 放弃；不再抱有希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient was given over by the doctor. 医生认为这病人已无法治疗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's about time you gave over that kind of conduct . 该是你改掉这种行为的时候了。</font>\n<br>5. yield (oneself); devote one's time to 放任；沉溺于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't give yourself over to drink all day long. 不要整天沉溺于饮酒。</font>\n
give rise to	<font color=blue size=4>give rise to</font>\n<br>cause 引起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such conduct might give rise to misunderstandings. 这种行为可能引起误会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A branch floating in the water gave rise to Columbus'hopes that land was near. 一根漂在水上的树枝使哥伦布产生了大陆就在附近的希望。</font>\n
give sba pain	<font color=blue size=4>give sba pain</font>\n<br>make sb. disgusted or annoyed 使人讨厌或烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bruce's laziness gives his mother a pain. 布鲁斯的懒惰使他母亲烦恼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His bad manners give his teacher a pain. 他的粗鲁使他的老师头痛。</font>\n

give thought to	<font color=blue size=4>give thought to</font>\n<br>think of 想到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan is good, and I've given no thought to change. 计划很好，我并没有想到要改变它。</font>\n
give up	<font color=blue size=4>give up</font>\n<br>1. stop trying; cease doing sth. 停止做某事；放弃做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I did want a holiday abroad, but I've given up the ided. 我确实想出国度假，但现在已放弃了这个想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If everyone gave up smoking and drinking, it would bring about the breakdown of tobacco and liquor indurstries. 如果人人戒掉烟酒，就会使烟酒业破产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems so ungrateful for anything we did that we have given up trying to help him. 他对于我们为他做的任何一件事是如此忘恩负义，以致我们不打算帮助他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She realized she was wrong and gave up the argument. 她意识到她错了，便停止了争论。</font>\n<br>2. stop hoping for; give up as a bad job; abandon hope; lose hope 对…不抱希望；对…绝望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her brother was given up by the doctors after the accident, but he lived just the same. 她弟弟在那场事故以后已被医生宣布活不长了，但他却活得很正常。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She seems to have given up all hope. 她似乎已放弃了一切希望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The climbers were given up for lost. 寻找失踪的登山者是没有希望了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just as it had been given up for lost, the necklace was found. 项链丢失了，正对它不抱希望时，却又找到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall never get that fellow to see the error of his ways; we may as well give him up as a bad job. 我们绝不会使那个家伙认识到自己的错误，我们还是不去管他算了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Much time and money was spent on attempting to repair the machine, but it had to be given up as a bad job. 花了很多时间和钱想把这台机器修好，但是没有希望，只好放弃。</font>\n<br>3. hand over; deliver up 交出；让出；移交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He refused to give up the documents, alleging that they had been entrusted to him by their owner. 他拒绝交出文件，声称那是文件的主人委托他保管的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave the books up to his brother. 他把书交给了他弟弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The passengers gave up their tickets as they left the railway station. 旅客们离开火车站时交出了车票。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man gave up his seat on the bus to the old man. 这位年轻人在公共汽车上把座位让给了那位老人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she realized that she would have to give up her children, she dropped the idea of getting a divorce. 当她意识到她要失去孩子时，就放弃了离婚的念头。</font>\n<br>4. devote; set apart or devote to a particular purpose or use 从事；全部用于（常用于被动态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rest of the evening was given up to letter writing. 那晚其余的时间用来写信了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole winter was given up to physical training. 整个冬季都用来体育训练。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His weekends were given up to golfing and motoring. 他的周末都用于打高尔夫球和驾驶汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her Sundays were given up to the preparation of a lecture. 她的星期日都用来备课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new building will be given up to the library. 新大楼将作图书馆。</font>\n<br>5. break the courtship off with; stop keeping company with 与…断绝恋爱关系；不再同…交朋友\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young lady threatened that if her sweetheart did not stop gambling she would give him up. 这位年轻的小姐威胁她恋人说，如果他不停止赌博，她就同他断绝关系。</font>\n<br>6. reveal; disclose 泄露；透露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't give up the secret of the Party. 她没有泄露党的秘密。</font>\n<br>7. surrender 投降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The murderer has given himself up. 杀人凶手已投案自首。</font>\n
give way	<font color=blue size=4>give way</font>\n<br>1. retreat; make room; get out of the way 退却；让路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Private cars should give way to an ambulance. 私人汽车应给救护车让路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy army is giving way before the cannon fire. 敌军在炮火前撤退。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John gave way to the old lady and let her pass. 约翰让路给老太太过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd slowly gave way before the policeman. 警察迫近时，那群人便慢慢退后。</font>\n<br>2. collapse 倒坍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The walls gave way in the earthquake. 墙在地震时倒坍了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wooden bridge gave way under the heavy load. 那座木桥因吃不住重压而倒塌了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The river was so high that the dam gave way. 河水水位太高，堤坝崩溃了。</font>\n<br>3. yield 屈服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her fear gave way to joy when she learned that the accident had not been serious. 她得知事故并不严重时喜形于色，不再恐惧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A deadlock was reached in the discussions, as neither side would give way to the other. 讨论已陷入僵局，因为双方互不让步。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary refused at first to marry him, but she gave way at last. 玛丽最初拒绝嫁给他，但是她最后让步了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We finally had to give way to his persuasion. 最后，我们听从了他的劝告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must not give way to his unreasonable demands or he will only make further demands. 你切不可对他的无理要求让步，否则，他就会得寸进尺。</font>\n<br>4. lose control of oneself; lose one's courage or hope 忍不住；失去控制；失去勇气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't give way during the flood, though she was very frightened. 她在洪水来临时虽然很害怕，但是没有失去自控。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She forced herself not to give way to her emotions. 她极力克制自己的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so frightened that his legs gave way under him. 他吓得两腿发软，站都站不起来。</font>\n<br>5. allow oneself to be overcome by; allow to decide 被…征服；听凭决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't give way to despair. 不要被绝望所压倒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She gave way to her husband in buying a new car. 她任她丈夫决定买部新车。</font>\n<br>6. be replaced or succeeded by; give place to 让位；转变为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grey clouds gradually broke up and gave way to a blue sky. 乌云渐渐消失，天晴了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As winter gave way to spring, the day began to lengthen. 冬天转变为春天时，白天开始长了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jealousy gave way to admiration of thir prowess. 人们已由嫉妒转变到钦佩他们的杰出才干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sorrow gave way to joy. 伤心转为喜悦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Black and white television has given way to colour television in popularity. 黑白电视已普遍为彩色电视所取代。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she saw the clowns, her tears gave way to laughter. 当她看到小丑演出时，破涕为笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her grief gave way to happiness as soon as she heard that her husband was still alive. 当她听到她丈夫还活着时，她一下子转悲为喜。</font>\n
glance at	<font color=blue size=4>glance at</font>\n<br>look quickly at 快看一眼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Glancing at the clock she saw that she was late. 看了一下钟，她知道她迟到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before going to work, I used to glance at the newspaper headlines. 上班之前，我习惯浏览一下报纸的大标题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She glanced shyly at him out of the corners of her eyes. 她害羞地从眼角里看了他一眼。</font>\n
glance down	<font color=blue size=4>glance down</font>\n<br>read quickly 速读；粗略地看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As she glanced down the list, she saw that she had left out a name. 她粗看一下名单，发现漏掉一个名字。</font>\n
glance off	<font color=blue size=4>glance off</font>\n<br>touch with a light blow 擦过；掠过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A big stone glanced off the bulletproof windows of his limousine. 一块巨石从他轿车的防弹窗上擦过。</font>\n
glance over/through	<font color=blue size=4>glance over/through</font>\n<br>run over 粗读；略读\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He glanced over my report and said that it seemed to be all right. 他看了一下我的报告说，写得似乎还可以。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher glanced over my manuscript and picked out a few spelling mistakes. 老师看了我的手稿并指出了一些拼写错误。</font>\n
go about	<font color=blue size=4>go about</font>\n<br>1. move freely（四处）自由走动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People are going about more now that the weather's better. 天气转好，人们四处走动的更多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Teenage boys tend to go about in groups. 十几岁的男孩喜欢成群结伙地四处闲逛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is dangerous to go about on the construction site without a safety helmet. 不戴安全帽在工地上走来走去是危险的。</font>\n<br>2. circulate; go around; spread 流传；四处传播（谣言、消息等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story may not be true, but it is going about all the same. 故事可能不真实，但照样四处流传。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is another rumour going about that the President will resign soon. 还有一条传闻说，总统不久就要辞职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are whispers going about the city that the Bank is to raise its interest. 城里流传说银行要提高利率。</font>\n<br>3. be busy with; be occupied with; keep working on 忙于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children are going about their homework very seriously tonitht. 孩子们今晚忙着认真地做作业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go about your businss. 去忙你自己的事吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The best cure for grief is to go about your usual work. 消除悲伤的最好办法是做你通常做的事。</font>\n<br>4. tackle; make a start at 交涉；对付；着手处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you help me with this problem? I don't quite know how to go about it. 你能帮我解决这个问题吗？我不太清楚如何处理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid you're not going about it the right way. 你这样做恐怕方法不对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will go about it with his whole heart. 他将全心全意地从事这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must go about our work or we'll fall behind the schedule. 我们必须着手这项工作，否则就完不成预定的计划了。</font>\n<br>5. keep company for friendship or for courting 来往密切；恋爱\n<br>How long have Eric and Hilda been going about with each other? \n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>埃里克和希尔妲恋爱多久了？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He goes about with a group of nice boys. 他常和一群好孩子在一起玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That pretty girl is about with a man who is old enough to be her father. 那位漂亮的姑娘正同一个年纪大得足以做她父亲的人来往很密切。</font>\n<br>6. (ship) change direction（船）改变航向；掉转方向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as the captain heard the cry “Man overboard”, he ordered the ship to go about and search for the missing man. 船长一听到“有人落水”的喊声，就命令掉转船头寻找失踪的人。</font>\n
go about one's business	<font color=blue size=4>go about one's business</font>\n<br>mind one's own business; occupy oneself with one's own affairs; stop interfering with the affairs of other people 专心于自己的事；不要管别人的闲事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better go about you own business. 你还是管管自己的事吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've no time to play chess with you; I've got to go about my business. 我没有时间跟你下棋，我要干我的事情了。</font>\n
go across	<font color=blue size=4>go across</font>\n<br>1. move across 过（马路）；渡（海）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We go across to the island every summer; it's so peaceful there. 我们每年夏天都渡海到那个岛上，那儿非常宁静。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went across to the other side of the street. 他们从这一边横穿到街的另一边去了。</font>\n<br>2. become understood or accepted 被理解；被接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did your speech go across to the crowd all right? 你的讲话那群人都理解了吗？</font>\n
go after	<font color=blue size=4>go after</font>\n<br>1. chase; try to catch 跟踪；追\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Half the guards went after the escaped prisoners, but they got away free. 半数的哨兵都去追赶逃犯，但他们还是跑掉了。</font>\n<br>2. aim for 以…为目标\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went there after petroleum. 他们去那里是为了那里的石油。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim's gone after another job. 吉姆一直在寻找另一份工作。</font>\n<br>3. try to win; pursue 赢得；追求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim intends to go after the big prize. 吉姆想得大奖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is going after the championship. 他在争取冠军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They both went after the same girl. 他们俩追求同一个姑娘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shouldn't go after fame and wealth. 我们不应追求名利。</font>\n
go against	<font color=blue size=4>go against</font>\n<br>1. oppose 反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use going against the customs of a country that you are visiting. 反对你所访问国家的风俗习惯是没有用处的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know why everything seems to go against me. 我弄不懂为什么事事都好象在跟我作对。</font>\n<br>2. be not in favour of 不利于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am afraid the case will go against you. 我担心这案件对你不利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The war goes against them. 这场战争对他们不利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The umpire's decision went against our team. 裁判员的判决对我们队不利。</font>\n<br>3. be opposite to; be contrary to 违背\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It goes against my nature to get up early in the morning. 我生性不习惯早起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you have done goes against your parents'wishes. 你所做的事与你父母的愿望相反。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His likes of purposely going against the opininons of most people put him in a disadvantageous position. 他喜欢故意违背大多数人的意见，这使他处于很不利的地位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lilly went against her mother's withes when she married Tony. 莉莉违背母意与托尼结婚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We mustn't do anything that goes against the interest of the people. 我们决不能做违反人民利益的事。</font>\n
go against the grain	<font color=blue size=4>go against the grain</font>\n<br>be contrary to sb. 's nature or inclination 不合自己的性格或本意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Staying in bed may go against the grain but that's what you must do if you want to get better. 卧床休息虽说你并不喜欢，但是如果你想恢复健康就必须这么做。</font>\n
go ahead	<font color=blue size=4>go ahead</font>\n<br>1. begin to do sth.;not wait 着手做某事；尽管去做；不要等（常用于祈使句）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“May I ask you a question? ”“Yes, go ahead. ”“我可以问你一个问题吗？”“可以，问吧！”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“May I start? ”“Yes, go ahead. ”“我可以开始了吗？”“行，开始吧。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told the students not to write on the paper yet, but John went ahead and wrote his name. 老师还没叫学生在纸上写，约翰就已开始写了他的名字。</font>\n<br>2. continue 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The council at last gave us permission to go ahead with our building plans. 委员会最后准许我们执行建筑计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be disturbed; just go ahead with your work. 不要受干扰，你们只管干你们的活。</font>\n<br>3. make progress; proceed; go forward 进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the strike settled, word on the new bridge went ahead like wildfire. 罢工的问题解决之后，新桥梁的建设速度突飞猛进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are going ahead rapidly in their capital construction in the city. 他们城市的基本建设进展很快。</font>\n<br>4. go first; go in front; move forward 领先；先走一步；走在前面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The athlete quickly went ahead in the race. 那位运动员很快在比赛中取得领先地位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go ahead and tell them that we will be there shortly. 你先走一步，告诉他们我们随后就到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is going ahead of me in English study; it's difficult for me to catch up with him. 他英语学习超过了我，我很难赶上他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the first trains ran, a law was passed stating that a man had to go ahead with a red flag to warn people that the train was coming. 当第一批火车开始运行时，通过了一项法律：必须有一个手持红旗的人在前面警告人们列车来了。</font>\n
go all out	<font color=blue size=4>go all out</font>\n<br>make one's utmost effort 尽某人最大努力；鼓足干劲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police are going all out to put a stop to the violence. 警察们正全力以赴制止这场暴力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall have to go all out if we are to win the race. 如果我们想赢得这场比赛，就得全力以赴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are going all out to make the fair a success. 他们正在全力以赴使这次交易会获得成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government is going all out to clear the cities of air pollution. 政府正在尽一切努力消灭城市污染。</font>\n
go all the way with	<font color=blue size=4>go all the way with</font>\n<br>agree completely; and in every respect; be in complete agreement 完全同意；完全一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I go all the way with what George says about Bill. 我完全同意乔治对比尔的看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Much of what you say I agree with, but I cannot go all the way with you. 你说的话很多我都同意，但我不能完全同意你的看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would go all the way with you in what you have just said. 我完全同意你刚才所说的话。</font>\n
go along	<font color=blue size=4>go along</font>\n<br>go on 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Work like this becomes less interesting as you go along. 这样的工作越往下干就越觉得没有兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may have some difficulty with this book at first, but you will find it easier as you go along. 开始时你会觉得这本书有点困难，但你继续读下去时，便会觉得较为容易了。</font>\n
go along with	<font color=blue size=4>go along with</font>\n<br>1. accept; agree with 同意；赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We cannot go along with you on this point. 在这一点上我们不能同意你的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't go along with your plan. 我不能同意你的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could go along with it most of the way, but not entirely. 他大部分同意，但不完全同意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't go along with doing things like that. 我不能同意那样做。</font>\n<br>2. go together with; accompany 与…一道前进；伴随\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Increasing unemployment has gone along with rising prices all over the world in recent years. 近年来，全球的失业人数增加是与物价上涨齐头并进的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go along with Henry; I'll come shortly. 你随亨利去，我一会就来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I go along with you as far as the post office. 我陪你走到邮局为止。</font>\n
go around	<font color=blue size=4>go around</font>\n<br>1. move about 到处走动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man is going around looking for work. 这位年轻人到处找工作。</font>\n<br>2. spread 流行；传播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are a lot of colds going around. 感冒正在流行。</font>\n<br>3. be shared; be enough to give to everyone 够分；分配；分享\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there aren't enough chairs to go around, I can bring some from the other room. 如果椅子不够坐，我可以从隔壁房间搬一些过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only a few guests came, so there were more than enough apples to go around. 客人来得不多，所以苹果够分了。</font>\n<br>4. go together; keep company 同行；相伴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill goes around with boys older than he is because he is big for his age. 比尔和年龄比他大的男孩在一起玩，因为他比同龄人长得大。</font>\n
go at	<font color=blue size=4>go at</font>\n<br>1. attack 攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspapers are really going at the government, aren't they? 报界确实是在攻击政府，对吗？</font>\n<br>2. go towards and overcome 扑向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thier went at the wall and cleared it. 那窃贼扑向那堵墙，并且翻了过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crazed man went at the policeman with a knife. 那个疯子拿着刀向警察扑过去。</font>\n<br>3. undertake energetically 努力从事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have taken physical exercise; now I must go at my lesson. 我已经体育锻炼过了，现在得温习功课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are you going to go at the job? 你打算如何着手干这工作？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've been going at it all day. Shouldn't you take a rest now? 这事你已干了一整天，还不该休息一会儿吗？</font>\n
go away	<font color=blue size=4>go away</font>\n<br>1. leave 离去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no answer to my knock, so I went away. 敲门没人答应，于是我就走了。</font>\n<br>2. cease 停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If this pain doesn't go away soon, I'll go mad. 若疼痛不马上止住，我要发疯了。</font>\n
go away with	<font color=blue size=4>go away with</font>\n<br>1. leave with; elope 同…一道离开；私奔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I saw her going away with her mother for a holiday. 我见到她和她母亲一道外出度假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went away with his friend's wife. 他和他朋友的妻子一起私奔了。</font>\n<br>2. take without permission 未经允许带走；偷走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's gone away with my clock. 她偷走了我的钟。</font>\n<br>3. believe 相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't go away with the idea that you won't have to pay for it. 别以为你不用付款。</font>\n
go back	<font color=blue size=4>go back</font>\n<br>1. move backwards or away 后退；撤离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go back a step or two; you're too near. 后退一两步，你离得太近了。</font>\n<br>2. return 返回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go back to bed, you're too ill to be up. 回到床上去，你病重不能起来。</font>\n<br>3. (of a clock or watch) be set to an earlier time（钟表）回拨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The clocks go back next week, so it will seem dark sooner. 下周钟要往回拨了，所以天似乎要黑得早些。</font>\n<br>4. take the mind back in time, in one's thoughts 回顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Yes, whenever she talks, she always likes to go back to her younger days. 是的，她只要一开口，就喜欢回顾她的青年时代。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went back to his childhood. 他回忆了他的童年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My memory doesn't go back that far. 我记不起那么久的事了。</font>\n<br>5. date back 追溯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The history of those archaeologicalfinds goes back to the 2nd century. 这些历史文物的发现可追溯到2世纪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story went back to thousands of years ago. 这个故事追溯到几千年以前。</font>\n<br>6. return to an earlier point (in space, time, a discussion, etc.) 回转；回复（前面的话题、讨论等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has gone back to her old habits. 她又恢复了老习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go back to the subject we were discussing. 让我们回到刚才讨论的题目吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now that you've done a year in Medicine, you can't very well go back and start an Arts course. 既然你已经学医一年，就不大好回过头来学人文学科了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once you decide to emigrate, there will be no going back. 一旦你决定移居他国，就不能反悔了。</font>\n
go back on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>go back on/upon</font>\n<br>fail to keep (a promise, an agreement, etc.); fail to be loyal to 违约；背弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never go back on your friends. 绝不要背弃你的朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's not the sort of man who would go back on his word. 他不是那种不守信的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you make a promise, you must not go back on it. 当你许下诺言时，就不可食言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid that I will have to go back on my word for I am now hopelessly ill in bed. 恐怕我要食言了，因为我现在重病在床。</font>\n
go bad	<font color=blue size=4>go bad</font>\n<br>turn sour; start to decay 变质；变坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't drink this milk; it's gone bad. 不要喝这个牛奶，它变质了。</font>\n
go behind	<font color=blue size=4>go behind</font>\n<br>1. search for 寻究；推敲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go behind what he says, you'll find he's not really enthusiastic about the plan. 只要你听他的弦外之音，你就会知道他对那个计划并不真正热心。</font>\n<br>2. reexamine the grounds of 进一步斟酌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager said that he was going to go behind the decision. 经理说他要对这一决定进一步斟酌。</font>\n
go between	<font color=blue size=4>go between</font>\n<br>fit well into a position between; pass between 放在…中间合适；做中间人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The picture goes nicely between the portraits of your father and mother. 这张画放在你父亲和母亲的照片中间正合适。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went between the two parties. 他为双方调解矛盾。</font>\n
go beyond	<font color=blue size=4>go beyond</font>\n<br>pass; exceed 经过；超过；越过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the ship went beyond the horizon, it appeared to sink until it could be seen no longer. 当船越过地平线时，看上去就好象在下沉，直至消失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the people present were wild with joy, for the results of the experiment went beyond their expectation. 所有在场的人都高兴得发狂，因为实验结果好得出乎意料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's going beyond a joke. 那样开玩笑未免太过火了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The control of the children is going beyond my power. 要我管住这些孩子实在是无能为力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have gone beyond our orders. 你的做法已经越出了我们的指示范围。</font>\n
go by	<font color=blue size=4>go by</font>\n<br>1. pass by 走过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've missed the bus; it just went by. 你错过了这趟公共汽车，它刚开走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We waited for the procession to go by. 我们等队伍过去。</font>\n<br>2. be guided by sth. giving direction 靠…指引（方向）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having no map to go by, we soon lost our way. 没有地图判断方向，我们很快就迷了路。</font>\n<br>3. act according to; be guided by 照…办事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should have a clearout criterion to go by. 我们应有明确的标准去遵循。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have a precedent to go by. 我们有先例可循。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you ride a bicycle, you must go by the traffic rules. 你如果骑车，就必须遵守交通规则。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always goes by a pattern when she makes a dress. 她总是照式样裁制衣服。</font>\n<br>4. judge by; form an opinion by; trust as being correct 判断；凭…而判断；以为…是正确的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't always go by appearance. 你不能老是以貌取人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't go by that clock; it is hardly ever right. 我们不能以那个钟为准，它很少对过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't go by one person's opinion; you must ask everyone what they think. 你不能光凭一个人的意见就下结论，你得问一问大家是怎么想的。</font>\n<br>5. (time, days, weeks, etc.) pass; elapse; go on（时间等）流逝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three years have gone by since we came to this university. 我们进这所大学已3年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This event will be forgotten as time goes by. 随着时间的推移，此事将被遗忘。</font>\n<br>6. (opportunity, chance, etc.) pass without being used or grasped（机会等）轻易地放过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let this opportunity go by. 不要错过这个机会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John hesitated just a little too long over the offer of a partnership in the firm, and when he finally made up his mind to accept, the opportunity had gone by. 约翰对别人主动要和他合股开商行迟疑的时间稍长了一点，等他下定决心同意时，机会已经错过了。</font>\n<br>7. be known by; be called 为人所知；称为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many actors do not go by their real names. 很多演员的真实姓名不为人知。</font>\n<br>8. stop for a short visit 短暂的走访；顺便走访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Have you seen Mr. Wang lately? ”“Yes, I went by his house last week. ”“你最近看到王先生了吗？”“看到了，我上周顺便去他家了一会儿。”</font>\n
go down	<font color=blue size=4>go down</font>\n<br>1. descend 下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go down by the lift. 咱们乘电梯下去吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go down and see who is at the door, please. 请下去看看谁在门口。</font>\n<br>2. lessen; be reduced; undergo a decrease; lose value 下降；减少；失去价值\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the wind goes down, we may be able to sail tomorrow. 如果风变小了，我们明天就可能出海。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shares have gone down again by six points. 股票又下跌了6点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prices are going up all the time; it seems they will never go down. 物价总是上涨，看来永远也不会下跌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pictures have gone down in value considerably. 这些画的价值降低了许多。</font>\n<br>3. sink; set 下沉；落下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship went down like lead. 这只船象铅似地下沉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun has gone down. 太阳落山了。</font>\n<br>4. be recorded; esp. in writing 记下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This day will go down in history. 这一天将载入史册。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their heroic exploits will go down in history. 他们的英雄事迹将会被记入史册。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will go down in history as a national hero. 他将作为一位民族英雄名垂史册。</font>\n<br>5. be received or be received favourably 被接受；被赞许\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did his lecture go down with the students? 他的课学生反映如何？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play went down very well with the audience. 这出戏很受观众的欢迎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your explanation won't go down very well. 你的解释不能令人满意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those proposals are not likely to go down with the majority of the members. 那些建议可能不会为大多数成员所接受。</font>\n<br>6. become deflated; recede 瘪了；消退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tyre of my bicycle has gone down. 我的自行车轮胎瘪了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The swelling has gone down a lot. 肿消了许多。</font>\n<br>7. be swallowed 被咽下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John was delighted that his wife's cooking should go down so well. 约翰很高兴，他妻子烧的菜竟是如此地好吃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pill won't go down. 这药丸吞不下去。</font>\n<br>8. fall; collapse 倒下；倒塌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wall went down with a crash. 墙呼隆一声倒塌了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went down on his knees and begged for mercy. 他跪下来求饶。</font>\n<br>9. be defeated or overthrown 被打倒；被推翻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They refused to go down before the invaders. 他们不甘为侵略者所征服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rome went down before the barbarian invaders. 罗马人被野蛮人所征服。</font>\n<br>10. fail in an exam 考试不及格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am afraid he has gone down again. 我担心他又不及格了。</font>\n<br>11. leave university at the end of a term or finally（大学生）学期末放假或毕业前离校\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students have all gone down for the summer vacation. 大学生们都离校过暑假去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The undergraduates are due to go down today. 本科生应该是今天离校。</font>\n<br>12. fall on a scale 度数下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the second day his temperature went down. 第2天他的体温下降了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pressure has gone down. 血压下降了。</font>\n<br>13. go bankrupt 倒闭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company went down only a year after it started. 那家公司办了一年就倒闭了。</font>\n<br>14. go as far as; extend in time 延续到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This history book goes down to the French Revolution. 这本历史书记述到法国革命为止。</font>\n
go down with	<font color=blue size=4>go down with</font>\n<br>become ill with 患…病\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was absent yesterday because I had gone down with flu. 昨天我因感冒没来。</font>\n
go far	<font color=blue size=4>go far</font>\n<br>1. travel a long way 运（搬）到很远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This car can go far on very little petrol. 这车耗极少量的汽油就可以跑得很远。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news went far. 这消息传得很远。</font>\n<br>2. last; hold out 持续（时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such zeal does not go far. 这种热情不会持久。</font>\n<br>3. have weight, force, or appllcation 有效力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His pleading went far with the judge. 他的辩护对法官很有影响。</font>\n<br>4. be successful; achieve great things; rise to a high position 有成绩（就）；有出息；成功；出名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will go far in scientific research. 他在科研上将大有成就。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young man is a brilliant scholar; he will go far. 这年轻人是位有才华的学者，他将会有大作为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With your dedication to work you are certain to go far. 你一心扑在工作上，定能出成果。</font>\n<br>5. extend far in use; buy plenty of goods 购买许多东西；派大用处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even a reasonable income doesn't go very, far these days, with the prices rising all the time. 物价一直在上涨，即使有中等收入也买不了多少东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A pound note does not go far these days. 一英镑的钞票现在不经用了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A small amount of money can go far if you are careful. 只要你精打细算，钱少也能派用处。</font>\n<br>6. suffice for distribution 足够分配\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our provisions will not go far. 我们的给养不够分配。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One bottle of milk will not go far among all these people. 这么多人一瓶牛奶不够分。</font>\n<br>7. help greatly 大大有助于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These measures should go far towards solving the problem. 这些措施会大大有助于解决这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His constructive suggestion will go far towards enhancing labour productivity and reducing the cost of production. 他的建设性意见将大大地有助于提高劳动生产率和降低生产成本。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You concession will go far towards reconciliation. 你的让步将大大有助于和解。</font>\n
go for	<font color=blue size=4>go for</font>\n<br>1. leave a place to perform an activity 离开（某地）去干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to go for a walk; will you come with me? 我想出去散散步，你能跟我一道去吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shall I go for a doctor? 要不要我去请一位医生来？</font>\n<br>2. be sold for 卖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were perfectly good coats going for ＄20！有一些很好的外套只卖20美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“How much did the house go for? ”“It went for far less than I expected. ”“那所房子卖了多少钱？”“卖价比我原来想象的少得多。”</font>\n<br>3. attack, either physically or by words 攻击（肉体上或口头上）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspapers have really gone for Tom's new book in a big way！报纸果真大张旗鼓地攻击起汤姆的那本新书来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The taller of the two men had scarcely said a word when the other put up his fists and went for him. 那个身材高些的男人刚刚说完一句话，另一个人就挥拳向他打去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She really went for him; I've never seen her so badtempered. 她真地对他破口大骂起来了，我还从没见过她发这么大的脾气。</font>\n<br>4. choose 选择\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I thought I'd go for question three; it looks easy. 我想选第3题，它似乎容易些。</font>\n<br>5. admire; like; pursue 喜欢；想得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is not the type of girl that John goes for. 她不是约翰要追求的那种女孩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She really goes for miniskirts. 她确实喜欢超短裙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dark men often go for blondes. 黑肤色的男人往往倾心于金发碧眼的女郎。</font>\n<br>6. intend to become; aim at 想成为；以…为目的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is going for an engineer. 他想当一名工程师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ken's going for the tennis cham pionship this year. 肯在为今年夺取网球冠军而奋斗。</font>\n<br>7. apply to; be true of 适用于；对…适用；适合于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Listen carefully, because this goes for you all. 大家认真听，这对你们都适用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your sister is a selfish girl, and that goes for you, too. 你姐姐是一个自私的女孩，你也一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What I've said to him goes for all of you as well. 我对他说的那番话，对你们大家都适用。</font>\n<br>8. give support to; give approval to 支持；赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the election, the majority of votes went for him. 在选举中，大多数选票都赞成他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can go for no such proposal as this. 我无法支持这样一个建议。</font>\n<br>9. be taken as; be regarded as 被看作；被认为是；起作用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All his work went for nothing. 他的一切工作被看成是毫无价值的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think your efforts will go for much. 我想你的努力不会有多大作用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His words don't go for much. We don't trust him. 他的话无足轻重，我们不信任他。</font>\n
go forth	<font color=blue size=4>go forth</font>\n<br>1. start; depart 动身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students went forth from the institute to meet the hero. 学生们从学校出发去迎接那位英雄。</font>\n<br>2. be published 发表（布）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The decree has gone forth. 命令已发布。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An order went forth to take the enemy camp before dawn. 命令说黎明前要拿下敌军营地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A few days ago the government issued an order which went forth that all the foreign troops retreat out of the country. 几天前政府发出了一条命令：命令所有的外国军队撤离出境。</font>\n<br>3. go away 离去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went forth to battle and was heard of no more. 他出征后就杳无音讯。</font>\n
go forward	<font color=blue size=4>go forward</font>\n<br>1. advance 前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain has asked all the sailors to go forward so that he can speak to them in a group. 船长让水兵们向前靠拢，以便对他们讲话。</font>\n<br>2. continue with sth. planned; proceed 继续进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The headmaster gave us permission to go forward with our teaching plan. 校长允许我们继续执行教学计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work is going forward at a satis factory pace. 工作正以令人满意的速度进行着。</font>\n<br>3. be sent further for approval by sb. 被提请…核准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your name will go forward to the committee when they are considerring the new appointments. 在委员会考虑新的任命人选时，你的名字将被提交上去。</font>\n

go home	<font color=blue size=4>go home</font>\n<br>1. return to one's home or country 回家（国）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must be going home; it's getting very late. 太晚了，我要回家了。</font>\n<br>2. die or be destroyed（人）死；（物）用坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid old Charlie's gone home. He'd been ill for years. 恐怕查理老人已经过世了，因为他已病了多年。</font>\n<br>3. have an effect on 对…产生影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman's pointed remark went home, and the committee kept silent. 主席直截了当的话语击中要害，全体委员寂静无声。</font>\n

go in	<font color=blue size=4>go in</font>\n<br>1. move indoors 进入（室内）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A servant opened the door and we went in. 仆人开了门，我们就进去了。</font>\n<br>2. take an active part 加入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A tennis tournament took place in our school yesterday, but I didn't go in. 网球联赛昨天在我校举行，但我没参加。</font>\n<br>3. fit in (a space) 适合于（某处）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An ordinary nail won't go in a brick wall. 一般钉子钉不进砖墙去。</font>\n<br>4. be understood 被理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I keep trying to understand how a car engine works, but it doesn't seem to go in; am I stupid something? 我一直很想了解一下汽车发动机的工作原理，但好象弄不懂。我是笨还是怎么的？</font>\n<br>5. (of the sun, etc.) disappear behind clouds（太阳等）被云遮蔽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At this time of year, when the sun goes in, it is suddenly much colder. 每年这个时候，当云层遮住阳光，天气突然间就冷多了。</font>\n
go in for	<font color=blue size=4>go in for</font>\n<br>1. go indoors for 因…进入室内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having already left the house, she went in for her umbrella. 她已离开了家，但见开始下雨又回到屋里取伞。</font>\n<br>2. try to pass or win 想通过或赢得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to go in for a more advanced examination if I can. 如果有可能的话，我还想通过更高层次的考试。</font>\n<br>3. take strong interest in 爱好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I thought he only went in for music and tennis. 我以为他只爱好音乐和网球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lots of men go in for fishing. 很多人对钓鱼感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many newspapers go in for sensational happenings. 许多报纸对轰动社会的事件很感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter goes in for collecting antique weapons. 彼得喜欢收集古兵器。</font>\n<br>4. aim towards (a profession); be engaged in 选择…为职业；从事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He may end up by going in for politics; he's always liked arguing. 他最终可能从政，因为他一直喜欢辩论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she left college, she went in for nursing. 大学毕业后，她从事护士工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Following his example, both his sons went in for medical work. 他的两个儿子跟他一样，从事医务工作。</font>\n<br>5. participate in; enter as a candidate 参加；加入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you go in for the civil service examination yesterday? 你参加昨天的公务员考试了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has gone in for the beauty competition. 她参加了选美比赛。</font>\n<br>6. give support to; express approval of 支持；赞同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An overwhelming majority of the committee members went in for the currency reform. 绝大多数委员赞成实行币制改革。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They all went in for the dockers of that country in their strike. 他们都支持那个国家的码头工人罢工。</font>\n
going strong	<font color=blue size=4>going strong</font>\n<br>in good health; flourishing (used mainly of people and organizations) 健康活跃；兴旺；繁荣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's nearly eighty but is still going strong. 她年近80, 但还很健康。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Literary Society is still going strong. 文学社还很兴旺。</font>\n
go into	<font color=blue size=4>go into</font>\n<br>1. go or fit inside of; be able to be put in 进入；放进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two men were seen going into the house after dark. 有人看见两个男人在天黑后进入这个住宅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The table is too big to go into the closet. 桌子太大，放不进贮藏室。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My foot won't go into this boot. 我的脚穿不进这长筒靴。</font>\n<br>2. enter a state or condition of 进入某种状态或情况\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sick man went into a coma. 病人进入昏迷状态。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone went into raptures over her dancing and singing. 看她跳舞唱歌，大家都欣喜若狂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new railway will go into service on the first of next month. 这条新铁路将于下月一日正式通车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new regulation goes into effect today. 新章程即日生效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book will go into its third edition. 这本书要出第3版了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old woman went into a decline and nothing the doctor could do would help. 她突然身体垮了，医生怎么治疗也无济于事。</font>\n<br>3. discuss; talk about; state in detail 讨（谈）论；详细论述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's no need to go into details yet; just give me the general idea. 还没有必要谈论细节，就给我谈谈一般情况吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher went into the subject of newspapers today. 老师今天谈论了报纸这个专题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engineer went into a full explanation of the purpose of the machine. 工程师详细地解释了这台机器的用途。</font>\n<br>4. be busy in or take part in; enter as a job or profession 从事；参与；进入（某种行业）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Mayor went into politics as a very young man. 市长年轻时便参与了政治。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wants to go into law when he gets out of school. 他毕业后想当律师。</font>\n<br>5. investigate; take up; examine 调查；着手处理；审查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police intend to go into the matter very carefully. 警察打算认真地调查这件事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accountant will go into these figures for you. 会计将替你审查这些数字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll go deep into the question. 我们将深入调查这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The case has to be gone into very carefully. 这个案子须认真审查。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The matter has been gone into very thoroughly, and we find there are no grounds for the allegations. 此事已经彻底调查，我们发现这些论断是没有根据的。</font>\n<br>6. hit with force 用力撞击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car went into a tree and was severely damaged. 汽车撞到树上，损坏严重。</font>\n<br>7. begin to wear; put on 开始穿；穿上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went into mourning on the death of her mother. 她为她母亲带孝。</font>\n<br>8. divide a number exactly by two or more 用2以上整数除某数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>2 goes into 6, 3 times, but 2 won't go into 7. 用2除6得3, 但2除不尽7。</font>\n
