go off	<font color=blue size=4>go off</font>\n<br>1. make a sudden ringing noise 爆发突然的响声\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bomb went off in the theater. 一颗炸弹在剧院里爆炸了。</font>\n<br>2. leave suddenly（突然）离走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went off without telling us. 他们走时没有告诉我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went off in a bad temper. 她怒气冲冲地走了。</font>\n<br>3. cease; wear off; disappear 终止；消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The effect of the drug will go off after two hours. 两小时后这药的效力就将失去。</font>\n<br>4. sell; be disposed of by sale 卖掉；售出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The goods went off rapidly. 那批货很快就卖掉了。</font>\n<br>5. become worse; deteriorate 变坏（质）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll complain to the shop; this meat started going off the same day that I bought it. 我要向这家商店申诉，我买的肉当天就变质了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better put the cake in the refrigerator, in case it goes off. 你最好把蛋糕放入冰箱，以免坏掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The milk has gone off slightly. It must be the weather. 这牛奶已经变质。一定是天气的关系。</font>\n<br>6. elope 私奔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went off with his manager's daughter. 他和经理的女儿私奔了。</font>\n<br>7. lose one's skill 失去技巧；工作质量下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The standard of his work has gone off over the last few weeks. 这几个星期以来，他的工作水平有所下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lecturer used to do well, but he seems to have gone off now. 这位讲师以前课讲得不错，现在似乎教学质量在下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The football team seemed to go off. 这个足球队似乎在滑坡。</font>\n<br>8. fall asleep; pass into unconsciousness 入睡；失去知觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Grand father's gone off in the chair. 爷爷在椅子上睡着了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't seem to be able to go off, so he went into the kitchen and made himself a cup of tea. 他似乎睡不着，因此他走进厨房给自己泡了一杯茶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old woman went off into a faint. 这位老太太晕倒失去了知觉。</font>\n<br>9. lose one's liking for (coffee, beer, pop music, painting, etc. , as a hobby) 不再爱好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went off driving altogether after his accident. 那场事故以后，他讨厌开车了。</font>\n<br>10. become unavailable (water, gas, electricity, power, etc.) 得不到；突然中断供应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just as the weather turned cold, the electricity supply went off. 正当天气转冷时，电力供应却中断了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The light went off as we entered the room. 我们进屋时停电了。</font>\n<br>11. go mad; behave in a crazy manner 发疯；发狂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Poor old Tom went off his head, spent all his money in six months and ended up begging in the streets. 可怜的老汤姆头脑发热了，在6个月内把钱全部花掉，最后到街上去行乞。</font>\n<br>12. be carried out; take place; proceed 进行；发生；举行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party went off without any trouble. 聚会顺利进行，没有任何麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had the operation this morning and it all went off quite well. 她今天上午动了手术，一切很顺利。</font>\n
go on	<font color=blue size=4>go on</font>\n<br>1. travel 旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to go on a long triP away from these troubles. 我要去作一次很远的旅行，以摆脱这些烦恼。</font>\n<br>2. (theatre) perform on stage 在舞台上表演\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She does not go on until Act Two. 她要到第2幕才出场表演。</font>\n<br>3. ride on (an animal, etc. for fun) 骑（动物等娱乐）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children want to go on the wooden horses. 孩子们想骑木马玩。</font>\n<br>4. be lit 被点亮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What time do the illuminations go on tonight? 今晚彩灯何时开亮？</font>\n<br>5. start 着手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll go on duty in half an hour. 我半小时后开始值勤。</font>\n<br>6. continue 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you've finished those questions, go on to page 41. 做完这些问题，你就接着做第41页上的题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was tired of listening to her complaints, but she went on and on. 我听厌了她发牢骚，但是她却唠叨个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll stop here for today and go on with the text next time. 今天我们就讲到这儿，下次接着讲课文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I asked Jane a question but she went on reading and did'n answer. 我问简一个问题，但她继续看书不回答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope it will not go on raining all day. 我希望不会整天下雨。</font>\n<br>7. continue after a pause; begin with the next thing（停顿后）继续；接着开始做另外的事（常用于动词不定式之前）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After he had given an account of the difficulties, he went on to suggest ways of overcoming them. 他先说明困难，接着建议如何克服这些困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father said mother had gone to the hospital, and went to say that Grandmother was coming to take care of us. 父亲说母亲住院了，接着他又说祖母将来照料我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After he had explained the theory, he went on to give us numerous examples. 他解释了这个理论之后，接着给我们举了很多例子。</font>\n<br>8. happen 发生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's going on here? 这里出了什么事？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told us what had been going on. 他告诉我们发生了什么事。</font>\n<br>9. begin to receive; get help from 开始领取；得到救济\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lot of people who never expected to be unemployed have to go on the dole. 许多从来没有料到会失业的人现在只好靠领取救济金过日子了。</font>\n<br>10. begin taking (medicine) 开始服用（药）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor says that Mother has to go on this special new drug for her heart. 大夫说，妈妈必须服用这种治疗她心脏病的特殊新药。</font>\n<br>11. accept; judge by act according to 接受；据…判断（猜测）；依据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You make a mistake if you go on appearances. 只凭外表看你就错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police have very little to go on in this case. 警察在这个案件上没有什么依据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't go on evidence like that. 你不能接受那样的证据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I suddenly saw that the belief I had been going on all my life was quite without foundation. 我突然明白我一生中所依据的信念毫无道理。</font>\n<br>12. (of money or time) be spent on（金钱、时光）消耗；流逝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lot of my grant goes on books, but I think it's money well spent. 我的大部分助学金用于买书，但是我认为这钱是花得恰到好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At least a quarter of the average income goes on housing. 普通收入至少有1/4花到住房上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As time went on, Mary began to wonder if John had forgotten their date. 时间过了，玛丽怀疑约翰忘了他们的约会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The years went on, and Betty's classmates became greyhaired men and women. 岁月无情，贝蒂的男女同学都变成白发老人了。</font>\n<br>13. behave 举止；表现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go on like this, you must expect trouble. 如果你继续这样做，你会自找麻烦的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've never seen her go on like that before. 我过去从没见过她象这个样子。</font>\n<br>14. fit on; be able to be worn 适合；能穿上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My sister's skirt wouldn't go on me; it was too small. 我姐姐的裙子我穿不上，太小了。</font>\n<br>15. fare; manage 进展；进行；安排；应付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you go on in your English examination? 你英语考得如何？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know how we should have gone on without your help. 我不知道没有你的帮助我们该如何应付。</font>\n<br>16. stop teasing; stop trying to fool 停止开玩笑；不要戏弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When father told mother she was the prettiest girl in the world, mother just said：“Oh, go on (with you) ！”父亲告诉母亲说她是世上最美的女人时，母亲说：“不要取笑了！”</font>\n<br>17. (sport) take one's turn（体育）接替；轮换\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's your turn to go on. 该你上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go on next. 下一个就是你上了。</font>\n
go one's own way	<font color=blue size=4>go one's own way</font>\n<br>go or act as one wants to 独自行动；一意孤行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use arguing with him, for he will go his own way instead of changing his mind. 和他争论没用，因为他将一意孤行，不会改变主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>None of this was discussed or communicated to me. He went his own way. 此事根本没有讨论过，也没有通知过我，他独断专行。</font>\n
go one's way	<font color=blue size=4>go one's way</font>\n<br>1. start again or continue to where one is going 出发；继续进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A stranger stopped and asked me for a light, then went his way. 一个陌生人停下来向我借了火，然后又继续向前走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The milkman left the milk and went his way. 送奶工人留下牛奶，又继续上路了。</font>\n<br>2. go or act the way one wants to 自行其事；随心所欲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't tell me how to do my homework. You go your way and I'll go mine. 不要告诉我如何做家庭作业。你做你的，我做我的。</font>\n
go on for	<font color=blue size=4>go on for</font>\n<br>approach; get nearer (a time, a number, an age, etc.) （时间、数字或年龄等）接近；靠近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He must be going on for forty. 他一定是快40岁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's going on for midnight. 现在快午夜了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The population of the city is going on for 500, 000：该市人口将近50万。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Good Lord！It's going on for ten o'clock and I promised to see Mr. Wang at half past nine. ”“天哪！已经快10点了，我答应9∶30去会见王先生的。”</font>\n
go on to	<font color=blue size=4>go on to</font>\n<br>1. pass from one subject or item to the next 转入（下一个项目等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If nobody has any objection, then we'll go on to the next item. 如果没有人有不同意见，我们就转入下一个议程了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a few minutes we went to the next station. 几分钟后我们继续到了下一站。</font>\n<br>2. adopt (as a new or temporary habit) 采取（作为一种新的或暂时的习惯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor told me that I would have to go on to a strict diet. 医生嘱咐我必须严格地按照规定的饮食进餐。</font>\n<br>3. change working arrangements to 把工作安排改成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Because of depression, many big factories had to go on to short time or stop production altogether. 由于经济不景气，许多大工厂不得不减少工时，甚至完全停产。</font>\n
go out	<font color=blue size=4>go out</font>\n<br>1. leave 离去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Browder isn't here; he's gone out, but he'll be back in a few minutes. 布鲁德先生不在这里，他出去了，但过几分钟就回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must go out shopping for half an hour. 我得外出半小时买东西。</font>\n<br>2. leave home for work 离开家出去工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she was eighteen, she went out as governess. 她18岁时离家当了家庭教师。</font>\n<br>3. cease burning 熄灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The match went out in the wind. 火柴被风吹熄了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The candlelight went out of itself. 蜡烛自己熄灭了。</font>\n<br>4. end 结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The year went out, with great achievements on all fronts. 过去的一年以各条战线上的辉煌成就而结束。</font>\n<br>5. cease to be fashionable; cease to be followed, practiced or accepted 过时；不流行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Few Englishmen wear frock coats now. They went out years ago. 现在，英国人很少穿大礼服了。大礼服已经过时多年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This expression has gone out; nobody uses it today. 这种表达法已经过时了，现在没有人再用它。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Short skirts have gone out. 短裙已经过时了。</font>\n<br>6. be sent out 被送出去了；被发出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the invitations for the party have now gone out. 所有宴会的请帖现在都已发出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have all the wedding invitations gone out yet? 所有的婚礼请帖都已发出去了吗？</font>\n<br>7. emigrate 移居国外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went out to Australia about five years ago. 大约5年前他就移居澳大利亚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole family have gone out to Canada. 全家已移居加拿大。</font>\n<br>8. cease to function (usn. in a competition); retire from power（比赛中）被淘汰；辞职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That team went out in the third round. 那个队在第3轮中被淘汰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president that has just gone out was unpopular. 刚下台的那位校长不受大家拥护。</font>\n<br>9. (the tide, sea, water) flow back or away（潮、海水等）退潮；退去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tide has gone out. 潮水退了。</font>\n<br>10. be on strike 罢工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers went out in protest against unbridled in flation. 工人们举行罢工，抗议失去控制的通货膨胀。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They gained some victory in going out. 他们罢工取得了一些胜利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The miners went out for more pay. 矿工罢工要求增加工资。</font>\n<br>11. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor old man went out yesterday. 那位可怜的老人昨天去世了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Suffering from a sudden heart attack, he went out in a few minutes. 他因心脏病发作，不到几分钟就死了。</font>\n
go out for	<font color=blue size=4>go out for</font>\n<br>1. seek to enter into; try for a place on 申请加入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I recalled bitterly what a poor impression I had made on the coach when I went out for football. 我申请参加踢足球时给教练的印象很差，想来痛心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ten boys went out for track that spring. 那年春天10个男孩参加田径队。</font>\n<br>2. strive for 努力争取得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's going out for a betterpaid job. 他正在谋取一个工资较高的职业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are going out for big results, and we must work harder than before. 我们正努力争取巨大的成就，因此我们必须加倍努力工作。</font>\n
go out of one's way	<font color=blue size=4>go out of one's way</font>\n<br>1. take trouble to do sth.;make an extra effort to 努力去做；不怕麻烦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher went out of his way to be nice to the newcomer. 我们老师对新同学格外好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The restaurant owner goes out of his way to see that all his guests are wellsatis fied. 饭店老板尽力照料客人，务使他们满意。</font>\n<br>2. go astray 误入歧途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not knowing the road, the stranger went out of his way. 这个陌生人因路不熟而误入歧途。</font>\n
go over	<font color=blue size=4>go over</font>\n<br>1. pass or move over 越过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Travellers will not be allowed to go over the frontier without their passports. 没有护照的旅客是不允许越过边界的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's dangerous here, with bullets going over our heads all the time. 这儿危险，子弹时刻在我们头顶飞过。</font>\n<br>2. look at carefully; examine to see that it is good; inspect 检查（是否有误）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We went over the house thoroughly before buying it. 在买房子前，我们彻底检查了一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mechanic went over the engine but found nothing wrong. 机修工检查了发动机，但没有发现什么毛病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you mind going over this work for me? 请替我把这个工作全部检查一遍好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher went over the test papers and analyzed the students'mistakes. 老师批阅了考卷并分析了学生的错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The auditor went over the accounts with care. 审计员仔细地核对了账目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police went over the gun for fingerprints. 警察仔细检查了枪上的指纹。</font>\n<br>3. study or repeat carefully; review 重复；温习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go over the text again. 让我们把课文复习一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've gone over my lessons carefully. 我已经把功课认真复习过了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actor had to go over his lines many times before he got them right. 这位演员要把台词重复好多遍才能背熟。</font>\n<br>4. clean or repair 擦洗或修理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've asked the garage people to go over my car thoroughly before I start my long journey. 在开始我的长途旅行之前，我请车库工人彻底擦拭保养我的车。</font>\n<br>5. touch up; improve 润色；改进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went over the painting, giving it the finishing touches. 他对这幅画作润色改进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has gone over this photograph. 有人修整了这张照片。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This paint should be gone voer with a new brush in the other direction. 这种油漆需用新刷换个方向重新涂。</font>\n<br>6. consider 考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've gone over your suggestion, and have decided not to accept it. 我已经考虑过你的提议，并决定不予采纳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go over the facts as we know them. 让我们考虑一下我们所了解的事实。</font>\n<br>7. search 搜索；搜查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police went over his room three times, but found nothing. 警察把他的房间搜查了3遍，但什么也没有找到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A woman policeofficer went over the girl from head to toe. 一位女警察官对这女孩从头到脚搜查了一遍。</font>\n<br>8. change one's allegiance to 改变立场（退出某政党加入另一党派）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a Democrat, but he says that he is going over to the Republicans in the next election. 他是一位民主党人，但他宣称在下一次选举中将转向共和党。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy commander finally decided to go over to the Eighth Route Army. 敌军司令官最后决定向八路军投诚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To treat comrades like enemies is to go over to the stand of the enemy. 如果把同志当敌人看待，就使自己站在敌人的立场上去了。</font>\n<br>9. be received 被接受；受欢迎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did his lecture go over well? Did you like it? 他的讲演成功吗？你们喜欢不喜欢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your idea went over well with the manager. 你的王意经理很欣赏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news went over without much comment. 这条消息并未引起多少评论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The film is going over big with the audience. 这部电影大受观众欢迎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These actors went over very well with the audience. 这些演员深受观众们的欢迎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play did not go over. It lasted only three days on Broadway. 话剧演得不成功，在百老汇只演了3天。</font>\n<br>10. be overturned 翻倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A truck went over into a ditch yesterday evening. 昨天晚上一辆卡车翻到沟里去了。</font>\n<br>11. undergo postponement 搁置起来；推迟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't have time to deal with this question today; it'll have to go over to the next session. 今天我们没时间讲这个问题，得留到下次了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some of us asked that the matter go over until tomorrow. 我们中部分人要求把这个问题推迟到明天讨论。</font>\n<br>12. abandon one thing or practice and adopt another 放弃（某事或某习惯）去接受（另一事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid we'll have to go over to a vegetarian diet if the price of meat goes rising. 如果肉价一直在上涨，我想我们得不吃肉而吃素了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's given up his interest in singing and has gone over to water colour paintings. 他对唱歌已经不感兴趣，现在改搞水彩画了。</font>\n
go round	<font color=blue size=4>go round</font>\n<br>1. move round 绕（道）而行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The front gate was shut, so we had to go round. 前门已关了，我们只好绕道而行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The earth goes round the sun. 地球绕太阳运行。</font>\n<br>2. (of news, disease, etc.) spread（新闻、疾病等）流行；传播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news soon went round the country. 消息迅速传遍全国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Chicken pox is going round the neighbourhood. 水痘正在这一带流行。</font>\n<br>3. be shared 分享\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have wine enough to go round. 我们有足够的酒可供大家畅饮。</font>\n<br>4. visit 访问；参观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We haven't time to go round the museums. 我们没时间参观博物馆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We went round to see him yesterday evening. 我们昨晚去拜访了他。</font>\n<br>5. keep company 陪伴（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill and Margaret have been going round for more than two years, but they still haven't decided whether to marry or not. 比尔和玛格丽特相处已两年多了，但他们还没有决定是否结婚。</font>\n<br>6. be dizzy 头晕；眩晕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only a few sips of whisky, and I felt my head go round. 我才喝了几口威士忌酒，就感到头晕了。</font>\n
go short (of) 	<font color=blue size=4>go short (of) </font>\n<br>have less of…than one should or than one would wish to 比某人应有的或希望有的少；匮缺；缺乏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never allowed his wife to go short of anything she wanted. 他从不让妻子缺少她所需要的任何东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't want you to go short of money in order to lend me what I need. 我不希望你因为借钱给我而缺钱花。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you take more than your fair amount of apples someone else will have to go short. 如果你拿的苹果比你应得的多，那么别人就会少得了。</font>\n
go straight	<font color=blue size=4>go straight</font>\n<br>become an honest person; lead an honest life 改邪归正；改过自新\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the man got out of prison, he went straight. 这个人出狱后就改过自新了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Wright promised to go straight if the judge would let him go free. 莱特先生答应，如果法官释放了他，他愿改邪归正。</font>\n
go through	<font color=blue size=4>go through</font>\n<br>1. pass through 穿过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain has gone through my overcoat. 雨水渗透了我的大衣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The material is so stiff that even the thickest needle won't go through. 这种布料太硬，连最粗的针也扎不进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A new idea went through his mind. 他脑子里有了一个新的主意。</font>\n<br>2. examine 查阅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must go through the account books together; there's still some money missing. 我们必须检查所有账簿，因为还有部分款项无着落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will go through your papers. 我将审阅你们的论文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have gone through the details of the plan to make sure tere are no loopholes. 我们仔细地审查了计划的每一个细节，以确保没有任何漏洞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lawyers went through the evidence. 律师们核查了证据。</font>\n<br>3. be put into effect 完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After months of efforts the work finally went through. 经数月的努力，工作终于完成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are they going through with their plans to build a new home? 他们将实现他们的计划，建立一个新家吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go through all the exercises before we go out. 我们出去前把练习做完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It requires courage and patience to go through the undertaking. 要完成这项工作，需要耐心和勇气。</font>\n<br>4. undergo; experience; suffer; endure 经历（困难、痛苦等）；遭受；忍受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has gone through such a lot since his wife died. 妻子死后他经受了不少苦难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will never know what she went through to educate her children. 你永远也不会知道她为了教育孩子，吃了多少苦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My grandfather had gone through a long illness before he breathed his last. 我祖父去世前遭受疾病的长期折磨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went through many hardships during the war. 他们在战争年代里历尽千辛万苦。</font>\n<br>5. be satisfactorily concluded; be passed; be accepted 得到圆满的结论；被通过；被认可\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the deal doesn't go through, they'll be ruined. 如果这笔交易做不成，他们就要破产了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The law has now gone through. 这项法律已获通过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was told that the deal went through. Congratulations！我听说那笔生意成交了。恭喜！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the meeting the managers went through the items one by one. 在会上，经理们把研究的项目逐一讨论通过了。</font>\n<br>6. do what one is supposed to do; do what one promised 做应该做的；履行手续；履行诺言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have gone through my part of the bargain, but you haven't gone through your part. 这笔交易我已履行了我的部分，但是你还没有履行你的部分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have all gone through the required formalities. 我们已履行完毕一切必要的手续。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Applicants for party membership must go through the procedure for admission. 申请入党的人必须履行入党手续。</font>\n<br>7. do or use all of; use up; consume 用完；消耗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We went through all our money at the circus. 我们在马戏团把钱全部花光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has gone through two pairs of shoes this year. 今年他已穿坏了两双鞋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've gone through too much money this month. 这个月我花的钱太多了。</font>\n<br>8. search 搜查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Customs went through all our luggage at the airport. 在飞机场，海关把我们的行李都检查了一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police went through the suspect's clothes. 警察搜查了嫌疑犯的衣服。</font>\n<br>9. be published in 出版；发行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This dictionary with bilingual explanations was warmly received by the reading public and went through two editions within a year. 这本双解词典很受读者欢迎，一年之内已经出了两版。</font>\n<br>10. discuss carefully 详细讨论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pros and cons of the issue have been gone through again and again, but we still haven't reached a conclusion. 这个问题的正反两方面意见已被研究了一遍又一遍，可是我们还没有得出结论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go through the details of the examination. 让我们详细讨论一下有关考试的具体问题吧。</font>\n
go through fire and water	<font color=blue size=4>go through fire and water</font>\n<br>suffer or experience danger or trouble 赴汤蹈火；冒生命危险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These heroes have gone through fire and water for the revolutionary cause. 这些英雄为了革命事业赴汤蹈火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said that he would go through fire and water to find out the truth of that matter. 他说为了查明那件事的真相，他将不顾个人安危。</font>\n
go through with	<font color=blue size=4>go through with</font>\n<br>finish; do as planned or agreed; complete 完成或结束某事；将某事坚持做到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy seems very determined about his plan. but his parents don't think he will go through with it. 这男孩似乎对他的计划下了决心，但他的父母认为他完成不了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are determined to go through with the undertaking. 我们决心完成这项任务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When will you be able to go through with the building of the bridge? 你们什么时候才能够建成这座桥？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Knowing very well the difficulties the work involved, they were still determined to go through with it. 他们充分认识到了那项工作的困难，但仍然下决心把它干到底。</font>\n
go to any length/go to great lengths	<font color=blue size=4>go to any length/go to great lengths</font>\n<br>do everything one can 竭尽所能；不遗余力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill will go to any length to keep Dick from getting a date with Mary. 比尔将尽一切努力阻止狄克与玛丽的约会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will go to any length to get what he wants. 他将不顾一切要得到他想要的东西。</font>\n
go to pieces	<font color=blue size=4>go to pieces</font>\n<br>fail to control oneself 神经错乱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the news of her son's death she went completely to pieces. 听说儿子死了，她的精神完全垮了。</font>\n
go to press	<font color=blue size=4>go to press</font>\n<br>be printed or about to be printed 付印\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book has gone to press. 这书已付印。</font>\n
go to the dogs	<font color=blue size=4>go to the dogs</font>\n<br>deteriorate very badly; go to ruin 大大变坏；走向灭亡；堕落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man went to the dogs after he started drinking and gambling. 此人开始酗酒和赌博以后，就堕落了。</font>\n
go to waste	<font color=blue size=4>go to waste</font>\n<br>be wasted 浪费掉；白费；付诸东流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy's work on the model plane went to waste when he dropped it. 这男孩做的模型飞机因摔在地下而付诸东流。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The strawberries went to waste because there was nobody to pick them. 草莓因没有人去摘统统浪费掉了。</font>\n
go under	<font color=blue size=4>go under</font>\n<br>1. (of person) fail; be defeated 破产\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The filling station went under because there were too many others on the street. 这个加油站破产了，因为在这条街上有好多家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He failed in speculation and went under. 他投机失败而告破产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His business has gone under. 他的生意亏本了。</font>\n<br>2. (of things) sink 沉没\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship struck upon a rock and soon went under. 船触岩石而迅速沉没了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship hit an icebery and went under. 船触冰山而沉没。</font>\n<br>3. (of the sun) set（日）落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun has gone under. 太阳已落山。</font>\n<br>4. die 死亡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went under in the war. 他在战争中阵亡了。</font>\n
go up	<font color=blue size=4>go up</font>\n<br>1. rise 升起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The smoke went up. 烟串上来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people came to watch the balloon go up. 许多人来看汽球升空。</font>\n<br>2. rise; increase; improve（物价）上涨；提高；增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Butter's going up again next week. 奶油下星期又要涨价了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prices of fruit and vegetables have already gone up. 水果和蔬菜的价格已经上涨了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has gone up in my estimation since he did that. 自从他做了那件事以后，他在我心目中的威信提高了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The goods have gone up in quality. 这些货的质量提高了。</font>\n<br>3. be built; be erected; be put up 被建造起来；被公布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Supermarkets are going up everywhere. 到处都建起了超级市场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tall buildings are rapidly up along the new road leading to the downtown area. 通往市中心的新公路两旁，迅速矗立起了一座座高楼大厦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Placards declaring new regulations were going up. 宣布新规定的公告张贴出来了。</font>\n<br>4. explode; be destroyed by explosion 爆炸；炸毁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bomb went up, killing two people. 炸弹爆炸了，炸死两人。</font>\n<br>5. be able to become heard; become loud or louder 使能听见；声音变大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A shout went up from the crowd at the game. 比赛时人群在高声助威呐喊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A cheer went up in the auditorium. 礼堂里响起一阵阵欢呼声。</font>\n<br>6. become bankrupt 破产\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Inflation was so bad that many firms went up. 通货膨胀十分严重，以致于许多公司破产了。</font>\n<br>7. enter (university) 入学（大学）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went up to Cambridge in 1980. 他198O年进入剑桥大学学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When are you going up? 你什么时候进大学？</font>\n
go up in smoke/in flames	<font color=blue size=4>go up in smoke/in flames</font>\n<br>1. burn; be destroyed by fire 燃烧；烧毁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before the firemen could get to the scene, the building went up in flames. 消防队员赶到现场之前，那栋大楼已被烧毁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The barn full of hay went up in smoke. 装满干草的谷仓已被烧光。</font>\n<br>2. disappear; fail; not come true 成泡影；未实现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His hopes of buying a new car went up in smoke when his father lost his job. 他想买部新车的愿望因他父亲失业无钱而成了泡影。</font>\n
go up to	<font color=blue size=4>go up to</font>\n<br>1. move upward to 上升到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the temperature goes up to 3Centigrade, the snow will melt. 气温升至3℃时积雪将融化。</font>\n<br>2. go near to 走（靠，接）近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I went up to the man and asked directions, but he was a total stranger. 我走近那个男人问路，但他却是个地道的外乡人。</font>\n
go with	<font color=blue size=4>go with</font>\n<br>1. travel with 同…一道旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I, ll go with you. 我跟你一起去。</font>\n<br>2. occur with; be the result of; be found together with 伴随；同时出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rights always go with obligations. 权利总是和义务分不开的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Poverty goes with laziness. 贫穷伴随着懒惰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Happiness doesn't necessarily go with money. 有钱并不一定就有幸福。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Disease often goes with dirt. 疾病往往与不清洁联系在一起。</font>\n<br>3. match or suit; harmonize with 配合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I like the way the blue carpet goes with the golden curtains. 我喜欢天蓝色的地毯配上金黄色的窗帘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The furniture goes very well with the room. 家俱和房间很和谐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Certain kinds of wine go with certain kinds of food. 什么样的酒配什么样的饭菜。</font>\n<br>4. be included with; be a part of 包括在…之内；是…的一部分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A set of tools goes with each tractor. 每出售一台拖拉机都奉送一套工具。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The radio does not go with the car. You have to pay for it separately. 收音机不是汽车的一部分，你得另外付钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Transshipment expenses are to go with the goods. 转船费用包括在货价之内。</font>\n<br>5. agree with; understand 和…意见一致；理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't go with you in that. 在那方面，我同你的意见不一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think I can go with you about the statement. 关于这项声明，我认为我的意见跟你不一样。</font>\n<br>6. keep company with (often with a view to marriage) 与…谈恋爱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's been going with an engineer. 她在与一位工程师谈恋爱。</font>\n
go without	<font color=blue size=4>go without</font>\n<br>continue in spite of lacking sth. 没有…也能对付过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there's no sugar you will have to go without; it won't do you any harm anyway. 假如没有糖，你就对付一下，无论如何这对你毫无害处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went without food for three days. 他一连3天没吃东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It looks as though we shall have to go without a holiday this year. 看起来，我们今年只好不休假了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At one time men never went without a hat. 有一个时期人们不戴帽子不出门。</font>\n
go without saying	<font color=blue size=4>go without saying</font>\n<br>be perfectly clear without the necessity of mentioning 不用说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It goes without saying that he's a top student. 他是个优等生，这是不消说的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It goes without saying that children should not be given knives to play with. 小孩不应该玩刀，这是不言而喻的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It goes without saying that she will lose all her friends if she continues to gossip about them. 不用说，她如果继续背后乱说，她会失去她所有的朋友。</font>\n
go wrong	<font color=blue size=4>go wrong</font>\n<br>1. take the wrong road travelling 走错路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must have gone wrong somewhere; we should have reached the village by now. 我们一定在什么地方走错了路，这个时候我们本应到达那个村子了。</font>\n<br>2. live immorally 堕落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's the best way to help young girls who go wrong? 什么是帮助失足少女的最好方法？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you follow my advice you can't go wrong. 你听我的话不会错。</font>\n<br>3. fail 失败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All his plans went wrong. 他所有的计划都落空了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sum is wrong, but I can't see where I went wrong. 总数不对，可我看不出我错在哪里。</font>\n<br>4. have a fault 有毛病（错误）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Something has gone wrong with my car. 我的车子出了毛病。</font>\n
grab at	<font color=blue size=4>grab at</font>\n<br> (attempt to) seize（试图）抓到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those who can grab at the opportunity will succeed. 能够抓住这个机会的人就会成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He grabbed at the chance the moment it was offered him. 那个机会一到手，他便抓住不放。</font>\n
grab off	<font color=blue size=4>grab off</font>\n<br>take quickly 迅速取得；抢先取得；捷足先登\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hurry up to grab off good seats. 快点，去找好位子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The women hurried to the store to grab off the things on sale. 女士们急忙涌向商店抢购减价商品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prettiest girls at the dance were grabbed off for partners first. 舞会中最漂亮的小姐是男士们抢先邀请的对象。</font>\n
grasp at	<font color=blue size=4>grasp at</font>\n<br>1. catch at 抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As he fell, he grasped at a hanging chain but missed it. 跌倒时他向一条悬挂的链条抓去，但没有抓到。</font>\n<br>2. try to seize 企图攫取\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man who grasps at too much may lose everything. 贪得无厌的人可能毫无所得。</font>\n
grasp/catch/cluth at straws	<font color=blue size=4>grasp/catch/cluth at straws</font>\n<br>depend on sth. that is useless or unable to help in a time of trouble or danger; try sth. with little hope of succeeding 捞救命稻草（将要溺死之人连一根草也要去抓）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws. 应付考试只凭记忆而不学习那是枉费心机。</font>\n
grateful to	<font color=blue size=4>grateful to</font>\n<br>thankful for 感谢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are particularly grateful to him for his timely help. 我们特别感谢他的及时帮助。</font>\n
grease sb's palm	<font color=blue size=4>grease sb's palm</font>\n<br>pay for sth. , esp. dishonestly; bribe; give a tip 塞红包；贿赂；给小费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some politicians will help you if you grease their palms. 有的政客只要你给他们好处就会给你帮忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to grease the palm of the waiter to get a table in the crowded restaurant. 在客满的饭店我们只有给服务员小费才能找到桌位。</font>\n
green with envy	<font color=blue size=4>green with envy</font>\n<br>full of envy; very jealous 充满嫉妒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were green with envy at our success. 他们十分嫉妒我们的成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was green with envy because you won the first prize. 你得了一等奖，她很嫉妒。</font>\n
grow on	<font color=blue size=4>grow on</font>\n<br>1. become more interesting or liked by 更加使人感到有趣；使人更加喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first glance this doesn't seem in teresting but it grows on me. 乍一看这并不有趣，但是它渐渐吸引了我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't like the song at first, but it grows on me the more I hear it. 我起初并不喜欢这首歌，可是我越听越觉得好听。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The more Jack saw Mary, the more she grew on him. 杰克看玛丽，越看越喜欢。</font>\n<br>2. become stronger in; increase as a habit of 对…越来越有影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sense of uneasiness grew on the little girl as she came before the silent stranger. 在那个沉默的陌生人面前，这个小女孩越来越感到紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The habit of early rising has grown on me. 我已经养成了早起的习惯。</font>\n
grow out of	<font color=blue size=4>grow out of</font>\n<br>1. develop from 发展自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most international firms have grown out of small family businesses. 多数国际性公司是从小的家庭企业发展起来的。</font>\n<br>2. arise or result from 起因于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His illness grew out of his tendency to overwork. 他的病是工作过度所致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accident grew out of his carelessness. 这场事故是由于他粗心而造成的。</font>\n<br>3. become too big or too old for 太大或太老而不再适合于…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son has grown out of his shoes. I have to buy him new ones. 我儿子已长大，穿不下这些鞋子了，我得给他买新的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no sense in buying expensive clothes for children, as they soon grow out of them. 给小孩买贵重的衣服划不来，因为他们很快就会长大穿不下了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My daughter has grown out of these toys. 我女儿已经长大，不再玩这些玩具了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has grown out of the bad habits of his boyhood days. 他长大了，已经改掉了童年时代的一些坏习惯。</font>\n
grow up	<font color=blue size=4>grow up</font>\n<br>pass from children to the stage of being adult; reach maturity 长大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Susan wants to be a doctor when she grows up. 苏珊长大想当个医生。</font>\n
had better	<font color=blue size=4>had better</font>\n<br>would find it wiser or more suitable to 最好是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better have that tooth pulled out. 你最好把那颗牙拔掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better not go by air. 你最好不要坐飞机去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better finish today's assignment, for tomorrow we'll have other things to do. 你最好把今天的任务完成，因为明天还有明天的事。</font>\n
had it not been for	<font color=blue size=4>had it not been for</font>\n<br>but for; without 如果没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Had it not been for your help, I could not have finished the work. 假如没有你的帮助，我是无法完成这项工作的。</font>\n
had rather/had sooner	<font color=blue size=4>had rather/had sooner</font>\n<br>choose to (do one thing instead of another); like better to; would prefer to 宁可；宁愿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He invited me to the movies, but I had rather go on a picnic with the girls. 他邀请我去看电影，但我倒是喜欢跟女孩们去野餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had sooner live in the city than in the countryside. 我宁愿住在城里而不愿住在乡村。</font>\n
had rather…than	<font color=blue size=4>had rather…than</font>\n<br>would regard as preferable; had better 宁愿…不愿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had rather die than surrender. 他宁死不屈。</font>\n
hale and hearty	<font color=blue size=4>hale and hearty</font>\n<br>in very good health; well and strong 身强力壮；矍铄的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though well over80, he's still hale and hearty. 他虽年过八旬，但仍然精神矍铄。</font>\n
hand back	<font color=blue size=4>hand back</font>\n<br>return sth. to sb. by hand 返还\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Examination papers will be handed back after the marks have been officially recorded. 成绩正式登记以后，试卷将归还。</font>\n
hand down	<font color=blue size=4>hand down</font>\n<br>1. pass to 递给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please hand down the large dish from the top shelf, I can't reach it. 请把架子最上面一层的大盘子递给我，我拿不到它。</font>\n<br>2. make a public statement 公布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city council will hand down the budget on Monday. 星期一市府将公布预算。</font>\n<br>3. pass sentence on sb. convicted of a crime 对罪犯判刑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The court handed down a sentence of ten years on the accused. 法庭宣布判处被告10年徒刑。</font>\n
hand down to	<font color=blue size=4>hand down to</font>\n<br>pass on to 传下来；传给\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their home contains many rare antiques which have been handed down to them from one generation to another. 他们家里藏了许多世代相传的珍奇古董。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These paintings have been handed down to us through three generations. 这些画传到我们手里时已经传了3代人了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our forefathers have handed a rich national culture down to us. 我们的祖先给我们传下来丰富的民族文化。</font>\n
hand in	<font color=blue size=4>hand in</font>\n<br>give sth. to sb. in charge 交上；上交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Each student has to hand in a composition once a week. 每个学生必须每周交一篇作文。</font>\n
hand in glove/hand and glove	<font color=blue size=4>hand in glove/hand and glove</font>\n<br>very close or friendly; working together; in very close agreement or cooperation, esp. for bad purposes 亲密合作；狼狈为奸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are hand in glove with each other in smuggling. 他们狼狈为奸，进行走私活动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Navy and the Coast Guard work hand and glove, especially in war time. 海军与海岸防卫队合作无间，战争年代更是如此。</font>\n
hand in hand	<font color=blue size=4>hand in hand</font>\n<br>1. each holding the other's hand 手拉手地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They strolled hand in hand in the street. 他们携手漫步街头。</font>\n<br>2. happening or working together; joinly 与…合作；与…携手共进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I gnorance and poverty often go hand in hand. 愚昧与贫困常常联系在一起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Theory should go hand in hand with practice. 理论应当与实践相结合。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doctors and nurses work hand in hand to save lives. 医生和护士密切合作挽救生命。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good teacher knows how to work hand in hand with students. 一位好教师知道如何与学生合作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The technical revolution should go hand in hand with the educational revolution. 技术革命应该和教育革命携手共进。</font>\n
hand on	<font color=blue size=4>hand on</font>\n<br>pass on to another by hand; transmit 传递\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please hand on the magazine to others. 请将杂志传递给其他人。</font>\n
hand out	<font color=blue size=4>hand out</font>\n<br>1. bring out from some place and put it forward with the hand 分送（给）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher handed the exercise books out to the students. 教师将作业本分发给学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall hand out these written statements to the reporters. 我们将把这些书面声明发给记者。</font>\n<br>2. offer as charity (to the unemployed, earthquake victims, etc.) 作为慈善把东西免费送给（失业者、地震等的受难者等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He handed out money to the poor. 他把钱捐给穷人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't need you handing out that sort of advice. 我不需要你向我提这样的劝告。</font>\n
hand over	<font color=blue size=4>hand over</font>\n<br>pass over or give over 递给；交出；移交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The escaped criminal was handed over to the police. 这个逃犯被送交了警方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Mr. Wang gets old, he will hand over his business to his son. 当王先生年老时，他将把他的公司移交给他儿子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has resigned and will hand over his office to his successor. 他已经辞职并将同他的继任者办理移交手续。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doesn't want to hand over the property to anyone. 他不想把财产交给任何人。</font>\n
hands down	<font color=blue size=4>hands down</font>\n<br>1. without working hard 轻而易举地；毫不费劲地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our team won the game hands down yesterday. 昨天我们队赢得很轻松。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He won the championship hands down. 他不费吹灰之力就拿了冠军。</font>\n<br>2. without question or doubt 无疑地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is hands down the best student in our class. 他在我们班上无疑是最好的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was hands down the best film I've ever seen. 这无疑是我看过的最好的一场电影。</font>\n
hand to hand	<font color=blue size=4>hand to hand</font>\n<br>in close personal contact 短兵相接；肉搏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our troops advanced and engaged the enemy in hand to hand fighting. 我军向前挺进，并同敌人短兵相接。</font>\n
hang about/around/round	<font color=blue size=4>hang about/around/round</font>\n<br>1. wait without purpose or activity 慢慢腾腾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't hang about; we have a train to catch. 别慢慢腾腾的，我们要赶火车。</font>\n<br>2. pass time or stay idly 徘徊不定；闲荡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two suspiciouslooking fellows were seen hanging about the village last night. 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在村里走动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy has nothing to do, just hanging about the street corners. 这孩子无事可做，只在街头游荡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill is hanging about that attractive girl. 比尔在那迷人的小姐附近徘徊着。</font>\n
hang back/off/behind	<font color=blue size=4>hang back/off/behind</font>\n<br>1. hesitate 犹豫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They hung back from committing themselves to the scheme until they knew more about it. 在他们未了解更多的情况之前，对是否答应负责这个项目一直犹豫不决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She hung back from asking the questions. 她犹豫着没提出那些问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We wanted Fred to join the club, but he hung off. 我们想让弗雷德参加俱乐部，可他犹豫不决。</font>\n<br>2. stay some distance behind or away; be unwilling to move forward 退缩；踌躇不前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old lady offered the little girl candy, but she was shy and hung back. 这位老妇人给那个女孩糖吃，但她却害羞而踌躇不前。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most of us dashed quickly across the street, but two hung back. 我们中大多数人很快地冲过大街，但有两个人却畏缩不前。</font>\n<br>3. hold back 抑制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pupil is so reserved that he hangs back from many activities. 那个学生太内向，许多活动都不参加。</font>\n<br>4. restore to a hanging position 挂回；挂着搁放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't need the clothes, hang them back in the wardrobe. 如果你不需要这些衣服，就挂回衣柜里去。</font>\n
hang behind	<font color=blue size=4>hang behind</font>\n<br>stay in a place after others have left; lag behind 别人离开后仍留在原处；落后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One or two of the audience hung behind after the lecture to have a word with the speaker. 演讲结束以后，一两个听众仍迟迟不走，想和演讲者聊聊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was hanging behind, too shy to speak. 她拖在后面，不好意思发言。</font>\n
hang by a hair/a thread	<font color=blue size=4>hang by a hair/a thread</font>\n<br>depend on a very small thing; be in doubt 千钧一发；处于紧急关头；安危未定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has lost so much blood that his life hangs by a thread. 他失血过多，生命垂危。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For three days he was so sick that his life hung by a thread. 他病危, 3天，真是命若游丝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His life hung by a hair, but the doctors managed to revive him. 他生命垂危，但医生们设法把他救了过来。</font>\n
hang fire	<font color=blue size=4>hang fire</font>\n<br>1. fail or be slow in shooting or firing 发射不出；发射迟缓\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled the trigger, but the gun hung fire and the enemy escaped. 他扣动扳机，但枪打不响，敌人跑了。</font>\n<br>2. be slow in beginning; be delayed 延迟；耽搁；进展缓慢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our plan for organizing a picnic hung fire because of the bad weather. 因为天气不好，我们组织去野餐的计划搁下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scheme for developing the area has hung fire for two years for lack of fund. 发展这个地区的计划因资金短缺已拖延了两年。</font>\n
hang heavy/on sb's hands	<font color=blue size=4>hang heavy/on sb's hands</font>\n<br>pass slowly or uninterestingly; be boring with little to do 闷得发慌；过得太慢而无聊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vacation time hung heavy on Bell's hands because all his classmates were away. 假期对比尔来说过得太慢了，因为他的同班同学都走了。</font>\n
hang in	<font color=blue size=4>hang in</font>\n<br>show pluck; persist 表现出勇气；坚持到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher often encourages us to hang in no matter what kind of difficulties we come across. 我们老师常常鼓励我们不管遇到什么困难都要无所畏惧，坚持到底。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hang in, boys！坚持下去，孩子们！</font>\n
hang in the balance	<font color=blue size=4>hang in the balance</font>\n<br>have reached a critical point; have two equally possible results 到了关键时刻；安危（胜负、成败）未定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is very sick and her life hangs in the balance. 她病得很厉害，生死难卜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The future of the nation was in the balance. 国家的存亡处于紧急关头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The outcome of the game hung in the balance. 比赛的结果胜负难分。</font>\n
hang off	<font color=blue size=4>hang off</font>\n<br>1. let go 放开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't hang off the rope, or you will fall down. 不要放开绳子，否则你就要摔倒。</font>\n<br>2. =hang back 1. 2. 3.\n
hang on	<font color=blue size=4>hang on</font>\n<br>1. continue listening on a telephone 继续听电话；不要挂断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please hang on a second; I'll look for the manager and tell him you are on the phone for him. 请稍等片刻，不要挂掉，我去找经理并告诉他你在电话里等他。</font>\n<br>2. lean or support oneself upon 倚；靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her head hanging on her mother's arm, the girl fell asleep. 这女孩倚在她妈妈怀里，睡着了。</font>\n<br>3. persevere; continue doing sth. 坚持；坚忍；继续做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is a hard task, but if you hang on, you will succeed in the end. 任务虽然艰巨，但如果你坚持下去，你最终是会成功的。</font>\n<br>4. cling to; hold on to sth. tightly 抓住；握紧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The climber almost fell off the cliff, but managed to hang on until help came. 登山者差点掉下悬崖，但他设法抓住崖边直到有人救他。</font>\n<br>5. depend on; wait on 取决于；依赖于；有待于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything hangs on his decision. 一切取决于他的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It all hangs on whether he is willing to cooperate with us. 一切都取决于他是否愿意和我们合作。</font>\n<br>6. listen with fascination 听得着迷；注意听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students hung on his every word. 学生们全神贯注地听着他的每一句话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was hanging on his answer, but he kept silent. 大家都在注意听他怎么回答，但他却一直不吭声。</font>\n<br>7. continue to sound; continue to cause suffering 继续响着；继续存在（疾病）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert had come to an end, but the strains of music seemed to hang on in our ears. 音乐会已经结束，但乐曲声似乎仍在我们耳边回荡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My cold has hung on for weeks, I just can't shake it off. 我感冒已经好几个星期，就是好不了。</font>\n
hang on to	<font color=blue size=4>hang on to</font>\n<br>1. hold tightly 牢牢抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was so windy that I had to hang on to my hat all the way along the street. 风太大，在街上我得一直牢牢抓住我的帽子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hang on to my hand, while we cross the street. 过街时要紧紧抓住我的手。</font>\n<br>2. rely on 依靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The only thing I can hang on to is none other than my own brain and hands. 我唯一能依靠的只有我自己的头脑和手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her son's death depressed her so much that she thought nothing was left for her to hang on to. 她儿子的死使她十分地伤心，以致于她认为没有什么是她可以依靠的了。</font>\n<br>3. retain possession of 留住；保留\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better hang on to those shares; they'll be going up again soon. 你最好留下那些股票，它们很快又会看涨的。</font>\n
hang out	<font color=blue size=4>hang out</font>\n<br>1. lean out 伸出身体\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog lay in the shade with his tongue hanging out; it was so hot. 那条狗趴在阴凉处伸着舌头，因为天气太热。</font>\n<br>2. fasten, spread, or show sth. out of a building 挂出门（窗）外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People hang flags out on the national holiday. 国庆节，人们把旗子挂在门外。</font>\n<br>3. endure; not give in; be unyielding 忍受；坚持；不屈服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The besieged soldiers had to hang out for four days without supplies. 被围困的战士们不得不在断绝给养的情况下坚持了4天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The striking workers hung out for more money before resuming work. 罢工的工人坚持要提高工资才复工。</font>\n<br>4. last (of supplies, resources, etc.) 维持；延续（供应、资源等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our food will hang out for two days. 我们的食品能维持两天。</font>\n<br>5. live; reside 居住；生活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where are you hanging out these days? 这日子你住在哪儿？</font>\n<br>6. spend one's time idly 鬼混；闲荡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher criticized Bill for hanging out in a bar. 老师批评比尔在酒吧鬼混。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you continue to hang out with that group of bad boys, you'll fail in your exams. 如果你继续和那群坏孩子鬼混，你考试会不及格的。</font>\n
hang over	<font color=blue size=4>hang over</font>\n<br>1. be going to happen; threaten 笼罩；威胁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Trouble hangs over the little town because its only factory has closed down. 这个小镇陷入困境之中，因为它唯一的工厂已经关闭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Danger hung over his head as he spoke. 他说话时，危难正降临到他头上。</font>\n<br>2. continue 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect the situation to hang over till next week. 我希望这种局面会继续到下周。</font>\n<br>3. remain to be finished or settled 搁下来有待解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll take up the business that hung over from last meeting. 我们将讨论上次会上遗留下来的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The court decided to let the suit hang over till its next session. 法庭决定把这个讼诉案留到下次开庭时解决。</font>\n
hang to	<font color=blue size=4>hang to</font>\n<br>1. take hold of 抓牢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus is turning the corner. Please hang to the straphanger. 公共汽车要转弯了，请抓住吊带站稳。</font>\n<br>2. keep persistent contact with 与…保持接触\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hound hung to the trail of the fox. 猎犬紧紧追踪那只狐狸。</font>\n
hang together	<font color=blue size=4>hang together</font>\n<br>1. stay united; help and defend one another 团结一致；互相帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we all hang together we are sure to succeed in our plan. 如果我们都团结一致，我们的计划一定能成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We always hang together when one of us is in trouble. 我们当中无论谁有困难，大家都团结一致，互相帮助。</font>\n<br>2. form a satisfactory whole; be consistent 编得前后一致；没有破绽；合乎逻辑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His story of why he was absent from seems to hang together. 他没来上课的理由似乎还合乎逻辑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His argument was a good one and hung together. 他的论据很好，逻辑性强。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These two assertions do not seem to hang together. 这两种说法似乎互相矛盾。</font>\n
hang up	<font color=blue size=4>hang up</font>\n<br>1. put a telephone receiver down 挂上电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't hang up (on me); I haven't finished talking to you. 别挂电话，我还有话对你说。</font>\n<br>2. delay; cause a delay; put aside; cause to wait 搁置；推迟；拖延；使等候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The project was hung up for lack of fund. 工程因资金短缺而被搁置下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy rain hung up the work on the building site for three weeks. 大雨使工地上的工作耽搁了3周。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry I'm late. I got hung up by a friend on the way here. 对不起我来晚了。路上遇到一个朋友，所以耽搁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rehearsals for the school play were hung up by the illness of some of the actors. 校戏剧节目的彩排因几位演员生病而推迟了。</font>\n<br>3. stick or cause to be stuck or held so as to be immovable 受困；搁浅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For nearly twenty minutes the train was hung up in a tunnel with the signal against it. 没有发通行信号，火车停在隧道里将近20分钟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus was hung up in snow and the driver could not get it out. 公共汽车受困于雪地里，司机无法将它开出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A big ssenger ship hung up on a sandbar for several hours. 一条大客轮搁浅在沙州已有几个小时了。</font>\n<br>4. set a record 破纪录\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hung up a school record for longdistance swimming. 他破了远程游泳的校纪录。</font>\n<br>5. place on a hook or hanger 挂起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the children come to school, they hang up their coats in the cloakroom. 孩子们到校后把外衣挂在衣帽间。</font>\n
happen on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>happen on/upon</font>\n<br>meet with; come unexpectedly on （偶然）遇见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I happened on this old photograph in the back of the drawer. 在抽屉后面我偶尔发现了这张旧照片。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the conference I happened upon an old friend I had not seen for years. 在大会期间我偶然遇到了一位多年不见的朋友。</font>\n
happen to	<font color=blue size=4>happen to</font>\n<br>chance to 碰巧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I happened to be out when he called. 他来访时我碰巧外出了。</font>\n
hard and fast	<font color=blue size=4>hard and fast</font>\n<br>not to be broken or changed; fixed; strict 严格的；非遵守不可的；不能变动的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a hard and fast rule; everyone must obey it. 这是个严格的规则，大家都必须服从。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The traffic regulations must be observed in a hard and fast way; any negligence would cause an accident. 交通规则必须严格遵守，任何疏忽都会造成事故。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher said that there was a hard and fast rule against smoking in the school. 老师说校方规定不准抽烟，任何人不允许违反这条规定。</font>\n
hard as nails	<font color=blue size=4>hard as nails</font>\n<br>1. not flabby or soft; physically very fit 结结实实；身体强壮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After working in the countryside for two years he is as hard as nails. 在乡下干了两年后，他身体非常结实。</font>\n<br>2. not gentle or mild;rough; stern 冷酷无情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John works for a boss who is as hard as nails and scolds John roughly whenever he does something wrong. 约翰的老板很严厉，每当约翰做错了事，他总是严加训斥。</font>\n
hard by	<font color=blue size=4>hard by</font>\n<br>near by; not far off 附近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hard by the school stood a big bookstore. 学校附近有一家大书店。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their house is hard by the station. 他们的房子就在车站附近。</font>\n
hard feeling	<font color=blue size=4>hard feeling</font>\n<br>angry or bitter feeling 敌意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim asked Andy to shake hands with him, just to show that there were no hard feelings. 吉姆请安迪同他握手，以示彼此无敌意。</font>\n
hardly/scarcely any	<font color=blue size=4>hardly/scarcely any</font>\n<br>almost no or almost none; very few 很少；几乎没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hardly any of the students did well on the test, so the teacher explained the test paper in detail. 几乎没有一个学生考得好，所以老师把考卷详细讲解了一遍。</font>\n
hardly/scarcely ever	<font color=blue size=4>hardly/scarcely ever</font>\n<br>very rarely; almost never; seldom 很少；稀少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We hardly ever get to see him nowadays; he must be very busy with his business. 近来我们很少看到他；他一定忙于他的事务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In New England, the month of September hardly ever passes without a frost. 在新英格兰, 9月很少不降霜的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hardly ever goes to bed before midnight. 他很少在午夜之前睡觉的。</font>\n
hardly…when	<font color=blue size=4>hardly…when</font>\n<br>no sooner…than; only just…when 刚…就\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had hardly reached here, when it began to snow. 他一到这儿就下起雪来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hardly had I got home, when the telephone rang. 我刚到家，电话就响了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had hardly heard the news, when she began to cry. 她一听到这消息就哭了。</font>\n
hard on	<font color=blue size=4>hard on</font>\n<br>1. near to 临近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is hard on eighty. 他快80岁了。</font>\n<br>2. severe upon 对…苛刻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is hard on his employees. 他对雇员太苛刻。</font>\n
hard/tough nut to crack	<font color=blue size=4>hard/tough nut to crack</font>\n<br>sth. difficult to understand or to do 难事；棘手的问题\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl found the algebra lesson was a hard nut to crack. 这女孩发现代数课难以应付。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dealing with that problem was a hard nut to crack; you must have worked hard to solve it. 处理那个问题很难，你一定花了很大的气力。</font>\n<br>hard put (to it) \n<br>in a difficult position; faced with difficulty 面临困境；为难\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little girl found herself hard to put to it to find the way home. 这小女孩发现她认不得回家的路了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were hard put to it to solve this problem, but we succeeded at last. 我们起先对解决这个问题感到很为难，但最终还是圆满解决了。</font>\n
have a ball	<font color=blue size=4>have a ball</font>\n<br>enjoy oneself very much 玩得痛快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the teacher left, the children had a ball. 老师走后，孩子们玩得很痛快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary and Tom had a ball exploring the town. 玛丽和汤姆快活地逛城市。</font>\n
have a bearing on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>have a bearing on/upon</font>\n<br>be related to; affect; influence 对…有影响；与…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The points you are raising have some bearing on the case now being tried. 你提出的几点对正在审理的案子有一些关系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whether you love him has no bearing on whether he's good or bad. 你是否爱他与他这个人是好是坏没有什么关系。</font>\n<br>have a finger in the pie have sth. to do with what happens; share interest or responsibility. 参与；有关；干涉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's none of your business; there's no need for you to have a finger in the pie. 这件事与你无关，用不着你插手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the girls got up a Christmas party, I felt sure Alice had a finger in the pie. 当姑娘们筹备圣诞舞会时，我确信艾丽斯一定会参与的。</font>\n
have a fit/have fits/throw a fit	<font color=blue size=4>have a fit/have fits/throw a fit</font>\n<br>1. have a sudden illness with stiffness or jerking of the body. 突然发作而痉挛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He suffers from epilepsy; that's why he had a fit yesterday. 他患有癫痫病，所以昨天他痉挛不止。</font>\n<br>2. become angry or upset 发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Bell decided to drop out of college, his parents had fits. 当比尔决定退学时，他父母很生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a fit when he learned about his son's misbehaviour at school. 当听到他儿子在校表现不好时，他大发脾气。</font>\n

have a hand/part in	<font color=blue size=4>have a hand/part in</font>\n<br>have a part in or influence over; be partly responsible for 参与或影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of us respect Professor Zhang and he has a hand in every important decision made by our department. 我们很尊重张教授，他参与我们系所做出的每一项重要决定。</font>\n<br>It is a very important project. Do you have a hand in the planning? \n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>这是一个很重要的项目，你参与规划了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had no hand in that matter. 他与那件事毫无关系。</font>\n

have a heart	<font color=blue size=4>have a heart</font>\n<br>stop being mean; be kind and generous or sympathetic 发发慈悲；做做好事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have a heart, Bob, and help me with the work; otherwise I can't finish it on time. 鲍勃，做做好事，帮我做这事情吧，否则我不能按时完成。</font>\n
