have an ear/an eye/a nose for	<font color=blue size=4>have an ear/an eye/a nose for</font>\n<br>be able to judge correctly; be able to detect, or appreciate sth. (because one's senses are alert or well trained) 有眼光；很能鉴赏；对…感兴趣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has an ear for music. 她对音乐很有欣赏能力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good reporter has a nose for news. 好的记者对新闻很敏感。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has an eye for color and style in clothes. 她对服装的颜色和式样很有鉴赏力。</font>\n<br>have an/the edge on sb. be in a position of advantage (compared with sb. else) （与某人相比）占优势；胜过某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In typing, he has an edge on everyone else in our class. 论打字，他比我们班任何人都强。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't beat them at tennis, but we have an edge on them in pingpong. 打网球我们赢不了他们，可是论乒乓球，我们比他们强。</font>\n
have a regard for	<font color=blue size=4>have a regard for</font>\n<br>respect 尊敬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a great regard for his teachers. 他很尊敬他的老师。</font>\n
have a stake in	<font color=blue size=4>have a stake in</font>\n<br> (have invested money, effort, etc. in sth. and therefore) stand to lose or gain（对某事进行了投资或花了精力，因此）与某事有利害关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager is worried over the decline in the business at the company. As a big shareholder he has quite a stake in it. 经理对公司的生意萧条甚为忧虑。作为一个大股东，他跟公司有着密切的利害关系。</font>\n
have a time	<font color=blue size=4>have a time</font>\n<br>1. have trouble; have a hard time 有麻烦；有一段艰苦的时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Suzan had a time trying to get the children to go to bed. 苏珊很难使孩子们入睡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a time passing his maths exam. 为了要通过数学考试，他忙了好一阵子。</font>\n<br>2. have a good time 度过欢乐的时光；快活（与反身代词连用）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary had herself a time dancing at the party. 玛丽在舞会上跳得真高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had himself a time playing football. 他踢足球踢得很开心。</font>\n
have a way with	<font color=blue size=4>have a way with</font>\n<br>be able to lead, persuade, or influence 很有办法（领导、说服、影响）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss has such a way with his employees that they do everything he tells them to do. 这位老板很有办法，能让他的雇员们做他所吩咐的每一件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ted will be a good teacher, because he has a way with children. 泰德将是一位优秀的教师，因为他知道如何管理孩子。</font>\n<br>have a word with sb. speak to sb. 与某人谈话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>May I have a word with you after the meeting? 会后我可以跟你谈话吗？</font>\n
have done	<font color=blue size=4>have done</font>\n<br>stop; finish 结束；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the teacher had done, she asked for questions from the class. 老师讲完课后就问学生有无问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you have done, I'll explain the matter. 如你已讲完了，我将解释这件事。</font>\n
have done with	<font color=blue size=4>have done with</font>\n<br>1. stop doing or using sih. 停止做某事；停止使用某物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>l wish you would have done with your criticisms. 我希望你能停止批评。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you have done with my book, please return it to me. 你看完我那本书以后，请还给我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have done with painting. 我已经不搞绘画了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have done with all these nonsense. 别瞎胡闹了。</font>\n<br>2. stop being friendly with sb. 不再与某人打交道；不再与某人有关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have found him dishonest, so I have done with him. 我发觉他不老实，所以不和他来往了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told me that he had done with those people. 他告诉我他已不和那些人来往了。</font>\n
have down	<font color=blue size=4>have down</font>\n<br>have sb. stay at one's house as a guest 请某人来家作客\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are planning to have some good friends down for the holiday. 他们打算请几个好朋友来家一起过假日。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shall we have our grandchildren down for the weekend? 我们是不是把孙儿孙女们一起请来过周末？</font>\n
have had it	<font color=blue size=4>have had it</font>\n<br>have experienced or suffered all one can; have come to the end of one's patience of life 受够了；吃尽了苦头；无法忍受；生命没救了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“I've had it. I'm resigning from the job right now. ”“我已经受够了，我要立刻辞去这份工作。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the doctor examined the man who had been shot, he said, “He's had it. ”医生检查过被枪杀的人以后说：“他已经没救了。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know how to thank you. If it had not been for your help, I'd have had it. 我不知道该如何感谢你，要是没有你的帮助，我就吃尽苦头了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“The boat is taking in water. ”the sailor cried：“We've had it. ”那个水手大声喊道：“船漏水了，这下我们可完了。”</font>\n
have in	<font color=blue size=4>have in</font>\n<br>entertain sb. at home; have sb. working in one's house 在家里招待某人；请某人来家里干活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had Professor Wang in for supper yesterday evening. 昨晚他们把王教授请来家里吃晚饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll have the electrician in today to fix the light. 今天我们将请电工来装电灯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better have the doctor in to see the child. 你最好请医生来给孩子看看。</font>\n
have in hand	<font color=blue size=4>have in hand</font>\n<br>1. have or possess 占有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have no money in hand. 我手头无钱。</font>\n<br>2. control 控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have the situation well in hand. 我们完全控制了局势。</font>\n
have it both ways	<font color=blue size=4>have it both ways</font>\n<br>enjoy two advantages; maintain two positions which are incompatible with each other 两全其美；保持两种不能并存的立场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must choose between a low rate of interest but security for your capital, and a higher rate of interest with the attendent risks; you cannot have it both ways. 你要么选择低息而资金有保障的措施，要么选择高利率而冒险的措施，二者不能兼得。</font>\n
have it in for	<font color=blue size=4>have it in for</font>\n<br>wish or mean to harm; hold a grudge against; have a bitter feeling against 伺机报复；怀恨在心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has it in for a neighbour who complained about him to the police. 他对向警察局告发他的邻居怀恨在心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George has it in for Bob because Bob told the teacher that George cheated in the examination. 因为鲍勃向老师报告乔治考试作弊，所以乔治怀恨在心伺机报复。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager has had it in for John ever since that mistake in the accounts was discovered. 自从账目上的错误被发现后，经理对约翰一直怀恨在心。</font>\n
have it out with	<font color=blue size=4>have it out with</font>\n<br>discuss angrily with 生气地把事情谈清楚；争论明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must have the whole matter out with her next time I see her. 下次见到她，我一定要把整个事情跟她争个明白。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For a long time my resentment of him grew until finally I had to have it out with him. 长期以来，我对他的怨恨越来越大，直到最后不得不气愤地和他摊牌。</font>\n
have no business	<font color=blue size=4>have no business</font>\n<br>have no right to do sth. 无权做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have no business to come so late; you should have come earlier. 你不该来得这么迟，应该早点来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had no business taking my car without my permission. 你无权未经我允许就开我的车。</font>\n
have nothing to do with	<font color=blue size=4>have nothing to do with</font>\n<br>have no connection with 与…毫无关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked some questions which had nothing to do with his lessons. 老师问了一些与上课内容毫无关系的问题。</font>\n
have on	<font color=blue size=4>have on</font>\n<br>1. wear 穿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had their best suits on for the celebration. 他们穿着节日盛装去参加庆祝活动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went to bed drunk, and when he woke up he found that he still had his shoes on. 他喝醉后就上床睡觉了，一觉醒来后发现自己还穿着鞋子。</font>\n<br>2. have arranged or planned; be engaged in doing; have an engagement 有…安排或计划；忙于做；有约会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What do you have on for tomorrow night? 明晚你有什么安排？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am engaged for the whole of today, but I've nothing on on Saturday. 我今天整天都有事，但星期六有空。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a lot on at the moment. 他这会儿有许多事要做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry I can't attend your dinner party, but I have a meeting on for tonight. 很抱歉我不能参加你的宴会，今晚我要参加一个会议。</font>\n<br>3. deceive; tease; mislead 欺骗；戏弄；引入歧途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid he must have been having you on. 我担心他一定是在骗你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to have me on too many times before, so it's not for me to take him seriously this time. 以前有好多次他老是捉弄我，所以这次我再也不把他的话当真了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop having us on, please！请不要耍弄我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've been had on too often to take his stories seriously. 我受骗次数太多了，不再认真听他的话了。</font>\n<br>4. have sth. in progress 在进行中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a lot on at the moment. 他这会儿有许多事要做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I found they had very important discussions on in the office at the moment. 我发现他们那会儿正在办公室讨论很重要的事情。</font>\n
have one's eyes for	<font color=blue size=4>have one's eyes for</font>\n<br>see or want nothing else but; give all one's attention to; be interested only in 看中；独钟情于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Of all the bicycles in the store, Jack had eyes only for the white one. 商店中所有的自行车中，杰克只看上了那部白色的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl had her eyes on a yellow scarf and decided to buy it. 这女孩看中一条黄颜色的头巾，便决定把它买下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many girls liked Fred, but he had eyes only for Helen. 许多女孩都喜欢弗雷德，但他只对海伦感兴趣。</font>\n
have one's hands full	<font color=blue size=4>have one's hands full</font>\n<br>have as much work as one can do; be very busy 手头工作很忙；无法分身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The worker said that he had his hands full and could not take another job. 这位工人说他手头工作很忙，不能再做另外的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall have our hands full when the freshmen arrive. 新生一到，我们就要大忙了。</font>\n<br>have one's/a hand in have a share in; participate in 干涉；参与\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is impossible that she could have had a hand in this notorious crime. 她不可能参与这种罪恶勾当。</font>\n
have one's heart set on	<font color=blue size=4>have one's heart set on</font>\n<br>want sth. very much; desire greatly 十分想要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tim doesn't know what to do. His wife has her heart set on a fur coat for Christmas but he can't afford to buy it for her this year. 蒂姆不知如何是好，他的妻子一心想买一件皮外衣过圣诞节，但是他今年买不起。</font>\n
have one's own way	<font color=blue size=4>have one's own way</font>\n<br>get one's own way; do or obtain what one wishes (esp. against opposition or contrary advice) 随心所欲；按自己的意思办事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My wife always wants to have her own way, but this time, for a change, she is going to do what I say. 我妻子总是按她自己的意愿办事，但是这次变了，她要按照我说的去办。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let him have his own way. 随他去吧。</font>\n<br>have one's own way to make have to advance in life by one's own efforts 自食其力；自立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the age of twelve, he was left penniless by the death of his father, so he had his own way to make. 在12岁时，他父亲就死了，分文没有留给他，所以他只好自食其力。</font>\n
have one's will	<font color=blue size=4>have one's will</font>\n<br>obtain what is desired 如愿以偿；达到目的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not good for a child to have his will in everything. 让孩子样样都得到满足，并非好事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have always had your will. 你总是自行其是。</font>\n
have on hand	<font color=blue size=4>have on hand</font>\n<br>1. have to do with; be occupied with or engaged in 有事要做；从事于；手中有事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have some hard work on hand. 我手中正有一件艰难的工作要做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll be absent for the next few days because he has a sick mother on hand. 他这几天不能来了，因为他母亲生病要他照料。</font>\n<br>2. have for disposal or for sale 有物要处理掉；有物待出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have many extra copies of the magazine on hand; do you want some? 这种杂志我手头有好多本，你想要一些吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has many articles on hand. 他有许多货要出售。</font>\n
have out	<font color=blue size=4>have out</font>\n<br>1. have removed or extracted 除去；拔掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My tooth was aching so much that I had to have it out. 我有颗牙齿疼得很厉害，只好拔掉它。</font>\n<br>2. invite sb. out 请某人出去（参加活动、吃饭等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to have you out for dinner this evening. 今晚我想请你去吃饭。</font>\n<br>3. discuss or argue towards a conclusion 讨论或争论出结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had it all out last night and cleared the air a little. 他们昨天晚上争论有了结果，问题有所澄清。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use keeping your anger to yourself; let's have the whole matter out now. 你生闷气也没有用，我们还是把整个事情说说清楚为好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must have the whole matter out with them next time I see them. 下次见到他们，我得把整个事情跟他们弄清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you've got a complaint, the best thing is to see the person concerned and have it out with him. 你如果有什么意见，最好去找有关人员说个明白。</font>\n<br>4. continue until complete 继续做完某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let him have his sleep out; he's very tired. 让他睡个够吧，他太累了。</font>\n
have/take a look at	<font color=blue size=4>have/take a look at</font>\n<br>look at for a moment 看一看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take your hat off and let me have a look at it. 把你的帽子摘下来让我瞧瞧。</font>\n

have (time) off	<font color=blue size=4>have (time) off</font>\n<br>have free time; not have to work 休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have time off for a coffee break every morning. 每天上午我们都有喝咖啡的休息时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He works only five days a week and has every Saturday and Sunday off. 他一周只工作5天，星期六和星期日休息。</font>\n
have to do with	<font color=blue size=4>have to do with</font>\n<br>be concerned with 与…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has to do with that matter. 他同那件事有牵连。</font>\n
have too high an opinion of	<font color=blue size=4>have too high an opinion of</font>\n<br>overestimate; regard too highly 过高地评价；过分尊重\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher has too high an opinion of his own students. 这位老师对他的学生估计过高。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That engineer has too high an opinion of his own talents. 那位工程师对自己的才能估计过高。</font>\n
have to oneself	<font color=blue size=4>have to oneself</font>\n<br>monopolize 独占；霸占\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't have all these apples to yourself. 你不能一个人独占这么多苹果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You haven't paid the rent yet; you can't have the room to yourself. 你还没有付房租，不能独占这房间。</font>\n
have two strings to one's bow	<font color=blue size=4>have two strings to one's bow</font>\n<br>have an alternative or choice 有两手准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've made sure in both directions. It's always good to have two strings to one's bow. 你已经在两个方面都落实了。有两手准备总是好的。</font>\n
have up	<font color=blue size=4>have up</font>\n<br>1. bring; order or invite (sb.) up from a lower place（从较低的地方或把较低职位的人）请来；叫来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager had the clerk up and reprimanded him for his constant carelessness. 经理把职员召唤进来，指责他经常粗心大意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shall we have the Greens up this weekend? 这个周末咱们把格林夫妇请来好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had him up to see me, to explain what he was doing. 我叫他上来见我，说明一下他在干什么。</font>\n<br>2. bring up for investigation; cause to appear in court 传讯；把某人传到法庭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go on saying things like that about me, I'll have you up for slander. 如果你继续那样说我，我就上法庭告你诽谤罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was had up by the police for dangerous driving. 他因违章驾驶被警察传去。</font>\n<br>3. be aroused in 使被激起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had his temper up and swore loudly. 他发起脾气来大声咒骂。</font>\n
have weight with	<font color=blue size=4>have weight with</font>\n<br>have effect on 对…有影响；对…产生效力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His opinions have great weight with us. 他的意见对我们影响很大。</font>\n
have words	<font color=blue size=4>have words</font>\n<br>dispute; quarrel 争执；争论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every time they two get together they have words. 他们俩一到一起就吵嘴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had words with his wife last night. 昨晚他和妻子发生口角。</font>\n
head for	<font color=blue size=4>head for</font>\n<br>travel in the direction of 向…方向运动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students headed straight for home after class. 课后学生们直接回家了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police expected the criminals to head for the coast. 警察预料罪犯会逃往海岸方向。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set sail at dawn and headed for the United States. 他们的船在黎明时启程驶向美国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are heading for an accident if you drive after drinking. 你酒后驾车是要出车祸的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is heading for trouble if he goes on behaving like that. 要是他继续那样胡来，他是自找麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go on with him, you're heading for disaster. 如果你继续和他在一起，那你就是走向灾难。</font>\n
head off	<font color=blue size=4>head off</font>\n<br>1. block; stop; prevent 阻截；停止；阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We tried our best to head him off from making a speech because he would reveal confidential in formation. 我们竭力阻止他去演讲，因为他会泄露机密的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will get into trouble if someone doesn't head him off. 如果没有人阻止他，他会惹上麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They could not think of a good way to head off the inflation. 他们想不出一个好办法来阻止通货膨胀。</font>\n<br>2. get in front of and stop; turn back or aside 超前拦截或截回\n<br>The hunters decided to head the an\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>imals off. 猎人决定拦截这些动物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ta ke this small lane and you can head him off at the crossroads. 走这条小巷，你就能在十字路口赶到他前面去。</font>\n<br>3. divert thought or attention of 使思想或注意力转移开去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to head off awkward questions about his past. 他设法避开有关他过去情况的尴尬问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief realized that the police were following him, but he succeeded in heading them off at the junction. 小偷发现警察在跟踪他，可是他在十字路口把他们甩掉了。</font>\n
head on	<font color=blue size=4>head on</font>\n<br>with the head or front pointing directly towards an object 头直向；迎面相撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship struck the rocks head on. 那只船迎头撞上了礁石。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two cars crashed head on. 两车迎面撞上。</font>\n
head out	<font color=blue size=4>head out</font>\n<br>leave; start out 离去；出发；启程\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have a long way to go before dark. I'm going to head out. 天黑之前我还要走一大段路程，我得上路了。</font>\n
head start	<font color=blue size=4>head start</font>\n<br>1. a beginning before sb.;lead or advantage at the beginning 抢先；开始时领先；先起步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are well ahead of us in science because they have made a head start by several years. 因为他们比我们先动手几年，所以他们在科学方面领先我们很多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The other racers knew they couldn't catch John if he got too big a head start. 其他赛车手都知道如果一开始就让约翰抢先太多，他们就追不上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe had a head start. He began to study earlier than we did. 乔领先我们，他在我们开始之前就已经准备功课了。</font>\n<br>2. a good beginning 好的开端，好的开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get a head start in painting the house by getting up early. 我们早一点起床粉刷房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher gave the class a head start on the exercise by telling them how to do the first two problems. 老师在班上给学生讲了如何做头两道题，给他们一个好的开始。</font>\n
heads up	<font color=blue size=4>heads up</font>\n<br>keep your head up and be careful or ready (used as a warning to prepare for sth. or clear the way) 注意；小心；留神（用以警告准备做某事或让路）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Heads up！”said the waiter carrying the hot food. “小心，请让路！”服务员端着热腾腾的菜肴说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Heads up, boys！A train is coming. 孩子们，当心！火车来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Heads up now！You can do better than that. 这次小心些，你就可以做得更好点。</font>\n<br>heap coals of fire on one's head be kind or helpful to sb. who has done wrong to you, so that he is ashamed 以德报怨使之羞愧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he had been unkind to us, we heaped coals of fire on his head by helping him in his misfortune. 虽然他对我们一向不友好，但是，他患难时，我们以德报怨，帮了他的忙，使他感到很羞愧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice heaped coals of fire on。Mary's head by inviting her to a party after Mary had gossiped about her. 艾丽斯在玛丽说了她的坏话之后，邀请她参加晚会，使她惭愧。</font>\n
head to head	<font color=blue size=4>head to head</font>\n<br>face to face 面对面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were talking head to head. 我们面对面地促膝谈心。</font>\n
head up	<font color=blue size=4>head up</font>\n<br>1. serve or act as the head of; direct 指挥；领头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She heads up a staff of 50, half of them lawyers. 她领导了50名职员，其中一半是律师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Jones will head up the new business. 琼斯先生将领导这家新公司。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is the best person to head up this department? 谁领导这个系最适合？</font>\n<br>2. be at the head or front of 居首位；领头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The elephants headed up the whole parade. 大象走在整个队伍的最前列。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of my jobs at the newspaper office was to head up the page before it was printed. 我在报社的工作之一是在报纸印刷前给版面上加标题。</font>\n<br>3. have a source; originate 起源；发源\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This river heads up in the Tianshan Mountains. 这条河发源于天山山脉。</font>\n

hear from	<font color=blue size=4>hear from</font>\n<br>1. receive a letter from sb. 收到信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hears from his son every month. 他每个月都收到儿子来信。</font>\n<br>2. receive a reprimand from 受到…申斥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll hear from your father when he gets home. 你父亲回家后要责骂你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the maid didn't have dinner ready, she would hear from him. 如果女仆没有把晚饭准备好，她会受到他的训斥的。</font>\n
hear of	<font color=blue size=4>hear of</font>\n<br>1. know about; be told of; hear mention of 听到；听说\n<br>How did you hear of our product? \n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>你怎么听说我们的产品的？</font>\n<br>2. entertain the idea of; consent to; permit or listen to (usn. used in negative form) 听从；同意；准许；采纳（常用否定结构）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother just won't hear of such an idea. 母亲就是不同意这样的主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would not hear of his complaint. 我不想听他的抱怨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will not hear of you making a trip wirh him. 我不会准许你和他一起去旅行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers were demanded to start off, but none of them would hear of parting with the villagers. 战士们接到命令出发，但是他们当中没有人愿意离开老乡们。</font>\n
hear out	<font color=blue size=4>hear out</font>\n<br>listen to the end 听完；听到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's hear him out; don't interrupt him before he finishes telling the whole story. 让他把话讲完，事情没说完之前不要打断他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't judge the man guilty without at least hearing his story out. 你连这个人的话都没有听完，就不能判断他有罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We decided to hear him out before making any judgements on what he haddone. 我们决定先听他讲完，再判断他干了什么事。</font>\n
heart and soul	<font color=blue size=4>heart and soul</font>\n<br>eager love; strong feeling; great enthusiasm; wholly and eagerly 忠心；热情；全心全意地；尽心尽力地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should serve the people heart and soul. 我们应该全心全意地为人民服务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I played the piano, my heart and soul is in it. 当我弹钢琴时，我全身心地投入了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John plays tennis badly, but with heart and soul. 约翰网球打得不好，但他打得很认真。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wants a puppy with all her heart and soul. 她极想要一条小狗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were heart and soul against the new rules. 他们竭力反对那些新规则。</font>\n

heart of gold	<font color=blue size=4>heart of gold</font>\n<br>kind, generous, or forgiving nature 仁慈的心；心地宽厚；有一颗金子般的心；善良的心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a heart of gold. I never saw him angry at anyone. 他心地宽厚，我从没有见过他对任何人发过脾气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Brown is a rich woman with a heart of gold. 布朗太太是位慷慨好施的富有女士。</font>\n
heart of stone	<font color=blue size=4>heart of stone</font>\n<br>a nature without pity 心狠；铁石心肠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Smith has a heart of stone. He whipped his horse until it fell down. 史密斯先生真是心狠。他鞭打他的马直到它倒下为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He couldn't refuse her; he hasn't got a heart of stone. 他不能拒绝她，他不是冷酷无情的人。</font>\n
heart stand still	<font color=blue size=4>heart stand still</font>\n<br>be very frightened or worried 提心吊胆；惊恐至极；十分担心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her heart stood still when she saw her son run into the street in front of a car. 看到她儿子跑到街上一辆小汽车前面时她吓坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everybody's heart stood still when the President announced that war was declared. 总统宣战时每一个人都忧心忡忡。</font>\n
heart to heart	<font color=blue size=4>heart to heart</font>\n<br>speaking freely and seriously about sth. private without hiding anything 贴心地；坦城地；开诚布公地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For over an hour we sat there talking heart to heart. 我们坐在那儿开诚布公地谈了一个多小时。</font>\n
heat up	<font color=blue size=4>heat up</font>\n<br>1. make or become hot 使热；变热\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wanted my bath heated up a little more. 我要洗澡水再加热一点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you go into the kitchen and heat up some coffee? 请去厨房热些咖啡好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The room was rather cold when we arrived, but soon began to heat up. 我们到达时屋里很冷，但很快就热起来了。</font>\n<br>2. intensify; become intense 加剧；激化\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That year Hitler heated up the aggressive war in Europe. 那年希特勒在欧洲加紧进行侵略战争。</font>\n

help out	<font color=blue size=4>help out</font>\n<br>help in doing or getting; assist as much as possible; help sb. out of a difficulty 帮忙；尽力协助；帮助克服困难\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was only a young girl to help out in the kitchen. 厨房里只有一个年轻的女孩在帮忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On a number of occasions when we were short of staff we were helped out by retired members coming back on a parttime basis. 有几次我们缺少职工，就请退休人员回来做零活，帮帮忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've of ten helped Bob out when he's short of money. 鲍勃手头拮据时，我常常资助他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They helped us out a lot during those difficult months. 在那些困难的月份里他们帮了我们很多忙。</font>\n

help up	<font color=blue size=4>help up</font>\n<br>help sb. to get up; assist in rising; help sb. to take sth. up 扶起某人；帮某人把某物搬上去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rushed to halp the old man up when he slipped on the ice. 老人在冰上滑倒时，他跑过去把他扶了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please Help me up with this heavy case. 请帮我把这沉重的箱子搬上去。</font>\n<br>helped up encumbered 妨碍；打扰；拖累\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't run to catch the bus, as I was helped up with a lot of parcels. 我赶不上公共汽车，因为许多包袱拖累着我。</font>\n
hem and haw	<font color=blue size=4>hem and haw</font>\n<br>1. pause or hesitate while speaking often with little throat noises 哼哼哈哈的不置可否；哼哈声\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was a poor lecturer because he hemmed and hawed too much. 他不是个好的演讲者，因为他哼哼哈哈，停顿太多。</font>\n<br>2. avoid giving a direct and clear answer 避免作正面回答\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hems and haws and comes out on both sides of every question. 他避免作正面回答而对每一问题都采取模棱两可的态度。</font>\n
here and now	<font color=blue size=4>here and now</font>\n<br>1. at the present moment; without delay; immediately 现在；立刻；马上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's start our work here and now. 让我们立即开始工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How about beginning our lesson here and now? 我们现在就上课好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want my dime back and I want it here and now.我要我的一角钱，而且我马上就要。</font>\n<br>2. the present time and place ; today 此时此地；此刻；今天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He enjoys the pleasure of here and now and never worries about the future. 他及时行乐，从不担心未来的日子怎么过。</font>\n
here and there	<font color=blue size=4>here and there</font>\n<br>in one place and then in another 到处；好多地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I looked here and there for my dictionary, but couldn't find it. 我到处找我的词典，但却找不到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though there are spelling mistakes here and there, your composition as a whole is well written.虽然有几处拼写错误，但总的来说，你的作文写得不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can see flowers here and there when spring comes. 春天来时，我们四处可以看到花。</font>\n
high and dry	<font color=blue size=4>high and dry</font>\n<br>1. up above the water; beyond the reach of splashing or waves 在水面之上；在水溅不到的地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fishermen dragged the boats up high and dry on the shore. 渔民们把船拖上岸来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the tide went out the boat was high and dry. 退潮后船就搁浅了。</font>\n<br>2. without anyone to help; alone and with no help 孤立无援；与世隔绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old Jack lost his pension and was left high and dry. 杰克老头失去了养老金，落得无依无靠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first the other boys helped, but when the work got hard, Bob found himself high and dry. 起初有许多孩子帮忙，但是工作难度加大时，鲍勃发现只剩下自己孤立无援。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Realizing that he was now left high and dry, the enemy commander became so panicstricken that he began to tremble fr head to foot. 敌军看到自己陷入孤立无援的绝境，不禁惊恐万状，浑身打颤。</font>\n
high and low	<font color=blue size=4>high and low</font>\n<br>\n<br>1. everywhere; here and there 到处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The restaurant kitchen was so clean that the health inspector had to search high and low to find some dust. 饭店的厨房非常清洁，卫生检查员得到处寻找才能找到灰尘。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jeff had to look high and low for his high school English book. 杰夫不得不到处寻找他高中的英文书。</font>\n
high and mighty	<font color=blue size=4>high and mighty</font>\n<br>1. members of the higher social strata of society, esp. those who are haughty or arrogant 显赫人物 （尤指骄横者）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You think you are one of the high and mighty; remember pride goes before a fall.你以为你是显要人物了，但是不要忘记骄者必败。</font>\n<br>2. in an insolent, proud or arrogant manner 神气活现的；傲慢的；不可一世的；自以为了不起的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He acts so high and mighty; I despise him. 他太趾高气扬，我瞧不起他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of us are fed up with his high and mighty airs.我们大家都讨厌他那种傲慢态度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary became high and mighty when she won the prize.玛丽得奖后就变得不可一世。</font>\n
high time	<font color=blue size=4>high time</font>\n<br>time to do sth. 该是…时候了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is high time you started off. 是你该动身的时候了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now it's high time we were off. 现在我们该走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's high time he found a job. 他该找份工作干干了。</font>\n<br>hinge on/upon depend on as decisive; be decided by; according to 决定；视…而定；根据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All our hopes hinged on the firm's success. 我们的一切希望都取决于公司的成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A strawberry grower's income for the year may hinge on what the weather is like in a few summer weeks. 种植草莓者的年收入可能要视夏季数周的天气而定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The decision hinges on the result of the investigation.一切以调查的结果而定。</font>\n
hint at	<font color=blue size=4>hint at</font>\n<br>suggest sth. in an indirect way 暗示\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you hinting at? 你在暗示什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hinted at her resignation. 他暗示她辞职。</font>\n
hire on	<font color=blue size=4>hire on</font>\n<br>find or accept employment 找到工作；接受雇用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hired on as a clerk with the shop. 他受雇为该店的店员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Miss Wang has hired on as a secretary with the company. 王小姐已被该公司雇用为秘书。</font>\n
hire out	<font color=blue size=4>hire out</font>\n<br>1. accept a job; take employment 受聘；受雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the meantime he hired out as a lecturer in a university. 在此期间他受聘为一个大学的讲师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Farm labourers used to hire themselves out for the summer.农业工人通常整个夏天受雇佣。</font>\n<br>2. rent; allow to use in return for payment 出租\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He makes a living by hiring out tractors.他靠出租拖拉机为生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Is there any service of hiring out cameras by the hour? 有按小时计算出租照相机的服务吗？</font>\n
hit between the eyes	<font color=blue size=4>hit between the eyes</font>\n<br>make a strong impression on; sur prise greatly 留下深刻的印象；使大为惊讶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The acrobatic show was so wonder ful that it hit us right between the eyes. 杂技表演非常精彩，给我们留下了深刻的印象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a wonderfully lifelike pic ture and it hit Sol right between the eyes. 这是一幅非常美妙而逼真的照片，给索尔印象极深。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To learn that his parents had en dured poverty for his sake hit John between the eyes. 当得知他父母为他吃了很多苦时，他大为惊讶。</font>\n
hit it off	<font color=blue size=4>hit it off</font>\n<br>enjoy one another's company; be happy and comfortable in each other's presence 相处甚欢；气味相投\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John and Mary hit it off from the very beginning. 约翰和玛丽一开始就相处得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think those two will hit it off very well; both of them are too quick tempered and too prone to take offence. 我想那两个人不会相处得很好，他俩都太性急，都太容易生气。</font>\n
hit off	<font color=blue size=4>hit off</font>\n<br>1.imitate 模仿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am too stupid to hit off. 我很笨，不善模仿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He imitates voices, and can hit off some famous people beautifully. 他模仿别人的讲话声音，而且能把某些知名人物的讲话声音模仿得极象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He imitates animal calls and can hit off cows and sheep perfectly. 他会学动物叫，能逼真地模仿牛羊的叫声。</font>\n<br>2. represent or describe cleverly 巧妙地描绘出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his new book he hits off the American temperament with amazing insight. 在他的新书里他对美国人性格的描绘表现了惊人的观察力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I never saw a character in a novel so thoroughly hit off. 我从未见过小说里的人物被描写得如此淋漓尽致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can hit off a poem, though she is not educated. 她虽然没有受过学校教育，但能即席作诗。</font>\n<br>3. suit; be in harmony 适合；符合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your proposal hits off with our plan. 你的提议符合我们的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan hits off with the present conditions. 这个计划与目前的条件相符合。</font>\n
hit on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>hit on/upon</font>\n<br>1. discover or think of sth. by lucky chance 偶尔发现；偶然想到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At last someone hit upon another road through the mountains. 有人终于发现了另一条穿山路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scientist experimented for a long time before hitting upon the solution to his problem.这位科学家经过长期实验才偶然发现这个问题的解决方法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hit on a good idea. 我想出了一个好主意。</font>\n<br>2. choose by chance 碰巧选择\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hit on a business that was just starting to grow rapidly. 他刚好选择了一个正在开始迅速发展的行业。</font>\n
hit out	<font color=blue size=4>hit out</font>\n<br>1. strike with the fists 用拳猛击；猛打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was hitting out right and left at his assailants. 他左右开弓地回击攻击他的人。</font>\n<br>2. attack violently in words 抨击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government wants us to hit out against corruption. 政府要我们抨击腐败现象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager sat calmly and let his critics have their say, then he rose to his feet and in a spirited speech hit out at them.经理冷静地坐着听批评者的发言，接着他站起来，猛烈地回击了他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several news commentators hit out at the president on his foreign policy. 有几位时事评论员猛烈抨击总统的对外政策。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made a speech hitting out at racial discrimination.他做了一次演讲，猛烈地抨击种族歧视。</font>\n
hit the mark	<font color=blue size=4>hit the mark</font>\n<br>attain one's object; succeed 达到目的；成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My brother hit the mark when he purchased a quantity of cotton cloth just before the rise in the market. 我弟弟刚好赶在市场涨价之前购进一批棉布，赚了大钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your answer just hit the mark. 你的答案正好击中要害。</font>\n
hit the nail on the head	<font color=blue size=4>hit the nail on the head</font>\n<br>get sth. exactly right; speak or act in the most fitting or effective way 语言中肯；一针见血；恰到好处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher hit the nail on the head when he said Bell's chief fault was vanity. 老师说比尔的主要毛病是好虚荣，这实在是一针见血。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your criticism really hits the nail on the head. 你的批评恰到好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Mayor's talk on race relations hit the nail on the head.市长谈论种族关系时语言中肯。</font>\n
hold against	<font color=blue size=4>hold against</font>\n<br>blame; put the blame on 责备；因…认为某人不好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can hold his failure against him because he never tried for a passing grade. 他的失败怪他自己，因为他从来连及格的分数都不努力争取。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you hold it against Mary that she divorced you? 玛丽和你离婚，你认为是玛丽不好吗？</font>\n
hold back	<font color=blue size=4>hold back</font>\n<br>1. keep sth./sb.in place; prevent from 阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Police horses were used to hold back the crowd. 警方的马队被用来阻止群众。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I had not held him back, he would have beaten you soundly. 要不是我阻止了他，他一定把你痛打一顿。</font>\n<br>2. restrain oneself; control (sth. such as a feeling) 克制；抑制（表情）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim held back his anger and avoided a fight. 吉姆忍住了怒气，避免了一场斗殴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so impatient that I could not hold him back. 他非常急躁，我制止不了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I held myself back from saying a word. 我克制自己不说一个字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though very angry, I held back from telling him exactly what I thought.虽然非常生气，但我能克制，未把我的真实想法告诉他。</font>\n<br>3. delay 拖延\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Heavy rain on the road held us back. 路遇大雨我们耽搁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't hold the meal back for more than half an hour to wait for you. 我们不能因为等你而把开饭时间推迟半小时以上。</font>\n<br>4. retain possession of; keep back 保有；扣留\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He held the money back from his client.他把钱扣下不给当事人。</font>\n<br>5. keep from (advancing to the next grade, stage, level, etc.) 阻止（前进）；使留在（原级、原阶段、原水平等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one can hold back the wheel of history.谁也不能阻止历史车轮前进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You show promise as a musician but your lack of practice is holding you back. 你有希望成为音乐家，但你懒于练习，使你毫无进展。</font>\n<br>6. stay back or away; show unwillingness; remain behind 走开；退缩；畏缩不前；犹豫不定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When danger appeared, every one of them held back. 当出现危险时，他们中每一个人都退缩了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must never hold back before difficulties. 我们在困难面前决不退缩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is very shy; she always holds back when we invite her to a party. 她很害差，我们请她去聚会时，她总是犹豫不决。</font>\n<br>7. conceal; keep (a secret, etc.) to oneself 隐瞒；保守（秘密等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told me most of the facts of the affair, but I'm sure he's still holding back some important in formation. 他对我讲了那件事的大部分情况，但我相信他仍保留了一些重要的东西没有告诉我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't hold anything back from us; we want to know the whole story. 你不应有所隐瞒，我们要知道全部事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could tell from his nervousness that he was holding back. 看他局促不安的样子，我就知道他心里隐瞒了什么事。</font>\n
hold by	<font color=blue size=4>hold by</font>\n<br>1. adhere to; accept 坚持；接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll hold by our decision.我们将坚持我们的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always holds by his own opinion. 他总是坚持他自己的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't hold by such foolish ideas. 我不接受这类愚蠢的想法。</font>\n<br>2. support; approve of 支持；扶助；赞成；允许\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he did not hold by us, he honoured us.虽然他没有支持我们，但是他尊重我们。</font>\n
hold down	<font color=blue size=4>hold down</font>\n<br>1. control or limit the freedom of; keep in obedience 压制；使服从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Kings used to know very well how to hold down the people. 国王很了解如何使人民服从他们。</font>\n<br>2. keep on the ground or in place 固定在地上或原地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police held the man down to prevent him escaping. 警察把这人按倒在地上以防他逃跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must hold the tents down because of the strong wind. 风很大，我们必须把帐篷固定住。</font>\n<br>3. work satisfactorily at; keep (a job) 顺利地工作；保住（工作）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Wang has held down the tough job for a long time. 王先生干这份艰苦的工作已经很长时间了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to be unable to hold any job down. 似乎他什么工作都保不住。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My father holds down quite a good job in the university. 我爸爸在这所大学有份相当好的工作。</font>\n<br>4.restrain; check;control; keep at a low level 压制；压低；控制；缩减\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hold down the noise！将声音放低一点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These measures helped to hold down traffic accidents. 这些措施有助于减少交通事故。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Bob gets mad, you can't hold him down. 鲍勃发火的时候，你无法控制他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should hold down our expenditure. 我们应该压缩开支。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Last year we had to hold down the enrolment because of the cuts in the grants. 由于补助金减少，我们去年不得不压缩招生人数。</font>\n<br>5.take care of 照应；照料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her neighbour held down her family duties while she was out on an errand. 她出差期间，她的邻居料理她的家务。</font>\n
hold forth	<font color=blue size=4>hold forth</font>\n<br>1.offer; propose 提出（供）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager held forth a promise of advancement to the more success ful salesmen. 经理提出了要提拔成绩突出的推销员的诺言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have no idea to hold forth. 我没有什么意见可提。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director held forth a way to do the job. 主任提供了一种方法去做这工作。</font>\n<br>2.speak at length 高谈阔论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker held forth on the same theme for at least two hours. 演讲者就同一话题至少讲了有两个钟头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was holding forth on free trade. 他在高谈阔论自由贸易问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When we entered the auditorium, the speaker was holding forth on the shortcomings of the young students. 当我们进入大礼堂时，演讲者正在谈论青年学生的缺点。</font>\n<br>3. take place 举行；发生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In winter, the three northeastern provinces of our country are a region where a great variety of winter sports hold forth. 在冬季，我国东北3省是举行各种各样冬季体育活动的好地方。</font>\n<br>hold good/true for remain valid; effective 有效；适用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firm's promise holds good for all its products. 该公司的承诺对其各种产品均有效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These rules should hold good in many cases.这些规章制度应当在许多情况下都适用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The contract holds good for five years. 这合同有效期为5年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your remarks do not hold good in this case. 你的话在这种场合不适合。</font>\n
hold in	<font color=blue size=4>hold in</font>\n<br>1. control or restrain 控制；抑制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your horse is going too fast; you must hold it in. 你的马跑得太快了，你得勒住些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My mother is good at holding in her emotions. 我母亲很善于克制自己的感情。</font>\n<br>2. contain oneself; exercise restraint 忍耐；克制自己\n<br>He was raging inside, but held himself in for fear of saying something he would regret.\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>他内心很生气，不过他忍着，生怕说出他会后悔的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wanted to speak up but thought better of it and held in. 他真想开口说话，但仔细想想还是忍住了。</font>\n
hold/keep one's temper	<font color=blue size=4>hold/keep one's temper</font>\n<br>make oneself quiet and peaceful; not become angry 平静；不生气；不激动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting would have gone smoothly if the director had kept his temper. 要是主任不激动的话，那个会议本来是会开得顺利的。</font>\n
hold off	<font color=blue size=4>hold off</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) remain at a distance; be aloof（使）拉开距离；（使）不接近；疏远；冷漠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His cold manner holds people off. 他的冷漠态度使人不敢接近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Finally he came to realize it was his haughtiness that held people off. 他终于意识到是他的傲慢态度使人不敢同他接近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Flynn holds off from everybody. I think he is shy. 弗林先生远离大家。我想他是害羞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship held off from the shore because of dangerous crosswinds.由于危险的侧风，船没有靠岸。</font>\n<br>2. delay; postpone 拖延；延期\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As so many different ideas were put forward, they had to hold off making the decision there and then. 因为各种各样的意见提了一大堆，所以他们当场只好不作决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack held off paying for the television set until the dealer fixed it. 杰克拖延到商家把电视机装好才付钱。</font>\n<br>3. resist 抵抗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our task is to hold off the enemy's attack for a few hours.我们的任务是将敌军的进攻抵挡住几小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police had difficulty in holding the fans off when the popstar was getting in the car. 当那位流行歌星上汽车时，警察费了很大劲儿才把歌迷们阻挡住。</font>\n<br>4. fail to appear（天气）未出现；拖延\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain held off for the whole morning, although we had all expected a storm. 虽然我们都预料到要有一场暴雨，但整个上午都没有下下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather forecast predicts that the rain will hold off till this evening. 天气预报说这场雨要到今天晚上才会下。</font>\n
hold on	<font color=blue size=4>hold on</font>\n<br>1. grasp; hold tightly to sth. 抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hold on to my hand while we cross the street. 过马路时，抓住我的手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's pretty windy. You'd better hold on to your hat. 风很大，你最好抓住你的帽子。</font>\n<br>2. continue; go on 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We held on our way. 我们继续赶路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rain held on steadily all afternoon.雨下了整整一个下午。</font>\n<br>3. wait and not hang up a telephone（电话）别挂掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he left the telephone to find a pencil, he asked me to hold on. 离开电话找铅笔的时候，他让我别挂掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Could you hold on a minute? 你能等一会儿，不要挂掉电话好吗？</font>\n<br>4. keep on with a business or job in spite of difficulties; endure 不顾困难继续经营；继续坚持；忍受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was hard to keep the store going during the depression, but he held on and at last met with success. 经济不景气时生意很难维持，但是他继续经营，最后终于成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he can just hold on a little longer, we can get help to him. 如果他能再坚持一会儿，我们就可以帮助他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers held on in that isolated position for more than two hours.战士们孤军奋战，坚持了两个多小时。</font>\n<br>5. wait a minute; stop (usu. used as a command) 等一下；停止（常用于命令式）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hold on！I can't hear what you are saying. 等一等！我听不清楚你在说什么。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just hold on a second while I get my breath back. 等一下，让我喘口气。</font>\n
hold one's breath	<font color=blue size=4>hold one's breath</font>\n<br>1. cease breathing for a short time 屏息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We held our breath when listening to her song, 我们屏息听她唱歌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The race was so close that everyone was holding his breath at the fin ish. 赛跑竞争激烈，快到终点时每个人都屏息着。</font>\n<br>2. endure great anxiety, nervousness or excitement 忍受着忧虑、紧张或感到兴奋\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He held his breath for days before he got word that he was accepted by that college. 在那所大学录取他之前，他紧张忧虑了好些天。</font>\n
hold one's ground	<font color=blue size=4>hold one's ground</font>\n<br>maintain one's position; refuse to retreat or surrender 坚持自己的地位或立场；不让步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Throughout the debate he firmly held his ground and won out in the end. 在整个辩论中，他坚持一步不让，终于得胜了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our troops held the ground bravely. 我们的部队勇敢地坚守阵地。</font>\n
hold one's own	<font color=blue size=4>hold one's own</font>\n<br>maintain one's position and be equal to it, usn. under stress 守住阵地；坚持立场；没有失败（失利、 恶化）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a skilled debater, and can hold his own against any opponent. 他是个熟练的辩论家，能在任何对手面前坚持自己的立场，从不失败。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary had a hard time after the operation, but soon she was holding her own. 玛莉手术后身体很弱，但很快她就康复了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's parents have never worried about him; even as a small boy he proved that he could hold his own in any situation.约翰的父母亲从不为他担心，甚至在他还是一个小男孩时，就显示他在任何情况下都能挺得住。</font>\n
hold one's peace	<font color=blue size=4>hold one's peace</font>\n<br>be silent and not speak against sth. ; keep quiet 沉默不发表意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I did not agree with the manager, but held my peace as he was rather angry. 我不同意经理的意见，但是由于他很生气，我只好保持沉默。</font>\n
hold one's tongue	<font color=blue size=4>hold one's tongue</font>\n<br>remain silent; say nothing of what one knows 保持沉默；守口如瓶；住嘴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better hold your tongue. 你最好不要开口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If people would hold their tongues from unkind speech, fewer people would be hurt.人们如果都能保持不饶舌，很多人就不会受到伤害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Hold your tongue！”he said. “住嘴！”他说。</font>\n
hold on to/onto	<font color=blue size=4>hold on to/onto</font>\n<br>1. hold tightly 抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hold on to my arm on this icy surface. 过有冰的路面时抓牢我的胳膊。</font>\n<br>2.stick to 坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we believe something is true and good we should hold on to it. 如果我们认为某事既真又好就应该坚持下去。</font>\n<br>3. stay in control of 控制；抑制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was so frightened that I had to hold on to myself not to scream. 我非常害怕以致于不得不控制自己不尖叫出声。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very angry but he had to hold on to his temper. 他非常气愤但又不得不控制自己不发脾气。</font>\n
hold out	<font color=blue size=4>hold out</font>\n<br>1. stretch forward; extend 延伸；伸出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were ready to hold out a friendly hand. 他们准备伸出友谊之手。</font>\nHold your arms out. 将两臂伸出。\n<br>2.offer (usu. promise, hope, likelihood, etc.) 提供（允诺、希望、可能性等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These were the promises they held out. 这些是他们许下的诺言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can hold out no hope of the invalid recovering. 我认为这位病人康复无望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some hope was held out by the chairman that the financial position of the company would improve. 董事长认为，该公司的财政情况有好转的希望。</font>\n<br>3. prove to be sufficient 够用；能维持（下去）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How long will our supplies hold out? 我们的给养能维持多久？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will stay in Maxico as long as my money holds out. 只要我的钱够用，我将一直呆在墨西哥。</font>\n<br>4. continue to operate 继续运转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think the engine will hold out till we get home, then I can have it seen to. 我想这发动机可继续工作到我们回到家，然后我可检查一下。</font>\n<br>5. resist; continue in spite of diffi culties 抵抗；（不畏困难地）继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town was surrounded, but the citizens held out until help at last came. 城市被围困，但居民们能顽强坚持到最后得救。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sailor held out against the strong wind and big waves for two days and nights. 这水手在大风大浪中挺了两天两夜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The regiment held out against the enemy until reinforcements ar rived. 这个团坚持顶住敌人直到增援部队的到来。</font>\n<br>6. survive; last 生存；坚持\nWe must hurry, because the trapped miner cannot hold out much longer. 我们得快点，受困的矿工不能再坚持多久了。\n<br>7. refuse to agree or settle (until one's wishes have been agreed to) 拒绝同意或妥协（直到某人的要求被接受）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The strikers held out for a raise of five cents an hour. 罢工者坚持要求每小时提高工资5美分决不妥协。</font>\n
hold over	<font color=blue size=4>hold over</font>\n<br>1. postpone 延期；推迟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting was held over until next week. 会议延期到下一周。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's hold the matter over until the next meeting, because it's too late to begin a discussion on it now. 咱们把这个问题推迟到下次会上再讨论吧，现在太晚了，不能对这个问题展开讨论了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The directors held over their decision until they could get more in formation.董事会决定延期，等到有更多的信息时再作决定。</font>\n<br>2. continue or keep until a later time 期满后继续延长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are going to hold that movie over for another week. 他们打算延长一周继续放映那部电影。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old treasurer held over for six months when the new treasurer died suddenly. 新任会计突然死亡，老会计继续留任6个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Miss Wang will hold over till a successor is appointed.王小姐将留任到继任者上任为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actors cannot be held over without additional pay. 不付额外工资演员们是不可能超期再演出的。</font>\n<br>3.keep 保存\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please hold over the rest of the goods. 请保存其余货物。</font>\n<br>4. threaten; use…as a threat 以某事威胁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is holding my past record over me. 他用我过去的档案记载来威胁我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He knows I have been to prison and is holding it over me. 他知道我坐过牢，就以此要挟我。</font>\n<br>hold still remain quiet; not move 静止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can I take your picture if you don't hold still? 如果你不安静下来，我怎么能给你照相呢？</font>\n
hold to	<font color=blue size=4>hold to</font>\n<br>1. abide by or adhere to 坚持；固守\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whatever your argument, I'll hold to my decision. 不管你有什么理由，我将坚持我的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He held to everything he said at the meeting despite the fact that several persons contradicted him. 他不顾好几个人反对，坚持他在会上的发言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy held to his explanation; he would not admit it was wrong.那* 男孩坚持他的解释，不承认那是错的。</font>\n<br>2. insist that one keep (a promise or a bargain, etc.) 坚持要某人执行（允诺、契约等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has made a bargain, and I shall hold him to it. 他已讲好了条件，我要坚持让他履行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've made such a promise, and should be held to it. 你们既然作了这样的允诺，就必须履行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“You can have the car when I go abroad. ”“I'll hold you to that. ”“我出国时，你可以使用我的汽车。”“希望你说话算数。”</font>\n<br>3. seize 抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm was so severe that even the sailors had to hold to the ropes. 风暴特大，就是水手也得抓住绳索。</font>\n<br>hold up 1.support; raise 举起；抬；拿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My husband has lost so much weight that he has to wear a belt to hold his thousers up.我丈夫体重减了好多，他只好用根带子把裤子提起来。</font>\n<br>2. prove true; prove effective or accurate 证明属实；证明准确、正确\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police were doubtful at first, but that worker's story held up. 警察起初怀疑，但那位工人的叙述证明情况属实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather forecasts don't always hold up. 天气预报并不总是那么准确。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The contract will hold up for ten years. 这合同有效期10年。</font>\n<br>3. remain good; not get worse 保持不衰；不坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sales held up well. 销售情况不衰。</font>\n<br>4. support; keep from falling 承受住；不倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry. The house will hold up.别担心，房子不会倒下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chair was too weak to hold you up. 这椅子不牢，经受不住你的体重。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How does he hold up under such a responsibility? 他怎么能承受住这么大的责任？</font>\n<br>5. keep up 跟得上；不掉队\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though it was a long walk, the youngsters held up until the last minute. 虽然这是长途跋涉，但是孩子们一直跟到最后，没有掉队。</font>\n<br>6. keep one's courage or spirit up; remain calm; keep control of oneself 振作精神；稳定情绪；自己控制自己\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grieving mother held up for her children's sake. 这位伤心的母亲为了孩子们在控制自己的情绪。</font>\n<br>7. stop for a short time; delay 暂时停止；停顿；延续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman held up the traffic to allow pedestrians to cross the road. 警察挡住车辆让行人过街。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Work on the building site has been held up by bad weather. 由于天气恶劣，建筑工地上的作业被延误了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were held up for nearly an hour on our way by the traffic accident. 我们在路上被交通事故耽搁近一个小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The steel strike may hold up production for several months, 钢铁工人的罢工会使生产停顿数月之久。</font>\n<br>8. rob 抢劫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminals held up the plane and took all the passengers'money. 这些歹徒劫持了飞机，并将乘客的钱财洗劫一空。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That bank has been held up threetimes. 那家银行被抢了3次。</font>\n<br>9. show…as an example 提出（作为榜样）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was held up to the students as a model of emulation.他被提出来作为学生的楷模。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our English teacher held up excellent models of composition for her class to imitate. 我们的英语老师在班上展出了优秀作文让同学们模仿。</font>\n<br>10. last; maintain in a state 持续；维持；坚持；挺住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think the car will just about hold up till we reach London.我认为这辆车能差不多正好让我们开到伦敦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Black holds up very well, in spite of all the trouble and illness he's had. 布莱克先生尽管遇到了许多麻烦而且又生病，但是他挺住了，过得不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smith's bank could hardly hold up in the depression 史密斯的银行在经济箫条期间很难坚持下去。</font>\n
hold water	<font color=blue size=4>hold water</font>\n<br>prove true; stand testing; bear examination 证明是正确的；经得起考验；站得住脚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>None of his arguments seemed to me to hold water. 我觉得他的论点一条也站不住脚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It sounds a good idea but onlywhen we try it out can we see if it holds water.这个主意听上去不错，不过，只有通过实践才能知道它是否是正确的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His argument can hold water all right. 他的论点很有道理。</font>\n
hold with	<font color=blue size=4>hold with</font>\n<br>1. be in agreement with; approve of 同意；赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't hold with his pessimistic views. 我不同意他的悲观看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hold with you that young people should dare to think, dare to speak and dare to act. 我同意你的看法，年轻人应该敢想、敢说、敢干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We do not hold with heavy drinking and wild parties. 我们不赞成酗酒和放荡的聚会。</font>\n<br>2. tolerate; forgive 容忍；原谅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I won't hold with such lawless acts. 我不能原谅这种目无法纪的行为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is so insupportable that even his wife can't hold with him. 他实在不能让人容忍，连他的妻子都不能原谅他。</font>\n
hold…in place	<font color=blue size=4>hold…in place</font>\n<br>keep… sticking together in the original place 保持（原地）不动；固定（在原地）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trees would hold the soil in place and prevent erosion.树林可以固定土壤，防止侵蚀。</font>\n
hope for	<font color=blue size=4>hope for</font>\n<br>expect and desire 希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men have been hoping for a rise.工人们一直希望增加工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In this we hope for your help. 在这件事上，我们希望得到你的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's hope for the best and prepare for the worst. 让我们作最好的打算，作最坏的准备。</font>\n
hot air	<font color=blue size=4>hot air</font>\n<br>exaggerated talk; unproven idea 夸张的谈话；吹牛；胡说八道\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He thinks and talks as if he knows everything, but he really doesn't; he's full of hot air. 他思考问题和谈话就好象他什么都知道一样，其实不然，他全是胡说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one likes a person who thinks very highly of his own opinions but is really full of hot air.把自己的意见看得十分高明而其实是在吹牛的人，谁都不喜欢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's speech was just a lot of hot air because he didn't really know what he was talking about. 约翰的演讲简直是吹牛，因为他根本就不知道他在讲些什么。</font>\n
hunt down	<font color=blue size=4>hunt down</font>\n<br>1. look for; persue and find 搜寻；追捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police were hunting down an escaped prisoner. 警察正在追捕一个逃犯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The offender was finally hunted down. 那个犯人终于被捕获归案。</font>\n<br>2. search for sth. until one finds it 寻找直到发现为止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Jones hunted down the written manuscript in the Library of Congress. 琼斯教授在国会图书馆找到了那份手稿。</font>\n
hunt for	<font color=blue size=4>hunt for</font>\n<br>1. chase and try to obtain 追踪；追猎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's on holiday in Africa, hunting for animals. 他在非洲度假，捕猎动物。</font>\n<br>2. search for 搜求；寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hunted for my lost pen. 我到处寻找我丢失的笔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They hunted high and low for the missing will. 他们到处寻找那份失踪的遗嘱。</font>\n
hunt up	<font color=blue size=4>hunt up</font>\n<br>search for (sth. hidden or difficult to find) 寻找；搜寻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor is hunting up the names of several Chinese herbs in the botanical dictionary. 这位医生正在植物学词典里查找几种中草药的学名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is hunting up references for his writing. 她正在寻找写作的参考数据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where did you hunt all those details. up? 你是在哪儿查明所有那些细节的？</font>\n
hurry on with	<font color=blue size=4>hurry on with</font>\n<br>make haste with 匆忙处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As time was limited, the teacher hurried on with the lecture.由于时间有限，老师匆忙地把课讲完了。</font>\n
hurry up	<font color=blue size=4>hurry up</font>\n<br>move or do sth. faster 赶快；快点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prnduction can be hurried up but we'll lose quality. 生产可以赶上去，但是质量却会下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hurried up his meal to catch the train. 他匆忙吃完饭去赶火车。</font>\n
hush up	<font color=blue size=4>hush up</font>\n<br>keep from getting out; prevent from knowing about 秘而不宣；隐藏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They did their best to hush the whole thing up. 他们尽力隐瞒整个事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to hush up the scandal, but news soon leaked out. 他们设法隐瞒这件丑闻，但是消息很快就走露了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible for them to hush up the news, which has already spread all over the city. 他们想封锁那则消息是不可能的，已经传得满城风雨了。</font>\n
ic other words	<font color=blue size=4>ic other words</font>\n<br>saying it in another way; expressing the abovementioned idea in another form 换言之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In other words, much thinking yields wisdom. 换句话说，多想出智慧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been working too much, and is not at all well. In other words, he needs a good rest. 他一直很劳累，身体很不好。换句话说，他需要彻底的休息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He became, in other words, a great hero. 换句话说，他变成了一个了不起的英雄。</font>\n
idle about/around	<font color=blue size=4>idle about/around</font>\n<br>move about in a lazy way 懒散；到处闲逛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not bear to see those idling about. 他看不惯那些懒懒散散的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His father asked him to stop idling about and do something useful. 他爸爸要他别再闲逛，而要做些有益的事情。</font>\n
idle away	<font color=blue size=4>idle away</font>\n<br>waste 浪费（掉）；荒废\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He idled away his entire vacation. 整个假期他都虚度了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should not idle away your time, but should make every minute count. 你不该白白浪费时间，而应该把分分秒秒都利用起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been idling his time away on the beach, lying around and doing nothing.他一直躺在海边，无所事事，白白浪费时间。</font>\n
ignorant of	<font color=blue size=4>ignorant of</font>\n<br> (of person) knowing little or nothing about; not aware of 无知识的；不知道的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am completely ignorant of his intentions. 我对他的企图全然不知。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is ignorant of English. 他不懂英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was ignorant of the fact. 他不了解事实。</font>\n
ih hand	<font color=blue size=4>ih hand</font>\n<br>1. available for use（手头）有；现有的；可支配的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I still have some money in hand. 我手头还有些钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom figured that his cash in hand with his weekly pay would be enough to buy a car. 汤姆算了一下，他手头的钱加上周薪够买车了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have only got ten minutes left in hand, so I must conclude my talk with a brief summary. 我只有10分钟了，因此我只能简单地归纳一下来结束我的讲话。</font>\n<br>2. in process; being worked on 在进行中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work is in hand, but not finished. 工作在进行中，还没完成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should finish the work we have in hand before we begin something new. 在开始新工作之前，我们应先完成正在做的工作。</font>\n<br>3. under control 控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The principal was happy to find that the new teacher had her class in hand. 校长高兴地发现新老师已将她的班级管理好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police now have the situation well in hand, and no further outbreaks are expected. 警方现在已经控制了局面，不会再有什么事情发生。</font>\n
ill at ease	<font color=blue size=4>ill at ease</font>\n<br>not feeling at ease or comfortable;anxious; worried; unhappy 紧张不安；焦虑；不愉快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This made me ill at ease. 这使我局促不安。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she first went to the dancing school, she was ill at ease, not knowing what to do. 当她第一天到舞蹈学校时，紧张得不知所措。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the news he seemed ill at ease. 听到这消息他似乎显得不安。</font>\n
immerse in	<font color=blue size=4>immerse in</font>\n<br>1. involve deeply 陷入；埋头于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is immersed in the study of English. 他潜心攻读英语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though they were immersed in difficultier, they were still in high spirits. 虽然他们陷于重重困难，但仍然情绪高涨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He immersed himself in sorrow. 他陷于悲伤之中。</font>\n<br>2. put under the surface of (water or other liquid) 浸入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She immersed her head in the water.她把头浸入水中。</font>\n
impose on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>impose on/upon</font>\n<br>1. place (a tax, duty, etc.) on 把 （税、任务等）加到…上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must per form the task that has been imposed upon me. 我必须完成我所承担的任务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>New duties were imposed on wines and spirits. 酒类被加征新税。</font>\n<br>2. force…on; force the acceptance of 强加；强迫…接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don'try to impose your wishes on us. 不要企图把你的意志强加到我们头上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He imposed his opinion on me.他把他的意见强加于我。</font>\n<br>3. deceive; cheat; trick 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are not to be imposed upon. 我们是不会上当的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was too wise to be imposed upon by fair words spoken without sincerity. 他很聪明，不会被花言巧语所骗。</font>\n<br>4. try to get more than offered 要求过份；得寸进尺；利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't you think you are imposing on your neighbor when you use his telephone for half an hour? 邻居的电话你一用就是半个小时，你不觉得太过份了吗？</font>\n
improve on	<font color=blue size=4>improve on</font>\n<br>make better 改进；改善；改良\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am unable to im prove on his suggestion. 我提不出比他更好的建议了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This method is better, but can still be im proved upon. 这个方法是好多了，但还可以改进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made good marks the first year, but she thought she could improve on them. 她第1年成绩很好，但她认为还可以更好。</font>\n
in a body	<font color=blue size=4>in a body</font>\n<br>all together; as a group 全体\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They moved forward in a body. 他们全体向前进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They resigned in a body. 他们集体辞职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The delegates came into the assembly hall in a body. 代表们一起步入会议大厅。</font>\n
in accordance with	<font color=blue size=4>in accordance with</font>\n<br>1.in conformity with 同…一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is in accordance with reason. 这是合乎情理的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His words are not in accordance with common sense. 他的话不符合常识。</font>\n<br>2. according to 根据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did not act in accordance with the orders. 他没有遵照命令办事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is done in accordance with the instructions of the principal.这是依照校长指示做的。</font>\n
in accord with	<font color=blue size=4>in accord with</font>\n<br>in agreement with 同…一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His actions are not in accord with his words. 他言行不一。</font>\n
in a circle	<font color=blue size=4>in a circle</font>\n<br>without any progress 无进展；无结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seemed to be working hard, but was. just running around in a cir cle. 他似乎工作很努力，但还是干不出什么结果来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee debated for two hours, just talking in circles.委员会辩论了两个小时，但仍然毫无结果。</font>\n
in addition to	<font color=blue size=4>in addition to</font>\n<br>besides 除…之外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In addition to English, he has to study a second foreign language. 除英语外，他还得学门第2外语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In addition to a large collection of scientific works in Chinese, our library contains many scientific books in foreign languages. 我们图书馆除了藏有大批中文科技书籍之外，还有许多外文科技书籍。</font>\n
in advance	<font color=blue size=4>in advance</font>\n<br>beforehand 事先；预先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please pay five yuan in advance.请预付人民币5元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She received one month's salary in advance.她预支了一个月的工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He registered for the examination well in advance. 他早就报名应试了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory fulfilled the state production plan one month in advance. 这个工厂提前一个月完成国家生产计划。</font>\n
in advance of	<font color=blue size=4>in advance of</font>\n<br>1.in front of 在…前面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came well in advance of the rest of the group. 他来的比组里其他人早得多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She walked in advance of her husband. 她走在她丈夫前面。</font>\n<br>2. superior to; further developed 优于；较…进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In some respects we are far in advance of our neighbouring countries. 在某些方面，我们比邻国进步得多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Galileo's ideas were in advance of the age in which he lived. 伽利略的想法超越了他所生活的时代。</font>\n

in an attempt to	<font color=blue size=4>in an attempt to</font>\n<br>in an effort to 为了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her father sent her to the warm south in an attempt to restore her health. 她父亲把她送往温暖的南方，希望她恢复健康。</font>\n
in and out	<font color=blue size=4>in and out</font>\n<br>1. coming in and going out often 进进出出；来来去去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no hope for Jim. He's been in and out of prison for ten years running. 吉姆没希望了，他进出监狱已连续 10年之久了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very busy Saturday and was in and out all day. 星期六他非常忙碌，终日进进出出忙个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's always in and out of hospital. 他时常生病住院。</font>\n<br>2. thoroughly; completely 彻底地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We know each other in and out. 我们彼此非常了解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He understands his business in and out. 他对自己的业务非常熟悉。</font>\n

in anticipation	<font color=blue size=4>in anticipation</font>\n<br>expected; awaited; prepared for 预期；期待；预备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have a journey to the White Mountains in anticipation.我预计将到白山旅游。</font>\n
in anticipation of	<font color=blue size=4>in anticipation of</font>\n<br>in expectation of; in view of 期望；预期；鉴于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All troops have been mobilized in anticipation of the coming war.全军动员以应付即将来临的战争。</font>\n
