in any case/event	<font color=blue size=4>in any case/event</font>\n<br>at all events; whatever happens 无论如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In any event I'll call you before I make a final decision. 不管怎样，我在作出最后决定前会打电话给你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In any case, you must get here no later than five o'clock, 无论如何，你务必5点钟前到达这里。</font>\n
in a/one word 1	<font color=blue size=4>in a/one word 1</font>\n<br>in summary; in short 总而言之；简言之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a word, if we want to do our work well, we must make preparations carefully.总之，如果我们想把工作做好，就要好好准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a word, matters are going from bad to worse.总之，情况越来越坏。</font>\n<br>In a word, while the prospects are bright, the road has twists and turns. 总之，前途是光明的，道路是曲折的。 in a/one word 2\n<br>to sum up briefly 简言之；总之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a word, I have no objection. 总之，我不反对。</font>\n
in a second	<font color=blue size=4>in a second</font>\n<br>in the briefest time 立刻；不一会儿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you shout in the valley, and in a second the echo will come from the hillside with great distinctness. 如果你在山谷中大叫一声，不一会儿就能听到从山边传来非常清楚的回音。</font>\n
in a sense	<font color=blue size=4>in a sense</font>\n<br>in a way; in one respect 在某种意义上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you say is true in a sense. 你所说的在某种意义上是对的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a sense, arithmetic is a language. 从某种意义上说，算术是一种语言。</font>\n
in a way	<font color=blue size=4>in a way</font>\n<br>1. to a certain extent; a little; somewhat 在某种程度上；有几分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your composition is well done in a way. 你的作文在某种程度上写得很成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I like Jane in a way, but she doesn't like me. 我在某种程度上喜欢简，但是她不喜欢我。</font>\n<br>2.in one thing 就一方面而论；从一方面看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a way, it is an important book. 从某一方面来说，这是本重要的书。</font>\n<br>3. agitated; much concerned 激动；忧虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Smith is in a way about his son's misbehavior.史密斯先生对于他儿子的不良行为颇为焦虑。</font>\n
in black and white	<font color=blue size=4>in black and white</font>\n<br>in print or writing; written on paper 印刷；书写；白纸黑字\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They insisted on having the agree ment written down in black and white. 他们坚持要把协议用白纸黑字写下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must have your statement in black and white. 你得把你的声明写下来。</font>\n
in brief	<font color=blue size=4>in brief</font>\n<br>in short; briefly 简（而）言之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a long letter, but in brief, he says“No. ” 这是封长信，但简单地说，他就是“不同意。”</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave in brief the story of the storm.他扼要地谈了风暴的情况。</font>\n
in case	<font color=blue size=4>in case</font>\n<br>if 如果；若\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In case he arrives be fore I get back, please ask him to wait. 如果我回来前他就到了，请叫他等我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In case it rains, do not expect me. 如果天下雨，就不要指望我来了。</font>\n<br>in case of in the event of; as for 要是；在… 时（候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In case of fire, the alarm bell. 如遇火灾，即按警铃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In case of any difficulty, call me at once. 如有任何困难，立即找我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In case of illness, you must consult a doctor. 假使有病，你必须请医生诊治。</font>\n
in charge (of) 	<font color=blue size=4>in charge (of) </font>\n<br>having the care or management 负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is in charge here? 谁是这儿的负责人？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll take this affair in charge. 他将主管这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Chen is in charge of scientific research in our department. 陈教授负责我们系的科研工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a teacher in charge of our class. 他是负责我们班的老师。</font>\n
in check	<font color=blue size=4>in check</font>\n<br>held back; controlled 在控制中；被阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I advise you to hold your temper in check. 奉劝你不要发脾气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary couldn't hold her feelings in check any longer and began to cry. 玛丽再也控制不了她的感情而哭了起来。</font>\n
in chief	<font color=blue size=4>in chief</font>\n<br>1. at the head; in or having the highest place or authority 居首；有最高之权位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was a commander in chief. 他过去是总司令。</font>\n<br>2. most of all; especially 主要；尤其\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has many good points but in chief his modesty. 他有很多优点，其中最主要的是他很谦虚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did it for many reasons, and this one is in chief. 他所以这样做，原因很多，这个原因是最主要的。</font>\n
in cold blood	<font color=blue size=4>in cold blood</font>\n<br>cruelly; ruthlessly 残酷地；残忍地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dictator, in cold blood, or dered the execution of all his ene mies. 那位独裁者残酷地下令将他所有的敌人处死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The robbers shot in cold blood ev erybody who was in their way. 抢劫者残忍地枪杀了所有阻挡他们的人。</font>\n
in common	<font color=blue size=4>in common</font>\n<br>1. shared equally 相同；相似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have very little in common in our taste. 我们的嗜好相同处很少。</font>\n<br>2. for or by all 共有的；公用的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have everything in common.我们什么都是共享的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have a kitchen in common.我们的厨房是共享的。</font>\n
in common with	<font color=blue size=4>in common with</font>\n<br>in the same way as; like 相同；相似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He believed, in common with the majority, that it was true. 他同多数人一样，认为那是真的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have nothing in common with each other. 他们之间毫无共同之处。</font>\n
in comparison with	<font color=blue size=4>in comparison with</font>\n<br>when compared with 同…比较\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Yangzhou is much smaller in comparison with Beijing. 扬州同北京比起来小多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tallest buildings in London are small in comparison with the skyscrapers in New York. 同纽约的摩天大楼比较，伦敦的最高建筑物还是算矮的。</font>\n
in compliance with	<font color=blue size=4>in compliance with</font>\n<br>complying with 听从；依从；按照\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She gave up the idea compliance with her parents'desire. 她依从父母的愿望放弃了自己的想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They will set up another middle school in this area in compliance with the wishes of the people. 他们将根据人们的愿望在这一地区再另建一所中学。</font>\n
in conclusion	<font color=blue size=4>in conclusion</font>\n<br>lastly 最后；在结束时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In conclusion, I world like to thank you for your coming to the meeting.最后，我对各位出席这次会议表示感谢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In conclusion, I'd like to say how much I've enjoyed staying in your beautiful country.最后，我想说说我呆在你们这个美丽的国家里是多么愉快。</font>\n
in condition	<font color=blue size=4>in condition</font>\n<br>in good health; physically fit 健康状况良好；身体条件适合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People who take part in sports must keep in condition.参加体育锻炼的人健康状况一定是好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must train regularly to be in condition.你应该经常锻炼以保持良好的体魄。</font>\n
in confidence	<font color=blue size=4>in confidence</font>\n<br>secretly; privately 秘密地；私下地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm telling you this in confidence; please don't tell anyone else.这件事我只告诉你一个人，请别告诉别人。</font>\n
in conformity with	<font color=blue size=4>in conformity with</font>\n<br>in agreement, accordance or harmony with; according to; in obedience to; in compliance with 同意；遵照；依据；听从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His action was in conformity with the law. 他的行为是合法的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All these are entirely in con formity with the interests and aspirations of the people of our two countries. 这一切完全符合我们两国人民的利益和愿望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should build our country in conformity with the principle of achieving greater, faster, better and more economical results. 我们应按照多、快、好、省的原则建设我们的国家。</font>\n
in conjunction with	<font color=blue size=4>in conjunction with</font>\n<br>together with 与…共同；连用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He runs a store in conjunction with his relative. 他同亲戚共同经营一家商店。</font>\n
in connection with	<font color=blue size=4>in connection with</font>\n<br>regarding; relating to 关于；同…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked many questions in connection with life in Britain. 他问了许多有关英国生活的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting is in connection with a proposal to construct a new swimmingpool. 这个会议是讨论一项建造新游泳池的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are working on the project in connection with another firm. 我们正与另一家公司共同建设这项工程。</font>\n<br>in consequence as a result; therefore 结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His conduct was bad, in consequen ce, he was dismissed. 他行为不轨，因而被开除了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You studied hard, and in consequence you passed the test. 你学习很努力，所以考试通过了。</font>\n
in consequence of	<font color=blue size=4>in consequence of</font>\n<br>as a result of 由于…原因\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In consequence of the deep snow, school will not open today. 由于雪很深，学校今天停课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In consequence of your bad behaviour I'm forced to dismiss you. 由于你行为不轨，我只好解雇你。</font>\n
in consideration of	<font color=blue size=4>in consideration of</font>\n<br>1. after thinking about and weighing; in view of; because of 考虑到；由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In consideration of the boy's young age, the judge did not put him in jail for carrying a gun. 考虑到这小孩尚年轻，法官不因他携枪而判他入狱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They didn't give him heavy work in consideration of his youth. 鉴于他年幼，他们不给他繁重的工作。</font>\n<br>2. in return for 报酬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We paid him well in consideration of his labour. 我们给他优厚的工资，作为他的劳动报酬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In consideration of the extra work he had done, his boss gave him extra pay. 考虑到他做了额外的工作，他的老板付给他额外的酬金。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I presented him with a Chinese painting in consideration of his assistance. 我送给他一幅中国画以酬谢他的帮助。</font>\n<br>\n<br>in (the) course of\n<br>in process of; during the process or progress of 正在…之中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The railway is now in course of construction. 那条铁路正在建造之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He happened, in course of conversation, to say that he had the intention of visiting China. 在谈话中，他碰巧提到他有意访问中国。</font>\n
in debt (to) 	<font color=blue size=4>in debt (to) </font>\n<br>owing 欠…的债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in debt to all his friends. 他欠所有朋友的债。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is heavily in debt. 他债台高筑。</font>\n
independent of	<font color=blue size=4>independent of</font>\n<br>not relying on others 独立于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wants to be independent of his parents. 他想离开父母独立。</font>\n
in detail	<font color=blue size=4>in detail</font>\n<br>minutely 详细地；详尽地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There isn't time to explain in detail. 没有时间详细阐述。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher explained the text in detail. 老师详细解释了课文。</font>\n
indifferent to	<font color=blue size=4>indifferent to</font>\n<br>having no feeling for 对…漠不关心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is indifferent to the sufferings of others. 他对别人的苦难漠不关心。</font>\n
indispensable to	<font color=blue size=4>indispensable to</font>\n<br>absolutely necessary to 对…不可缺少的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Clearness and precision are indispensable to a good style of writing. 明晰和精确是文体优美的作品所不可缺少的。</font>\n
in due time	<font color=blue size=4>in due time</font>\n<br>at the exact time 及时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He arrived in due time. 他及时赶到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Spring and summer will arrive in due time. 春季夏季会适时来临的。</font>\n
in earnest	<font color=blue size=4>in earnest</font>\n<br>serious (ly) 认真的／地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her parents thought the girl was joking when she said she wanted to be a scientist, but she was in earnest. 这女孩说她想当一名科学家，她父母认为她是在开玩笑，但她却是认真的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Surely you are not in earnest in saying that, are you? 你说那话不是当真的，是吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you say it in earnest? 你那样讲是当真的吗？</font>\n
in effect	<font color=blue size=4>in effect</font>\n<br>1. in fact 实际上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two methods are in effect identical. 这两种方法实际上是一样的。</font>\n<br>2. (of law) become active（法律）生效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These regulations are still effect. 这些规定仍然有效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The law remains in effect. 这条法律仍然有效。</font>\n
in error	<font color=blue size=4>in error</font>\n<br>mistaken; wrong 弄错\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has sent the book to you in error. 他把书错寄给你了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You were in error in assuming that he would wait for us. 你误以为他会等我们。</font>\n
in essence	<font color=blue size=4>in essence</font>\n<br>in its nature; as a matter of fact 在本质上；实质上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In essence, both proposals are much the same. 这两个建议实质上是差不多的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Officially he is in charge, but in fact his secretary does all the work. 从职位上讲是他负责，但实际上，他的秘书做所有的工作。</font>\n
in evidence	<font color=blue size=4>in evidence</font>\n<br>easily seen 明显；显而易见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's the sort of woman who likes to be very much in evidence. 她是个特爱出风头的女人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smith was nowhere in evidence. 史密斯无论在何处都不惹人注意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tulips are blooming; spring was in evidence. 郁金香盛开，春天显然到了。</font>\n
in exchange (for) 	<font color=blue size=4>in exchange (for) </font>\n<br>exchanging for（以…）交换\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I gave him my used textbooks and received a dictionary in exchange. 我把旧课本给了他，换得了一本字典。</font>\n
in existence	<font color=blue size=4>in existence</font>\n<br>existing 现有（的）；存在的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is the largest ship in existence. 这是现有的最大的船。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many species of animals which once lived on the earth are no longer in existence. 有许多动物曾一度在地球上生存过，但今天已不复存在了。</font>\n
in fact	<font color=blue size=4>in fact</font>\n<br>actually; really; indeed 实际上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think so; in fact, I'm quite sure. 我想是这样，事实上我十分相信是这样。</font>\n
in favour of	<font color=blue size=4>in favour of</font>\n<br>1. in support of 赞成；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you in favour of the proposal? 你赞成这个建议吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students were in favour of reform. 学生们都赞成改革。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone in the class voted in favour of the dancing party. 班里的每个人都投票赞成开舞会。</font>\n<br>2. to the advantage of; helping 有利于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The evidence is in favour of the defendant. 证据对被告有利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Price control would gradually dis appear in favour of a free market. 价格控制将逐渐消失而代之以利伯维尔场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The law is in favour of the poor people. 这条法律有利于穷苦人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prices are in buyers' favor. 价格对买主有利。</font>\n<br>3. be paid to 支付；以…为收款人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cheques should be drawn in favour of the treasurer. 开支票应以会计为收款人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please make out your checks in favour of the corporation. 开支票时，请写明本公司为收款人。</font>\n
inferior to	<font color=blue size=4>inferior to</font>\n<br>worse than 劣于…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Woman is inferior to man in running. 讲赛跑，女人不如男人。</font>\n
in force	<font color=blue size=4>in force</font>\n<br>1. have power; become law 生效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The system of conscription has been in force for many years. 征兵制度已经实行好多年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The treaty shall remain in force for a period of ten years. 这条约的有效期为10年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>New timetable is in force. 新的时间表现在生效。</font>\n<br>2. a great number of; in a large group 大批；大量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy is in force behind the hill. 敌人在山后集结了大量兵力。</font>\n
inform…of	<font color=blue size=4>inform…of</font>\n<br>tell 告诉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you informed them of your intended departure? 你已经把准备离开的事告诉他们了吗？</font>\n
in front of	<font color=blue size=4>in front of</font>\n<br>before 在…的前面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A large tree stands in front of his house. 他的房前长有一棵大树。</font>\n
in full	<font color=blue size=4>in full</font>\n<br>completely 完全地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please write your name in full. 请把你的全名写出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please describe the matter in full. 请把事情详细说说。</font>\n<br>They accomplished the task in full. 他们圆满地完成了这项任务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech was published in full in all the papers yesterday. 昨天各家报纸全文刊登了他的讲话。</font>\n
in full swing	<font color=blue size=4>in full swing</font>\n<br>at the maximum point of activity 紧张（积极）进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The negotiations are in full swing. 谈判正在紧张地进行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he arrived, the meeting was already in full swing. 当他到那里的时候，会议正开得很热烈。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A mass campaign to plant trees is in full swing. 一场群众性植树运动正在轰轰烈烈地进行。</font>\n
in fun/for fun	<font color=blue size=4>in fun/for fun</font>\n<br>as a joke; playfully; not seriously 开玩笑的；非认真的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I said it only in fun. 我说这话不过是开玩笑的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be angry; I only said so for fun. 请不要生气，我这样说只是为了开个玩笑。</font>\n
in general	<font color=blue size=4>in general</font>\n<br>1. as a rule; usually 通常；照例\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In general, your suggestion is good. 你的建议总的来说是好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am speaking of students in general. 我说的是一般学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather in Florida is warm in general. 佛罗里达的天气通常是温暖的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In general, the bus is here by 9 a.m. 通常公共汽车是9点前到达这里。</font>\n<br>2. for the most part; in most cases 大多数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Boys in general like outdoor sports more than girls do. 大多数男孩比女孩爱好户外运动。</font>\n
in good order	<font color=blue size=4>in good order</font>\n<br>systematically arranged（放置）整齐地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She kept everything in the room in good order. 她把房间收拾得井然有序。</font>\n
in good time	<font color=blue size=4>in good time</font>\n<br>1. on time 准时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We arrived in good time. 我们准时到达。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students finished their school work in good time. 学生们按时完成了作业。</font>\n<br>2. immediately 赶快；立即\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get the letter off in good time. 赶快把这封信寄出去。</font>\n
in (great) demand	<font color=blue size=4>in (great) demand</font>\n<br>much sought after 大量需要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The goods are much in demand in winter. 这种物品冬季需求量很大。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Oil is in great demand these days. 现在非常需要石油。</font>\n
in half	<font color=blue size=4>in half</font>\n<br>in two; into halves 分成两半\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party is likely to split in half. 这个党有可能分裂成两派。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cake was cut in half. 饼子被切成了两半。</font>\n
in high spirits	<font color=blue size=4>in high spirits</font>\n<br>in a joyous mood 高兴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of us were in high spirits when we heard the good news. 听到那则好消息，我们大家都很高兴。</font>\n
in honour of	<font color=blue size=4>in honour of</font>\n<br>as an honour to; for showing respect or thanks to 尊敬；向…表示敬意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We celebrate Mother's Day in honour of our mothers. 我们庆祝母亲节是对母亲表示敬意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city dedicated a monument in honour of the general. 该市为对这位将军表示敬意建造了一个纪念碑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A great banquet was held in honour of our distinguished guests. 我们为贵宾举行了一次盛大的宴会。</font>\n
in keeping with	<font color=blue size=4>in keeping with</font>\n<br>according to; consistent with 按照；协调（一致）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good man's actions are in keeping with his promises. 正直人的言行一致。</font>\n
in large quantities	<font color=blue size=4>in large quantities</font>\n<br>in a large amount 大量地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He buys cotton in large quantities. 他买进大量棉花。</font>\n
in line with	<font color=blue size=4>in line with</font>\n<br>in agreement with 符合；根据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In line with the customs of the school, the students had a holiday between Christmas and New Year's Day. 根据学校的惯例，在圣诞节和新年期间学生放假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Students often work in factories in line with the Party's policy of combining education with productive labour. 根据党的教育与生产劳动相结合的方针，学生们常常去工厂劳动。</font>\n
in (me) course of time	<font color=blue size=4>in (me) course of time</font>\n<br>in the progress of time 迟早；终有一日\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you study hard, you'll learn English well in course of time. 如果你努力学习，最终你一定能掌握英语。</font>\n
in memory of	<font color=blue size=4>in memory of</font>\n<br>keeping alive the memory（为）纪念\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are going to erect a monument in memory of the men who laid down their lives in defense of their country. 他们将树碑纪念为保卫祖国而献身的人们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A monument has been erected in memory of their beloved teacher. 为了纪念他们敬爱的老师，他们已经树起了一块纪念碑。</font>\n
in name	<font color=blue size=4>in name</font>\n<br>in appearance or by title 名义上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is the president of the association only in name. 她只不过是这个协会的名义上的主席。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man is a doctor in name only. He does not have patients now. 这位老人仅仅是挂空名的医生。目前他没有任何病人。</font>\n
in need	<font color=blue size=4>in need</font>\n<br>in poverty; in difficulty 在贫困中；在困难中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A friend in need is a friend indeed. 患难朋友才是真朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in great need. 他非常贫穷。</font>\n
in no mood	<font color=blue size=4>in no mood</font>\n<br>not inclined 没有心情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am in no mood to make up a story about Santa Claus. 我没有心情编造一个关于圣诞老人的故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She seems worried about something and is in no mood for joking today. 她今天象是惦记着什么事情似的，没有心思说笑。</font>\n
in no sense	<font color=blue size=4>in no sense</font>\n<br>not at all 并不；毫不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The older boy is in no sense wiser than the younger one. 那个岁数大的男孩一点也不比那个岁数小的聪明。</font>\n
in no time	<font color=blue size=4>in no time</font>\n<br>very quickly; very soon 很快地；不久\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With a pair of scissors, she can turn out a beautiful design in no time. 用一把剪刀，她可以立即剪出一个美丽的花样来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take this medicine, and it will cure you in no time. 吃了这种药，你的病马上就会好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They finished the work in no time at all. 他们立刻完成了这项工作。</font>\n
in no way	<font color=blue size=4>in no way</font>\n<br>under no circumstances; never 决不；并不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your plan is in no way different from ours. 你们的计划与我们的计划并没有什么不同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in no way superior to me in knowledge. 他在知识方面并不比我强。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is in no way to blame. 她完全不应该受责备。</font>\n
in no wise	<font color=blue size=4>in no wise</font>\n<br>by no means; in no manner 毫不；绝不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has in no wise changed his opinion. 他丝毫没有改变他的看法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll in no wise lose his reward. 他决不会失去他应得的报酬。</font>\n
in number	<font color=blue size=4>in number</font>\n<br>in sum total; altogether 总计；共计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One's bosom friends are always few in number. 知己的朋友总是很少的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were ten in number. 我们一共10人。</font>\n
in obedience to	<font color=blue size=4>in obedience to</font>\n<br>obeying 服从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should act in obedience to the decisions of the Party organization. 你必须服从党组织的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Soldiers act in obedience, to the orders of their officers. 士兵们总是服从军官命令的。</font>\n
in one's own way	<font color=blue size=4>in one's own way</font>\n<br>in one's own manner; freely 按自己的方式；自由地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They can act in their own way. 他们可以按自己的办法行事。</font>\n
in opposition to	<font color=blue size=4>in opposition to</font>\n<br>opposite to 反对；同…相反（的）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he has done is in opposition to his wishes. 他事与愿违。</font>\n
in order	<font color=blue size=4>in order</font>\n<br>having sth. neatly arranged 整理好；井然有序；保持整洁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The books are kept in alphabetical order. 这些书是以字母顺序放好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put his papers in order before he left the office. 离开办公室前，他把文件整理好。</font>\n
in order that/to	<font color=blue size=4>in order that/to</font>\n<br>for the purpose of 为了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come early in order that you may see him. 要想见到他，你就得早来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran in order to catch the train. 他跑着赶这趟火车。</font>\n
in parallel with	<font color=blue size=4>in parallel with</font>\n<br> (of lines) continuing at the same distance from one another（线条）彼此平行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trees stand in parallel with the road. 树长得与路平行。</font>\n
in part	<font color=blue size=4>in part</font>\n<br>partly; to an extent 部分地；（在）某种程度（上）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His success is in part owing to luck. 他的成功在某种程度上是由于走运。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is in part your own fault that you have failed. 你的失败有一部分是你自己的过错造成的。</font>\n
in particular	<font color=blue size=4>in particular</font>\n<br>especially 特别地；尤其是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I remember one of them in particular. 我特别记住了他们之中的一位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am interested in stories in general, and in detective stories in particular. 我总的来说对小说感兴趣，尤其是对侦探小说感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you doing anything in particular tonight? 你今晚有什么特别的事要做吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are so many books here. Why do you like that one in particular? 这里有这么多书，你为什么特别喜欢那一本？</font>\n
in person	<font color=blue size=4>in person</font>\n<br>personally 亲自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you apply for the position by letter or in person? 你申请那个工作是亲自去还是写信去？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't attend the meeting in person, but I'll send someone to speak for me. 我不能亲自出席会议，但是我将派人替我发言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better go and speak to him in person. 你最好亲自去跟他谈。</font>\n
in place	<font color=blue size=4>in place</font>\n<br>1. in correct order or position（在）适当的（位置）；各得其所\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She likes to have everything in place. 她喜欢把什么事都安排得井井有条。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please take a look and see if everything is in place. 请看看是否一切都安排妥当了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please put all the books in place on the shelf after you finish reading them. 看完书后请放回书架原处。</font>\n<br>2. suitable 适当的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't think your suggestion is quite in place. 我们认为你的建议不很恰当。</font>\n
in plenty	<font color=blue size=4>in plenty</font>\n<br>as much as or more than is needed; a large number of 富裕；充足；大量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are good books in plenty. 有大量的优秀书籍。</font>\n
in point of fact	<font color=blue size=4>in point of fact</font>\n<br>indeed; truly; really 事实上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She told you she'd seen it, but in point of fact, she wasn't really there. 她告诉你说她亲眼看到此事，实际上她根本不在场。</font>\n
in possession of	<font color=blue size=4>in possession of</font>\n<br>having or controlling; occupying 占有；具有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old professor is in possession of many books. 这位老教授拥有大量的书籍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our library is in possession of several sets of encyclopaedias. 我们图书馆存有好几部百科全书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter is in possession of the house which belonged to his father. 彼得现在占用原来属于他父亲的房子。</font>\n
in practice	<font color=blue size=4>in practice</font>\n<br>1. practising; in fact 实践中；实际上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have rich experience in practice. 他们有丰富的实践经验。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your idea sounds good but will it work in practice? 你的主意很好，但它能实现吗？</font>\n<br>2. in proper condition to do sth. well through practice 在不断练习中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The iceskater keeps in practice by skating every day. 这位溜冰者每天练习溜冰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A pianist gets his fingers in practice by playing scales. 钢琴家练习音节，磨练手指的灵活。</font>\n
in praise of	<font color=blue size=4>in praise of</font>\n<br>praising 赞扬；表扬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Much has been said in praise of our monitor. 人们说了许多赞扬我们班长的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone of us spoke in praise of her heroism. 我们大家都赞扬她的英雄行为。</font>\n
in principle	<font color=blue size=4>in principle</font>\n<br>as a general rule; as a matter of principle 大体上；原则上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I agree with you in principle. 我原则上同意你的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This, in principle, is a good project, but we need to go further into the details. 这个计划大体上是好的，但在细节方面我们还得作进一步的推敲。</font>\n
in private	<font color=blue size=4>in private</font>\n<br>privately; secretly 私人地；秘密地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish to talk to you in private. 我想同你私下谈谈。</font>\n
in proportion to	<font color=blue size=4>in proportion to</font>\n<br>in relation to the degree 与…成比例\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Each man's pay will be in proportion to his work. 每个人的报酬将与其工作成比例。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His expenditure is not in proportion to his income. 他的支出与收入不平衡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house is tall in proportion to its width. 按照宽度来说这房子是很高的。</font>\n
in proximity to	<font color=blue size=4>in proximity to</font>\n<br>near to 接近；靠近；临近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His house is in close proximity to a park. 他的住宅毗邻公园。</font>\n
in public	<font color=blue size=4>in public</font>\n<br>openly; publicly 公开地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't quarrel with each other in public, will you? 不要在大庭广众之下吵架，好不好？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is nervous in public. 他在公开场合很紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't like to speak in public. 他不愿当众讲话。</font>\n
in pursuit of	<font color=blue size=4>in pursuit of</font>\n<br>act of pursuing 追求；追赶；追捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They immediately set out in pursuit of the enemy. 他们立即出动，追击敌人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police car raced through the streets in pursuit of another car. 警车在街上急驰，追赶另一辆汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He does it in pursuit of health. 他为了健康而做这事。</font>\n
in question	<font color=blue size=4>in question</font>\n<br>under consideration or discussion 正被谈论或考虑的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where is the man in question? 刚刚谈到的这个人在哪儿？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Here are the two students in question. 这就是我们所谈到的两个学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book in question was published in 1990. 该书是1990年出版的。</font>\n
inquire about	<font color=blue size=4>inquire about</font>\n<br>try to get information about 打听消息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Newspaper reporters have been inquiring about the missing child. 报纸记者们一直在打听那位失踪小孩的下落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wants to inquire about his luggage. 他想查问他的行李。</font>\n
inquire after	<font color=blue size=4>inquire after</font>\n<br>ask politely about sb. 's health 问好；问安\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher inquired after your health. 老师问起了你的健康情况。</font>\n<br>He asked me to inquire after you.\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>他要我问候你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He inquired after me with solicitude. 他关心地向我问好。</font>\n
inquire for	<font color=blue size=4>inquire for</font>\n<br>1. ask to meet sb. 欲见某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She inquires for the manager. 她要求见经理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>someone came here to inquire for you today. 今天有人来求见你。</font>\n<br>2. ask about sb. 's health 问候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My mother asked me to inquire for you. 我母亲要我问候你。</font>\n<br>3. ask 问\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He inquired for the way to the station. 他问到车站去的路。</font>\n<br>4. ask for 要；寻求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is inquiring for a copy of English grammar. 她要一本英语语法书。</font>\n
inquire into	<font color=blue size=4>inquire into</font>\n<br>try to discover the fact of 调查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police are inquiring into the matter. 警察正在调查此事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They inquired into the matter rather thoroughly. 他们彻底调查了这件事。</font>\n
inquire of	<font color=blue size=4>inquire of</font>\n<br>seek information by questioning 向…询问；探询\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We inquired the way of a farmer. 我们向一农夫问路。</font>\n
in reality	<font color=blue size=4>in reality</font>\n<br>actually; in fact 实际上；其实\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She looks about thirty, but in reality she's nearly forty. 她看上去大约30岁，但实际上她快40岁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This may seem a bad thing, but in reality it is a good thing. 这看起来是坏事，其实是好事。</font>\n
in reason	<font color=blue size=4>in reason</font>\n<br>1. reasonable 正当的；合情合理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We will give serious consideration to anything in reason that he suggests. 对他提的建议，只要合情合理我们都愿意慎重考虑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will do anything in reason. 只要是合情合理的事我都愿意去做。</font>\n<br>2. within sensible limits 道理上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They cannot, in reason, doubt what he says. 在道理上，他们不能怀疑他所说的话。</font>\n
in reply to	<font color=blue size=4>in reply to</font>\n<br>in answer to 答复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What did you say in reply to his suggestion? 你怎么答复他的建议的？</font>\n
in reserve	<font color=blue size=4>in reserve</font>\n<br>put aside for future use 保存起来；储备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They keep grain in reserve for emergencies. 他们存粮以备急用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spent some of his money and kept the rest in reserve. 他花了一部分钱，余款存了起来。</font>\n
in response to	<font color=blue size=4>in response to</font>\n<br>in reply to 应…的；为回答…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He contributed one hundred dollars in response to my request. 他应我的请求而捐了100美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many young people have volunteered to reclaim the remote regions of their motherland in response to the call of the Party. 许多青年人响应党的号召自愿去开垦祖国的边远地区。</font>\n
in return (for) 	<font color=blue size=4>in return (for) </font>\n<br>as repayment; as a reward 回报；作为报酬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope I can be of some servise to you in return. 但愿我能为你做点事作为报答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What can we do for them in return for all the help they have given us? 我们将怎样来报答他们所给我们的种种帮助呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I gave him some books in return for his assistance. 我给了他一些书，作为对他所提供的帮助的回报。</font>\n
in ruins	<font color=blue size=4>in ruins</font>\n<br>broken to pieces 变成废墟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Berlin was in ruins after World War Ⅱ. 二次大战后，柏林一片废墟。</font>\n
ins and outs	<font color=blue size=4>ins and outs</font>\n<br>all the details 详细情形\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George knew all the ins and outs of the case. 乔治知道案件的详细情形。</font>\n
in sb's favour	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's favour</font>\n<br>in a way that is good for sb.;to sb. 's advantage 对某人有益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob made good grades in high school, and that was in his favour when he looked for a job. 鲍勃在中学时成绩优秀，这在他找工作时，对他有利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People always make in ferences in her favour. 人们常作出有利于她的推断。</font>\n
in sb's line	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's line</font>\n<br>such as one likes; be accustomed to; be capable of 内行；在行；适合；擅长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Storekeeping is not in my lines. 开店与我性情不合。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may make a speech or write a poem, but such things are not in my line. 你可以演说或写诗，但这些不是我的特长。</font>\n
in sb's power	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's power</font>\n<br>possible or practicable for sb. 在某人的能力或权限内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will do all in my power to help you. 我一定尽力帮助你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not in my power to grant you the loan of five thousand dollars. 我无权给你5000美元的贷款。</font>\n
in sb's shoes	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's shoes</font>\n<br>in sb. 's situation 处于某人之地位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't be in your shoes for all the wealth in the world. 给我世界上所有的财富，我也不愿处于你那个地位。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I were in your shoes I'd ask for more money. 如果我处于你的地位，我会要更多的钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's always in debt; I wouldn't be in his shoes for anything. 他总是向别人借钱，我无论如何不愿过他那种日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Supposing you put yourself in his shoes, would you have behaved differently in the circumstances? 假如你处在他的位子上，在那种情况下你会做得和他不一样吗？</font>\n
in sb's view	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's view</font>\n<br>according to sb. 's opinion 在…看来；依…之见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In my view, there is much oil here. 依我看，这儿石油很多。</font>\n
in sb's way	<font color=blue size=4>in sb's way</font>\n<br>1. within reach; likely to be met; before sb. 可及；可得到；在眼前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chance to work for a printer was put in my way. 一个在印刷厂工作的机会摆在我面前。</font>\n<br>2. in sb. 's path as a hindrance; placed so as to block the way 妨碍；阻碍；挡路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A big tree had fallen across the street and was in our way as we drove. 一棵大树倒在大街上，挡住了我们的路，车开不过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My son is always getting in my way. 我儿子总是妨碍我。</font>\n
in search of	<font color=blue size=4>in search of</font>\n<br>seeking or looking for; in pursuit of 寻找；追寻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are in search of a typist. 我们在招聘一名打字员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prospecting team traversed far and wide in search of mineral deposits. 地质勘探队为寻找矿藏走遍四面八方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went out to Australia in search of gold. 他们去澳大利亚淘金。</font>\n
in season	<font color=blue size=4>in season</font>\n<br>1. at the time of a year when sth. is plentiful 盛产季节；旺季；正当时令\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fruit is cheapest in season. 水果旺季时，价格最便宜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Native watermelons will be in season soon. 地产西瓜就要上市了。</font>\n<br>2. at the right time 恰好的时候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I arrived in season for the examination. 我及时赶上考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spoke a word in season to me. 他及时地劝导了我。</font>\n
in short	<font color=blue size=4>in short</font>\n<br>in brief 简言之；总之\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In short, he is a promising young man and has a bright future. 总之，他是一个有希望、有前途的青年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In short, we must be prepared. 总之，我们要有所准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In short, finishing the job is not so easy as you may think. 总之，完成这工作不是你想象的那么容易。</font>\n
inside out	<font color=blue size=4>inside out</font>\n<br>1. upside down 翻过来；倒过去；里在外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wind blew Mary's umbrella inside out. 风把玛丽的伞吹得翻过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was wearing his coat inside out. 他把衣服反穿着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I turned my trouser pockets inside out but could not find the piece of paper with the address. 我把裤子口袋翻过来也没有找到留有地址的那张条子。</font>\n<br>2. perfectly; completely 完全地；彻底地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He knew his trade inside out. 他对他的业务了如指掌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since he knows the problem inside out, he has more say on it that I do. 他对这个问题了解得很清楚，因此，他比我更有发言权。</font>\n
in sight	<font color=blue size=4>in sight</font>\n<br>visible; able to be seen; within sight 看得见；出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was not a ship in sight. 看不到一只船。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A ship came in sight from the horizon. 天际出现了一条船。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peace is now in sight. 现在和平有望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With success in sight they all felt jubilant. 成功在望，他们都欢天喜地。</font>\n
in sight of	<font color=blue size=4>in sight of</font>\n<br>where one can see or be seen by 在看得见的地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were in sight of land. 我们已看见陆地了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll soon be in sight of Tian An Men. 你就要看见天安门了。</font>\n
in silence	<font color=blue size=4>in silence</font>\n<br>speechlessly; soundlessly 默不作声地；静悄悄地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They looked at each other in silence. 他们默不作声地相互对视。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As night fell, everything was in silence. 夜幕降临，一切静悄悄。</font>\n
insist on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>insist on/upon</font>\n<br>1. declare firmly 坚持；坚决认为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Throughout the trial, the prisoner insisted on his lack of guilt. 在整个审讯中，犯人坚持认为他没有罪。</font>\n<br>2. urge; strongly demand 坚决要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He insisted upon a doctor being sent for. 他坚持要去请医生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I insisted on paying for my share of the meal. 我坚持要付我的那份饭钱。</font>\n<br>3. make emphatically or repeat an assertion 主张；强调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He insisted on the importance of being punctual. 他强调准时的重要性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is a gentleman who insists on seeing you. 有一位先生坚持要见你。</font>\n
in so far as	<font color=blue size=4>in so far as</font>\n<br>to the extent that; to the point that 就…而言；视…而定；在…范围内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In so far as the report is concerned, I have already had it copied. 至于那份报告，我已经将它复印了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In so far as the definitions of some obscure expressions are concerned, there may still be a few inaccuracies in this dictionary. 就某些疑难词组的释义来说，这本词典可能还有一些不够准确的地方。</font>\n
in so many words	<font color=blue size=4>in so many words</font>\n<br>in a frank manner 明确地；直截了当地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He refused my invitation in so many words. 他明确地拒绝了我的邀请。</font>\n
in spirit	<font color=blue size=4>in spirit</font>\n<br>inwardly; in one's thoughts or imagination 在精神上或思想上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I in spirit flew into the sky. 我在想象中飞入了天空。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am beside you in spirit. 我在想象中在你身旁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My friend couldn't come to my birthday party, but she said she would be there in spirit. 我朋友不能来参加我的生日宴会，但她说她在想象中将和我们在一起。</font>\n
in spirits	<font color=blue size=4>in spirits</font>\n<br>in a good humor; laughing and joking 和颜悦色；兴高采烈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always in spirits. 他总是兴高采烈的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was in low spirits because he failed in the exam. 她情绪不好，因为她考试不及格。</font>\n
in spite of	<font color=blue size=4>in spite of</font>\n<br>despite; not withstanding; regardless of 不管；不顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of the bad storm John delivered his papers on time. 虽然天下暴雨，约翰仍按时投递报纸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of the rainy weather, the streets were full of people on May Day. 五一节那天，尽管下雨，街上还是挤满了人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeded in the end in spite of the immense difficulties. 尽管困难重重，他最终还是成功了。</font>\n
in spite of oneself	<font color=blue size=4>in spite of oneself</font>\n<br>not withstanding one's own efforts 尽管有所努力；情不自禁；不由自主地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the sight of his little sister dressed up for the play in the role of an old woman he laughed aloud in spite of himself. 看到自己的小妹妹扮演剧中老太大的角色，他情不自禁地哈哈大笑起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On hearing the news, the poor old man cried in spite of himself. 听到这消息，这位可怜的老人不由自主地哭起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On hearing the joke, they all laughed in spite of themselves. 听了这个笑话，他们全都情不自禁地笑了起来。</font>\n
instead of	<font color=blue size=4>instead of</font>\n<br>in place of; rather than 代替；而不是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shall we have fish instead of meat today? 我们今天吃鱼不吃肉好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will go instead of you. 我将代替你去。</font>\n
in stock	<font color=blue size=4>in stock</font>\n<br>available 有现货\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The store had no more red shoes in stock, so Mary chose brown ones instead. 店里红色的鞋子无货，所以玛丽选了双棕色的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We do not have a shirt of your size in stock now, but we can order it for you. 你这种尺码的衬衣我们现在无货，但我们可以为你定购一件。</font>\n
in store	<font color=blue size=4>in store</font>\n<br>1. about to happen; waiting 必将来到或发生；等候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What does the future hold in store for the boy who ran away? 等待那外逃男孩的前途是什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't know what is in store for us. 我们不知自己将来的遭遇如何。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he was arrested by the enemy, he knew perfectly well what was in store for him, but he remained calm. 遭到敌人逮捕时，他清楚地知道等待着他的是什么，但他还是非常沉着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope a bright future is in store for you. 我希望光明的前途在等着你。</font>\n<br>2. saved for future use 备用；贮藏着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are many other energy sources in store. 有待开发的能源还有好多种。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the electricity goes off, we have candles in store. 如果停电，我们备有蜡烛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better keep some of these in store for next year. 我们最好把这些东西贮藏一些待明年使用。</font>\n
in style	<font color=blue size=4>in style</font>\n<br>fashionable 时髦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A welltailored suit it always in style. 做工好的衣服总是时髦的。</font>\n
in substance	<font color=blue size=4>in substance</font>\n<br>1. in important fact; in the main or basic parts 主要地；大体上；基本上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two cars are the same in substance, except one is red and the other is red and white. 这两部车除了一部是红的，另一部是红白色的，其它大体相同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I agree in substance with what you say, but differ on some small points. 我大体上同意你所说的，但在一些细节问题上与你的意见还有不同之处。</font>\n<br>2. actually; really 实在地；真正地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This composition is in substance better than the previous one. 这篇作文实际上比上一篇作文要好一些。</font>\n
in succession	<font color=blue size=4>in succession</font>\n<br>one after another in order, sequence, or in the course of events 接连地；相继\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's won the national championship in tabletennis for two years in succession. 她连续两年荣获乒乓球全国冠军。</font>\n
intend for	<font color=blue size=4>intend for</font>\n<br>1. mean 意指\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His remark was intended for you. 他的话是说给你听的。</font>\n<br>2. have in mind as a purpose 打算\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All my property is intended for my grandchildren. 我的所有财产打算赠给我的孙子们。</font>\n
intent on	<font color=blue size=4>intent on</font>\n<br>with one's attention directed toward or concentrated on 全神贯注\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is intent on his writing. 他一心一意地写作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the pupils were intent on drawing when we entered. 当我们进去时，小学生们都在专心致志地画画。</font>\n
interested in	<font color=blue size=4>interested in</font>\n<br>showing interest in 对…有兴趣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have always been interested in history. 我对历史一直有兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am interested in joining your company. 对加入贵公司我很感兴趣。</font>\n
interfere with	<font color=blue size=4>interfere with</font>\n<br>prevent 妨碍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You mustn't let pleasure interfere with business. 切不可纵情玩乐而耽误了事业。</font>\n
in terms of	<font color=blue size=4>in terms of</font>\n<br>1. in the matter of; on the subject of; especially about 关于；特别是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In terms of output per capita that country's agriculture is very efficient. 那个国家的农业，按人口计算的产量来说是很有效率的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is a small country both in terms of size and population. 就面积和人口而论，它都是个小国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In terms of money they're quite rich, but not in terms of happiness. 就钱而论，他们很富有，但是没有幸福。</font>\n<br>2. in the language of 用…措辞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talked about his students in terms of praise. 他对他的学生大加赞扬。</font>\n<br>3. expressed by 用…表示\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not to be considered in terms of money. 这件事不能从金钱方面考虑。</font>\n
in that	<font color=blue size=4>in that</font>\n<br>for the reason that; because 因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I like the city, but I like the country better in that I have more friends there. 我喜欢这个城市，可是我更喜欢农村，因为在那里我有更多的朋友。</font>\n
in the absence of	<font color=blue size=4>in the absence of</font>\n<br>1. being away 不在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the absence of their parents, the children played in the house. 家长不在时，孩子们便在家里玩耍。</font>\n<br>2. lacking 缺乏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the absence of evidence, the suspect was released. 因缺乏证据，那个嫌疑犯被释放了。</font>\n
in the air	<font color=blue size=4>in the air</font>\n<br>1. unsettled; uncertain 未确定的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our plans are in the air. 我们的计划还悬而未决。</font>\n<br>2. going about 流传\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are rumors in the air. 谣言传开了。</font>\n
in the dark	<font color=blue size=4>in the dark</font>\n<br>1. with no light 黑暗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't leave the child alone in the dark; he'll be afraid. 不要把孩子单独留在黑暗中，他会害怕的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hit my head against the door in the dark. 黑暗中我的头撞在了门上。</font>\n<br>2. in ignorance 不知道；隐瞒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John was in the dark about the job he was being sent to. 约翰对于指派他做的工作一无所知。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tax payers don't like being kept in the dark about the government's intentions. 纳税人不希望对政府的打算一无所知。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am still kept in the dark about the matter. 对这事我仍然一无所知。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is not necessary to keep it in the dark. 这件事没有必要保密。</font>\n
in the distance	<font color=blue size=4>in the distance</font>\n<br>far away; at a distance 远处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A small house can be seen in the distance. 远处可以看到一幢小房子。</font>\n
in the end	<font color=blue size=4>in the end</font>\n<br>finally; eventually; at last 最后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They reached the top of the mountain in the end. 他们最后爬到了山顶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeded in the end. 最后他成功了。</font>\n<br>in the event of in case of; if there is 假如；万一\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wall was built along the river in the event of floods. 沿河筑墙，以防洪水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the event of his not coming, what shall we do? 如果他不来，我们怎么办？</font>\n
in (the) face of	<font color=blue size=4>in (the) face of</font>\n<br>1. confronted by 面对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never shows any fear in face of danger. 在危险面前他从不畏惧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What could he do in face of all these difficulties? 面对这些困难，他能干什么呢？</font>\n<br>2. in opposition to; in spite of 反对；不顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Talking continued even in the face of the teacher's command to stop. 纵然老师已下令停止谈话，但有人还是讲个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeded in the face of all difficulties. 尽管困难重重，他还是成功了。</font>\n
in the field of	<font color=blue size=4>in the field of</font>\n<br>in the special line of 在…（学术）方面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made several important inventions in the field of telegraphy. 他在电报方面有过几项重要发明。</font>\n
in the first place	<font color=blue size=4>in the first place</font>\n<br>1. in the beginning; before now 早先；起初；早就\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You already ate breakfast！ Why didn't you tell me that in the first place? 你已经吃过啦！你为什么一开始不告诉我呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We would have finished the job long ago if we had listened to him in the first place. 要是我们一开始就听他的话，这工作早就完成了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Carl patched his old ball but it soon leaked again. He should have bought a new one in the first place. 卡尔把旧球补好，可很快又漏气了。他早就该买个新球了。</font>\n<br>2. firstly 首先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You cannot go swimming. In the first place, the water is too cold; and in the second place, there is no enough time before dinner. 你不能去游泳。第一，水太冷；第二，晚饭前没有足够的时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the first place, students should study hard. 首先，学生应该努力读书。</font>\n
in the habit of	<font color=blue size=4>in the habit of</font>\n<br>habitually 习惯地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in the habit of scratching his head when thinking. 他思考时习惯抓头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is in the habit of smoking. 她有吸烟的习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're in the habit of reading the newspaper at breakfast. 你有边吃早饭边看报纸的习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you in the habit of rising early? 你有早起的习惯吗？</font>\n
in the hands of	<font color=blue size=4>in the hands of</font>\n<br>possessed by 为…所有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town is still in the hands of the enemy. 这个城镇仍在敌人控制之下。</font>\n
in the interest of	<font color=blue size=4>in the interest of</font>\n<br>for the sake of 为了…的利益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are exploring the space in the interest of humanity. 他们在为人类的利益开发空间。</font>\n
in the least	<font color=blue size=4>in the least</font>\n<br>even a little; in the smallest degree; to the least degree or extent （常用于否定句中）一点（不）；丝毫（不）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mike was not upset in the least by the storm. 暴风雨一点也没有使迈克感到焦虑不安。</font>\n
in (the) light of	<font color=blue size=4>in (the) light of</font>\n<br>1. because of 由于；因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In light of the muddy field, the football team put on their rubbers. 因为道路泥泞，足球队员都穿上了胶鞋。</font>\n<br>2. according to; as a result of (new information) ; by means of (new idea) 依据；根据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is to be regarded as excusable in the light of circumstance. 考虑到具体情况，这将被看作是可以原谅的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher changed John's grade in the light of the extra work in his exercise book. 老师根据他作业本里所做的额外作业而更改了他的成绩。</font>\n
in the long run	<font color=blue size=4>in the long run</font>\n<br>finally; in the end 最终；从长远观点来看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Real ability will win in the long run. 真正的才能最终会使人获得成功的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It pays in the long run to buy goods of high quality. 买优质产品终归是合算的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may make good grades by studying only before examinations, but you will succeed in the long run by studying hard every day. 你考试前才看书也许会取得好成绩，不过你若每天努力学习最终定会成功。</font>\n
in the main	<font color=blue size=4>in the main</font>\n<br>in most cases 大体上；多数情况下；基本上；主要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he has said conforms in the main to facts. 他所讲的基本上符合事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The letters were in the main from my old classmates. 这些信件主要是我老同学写来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the main, the students did well on the test. 总的说来，学生们考得不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The results are in the main satis factory. 结果总的来说是满意的。</font>\n
in the matter of	<font color=blue size=4>in the matter of</font>\n<br>as regards 在…上；就…而言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is strict in the matter of discipline. 他在纪律方面是严格的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has not a good reputation in the matter of honesty. 要说诚实，他的名声不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have everything you need in the matter of books. 就书而言，你需要的都有。</font>\n
in the meantime	<font color=blue size=4>in the meantime</font>\n<br>at the same time; meanwhile 同时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the meantime, they took part in various contests and games. 与此同时，他们参加了各种比赛和游戏。</font>\n
in the middle	<font color=blue size=4>in the middle</font>\n<br>between two sides of an argument, two choices, etc. 在…之间；夹在争论双方的中间或两种选择之间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary found herself in the middle of the quarrel between Joyce and Ethel. 乔埃斯和埃塞尔发生争执，玛丽不知该倾向哪一方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John promised Larry to go fishing but his father wanted him to help at home. John was in the middle. 约翰答应莱里去钓鱼，可是他父亲却要他帮助做家务。约翰为难了。</font>\n
in the name of	<font color=blue size=4>in the name of</font>\n<br>1. using the authority of 凭…的权威；以…的名义\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I arrest you in the name of the law. 我根据法律逮捕你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am speaking in the name of all the students of our class. 我是代表我们班全体同学讲话的。</font>\n<br>2. for the sake of 为了…的缘故\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did it in the name of his brother. 他为了他弟弟的缘故而这样做。</font>\n
in the open (air) 	<font color=blue size=4>in the open (air) </font>\n<br>1. not within a building 露天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They slept in the open last night. 昨夜他们露宿。</font>\n<br>2. without secrecy 公开的；非秘密的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The problem caused discussion in the open. 这个问题引起了公开的讨论。</font>\n
in theory	<font color=blue size=4>in theory</font>\n<br>theoretically 理论上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan should work in theory, but will it work in practive? 这项计划在理论上一定有效，但在实践中能行得通吗？</font>\n
in (the) place of	<font color=blue size=4>in (the) place of</font>\n<br>instead of 代替…；…而不…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We use chopsticks in place of knives and forks. 我们用筷子代替刀叉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I attended the meeting in place of John because he was sick. 约翰生病了，所以我代替他出席了那次会议。</font>\n
in the possession of	<font color=blue size=4>in the possession of</font>\n<br>owned or controlled by 被…占有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The famous portrait is now in the possession of the National Gallery, 那张有名的照片被保存在国家美术馆里。</font>\n
in the presence of	<font color=blue size=4>in the presence of</font>\n<br>before 在…面前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was calm in the presence of danger. 他临危不乱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was shy in the presence of stangers. 这个女孩在陌生人面前显得腼腆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't get discouraged in the presence of failure. 他在失败面前没有气馁。</font>\n
in (the) process of	<font color=blue size=4>in (the) process of</font>\n<br>in the course of 在…过程中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The street is in (the) process of repair. 这条街正在翻修中。</font>\n
in the same boat	<font color=blue size=4>in the same boat</font>\n<br>in the same trouble; sharing the same misfortune 境遇相同；共患难\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dick was disappointed because Fern refused to marry him, but he knew others were in the same boat. 狄克很失望，因为费恩不肯嫁给他，不过他知道，其他人也没能娶上费恩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were in the same boat during the war. 他们在战时共患难过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are all in the same boat. 我们的处境都是相同的。</font>\n
in the same breath	<font color=blue size=4>in the same breath</font>\n<br>1. at the same time 同时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He admitted and denied his mistake in the same breath. 他刚承认了错误又立即推翻了。</font>\n<br>2. in the same class; in as high a group (usu. used in the negative) 在同一等级；同一程度；相提并论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary is a good swimmer, but she should not be mentioned in the same breath with you. 玛丽是一位很好的游泳者，但她还不能和你相提并论。</font>\n
in the swim	<font color=blue size=4>in the swim</font>\n<br>1. doing the same things that other people are doing 做别人正在做的事；随大流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim found some college friends at the lake that summer and soon was in the swim of things. 那年夏天吉姆发现他的一些大学同学在湖边度假，于是他很快加入到他们的活动中去。</font>\n<br>2. following fashion 赶时髦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary went to the city and found girls were dressed in green, and soon she was quite in the swim. 玛丽去那座城市，发现姑娘们都穿绿色的衣服，于是很快也赶上了潮流。</font>\n
in the twinkling of an eye	<font color=blue size=4>in the twinkling of an eye</font>\n<br>in a moment; very quickly 倾刻间；一刹那\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children finished eating all the candies in the twinkling of an eye. 孩子们刹那间就把糖果全吃光了。</font>\n
in the wake of	<font color=blue size=4>in the wake of</font>\n<br>as a result of; right after; following 由于；紧随\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were many troubles in the wake of the war. 战后许多麻烦接踵而来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were heavy losses of property in the wake of the flood. 由于洪水使得财产受到重大损失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Traders came in the wake of the conquering armies. 商人随着征服的军队而来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students followed in the wake of the teacher. 学生们跟在老师的后面。</font>\n
in the way	<font color=blue size=4>in the way</font>\n<br>placed so as to block the way; causing inconvenience 挡路；妨碍人的；碍手碍脚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fred tried to get to the door, but the table was in the way. 弗雷德试图走近大门，可是桌子挡住了去路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will visit you on Sunday, if there is nothing in the way. 如果没有什么妨碍的话，我将在星期日去拜访你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are very busy now, so let's take our leave quickly, otherwise we'll be in the way. 他们眼下正忙着，我们还是快走吧，要不就碍事了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary tried to clean the house, but her baby got in the way. 玛丽想打扫房子，可是她的孩子总是碍手碍脚的。</font>\n
in the way of	<font color=blue size=4>in the way of</font>\n<br>1. in a favorable position for doing or getting 在有利的地位；便利于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put me in the way of a good job. 他帮我找到了一份好工作。</font>\n<br>2. in the matter or business of; as regards 关于；有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have done a lot in the way of improving living conditions for the workers. 我们已经在改善工人的居住条件方面做了大量的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have a small stock in the way of short skirts. 他们有一小批短裙的存货。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have not yet done much in the way of invention. 我们在发明创造方面做的还不多。</font>\n<br>3. in the habit of 习惯于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not much in the way of working on Sundays. 我没有星期天工作的习惯。</font>\n<br>4. in the process of 在…过程中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Failure, success, failure again, success again—that's quite normal in the way of scientific experiments. 失败，成功，再失败，再成功，这在科学实验的过程中是很正常的。</font>\n
in the wind	<font color=blue size=4>in the wind</font>\n<br>1. seeming probable 看上去有可能的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Changes in the top management of the company had been in the wind for weeks. 公司最高主管的变动已酝酿了好几个星期了。</font>\n<br>2. soon to happen; about to occur 快要发生的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom's close friends knew that his marriage was in the wind. 汤姆的好朋友都知道他很快要结婚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are having an urgent session; there must be something in the wind. 他们在召开紧急会议，肯定发生了什么事情。</font>\n
in the world/on earth	<font color=blue size=4>in the world/on earth</font>\n<br>at all; ever; of all possible things 究竟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who in the world is that fellow? 那人究竟是谁？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where in the world did you find that necklace? 你究竟是在哪儿发现这根项链的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't understand what on earth the teacher meant. 他不能理解老师究竟说了些什么。</font>\n
in the wrong	<font color=blue size=4>in the wrong</font>\n<br>to blame; in error 不正当；错误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in the right and you are in the wrong. 他是对的，你错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In attacking a smaller boy, Jack was plainly in the wrong. 杰克欺侮一个比他小的孩子，很明显是他不对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He knew he was in the wrong, but refused to concede to the point. 他知道他错了，但不肯认错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are both in the wrong. 你们两位都错了。</font>\n
in time	<font color=blue size=4>in time</font>\n<br>1. within or before a fixed time 及时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got to the station just in time to catch the train. 我们及时赶到火车站乘上火车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A stitch in time saves nine. 及时处理，事半功倍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can rest assured that we'll finish the work in time. 你放心吧，我们一定按时完成任务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor came in time to save his life. 医生及时前来挽救他的生命。</font>\n<br>2. eventually; in the end; after a while; in the future 不久；最好；将来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fred and Jim did not like each other at first, but in time they became friends. 弗雷德和吉姆开始互不喜欢，可是最终他们成了好朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll get used to the weather in Nanjing in time. 你迟早会适应南京的气候的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you keep on trying, you will succed in time. 只要你继续努力，你迟早会成功。</font>\n<br>3. in step 合拍子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The marchers kept in time with the band. 游行者和着乐队的节奏往前走。</font>\n
in time of	<font color=blue size=4>in time of</font>\n<br>when one is in 当处于…之时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Confidence is a great weapon, especially in time of fear, uncertainty and danger. 信心是一种重要的武器，尤其是在恐惧、疑虑和危险的时候。</font>\n
in to case	<font color=blue size=4>in to case</font>\n<br>under no circumstances 决不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will in no case reveal your secret. 我决不会把你的秘密泄露出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In no case have I noticed that matter. 我决没有注意到那件事。</font>\n
in touch with	<font color=blue size=4>in touch with</font>\n<br>1. in contact with; communicating with 与…接触；同…保持联系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please get in touch with me while you are away. 你走后请与我联系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A newspaper keeps one in touch with the world. 报纸使人们同世界保持联系。</font>\n<br>2. having a delicate appreciation and intimate knowledge of; in sympathy with 深知；熟悉；同情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not quite in touch with anyone in this neighbourhood. 他和这一地区内的任何人都不熟悉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is in touch with the latest developments in the case. 她对这一案件的最新发展情况是知道的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He reads the daily press regularly to keep in touch with the developments both at home and abroad. 他经常读报以了解国内外形势的发展。</font>\n
in trouble	<font color=blue size=4>in trouble</font>\n<br>1. in a difficult situation; suffering 在困扰中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always offers his help when I am in trouble. 每当我陷入困境，他总伸出援助之手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is a kind friend to everyone in trouble. 她对处于困境的人都很友善。</font>\n<br>2. going to be punished 将受惩罚；被责难\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in trouble again, because he has broken a window. 他又受到了责罚，因为他打碎了窗户。</font>\n
in truth	<font color=blue size=4>in truth</font>\n<br>in fact; in reality; actually 实际上；实事上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In truth, he cannot teach you anything on French. 事实上，他不能教你法语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is in truth an ideal site for a power plant. 这里的确是建设发电厂的理想场所。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is in truth very poorly made. 说实在的，这个东西做得太差劲了。</font>\n
in turn	<font color=blue size=4>in turn</font>\n<br>one by one 依次\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Each man in turn got up and spoke. 每个人依次站起来发言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll see you all in turn. 我将一个一个地去看望你们大家。</font>\n
in two	<font color=blue size=4>in two</font>\n<br>in half 分成两半\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was only one piece of cake, so we cut it in two. 只有一块蛋糕，所以我们把它分成两半。</font>\n
in vain	<font color=blue size=4>in vain</font>\n<br>without success; without effect 徒劳地；无效地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed his life in vain. 他虚度了一生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The drowning man called in vain for help. 溺水者求救无门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the doctor's efforts were in vain and the man soon died. 医生所有的努力都无效，那个人很快就死了。</font>\n
in view	<font color=blue size=4>in view</font>\n<br>1. in sight 看见；在望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We reached the hill top and there was the sea in view. 我们爬上山顶，看见了大海。</font>\n<br>2. as a purpose 意在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has some pleasure in view. 他意在找些快乐。</font>\n
in view of	<font color=blue size=4>in view of</font>\n<br>considering; on account of 由…看来；考虑到；由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Schools were closed that day in view of the heavy snowstorm. 由于暴风雪，学校那天没有上课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must do your best in view of . 由于暴风雪，学校那天没有上课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must do your best in view of those facts. 鉴于那些事实，你应当尽力而为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was pardoned in view of the circumstances. 由于考虑到当时的情况，他被宽恕了。</font>\n
in virtue of	<font color=blue size=4>in virtue of</font>\n<br>by virtue of; because of, on the grounds of; by means of 由于；因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Plastic bags are useful for holding many kinds of food, in virtue of their clearness, toughness and low cost. 塑料袋因透明、牢固、价廉而被用来包装多种食物。</font>\n
in want of	<font color=blue size=4>in want of</font>\n<br>in need of; wanting 需要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby is in want of special care. 这个婴儿需要特别护理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are so well provided that we are not in want of anything. 我们应有尽有，什么也不缺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you in want of money? 你需要钱吗？</font>\n
in/with reference to	<font color=blue size=4>in/with reference to</font>\n<br>concerning; about 关于；有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have nothing to say in reference to that case. 对于那个事件，我无可奉告。</font>\n
in word	<font color=blue size=4>in word</font>\n<br>in speech only 口头上地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is faithful in word and in deed. 他无论说话办事都可以信得过。</font>\n
jazz up	<font color=blue size=4>jazz up</font>\n<br>1. brighten up; make more exciting 使活跃起来；使更振奋\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party was very dull until Peter jazzed it up with his drum. 聚会枯燥无味，直到彼得敲鼓才改变了气氛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newsman jazzed up the story to sell himself to the editors of the weekly. 这个记者把报道写得绘声绘色，以求博得那家周刊编辑们的青睐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go out and get some more to drink; this party meeds jazzing up a bit. 你出去多买些饮料，这次聚会需要搞得热闹点。</font>\n<br>2. improve; give an appearance of improvement 改进；使带有改进的外观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The room decorations appeared to have been jazzed up. 房间的装饰好象已经改观了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've tried to jazz up the old car with a spot of paint and some accessories. 我设法用少量油漆和一些配件修整这辆旧汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our exhibition stand was dull and boring last year. —Can't we jazz it up a bit this year? 我们的展览架去年很枯燥无味。—今年我们可不可使它吸引人一点？</font>\n
jealous of	<font color=blue size=4>jealous of</font>\n<br>1. feeling of unhappiness because of the better fortune, etc. of others 嫉妒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is jealous of his colleague's success. 他嫉妒他同事的成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should not be jealcus of their happiness. 你不应妒忌他们的幸福。</font>\n<br>2. valuing highly and guarding 爱惜；爱护\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is very jealous of his honour. 他很爱惜他的荣誉。</font>\n
jib at	<font color=blue size=4>jib at</font>\n<br>refuse to accept; reject 拒绝接受；抵制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't object to the idea of going; he only jibbed at having to go there alone. 到那儿去他并不反对，他只是反对一个人去罢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse jibbed at that high fence. 马在那个高篱笆前不肯跳过去。</font>\n
