known as	<font color=blue size=4>known as</font>\n<br>called by 被称为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actress likes to be known as May Diamond, although it is not her real name. 这位女演员喜欢别人叫她“梅宝石”, 虽然这不是她真正的名字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is known as a great statesman. 众所周知他是一位伟大的政治家。</font>\n
known for	<font color=blue size=4>known for</font>\n<br>famous for 因…而出名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hangzhou is known for the West Lake. 杭州以西湖而著名。</font>\n
known to	<font color=blue size=4>known to</font>\n<br>known by 为…所知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is known to everyone as an honest man. 人们都知道他是一个诚实的人。</font>\n
know of	<font color=blue size=4>know of</font>\n<br>have heard of/about 听说过（没见过）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know the Professor, but I know of him. 我不认识这位教授，但是我听说过他。</font>\n
labour at/over	<font color=blue size=4>labour at/over</font>\n<br>make a lot of effort about 努力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't labour at your writing; try to make it easy and natural. 写文章不要过分雕琢，要力图使其易懂自然。</font>\n
labour for	<font color=blue size=4>labour for</font>\n<br>work hard so as to gain 努力工作以获取\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leaders of many nations are labouring for peace. 许多国家的领导人致力于和平事业。</font>\n
labour under	<font color=blue size=4>labour under</font>\n<br>1. be burdened, troubled, or distressed by; suffer from the shortcoming of 为…苦恼；困于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think you must be labouring under a misunderstanding. 我想你可能是受误解之苦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She labours under speech handicaps because she stammers. 由于有口吃的毛病，她说话很费力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firm has been labouring under difficulties for the past year. 公司去年一直在困难中挣扎。</font>\n<br>2. be misled or blinded by 受…骗；受…蒙蔽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been labouring under the impression that we are prejudiced against him. However, we have been treating him with fairness. 他一直以为我们对他有偏见，感到很苦恼，可我们一向对他是公正的。</font>\n
lack in	<font color=blue size=4>lack in</font>\n<br>fail to have any or enough 缺少；不够\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This car is lacking in speed. 这辆车速度不够。</font>\n
lag behind	<font color=blue size=4>lag behind</font>\n<br>fail to catch up with 落后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rest of the family had nearly reached the bank, but Jane was lagging behind. 家里其他人都快要游到岸边，只有简落在后面。</font>\n
later on	<font color=blue size=4>later on</font>\n<br>at a later time 以后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll let you know later on. 以后我会告诉你的。</font>\n
laugh at	<font color=blue size=4>laugh at</font>\n<br>1. laugh to scorn; mock 嘲笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is unkind to laugh at a person in trouble. 对人幸灾乐祸有欠忠厚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't laugh at her. 不要嘲笑她。</font>\n<br>2. get amused about; make fun of 因…发笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you laughing at? 你们在笑什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's nothing to laugh at. 那没啥可笑的。</font>\n<br>3. show apathy or indifference to; reject 一笑置之；付之一笑；轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He laughed at the idea. 他对这个意见不以为然。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We advised him not to laugh at the official warnings. 我忠告他不要对官方的警告不以为然。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The daring climbers laugh at danger. 勇敢的登山者对危险付之一笑。</font>\n
laugh away	<font color=blue size=4>laugh away</font>\n<br>1. continue laughing 笑而不止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd were still laughing away as they left the theatre. 人们离开剧场时仍笑声不止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know why he was laughing away to himself all the time. 我不知道为什么他自己一直在笑个不停。</font>\n<br>2. dismiss or get rid of with a laugh; scorn 付之一笑；轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He just laughed away the enemy's threats. 对敌人的威胁，他一笑置之。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those who can laugh away all regrets are sure to live longer. 能用笑声来解愁者必长寿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no point in trying to laugh away this problem. It has to be dealt with realistically. 对这个问题想一笑了之是不行的，必须切实加以处理。</font>\n<br>3. while away (time) with laughter 以笑来消磨时光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talks and laughs away his vacant hours. 他谈笑风生，消磨无聊的空余时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We laughed away the time when we were together. 我们说说笑笑消磨了我们在一起的时间。</font>\n
laugh down	<font color=blue size=4>laugh down</font>\n<br>defeat, dismiss or silence by laughing 用笑声压倒、拒绝或打断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience laughed the speaker down. 听众的笑声打断了演讲者的谈话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know why they laughed down my proposal. 我不懂他们为什么用笑声来拒绝我的建议。</font>\n
laugh off	<font color=blue size=4>laugh off</font>\n<br>1. dismiss with a laugh as not important or not serious; not take seriously 一笑置之；不予重视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is a mistake that can't easily be laughed off. 这不是一个可以等闲视之的错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a bad fall while iceskating but he laughed it off. 他在溜冰时重重地跌了一跤，但他一笑了之，没把它当回事。</font>\n<br>2. escape from or get rid of by laughing 以笑来排除；笑着逃过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We could but laugh off his suspicions. 我们只好以笑声来排除他的疑心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Beset with embarrassing questions at the press conference, the diplomat tried to laugh off his predicament. 在记者招待会上，这位外交官给一些难题弄得很尴尬，只好以笑声加以掩饰。</font>\n
laugh over	<font color=blue size=4>laugh over</font>\n<br>laugh while talking about 笑着谈论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We laughed over the tale we had just heard. 我们笑着谈论那则刚刚听到的故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old couple laughed over the letter they had received from their little grandson. 老俩口收到小孙子的来信，一边谈一边笑。</font>\n
launch on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>launch on/upon</font>\n<br>make a start on; commence 开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The opposition speaker launched a bitter attack on the government's mishandling of the taxpayers'money. 反对党演讲者猛烈抨击政府使用纳税款不当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory launched on the production of walkingtractors on a large scale. 这家工厂开始大规模地生产手扶拖拉机。</font>\n
launch (out) into	<font color=blue size=4>launch (out) into</font>\n<br>1. make a start on 开始；发动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After leaving college, David launched out into a business career. 大学毕业后，戴维就经商了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are launching out into a series of scientific experiments. 他们正在着手进行一系列的科学试验。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Burk used the money to launch into a new business. 伯克先生利用这笔钱开始搞一项新的企业。</font>\n<br>2. speak out critically 大发议论；批评；谴责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He at once launched out into oaths and curses. 他突然大肆咒骂起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first he spoke slowly and gently, but then launched out into fierce words of criticism. 一上来他讲话语气平缓，可后来就言词激烈地批评起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The opposition launched into a violent attack on the government. 反对党猛烈地攻击政府。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He launched out into a colourful description of his journey. 他开始绘声绘色地叙述他的旅行见闻。</font>\n
lay about	<font color=blue size=4>lay about</font>\n<br>attack 袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The three men laid about him with their hands and boots. 3个家伙对他拳打脚踢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rushed upon those who were causing the trouble, and laid about them. 他冲向那些肇事者，把他们痛打了一阵。</font>\n
lay aside	<font color=blue size=4>lay aside</font>\n<br>1. put to one side; cease temporarily some work or activity in which one is engaged 暂停某一工作或活动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At eight o'clock every evening she laid aside whatever she was doing to tell the children a story before they went to bed. 每晚一到8点，她就丢掉手头在做的一切，给孩子们讲故事，以让他们睡觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students laid aside their books to listen to the news broadcast. 学生们收起书本去听新闻广播。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lay aside your book and go to bed. 放下你的书去睡觉吧。</font>\n<br>2. save; put by for some special purpose 节省；为特定目的而积蓄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is laying aside money for his old age. 他在积蓄钱以备晚年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Half the prize money he spent, and the rest was laid aside for a rainy day. 他花了一半奖金，其余的钱存起来以备不时之需。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She laid aside one hour a day for reading. 她每天抽一个小时来看书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every family has spare money to lay aside and surplus grain in store. 家家有存款，户户有余粮。</font>\n<br>3. abandon; reject 抛弃；拒绝；除去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has laid aside the habit of smoking. 他已戒烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time to lay aside our differences and work together for a shared purpose. 是我们放弃不同意见，为共同目标而通力合作的时候了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want you to lay aside these useless prejudices. 我希望你丢开这些无益的偏见。</font>\n
lay away	<font color=blue size=4>lay away</font>\n<br>1. save 储蓄；把商品留存起来（待以后交货）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She laid a little of her pay away each week. 她每周储蓄一点薪金。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The store would be glad to lay away this dress for you till Christmas. 本店愿意把这服装为你保留到圣诞节。</font>\n<br>2. bury 埋葬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was laid away in his favorite spot on the hill. 他被安葬在山上他最喜欢的地点。</font>\n
lay by	<font color=blue size=4>lay by</font>\n<br>save, esp. a little at a time 储蓄；储存\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He laid a little money by every week till he had enough for a trip to Florida. 他每周储蓄点钱直到足以去佛罗里达旅行一趟为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmer laid by some of his best corn to plant the next year. 这位农场主留存了一些最好的玉米，以备来年下种之用。</font>\n
lay down	<font color=blue size=4>lay down</font>\n<br>1. resign 辞职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man has laid down his office to make way for a younger man. 这位老人为了给年轻人让位，辞去了他的职务。</font>\n<br>2. store away for future use 贮藏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They laid down provisions for the voyage. 他们贮备粮食以备航行之用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has laid down some excellent vintoges. 他贮藏了非常好的葡萄酒。</font>\n<br>3. cease using 放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please lay down the watch gently. 请把手表轻轻放下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell your men to lay down their armsthe war is over. 告诉你们的人投降吧，战争已经结束了。</font>\n<br>4. sacrifice 牺牲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He laid down his life for the country. 他为国牺牲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thousands of young men laid down their lives for the cause of peace. 成千上万的年轻人为了和平事业献出了自己的生命。</font>\n<br>5. state clearly and definitely 明确规定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is laid down that no changes can be made after a committee decision. 按规定，委员会决定后不能再做任何修改。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school authorities have laid down some new rules. 学校当局制订了一些新的规章制度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Act lays it down that no pension can be paid to anyone under the age of sixty unless he is disabled. 法令规定，除残废者外, 60岁以下者，不得领取养老金。</font>\n<br>6. bet 下赌注\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How much is Martin ready to lay down on the horse? 马丁打算在这匹马上下多少赌注？</font>\n<br>7. construct; build 建造\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are laying down a nuclear submarine. 他们正在建造一艘核潜艇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several of the newtype tankers are being laid down. 有几艘新型油船正在建造之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The track was laid down in the 19th century and is in need of repair. 这条铁路是19世纪铺设的，急需整修。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many new railways have been laid down in the past few years. 几年来建造了许多新铁路。</font>\n<br>8. plant or sow (a field) with a certain crop; convert (land) into pasture 在（耕地上）种上；把（耕地）改成牧场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This year we must lay the big field down to grass. 今年我们必须把这块大田改种牧草。</font>\n
lay down/put one's cards on the table	<font color=blue size=4>lay down/put one's cards on the table</font>\n<br>let sb. know your position and interest openly; act without trickery or secrets 公开表明态度或意愿；行为光明正大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In talking about buying the property Peterson laid his cards on the table about his plans. 彼得逊在购买那份产业时，明白说清了他置产的计划。</font>\n
lay down the law	<font color=blue size=4>lay down the law</font>\n<br>1. give strict orders 下命令；严令\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could usually be found in the centre of a small group of people to whom he was laying down the law. 我们常看到他在一小群人当中发号施令。</font>\n<br>2. speak severely or seriously about a wrong doing; scold 严厉斥责；呵斥\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The principal called in the students and laid down the law to them about skipping classes. 校长集合学生严责他们逃课。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father is laying down the law to the children again; I wonder what they've done now. 父亲又严厉地训斥孩子们了，不知道他们现在又干了什么事。</font>\n
lay for	<font color=blue size=4>lay for</font>\n<br>hide and wait for in order to catch or attack 等待时机（抓住、袭击）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bandits laid for him along the road. 匪徒埋伏在路旁等着他。</font>\n
lay hands on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>lay hands on/upon</font>\n<br>1. get hold of; seize; get possession of; find 得到；找到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the police can lay hands on him, they will put him in jail. 警察若能抓住他，一定会让他入狱的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have the book somewhere but I cannot lay hands on it just now. 我把那本书放在一个地方，但现在找不到了。</font>\n<br>2. do violence to; harm; hurt 伤害；加害\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He laid violent hands upon himself. 他自杀了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were afraid that if they left him alone in his disturbed condition he would lay hands on himself. 他心情不好，他们担心假如离开他，他会做出伤害自己的事情。</font>\n
lay in	<font color=blue size=4>lay in</font>\n<br>store away for future use; provide; save 贮藏；贮存\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have laid in a good supply of food for the winter. 我们已经贮存了足够的粮食过冬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every time they came to land, they laid in a good plenty of fresh water. 他们每次靠岸都要备足淡水。</font>\n
lay into	<font color=blue size=4>lay into</font>\n<br>1. attack physically; go at vigorously 殴打；痛击；猛击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two fighters laid into each other as soon as the bell rang. 铃声一响，两位拳手互相猛击起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I saw Jones lay into a man twice his size. 我看见琼斯狠揍一个比他个子大一倍的男人。</font>\n<br>2. attack with words 用语言攻击；抨击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I let him have his say, and then I laid into him. 我让他把话说完，然后把他痛骂了一顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The senator laid into the opponents of his bill. 那位参议员猛烈抨击了反对他的提案的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the meeting they laid into each other fiercely. 在会上他们激烈地相互指责。</font>\n
lay off	<font color=blue size=4>lay off</font>\n<br>1. dismiss temporarily, generally because of lack of work 临时解雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If business continues to be slow, we may have to lay off ten people. 如果生意继续萧条，我们可能得暂时辞退10个人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill hasn't lost his job. His firm laid him off for two weeks. 比尔没有失业，他的公司临时解雇他两个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Was John fired or laid off? 约翰是被解雇了，还是被临时辞退一段时间？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work there was seasonal, and there was a great deal of hardship among the employees when they were laid off each winter. 那里的工作带有季节性，所以每年冬天雇工们被解雇时，日子是很难过的。</font>\n<br>2. discontinue work or activity; take a rest 停止工作或活动；休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor told him to lay off for a rest. 医生嘱咐他把工作停下来休息一段时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better lay off smoking for a while. 你最好这会儿不要抽烟。</font>\n<br>3. stop doing sth. which irritates or annoys; stop bothering; leave alone 不要惹人生气；不要打扰别人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't like some of the things he was saying about her so I told him to lay off. 他在说她的一些事，我不愿听，所以我告诉他不要再说了。</font>\n<br>4. stop using or taking 戒除；勿再\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His doctor told him to lay off smoking. 他的医生要他戒烟。</font>\n<br>5. mark out the boundaries or limits 标出界线\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boundaries are clearly laid off on the map. 地图上清楚地标出了界线。</font>\n<br>6. take off; put (a garment, etc.) aside 脱掉；把（衣服等）搁在一边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time we were able to lay off these heavy winter clothes. 现在是我们可以把这些厚重的冬装换下搁在一边的时候了。</font>\n
lay on	<font color=blue size=4>lay on</font>\n<br>1. supply (gas, water, electricity) to a building; provide 供应（煤气、水电等）；提供\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house has water and electricity laid on. 这座房子有水电供应。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was years before gas was laid on to the village. 好多年以后这村子才装起了管道煤气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They lay on all essential services. 他们提供一切必要的服务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus company intends to lay on two more buses for this route. 公交公司打算再给这条线路提供两部车。</font>\n<br>2. beat; strike; attack violently 猛打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As he laid on blows to the boy's back, a man came up and took the whip out of his hand. 他鞭打男孩背部时，一个男人走过来夺了他手中的鞭子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Little John seized a club and began to lay on for dear life. 小约翰拿起一根棍子拼命乱打。</font>\n<br>3. cover with; apply 涂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told us that we should lay on a second coat of paint for better protection against the weather. 他告诉我们，为了防止气候侵害应再涂一层油漆。</font>\n<br>4. organize or arrange for (entertainment, concert, etc.) 组织安排（文娱活动、音乐会等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the whole tour we hadn't to trouble about anything ourselves; everything was laid on for us. 整个旅游过程中，我们什么都不用自己去操心，一切都为我们安排好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stage shows were laid on to entertain the foreign guests. 安排了几场演出招待那些外宾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has all the food and drink been laid on? 所有饮食都已安排好了吗？</font>\n<br>5. impose (taxes, commands, penalties) 征（税）；下（命令）;施加（惩罚）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government has laid on a new tax. 政府已征收新税。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firm is laying on higher prices. 这个公司正在强行加价。</font>\n<br>6. provide as a gift, bonus or treat 作为赠品赠送；奉送；招待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The owner of the factory laid on a Christmas dinner for the employees. 工厂的老板设圣诞宴会招待其员工。</font>\n
lay oneself out	<font color=blue size=4>lay oneself out</font>\n<br>try very hard 努力；尽力去做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They promised that they would lay themselves out to help us. 他们答应将尽全力帮助我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Larry wanted to win a medal for his school, so he really laid himself out in the race. 拉里想为学校赢得奖牌，因此他确实在比赛中下了很大功夫。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He may want the job, but I haven't seen him lay himself out trying to get it. 他可能想得到这个职位，但是我没有看到他竭力去争取。</font>\n
lay out	<font color=blue size=4>lay out</font>\n<br>1. spend; pay 花费；付钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always hard up because he doesn't lay out his money wisely. 他总是没钱，因为他用钱不会精打细算。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee decided to lay out all their budget on redecorating the college. 委员会决定把他们所有的预算都花在重新修缮这所大学上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His money is well laid out. 他花钱很得当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She laid out a lot of money on this house. 她为这幢房子花了许多钱。</font>\n<br>2. spread out ready for use or so as to be seen easily; display 展现；呈现；陈列\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scene that was laid out before the climbers was magnificent. 呈现在登山者面前的风景是非常壮丽的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shopassistants were busy laying out their windows for the coming National Day. 售货员为了迎接国庆节的到来，正忙着布置橱窗。</font>\n<br>3. plan; plot; organize 计划；安排\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come here, Fred, I have a job laid out for you. 过来，弗雷德，我替你安排了一个工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He laid out the day's work for his students. 他给学生们安排了当天的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work for tomorrow is all laid out. 明天的工作都安排好了。</font>\n<br>4. prepare; prepare (a corpse) for burial 准备；为（尸体）作殡葬准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The servants laid out his meals carefully. 佣人们为他精心准备了饭菜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The family passed one by one through the small parlour where the father's body was laid out. 一家人一个接一个地走过放着父亲遗体的小客厅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The undertaker laid out the corpse prior to burial. 殡仪员做好尸体的殡葬准备。</font>\n<br>5. knock down or make unconscious 打倒；击昏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hit the secret agent on the jaw and completely laid him out. 他朝那特务的下巴一拳打去，把他打昏在地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves laid out two of the guards during the armed robbery. 在武装抢劫时，盗贼们杀死了两个卫兵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With one blow he laid his attacker out. 他一拳就打昏了袭击他的人。</font>\n<br>6. plan the building or arrangement of; design 设计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The architect laid out the interior of the building. 建筑师设计了大厦的内部。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pictures in. the magazine are well laid out. 那本杂志里的图片编排得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The garden is tastefully laid out. 花园设计得很优雅。</font>\n
lay over	<font color=blue size=4>lay over</font>\n<br>1. put off until later; delay; postpone 推迟；耽延\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We voted to lay the question over to our next meeting for discussion. 我们一致赞成将这个问题推迟到下次会议讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For various reasons, the meeting was laid over till the next day. 由于种种原因，会议延至次日举行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert had to be laid over for several days because one of the singers had hurt her throat. 因为一个女歌手的嗓子受了伤，所以音乐会只能延期几天举行。</font>\n<br>2. arrive in one place and wait some time before continuing the journey（旅途中）稍作停留\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to lay over in St. Louis for two hours waiting for a plane to Seattle. 我们得在圣路易斯等待两小时，换乘飞机去西雅图。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We decided to lay over for a couple of days in Hong kong on our way to Canada. 我们决定在去加拿大的途中在香港呆一、二天。</font>\n
lay/put heads together	<font color=blue size=4>lay/put heads together</font>\n<br>conspire; confer 共谋；商议；集思广益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd better lay our heads together before deciding on any definite course of action. 我们最好先商量一下，然后再决定行动方案。</font>\n
lay siege to	<font color=blue size=4>lay siege to</font>\n<br>1. besiege; invest with a hostile army 包围；围困\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The army has laid siege to the city several months. 军队已包围该城数月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The German army laid siege to Paris in 1870. 德军于1870年包围巴黎。</font>\n<br>2. beseech or importune constantly 恳求；强求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was struck by Mary's beauty and laid siege to her heart. 他为玛丽的美色所迷，并拼命追求她。</font>\n
lay stress on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>lay stress on/upon</font>\n<br>emphasize 强调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his speech he laid stress on the need for better understanding among nations of the world. 在演讲中，他强调世界各国有必要加强相互之间的了解。</font>\n
lay to	<font color=blue size=4>lay to</font>\n<br>1. give the blame or credit to; name as cause 归因于；归功于（或归罪于）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was unpopular and when he made money, it was laid to his dishonesty, but when he lost money, it was laid to his stupidity. 他不得人心，当他赚钱时，人家说他来路不正，而当他赔了本时，人家又说他笨。</font>\n<br>2. hold a ship or boat still against the wind; come to anchor 逆风而保持船静止不动；停泊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship laid to off the coast. 这艘船停泊在海岸外面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pirates decided to lay to that night and go ashore in the morning. 海盗们决定该晚停船不动，天亮再登岸。</font>\n<br>3. exert oneself; work hard 努力工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got hold of a shovel and laid to with the others. 他拿起铲子与别人一起大干起来。</font>\n<br>4. attack vigorously 猛烈攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seized a stick and laid to in all directions. 他抓起一根棍棒向四下乱打。</font>\n
lay to heart	<font color=blue size=4>lay to heart</font>\n<br>hear seriously; ponder deeply over 认真听；深思\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish the boy would lay to heart the wise counsel his teacher has given him. 我希望这个男孩能认真听老师对他的忠告。</font>\n
lay to rest	<font color=blue size=4>lay to rest</font>\n<br>1. get rid of; put away permanently; stop 除去；放下；停止；烟消云散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her doubts were quickly laid to rest when he arrived as he had promised. 当他按约到来以后，她的疑虑就烟消云散了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rumour that the principal had accepted another job was laid to rest when he said it wasn't true. 有关校长已经接受了另一工作的谣言，在其本人辟谣以后就没有人再乱传了。</font>\n<br>2. put a dead person into a grave or tomb; bury 安葬；埋葬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was laid to rest in the churchyard. 他被安葬于教堂墓地。</font>\n
lay up	<font color=blue size=4>lay up</font>\n<br>1. save or store for future use 储备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bees lay up honey for the winter. 蜜蜂采蜜以过冬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no ammunition laid up in the storehouses. 仓库里没有贮存军火。</font>\n<br>2. keep in bed; cause to stay in bed or keep indoors 卧床；呆在家里\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been laid up with a broken leg. 他腿摔坏后一直卧床。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bad attack of flu can lay you up longer than you think. 严重流感会使你卧床的时间比想象得长。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've been laid up with rheumatism for a week. 风湿病使我卧床休息了一个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll lay yourself up if you go on like this. 如果你这样继续下去的话，你就要病倒了。</font>\n<br>3. (of a car or a ship) take out of use or active service and keep in a garage or a boat dock（船或小汽车）搁置不使用；放在车棚里或停在码头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are some people who use their cars only in the period between March and December, and lay them up during the winter. 有些人只在3月至12月期间使用小汽车，在冬天就停止使用了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill had to lay up his boat when school started. 学校开学后，比尔不得不把他的船收藏起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company have had to lay up several of their fleet, and others are likely to be laid up if trade does not improve. 公司不得不让一些船休航在码头，如果生意无起色的话，其它船队也可能停航。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My car has been laid up for a week for urgent repairs. 我的小车要紧急修理，已经停止使用一个星期了。</font>\n<br>4. accumulate 积蓄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better have an allround physical examination right away or you're laying up trouble for yourself. 你最好立即作一次全面的体格检查，否则你会给自己添麻烦的。</font>\n
lay waste	<font color=blue size=4>lay waste</font>\n<br>cause wide and great damage to; destroy and leave in ruins 损毁；蹂躏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Enemy soldiers laid waste the land. 敌军糟蹋了这块土地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In less than an hour's time, the typhoon laid waste a number of towns and villages along the coast. 不到一个小时，台风就把沿海一些城镇和乡村变成了废墟。</font>\n
laze about/around	<font color=blue size=4>laze about/around</font>\n<br>move or lie about lazily 懒懒散散地闲逛或懒散地躺着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have been lazing about too much lately. 你近来太懒散了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop lazing about and do something！别再鬼混了，干点事吧！</font>\n
laze away	<font color=blue size=4>laze away</font>\n<br>1. be lazy or idle continuously 连续地懒散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's lovely just to laze away in the sun. 在阳光下懒散一会儿真是太舒服了。</font>\n<br>2. pass (time, etc.) lazily 懒散地度过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They lazed away the whole afternoon. 他们懒散了整个下午。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't laze away your time. 不要虚度光阴。</font>\n
lead a dog's life	<font color=blue size=4>lead a dog's life</font>\n<br>live a hard life 生活艰苦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He led a dog's life in the past. 他过去生活贫困。</font>\n
lead astray	<font color=blue size=4>lead astray</font>\n<br>guide into a wrong way; tempt sb. to do sth. wrong 领错路；引入歧途\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My trained dog has never led the sheep astray. 我那条训练过的狗从未把羊领错路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was led astray by evil companions. 这男孩被坏朋友带上了斜路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The unthinking public are easily led astray by the false picture of reality given in television shows. 不加思考的公众很容易被电视对现实所描绘出的假象引入歧途。</font>\n
lead by the nose	<font color=blue size=4>lead by the nose</font>\n<br>have full control of 完全控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let anyone lead you by the nose; use your own judgement and do the right things. 不要让别人牵着你的鼻子走，要用你自己的判断力做应该做的事。</font>\n
lead in	<font color=blue size=4>lead in</font>\n<br>1. introduce; open one's remarks 做介绍；开场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman led in with some flattering references to the visiting speakers'record in the industry. 主席对请来的演讲人在本行业中的经历作了一番恭维的介绍。</font>\n<br>2. (electricity) come in; enter; bring in（电）引入；使领入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They intend to lead the wires in through this hole. 他们打算从这个孔把导线引入。</font>\n
lead off	<font color=blue size=4>lead off</font>\n<br>begin; start 开始；领先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the teacher asked if the film helped them to understand, Phil led off by saying that he learned a lot from it. 当老师问这部电影是否有助于他们的理解时，费尔带头回答说他从中学到了很多东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The singer led off with a popular ballad. 这位歌手首先唱了一首流行的民歌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is to lead off the discussion? 讨论由谁来带头发言？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town band led off by playing the National Anthem. 市府乐队首先奏国歌。</font>\n
lead on	<font color=blue size=4>lead on</font>\n<br>deceive; mislead 欺骗；诱使\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The washing machine salesman led his customer on with promises of special discounts and aftersales service. 洗衣机推销商的许诺使顾客误以为会有特别的销售折扣和售后服务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom led us on to believe that he was a world traveller, but we found out that he had never been outside of our state. 汤姆骗我们相信他周游过世界，但我们却发现他从未离开我们这个州。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you believe in telling the truth, you should never lead someone on. 如果你相信讲真话，你绝不会欺骗任何人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The salesman led us on about the quality of the product so that I would buy it. 售货员诱使我们相信产品的质量以便我买他的产品。</font>\n
lead the way	<font color=blue size=4>lead the way</font>\n<br>guide 领先\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys need someone to lead the way on their hike. 在徒步旅行中这群男孩需要有人为他们领路。</font>\n
lead to	<font color=blue size=4>lead to</font>\n<br>result in; cause; bring as a result to 导致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such an armament race can only lead to war. 这样的军备竞赛只会导致战争。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of discussion will certainly lead to still greater differences between the two parties. 这样的讨论，必将导致双方更大的分歧。</font>\n
lead up to	<font color=blue size=4>lead up to</font>\n<br>1. approach indirectly 渐渐讲到；暗示\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone could see what he was leading up to. He wanted to borrow some money from us. 谁都看得出他将要提到的是什么，他是要向我们借钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He led up to the question of money. 他渐渐提到钱的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you leading up to? 你究竟想要说什么？</font>\n<br>2. prepare the way for 为…铺路；引起；导致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These circumstances will lead up to war. 这种形势会导致战争。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The series of events led up to his resignation. 这一连串的事件导致了他的辞职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The border conflict led up to an allround war between the two countries. 边境冲突导致了两国间的全面战争。</font>\n
leak away	<font color=blue size=4>leak away</font>\n<br>be gradually lost 漏掉；逐渐失去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the continued loss of blood, his life was steadily leaking away. 他流血不止，在慢慢地死去。</font>\n
leak out	<font color=blue size=4>leak out</font>\n<br>1. go out through a hole 漏出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water is leaking out of the kettle. 这个壶在漏水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The oil has leaked out into the surrounding soil. 油已漏到周围的土地里。</font>\n<br>2. become known (probably by some unofficial means); become public 泄露；为公众所知（可能是通过非官方手段）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was plain that the news of his engagement had leaked out. 很明显，他的订婚消息已经泄露出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have leaked the information out to the press. 他们已把情报透露给新闻界了。</font>\n
lean on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>lean on/upon</font>\n<br>1. depend on; rely or draw upon for support or inspiration 依赖；从…中获得支持或启发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to make your own way in the world, and not lean on your father for the rest of your life. 今后你得自己闯天下，而不是依赖你的父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's fortunate that his cousin lives locally—he leant on her a lot in those first few weeks after his wife's death. 幸运的是他的表姐就住在当地—他在妻子去世后的最初几个星期里全靠表姐的帮助。</font>\n<br>2. pressure sb. by blackmailing, threats, physical violence in order to make him comply with a wish or request 强迫；威胁利诱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would gladly do what you ask if you only stopped leaning on me so hard. 我愿意照你的意思做，只是你不要这样强迫我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe'soft. He'll cooperate. He just needs leaning on a little. 乔生性软弱。只要给他点颜色看看，他就会和我们一起干的。</font>\n
leap forward	<font color=blue size=4>leap forward</font>\n<br>1. move suddenly 突然向前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse leaped forward, and I got out of the way only just in time. 马突然向前冲，我刚好及时地闪开了。</font>\n<br>2. develop very fast 迅速发展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Scientific discoveries have leapt forward in recent years. 科学发现近来日益增多。</font>\n
leap in the dark	<font color=blue size=4>leap in the dark</font>\n<br>step taken in ignorance of the consequence 不管结果如何贸然行事；鲁莽之举；冒险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The experiment was a leap in the dark. 此项实验实在是冒险。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm about to make my last voyage, a great leap in the dark. 我就要作最后的航行，一次大冒险。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will be a leap in the dark to make an important decision without investigation. 不进行任何调查就作出重要的决定将是冒险的行动。</font>\n
leap into	<font color=blue size=4>leap into</font>\n<br>suddenly enter 突然闯进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A great idea just leaped into my mind. 我突然想到一个绝妙的主意。</font>\n
leap out	<font color=blue size=4>leap out</font>\n<br>be noticeable 引人注目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His name leaped out at me from the newspaper. 他的名字出现在报上，引起了我的注意。</font>\n
learn of	<font color=blue size=4>learn of</font>\n<br>come to hear about 听说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you learn of my name? 你是怎么知道我的名字的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I learnt of your success in the newspaper. 我从报纸上得知你成功的消息。</font>\n
learn sthby heart	<font color=blue size=4>learn sthby heart</font>\n<br>learn by memory 默诵；暗记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone in the class has to learn by heart Lincoln's Gettysburg Address. 班上每一个学生都必须默诵林肯的盖茨堡演说词。</font>\n
leave alone	<font color=blue size=4>leave alone</font>\n<br>1. not bother or interfere with; not touch 不要打扰；不要碰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go way and leave me alone. 走开，不要管我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You leave my sister alone or I'll be telling my father. 别惹我妹妹，不然我要告诉我爸爸了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leave that machine alone. 别碰那台机器。</font>\n<br>2. cause sb. to remain alone 撇下…一个人；让…一个单独呆着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't want to be left alone. 我不愿一个人呆着。</font>\n
leave behind	<font color=blue size=4>leave behind</font>\n<br>go away without 遗留；留下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you tell me the time? I've left my watch behind. 你能告诉我时间吗？我没带表。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I realized I'd left my umbrella behind on the train. 我意识到把雨伞忘在火车上了。</font>\n
leave for	<font color=blue size=4>leave for</font>\n<br>go to; start for 离此而去…；往…出发…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are leaving for Canada next week. 下星期我们要去加拿大。</font>\n
leave off	<font color=blue size=4>leave off</font>\n<br>1. stop 停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please leave off biting your nails. 请不要咬指甲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told the boys to leave off teasing his little brother. 他要那些孩子们停止戏弄他的小弟弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we should leave off now and have a cup of tea. 我想我们该停下来喝杯茶了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We leave off work at 12. 我们12点钟下班。</font>\n<br>2. no longer wear; stop wearing or using 不再穿；不再使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They left their woollen underwear when the weather got warm. 天气转暖时，他们不穿羊毛衫了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She left her coat off when she went out. 她没穿外衣就出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have left off my overcoat. 我已经不穿大衣了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has left off all ather medicines. 他已停服其它所有的药。</font>\n
leave on	<font color=blue size=4>leave on</font>\n<br>1. continue wearing 继续穿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel a bit cold so I'll leave my coat on. 我觉得有点冷，所以外套就不脱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's rude for a man to leave his hat on indoors. 一个男子在室内仍戴着帽子是不礼貌的。</font>\n<br>2. allow to stay in place or position 使…留在原处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Leave the cloth on. I want to lay the table for supper. 台布不要取下，我要摆桌子开晚饭了。</font>\n<br>3. not switch off 不关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The electric fire had been left on overnight. 电炉整夜没有关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't leave the light on when you go out? 出去时，请关灯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want to leave the soup on all morning to thicken it. 我想把这个汤煮一个上午，让汤煮稠点。</font>\n
leave out	<font color=blue size=4>leave out</font>\n<br>1. omit 省略；删去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can leave out the third sentence. 我们可以删去第3句。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can leave out the details; just give us the main facts. 你可以省去细节，就告诉我们主要的事实就行了。</font>\n<br>2. neglect to put in 遗漏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In copying this paper, be careful not to leave out any word. 抄这个文件时，不要漏掉任何一个字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She left out an important detail in her account. 她的账目漏掉了一个重要的项目。</font>\n<br>3. exclude; ignore 排除；忽略；冷落（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please leave me out of your plans. 你的计划中请不要把我考虑在内。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't leave our teachers out from the invitations. 请不要忘记邀请我们的老师们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's Mary's own fault if she feels left out at the party; she makes no effort to be friendly to peple. 要是玛丽感到在晚会上遭冷落，那是她自己的过错，她一点也不想亲近人们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You left out the possibility that the train might be late. 你忽略了火车晚点的可能性。</font>\n<br>4. leave available 留下备用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you aren't home when I go to bed, I'll leave some food out for you. 如果我睡觉时你还没回来，我就给你留饭。</font>\n
leave sbto himself	<font color=blue size=4>leave sbto himself</font>\n<br>leave sb. to look after himself; not control sb. 听任某人自行其是；自己照看自己；不去管\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I decided to leave Jim to himself after he had refused to accept any of my suggestions. 吉姆拒绝我的任何建议之后，我决定一切由他去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children were left very much to themselves during the holidays. 孩子们在假期中可以自由活动。</font>\n
leave (up) to	<font color=blue size=4>leave (up) to</font>\n<br>give the choice or decision to 让…来决定、选择；把某事交给…处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since you don't want to decide, leave the matter up to your boss when he returns. 既然你不想作决定，就让你老板回来后作决定吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I left the choice of colours for the house up to my wife. 我让我妻子来选择房子的颜色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now you just leave it to me. 这事你交给我好了。</font>\n
lend/give a hand	<font color=blue size=4>lend/give a hand</font>\n<br>help; give assistance 帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please lend a hand with my luggage. 请帮我拿一下行李。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ask the boy to lend a hand with moving the piano. 让这男孩帮忙搬一下这架钢琴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dick saw a woman with a flat tire and offered to give her a hand with it. 狄克见一妇人轮胎泄气，就自告奋勇帮助她补胎。</font>\n
lend itself to	<font color=blue size=4>lend itself to</font>\n<br>give a chance for or be useful for; be possible or right for 适合；适宜于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This subject lends itself admirably to dramatic treatment. 这个题目极其适合写成剧本。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building lends itself to conversion into a theatre. 这座大楼很适合改成剧院。</font>\n
lend oneself to	<font color=blue size=4>lend oneself to</font>\n<br>give help or approval to; encourage; assist 帮助；协助；赞助；鼓励\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't lend yourself to such dishonest schemes. 不要参与这种欺诈的勾当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice wouldn't lend herself to the plot to hide the teacher's chalk. 艾丽斯不赞成要把教师的粉笔藏起来的鬼主意。</font>\n
lend to	<font color=blue size=4>lend to</font>\n<br>contribute 给予；使具有…作用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The support of the government lent importance to the study of the new economic theory. 政府的支持对研究那项新的经济理论起了重要的作用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The laboratory research will lend significance to the police analysis of criminal cases. 实验室的研究工作对警察分析案例将起到重要的作用。</font>\n
length by length	<font color=blue size=4>length by length</font>\n<br>by making gradual progress 渐渐地进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Length by length, a caterpillar got to the top of the tree. 毛虫缓缓地爬到了树的顶端。</font>\n
less than	<font color=blue size=4>less than</font>\n<br>not; little 不；不太\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were busy and less than delighted to have company that day. 那天我们很忙，不喜欢有客人来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was less than happy about going to the cinema that night. 那天晚上，他不高兴去看电影。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The road was something less than smooth. 那条路不太平坦。</font>\n
less than no time	<font color=blue size=4>less than no time</font>\n<br>very short time 很短时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can be ready to go in less than no time. 我们马上就可以准备出发。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took her less than no time to get dinner ready. 她很快就把饭菜做好了。</font>\n
let alone	<font color=blue size=4>let alone</font>\n<br>1. allow sb. to do sth. unaided; not interfere with 别管；别干涉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When joe gets mad, just let him alone. 乔发怒时不要去管他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please let my things alone. 请不要干涉我的事情。</font>\n<br>2. not to mention; to say nothing of 更不用说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't afford a bicycle, let alone a car. 我连一部自行车也买不起，更不用说买小轿车了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't have enough money for food, let alone amusements. 他连吃饭都不够，更不用说娱乐了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't speak to him, let alone trust him and lend him some money. 我理都不愿理他，更谈不上信任他，把钱借给他了。</font>\n
let/blow off steam	<font color=blue size=4>let/blow off steam</font>\n<br>1. let or make steam escape 排气；放气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The worker let off some steam because the pressure was too high. 那位工人排出一些水气，因为压力大高。</font>\n<br>2. get rid of physical energy or strong feeling through activity; in dulge in strong or violent language to relieve one's feeling 发泄精力或情绪；讲激烈而粗野的话以发泄感情；出气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the rain stopped, the boys let off steam with a ball game. 雨停后，孩子们赛球解闷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When men let off steam, they tend to shout; women, on the other hand, express their feelings by weeping. 男人发泄强烈感情时，倾向于大声喊叫；妇女则不然，用哭泣来发泄感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't take any notice of what he says; he's just letting off steam. 不要理睬他所说的话，他在出气罢了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill had to take his foreman's rough criticisms all day and he would blow off steam at home by scolding the children. 比尔整天挨领班的训责，回家后就拿孩子出气。</font>\n
let bygones be bygones	<font color=blue size=4>let bygones be bygones</font>\n<br>let the past be forgotten 既往不咎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a long angry quarrel, the two boys agreed to let bygones be bygones and made friends again. 两个孩子进行了长时间的激烈争吵，后来同意言归于好，既往不咎。</font>\n
let down	<font color=blue size=4>let down</font>\n<br>1. descend; lower 放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please let down the blinds. 请把百叶窗放下。</font>\n<br>2. disappoint; betray 使…失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The team felt that they had let the coach down. 队员们觉得他们让教练失望了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've been let down so many times by the importers, who always seem to be late delivering the goods. 进口商们已多次令我们失望，他们似乎总是要推迟交货。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He won't let you down; he's very reliable. 他不会让你失望的，他很靠得住。</font>\n<br>3. slow up; slacken 慢下来；松懈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse let down near the end of the race and lost. 那匹马在近终点时慢了下来，所以输了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let down even if the going is good. 即使在顺利的情况下也不要松劲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must not let down our vigilance against the enemy. 我们决不可放松对敌人的警惕性。</font>\n<br>4. lengthen; make (clothes) longer 延长；把（衣服）放长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She let the dress down, several centimetres. 她把这件衣服放长了几厘米。</font>\n<br>5. loosen and let fall 披散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She let her hair down. 她披散着头发。</font>\n<br>6. deflate 放气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A naughty boy has let down the back tyre of my bike. 一个顽皮的男孩把我自行车后胎的气给放了。</font>\n
let go	<font color=blue size=4>let go</font>\n<br>1. release; stop holding 释放；放手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy grabbed, Jack's coat and would not let go. 小男孩抓住杰克的衣服不放。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The balloon flew up into the air as soon as the child let if go. 那孩子一松手，气球就升上了天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let him go. 放他走。</font>\n<br>2. neglect; pay no attention to 忽视；不注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Robert let his teeth go when he was young and now he has to go to the deatist often. 罗勃特年轻时对自己的牙齿不注意，现在他不得不常去看牙科医生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After she was married, Jane let herselt go and was not pretty any more. 简结婚以后忽视了打扮自己，就不再漂亮了。</font>\n<br>3. weaken and break under pressure 破裂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old water pipe suddenly let go and water poured out of it. 旧水管突然破裂，水流了出来。</font>\n<br>4. allow sth. to pass; do nothing about 听其自然；放任；不予计较\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children teased Frank, but he smiled and let it go. 孩子们逗弗兰克，他笑笑就算了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When John was late, the teacher scolded him and let it go at that. 当约翰迟到时，老师训斥了他一顿以后就算了。</font>\n<br>5. discharge from a job; fire 撤职；革职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Wilson got into a quarrel with his boss and was let go. 威尔逊先生与他的老板吵了一架，被解雇了。</font>\n<br>6. make sth. go out quickly; shoot; fire 发射；射出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers let go a number of shots. 战士们连发了数枪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Paul was so angry that he let go a blow at the boy. 保罗生气挥拳揍那男孩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The truck driver saw the flat tire and let go a loud curse. 卡车司机看见轮胎漏气瘪了，大骂起来。</font>\n<br>7. be free in one's actions or talk; relax 行动或说话无拘束；轻松\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Brown let go at the reunion of his old class and had a good time. 布朗先生与老同学重聚时玩得轻松愉快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers worked hard all week, but on Saturday night they went to town and let themselves go. 工人们辛苦工作了一周，但在周六晚上则进城去放松放松。</font>\n
let in	<font color=blue size=4>let in</font>\n<br>1. (of water) enter by leakage （水）漏入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These rubber shoes are letting in water. They need repairing. 这双胶鞋漏水，得补一下了。</font>\n<br>2. admit; allow to enter or penetrate 容许进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better open the window and let in the light and fresh air. 你最好打开窗户让光线和新鲜空气进入室内。</font>\n
let in for	<font color=blue size=4>let in for</font>\n<br>bring sth. upon sb.;cause sb. to incur (a debt, an obligation, a task, etc.) 使某人招致某事；使某人卷入（债务、责任、任务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not feeling very pleased with those children; through their carelessness I've been let in for something like thirty dollars. 跟那些孩子们在一起感到不太愉快；由于他们不小心，使我花费了大约30美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's letting himself in for a lot of trouble. 他给自己惹来许多麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was let in for a good hundred pounds by his son's bankruptcy. 他儿子的破产使他也受到了足足100镑的损失。</font>\n
let in on	<font color=blue size=4>let in on</font>\n<br>share a secret with; allow sb. to know about sth. ; permit to participate in 透露秘密；让某人介入某事；准许加入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We mustn't let him in on our plans. 我们不应让他了解我们的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do let me in on your secret！一定得让我知道你们的秘密。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We re fused to let him in on any information concerning the research project. 我们拒绝告诉他有关那个研究项目的任何消息。</font>\n
let into	<font color=blue size=4>let into</font>\n<br>1. allow to enter 让…进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who let you into the building? 谁让你进入大楼的？</font>\n<br>2. put into the surface of 嵌入；插入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She let a piece of lace into her dress. 她在衣服上镶了一条花边。</font>\n<br>3. allow to share (a secret) 告之；使知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have let her into the secret. 我们已经把秘密告诉了她。</font>\n<br>4. assail either physically by blows or with words 责骂某人；拳打某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was so infuriated by what he said that without a word I let into him. 他说的话使我大怒，以致于我一句话没说就揍了他一顿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Brown rose to his feet and let into the last speaker. 布朗先生站起来，责骂前一个发言的人。</font>\n
let loose	<font color=blue size=4>let loose</font>\n<br>1. allow to go free; set free; loosen; release from restraint 放开；释放；松开；放出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmer opened the gate and let the bull loose in the pasture. 农夫打开门，把牛放到草地上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim caught Ruth' s arm and would not let loose. 吉姆抓住鲁思的手臂不放。</font>\n<br>2. give freedom to sb. to do sth.;allow sb. to speak or act freely 随心所欲；自由言论；不加限制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother let Jim loose on the apple pie. 母亲任吉姆吃苹果饼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who let this teacher loose on that class? 谁让这个老师随心所欲地管那个班的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told Henry that some 368day she was going to let loose and tell him what she thought of him. 老师告诉亨利总有一天她要痛快地说出她对他的看法。</font>\n
let off	<font color=blue size=4>let off</font>\n<br>1. explode; fire; release 放（枪、炮、烟火等）；排放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys were letting off fireworks. 孩子们在放烟火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engine let off steam in sudden blasts. 机车突然放出一股蒸汽来。</font>\n<br>In honour of the distinguished guest. they let off a salute of 21guns. 为向贵宾表示敬意，他们鸣礼炮21响\n<br>2. excuse from a penalty 免罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two boys were caught smoking in the school but the principal let them off with a warning. 两个男孩在学校抽烟，不过校长对他们提出警告后放了他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With your record, you can hardly expect to be let off lightly. 你有前科，很难指望会从轻发落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's been let off the dryingup again. 她再次忘记台词又没有受到批评。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The magistrate told the youths he would let them off this time, but that they would be severely punished if they appeared before him again. 地方法官告诉这些年轻人；他这次放过他们，但如果他们再次在他面前出现，他们将受到严惩。</font>\n<br>3. discharge; allow to get off 卸下；让…离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train stops to let off passengers on signal. 这列火车按信号停车让旅客下车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I asked the captain to let me off at the next port of call. 我请求船长在下个停靠岸让我下船。</font>\n<br>4. excuse from a task or an obligation 免除任务或责任等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary's mother said that she would let Mary off from washing the supper dishes. 玛丽的母亲准许玛丽晚餐的碗碟不洗了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory closed for a month in the summer and let the workers off. 工厂夏天停工一个月，放了工人的假。</font>\n<br>5. lease in portions; allow to rent a building in portions 分开出租\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The five floors of this large building were let off as separate flats. 这座大楼的5层全都分为套间出租。</font>\n
let on	<font color=blue size=4>let on</font>\n<br>1. allow to be known; reveal one's knowledge of (usu. used in the negative) 泄露（常用于否定式）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let on that I told you. 不要说出我告诉了你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was terrified at the information, but didn't let on. 她听到消息十分害怕，但没有泄露。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let on about what they did. 不要讲他们干的事。</font>\n<br>2. pretend; make believe 假装；装做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He let on that he did not see me. 他装做没有看见我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is not as rich as she lets on. 她并不象她装得那样有钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They let on that they didn't care about not being invited, but I could tell they were hurt. 他们未被邀请，作出满不在意的样子，但是我知道他们的自尊心受到了伤害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got the job by letting on that he had a lot of experience. 他装着很有经验的样子得到了这份工作。</font>\n
let onto	<font color=blue size=4>let onto</font>\n<br>reveal; inform; tell 告诉；通知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let onto Helen that we are planning to go to the movies tonight. 不要告诉海伦我们今晚要看电影。</font>\n
let out	<font color=blue size=4>let out</font>\n<br>1. rent out 租出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He used to let out cars. 他过去出租汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the park boats are let out for 3yuan per hour. 在公园里，可以以每小时3元的价格出租小游艇。</font>\n<br>2. allow to go out or escape 放出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guard let the prisoners out of jail to work in the garden. 看守放犯人出牢房，在园子里干活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me out！I'm locked in！让我出来！我被锁在里面了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor is letting her out of hospital next week. 医生打算下周让她出院。</font>\n<br>3. tell; reveal 泄漏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll never tell you another secret if you let this one out. 假如你把这个机密泄漏出去，有秘密的事我再也不告诉你了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who let out the exam results? They were supposed to be confidential until tomorrow. 谁泄露了考试结果？在明天以前这些结果都属于机密。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has let the news out. 有人把这个消息泄露出去了。</font>\n<br>4. make larger 放大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary's mother had to let out Mary's dress because she was growing so tall. 玛丽的母亲不得不把玛丽的衣服放大些，因为玛丽长得那么高。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If she gets much fatter she will have to let out all her dresses. 如果她继续发胖，她所有的衣服都得放宽。</font>\n<br>5. dismiss 解雇；革职；开除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop closed down and all the men were let out. 店关了门，所有的员工都被辞退了。</font>\n<br>6. terminate; be finished; end（学校）放学；（戏院）散场；（训练）结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does the university let out for the summer? 大学何时放暑假？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach let us out from practice at 3 o'clock. 训练到 3点钟，教练把我们解散了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were waiting for school to let out. 他们在等学校放学。</font>\n<br>7. make (a sound) come out of the mouth; utter 自口中发出（声音）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bee stung Charles. He let out a yell and ran home. 一只蜜蜂咬了查理，他大叫一声跑回家了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He let out a cry of pain as the nail went into his foot. 钉子扎进他的脚时，他痛苦地大喊了一声。</font>\n<br>8. release from further responsibility; release from an obligation 免除进一步的责任；免除义务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was glad to be let out of that nasty affair, and have someone more experienced handle the trouble. 我高兴的是我从那件讨厌的事情中解脱了，已让另外一个更有经验的人去处理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My flu let me out of attending the meeting. 由于患了流感；我参加不了那个会了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The regular teacher is back, that let me out. 正式的老师回来了，我可以解脱了。</font>\n<br>9. release from restraint; allow to gather speed 使放开速度；让…加速前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He turned into an express way and let the car out. 他把车子转入高速公路，然后加速前进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rider let out his horse to try to beat the one ahead of him. 骑士放马快跑想追上领先的那匹马。</font>\n
let up	<font color=blue size=4>let up</font>\n<br>1. lessen in intensity; diminish; slacken off 减少；放松\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's raining hard as ever. It's not letting up at all. 雨下得还是那么大，根本没有小下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Harry never lets up for a minute. 哈利一刻也没有松劲。</font>\n<br>2. stop working 停止；停止做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let up for a few minutes. You can't work hard all day. 歇一会吧，你不能整天苦干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor has been working for fifty hours without letting up. 医生已马不停蹄地连续工作了50小时。</font>\n<br>3. become easier, kinder or less strict 宽容（常与on 连用）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let up on Jane. She is sick. 对简宽容点，她病了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let up on him. He didn't mean any harm. 饶了他吧，他并没有什么恶意。</font>\n
level down	<font color=blue size=4>level down</font>\n<br>1. make level by lowering the height of 铲平；弄平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That path is too high; level it down from here. 那条路太高，从这里把它铲平。</font>\n<br>2. lower; reduce 降低；减低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must make sure the expansion of higher education does not level down university standards. 我们一定要做到既发展高等教育又不降低大学水平。</font>\n
level off	<font color=blue size=4>level off</font>\n<br>1. make flat or level 整平；弄平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bulldozers quickly levelled off the site. 推土机很快就把工地平整了。</font>\n<br>2. even off; become steady 稳定；达到平衡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After going up for half a year, the cost of living levelled off in September. 物价上涨了半年之后，在9月份稳定了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Production has levelled off now and we don't expect to increase it. 现在生产已经稳定，我们并不期望增加生产。</font>\n<br>3. return to a horizontal position in flight（飞机）恢复水平飞行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plane climbed to 10, 000 metres and then levelled off. 飞机升到1万米高度后就水平飞行了。</font>\n
level out	<font color=blue size=4>level out</font>\n<br>1. move horizontally (after climbing) ; remain steady（上升后）水平飞行；达到平衡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We climbed steeply after takeoff, and levelled out at 25, 000 feet. 我们起飞后就急剧上升，到达2万5千英尺时才水平飞行。</font>\n<br>2. remove by means of a lever 用杠杆移动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He levelled the stone out. 他用杠杆挪动那块石头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have tried to level him out of his powerful position. 他们试图把他从有权力的职务上拉下来。</font>\n<br>3. lift out 抬起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He levelled himself out of the chair. 他从椅子上站起来。</font>\n
level up	<font color=blue size=4>level up</font>\n<br>bring what is lower to an equality with what is higher 提升；提至高水平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old clerks with small salaries applied to have them levelled up to the salaries of the newcomers. 薪水低的老职员请求把他们的薪水提高到和新来的人一样高。</font>\n
lie about/around	<font color=blue size=4>lie about/around</font>\n<br>1. lie unused or unwanted 搁置不用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That old book was lying about for years before I finally threw it away. 那本旧书搁放了好几年不用，最后我把它扔掉了。</font>\n<br>2. be thrown about 到处乱放；乱撒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't leave your clothes lying about the room. 不要把衣服乱扔在房间里。</font>\n<br>3. lie idly doing nothing 闲躺着不干事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't lie about all day. 别整天躺着啥事也不干。</font>\n
lie back	<font color=blue size=4>lie back</font>\n<br>1. get into or be in a lying position 躺下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lie back, and you'll be more comfortable. 向后靠，这样你会舒服些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She lay back in bed. 她仰着躺在床上。</font>\n<br>2. stop working; rest 停止忙碌；休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a busy life he was content to lie back and take it easy. 经过一生忙碌的生涯后，他对能休息下来享受清闲的生活而感到满足。</font>\n
lie behind	<font color=blue size=4>lie behind</font>\n<br>1. be the cause of; be the explanation for 是…理由\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not sure what lay behind his remarks. 我不清楚他说这样的话的原因是什么。</font>\n<br>2. have happened to; be in the past 先于…存在；已成过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some difficulties lie behind us, but greater ones lie ahead. 有些困难已经过去，而更大的困难还在前面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Behind lay nothing but defeat; ahead lay the certainty of victory. 回顾过去，只有失败；展望未来，胜利在望。</font>\n
lie down	<font color=blue size=4>lie down</font>\n<br>1. recline 躺下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better go and lie down. 你还是去躺一下好。</font>\n<br>2. go to rest; sleep; wait 休息；睡觉；等候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I lay down for an hour. 我躺下休息了一个小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me lie down; I am very tired. 让我休息，我很疲倦。</font>\n<br>3. fail in response to obligations; prove disappointing; purposely fail to do one's job 令人失望；有意失职；偷懒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lay down on me. 他令我失望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you lie down on your job, you will lose it. 你如果故意偷懒，就会失业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bell isn't trying to learn his lessons. He is lying down on the job. 比尔不想学习，他是有意偷懒。</font>\n<br>4. submit tamely; accept 驯服；接受；忍受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lay down like a coward. 他象懦夫一样地屈服了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you don't expect me just to lie down and take his insults. 我想你不会要我容忍他的污辱的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men will not lie down under such treatment. 工人们不会逆来顺受这种待遇。</font>\n
lie in	<font color=blue size=4>lie in</font>\n<br>1. be in the power of 在…能力以内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have done everything that lies in my power. 我已尽了最大努力。</font>\n<br>2. centre in; exist in; be found in 集中于；在于；存在于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All their hopes lie in him. 他们把一切希望都寄托在他身上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chief difficulty lies in finding a good opportunity. 主要困难在于找到一个好时机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trouble lies in the engine. 毛病出在发动机上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His chief attraction lies in his character, not his looks. 他的魅力在于他的性格，而不是外貌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fundamental way out for agriculture lies in mechanization. 农业的根本出路在于机械化。</font>\n<br>3. stay in bed to await the birth of a child 分娩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is lying in. 她正在分娩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The time has come for her to lie in. 她生产的时候已经到了。</font>\n<br>4. stay in bed after the normal time for getting up 睡懒觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You ought to lie in tomorrow and catch up on your sleep. 你明天应当晚起，把你所缺的觉补上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She never lies in, even on Sunday mornings. 她从不睡懒觉，即使星期天早上也如此。</font>\n
lie off	<font color=blue size=4>lie off</font>\n<br>1. keep a little away from the shore; rest nearby 与陆地保持一段距离；在附近停泊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship is now lying off, ready to load up. 现在这艘船在附近停泊，等待装货。</font>\n<br>2. cease work for a time 歇工；暂停工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he makes a little money, he lies off and spends it. 他挣一点钱就不干活，将其花尽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men had to lie off for a week as the rain made building impossible. 大雨使建筑工程无法进行，工人们只好暂时歇工一星期。</font>\n
lie on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>lie on/upon</font>\n<br>1. be a matter of obligation or duty 为…义务或职责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It lies upon him to support his family. 赡养家庭是他的责任。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole responsibility lies upon me. 全部责任落在我的身上。</font>\n<br>2. depend on 依赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your success lies upon your effort. 你的成功归于你的努力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her life lies on the result of this operation. 她的生命取决于这次手术的结果。</font>\n<br>3. bear as a burden 压在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crime lay heavy on his conscience. 那罪行成为他良心上的沉重负担。</font>\n
lie over	<font color=blue size=4>lie over</font>\n<br>1. be postponed for action at some future time; be left waiting until a later time 推迟；延期；待以后处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let the matter lie over until the next committee meeting. 这件事留到下次委员会再讨论吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The decision must lie over until the next executive meeting. 这项决定必须留到下一次执委会讨论再定。</font>\n<br>2. (a note, payment, etc.) remain unpaid when overdue（票据、款项等）逾期未付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must first pay the rent lying over from last month. 你必须首先付清上月欠下的房租。</font>\n
lie up	<font color=blue size=4>lie up</font>\n<br>1. stay in bed or in one's room from illness (for a long period) 长期躺在床上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother was so ill after her operation that she had to lie up for a month. 母亲动完手术后病情十分严重，不得不在床上躺了一个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor advised me to lie up for a week. 医生建议我休息一周。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He intends to lie up for a time. 他打算休息一段时间。</font>\n<br>2. remain in hiding 藏匿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminals are lying up somewhere in those hills. 罪犯就藏在那些山里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They lay up by day, and by night came out to attack convoys. 他们白天隐藏起来，晚上出来袭击车队。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police suspect that the escaped convict is lying up in this city. 警察怀疑那逃犯可能隐藏在这个城市。</font>\n<br>3. be out of use 停止使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My car has been lying up all winter. 我的车整个冬天都没有使用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His boat is lying up for repairs. 他的船正在船坞里进行检修。</font>\n
light on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>light on/upon</font>\n<br>discover by chance; find or come upon unexpectedly 偶然发现；无意中发现；偶尔得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you look hard enough in this field, you may light on some valuable ancient coins. 你若在这块地上用心找，或许能找到一些有价值的古钱币。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The explorers suddenly lit upon an entrance to secrer chamber. 搜索人员突然发现了密室的一条通道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I was in a secondhand bookshop I lighted on a book I had been looking for for ages. 我在一家旧书店无意中得到了我已找了好久的书。</font>\n
light out	<font color=blue size=4>light out</font>\n<br>1. run as fast as one can 尽快跑；拼命跑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John lit out for home with the bully chasing him. 因为有流氓在追他，约翰拼命地往家跑。</font>\n<br>2. go away in a hurry; leave suddenly 匆匆离去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gang packed their bags and lit out of town. 那帮家伙收拾行李匆匆逃出了城。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The robbers lit out for Mexico. 盗匪们匆匆向墨西哥逃去。</font>\n
light up	<font color=blue size=4>light up</font>\n<br>1. fill with light; illuminate brightly or extensively 照亮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The searchlight lit up the whole area. 探照灯把整个地区都照亮了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house was all lit up as though a big celebration was going on. 满屋灯火通明，宛如在进行一场大庆典。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The streets were well lighted up. 街上灯火辉煌。</font>\n<br>2. switch on the headlights of a motor vehicle at dusk; switch on the street lighting（黄昏时）打开车灯；开亮街灯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's seven o'clock, and still one or two cars haven't lit up. 已经 7点钟了，仍有个别车辆没有开灯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At this time of the year, the official hour to light up is sixthirty. 在这个季节，规定开街灯的时间是6点半钟。</font>\n<br>3. light a pipe, cigarette or cigar 点上烟斗、香烟或雪茄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had difficulty lighting up my cigarrette in the strong wind. 刮这么大的风，我很难点着烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two men lit up their pipes and then sat down for a chat. 两个人点上烟斗，坐下来谈心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as the meal was over all the smokers lit up. 一吃完饭，所有抽烟的人都点上了烟。</font>\n<br>4. suddenly look pleased and happy; become cheerful 突然高兴；面露喜色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her face lit up with joy when she heard the good news. 当她听到这则好消息时，面露喜色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom will surely light up when he sees his new bike. 汤姆看到他的新自行车时，必定很高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her face lit up with happiness. 他脸上喜气洋洋。</font>\n
line out	<font color=blue size=4>line out</font>\n<br>1. mark with lines 用线画出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>let me line out the house on this piece of paper. 我来在这张纸上画个屋子。</font>\n<br>2. outline 草拟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We followed the plan lined out by the leading group. 我们遵照领导小组拟订的计划去做。</font>\n<br>\n<br>line up\n<br>1. form into a line; form a queue 排列一行；排长队\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The people lined up at the ticket office. 人们在售票处排队购票。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hate lining up in the cold to go to a cinema. 我讨厌为了看一场电影而在大冷天排长队。</font>\n<br>2. take places in a line or formation; stand side by side; form a line or pattern 排队；整队；排列起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The monitor lined up his class in the playground. 班长让全班学生在大操场排好队。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shoes of various sizes were lined up on the shelves. 货架上排列着各种尺码的鞋子。</font>\n<br>3. arrange 安排\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who lined you up to speak at the meeting? 谁安排你在大会上发言的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What songs are lined up for tonight's broadcast? 今晚的广播安排了哪些歌曲？</font>\n<br>4. make ready for action; take up a position, for election, etc.;complete a plan or agreement for; arrange 完成布置；安排妥当；为选举摆开阵势等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His friends lined up so many votes for him that he won the election. 他的朋友们帮他拉了很多票，所以他竞选成功了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The political parties have lined up behind their candidates. 各政党都已摆开阵势来支持他们的候选人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lined up a summer job before school was out. 学期结束之前他已经为自己安排好了一个暑假工作。</font>\n<br>5. obtain; contrive 获得；设法做到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have lined up a lot of support for their candidate. 他们已经为他们的候选人争得了许多票。</font>\n<br>6. become ready for action; come together in preparation or agreement 联合起来；一起行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Larry wanted to go to the seashore for the family vacation, but the rest of the family lined up against him. 莱里想要全家去海边度假，但是家中其他人一致反对。</font>\n
link up	<font color=blue size=4>link up</font>\n<br>join or combine 连接\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two cities are linked up by a river. 这两座城市靠一条河连接起来。</font>\n
listen for	<font color=blue size=4>listen for</font>\n<br>be eager or make an effort to catch the sound of 倾听；用心听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were listening for the sound from the next room. 他们正留心听隔壁屋子是否有声音。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please listen carefully for the telephone while I am upstairs. 我在楼上的时候，请注意听着电话。</font>\n
listen in	<font color=blue size=4>listen in</font>\n<br>1. listen to a radio broadcast, etc. 听广播等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were listening in to the President's speech. 我们在收听总统的广播讲话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He likes to listen in late at night. 他喜欢在深夜听广播。</font>\n<br>2. listen to the talk of others 偷听（讲话）；窃听（电话）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Mary talked to her boy friend on the telephone, her little brother listened in. 玛丽与男朋友打电话时，她弟弟在偷听。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police had tapped his tele phone wire and listened in on his conversations with his confederates. 警方在他的电话在线搭线，监听他和同伙的谈话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy listened in while we were discussing the problem. 我们在讨论这个问题时，这男孩在旁边听着。</font>\n
listen to	<font color=blue size=4>listen to</font>\n<br>give ear to; try to hear 倾听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All listened to him with great attention. 所有人都聚精会神听他说话。</font>\n
