little by little	<font color=blue size=4>little by little</font>\n<br>by degrees; gradually; step by step 渐渐地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He learned to cook little by little. 他慢慢学会了做菜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has become rich little by little. 他渐渐富裕起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John hadn't been able to quit smoking suddenly; he had to control his smoking desire little by little. 约翰不能立即把烟戒掉，他得慢慢地控制烟瘾。</font>\n
live by	<font color=blue size=4>live by</font>\n<br>make a living from; live by means of 靠…为生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to live by writing, but it didn't provide a good enough income. 她想靠写作为生，但收入仍然不够。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives by teaching. 他以教书为生。</font>\n
live by oneself	<font color=blue size=4>live by oneself</font>\n<br>live alone 独自生活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can you bear living by yourself? 你怎么能忍受独自一人生活呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the children have all gone abroad, she is now living by herself. 孩子们都出国了，她现在一个人生活。</font>\n
live by/on one's wits	<font color=blue size=4>live by/on one's wits</font>\n<br>live by dishonest means 靠行骗为生；靠小聪明过日子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Unable to get a job when he left school, the boy lived by his wits and in the end turned to crime. 这个男孩毕业以后找不到工作，靠行骗过日子，结果犯了罪。</font>\n
live down	<font color=blue size=4>live down</font>\n<br>live so as to allow (a scandal, disgrace, etc.) to be forgotten or forgiven; remove (blame, distrust) by good conduct 改过自新；被忘怀或原谅；变好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After her release from prison, she vowed to live down her crimes. 她从狱中被释放以后，发誓改过自新。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Frank was rather a bad boy, but he lived it down as he grew up. 法兰克是个相当坏的孩子，但当他长大后渐渐变好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will be difficult to live down this humiliation. 忘记这样的耻辱是困难的。</font>\n
live from hand to mouth	<font color=blue size=4>live from hand to mouth</font>\n<br>1. live without saving for the future 过日子不顾将来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They live from hand to mouth, without plan. 他们生活没有计划，过一天算一天。</font>\n<br>2. live on little money and spend it as fast as it comes in 生活仅够糊口；度日艰难；家无隔日之粮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John got very little pay, and the family lived from hand to mouth when he had no job. 约翰薪水本来很少，当他失业以后，日子就更艰难了。</font>\n
live in	<font color=blue size=4>live in</font>\n<br>live in a place, as an employee or member of an institution 在所在单位寄宿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Servants used to live in, and have their own rooms in their master'shouse. 过去佣人通常住在主人家中，而且还有自己的房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Students of this college can live in or get a room in town. 这个学院的学生可以住校也可以在城里找一个房间走读。</font>\n
live off	<font color=blue size=4>live off</font>\n<br>1. survive on 靠…活下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lived off fruit and nuts in the forest. 他在森林里靠水果和坚果维持生命。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These animals with long necks live off leaves of tall trees. 这些长颈动物吃高树的树叶。</font>\n<br>2. live at the cost of; depend on for support and shelter 靠…供应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been living off his brother for nearly a year. 近一年来他一直靠他兄弟接济。</font>\n<br>3. find enough food or income 寻求足够的食物或收入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will not be able to live off her writing. 靠写作她是难以谋生的。</font>\n
live on	<font color=blue size=4>live on</font>\n<br>1. have…as food or diet; rely on as food 以…为食\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They live chiefly on rice. 他们以米为主食。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives on plain food. 他靠粗茶淡饭度日。</font>\n<br>2. depend upon for support, etc. 靠…过活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can he manage to live on that pension? 依靠那点养老金他怎样生活呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lost his job and lived on credit. 他失去了工作，靠借贷过日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't live on air！我总不能靠喝西北风过日子！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't live on rumourmongering and lying. 不要靠造谣说谎过日子。</font>\n<br>3. continue to live; continue 继续活着；继续存在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will die, but his fame will live on after him. 他是要死的，但是他的声誉将永存。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These traditions will live on for centuries. 这些传统将世代相传。</font>\n<br>live on one's name／reputation keep one's position or continue to earn money because one has been successful in the past 靠过去的名声维持生活（或挣钱）；吃老本\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom has only written one bestselling book; he can't live on his reputation for ever. 汤姆只写了一本畅销书，他不能只靠这本书的名声过一辈子。</font>\n
live out	<font color=blue size=4>live out</font>\n<br>1. stay alive through; survive; last through; endure to the end of 活过（一段时期）；保持寿命；忍受到最后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lived out the earthquake, but his house was completely destroyed. 他虽然经历地震而活过来了，但他的房子彻底完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient lived out another month. 病人又活了一个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I doubt if she'll live out the winter. 我怀疑她是否能熬过这个冬天。</font>\n<br>2. live outside a place of work or institution 在所在单位外寄宿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My servant lives out. 我家的佣人不住在我家。</font>\n<br>3. finish (a period of time) ; spend 完成（一段时间）；消磨时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After retiring, John and his wife lived out their lives in Florida. 退休后，约翰和他太太在佛罗里达度过余生。</font>\n
live through	<font color=blue size=4>live through</font>\n<br>experience and survive 经历…而未死；活过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old worker who spoke to us yesterday had lived through the three revolutionary civil wars. 昨天跟我们讲话的那位老人经历过3次国内革命战争。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think the old man will manage to live through another bad winter. 我想这位老人熬不过明年的严冬了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All those who lived through the earthquake still have fear in their hearts. 所有经历过那次地震的人至今仍然心有余悸。</font>\n
live up to	<font color=blue size=4>live up to</font>\n<br>1. reach or maintain a certain high standard 达到；不辜负（期望）；无愧于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This car wil certainly live up to all your expectations if you buy it, sir. 如果你买这辆车的话，先生，它将肯定会使你一切如愿的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was clear that he would never live up to his father's expectations. 很显然他永远也达不到他父亲对他的期望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll live up to what our Party expects of us. 我们决不辜负党对我们的期望。</font>\n<br>2. act according to; agree with; follow 遵守（原则）；履行（诺言）等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Students should live up to certain standards of behaviour. 学生应该遵守一定的行为准则。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is difficult to live up to the principles of the Christian religion. 实行基督教的信条是不容易的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must live up to your promises. 你必须履行你的诺言。</font>\n
live with	<font color=blue size=4>live with</font>\n<br>1. dwell with 和…住在一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It'always better to live with someone you respect because respect breeds confidence. 最好和你所尊敬的人生活在一起，因为尊敬会产生信任。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She expects to live with her classmates. 她想和她同学住在一起。</font>\n<br>2. accept without protest; resign to; put up with 接受；忍受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whether you like it or not, you will have to live with the new tax law. 不管你喜欢与否，你得接受新的税法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must live with the fact that you're no longer as young as you were. 你必须承认，你已经不象过去那样年轻了。</font>\n
long for	<font color=blue size=4>long for</font>\n<br>expect anxiously; greatly desire 渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People are longing for peace. 人们正渴望和平。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's been raining for days, and we are all longing for some sunshine. 一连下了好几天雨，我们渴望太阳出来。</font>\n
look about/around	<font color=blue size=4>look about/around</font>\n<br>1. be on the watch; be on the lookout 提防；留心；注视；戒备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you ride in the street you must look about lest you bump into someone. 在街上骑自行车时，你必须留神四周，免得撞着别人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look about before you cross the street. 过马路前，要四下看看。</font>\n<br>2. turn one's eyes to; go about observing in (a country, town, etc.) 观察；察看；游览\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They spent two months in New York looking about the city. 他们在纽约花了两个月的功夫游览该城。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy looked about with great interest. 这男孩怀着极大的兴趣四周看看。</font>\n<br>3. inspect or survey (moving about while doing so) 视察；调查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must look about before making the decision. 你得考虑好了再作决定。</font>\n<br>4. search around 四处寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm looking about for a house. 我正在找房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For a whole month Bill went here and there, looking about for a job. 整整一个月，比尔到处奔波找工作。</font>\n
look after	<font color=blue size=4>look after</font>\n<br>1. take care of; attend to 照顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's mother told him to look after his younger brother. 约翰的母亲告诉他好好照顾弟弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has looked after her elderly parents for many years. 多年来她一直照顾她年迈的父母。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he went to Europe, Mr. Jenkins left his son to look after the business. 詹金斯先生去欧洲时，把生意交给儿子照管。</font>\n<br>2. follow (a departing person or thing) with the eye 目送\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My mother stood at the gate and looked after us as we walked toward the railway station. 我妈妈站在大门口，目送着我们向火车站走去。</font>\n<br>3. pay attention to; concern oneself with 对…关注；为…操心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He knows how to look after his own interests. 他知道如何照顾到他自己的利益。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't look after your own interests to the exclusion of those of others. 不要只顾自己的利益而不顾别人的利益。</font>\n
look ahead	<font color=blue size=4>look ahead</font>\n<br>think of and prepare for future needs 考虑到将来；展望未来；预料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must look ahead before we go further in the matter. 在进一步进行这件事情之前，我们必须考虑得远一些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are looking ahead to a prosperous future. 我们预料将会有一个繁荣昌盛的未来。</font>\n
look at	<font color=blue size=4>look at</font>\n<br>1. watch 看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father always looks at me with love in his eyes. 父亲总带着慈祥的眼光看着我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everybody looked at the hero with great admiration. 大家都以钦佩的目光注视这位英雄。</font>\n<br>2. have a way of thinking or feeling toward; think about sth. in a certain way; consider 对…持某种看法或感觉；考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Is he a hero or a villain? That depends on how you look at it. 他是英雄还是恶魔？那要取决于你如何看待他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should look at problems from different aspects, not from just one. 看问题要从各个方面去看，不能只从单方面看。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he looks at is its economy. 他是从经济的角度看问题的。</font>\n<br>3. judge by the outward appearance 从表面看来；从外观来看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To look at her, you'd never guess that she is a university professor. 从外表看，你决不会猜到她是一位大学教授。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building is not much to look at. 这幢房子的式样不怎么好看。</font>\n<br>4. examine; inspect 检查；察看；调查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better have your ankle looked at by the doctor. 你最好让医生检查一下你的踝骨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you asked the plumber to come and look at the leaking pipe? 你叫管道工来检查过漏水的管子了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must look at all the facts. 我们必须调查所有事实。</font>\n<br>5. consider or accept (a proposal, suggestion, offer, etc.) (usu. used in negative form) 考虑或接受（建议、提供等）（通常用否定式）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't look at a job like that. 我不愿接受那样的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the way he treated her, she wouldn't look at another man. 她领略了他对待她的方式以后，就不愿再和任何男人打交道了。</font>\n
look back	<font color=blue size=4>look back</font>\n<br>1. review the past ; think of what has happened 回顾过去；回想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we look back, we will realize the tremendous changes reform has made. 回顾过去，我们就会发现改革带来的巨大变化。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looked back with remorse on the serious mistakes he had made. 他回顾自己所犯的严重错误，深感悔恨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As John looked back, his life seemed good to him. 约翰回顾过去的生活时，他觉得过得不错。</font>\n<br>2. show signs of retrogression or interrupted progress 后退；停止不前；畏缩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't look back; you will succeed. 不要畏缩，你一定会成功的。</font>\n
look black	<font color=blue size=4>look black</font>\n<br>1. look angry 面现怒容\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looked black at his enemy. 他怒视敌人。</font>\n<br>2. appear threatening; indicate misfortune（形势等）看上去严峻；呈现危机\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The future looked black when father got hurt and could not work. 父亲受了伤不能去上班，前景很严峻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As prices dropped lower and lower, things looked black for Henry's company. 价格一再下跌，亨利的公司面临了危机。</font>\n
look blank	<font color=blue size=4>look blank</font>\n<br>appear astonished, confused or perplexed 吃惊；茫然不知所措\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looked blank when he was informed of his dismissal. 听说他被解雇时，他茫然不知所措。</font>\n
look blue	<font color=blue size=4>look blue</font>\n<br>1. look unhappy; look disheartened or dejected 愁眉不展；沮丧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She looks blue all day. 她整日愁眉不展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The banker looked blue when he read of the decline in stocks. 那位银行家读到股票下跌的新闻时，神情十分沮丧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are looking blue, what's the matter? 你愁眉苦脸，出了什么事啦？</font>\n<br>2. have no hope 无希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Things look blue. 事情没有希望了。</font>\n
look down one's nose at	<font color=blue size=4>look down one's nose at</font>\n<br>feel scorn at; think of as worthless 鄙视；瞧不起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looks down his nose at his classmates'interest in Jazz. 他鄙视班上的同学醉心于爵士乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jerry was the athlete who looked down his nose at the weak students. 杰里是位运动员，他看不起身体不强壮的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why do you always look down your nose at people who aren't dreesed as smartly as you? 你为什么总要看不起那些穿着不如你潇洒的人呢？</font>\n
look down upon	<font color=blue size=4>look down upon</font>\n<br>despise; scorn; consider inferior 蔑视；轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack looked down upoo Alf for his poor manners. 杰克因阿尔夫举止粗鲁而瞧不起他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone looks down upon you, just because you've not got a job. 大家都瞧不起你，就是因为你没有工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are snobs. That is why they look down upon us. 他们是势利眼，这就是他们看不起我们的原因。</font>\n
look for	<font color=blue size=4>look for</font>\n<br>1. try to find; seek; search for 寻找；寻求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is looking for a job. 他在找工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are looking for an ambitious young assistant. 我们正在找一名有雄心壮志的青年助手。</font>\n<br>2. expect 期待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob wouldn't go for a ride with other boys because he was looking for a phone call from Julie. 鲍勃不肯与其他男孩一起去兜风，因为他在等朱丽的电话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's clear that the result of the experiment was better than we had been looking for. 很明显，试验的结果要比我们预料的好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We didn't look for such a success. 这样的成功是我们没想到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't look for any help from him. 别期待他会帮助你。</font>\n<br>3. do things that cause (one's own trouble) 自找（麻烦）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe often gets into fights because he is always looking for trouble. 乔常跟人家打架，因为他总是惹麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you say the opposite of everything that others say, you are looking for a quarrel. 假若你跟人家唱反调，你就是在自找麻烦。</font>\n
look forward to	<font color=blue size=4>look forward to</font>\n<br>expect; be eager for; anticipate 期待；盼望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Frank was looking forward to that evening's date. 弗兰克期待着那天晚上的约会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim has been working hard and looks forward to spending his vacation lying on the beach doing nothing. 吉姆一直工作努力，他渴望能躺在海边什么也不干，度过假期。</font>\n
look in on	<font color=blue size=4>look in on</font>\n<br>make a short visit; drop in 拜访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On his way downtown, Jim looked in on his aunt. 吉姆在进城的路上顺道看望了他的婶母。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll look in on you again sometime, Mary！Bye for now！过些时候我会再来看你的，玛丽！再见！</font>\n
look in the eye/face	<font color=blue size=4>look in the eye/face</font>\n<br>face bravely or without shame; meet with a steady look 勇敢对待；直视；面对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary looked the gangster in the eye, and he turned away without hurting her. 玛丽面对歹徒面无惧色，结果歹徒逃走，没有伤害她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I promised to write to Julie while I was on vacation, and if I don't do it, I won't be able to look her in the eye. 我答应在假期中给朱丽写信，如果不写，我将不好意思见她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had an easy conscience and could look everybody in the face. 他心中坦然，什么人都敢正视。</font>\n
look into	<font color=blue size=4>look into</font>\n<br>1. examine; inspect; investigate 调查；研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He promised me to look into the matter. 他答应我调查此事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Jones said he was looking into the possibility of buying a house. 琼斯先生说他正在研究买房子的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government will look into how to reduce unemployment. 政府将研究如何降低失业率。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thank you very much for the information, sir; I'll get one of our detectives to look into the matter. 非常感谢你提供这些情况，先生，我将指派一名侦探调查此事。</font>\n<br>2. dip into (a book, etc.); consult (a book, etc.) in a rapid or cursory manner 浏览（书等）；快速或草率地查阅（书等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I usually look into a book before deciding whether to read it. 我通常在决定是否读这本书之前先浏览一下。</font>\n<br>3. make a brief call or visit to; enter (a house, etc.) for a few moments in passing 对…作暂短的访问或参观；顺便进入（房屋等）看看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll look into the library on the way home to borrow some books for my children. 在回家的路上，我将顺便去图书馆给孩子们借几本书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must look into the garage on the way home to book a service for the car. 回家时我得顺路到汽车修理厂去预约检修汽车的事情。</font>\n
look on to	<font color=blue size=4>look on to</font>\n<br>face 朝向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This building looks on to the public centre square. 这个建筑物面朝中心广场。</font>\n
look out	<font color=blue size=4>look out</font>\n<br>1. be careful; watch 小心；注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look out！ A train is coming. 注意！火车来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look out when you're crossing the street. 过马路要小心。</font>\n<br>2. search for 寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go through the books in our library and look out any that you would like to borrow. 到我们的图书馆去仔细找，把你要借的书挑出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's looked out some clothes for her trip. 她为自己的旅行挑选了几件衣服。</font>\n
look out for	<font color=blue size=4>look out for</font>\n<br>1. watch out for; keep a watch for 密切注意；提防\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you're eating fish, look out for the bones. 吃鱼的时候，当心鱼刺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must look out for catching cold. 你得小心，不要感冒了。</font>\n<br>2. seek if one can find 寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you go to the station and look out for your uncle? 你去火车站找你叔叔吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have been looking out for a new house, but the ones we've seen have all been too expensive. 我们一直在找一所新房子，但是我们看的几所房子都要价太高。</font>\n<br>3. take care of 照顾；照看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You needn't worry about me, I can look out for myself. 你不用替我担心，我会照顾自己的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you're catching the same train as me, I'll look out for you. 如果你要和我同乘一次火车，我会照料你的。</font>\n
look out upon/on	<font color=blue size=4>look out upon/on</font>\n<br>face; overlook 面对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their rear windows look out upon a lovely garden. 他们的后窗面对一个美丽的花园。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our apartment looks out on a river. 我们的公寓房间面对一条河。</font>\n
look over	<font color=blue size=4>look over</font>\n<br>1. examine carefully or fully 全面或仔细检查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have looked over the accounts. 他们已经查过账目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I want to look over these exercises before I give them to the teacher. 交给老师之前，我要把这些作业检查一遍。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager has looked over your work and has some comments to make. 他仔细地检查了你的工作，并且要提出一些看法。</font>\n<br>2. fail to see or notice ; pass over without punishing 忽略；宽恕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has done wrong but the teacher will look over it this time. 他做错了，但老师这次将原谅他。</font>\n<br>I'll look over your carelessness this time,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>but be more careful in future. 这次我原谅你的粗心大意，但以后得细心点。</font>\n<br>3. revise 复习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I should look over my notes before the exam. 考试前我得复习我的笔记。</font>\n<br>4. inspect by making a tour of (a house, etc.) 仔细查看；巡视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must look the school over before sending our son there. 我们得先去仔细考察一番这所学校，再决定是否把儿子送去学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should look over the house before you decide to move in. 在决定搬进去之前，你必须先去看一下房子。</font>\n<br>5. peer over 从…上面看过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief pulled himself to the top of the wall and looked over. 小偷爬上墙头观望。</font>\n
look round	<font color=blue size=4>look round</font>\n<br>1. examine possibilities before deciding sth. 事前仔细考虑；慎思而后行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't make a hurried decision; look round well first. 不要忙于做决定，先好好考虑一下。</font>\n<br>2. look in all directions 四下环顾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't look round; I don't want him to notice us. 不要四下张望，我不想让他注意我们。</font>\n<br>3. go about observing in; visit; inspect; go sightseeing 四处游览；参观；视察\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do we have time to look round before lunch? 午饭前我们还有时间逛逛吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party was looking round the factory. 这一行人在参观工厂。</font>\n
look sharp	<font color=blue size=4>look sharp</font>\n<br>hurry 赶快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look sharp！ We haven't much time to waste. 赶快！我们没多少时间可以浪费。</font>\n
look through	<font color=blue size=4>look through</font>\n<br>1. study; examine 温习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look through your notes before the examination. 考试前把你的笔记从头至尾看一遍。</font>\n<br>2. inspect carefully 仔细查看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I looked through my drawer, but I could not find my keys. 我仔细查过抽屉，但是找不到钥匙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to look through those reports before you attend the meeting. 开会前，你必须把那些报告看一遍。</font>\n<br>3. not see sb. or sth. that is clearly visible; deliberately ignore sb. one can plainly see 故意视而不见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I met him on the way home yesterday, but he just looked straight through me. 昨天我在回家的路上碰见了他，但他却故意不理睬我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must be blind, I was standing ten yards away, and you looked straight through me. 你一定瞎眼了，当时我站在离你只有10码远的地方，你竟看不到我。</font>\n<br>4. survey or scan (a book, paper, etc.) often briefly 粗略地检查、浏览或翻阅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I usually look through newspapers after supper. 晚饭后我常常浏览一下报纸。</font>\n
look to	<font color=blue size=4>look to</font>\n<br>1. attend to ; take care of ; give attention to 照管；照顾；注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president assigned a man to look to our needs. 总统派了一个人来对我们要求的东西作出安排。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must each look to our own work. 我们每个人都必须负责自己的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look to it that this doesn't happen again. 注意不要让这种事再发生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look to your manner, my boy, don't be so rude. 注意礼貌，孩子，别这么无礼。</font>\n<br>2. depend on; turn to for help 依赖；指望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They all look to you for help. 他们全都依赖你的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is ashamed to look to others for assistance. 他不好意思求别人帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We looked to him to settle most of the troubles that arose among us. 我们都指望他来解决我们中间产生的大部分问题。</font>\n<br>3. look forward to; expect 预期；期待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We look to the day when world peace will be a reality. 我们期待着世界和平实现的一天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We looked to her for a solo. 我们希望她来一个独唱。</font>\n<br>4. (a house, a building, etc.) face 面向；朝向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house looks to the south. 这房子朝南。</font>\n
look up	<font color=blue size=4>look up</font>\n<br>1. call on sb ; pay a visit 访问或拜访某人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do look me up next time you are in town. 下次进城请一定来看我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must look up Uncle George. I've heard he's in bed with arthritis. 我应该去看看乔治叔叔，听说他因关节炎卧床不起了。</font>\n<br>2. search for in a dictionary, a reference book, etc. 查阅字典或参考书等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you look up the time of the next train to Beijing? 你能查一查下一趟去北京的火车时间吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll look it up in the encyclopaedia. 我将在百科全书中查阅它。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't know the meaning of a word, look it up in the dictionary. 如果你不懂一个词的意思，就查一查词典。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is looking a name up in the telePhone directory. 他在电话簿里找一个人的名字。</font>\n<br>3. rise in price 上涨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The price of goods is looking up. 物价正在上涨。</font>\n<br>4. be improving; promise more success 好转；渐有起色；进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather is looking up at last. 天气终于好起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Share prices are looking up again！So is business. 股票行情又见涨！生意也有了起色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first year was tough, but business looked up after that. 头一年很困难，但后来生意就兴旺起来了。</font>\n<br>5. raise eyes 仰望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She looked up and saw me. 她抬头看见了我。</font>\n<br>6. seek and find 寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While he was in Chicago Henry looked up a friend of college days. 亨利在芝加哥时，寻找一位大学时代的朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I had known you were in the office building, I would have looked you up. 如果知道你在办公楼里，我就来找你了。</font>\n
look (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>look (up) on</font>\n<br>1. watch without taking part; be a spectator 旁观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I looked on as they tried to fix the machinewhich had broken down. 当他们在修理坏的机器时，我在一旁看着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children played in the park while their mother looked on. 孩子们在公园里玩，他们的母亲在一旁看着。</font>\n<br>2. regard; consider; think of 认为；看待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know how you look upon this matter. 我不知道你怎么看待这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's always been looked on as one of the best lawyers in town. 他一直被认为是城里最好的律师之一。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is looked upon as a great authority on the tax system. 在税收制度方面他被看作是一位大权威。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should look on the bright side of things. 我们应该看到事物光明的一面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They all looked on him as a member of their family. 他们都把他看作是自家人。</font>\n
look up to	<font color=blue size=4>look up to</font>\n<br>admire; respect highly 尊敬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Smith had taught for many years, and all the students looked up to him. 史密斯先生执教多年，他的学生都非常尊敬他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was always taught to look up to older people. 他接受的教育总是要尊敬老人。</font>\n
lose contact with	<font color=blue size=4>lose contact with</font>\n<br>lose track of 与…失去联系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have lost contact with him since he left last summer. 自他去年夏天离开后，我们就与他失去了联系。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was friendly with many people at college, but I've lost contact with most of them now. 我上大学时有许多朋友，但现在我已和大多数人失去了联络。</font>\n
lose heart	<font color=blue size=4>lose heart</font>\n<br>feel discouraged 气馁；失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee lost heart when money given by supporters fell by 50％in three months. 当赞助者的钱在3个月以内减少了百分之五十时，委员会失去了信心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The team had won no games and it lost heart. 球队一场未赢，球员们很失望。</font>\n
lose oneself	<font color=blue size=4>lose oneself</font>\n<br>1. lose one's way 迷路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We lost ourselves in the dark. 黑暗中我们迷了路。</font>\n<br>2. hide 隐藏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pickpocket lost himself in the crowd and escaped the police. 小偷躲进人群，逃过了警察的追捕。</font>\n<br>3. become absorbed in 耽于…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sometimes Harry would lose himself in a book for an afternoon. 有时哈里整个下午都泡在书中。</font>\n
lose one's head	<font color=blue size=4>lose one's head</font>\n<br>become upset; lose one's selfcontrol 惊慌失措；失去控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is liable to lose his head. 他容易发脾气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the politician hadn't gotten angry and lost his head, he never would have slandered his opponent. 如果那个政治家不是生气并且失去控制的话，他是决不会诽谤他的反对者的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Seeing the other car coming toward him at such speed, John lost his head and drove up over the curb into a tree. 看见另一部小汽车飞速向他开过来，约翰惊慌失措把车子开到路边的镶边石上，撞到树上去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She lost her head when she found the house on fire. 她发现房子着火时惊慌失措。</font>\n
lose one's tongue	<font color=blue size=4>lose one's tongue</font>\n<br>be too embarrassed or surprised to talk 张口结舌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lost his tongue when he was introduced to the audience. 当他被介绍给观众时，他不知说什么是好。</font>\n
lose one's way	<font color=blue size=4>lose one's way</font>\n<br>go in a wrong direction and become lost while trying to find a place 迷路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to be so late but I lost my way; I went right instead of left on Fifth Street. 很抱歉我这么迟才来，我迷路了，在第5大街应向左拐，但我向右拐了。</font>\n
lose sight of	<font color=blue size=4>lose sight of</font>\n<br>1. fail to see 看不见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I watched the plane go higher and higher until I lost sight of it. 我看着飞机越飞越高，直到看不见为止。</font>\n<br>2. forget ; overlook 忘记；忽略\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Johnny was so interested in the game that he lost sight of the time. 乔尼对比赛兴趣特浓，连时间也忘记了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No matter how rich and famous he became, he never lost sight of the fact that he was born in the slums. 无论他多么富有和有名气，他从不忘记他出生于贫民窟。</font>\n<br>3. lose contact with; do not hear from 不得音讯；失去联络\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have lost sight of my old friend for many years. 我已多年得不到我的老朋友的音讯了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have lost sight of him since he went abroad. 他出国以后，我们就和他失去了联系。</font>\n
lose track of	<font color=blue size=4>lose track of</font>\n<br>1. forget about 忘记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John lost track of the money he spent. 约翰忘了他花了多少钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom's work was so interesting that he lost track of the time. 汤姆的工作十分的有趣，以至于他忘了时间。</font>\n<br>2. be unable to find; misplace 找不到；错放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She lost track of her umbrella at the office, so she borrowed her friend's. 她把伞丢在办公室了，因此她借了她朋友的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was so bored that I lost track of what he was saying. 我烦透了，忘了他讲了些什么。</font>\n
loyal to	<font color=blue size=4>loyal to</font>\n<br>faithful to 忠于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is loyal to the people. 他忠于人民。</font>\n
made do (with, without) 	<font color=blue size=4>made do (with, without) </font>\n<br>manage 凑合；对付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This motel isn't what we wanted, but we must make do. 这家汽车旅馆不是我们想住的，但我们只好将就一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'll make do with the old typewriter until the new one arrives. 新打字机到之前她将凑合着用旧的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If yod don't have the right tool for the job, we'll have to make do without it. 假如你没有干这活的适当工具，咱们只得对付着干。</font>\n
made up of	<font color=blue size=4>made up of</font>\n<br>composed of; consisting of; comprising 由…组成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee is made up of seven members. 委员会由7人组成。</font>\n
major in	<font color=blue size=4>major in</font>\n<br>specialize in the study of 专业是…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you majoring in English literature? 你的专业是英国文学吗？</font>\n
make a dent in	<font color=blue size=4>make a dent in</font>\n<br>1. make less by a very small amount; reduce slightly 略为减少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy shoveled and shoveled, but he didn't seem to make a dent in the pile of sand. 这男孩铲了又铲，可他好象并没有把沙铲走多少。</font>\n<br>2. make a first step towards success in 取得进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter studied all evening, but hardly made a dent in his homework. 彼得整晚都在学习，但他的作业似乎没有进展。</font>\n
make a difference	<font color=blue size=4>make a difference</font>\n<br>be of importance 关系重大；重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It does make a difference. 那确实是很重要的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's score on the test will make the difference between his passing or failing the course. 约翰这次考试的得分关系着他这门功课能否通过。</font>\n
make a face	<font color=blue size=4>make a face</font>\n<br>make faces 做苦脸；扮鬼脸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made a face when I told her to take the medicine. 我要她吃药时，她做了个鬼脸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child made a face when he was scolded. 这孩子被训时做了一个鬼脸。</font>\n
make a fool of	<font color=blue size=4>make a fool of</font>\n<br>trick; deceive 愚弄；欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did not know his roommate was making a fool of him. 他不知道他的室友在愚弄他。</font>\n
make a fortune	<font color=blue size=4>make a fortune</font>\n<br>gain wealth; become rich 发财\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went to Australia and soon made a fortune. 他去澳大利亚，不久便发了财。</font>\n
make after	<font color=blue size=4>make after</font>\n<br>chase; follow 追逐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made after the enemy officer regardless of the danger to himself. 他不顾个人安危追逐敌军官。</font>\n
make a fuss about/over	<font color=blue size=4>make a fuss about/over</font>\n<br>show unnecessary nervousness or excitement 大惊小怪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't make a fuss over such a thing. 请不要为这点小事大惊小怪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made a tremendous fuss about it. 这件事她闹得满城风雨。</font>\n
make a go/success of	<font color=blue size=4>make a go/success of</font>\n<br>cause to be a success; produce good results 使成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In brief, we should make a success of the conference. 总之，这次会议我们要开好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several times I thought in despair, “It's no good, we'll never make a go of it. ”有好几次我绝望地想：“毫无办法，我们决不会成功的。”</font>\n
make allowance (s) for	<font color=blue size=4>make allowance (s) for</font>\n<br>1. take into consideration 考虑（到）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor made allowance for the growth of the boy and didn't cut his coat small. 裁缝考虑到孩子会长大，没有把他的外衣裁小。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The court was asked to make allowances for his age. 法院被要求考虑他的年龄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It would be sensible to add a further￡200 to the budget to make allowance for inflation. 考虑到涨价的因素，在预算之外再追加英镑是一个明智之举。</font>\n<br>2. excuse for 原谅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must make allowance for his ill manners. 你必须原谅他的不礼貌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They esteemed each other and made allowances for each other. 他们互敬互谅。</font>\n
make a long story short	<font color=blue size=4>make a long story short</font>\n<br>say sth. briefly 长话短说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make a long story short, John; there isn't much time left. 长话短说吧，约翰，时间不多了。</font>\n
make an example of	<font color=blue size=4>make an example of</font>\n<br>punish sb. as a warning to others 杀一儆百\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher made an example of the boy who copied from another student during the test. 老师惩罚了考试中抄袭别人试卷的男孩以警告别的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The headmaster made an example of Jane to try to stop misbehavior by the other pupils. 校长对简作了惩罚，以儆戒其他同学不要调皮捣蛋。</font>\n
make an impression on	<font color=blue size=4>make an impression on</font>\n<br>1. have a strong influence on 使深受印象\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech made a strong impression on the audience. 他的演说给听众留下了深刻的印象。</font>\n<br>2. have an effect on 对…有效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Punishment seemed to make no impression on the child. 惩罚似乎对这小孩不产生效果。</font>\n
make a point of	<font color=blue size=4>make a point of</font>\n<br>1. regard as necessary or very important; lay streaa on 重视；强调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John makes a point of reading a fresh book every month. 约翰坚持每月读一本新书。</font>\n<br>2. be careful to; be sure to 特别注意地做；有意识地做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Punctual people always make a point of being a little early. 准时的人总是有意识地稍微早一点儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made a point of thanking his hostess before he left the party. 离开宴会前他特地去感谢女主人一番。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always made a point of helping old ladies cross the road. 他总是小心翼翼地帮助老太太们过马路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If someone sends you a gift, make a point of thanking them the next time you meet. 当有人送你礼物时，下次见面时一定要谢谢他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Because I was late for class, I made a point of apologizing to the teacher after class. 因为我上课迟到了，下课时我特意向老师道歉。</font>\n<br>3. try hard to; take pains to 努力去做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made a point of remembering to get his glasses fixed. 他让自己务必记住去修眼镜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since she couldn't put up with him at all, she made a point of ignoring him altogether. 她一点也不能容忍他，因此她总是千方百计地回避他。</font>\n
make a practice of	<font color=blue size=4>make a practice of</font>\n<br>make a habit of 养成…的习惯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make a practice of being on time for work. 要养成按时工作的习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made a practice of taking a walk together every evening. 他们每天傍晚总是一起散步。</font>\n
make at	<font color=blue size=4>make at</font>\n<br>start to attack 袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner made at the guard with a knife. 囚犯用刀袭击看守。</font>\n
make away (with) 	<font color=blue size=4>make away (with) </font>\n<br>1. steal and hurry away with 携…而逃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made away with a large amount of money. 他窃走了一大笔钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two masked men held up the clerk and made away with the payroll. 两个戴面具的匪徒截住了职员，抢走了薪水册。</font>\n<br>2. spend 花掉；浪费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He soon made away with his fortune. 他很快就把财产挥霍一空。</font>\n<br>3. eat up 吃完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The kid made away the whole pie. 那小孩把整整一大块馅饼都吃光了。</font>\n<br>4. destroy 毁灭；消除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to make away with the proof. 他企图消灭罪证。</font>\n<br>5. kill 杀死；谋杀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor fellow made away with himself unnecessarily for he was proved innocent. 这个可怜人无谓地自杀了，因为他已被证明是无罪的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our neighbor tried to make away with herself by drinking posison. 我们的邻居试图服毒自杀。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made away with their opponents. 他们暗杀了他们的对手。</font>\n
make believe	<font color=blue size=4>make believe</font>\n<br>1. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made believe not to be aware of my presence. 他假装不知道我在场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's make believe that we're Red Indians. 让我们假扮成印第安人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys made believe that they were explorers in the African forests. 孩子们假装他们是非洲森林里的探险家。</font>\n<br>2. imagine as if sth. is true while you know it is not 幻想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She used to set the table for two and make believe that her husband was with her again. 她过去总是摆两个人的饭，幻想她丈夫还同她在一起。</font>\n
make (both) ends meet	<font color=blue size=4>make (both) ends meet</font>\n<br>earn what it costs to live 收支相抵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not make both ends meet. 他入不敷出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>However much money you earn, it's still difficult to make ends meet. 不管你挣多少钱，若要收支平衡仍有困难。</font>\n
make certain (of) 	<font color=blue size=4>make certain (of) </font>\n<br>make sure (of) 弄清楚；确定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make certain where we are going. 弄清楚我们去哪儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you made certain of the time of the train? 火车的时间你已弄清楚了吗？</font>\n
make clear	<font color=blue size=4>make clear</font>\n<br>clarify; explain 解释\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meaning of the story is made clear in the introduction. 这个故事的含意在引言中已说清楚。</font>\n
make down	<font color=blue size=4>make down</font>\n<br>make smaller 使…变小\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you make the dress down for her younger sister? 你能把她妹妹的这件衣服做小点吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The eldest girl's frocks can be made down for her sisters. 那最大女孩的外衣可以改小给她妹妹们穿。</font>\n
make fast	<font color=blue size=4>make fast</font>\n<br>fasten firmly 系紧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tie the rope round the pole and then make it fast. 把绳子绕在杆子上，然后系紧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I forgot to make fast the back door. 我忘了把后门关好。</font>\n
make for	<font color=blue size=4>make for</font>\n<br>1. go in the direction of 向…前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the concert the crowd made for the nearest door. 音乐会结束后，人群涌向离他们最近的门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the mother came into the room, her little girl made straight for her. 当母亲走进房间时，她的小女孩直向她扑去。</font>\n<br>2. promote 对…有益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Does early rising make for good health? 早起可以增进身体健康吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you've said will make for the good relations between our two people. 你讲的话有助于发展我们两国人民的友好关系。</font>\n<br>3. attack ; rush violently 攻击；袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I was half way across the field the bull made for me and I had to run. 当我走到田中间时，那头公牛向我冲来，我只得跑开。</font>\n
make free with	<font color=blue size=4>make free with</font>\n<br>1. take or use without asking 随便用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob makes free with his roommate's clothes. 鲍勃随便穿他室友的衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your friends at the party who made so free with the drinks weren't invited！你的那些在晚会上擅自喝酒的朋友竟然不请自来。</font>\n<br>2. act in a rude way 无礼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girls don't like Ted because he makes free with them. 女孩子们不喜欢泰德，因为他对她们无礼。</font>\n
make friends with	<font color=blue size=4>make friends with</font>\n<br>become friendly with 与…交友\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Within two days she made friends with everybody on the boat. 两天之内她便同船上的每个人交了朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Chuck's made friends with several people at work. 查克跟好几个一同工作的人交上朋友。</font>\n
make fun of	<font color=blue size=4>make fun of</font>\n<br>joke about; laugh at 开玩笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>James was making fun of the new pupil. 詹姆士在与那位新生开玩笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People enjoy making fun of the clothes I wear, though they seem all right to me. 他们爱拿我穿的衣服开玩笑，虽然我的衣服对我似乎很合适。</font>\n
make good	<font color=blue size=4>make good</font>\n<br>1. do what one promises to do 遵守诺言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government still has to make good many promises it made at the last election. 政府仍然必须兑现它在上次选举中做的许多承诺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made good his word and arrived at the conference in time despite many difficulties. 他遵守诺言，克服了困难，准时到会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe made good his boast to swim across the lake. 乔吹牛说要游过湖去，他真的那么做了。</font>\n<br>2. pay for the loss 赔偿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The insurance company will make good your loss. 保险公司将赔偿你的损失。</font>\n<br>3. succeed 成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sure he will make good. 我相信他会成功的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story is the traditional one of a local boy from a poor background who dreams of glory and eventually makes good. 这是一个传统的故事，讲的是当地的一位少年出生贫寒，渴望荣耀，最后终于如愿以偿。</font>\n
make good time	<font color=blue size=4>make good time</font>\n<br>travel rapidly at good speed 按规定的速度迅速前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We made good time on our trip to Florida. 我们很快抵达佛罗里达旅游。</font>\n
make haste	<font color=blue size=4>make haste</font>\n<br>move fast; hurry 赶快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary saw that she had hurt John's feelings, and made haste to say she was sorry. 玛丽见她伤害了约翰的感情，连忙说对不起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shepherds made haste to gather their sheep before dark. 牧羊人在天黑之前匆匆把羊群赶在一起。</font>\n
make it	<font color=blue size=4>make it</font>\n<br>1. be successful 成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a very difficult examination; are you sure you can make it? 这次考试很难，你肯定能通过吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's natural to have dreams of success and fame, but only a few people in this world actually make it. 梦想成功和追求名利是很自然的，但这世界上只有为数不多的人能真正做到。</font>\n<br>2. get to a destination or an appointment in time 及时到达目的地或及时约会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus goes in ten minutes; you must hurry or you won't make it. 汽车还有10分钟就要开了，你必须快一点，否则就赶不上了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't make it to the other shore in this weather. 天气恶劣，你到不了对岸。</font>\n<br>3. recover 痊愈；复原\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor knew that the man was unlikely to make it. 医生知道这人很可能治不好了。</font>\n
make light of	<font color=blue size=4>make light of</font>\n<br>consider unimportant; minimize the importance of. 轻视；看不起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldier made light of his wound. 这个士兵没把伤当一回事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom made light of his mistakes, but his teacher didn't at all. 汤姆对他的错误不当一回事，可他的老师对他的错误却很认真。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In fact, she suffered great inconvenience, but she made light of the whole affair when I asked her about it. 事实上，她遇到了很大麻烦，可我向她提起此事时，她却一点都不放在心上。</font>\n
make little of	<font color=blue size=4>make little of</font>\n<br>1. treat as of little importance 轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She makes little of walking fifty kilometres in a day. 她一天走50公里是不在乎的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made little of his illness. 他认为自己的病无关紧要。</font>\n<br>2. hardly understand 简直弄不懂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could make little of what he was saying. 我简直弄不懂他在说些什么。</font>\n
make merry	<font color=blue size=4>make merry</font>\n<br>have fun 寻欢作乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young people made merry at the picnic. 那些年轻人在野餐时尽情欢乐。</font>\n
make much of	<font color=blue size=4>make much of</font>\n<br>lay much emphasis on 特别强调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The report made much of the fact that there had not been enough cooperation among the department heads. 该报告强调各部门负责人没有尽力合作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He makes much of his upperclass background when you talk to him. 当你同他谈话时，他总是强调他上流社会的家庭背景。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't make too much of Sally's harsh manner;she's really quite gentle one you get to know her. 别太计较萨利粗暴的态度，一旦你了解她，就会知道她实际上是一个相当温和的人。</font>\n
make no difference	<font color=blue size=4>make no difference</font>\n<br>be unimportant 无关紧要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It makes no difference which road you take; both lead to the city, and they are equally long. 你走哪条路都无关紧要，二者都通往城里，而且一样长。</font>\n
make nothing of	<font color=blue size=4>make nothing of</font>\n<br>1. treat as of no importance 认为不重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made nothing of the injury and went on working. 他受了伤却全不在意，继续干活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's strange that he should make nothing of others' opinions. 真奇怪，他对别人的意见居然毫不重视。</font>\n<br>2. not understand 不了解；不懂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can make nothing of what he says. 我不懂他的话是什么意思。</font>\n
make off	<font color=blue size=4>make off</font>\n<br>go or run away 逃走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the deer saw the hunter, it made off at once. 当那头鹿看见猎人时，拔腿就跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves ran out of the jeweller's and made off in a stolen car. 窃贼们溜出珠宝行，坐上偷来的汽车逃走了。</font>\n
make off with	<font color=blue size=4>make off with</font>\n<br>1. steal and hurry away with 偷走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cashier made off with all the money in the safe. 出纳员偷走了保险箱里所有的钱。</font>\n<br>2. carry off 携走；拿走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made off with the first prize in the table tennis tournament. 他在乒乓球联赛中获得第1名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has made off with my pen. 有人把我的钢笔拿走了。</font>\n
make oneself at home	<font color=blue size=4>make oneself at home</font>\n<br>feel comfortable, as though one were in one's own home 感到自在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When people come to our house, we like them to make themselves at home. 当有人来我们家时，我们愿意他们象在自己家里一样感到自在。</font>\n
make one's mark	<font color=blue size=4>make one's mark</font>\n<br>make a reputation 出名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shakespeare made his mark as a playwright. 莎士比亚作为一个剧作家享有盛名。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've made your mark in the engineering world, you ought to be content. 你已在工程学方面取得了成功，你该满意了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Norman quickly made his mark and was the company's top salesman. 诺曼很快做出了成绩，成为公司第一流的推销员。</font>\n
make one's way	<font color=blue size=4>make one's way</font>\n<br>1. go forward with difficulty 艰难地向前走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he saw us, Henry made his way through the crowd to greet us personally. 亨利一看见我们就从人群中挤过来，亲自迎接我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the evening we made our way to the appointed meeting place. 到了晚上我们就向约定会面的地方赶去。</font>\n<br>2. do many hard things to earn a living 自力更生；自食其力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't have the determination to make his way in the world. 他没有努力上进的决心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was anxious to finish school and make her own way in the world. 她渴望早点毕业好在社会上谋生。</font>\n
make out	<font color=blue size=4>make out</font>\n<br>1. fill out 填写\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher made out the report cards and gave them to the students to take home. 老师填好成绩单，交给学生带回家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you please make out my bill? 请把我的账单开给我好吗？</font>\n<br>2. understand 理解；了解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't make out what he was saying. 我不明白他在说什么。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I never could make Janet out. Why does she always annoy people who try to help her? 我永远也不可能理解珍妮，为什么她总要使那些想帮她忙的人感到不愉快呢？</font>\n<br>3. distinguish 辨认\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't make out what that sign says; it's still too far away. 我无法看清那个标记，它距离我太远了。</font>\n<br>4. try to prove 企图证明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Charles and Bob had a fight, and Charles tried to make out that Bob started it. 查尔斯和鲍勃打了一架，查尔斯竭力说是鲍勃先动的手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made out that he had never been to the place before. 他企图证明他从未去过那个地方。</font>\n<br>5. represent; represent as being 声称；把…说成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They make themselves out to be poorer than they really are. 他们把自己说得比实际上要穷些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made me out to be a hypocrite. 他把我说成是伪君子。</font>\n<br>6. progress 进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is making out very well in his new job. 他那项新工作干得很不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems a little bit irresponsible now, but I think he will make out all right. 目前看来他有点缺乏责任感，但我相信他会变好的。</font>\n<br>7. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made out they were weavers. 他们假装是织布工人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made himself out to be interested in our planned trip. 他假装对我们计划中的旅行感兴趣。</font>\n<br>8. complete (a total) 凑足（总数）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot make out the required sum to settle this account. 我凑不出这笔款子来还账。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several other items were added to make out a round number. 加了几个别的项目以凑足一个整数。</font>\n
make out of	<font color=blue size=4>make out of</font>\n<br>1. produce from 用…制成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cottage was made out of logs. 那小屋是用圆木建成的。</font>\n<br>2. change…to 把…培养成；使…变成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was the school's responsibility to make good citizens out of the students. 学校的职责是把学生培养成良好的公民。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made an illiterate out of my daughter. 他们使我女儿变成了文盲。</font>\n
make over	<font color=blue size=4>make over</font>\n<br>1. alter and make like new (particularly of clothes) 翻改（衣服）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you think you can make over this old coat? 你看你能把这件旧上衣改一下吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house has been made over into a school. 这座房子已改建成一所学校。</font>\n<br>2. transfer 转移\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Brown has made over his business to his son. 布朗先生已经把公司移交给了他儿子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>he has made over his property to a hospital. 他把他的财产捐给了一家医院。</font>\n
make peace (with) 	<font color=blue size=4>make peace (with) </font>\n<br>be on good terms (with) （与…）和好；（与…）讲和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leaders of the two nations decided to make peace. 两国领导人决定议和。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has Philip made peace with Rosemary or are they still arguing? 菲利浦已经同罗斯玛丽握手言好了，还是他们仍在争吵不休？</font>\n
make room for	<font color=blue size=4>make room for</font>\n<br>1. arrange space for 为…腾出空地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can easily make room for you at this table. 我们很容易就能在这张桌上为你腾出位置。</font>\n<br>2. be replaced by 被…所替代\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's in the very nature of things that the old eventually makes room for the new. 旧事物终将被新事物所代替，这是必然的。</font>\n
make sb's blood boil	<font color=blue size=4>make sb's blood boil</font>\n<br>make sb. angrg 激怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When someone called him a liar it made his blood boil. 当有人说他是个扯谎的人时，他十分恼火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It made Mary's blood boil to see the children make fun of the crippled girl. 玛丽看到孩子们在取笑那位残废的女孩时，勃然大怒。</font>\n
make sense	<font color=blue size=4>make sense</font>\n<br>1. be sth. you can understand or explain 能理解；合理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he said just doesn't make sense. 他讲的那番话简直不知所云。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doesn't talk much, but what she says makes sense. 她不多讲话，但言之有理。</font>\n<br>2. seem right; sound reasonable or practical 可行；合乎情理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Does it make sense to let little children play with matches? 让孩子们玩火柴能行吗？</font>\n
make sense of	<font color=blue size=4>make sense of</font>\n<br>understand; interpret successfully 理解\n<br>Even though the speaker had a strong accent,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry could catch on to his story, but Tom couldn't make sense of it at all. 尽管演讲者地方口音很重，但是亨利能听懂他的话，而汤姆却一点儿也听不懂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you make sense of what he said? 你听懂他说的话吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't make sense of either the Chinese or Korean language, and that's why I can't tell them apart. 我既不懂汉语，也不懂朝鲜语，这就是我分不清这两种语言的原因。</font>\n
make sthdo	<font color=blue size=4>make sthdo</font>\n<br>substitute one thing for another 用一物代替另一物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there's no cream for the coffee, we'll just have to make milk do. 如果没有奶油放在咖啡里，放牛奶也可以。</font>\n
make sure	<font color=blue size=4>make sure</font>\n<br>be sure or certain 务必\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father makes sure that all the lights are off before he goes to bed. 父亲在确认所有的灯都关了以后才上床。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's make sure that it has been finished. 让我们搞清楚这工作是否确实已完成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must make sure of the facts. 我们必须把事实搞清楚。</font>\n
make/take a journey	<font color=blue size=4>make/take a journey</font>\n<br>travel 旅行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We made a journey from Paris to Berlin. 我们从巴黎旅行到柏林。</font>\n
make the best of	<font color=blue size=4>make the best of</font>\n<br>1. try to use to the best advantage 尽量利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the government cutbacks, the hospital will just have to make the best of the limited resources at its disposal. 当政府削减拨款时，这家医院就只能充分利用那些有限的财力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should make the best of this valuable opportunity. 你应该充分利用这宝贵的机会。</font>\n<br>2. accept cheerfully 欣然接受\n<br>He has bad luck,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>but he always makes the best of everything. 他运气不佳，但他总能坦然接受一切。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since we can't get any new equipment right now, let's make the best of what we have. 既然现在搞不到新设备，我们就先将就着用现有的设备吧。</font>\n
make the grade	<font color=blue size=4>make the grade</font>\n<br>1. make good; succeed 成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Baker made the grade in the insurance business. 贝克先生在保险业务上干得很不错。</font>\n<br>2. meet a standard; qualify 够水准；合格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After repeated trials the new calculators eventually made the grade. 通过反复试验，那种新计算器终于达到了标准。</font>\n<br>He tried several times to enlist, but first he was too young,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>then too thin, to make the grade. 他几次报名参军，但都不合标准，先是由于他年龄大小，而后又由于他个子太瘦。</font>\n
make the most of	<font color=blue size=4>make the most of</font>\n<br>get as much as possible out of a situation 充分利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George studied hard. He wanted to make the most of his chance to learn. 乔治学习很努力，他想利用一切机会学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctors have told him he's only got six months to live, so he's making the most of them. 医生已经告诉他，他只能活6个月时间了，所以他在充分利用这段时间。</font>\n
make up	<font color=blue size=4>make up</font>\n<br>1. invent; fabricate 编造\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane made up stories to amuse her little brother. 简编故事逗她的小弟弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's very good at making up songs. 他很善于编歌。</font>\n<br>2. constitute 组成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A car is made up of many different parts. 汽车由许多零部件组成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peasants make up over 80 percent of the Chinese population. 农民占中国人口的百分之八十以上。</font>\n<br>3. repay; compensate 补偿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to drive fast to make up the hour we lost in Boston. 我们的车得开快一点，好补回我们在波士顿丢掉的时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By hard work they made up the loss of time. 由于努力工作，他们弥补了失去的时间。</font>\n<br>4. apply cosmetics 化妆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom watched his sister make up her face for her date. 汤姆望着他姐姐化妆去赴约。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She spent two hours making herself up before the party. 她在参加聚会前用了两个小时化妆。</font>\n<br>5. become friends again after a quarrel 复交；和解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you make up with her and forget all about your quarrel? 你为什么不能同她和解并忘掉你们吵架的事呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has Ray made it up with Ros yet? 雷跟罗斯还没有握手言好吗？</font>\n<br>6. complete 完成；凑成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has a lot of work to make up. 她有许多事要做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We still need 50 yuan to make up the required sum. 我们还需50元来凑足需要的款项。</font>\n<br>7. arrange bedclothes 铺床；（临时）搭床铺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make up your bed before you sleep. 睡前要铺床。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made up a special bed for her sick mother. 她为生病的母亲搭了个特制的床。</font>\n<br>8. prepare sth. , esp. medicine, by putting different things together 配制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please call at the drugstore and have this prescription made up for me. 请去药店照这张方子给我配些药来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made up a bottle of cough medicine. 他配制了一瓶咳嗽药水。</font>\n<br>9. add fuel to a fire, boiler, etc. 加燃料使（火）不熄；生（火）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the stove isn't made up, it'll soon go out. 不给火炉加点燃料的话，火很快就会灭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He made up a fire. 他生了堆火。</font>\n<br>10. wrap up; fasten up 包扎；把…打成包\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made up a big bundle of all her old clothing. 她把她所有的旧衣服扎成一大包。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop assistant made up the parcel expertly. 那个店员把小包捆得干净利落。</font>\n<br>11. make (cloth) into a garment 缝制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She would like to have this piece of cloth made up into a skirt. 她想用这块布做条裙子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This material will make up into two dresses. 这块衣料可做两件女装。</font>\n
make up for	<font color=blue size=4>make up for</font>\n<br>compensate 弥补\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hard work can often make up for a lack of intelligence. 勤奋工作往往可以弥补智力的不足。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His strong personality makes up for his ugly appearance. 他坚强的性格弥补了他丑陋的外表。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your kind behavior now more than makes up for your rudeness last week. 你此刻的善良举止大大地弥补了你上周的野蛮粗鲁。</font>\n
make up one's mind	<font color=blue size=4>make up one's mind</font>\n<br>decide; choose what to do; determine 决心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made up their minds to sellthe house. 他们下决心要把房子卖掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look, I've thought about it a lot, and now I've made up my mind—you can borrow my car！瞧，这件事我已想了许多，现在我主意已定，你可以借用我的车了。</font>\n
make up to	<font color=blue size=4>make up to</font>\n<br>1. advance to; approach 接近；向…前行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was easy to make up to him. 他是容易接近的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A suspicious boat made up to us. 一艘行迹可疑的船向我们驶来。</font>\n<br>2. flatter 奉承\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She started making up to him the day she learnt that he was a millionaire. 从她开始得知他是个百万富翁那天起，她就巴结他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She makes up to her boss all the time. 她总是讨好她的老板。</font>\n<br>3. repay 补偿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can we make it up to them for all the worry we've caused them? 我们害得他们如此焦虑不安，要怎样才能弥补呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lost some money, but his father made it up to him. 他丢了些钱，可是他父亲给他弥补了这笔损失。</font>\n
make use of	<font color=blue size=4>make use of</font>\n<br>use; utilize 利用；使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must make good use of any opportunity to practise English. 你必须好好利用任何机会练习英语。</font>\n
make way	<font color=blue size=4>make way</font>\n<br>stand aside 让路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When older men retire they make way for younger men to take their places. 年长者退休时为年轻者让路，让他们接班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All traffic has to make way for a fire engine. 所有车辆都得给消防车让路。</font>\n
make…of	<font color=blue size=4>make…of</font>\n<br>1. produce…from 用…制作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would rather make a house of stone. 我想用石头盖房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ships used to be made entirely of wood. 从前的船全是用木头造的。</font>\n<br>2. understand 理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know what to make of the boy's behavior. 我不知道如何来理解这孩子的行为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What do you make of the editorial in the morning paper? 你对晨报上的那篇社论有何看法？</font>\n<br>3. cause…to become 使…成为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will never make a musician of that boy. 你永远也不可能把那男孩培养成音乐家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The navy has made a man of him. 海军把他培养成人。</font>\n
man in the street	<font color=blue size=4>man in the street</font>\n<br>average man; ordinery man 普通人；平常人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspaper took a poll of people to see what the man in the street thinks. 那家报纸对 300个人进行了民意测验，看普通百姓有些什么想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Like a good politician, he wants to know how the man in the street feels about the issus. 象一个老练的政治家一样，他很想知道普通人对这个问题的看法。</font>\n
man of few words	<font color=blue size=4>man of few words</font>\n<br>a man who doesn't talk very much 沉默寡言者\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Brown, who was a man of few words, nodded assent. 布朗先生话虽不多，但肯定地点点头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The principal is a man of few words, but the pupils know what he wants. 校长是一个沉默寡言的人，可是学生们却知道他的意向。</font>\n
man of one's word	<font color=blue size=4>man of one's word</font>\n<br>reliable person 可靠的人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a man of his word. If he says he'll do it, he will. 他是个可以信赖的人。如果他答应去做，他一定会去做的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're a man of your word, I see. Most people wouldn't have visited an old man like me in such bad weather as this. 我看得出，你是个讲信用的人。大多数人都不愿意在这种恶劣的天气里来看望象我这样一个老头。</font>\n
man of parts	<font color=blue size=4>man of parts</font>\n<br>a person who has several different skills, talents, or qualities 多才多艺的人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pianist is a man of parts. He writes the piece he plays, and he also plays the flute well. 这位钢琴家多才多艺。他自写自弹，还吹一口好笛子。</font>\n<br>A social worker must be a man of many parts—able to act quickly in an emergency,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>good at listening, and at the right time, able to give advice. 一个社会工作者必须是一个多才多艺的人—能在紧急情况下迅速作出反应，善于倾听别人的意见，并且能够适时地给他人以忠告。</font>\n
many a	<font color=blue size=4>many a</font>\n<br>many 许多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many a student likes to read this magazine. 很多学生喜欢读这本杂志。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many a day was spent preparing the new textbooks. 好多天时间花在编写新的教科书上。</font>\n
map out	<font color=blue size=4>map out</font>\n<br>1. mark out on a map 在地图上标出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The staff officers mapped out the area thoroughly. 参谋人员在地图上把这个地方清楚地标了出来。</font>\n<br>2. plan 计划\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has mapped out what he will do. 他所要做的事都已计划好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must map our work out carefully for the next three weeks. 我们必须仔细地把下3周的工作计划一下。</font>\n
mark down	<font color=blue size=4>mark down</font>\n<br>1. lower the price of 减价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All our stock has been marked down thirty percent. 我们的所有存货都已减价百分之三十。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wonder why these dresses have been marked down. 我不知道这些衣服为何降价。</font>\n<br>2. note down with a mark 作记号\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher immediately marked down the students'suggestion in his notebook. 老师立即将学生提出的建议记在笔记本上。</font>\n<br>3. single out 选出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been marked down for assassination. 他们事先定下来要暗杀他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He marked down that house for his headquarters. 他选那所房子作他的指挥部。</font>\n
mark off	<font color=blue size=4>mark off</font>\n<br>lay out in sections 划出界线\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fiela will be marked off in accordance with the special track events which will take place tomorrow. 场地将按照明天的特殊径赛项目而划分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This feature marks him off from other boys. 这个特征使他和别的孩子有所区别。</font>\n
mark out	<font color=blue size=4>mark out</font>\n<br>1. put lines on to indicate limits 划线\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tennis court has been freshly marked out. 网球场新划了线。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The site of the new chemical fertilizer plant has been marked out. 新的化肥厂的地界已经划出来了。</font>\n<br>2. chart the course of 制订\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have marked out a general course of action. 他们已经拟订了一个行动计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The directions of urban development have been marked out. 城市发展的规划已制订出来了。</font>\n<br>3. select sb. for special treatment 选定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three of his paintings have been marked out for exhibition. 他的3幅画已被选出，准备送去展览。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was marked out as the most promising young soldier in the whole army. 他被认为是全军最有前途的青年军人。</font>\n
mark time	<font color=blue size=4>mark time</font>\n<br>1. be idle; wait for 等待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher marked time until all the children were ready for the test. 老师一直等到所有孩子都作好了考试准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Business is fairly slow; we're just marking time till the economy improves. 现在生意相当萧条，我们正等待经济的好转。</font>\n<br>2. move the feet up and down as in marching, but not going forward 原地踏步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain ordered his men to mark time. 上尉命令士兵原地踏步。</font>\n
mark up	<font color=blue size=4>mark up</font>\n<br>1. put up with a mark 记分；在…上作记号\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child used his new crayons to mark up the kitchen walls. 小孩用新蜡笔在厨房的墙上画。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They marked up the score on the scoreboard. 他们把得分记在记分牌上。</font>\n<br>2. decide the price at which to sell sth. 给…标价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we mark them up at that price, we'll never sell them. 如果我们标那样的价，那这些货永远也卖不出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have marked up all these items. 他们把这些商品通通标了价。</font>\n<br>3. raise the price 涨价；加价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything in the shop will have to be marked up if the tax is increased. 如果税收增加的话，商店里所有的物品都得加价。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They marked up the prices of those rare books. 他们提高那些珍本书的定价。</font>\n<br>4. add (an item) to a store account; give credit for 记账；赊欠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shaved a gentleman who asked me to mark it up. 我替一位先生修了面，他要我记账。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A man bought an umbrella from us and asked us to mark it up. 一个男人向我们买了一把伞，叫我们记账。</font>\n<br>5. increase the marks awarded to (a student, a class, etc.) 增加（学生等的）分数\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we mark up Jones on two papers he will just scrape a pass. 要是我们给琼斯的两份卷子加分，他也只能勉强及格。</font>\n
marry up	<font color=blue size=4>marry up</font>\n<br>join together; unite 会合；联合；结合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The regular troops married up with partisans pressing down from the hills. 正规军和从山上冲下来的游击队会合了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two parts of the project are not well married up. 计划的两个组成部分结合得不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The povertystricken Jordan is married up with a rich lady. 一贫如洗的乔丹和一个有钱的妇人结了婚。</font>\n
match up	<font color=blue size=4>match up</font>\n<br>1. correspond; bring into correspondence or harmony 相配；和谐；使相配；使和谐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has matched the patterns up very well. 他把这些图案配得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her blouse and skirt match up nicely. 她的衬衫和裙子很配。</font>\n<br>2. fit together to form a complete and intelligible whole 把…拼成一个整体；使吻合起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I found it difficult to match up the different versions of the event by two eyewitnesses. 我发觉很难把那次事件的两位目击者的说法吻合起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't match up the two halves of the photograph. A bit is missing from the middle. 我们无法把这两个半张的照片拼起来，因为中间缺了一块。</font>\n
match up to	<font color=blue size=4>match up to</font>\n<br>be equal to 胜任；比得上；对付得了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His performance did not match up to the glowing account we had received of him. 他的演出完全不象我们听说的那样了不起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He matched up to the situation. 那局面他应付过去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The imitation hardly matches up to the original. 这个仿制品简直不能同真品相比。</font>\n
matter of course	<font color=blue size=4>matter of course</font>\n<br>sth. always done; the usual way 当然的事；惯常；习惯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since his proposal ran counter to the wishes of the community, its rejection was a matter of course. 既然他的建议与大家的愿望背道而驰，它理所当然地受到大家的拒绝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bank officers ask questions as a matter of course when someone wants to borrow money. 有人要贷款时，银行职员按例要问一些问题。</font>\n
matter of fact	<font color=blue size=4>matter of fact</font>\n<br>sth. that is really true; sth. that can be proved 事实\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a matter of fact that he runs faster than you do. 他比你跑得快，这是事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary wasn't wearing a blue dress.
