As a matter of fact, she hasn't got a blue dress. 玛丽没有穿蓝衣服，事实上她根本就没有蓝衣服。</font>\n
may/might as well	<font color=blue size=4>may/might as well</font>\n<br>may be equally advantageous to 最好…；还是…为好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall have to pay the bill some time, so I may as well pay it now. 我将来反正得付这笔钱，所以我还是现在付了为好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you're going to the library, I might as well go with you; I have to return this book. 如果你去图书馆，我不妨和你一起去，我得去还书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You might as well throw your money into the sea as lend it to him. 你借钱给他还不如把钱扔到海里。</font>\n
mean business	<font color=blue size=4>mean business</font>\n<br>be serious 严肃的；正经的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he said he was going to the library to study, he meant business. 他说他要去图书馆学习，他确实是认真说的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By sending their top people to meet our leaders at the summit conference, they really showed they meant business. 在这次最高级会议上，他们派出了他们的首领同我们的领袖见面，这表明他们是郑重其事的。</font>\n
measure off	<font color=blue size=4>measure off</font>\n<br>mark off by measuring 划出；量出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They measured off the area in which they would work. 他们划出了他们将要工作的地区。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I asked the shopassistant to measure off two metres of blue corduroy for me. 我叫营业员给我量两米蓝灯芯绒。</font>\n
measure out	<font color=blue size=4>measure out</font>\n<br>appoint in measured amounts 量出；按量分配\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chemist carefully measured out a dose of herbal medicine and told me how to brew it. 药剂师仔细地配好一付中药，并告诉我煎药的方法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He opened the flourbin and measured out some flour. 他打开面粉柜，量出了一些面粉。</font>\n
measure up	<font color=blue size=4>measure up</font>\n<br>1. be good enough 尽善尽美；符合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a number of trials, the product finally measured up. 经过反复试验，该产品终于达到了标准。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'll measure up, don't worry. 别担心，她能干好的。</font>\n<br>2. take measurement; measure fully 量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How does the food here measure up according to your nutrition standards? 按照你的营养标准来衡量，这儿的伙食怎么样？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He measured up the wood be fore he started. 他在动工前先把木头量了一下。</font>\n<br>3. measure for a suit 给…量尺寸做衣服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll just measure you up, sir, if I may? 先生，我这就给你量衣服尺寸，行吗？</font>\n<br>4. assess 对…进行估价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've been trying to measure up his chances. 我们一直试图估计他到底有多少机遇。</font>\n
measure up to	<font color=blue size=4>measure up to</font>\n<br>display qualities, skills, etc. of a required standard 胜任；适合；符合标准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The products did not measure up to specifications. 这些产品没达到规格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If she doesn't measure up to the job, she'll just have to leave. 要是她不能胜任这工作，她只得离去。</font>\n
meet one's engagements	<font color=blue size=4>meet one's engagements</font>\n<br>1. keep one's promise 承诺（约言、契约）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has met his engagements. 他已履行了他的契约。</font>\n<br>2. make payment 付款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has not enough money to meet his engagements. 他没有足够的钱来偿清他的债务。</font>\n
meet sbhalf way	<font color=blue size=4>meet sbhalf way</font>\n<br>compromise; come to an understanding with sb. when opinions differ 妥协；和解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In an effort to end the strike, the owners agreed to meet the strikers halfway. 为了努力结束这场罢工，老板自己和罢工者和解了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two sides finally met halfway —the workers gave up their pay claim but got the cut in working hours that they wanted. 双方最后都作出了让步—工人们放弃增加工资的要求，但得到了他们想要的劳动时间的减少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John has definite ideas about things, but he's not unreasonable, he always tries to meet you halfway. 约翰对事情有明确的意见，但他不是不讲理的，他总是努力和你折衷一下。</font>\n
meet sb. 's eye	<font color=blue size=4>meet sb. 's eye</font>\n<br>appear clearly 清楚地出现在某人眼前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When John walked out of the woods, a clear blue lake met his eye. 约翰走出树林时，清澈的湖水展现在他眼前。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was afraid to meet my eye. 她不敢正眼看我。</font>\n

meet with	<font color=blue size=4>meet with</font>\n<br>1. meet, usu. by accident（偶然）遇见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the woods, he met with two strangers. 在树林里他遇上了两个陌生人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I met with an old friend at the meeting. 我在会上碰到了一个老朋友。</font>\n<br>2. meet together, usu. by plan （按计划）约见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two scouts went to meet with the officers to talk about plans for the march. 两位侦察员前去会见军官，讨论行军计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I met with him at the bus stop and together we went to dine at a restaurant. 我和他在汽车站碰头，然后一起去饭馆吃饭。</font>\n<br>3. experience 经历；遭受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmer met with misfortune; storm. 这位农场主遭受了不幸，他的庄稼被一场暴风雨毁了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On every battle field the enemy met with defeat. 敌军在各个战场上都吃了败仗。</font>\n<br>4. agree with; be in accord with 符合（某种意见）；获得（同意）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The suggestion met with unanimous approval. 该项建议获得一致通过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan you submitted seems to meet with the committee's ideas on the subject. 你提出的计划似乎符合委员会对这个问题的主张。</font>\n
melt away	<font color=blue size=4>melt away</font>\n<br>1. become liquefied by heat; thaw 熔化；融化\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The snow soon melted away when the sun came out. 太阳一出来，雪很快就融化了。</font>\n<br>2. disappear or cause to disappear gradually 消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The suspicion melted away when he had told me the truth. 他把事情真相告诉我后，我心中的疑团涣然冰释。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd quickly melted away when police asked for the names of witnesses. 警察询问证人姓名时，人们很快走光了。</font>\n<br>3. dissolve into ecstasies 着迷；神魂颠倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My heart melted away in secret raptures. 我暗地里高兴得心花怒放。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His story melted away my soul. 他的故事使我着了迷。</font>\n
melt down	<font color=blue size=4>melt down</font>\n<br>reduce by melting 熔化\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They melted down the lead and poured it into moulds. 他们把铅熔化，倒进模子里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The state offers fair prices for scrapiron to be melted down for reuse. 国家以合理的价格收购废铁以使回炉后重新使用。</font>\n
melt in sb's mouth	<font color=blue size=4>melt in sb's mouth</font>\n<br>taste very good, delicious 美味可口的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother's apple pie really melts in your mouth. 妈妈做的苹果饼真是好吃极了。</font>\n
merge together	<font color=blue size=4>merge together</font>\n<br>blend together（使）混和起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shadows slowly merge togeth er. 阴影慢慢地合在了一起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The painter tried to merge the colors together. 画家试图把那几种颜色和起来。</font>\n
mess about/around	<font color=blue size=4>mess about/around</font>\n<br>1. handle or play with sth. carelessly 瞎弄；乱搞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He won't allow anyone to mess about with his new bike. 他不许任何人乱摆弄他的新自行车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell the child not to mess around with the fire. 叫孩子不要玩火。</font>\n<br>2. behave in a foolish, noisy way 吵闹；胡闹\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children were messing about in their mother's room. 孩子们在母亲房里乱闹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who's messing about there and making such a noise? 谁在那儿胡闹，发出这么大的声响？</font>\n<br>3. engage in idle or purposeless activity 无所事事；鬼混\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish he'd stop messing about and get down to some serious work. 我希望他干点正事不要再鬼混了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They messed about on the beach most of the summer. 夏天的大部分时间他们都在海滨闲混。</font>\n<br>4. treat roughly 粗暴地对待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man was very angry, because he had never been messed about like that by anybody all his life. 老人气极了，因为这辈子从来没有人对他这样粗暴过。</font>\n
mess up	<font color=blue size=4>mess up</font>\n<br>spoil sth. or do a job badly 弄乱；弄糟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've sorted out the books; now don't mess them up again. 我已经把书整理好了，请不要再把它们弄乱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather messed up our holiday plans. 坏天气把我们的度假计划给破坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't mess up my clean floor. 别把我的干净地板弄脏了。</font>\n
mind one's own business	<font color=blue size=4>mind one's own business</font>\n<br>attend to one's own duties and not interfere with those of others 不要多管闲事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better mind your own business. 你最好少管闲事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“How's that new contract with Smith coming on? ”“Mind your own business！”“同史密斯订的新合同怎么样了？”“少管闲事！”</font>\n
mind out	<font color=blue size=4>mind out</font>\n<br>take care 小心；留神\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mind out, the steps are slippery！注意，台阶很滑！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll trip over the stone if you don't mind out. 如果你不留神，你会被石头绊倒的。</font>\n
mind you	<font color=blue size=4>mind you</font>\n<br>please note 请注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mind you, there will be a big storm tonight. 注意，今晚有暴风雨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“We spent a lot of money last month. ”“Yes, but mind you, it was Christmas, and we did have all the presents to buy. ”“上个月我们花了很多钱。”“是的，不过你听我说，这是圣诞节，我们的确有许多礼物要买。”</font>\n
miss by a mile	<font color=blue size=4>miss by a mile</font>\n<br>1. be very wrong; be far from right 极不正确\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to guess on the examination, but his answers missed by a mile. 他在考试中试图猜题，可他的答案离题万里。</font>\n<br>2. fail badly; not succeed at all 彻底失败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Temple stood for election, but in the final counting he missed by a mile. 坦普尔参加了竞选，但最后计票时遭到了惨败。</font>\n
miss out	<font color=blue size=4>miss out</font>\n<br>1. lose a good chance 错失良机\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You missed out by not coming with us; we had a great time. 你没有同我们一起去真是错失了良机，我们玩得可开心啦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll miss out unless you get to the shop on the first morning of the sale. 商店开张的第一天早上要是不去的话，你会错过良机的。</font>\n<br>2. fail to put in 遗漏；略去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The printers have missed out a line. 印刷工人遗漏了一行字。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you like to check the report in case I've missed out anything important? 你检查一下我的报告好吗？万一我漏掉了一些重要内容。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may miss out the third paragraph of the article while reading it . 你读这篇文章时可略去第3段。</font>\n
mistake for	<font color=blue size=4>mistake for</font>\n<br>take for 误认为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She mistook him for your brother. 她误认为他是你哥哥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She looks so young that people often mistake her for her daughter. 她非常年轻，人们经常把她误认为是她女儿。</font>\n
mix up	<font color=blue size=4>mix up</font>\n<br>1. confuse 混乱；搞混\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The airline staff mixed my luggage up with yours. 飞机航班服务员把我的行李和你的混淆了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People are always mixing me up with my twin brother. 人们总是分不清我和我的孪生弟弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got mixed up in our directions, took the wrong road, and drove many miles out of our way. 我们搞错方向上错了路，结果绕开正路开了许多英里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even the twin's mother mixed them up. 甚至这对双胞胎的母亲也会把他们搞混。</font>\n<br>2. mix thoroughly; mingle together 搅匀；拌和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She mixed their medicine up in a glass. 她在杯子里调匀他们的药。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dinner will be ready as soon as I finish mixing up this salad dressing. 我把色拉调料一调好，咱们就吃饭。</font>\n<br>3. involve 使卷入；使牵连进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you become mixed up in such affairs? 你怎么会牵涉到这些事情里面去的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They advised him not to ger mixed up with such people. 他们劝他不要和这种人搞在一起。</font>\n
monkey about/around	<font color=blue size=4>monkey about/around</font>\n<br>1. play or interfere with sth. mischievously 胡闹；恶作剧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't monkey about any more; it's time you learned to behave yourself. 别再胡闹下去了，你该学学怎么做人了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of you is going to get hurt if you don't stop monkeying around. 再不停止胡闹的话，你们中的一个就会受伤了。</font>\n<br>2. tinker (often out of curiosity) 摆弄（常指出于好奇心）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's dangerous to let the child monkey around with matches. 让孩子玩火柴，太危险了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim likes to monkey around with antomobile engines. 杰姆喜欢瞎玩汽车引擎。</font>\n
mop up	<font color=blue size=4>mop up</font>\n<br>1. clean up with a mop 擦掉；抹去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He quickly mopped up the water on the floor. 他迅速抹去了地板上的水。</font>\n<br>2. eliminate 消灭；肃清\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The army has now mopped up the enemy. 部队把敌人消灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two companies were left behind to guard and mop up the recaptured territory. 留下两个连守卫收复的失地，并对这个地方进行扫荡。</font>\n<br>3. finish off; complete (a project or task) 完成（任务）；结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They promised to mop up what was left of the work as soon as they could. 他们答应尽快地结束余下的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new product is mopping up on the international market. 这种新产品在国际市场上销售迅猛。</font>\n
more often than not	<font color=blue size=4>more often than not</font>\n<br>very often 常常；多半\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>More often than not, I take a cold bath every evening in summer. 夏天我常常晚上洗个冷水澡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During foggy weather, the trains are late more often than not. 有雾时，火车常常误点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a fairly good runner. He wins more often than not. 他是一名相当好的赛跑运动员，常常跑赢。</font>\n
more or less	<font color=blue size=4>more or less</font>\n<br>1. a little; somewhat 有点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is more or less selfish. 他多少有点自私。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The road runs more or less parallel to the Bell Street. 这条路基本上是和贝尔大街平行的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By September we knew more or less what our income would be for the whole year. 到9月份，我们就大概知道了我们全年的收入是多少。</font>\n<br>2. nearly 大约\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a mile, more or less, from his home to school. 从他家到学校大约有一英里远。</font>\n
more than	<font color=blue size=4>more than</font>\n<br>1. very（后接形容词，表示被修饰的形容词的强烈程度）非常；十分；不仅仅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was more than upset by the accident. 他为此事故深感不安。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were more than glad to help us. 他们非常乐意帮助我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In doing experiments, you must be more than careful with the precision instruments. 在做实验时，你必须特别小心这些精密仪器。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such work requires more than indomitable will. 这项工作不仅仅需要坚韧不拔的意志。</font>\n<br>2. rather（后接副词或分词）简直；十分；不止…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was more than slightly hurt. 这女孩伤得可不轻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She behaved more than fairly to him. 她对他十分公正。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was more than surprised; I was astonished. 我不止是诧异，简直是大吃一惊。</font>\n<br>3. nearly（后接动词）十分；绰绰有余；大大地；几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He more than hesitated to promise that. 他几乎是拒绝答应那件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a moonless night, but the brilliant stars more than made up for the want of moonshine. 晚来无月，但繁星点点，皎洁明亮，足补月亮之缺而有余。</font>\n<br>4. not only（后接名词，或名词从句）不只是…；不仅仅…；非但…尤其…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is more than a friend to me. 他对我不只是一个朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My trip to Beijing is more than sightseeing. 我到北京的旅行不仅仅是观光而已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The stars are something more than huge inert masses; they are machines in action, generating and emitting the radiation by which we see them. 星星不只是某种巨大的惰性物质，它们是运动着的机器，产生和放出我们借以看见它们的光。</font>\n<br>5. over（后接数词）…以上；不只\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have studied English for more than ten years. 我们学英语已经10多年了。</font>\n<br> more…than\n<br>rather than 与其说…不如说…；是…而不是…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is more diligent than clever. 与其说他聪明，倒不如说他勤奋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was more a command than a question. 这话不是提问，而是一个命令。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything in the world should be regarded more as in motion than as at rest. 世界万物都应该看成是在运动之中，而不是处于静止状态。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The socalled goodquality product is more in name than in reality. 这种所谓的优质产品名不符实。</font>\n
more than a little	<font color=blue size=4>more than a little</font>\n<br>very 十分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you tell your father what you've done, he'll be more than a little angry. 如果你把你所干的事情告诉你父亲，他会很生气的。</font>\n
more than…can	<font color=blue size=4>more than…can</font>\n<br>cannot 简直不；难以\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His insolence is more than I can stand. 他的傲慢使我难以忍受。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The beauty of the park is more than words can describe. 这个公园的美不是语言所能描绘的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The traveller entertained his host with stories, some of which were really more than could be believed. 这个旅行者讲了一些故事给他的主人听，其中一些简直难以置信。</font>\n
more…than	<font color=blue size=4>more…than</font>\n<br>rather than 与其说…不如说…；是…而不是…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is more diligent than clever. 与其说他聪明，倒不如说他勤奋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was more a command than a question. 这话不是提问，而是一个命令。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything in the world should be regarded more as in motion than as at rest. 世界万物都应该看成是在运动之中，而不是处于静止状态。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The socalled goodquality product is more in name than in reality. 这种所谓的优质产品名不符实。</font>\n<br> more than\n<br>1. very（后接形容词，表示被修饰的形容词的强烈程度）非常；十分；不仅仅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was more than upset by the accident. 他为此事故深感不安。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were more than glad to help us. 他们非常乐意帮助我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In doing experiments, you must be more than careful with the precision instruments. 在做实验时，你必须特别小心这些精密仪器。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such work requires more than indomitable will. 这项工作不仅仅需要坚韧不拔的意志。</font>\n<br>2. rather（后接副词或分词）简直；十分；不止…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was more than slightly hurt. 这女孩伤得可不轻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She behaved more than fairly to him. 她对他十分公正。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was more than surprised; I was astonished. 我不止是诧异，简直是大吃一惊。</font>\n<br>3. nearly（后接动词）十分；绰绰有余；大大地；几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He more than hesitated to promise that. 他几乎是拒绝答应那件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a moonless night, but the brilliant stars more than made up for the want of moonshine. 晚来无月，但繁星点点，皎洁明亮，足补月亮之缺而有余。</font>\n<br>4. not only（后接名词，或名词从句）不只是…；不仅仅…；非但…尤其…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is more than a friend to me. 他对我不只是一个朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My trip to Beijing is more than sightseeing. 我到北京的旅行不仅仅是观光而已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The stars are something more than huge inert masses; they are machines in action, generating and emitting the radiation by which we see them. 星星不只是某种巨大的惰性物质，它们是运动着的机器，产生和放出我们借以看见它们的光。</font>\n<br>5. over（后接数词）…以上；不只\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have studied English for more than ten years. 我们学英语已经10多年了。</font>\n
mount up	<font color=blue size=4>mount up</font>\n<br>increase 增长；上升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His debts are beginning to mount up. 他的债务开始越欠越多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money he put aside every month soon mounted up to quite a sizable amount. 他每月积累的钱很快就达到一笔可观的数字。</font>\n
move about/around	<font color=blue size=4>move about/around</font>\n<br>1. travel about 到处旅行；走来走去；搬来搬去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a great traveller and has moved about all over the world. 他是个大旅行家，走遍了全世界。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can hear somebody moving about upstairs. 我听见楼上有人走动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before liberation his family was moved around a good deal. 解放前他的家老是搬来搬去。</font>\n<br>2. be restless 坐立不安\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children kept moving about. 孩子们总动个不停。</font>\n
move a muscle	<font color=blue size=4>move a muscle</font>\n<br>move a little 挪动一点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girls were so startled that they did not move a muscle. 女孩子们惊讶之极，在那儿一动也不动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The robber said he would shoot the bank worker if he moved a muscle. 强盗说银行职员若敢动一下，他就开枪。</font>\n
move in	<font color=blue size=4>move in</font>\n<br>1. transfer one's possessions to where he is going to live 搬进；迁入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our new neighbours are moving in tomorrow. 我们的新邻居明天搬来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided to move the luggage in while there was time. 他们决定趁还有时间把行李搬到屋子里去。</font>\n<br>2. take possession of a place 占据某地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy moved in last night. 敌人昨晚占领了那个地方。</font>\n
move in on	<font color=blue size=4>move in on</font>\n<br>1. approach; enter or attack an area when trying to get control of it 向…移近；向…进逼；为捕获而逼进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The army has begun to move in on the defenders. 部队开始围歼守敌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The camera moved in on the hero for a closeup sequence. 摄影机向男主角移近，准备拍一组特写镜头。</font>\n<br>2. take control of; take over 控制；占有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He moved in on my girl friend and now we're not talking to each other. 他抢走了我的女朋友，现在我们互不理睬对方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gang has decided to move in on the slot machine business. 那伙人决定控制自动售货机的生意。</font>\n
move off	<font color=blue size=4>move off</font>\n<br>1. depart（开始）离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The troops moved off at dawn. 部队在黎明时出发了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train moved off. 火车开动了。</font>\n<br>2. be sold rapidly 畅销\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first edition moved off within a week. 第1版不到一星期就销完了。</font>\n<br>3. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whether from the fall or the fright, the Major moved off in a month. 也不知道由于跌倒还是由于惊吓，少校不到一个月就死了。</font>\n
move on	<font color=blue size=4>move on</font>\n<br>1. proceed; advance 前进；继续前进；继续进行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Medical science has moved on a lot since I was a boy. 从我孩提时起，医学就一直发展得很快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll now move on to your next proposal. 我们现在接着讨论你的下一个建议。</font>\n<br>2. change the discussion, conversation, etc. to sth. else 改换（新的东西）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we've talked enough about that subject; let's move on. 我看那个题目我们已经谈得够多了，让我们换换话题吧。</font>\n<br>3. depart; start 离开；出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time to be moving on. 该走啦。</font>\n
move out	<font color=blue size=4>move out</font>\n<br>1. move or cause to move from a house, etc. 搬出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tenants of that old house are moving out to the new flats. 那座老房子的住户将搬到新公寓去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They're having to move out because they can't afford the rent. 因为交不起房租他们只得准备搬家。</font>\n<br>2. quit; leave 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The troops have moved out. 军队已经开拔了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell the men to pack their kit; we're moving out. 通知大家打好背包，我们要出发了。</font>\n
move up	<font color=blue size=4>move up</font>\n<br>1. move farther in the direction indicated 沿着指定的方向往前移动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Move up in front, we haven't any room to sit. 往前移点儿，我们没地方可坐了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you mind moving up a bit to that I can sit down? 能不能挪点地方让我坐下来？</font>\n<br>2. rise in rank; promote 升职；提升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's moved very rapidly up the promotion ladder. 他步步高升。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's learnt so fast that we can now move her up to a more advanced class. 她学得很快，我们可以把她调到高班去。</font>\n<br>3. (an exchange rate, etc.) rise （兑换率等）升高\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The exchange rate of the pound moved up sharply. 英镑的兑换率急剧上升。</font>\n<br>4. move into a battle area 进入战斗区\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two companies were moved up under cover of darkness to reinforce the front line. 两个连在夜幕的掩护下增援前线。</font>\n
mow down	<font color=blue size=4>mow down</font>\n<br>1. murder or kill people in large numbers 大量杀死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many enemy soldiers were mowed down by our artillery fire. 许多敌军士兵在我炮火轰击下纷纷倒毙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The machineguns mowed down the advancing lines of infantrymen. 机枪大量地杀伤行进中的步兵。</font>\n<br>2. utterly crush; overwhelm; meet and overcome swiftly and completely 完全压倒；彻底制服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our difficulties may be mountains high, but we'll mow them down. 那怕困难象山一样高，我们也要克服它们。</font>\n
much less	<font color=blue size=4>much less</font>\n<br>and also not; and even less able or likely to 更不；更别提\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs. 约翰连这箱子提都提不起来，更别说把它搬上楼了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've never seen the man, much less spoken to him. 我见也没见过这个人，更谈不上跟他说话了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy can hardly understand arithmetic, much less algebra. 那孩子连算术都不大懂，更不用说代数了。</font>\n
muck about/around	<font color=blue size=4>muck about/around</font>\n<br>1. spend time in an aimless or idle way 闲荡；混日子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I were you, I'd stop mucking about and look for a job. 我要是你的话，就不再整天无所事事，而去找一份工作干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The square was full of people mucking around. 广场上尽是些闲逛的人。</font>\n<br>2. handle sth. playfully or in a clumsy way 瞎弄；乱弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He keeps mucking about with things he doesn't understand. 他总是瞎弄他所不明白的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has been mucking about with my bicycle. 有人在瞎搞我的自行车。</font>\n<br>3. irritate 激怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to enjoy mucking me about. 他似乎以气我取乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hates customers who muck him about. 他恨那些使他生气的顾客。</font>\n<br>4. behave in a silly, playful or foolish way 胡闹\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll send the pair of you to see the headmaster if you don't stop mucking about. 你们要是不停止胡闹，我就把你们两个都送去见校长。</font>\n
muck in	<font color=blue size=4>muck in</font>\n<br>take part 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You don't want people to think that you are too proud to muck in, do you? 你不想让人认为你这人很高傲而不想加入，是吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've mucked in with each other ever since childhood. 他们俩自幼相处，关系一直很好。</font>\n
muck up	<font color=blue size=4>muck up</font>\n<br>1. make dirty 弄脏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell down and came home with his clothes all mucked up. 他摔了一跤，回家时衣服都弄脏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Clean your shoes on the mat, or you'll muck up the floor. 把鞋子在垫上擦干净，否则你会把地板弄脏的。</font>\n<br>2. spoil; make a mess of 搞糟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hairdresser has really mucked my hair up this time. He's cut it much too short. 理发师这次真把我头发弄坏了，他剪得太短了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have mucked my plan up completely. 他们把我的计划全搞乱了。</font>\n
muddle along/on	<font color=blue size=4>muddle along/on</font>\n<br>manage somehow 好歹对付；得过且过；混日子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He muddled on without making any real effort. 他得过且过，从不努力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Oh, we muddle along, you know, though we are not rich. 哦，你知道，我们虽不富裕，但凑合还过得去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In our factory you see nobody muddling along. 在我们厂里，你看不到混日子的人。</font>\n
muddle through	<font color=blue size=4>muddle through</font>\n<br>manage to do or complete sth. , despite lack of knowledge or skill 勉强过得去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It always amazes me how Tom manages to muddle through. 令我惊奇的是汤姆不知怎么总能混下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He knows enough mathematics to muddle through in his job. 他懂得一些数学，工作上大体可以对付过去。</font>\n
muddle up	<font color=blue size=4>muddle up</font>\n<br>confuse; mix up 把…搞乱；搞混\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have muddled up the answers. 你把答案搞错了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's concentrate on one job at a time, or you'll muddle me up. 我们一次集中干一件事，否则你会把我搞胡涂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The photographs got muddled up with the postcards and it was difficult to sort them out. 照片和明信片混在一起了，很难把它们清理出来。</font>\n
mug up	<font color=blue size=4>mug up</font>\n<br>learn thoroughly, usually for an exam（考前）拼命强记；攻读\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use mugging up those formulas without mastering them. 不掌握公式，光是强记是没有用的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've forgotten nearly everything that I mugged up for the. last exams. 以前考试时强记的东西我现在已忘得差不多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's mugging up history for the exam. 他正在死记历史以应付考试。</font>\n
mull over	<font color=blue size=4>mull over</font>\n<br>consider or think about sth. 对…琢磨；思考\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's asked for a bit more time to mull over my proposal. 他要求给他点时间来考虑我的提议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wanted the the chance of mulling over his conclusions about the subject. 他希望有机会仔细考虑一下他对这个问题的结论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He mulled the idea over in his mind. 他脑子里反复思考这个主意。</font>\n
muscle in	<font color=blue size=4>muscle in</font>\n<br>force one's way in 强行进入；强夺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to muscle in on the meeting, but they threw him out. 他想强行进入会场，但他们把他赶了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't want any of the big companies muscling in on the project. 我们不希望任何一家大公司强取这一工程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gang has muscled in on their rivals'territory. 这伙匪徒强行进入了他们对手的地盘。</font>\n
muster up	<font color=blue size=4>muster up</font>\n<br>develop; gather 鼓起；奋起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He mustered up courage to climb the cliff. 他鼓起勇气攀登那个峭壁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Muster up yodr courage. The difficulty will soon be overcome. 鼓起勇气来，困难很快就会克服的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He mustered up all his courage for the ordeal. 他鼓足勇气去经受严峻的考验。</font>\n
nail down	<font color=blue size=4>nail down</font>\n<br>1. make secure by using nails 用钉子钉住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the corner of the carpet curls up, nail it down. 要是地毯的角卷起了，就把它钉牢。</font>\n<br>2. settle definitely; make sure 确定；肯定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe had a hard time selling his car, but he finally nailed the sale down when he got his friend Sam to give him＄300. 乔的车很难脱手，在他朋友山姆出价300元时，他终于做成了交易。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our company has just managed to nail down a new, contract worth ￡60, 000. 我们公司刚设法确定了一份价值6万英镑的合同。</font>\n<br>3. make sb. express his position, opinion, etc. 要（某人）把话讲明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible to tell how much truth there is in his allegations as he refuses to be nailed down. 要说出在他的断言中有多少真实性是不可能的，因为他不肯讲明白。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The more we try to nail her down, the more she refuses even to talk about the issue. 我们越是想让她讲明白，她越是拒绝谈论这个问题。</font>\n<br>4. insist on sb. keeping a promise, an undertaking, etc. 坚持要（某人）遵守诺言等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not going to be nailed down to a particular date for completing the work. 我不打算受在某个特定日期完成任务的约束。</font>\n<br>5. make agree 使同意；使应允\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>See if you can nail him down to accepting our offer. 看你能否使他同意接受我们的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I nailed him down to coming at six. 我让他一定在6点钟来。</font>\n
name after	<font color=blue size=4>name after</font>\n<br>give the same name as 用…命名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The substance was named after its discoverer. 这一物质是以其发现者的名字命名的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was named after his mother. 这个孩子是以他母亲的名字起名的。</font>\n
narrow down	<font color=blue size=4>narrow down</font>\n<br>become narrow; become limited; reduce 变窄；缩小；减少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The path has narrowed down a lot since I was last here. 自我上次到这里以来，这条路已窄了许多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The selection committee has narrowed down the original pile of applications to just these five. 选拔委员会已把原来的一大堆申请书缩小到这5份了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole question narrows down to who is going to pay for all the damage. 整个问题只剩下该由谁来赔偿损失了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have narrowed the search down to this area of the town. 他们已把搜查范围缩小到该市的这个地区。</font>\n
near at hand	<font color=blue size=4>near at hand</font>\n<br>1. close by 在近旁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should always have a good dictionary near at hand. 你手头应当一直有一本好词典。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fortunately there was a hospital near at hand and they took the man there. 幸好附近有所医院，他们就把这人送到那里去了。</font>\n<br>2. soon to happen 即将发生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The examinations are near at hand. 考试即将来临。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day when he will have to be punished is near at hand. 他很快就将受到惩罚。</font>\n
neck and neck	<font color=blue size=4>neck and neck</font>\n<br>close together; side by side; with no advantage over the other in a race 并驾齐驱；不分上下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two longdistance runners were neck and neck all the way to the finish line. 两个长跑运动员一直到终点都是并驾齐驱，不分上下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two race boats seemed neck and neck as they rounded the final curve. 两条赛船在驶到最后一个拐弯处时似乎并肩而行，不分胜负。</font>\n
neglectful of	<font color=blue size=4>neglectful of</font>\n<br>in the habit of neglecting things 常常忘记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She works so hard that she is often neglectful of her family. 她工作非常卖命，常常连家都忘了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is often neglectful of his promise. 他常常言而无信。</font>\n
neither fish, (flesh, ) nor fowl	<font color=blue size=4>neither fish, (flesh, ) nor fowl</font>\n<br>sth. or sb. that does not belong to a definite group or known class 非驴非马；不伦不类\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Harris bought a piece of furniture that was both a table and a chair. Mr. Harris said it was neither fish nor fowl. 哈里斯太太买了一张桌子兼椅子的家俱，她先生说那是不伦不类。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That book is neither fish, flesh, nor fowl. 这本书写得不伦不类。</font>\n
neither here nor there	<font color=blue size=4>neither here nor there</font>\n<br>not important to the thing being discussed 不重要；与题目不相干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talked for two hours but his remarks were neither here nor there. 他讲了两个小时，但尽说些不相干的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you have just said is neither here nor there. Try to keep to the topic. 你刚才所讲的与题无关，要尽量扣紧主题。</font>\n<br>neither…nor…既不…也不…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Neither you nor I nor anybody else knows the answer. 你我以及其他任何人都不知道这个答案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is neither blue nor green. 它既不是蓝的，也不是绿的。</font>\n
new deal	<font color=blue size=4>new deal</font>\n<br>another chance 新机会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy asked for a new deal after he had been punished for fighting in school. 这男孩在学校里因打架而受处分后，要求重新给他一次机会。</font>\n
next door to	<font color=blue size=4>next door to</font>\n<br>1. in or to the next house of 在…隔壁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives next door to me. 他住在我隔壁。</font>\n<br>2. very close to; almost the same as 几乎等于；接近于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Publishing secrets about the country's missiles is next door to treason. 刊登有关国家导弹的秘密等于叛国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sick man was next door to death. 这病人即将死亡。</font>\n
next to	<font color=blue size=4>next to</font>\n<br>1. beside; nearest in space 在…旁边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He placed his chair next to mine. 他把椅子放在我的旁边。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like wool next to my skin. 我不喜欢把毛衣贴身穿。</font>\n<br>2. inferior to; ranking second 次于；仅次于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is the largest city next to London. 这是仅次于伦敦的最大都市。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Next to riding, I like swimming best. 除骑马外，我就最爱游泳了。</font>\n<br>3. almost; almost amounting to 几乎是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No wonder she is ill！She eats next to nothing. 难怪她生病！她几乎什么也不吃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I admit I knew nest to nothing about teaching although I knew a lot about chemistry when I first became a science teacher. 我承认我对教学几乎一窍不通，虽然我当初成为理科教师时，已经掌握了许多化学知识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was next to robbery. 这简直是抢劫。</font>\n
no better than	<font color=blue size=4>no better than</font>\n<br>almost 几乎是；简直是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her life before liberation was no better than that of a beggar. 解放前她的生活同乞丐差不多。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he boasts a lot, he is no better than the others. 别看他吹得厉害，其实他并不比别人强。</font>\n
nobody's fool	<font color=blue size=4>nobody's fool</font>\n<br>smart person 聪明者\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the classroom and on the football field, Henry was nobody's fool. 在课堂上，亨利是最好的学生，在球场上，他是最佳球员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sure you won't be able to trick Jack into helping you with the robbery or anything else illegal—he's nobody's fool. 我肯定，你要把杰克骗去帮你枪劫或做什么非法的事是办不到的—他聪明的很。</font>\n
nod off	<font color=blue size=4>nod off</font>\n<br>fall asleep unintentionally 打瞌睡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He nodded off over his paper. 他在看报时睡着了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Is it really so late? I must have nodded off. 真的这么晚了吗？我一定是睡着了。</font>\n
no doubt	<font color=blue size=4>no doubt</font>\n<br>doubtless; without question; certainly 无疑；一定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No doubt Susan was the smartest girl in her class. 无疑苏珊是她班上最聪明的学生。</font>\n
no end	<font color=blue size=4>no end</font>\n<br>1. very much; exceeding 非常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim was no end upset because he couldn't go swimming. 吉姆非常着急，因为他不能去游泳。</font>\n<br>2. almost without stopping; continually 不停；继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby cried no end. 婴儿不住地哭。</font>\n
no end of/to	<font color=blue size=4>no end of/to</font>\n<br>1. so many／much of as to seem almost endless 不尽的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no end of letters pouring into the post office. 数不尽的信件投到邮局。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There will be no end of trouble later on if we don't wipe out the insect pests now. 现在不根除害虫，将来后患无穷。</font>\n<br>2. especially; very 非常地；无比地；特别地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He thinks no end of himself. 他觉得他自己很了不起。</font>\n
no good	<font color=blue size=4>no good</font>\n<br>not satisfactory; not adequate; notapproved 不满意；不中用；不足；不同意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried appealing to the man's pride, but it did no good. 他想讨好那个人，但行不通。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no good arguing with him since he is incapable of seeing anyone else's point of view. 跟他争没用，他不会接受任何人的观点的。</font>\n
no less than	<font color=blue size=4>no less than</font>\n<br>1. as much as 正好；至少\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no less than thirty dollars in the drawer. 抽屉里少说也有30美元。</font>\n<br>2. as many as 与…一样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This boy is no less clever than that one. 这个男孩与那个男孩一样聪明。</font>\n
no longer	<font color=blue size=4>no longer</font>\n<br>not any more 不再\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is no longer living here. 他已不住在这里了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now this great stretch of lowland no longer faces the menace of flood. 现在，这一大片洼地已不再受洪水的威胁了。</font>\n
no matter	<font color=blue size=4>no matter</font>\n<br>1. regardless of; in spite of 无论；不管\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to get the car fixed no matter how much it cost. 无论花多少钱他都得把车子送去修一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No matter when he comes, I won't see him. 无论他什么时候来，我都不会见他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll always love you, no matter what happens. 无论发生什么事情，我将永远爱你。</font>\n<br>2. not anything important 不重要的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wanted to see him before he left, but it's no matter. 他离开前我想见他，但这并不很重要。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no matter if the work is not finished today. 这工作今天完不成也没关系。</font>\n
no more	<font color=blue size=4>no more</font>\n<br>1. not any more; not again 不再\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His voice is heard no more. 他的声音再也听不见了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time lost will return no more. 失去的时间不会再来。</font>\n<br>2. dead 死了；不复存在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The barren hills are no more; all around there are fruit trees. 荒山不见了，到处都是果树。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ancient city Troy is no more. 古城特洛伊已不存在了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The great leader is no more. 这位伟大的领袖已去世了。</font>\n<br>3. neither 也不；也没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You don't know Spanish, no more does he. 你不懂西班牙语，他也不懂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't afford a new car, and no more can I. 他买不起新车，我也买不起。</font>\n
no more than	<font color=blue size=4>no more than</font>\n<br>only 只有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no more than thirty dollars in the drawer. 抽屉里只有30美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was no more than an ordinary worker but she has invented a lot of new machines. 她只不过是一个普通的工人，然而她却发明了许多新机器。</font>\n<br> no more…than…\n<br>not at all more than 与…相比，同样也不…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is no more diligent than you. 你不勤奋，他也不勤奋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A student can no more obtain knowledge without studying than a farmer can get harvest without ploughing. 学生不学习不能获得知识，正如农民不耕种就不能收获一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One minute late is no more in time than half an hour. 迟到一分钟跟迟到半小时同样是不准时。</font>\n
no more…than…	<font color=blue size=4>no more…than…</font>\n<br>not at all more than 与…相比，同样也不…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is no more diligent than you. 你不勤奋，他也不勤奋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A student can no more obtain knowledge without studying than a farmer can get harvest without ploughing. 学生不学习不能获得知识，正如农民不耕种就不能收获一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One minute late is no more in time than half an hour. 迟到一分钟跟迟到半小时同样是不准时。</font>\n<br> no more than\n<br>only 只有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no more than thirty dollars in the drawer. 抽屉里只有30美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was no more than an ordinary worker but she has invented a lot of new machines. 她只不过是一个普通的工人，然而她却发明了许多新机器。</font>\n
none the less	<font color=blue size=4>none the less</font>\n<br>however 仍然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is old, none the less he works like a young man. 他虽说上了年纪，但干起活来还象个年轻人。</font>\n
none too	<font color=blue size=4>none too</font>\n<br>not at all 根本不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor arrived none too soon, as Mary's fever was very alarming. 玛丽发烧温度高得吓人，可医生并没有及时赶到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were discovered by the pilot of the helicopter, and none too soon, because they'd eaten all their food. 他们被直升飞机驾驶员发现，差一点就来不及了，因为他们已吃光了所有食物。</font>\n
nose about/around	<font color=blue size=4>nose about/around</font>\n<br>look for sth. kept private or secret 探问；打听\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hates the way her mother goes nosing around the house each time she visits them. 他恨她母亲每次去看他们时，总喜欢在家里东找西寻的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is fond of nosing about for grapevine news. 他爱打听小道消息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The detective was nosing around in the crowd, looking for pickpockets. 侦探在人群中搜寻扒手。</font>\n
nose into	<font color=blue size=4>nose into</font>\n<br>enquire inquisitively into sb. 's private affairs 干涉（某事）；探听（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why do you always try to nose into others' affairs? 你为什么总想干涉别人的事情？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's always nosing into other people's business. 她老是爱打听别人的私事。</font>\n
nose out	<font color=blue size=4>nose out</font>\n<br>1. learn by effort; uncover 探知；觉察\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there's anything wrong with the machine, he can nose it out promptly. 如果机器出了什么毛病，他立即就能觉察出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The principal nosed out the truth about the stolen examination paper. 校长查出了试卷失窃的真相。</font>\n<br>2. defeat by a nose length 险胜；击败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Collins was nosed out by his opponent in the primary. 柯林斯在初选中就被他的对手击败了。</font>\n
no sooner…than	<font color=blue size=4>no sooner…than</font>\n<br>immediately after…；as soon as 刚…就…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had no sooner left the house than it began to rain. 我刚离开家天就下雨了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No sooner had he entered the office than the telephone rang. 他刚进办公室，电话铃就响了。</font>\n
not a little	<font color=blue size=4>not a little</font>\n<br>rather a large amount of; quite a little 不少；很多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are not finished; not a little is left for us to do. 我们的工作还未完成，还有许多事要我们去做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to have given you not a little trouble. 我很抱歉给你带来许多麻烦。</font>\n
not at all	<font color=blue size=4>not at all</font>\n<br>not in the least 一点也不；根本不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't understand it at all. 他根本就不懂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not at all satisfied with his report. 我对他的报告一点也不满意。</font>\n
notch up	<font color=blue size=4>notch up</font>\n<br>1. mark up in notches or cuts 用刻痕标出；刻下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gunman notched up five victims on the handle of his gun. 枪手在自己的枪柄上刻上5个受害者的记号。</font>\n<br>2. achieve; gain 取得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teams have notched up a number of wins in the tournament. 我们的运动队在这次联赛中频频获胜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has notched up quite a few triumphs lately. 他最近取得了好几项成就。</font>\n
noted for	<font color=blue size=4>noted for</font>\n<br>famous for 以…著名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Australian wool is noted all over the world for its fineness and good quality. 澳大利亚羊毛因其质地柔软和质量上乘而著称于世。</font>\n
note down	<font color=blue size=4>note down</font>\n<br>write sth. down 记录；记下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He noted down her address and telephone number in the back of his diary. 他在日记本的最后一页记下了她的地址和电话号码。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He noted down everything I said. 他把我说的都记下了。</font>\n
nothing but	<font color=blue size=4>nothing but</font>\n<br>nothing except; only; nothing else but 只；不过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It, s nothing but an ordinary watch. 这只是块普通的表。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had nothing but a cup of tea this morning. 他早上只喝了杯茶。</font>\n
nothing less than	<font color=blue size=4>nothing less than</font>\n<br>quite the same as 与…完全相同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is nothing less than aggression. 这简直是侵略行为。</font>\n
nothing to	<font color=blue size=4>nothing to</font>\n<br>1. not important to 对…不重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is nothing to me. 这件事对我来说没什么。</font>\n<br>2. not comparable with 与…不能相比\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My losses are nothing to yours. 我的损失不能和你的相比。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm is nothing to the one last year. 这次风暴比不上去年那一次大。</font>\n
not in the least	<font color=blue size=4>not in the least</font>\n<br>not at all 毫不；一点也不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am not in the least suspicious of it. 对此我毫不怀疑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wasn't in the least afraidher Dad was with her. 她一点儿也不害怕，因为她父亲和她在一起。</font>\n
not much of	<font color=blue size=4>not much of</font>\n<br>not very good as 不很好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not much of a cook. 他不是个好厨师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not much of a mechanic, I'm afraid, but I'll have a look at your car if you like. 我恐怕不是一个很熟练的技师，但如果你愿意的话，我就看看你的汽车。</font>\n
not to mention	<font color=blue size=4>not to mention</font>\n<br>without saying anything about 更不必说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible for me to go to Green's party tonight. I've got to babysit for my sister, not to mention write a book report and prepare for an exam. 今晚我不可能去参加格林的晚会了。我得照看我姐姐的小孩，更不用说写读书报告和准备考试了。</font>\n
not to speak of	<font color=blue size=4>not to speak of</font>\n<br>not to mention 不用说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He writes good French, not to speak of rending it. 他的法语写得很好，更不用说阅读了。</font>\n
no use	<font color=blue size=4>no use</font>\n<br>1. uselessness 没有用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no use in crying about your broken bike. 你的车子坏了，哭也没用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use for you to pretend that you didn't know the rules. 你假装不懂规则对你是没有用的。</font>\n<br>2. disliking 讨厌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had no use for dogs after a dog bit him. 被狗咬了以后他再也不喜欢狗了。</font>\n
now and then	<font color=blue size=4>now and then</font>\n<br>now and again; occasionally; once in a while 时而；偶尔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now and then he goes to a ball game. 他偶尔去看看球赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now and then Larry and his wife go out to dinner at an expensive firstrate restaurant. 拉里和他妻子偶尔去豪华饭店吃饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every now and then she would glance up at the clock. 她不时抬头看看钟。</font>\n
no wonder	<font color=blue size=4>no wonder</font>\n<br>not surprising; expected 难怪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is no wonder that the children love to visit the farm. 难怪孩子们喜欢参观农场。</font>\n
now that	<font color=blue size=4>now that</font>\n<br>since 既然；因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now that dinner is ready, wash your hands. 饭准备好了，洗手去吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now that you have finished your work, you'd better have a rest. 既然你的工作已经做完了，最好休息一下吧。</font>\n
now…now	<font color=blue size=4>now…now</font>\n<br>sometimes 有时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather changed every day; it was now hot now cool. 天气每天都在变，有时热有时凉。</font>\n
object to	<font color=blue size=4>object to</font>\n<br>oppose in words or argument 反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one objected to the decision when it was made. 做出这项决定时没有人反对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can James object to my going away with you? 詹姆斯怎么会反对我和你一起走呢？</font>\n
obliged to	<font color=blue size=4>obliged to</font>\n<br>1. required to 不得不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was obliged to leave his home town 30 years ago. 30年前他被迫离开了家乡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were obliged to give up the chance. 他们不得不放弃这次机会。</font>\n<br>2. acknowledging a favor received 感激\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will be much obliged to you for an early reply. 尽早赐复，不胜感激。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are much obliged to you for your help. 我们非常感谢你的帮助。</font>\n
occupied in/with	<font color=blue size=4>occupied in/with</font>\n<br>busy in／with 忙于；从事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were occupied in building a bridge. 他们忙着修建一座桥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are mainLy occupied with agriculture. 他们主要从事农业。</font>\n<br>occur to sb. come to／into sb. 's mind 想到\n<br>It just occurred to me that we had better make reservations in advance if we\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>want to see the play this evening. 我刚刚想起，如果今晚我们要去看戏，最好预先订座。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It never occurred to him to phone me. 他根本没想到要打电话给我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A new idea suddenly occurred to me. 我忽然想到了一个新主意。</font>\n
odds and ends	<font color=blue size=4>odds and ends</font>\n<br>small articles without much value 零碎东西；残剩东西\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This room is filled with odds and ends. 这房里塞满了零碎物品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have some odds and ends to do tomorrow morning. 明早我有些零碎事要做。</font>\n
of age	<font color=blue size=4>of age</font>\n<br>becoming old enough to be responsible in law 成年\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In England, both men and women come of age at 21. 在英国，无论男女，都以21岁为成年。</font>\n
of course	<font color=blue size=4>of course</font>\n<br>naturally; certainly 当然地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain came pouring down, and of course the sports meet was canceled. 大雨瓢泼，运动会当然也就取消了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Of course you know that girl; she's in your class. 你当然认识那个女孩，因为她在你们班上。</font>\n
off and on	<font color=blue size=4>off and on</font>\n<br>not regularly; occasionally 时辍时续的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It rained off and on all day. 雨断断续续地下了一整天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wrote to a girl in London off and on for several years. 他与伦敦的一位姑娘断断续续地通了几年信。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't go to the theatre regularly, just off and on. 我们不常去看戏，只是偶尔看看罢了。</font>\n
off balance	<font color=blue size=4>off balance</font>\n<br>1. not in balance 失去平衡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Paul was speeding along on his bicycle, when an unexpected hole in the road caught him off balance. 保尔飞快骑着自行车，没料到路上的一个坑使他失去平衡，从车上摔下来。</font>\n<br>2. not prepared; not ready 无准备地；不防备地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our surprise attack caught the enemy off balance and threw them into confusion. 我们的突然袭击把敌人打了个措手不及，他们顿时乱作一团。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher's surprise test caught the class off balance, and nearly everyone got a poor mark. 老师突然抽考，使全班毫无防备，几乎每个同学成绩都很差。</font>\n
off base	<font color=blue size=4>off base</font>\n<br>not agreeing with fact; wrong 与事实不符的；错误的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So far as I know, what he said at the meeting is off base. 据我所知，他会上所讲的那番话与事实不符。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Any man who said such a thing is certainly off base. 说这事的人都是没有根据的。</font>\n
off color	<font color=blue size=4>off color</font>\n<br>unwell; in low spirits 气色不好；身体有点不舒服；神情沮丧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm off color today. 今天我感到不舒服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“You're looking a bit off color yourself, Mr. Young. ”“Oh, I feel very tired, doctor. ”“杨先生，你看上去气色有点不好。”“噢，医生，我感觉很累。”</font>\n
off duty	<font color=blue size=4>off duty</font>\n<br>not at work 不值班；下班\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is off duty today. 他今天不值班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It seems that all the taxis in New York are off duty whenever it rains. 雨天，纽约所有的出租车似乎都休息了。</font>\n
off guard	<font color=blue size=4>off guard</font>\n<br>in a careless attitude 疏忽；不提防\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tim's question caught Jones off guard. 蒂姆提的问题令琼斯毫无准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck me while I was off my guard. 他乘我不备打了我一下。</font>\n
off sb's hands	<font color=blue size=4>off sb's hands</font>\n<br>1. done 完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The responsibility is off my hands. 我已完成那项任务。</font>\n<br>2. disposed of 售出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a lame horse which he wished to get off his hands. 他有一匹瘸马要卖。</font>\n<br>3. no longer in sb. 's care or possession 不再由（某人）照管或负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Now my two sons are off my hands: one of them is working in a factory and the other teaching in a school. 现在我两个儿子都自立了，一个在工厂做工，一个在学校教书。</font>\n
off the beam	<font color=blue size=4>off the beam</font>\n<br>1. (of an airplane) not in the radio beam that marks the path to follow between airports（飞机）脱离航向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pilot received a warning that his plane was flying off the beam. 飞行员接到了他的飞机偏离了航向的警告。</font>\n<br>2. wrong; mistaken 错误的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've come to realize what I said at the meeting was off the beam. 我已经认识到我在会上所讲的话是错误的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim was off the beam when he said that the girls didn't like him. 杰姆说那些女孩都不喜欢他，他是错了。</font>\n
off the beaten track	<font color=blue size=4>off the beaten track</font>\n<br>1. not wellknown; not visited by many people 不出名；人们不常去的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know a nice place for a picnic that's off the beaten track; hardly anyone goes there. 我知道一个野餐的好地方，那儿很少有人去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This theatre is off the beaten track. 这家剧院并不出名。</font>\n<br>2. unusual 不寻常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers went off the beaten track and designed a newtype grinder. 工人们打破常规，设计了一台新型磨床。</font>\n
off the cuff	<font color=blue size=4>off the cuff</font>\n<br>without preparing ahead of time what one will say 无准备地；即兴地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always at his best when he speaks off the cuff. 他即席讲话总是讲得很出色。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Considering that the speech was off the cuff, it was rather good. 由于这发言是毫无准备的，所以它还算是不错的。</font>\n
off the ground	<font color=blue size=4>off the ground</font>\n<br>making progress 进展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our plans for a party didn't get off the ground because no one could come. 我们聚会的计划未能实现，因为没人前来参加。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make sure your project gets off the ground at the start. 一定要使你们的工程一开始就进行得顺利。</font>\n
off the hook	<font color=blue size=4>off the hook</font>\n<br>out of trouble; out of an awkward situation 摆脱窘境\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Seeing that he couldn't answer the question, I tried to get him off the hook by changing the subject. 看到他那个问题答不上来，我就设法换个话题让他摆脱窘境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he saw her smile he knew he was off the hook. 他一看到她的笑脸，就明白他已没麻烦了。</font>\n
off the map	<font color=blue size=4>off the map</font>\n<br>remote 偏远的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our house is rather off the map. I think it would be best for me to meet you at the station. 我们的房子在很偏远的地方。我想最好是我到车站去接你。</font>\n
off the point	<font color=blue size=4>off the point</font>\n<br>not related to the subject 离题的；不切题的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I understand what you are trying to say, but I think it's off the point. 我知道你想讲什么，但是我认为你要讲的与本题无关。</font>\n
off the record	<font color=blue size=4>off the record</font>\n<br>confidentially; not for official publication 不可记录或引用的；不公开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president told the reporters that his remarks were strictly off the record. 总统告诉新闻记者，他的谈话严禁公开发表。</font>\n
off the top of one's head	<font color=blue size=4>off the top of one's head</font>\n<br>without thinking hard; quickly 不加思索地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't prepare his lecture beforhand, but only talked off the top of his head. 他事先没有准备，在讲演时只是想到哪里讲到哪里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim answered the teacher's question off the top of his head. 吉姆回答老师的问题时不大动脑筋。</font>\n
off the track	<font color=blue size=4>off the track</font>\n<br>1. following a wrong line of action 出轨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train ran off the track. 火车出轨了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our effort proved fruitless because we were off the track from the very beginning. 我们一开始路子就迈得不对，所以一番功夫尽付东流。</font>\n<br>2. away from the subject 离题\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker was a long way off the track. 演讲者离题太远。</font>\n
of itself	<font color=blue size=4>of itself</font>\n<br>automatically 自动地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The door opened of itself. 门自动地开了。</font>\n
of late	<font color=blue size=4>of late</font>\n<br>in the recent past; not long ago 近来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There have been too many high school dropouts of late. 近来中途退学的中学生太多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She doesn't seem to be very happy of late. 最近她看上去不大开心似的。</font>\n
of necessity	<font color=blue size=4>of necessity</font>\n<br>necessarily;unavoidably 必然地；不可避免地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the Spring Festival coming soon, the traffic will of necessity become heavier. 随着春节的到来，运输必将更加繁忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Being your lawyer, he will of necessity want to know all the details. 作为你的律师，他当然要了解全部细节。</font>\n
of no account	<font color=blue size=4>of no account</font>\n<br>of no importance 无关紧要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This question is of no account. 这个问题不重要。</font>\n
of no avail	<font color=blue size=4>of no avail</font>\n<br>useless; unsuccessful; in vain 没有用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His sickness was treated with many medicines, but all were of no avail. 他的病已用各种药治过，但都无效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom's practicing was of no avail. He was sick on the day of the game. 汤姆平时的练习全部泡汤了，比赛那天他病了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although they tried hard, their efforts seemed to be of no avail. 虽说他们花了很大力气，但看来还是徒劳无功。</font>\n
of old	<font color=blue size=4>of old</font>\n<br>long ago; in the past 古时候；过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Knights of old had to wear armor in battle. 古代的骑士作战时都戴盔甲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Things are very different now from what they used to be of old. 现在的情况跟从前大不一样了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He often recollects days of old. 他常常回想起往昔的日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In days of old, Mary's grandfather lived in this village. 从前，玛丽的祖父就住在这个村子里。</font>\n
of one's own accord	<font color=blue size=4>of one's own accord</font>\n<br>of one's own wish; voluntarily 出于自愿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On her mother's birthday, Betsy did the housework of her own accord. 母亲过生日那天，贝茜主动做家务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He joined the search party of his own accord. 他主动参加了搜索组。</font>\n
of one's own free will	<font color=blue size=4>of one's own free will</font>\n<br>of one's own wish 自动地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm going of my own free will; no one has ordered me to go. 我是自愿去的，没有人命令我。</font>\n
of sorts	<font color=blue size=4>of sorts</font>\n<br>not especially good 勉强称得上的；普通的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though some people praise his verse, he's really only a poet of sorts. 尽管有人称赞他的诗，实际上他只是一个蹩脚的诗人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom was a magician of sorts but popular at parties. 汤姆算不上是个好魔术师，但在聚会时很受欢迎。</font>\n
of the first water	<font color=blue size=4>of the first water</font>\n<br>of the finest quality; superior 最好的；第一流的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was no doubt a painter of the first water. 他无疑是位一流的画家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The jeweler chose diamonds of the first water for the queen's crown. 珠宝商为王后的冠饰挑选头等钻石。</font>\n
of use	<font color=blue size=4>of use</font>\n<br>useful 有用的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This book will be of some use to you in future. 这本书将来对你会有用的。</font>\n
old hand	<font color=blue size=4>old hand</font>\n<br>experienced worker; very knowledgeable person 老手；有经验的人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cowboys were old hands at controlling cattle. 牛仔们是驯牛老手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Jackson is an old hand at negotiating our contracts, he's been with the firm for nearly twenty years, so he knows all the procedures. 杰克逊先生在我们的合同谈判方面很在行，他在这公司已将近20年，所以他熟悉一切程序。</font>\n
on account	<font color=blue size=4>on account</font>\n<br>1. as interim payment 预付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give the driver ten dollars, and tell him it is on account. 给司机10美元，告诉他那是预支的。</font>\n<br>2. in the creditor's book 分期付款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John paid ＄10 down and ＄5 on account each month for his bicycle. 约翰购买自行车时先付了10美元，以后每月按5美元分期付款。</font>\n
on account of	<font color=blue size=4>on account of</font>\n<br>as a result of; because of 因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The picnic was held indoors on account of the rain. 由于天下雨，野餐在室内进行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Flights were delayed two hours on account of the thick fog. 由于大雾，班机推迟了两小时。</font>\n
on a diet	<font color=blue size=4>on a diet</font>\n<br>living on a limited list of foods and drinks 按规定进食\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better give her something else but candy and chocolate because she is on a diet. 你最好不要给她糖和巧克力而给些别的，因为她在节食。</font>\n
on all fours	<font color=blue size=4>on all fours</font>\n<br>1. on all four legs;on hands and knees 匍匐而行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alice's father got down on all fours and gave the baby a ride. 艾丽丝的父亲趴下，让她骑在背上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby crawled around the floor on all fours. 那婴孩在地板上到处乱爬。</font>\n<br>2. in agreement with 一致的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your argument is on all fours with mine. 你的论点和我的一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This simile is not on all fours with the thing that it is supposed to illustrate. 这个比喻同那个要说明的事物不太贴切。</font>\n
on and on	<font color=blue size=4>on and on</font>\n<br>continuously 连续不断地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She talked on and on about her son. 她不停地谈到她的儿子。</font>\n
on an even keel	<font color=blue size=4>on an even keel</font>\n<br>in a wellordered way or condition; orderly 有条不紊地；安定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the discussion seemed to be getting out of hand the chairman got things back on an even keel. 眼看争论激烈得要难以收场时，会议主席设法使大家平静下来。</font>\n
on an/the average	<font color=blue size=4>on an/the average</font>\n<br>in most cases; usually 通常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On an average Don's mother has to ask him three times before he helps wash dishes. 通常唐的母亲叫他3遍他才帮助洗盘子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the average the machine turns out one bottle every two seconds. 这台机器平均每两秒钟生产1只瓶子。</font>\n
on approval	<font color=blue size=4>on approval</font>\n<br>with the understanding that the thing may be refused（商品）供试用的；包退包换的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The corporation offered to send us samples on approval. 公司提出要向我们提供一些试用样品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Grey bought his camera on approval. 格雷先生买的相机包退包换。</font>\n
on/at the tip of one's tongue	<font color=blue size=4>on/at the tip of one's tongue</font>\n<br>just going to say 话到嘴边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was on the tip of my tongue to tell him. 我差点告诉了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was on the tip of my tongue to call him a liar, but I stopped myself just in time. 我差一点叫他为撒谎鬼，但我及时制止了自己。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's on the tip of my tongue but I still can't remember your name. 你的名字就在我嘴边，可我就是想不起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has half a dozen languages at the tip of his tongue. 他能随口讲5、6种语言。</font>\n
on behalf of	<font color=blue size=4>on behalf of</font>\n<br>1. as a representative 代表\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John accepted the championship award on behalf of the team. 约翰代表球队领取冠军奖。</font>\n<br>2. for the good of 为了… 的利益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rendered many valuable services on behalf of justice and freedom. 他为正义和自由做了许多有意义的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They worked hard all their lives on behalf of the poor. 他们毕生为穷人的利益而辛劳。</font>\n
on board	<font color=blue size=4>on board</font>\n<br>on a ship or train 在（船、火车）上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A ship was leaving the harbor, and we saw the people on board waving. 船缓缓地离开港口，我们看见船上的人在挥手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack wasn't on board the ship when it sailed. 启航时，杰克不在船上。</font>\n
on business	<font color=blue size=4>on business</font>\n<br>for the purpose of doing business 有事；因公\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you here on business or for pleasrue? 你来这儿是有事还是消遣呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The secretary told the visitor that the manager was out on business. 秘书告诉来访者说经理出差去了。</font>\n
on call	<font color=blue size=4>on call</font>\n<br>ready and available 随叫随到的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctors in our clinic are on call day and night. 无论白天黑夜，我们医务室的医生总是随叫随到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money is payable on call. 这笔钱可以随时支付。</font>\n
once (and) for all	<font color=blue size=4>once (and) for all</font>\n<br>1. definitely 断然地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The mosquitoes must be destroyed once and for all. 必须把这些蚊子全部消灭掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm going to settle this matter once and for all. 我要彻底解决这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once and for all, I'll not go swimming with you. 我绝对不会同你一块去游泳。</font>\n<br>2. permanently 水远地；一劳永逸地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two countries decided to end the war once and for all. 两国决定这场战争从此结束。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is not something that can be completed once for all. 这不是件可以一劳永逸的事。</font>\n
once in a while	<font color=blue size=4>once in a while</font>\n<br>occasionally; now and then 有时；偶尔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We go for a picnic in the park once in a while. 我们有时去公园里野餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once in a while the puppy would run away. 小狗有时也会溜出去。</font>\n
once more	<font color=blue size=4>once more</font>\n<br>a second time 再度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked the question once more. 他再次提出这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would try once more. 他说他将再试一次。</font>\n
once upon a time	<font color=blue size=4>once upon a time</font>\n<br>1. long ago 从前；很久以前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once upon a time there dwelt a fisherman on the lakeside. 从前湖边住着一个渔民。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once upon a time there lived a king who had an ugly daughter. 从前有一位国王，他有一个丑陋的女儿。</font>\n<br>2. sometime before now 以前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once upon a time she was thought to be the most talented actress in the country. 以前她被认为是该国最有才华的女演员。</font>\n
on condition that	<font color=blue size=4>on condition that</font>\n<br>if; provided that 假如；在…条件下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will lend you the money on condition that you pay it back in one month. 假如你在一个月内能还我钱，我就借给你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can go there on condition that you don't come back late for dinner. 你可以去那儿，条件是回来吃饭不能太晚。</font>\n
on credit	<font color=blue size=4>on credit</font>\n<br>promising to pay at some future time 赊欠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I bought it on credit. 这是我赊账买的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Goods in our shop are not sold on credit but have to be paid for in cash. 本店货物现金交易，概不赊欠。</font>\n
on deck	<font color=blue size=4>on deck</font>\n<br>1. on the open floor of a ship 在甲板上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shall we go up on deck? 我们到甲板上去好吗？</font>\n<br>2. ready to do sth. 准备好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every employee had to be on deck at nine o'clock. 每个雇员都必须在9点钟到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was on deck for the dress rehearsal. 大家都为彩排作好了准备。</font>\n
on deposit	<font color=blue size=4>on deposit</font>\n<br>in bank 存款\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children saved their pennies and each month placed them on deposit. 孩子们省些零钱每月存入银行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has almost ＄400 on deposit in his account. 他帐户上大约有400美元的存款。</font>\n
on display	<font color=blue size=4>on display</font>\n<br>being shown publicly 陈列着；在展览\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop crying if you are not going to have yourself on display in shame！你不想丢人现眼的话就不要哭了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Samples of all major export commodities will be on display at the fair. 主要出口商品的样品将全部在交易会上展出。</font>\n
on duty	<font color=blue size=4>on duty</font>\n<br>doing one's job;at work 上班\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't talk with him. He's on duty now. 不要跟他说话，他正在值班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Policemen are not allowed to smoke while on duty. 警察上班时不许吸烟。</font>\n
one after another/the other	<font color=blue size=4>one after another/the other</font>\n<br>one by one 一个接一个\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wounded soldiers died one after another. 伤兵相继死亡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two happy events came one after the other. 两件喜事接踵而至。</font>\n
one and all	<font color=blue size=4>one and all</font>\n<br>everyone 个个都；全都\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One and all, from the cities and from the villages, came to see him off. 城乡人民个个都来给他送行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They took part in the National Day celebrations, one and all. 他们全都参加了国庆节庆祝活动。</font>\n
