one and the same	<font color=blue size=4>one and the same</font>\n<br>the very same 同一个；完全一样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One and the same idea occurred to each of them. 他们每个人都想起同样的念头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde were one and the same person. 吉基尔博士和海德先生是同一个人。</font>\n
one another	<font color=blue size=4>one another</font>\n<br>each other 彼此\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They gave presents to one another at Christmas. 圣诞节他们互赠礼品。</font>\n
on earth	<font color=blue size=4>on earth</font>\n<br>1. in the world 在世界上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Honolulu boasts that it has the best weather on earth. 檀香山以气候最佳夸称于世。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They consider themselves the wisest men on earth. 他们自认为是世上最聪明的人。</font>\n<br>2. ever 究竟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where on earth did you find that cap? 你究竟在哪儿找到那顶帽子的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How on earth did you manage to do that? 你究竟是怎样设法做那件事的？</font>\n
on easy street	<font color=blue size=4>on easy street</font>\n<br>rather rich 生活优裕；富裕的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After her success in several films, Mary found herself on easy street. 成功地拍摄了几部影片之后，玛丽发现自己的生活颇为优裕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been living on easy street since the family business began to prosper. 自从家庭生意开始兴隆以来，他们就过着富裕的生活。</font>\n
one by one	<font color=blue size=4>one by one</font>\n<br>singly 一个一个地；依次地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students went into the classroom one by one. 学生一个一个地走进教室。</font>\n
one day	<font color=blue size=4>one day</font>\n<br>on a certain day（过去或将来的）某一天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll take you there one day. 总有一天我会带你去那儿的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came to see me one day. 有一天他来看过我。</font>\n
on edge	<font color=blue size=4>on edge</font>\n<br>excited or nervous; irritable 兴奋；紧张；烦躁不安\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The magician kept the children on edge all through his show. 魔术师在他的整个表演中使孩子们兴奋不已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most people feel on edge before exams. 考试前大多数人感到很紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was on edge to hear the verdict. 每个人都迫切地要听到裁决。</font>\n
one in a thousand	<font color=blue size=4>one in a thousand</font>\n<br>very good indeed 千中之一；难得的人（或物）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom, not one in a thousand would have forgiven you as he has done. 汤姆，很少有人会象他那样原谅你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's one in a thousand. She does her work quickly and conscientiously and can always be relied on. 她这个人是很难得的，干活利索认真，又总是那么可信赖。</font>\n
on end	<font color=blue size=4>on end</font>\n<br>1. continously 连续不断地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play is so successful that it has run for years on end. 这出戏非常成功，连演几年不衰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There has been no rain for weeks on end. 持续几个星期没下雨了。</font>\n<br>2. upright 竖着地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to stand the table on end to get it through the door. 要让桌子从门里进，我们只好把它侧着竖起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please put the barrel on end. 请把这只桶竖起来。</font>\n<br>on even terms (with) \n<br>at the same level (with) （与…）不相上下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are on even terms. 他们不相上下。</font>\n
on faith	<font color=blue size=4>on faith</font>\n<br>without question or proof 毫无疑问；无需证据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He looked so honest that we accepted his story on faith. 他看上去极为诚实，我们也就毫不怀疑地相信了他的话。</font>\n
on file	<font color=blue size=4>on file</font>\n<br>stored in a file 存档\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This card should be kept on file for reference. 这张卡片应该存盘以备参考。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our documents on file may throw some light on the matter. 我们保存的文件也许会对这件事有所启示。</font>\n
on fire	<font color=blue size=4>on fire</font>\n<br>1. burning 着火；失火\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We saw a house on fire when we passed the road. 我们经过这条路时，看到一所房子失火了。</font>\n<br>2. in a rage 愤怒；急切\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were on fire with zeal to defend their native land. 他们热血沸腾，决心捍卫自己的祖国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was on fire to rejoin his family after an absence of five years. 他急切地想和阔别5年的家人团聚。</font>\n
on foot	<font color=blue size=4>on foot</font>\n<br>1. by walking 步行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sally's bicycle broke and she had to return home on foot. 萨莉的自行车坏了，她只好步行回家。</font>\n<br>2. being planned 在计划中\n<br>Plans have been set on foot by the\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>company for a party, because Miss Jackson is retiring. 公司已经计划举办一次聚会，以欢送杰克逊小姐退休。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A plan's on foot to invite the Minister of Health to visit our hospital. 邀请卫生部长来我们医院访问的准备工作正在进行。</font>\n
on good terms (with) 	<font color=blue size=4>on good terms (with) </font>\n<br>enjoying friendly relations (with) （与…）和睦相处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two neighbouring countries are on good terms. 这两个邻国和睦相处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two brothers had not been on good terms since their father died, and there was a dispute over the will. 兄弟俩自从父亲死后一直不睦，他们对遗嘱有争议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are not on very good terms with the people next door. 我们和邻居关系不太好。</font>\n
on guard	<font color=blue size=4>on guard</font>\n<br>watchful 警惕；警戒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police warned people to be on guard for pickpockets during the Christmas rush. 警察警告人们在圣诞购物高潮时谨防小偷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be always on guard against complacency. 要时时警惕自满情绪。</font>\n<br>\n<br>on hand\n<br>1. nearby; within reach 附近；在手头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you happen to have any aspirin on hand? I seem to be getting a headache. 你身边有阿斯匹林吗？我似乎头痛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Alwaya have your dictionary on hand when you study. 学习时要随时将词典放在手边。</font>\n<br>2. present 出席；在场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better wait here so you'll be on hand when you're needed. 你最好在这儿等着，以便需要你的时候你在场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Baker's secretary is always on hand when he appears in public. 贝克先生出现在公众面前时，他的秘书总是在场。</font>\n<br>3. in stock; available 现有（存货）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have some new woollen goods on hand. 我们现有一些新羊毛织品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The department store has a large stock of goods on hand. 这家百货商店现有大量存货。</font>\n
on ice	<font color=blue size=4>on ice</font>\n<br>1. sure to be won 有获胜（成功）的把握\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With their lead they had the game on ice. 由于他们得分领先，他们有了赢得这场比赛的把握。</font>\n<br>2. away for safekeeping or later use 留待后用；搁置\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plan for the new book is on ice at the moment. I've been busy with too many other things. 写新书的计划暂停。我一直在忙于做太多其它的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will have to put his vacation plans on ice until his debts are paid. 在还清债务之前，他只好搁置度假计划。</font>\n
on/in sb's behalf	<font color=blue size=4>on/in sb's behalf</font>\n<br>1. for; in the interest of; on account of 因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be uneasy on my behalf. 不要为我担心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thank you for all the trouble you have taken in my behalf. 谢谢你为我解决问题所尽的努力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Public sympathy was active in his behalf. 公众对他深表同情。</font>\n<br>2. as the representative 代表\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chairman signed the document on behalf of the company. 董事长代表公司签署了文件。</font>\n
on leave	<font color=blue size=4>on leave</font>\n<br>absent with permission 请假；休假\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldier is absent from his regiment on leave. 这位士兵休假，不在队上。</font>\n
only that	<font color=blue size=4>only that</font>\n<br>1. with the exception that 除了；只是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a good student, only that he is a little lazy. 他是个好学生，只是稍微懒一点。</font>\n<br>2. were it not that 若不是；要是没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I should like to go, only that I am ill. 要是没病，我倒是很想去的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would come only that I'm engaged to dine out. 若不是有约外出吃饭，我倒是愿意来的。</font>\n
only too	<font color=blue size=4>only too</font>\n<br>very 非常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am only too glad to hear it. 我听了不胜欢喜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was only too willing to accept the proposal. 他非常愿意接受那个建议。</font>\n
on my honor	<font color=blue size=4>on my honor</font>\n<br>upon my word 发誓；一定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I promise on my honor not to betray the secret. 我发誓不泄露机密。</font>\n
on no account	<font color=blue size=4>on no account</font>\n<br>definitely not 决不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On no account should we go out in this big storm. 我们决不能在这场大暴风雨中外出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't on any account leave your baby alone in the house. 切不可将婴儿独自留在家里。</font>\n
on occasion	<font color=blue size=4>on occasion</font>\n<br>occasionally; now and then 偶然地；有时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I went swimming on occasion in summer. 夏天我有时去游泳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I meet him on occasion at the club or in the theatre. 我在俱乐部或戏院里有时能遇到他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On occasion we feel like celebrating and have a party. 我们有时喜欢来个聚会庆贺一番。</font>\n
on one's best ／good behavior	<font color=blue size=4>on one's best ／good behavior</font>\n<br>behaving right 行为规矩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While his father was around, the boy was on his good behavior, but when the father left, the boy soon got into mischief. 父亲在场时，这孩子规规矩矩，但父亲一走，他马上就调皮起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The naughty boy is on his best behavior today. 今天这个调皮鬼表现很好。</font>\n
on one's feet	<font color=blue size=4>on one's feet</font>\n<br>1. standing or walking 站立或步行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before the teacher finished asking the question, George was on his feet, ready to answer it . 老师的问题还没问完，乔治就已经站起来准备回答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How do you keep on your feet so long? 你怎么坚持站了这么长时间？</font>\n<br>2. recovering 恢复（身体）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack is back on his feet after a long illness. 杰克病了好长时间，现在恢复健康了。</font>\n
on one's head	<font color=blue size=4>on one's head</font>\n<br>easily 易如反掌地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When asked if he could lift the big stone, the boy said he could do it on his head. 当有人问那男孩能否举得起那块大石头时，他说这不费吹灰之力。</font>\n
on one's high horse	<font color=blue size=4>on one's high horse</font>\n<br>1. being very proud and scornful 趾高气扬；自高自大\n<br>I don't like him: he's always on his high horse, thinking he can order\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>everyone else about. 不喜欢他，他总是趾高气扬的，以为什么人都得听他的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Martha was chairman of the picnic committee, and at the picnic she was on her high horse, telling everyone what to do. 马莎是野餐会的主席，在野餐时她盛气凌人地指挥每个人怎么做。</font>\n<br>2. in a bad temper 发脾气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl was on her high horse because she found her boyfriend insincere. 姑娘发现她的男友不诚实，非常生气。</font>\n
on one's honor	<font color=blue size=4>on one's honor</font>\n<br>trusted 信任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students were not supervised during the examination. They were on their honor not to cheat. 学生考试时没人监考。老师相信他们不会作弊。</font>\n
on one's knees	<font color=blue size=4>on one's knees</font>\n<br>1. pleading; begging very hard 求饶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children were on their knees for hours before their parents agreed to their camping plans. 孩子们求了几个小时家长才同意让他们去野营。</font>\n<br>2. in a very weak condition; near failure 处于困境；濒临失败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company was on its knees owing to a decrease in its sales. 由于销售额下降，公司陷入了困境。</font>\n
on one's own	<font color=blue size=4>on one's own</font>\n<br>with no help from others; independent 自立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are allowed to drive a car on your own. 允许你独自开车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm all on my own today. 今天只是我一个人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why are you sitting all on your own? 你为什么独自一个人坐在那里？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't need your advice, thanks. I can do it on my own. 谢谢，我不需要你的忠告，我自己能做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can tackle problems on my own. 我能独立解决问题。</font>\n
on one's own account	<font color=blue size=4>on one's own account</font>\n<br>1. for oneself 为自己\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After they had picked out the school gift, some staff members did some shopping on their own account. 挑选出了学校礼品后，一些员工为自己购货去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He bought the watch on his own account, not for his brother. 这表不是给他兄弟买的，而是为他自己买的。</font>\n<br>2. independently 独立地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's too dangerous; I dare not do it on my own account. 这太危险了，我不敢独自一人担这个风险。</font>\n
on one's toes	<font color=blue size=4>on one's toes</font>\n<br>alert; ready to act 机警；准备去做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good ball player is always on his toes. 好的球员总是很机警的。</font>\n
on one's way (to) 	<font color=blue size=4>on one's way (to) </font>\n<br>on the way to 在（赴…的）途中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll buy some apples on my way home. 在回家的路上我要买些苹果。</font>\n
on order	<font color=blue size=4>on order</font>\n<br>requested but ont yet supplied 订购中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop assistant told the customer that they didn't have this type of shoes in stock then, and that they were on order. 售货员告诉顾客他们店现在这种鞋已没货了，正在订购中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When do you think you can ship the goods on orer? 你认为何时能运走所订的货物？</font>\n
on paper	<font color=blue size=4>on paper</font>\n<br>1. judging by appearance 表面上看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The football team look good on paper, but they have lost many games. 这支足球队表面上看来挺不错，但他们已经输了许多场球。</font>\n<br>2. in written words 以书面形式\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get the agreement down on paper. 我们必须将此协议形成文字。</font>\n<br>3. in theory 理论上；从文字上看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The idea sounds good on paper, but I'm not sure whether it will really work. 这个主意从字面上看是很好的，但我不敢肯定它是否真正能行得通。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The applicant looks good on paper. 从书面材料看，这个申请人的情况很不错。</font>\n
on pins and needles	<font color=blue size=4>on pins and needles</font>\n<br>worried 焦虑；坐立不安\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane was very late getting home from school, ane her mother was on pins and needles. 简放学很晚才回家，她妈妈焦急不安。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wounded soldier was on pins and needles, wanting to know the fate of his comrades. 那位伤员因急于想知道战友们的情况而焦虑不安。</font>\n
on principle	<font color=blue size=4>on principle</font>\n<br>as a moral matter 按道理；原则上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He drinks a cup of hot milk every night on principle. 他每晚照例喝一杯热牛奶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I dislike going out for meals in restaurants on principle; why should you pay so much money for food that you could prepare yourself? 我就是不喜欢去外面餐馆吃饭，干吗要花那么多钱去买那些自己能做的食物呢？</font>\n
on purpose	<font color=blue size=4>on purpose</font>\n<br>intentionally 故意地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jimmy hit his little brother in the eye, but he didn't do it on purpose. 杰米打了他弟弟的眼睛，但他不是故意的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not forget her coat; she left it in the locker on purpose. 她并未忘记要带外衣，她是故意放在锁柜里的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She broke the dish on purpose just to show her anger. 她故意打破那个盘子以发泄她的愤怒。</font>\n
on record	<font color=blue size=4>on record</font>\n<br>1. written down in a record 记录在案的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't know when the famous writer was born, but the date of his death was on record. 我们不知道这位名作家何时出生，但他的去世日期是有记录的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's on record that this summer was the hottest in 50 years. 据记载，今年夏天是50年来最热的。</font>\n<br>2. known to have said or done a certain thing 人所共知的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That congressman is on record as an enemy of waste in government. 那位国会议员以反对政府浪费而著名。</font>\n
on sale	<font color=blue size=4>on sale</font>\n<br>selling for a special low price 削价出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These shoes are very cheap, as they are on sale. 这些鞋子非常便宜，正在削价出售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bookstore is to close down, and many books are on sale as waste paper. 书店要关闭，所以许多书象废纸一样在廉价出售。</font>\n
on sb's account	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's account</font>\n<br>for sb. 's sake 为了…利益\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you didn't bring tea to the picnic just on my account. 我希望你不要为了我而带茶来参加野餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Barry studied hard on his mother's account. 贝利为使母亲高兴而用功读书。</font>\n
on sb's back	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's back</font>\n<br>being an annoyance or bother to sb. 打扰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't get any work done with the children on my back from morning till night. 孩子们从早到晚打搅我，我什么事也干不成。</font>\n
on sb's bad side	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's bad side</font>\n<br>not liked by sb. 使人讨厌的；不为（某人）所喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sally's boyfriend got on Father's bad side by keeping her out too late after the dance. 萨莉的男朋友在舞会后没带她早点回家，她的父亲因此不喜欢他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy's on his mother's bad side because he is lazy. 妈妈不喜欢那男孩，因为他懒。</font>\n
on sb's chest	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's chest</font>\n<br>feeling worried or upset 心中有事；闷闷不乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane looks unhappy because she has the quarrel with Sue on her chest. 简显得不高兴，因为她和苏吵了架，心里有些烦闷。</font>\n
on sb's good side	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's good side</font>\n<br>friendly with sb. ; liked by sb. 与人友善；被人喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Diligent pupils get on their teachers'good side. 老师总是喜欢勤奋的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Successful workers stay on the good side of their bosses. 成功的工人总给老板留下一个好印象。</font>\n
on sb's hands	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's hands</font>\n<br>resting on sb. as a responsibility 在某人手中；成为某人的负担\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After everyone had bought a ticket to the dance, the club treasurer had over＄100 on his hands. 每人买了舞会票以后，俱乐部财务主管手头还有100多美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've enough work on my hands already and don't want any more. 我已承担了大量工作，所以不想再接受任何任务了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time hangs heavy on his hands. 时间慢得使他难受。</font>\n
on sb's heels	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's heels</font>\n<br>following closely 紧随\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Little children like to follow on the heels of their elder brothers and sisters. 小孩喜欢跟他们的哥哥姐姐学。</font>\n
on sb's mind	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's mind</font>\n<br>in sb. 's thoughts 想；沉思\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's on your mind? 你在想什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm glad you want to talk about this. It's been on my mind for weeks. 我很高兴你要谈论这件事。我已想了好几个星期了。</font>\n
on sb's part	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's part</font>\n<br>as far as…concerned 就…而言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The other team blamed their defeat on unfairness on the part of the referee. 另一支球队把他们的失败归咎于裁判的不公正。</font>\n
on sb's shoulders	<font color=blue size=4>on sb's shoulders</font>\n<br>in sb. 's care; as sb. 's responsibility 归某人管；为某人的责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The success of the program rests on your shoulders. 此项计划的成功就取决于你了。</font>\n
on schedule	<font color=blue size=4>on schedule</font>\n<br>punctual; at the expected time 在预定的时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If my train is on schedule, I will be home by nine o'clock. 若火车准点，我9点以前可以到家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the meeting is not held on schedule, I'll have to leave without at tending it. 要是会议不准时举行，我只好缺席了。</font>\n
on second thoughts	<font color=blue size=4>on second thoughts</font>\n<br>upon reflection; after further or more deliberate consideration 深思熟虑后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On second thoughts they decided to leave London. 经仔细考虑，他们决定离开伦敦。</font>\n
on the air	<font color=blue size=4>on the air</font>\n<br>on radio or TV 在广播里或电视上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President will be on the air at 9∶15 tonight. 总统将于今晚9时15分发表广播讲话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's on the air this evening? 今晚的广播内容是什么？</font>\n
on the alert	<font color=blue size=4>on the alert</font>\n<br>watchful 注意；留神\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Drivers must be on the alert for traffic signals. 汽车驾驶员必须注意交通信号。</font>\n
on the ball	<font color=blue size=4>on the ball</font>\n<br>1. paying attention and doing things well 留神；警觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's not really on the ball—he lets so many chances slip by. 他确实是不留心，那么多机会都被他错过了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was on the ball and as soon as something went wrong with the machine, he rushed over to fix it. 他十分警觉，机器一有毛病，他就赶过去修理。</font>\n<br>2. good at 能干；熟练\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you think he has anything on the ball? 你认为他有能力吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all like to have Miss Li do the job because she has a lot on the ball. 我们都想让李小姐做这件事，因为她能力很强。</font>\n
on the basis of	<font color=blue size=4>on the basis of</font>\n<br>according to 按照；基于…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The judges are chosen on the basis of their qualification. 法官是按照资格选出的。</font>\n
on the beach	<font color=blue size=4>on the beach</font>\n<br>unemployed 失业的；穷困潦倒的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's on the beach for several weeks and no job seems available in the foreseeable future. 他失业几个星期了，看来还不可能很快就找到工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was then strictly on the beach. 他那时的确穷困潦倒。</font>\n
on the beam	<font color=blue size=4>on the beam</font>\n<br>1. (of an airplane) flying in the right direction（飞机）航向正确\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A radio signal tells the pilot of an airplane when he is flying on the beam. 无线电信号向飞行员指明其飞行航向正确。</font>\n<br>2. doing well; just right 正确的；干得好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dick's answer was right on the beam. 狄克的回答是正确的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are on the beam today. You haven't made a single mistake. 你今天干得很好，没有出一点差错。</font>\n
on the bench	<font color=blue size=4>on the bench</font>\n<br>1. sitting in a law court as a judge 当法官；主持审判\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Judge Abbot will be on the bench this morning. 艾伯特法官今天上午将主持开庭。</font>\n<br>2. sitting among the substitute players 坐冷板凳；当后备队员\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach had to keep his star player on the bench with a sprained ankle. 教练只好让他那名扭伤了踝骨的主力队员在场外候补。</font>\n
on the blink	<font color=blue size=4>on the blink</font>\n<br>not working well; needing repair （机器、工具等）坏了；不能用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother called the repairman because her washing machine was on the blink. 洗衣机坏了，母亲叫人来修。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you call about a television set on the blink? 你有没有打电话来说有架电视机坏了？</font>\n
on the block	<font color=blue size=4>on the block</font>\n<br>for sale 出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vacant house was on the block. 这幢空房子待售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There I saw a lot of old furniture on the block. 我看见那儿有许多旧家俱在拍卖。</font>\n
on the board	<font color=blue size=4>on the board</font>\n<br>being discussed at the meeting 在会上讨论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rules and regulations will be laid on the board. 这些规章制度将在会上讨论。</font>\n
on the button	<font color=blue size=4>on the button</font>\n<br>1. at the right place; at the heart of the matter 准确；中肯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His criticisms of our work were right on the button. 他对我们工作的批评是很中肯的。</font>\n<br>2. exactly on time 准时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She then strolled over to the department store at 5 o'clock on the button. 她后来5点钟准时走到了百货商店。</font>\n
on the cards	<font color=blue size=4>on the cards</font>\n<br>probable 可能的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They say war's on the cards. 他们说有可能爆发战争。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's quite on the cards that some message may come during the day. 今天很可能会有消息。</font>\n
on the charge of	<font color=blue size=4>on the charge of</font>\n<br>being accused of 以…的罪名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been sentenced to death on the charge of murder. 他以谋杀罪被判死刑。</font>\n
on the cnance of	<font color=blue size=4>on the cnance of</font>\n<br>in the hope of 怀着…的希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We went to the cinema on the chance of seeing him there. 我们去电影院希望在那儿能见到他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People will gather by hundreds outside a police court on the chance of catching a glimpse of the criminal. 数以百计的人聚在警署外希望看一眼罪犯。</font>\n
on the contrary	<font color=blue size=4>on the contrary</font>\n<br>exactly the opposite 相反地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not selfish; on the contrary, he is very noble and generous. 他并不自私，恰恰相反，他是一个非常高尚而又慷慨的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher thought that the children went to the zoo; on the contrary, they went to the bakery. 老师以为孩子们去了动物园，恰恰相反，他们却去了面包房。</font>\n
on the cuff	<font color=blue size=4>on the cuff</font>\n<br>agreeing to pay later; on credit 以赊账方式\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was able to buy it on the cuff. 他能以赊账方式把它买到手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people buy cars and TV sets on the cuff. 许多人分期付款买汽车和电视机。</font>\n
on the edge of	<font color=blue size=4>on the edge of</font>\n<br>1. on the verge of 在…边缘\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't put the glass on the edge of the table. 不要把玻璃杯放在桌边上。</font>\n<br>2. near; close to 快要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is on the edge of bankruptcy. 他濒临破产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Worn out, he was already on the edge of sleep. 他累极了，快要睡着了。</font>\n
on the eve of	<font color=blue size=4>on the eve of</font>\n<br>just before 前夕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He died on the eve of victory. 他在胜利前夕死去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor told the patient that he was on the eve of complete recovery. 医生告诉病人他快痊愈了。</font>\n
on the face of it	<font color=blue size=4>on the face of it</font>\n<br>apparently; as it seems 从表面上看；显然地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His statement that he is a millionaire is, on the face of it, false. 他说他是个百万富翁显然是虚构的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the face of it, his theory is OK, but we still have to wait and see how it works in practice. 他的理论看来不错，但在实践中是否可行我们还得拭目以待。</font>\n
on the fence	<font color=blue size=4>on the fence</font>\n<br>in doubt; undecided 迟疑不决的；保持中立的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have been on the fence for too long. It's time you made up your mind. 你犹豫的时间太长了，该下决心了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Philip used to sit on the fence before deciding which side he would be on, but he was looked down upon by others. 菲利浦过去总喜欢在做决定支持哪一方之前观望，但他也总被他人瞧不起。</font>\n
on the fly	<font color=blue size=4>on the fly</font>\n<br>1. in flight 在空中；在飞行中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom was called out because the catcher caught the ball on the fly. 汤姆被判出局，因为接球员接住了飞来的球。</font>\n<br>2. busy 忙碌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Getting the house ready for the visitors kept Mother on the fly all day. 为了把房子整理好接待客人，母亲忙碌了一整天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The housekeeper of our school is always on the fly. 学校管理员整天忙得很。</font>\n
on the go	<font color=blue size=4>on the go</font>\n<br>active 活跃的；忙碌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Successful businessmen are on the go most of the time. 成功的商人大部分时间总是忙忙碌碌的。</font>\n
on the ground of	<font color=blue size=4>on the ground of</font>\n<br>for the reason 以…为理由\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the ground of sufficient evidence he charged the young man with murder. 他以充分的证据指控那个年轻人犯有谋杀罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has expressed his desire to retire on the ground of failing health. 他以体力不支为由表示希望退休。</font>\n
on the increase	<font color=blue size=4>on the increase</font>\n<br>increasing 在增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Crime in big cities is on the increase. 大城市的犯罪率在上升。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The demand for consumer goods is ever on the increase. 对消费品的需求日益增长。</font>\n
on the job	<font color=blue size=4>on the job</font>\n<br>1. working 工作着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe was on the job all the time. 乔一直在工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's on the job now. Could you ring him up later? 他在上班。你过会儿再打电话来好吗？</font>\n<br>2. working hard 努力工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is promoted because he is always on the job. 他得到了提升，因为他一直努力工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The operation was successfully performed because the surgeons were earnestly on the job. 由于医生非常认真，手术做得很成功。</font>\n
on the level	<font color=blue size=4>on the level</font>\n<br>honest (ly) ; truthful (ly) 诚实；可靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've known him all my life and you can believe me when I say he is on the level. 我从小就认识他，我说他诚实，你完全可以相信我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can trust him because he always acts on the level. 你可以相信他，因为他办事一向很公正。</font>\n
on the lookout	<font color=blue size=4>on the lookout</font>\n<br>looking for 寻找；注意；收集\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager is on the lookout for a new secretary. 经理正在寻觅一位新的秘书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is on the lookout for the reference book you want. 他正在寻找你要的那本参考书。</font>\n
on the loose	<font color=blue size=4>on the loose</font>\n<br>free to go 自由行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The zoo keeper forgot to close the gate to the monkey cage and the monkeys were on the loose. 动物园管理员忘记关上笼子，于是猴子在外面四处乱跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Brown has gone out on the loose, and won't be back till late. 布朗出去玩去了，要很晚才回来。</font>\n
on the make	<font color=blue size=4>on the make</font>\n<br>1. progressing; improving 在改进中；在成长中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we are on the make and the tide is running in our favor. 我认为我们的情况有所好转，而且形势是对我们有利的。</font>\n<br>2. searching for personal profit or gain 追求名利的；一心想发财\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is always on the make. 不管做什么事情，她老是拚命赚钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a merchant on the make. 他是一个唯利是图的商人。</font>\n
on the market	<font color=blue size=4>on the market</font>\n<br>for sale 出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the summer many fresh vegetables are on the market. 夏季有许多新鲜蔬菜出售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is the best article on the market. 这是市场上可以买到的最好的商品。</font>\n
on the mend	<font color=blue size=4>on the mend</font>\n<br>healing; becoming better 愈合；好起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's broken leg is on the mend. 约翰摔坏了的那条腿伤口正在愈合。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary's relationshp with Joan is on the mend. 玛丽和琼的关系在好转。</font>\n
on the move	<font color=blue size=4>on the move</font>\n<br>1. in motion 移动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was vacation time, and the highways were full of families on the move. 时值假日，公路上载着全家老小外出的汽车川流不息。</font>\n<br>2. moving forward 向前；进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man bragged tha if he was made the manager he would get the company on the move. 那人吹牛说如果他当经理，他就能使公司取得进展。</font>\n
on the nose	<font color=blue size=4>on the nose</font>\n<br>just right; exactly 正好；正是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All of our estimates about the costs were a little off, but Frank's was right on the nose. 对费用的估计我们都偏了一点，只有福兰克估得恰到好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George hit the ball on the nose. 乔治正好击中了球。</font>\n
on the occasion (of) 	<font color=blue size=4>on the occasion (of) </font>\n<br>at the time (of) （在…）之际\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An editorial was published by the People's Daily on the occasion of the Party's brithday. 党的生日之际，人民日报发表了一篇社论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the occasion, I was not at home. 那时我不在家。</font>\n
on (the) one hand	<font color=blue size=4>on (the) one hand</font>\n<br>from one point of view 一方面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John wants to be a printer or a teacher: on one hand, printing pays better; on the other hand, schools need good teachers. 约翰想成为一个印刷商或教师：一方面是因为印刷商的报酬高，另一方面学校需要好的教师。</font>\n
on the other hand	<font color=blue size=4>on the other hand</font>\n<br>from another point of view 另一方面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father and mother wanted to go for a ride, and on the other hand, the children wanted to stay home and play with their friends. 父母想开车出去兜风，而孩子们却想在家里与朋友们一道玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am very willing, but he, on the other hand, is reluctant. 我很愿意，他却不愿意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bert is extremely intelligent; on the other hand, he is a very lazy student and therefore gets low grades. 彼尔特非常聪明，可他是个懒学生，因此他成绩不高。</font>\n
on the outs	<font color=blue size=4>on the outs</font>\n<br>not friendly; having a quarrel 不友善；争吵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim was on the outs with most of the kids on the block. 杰姆和街区的大多数孩子不和。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary and Jane were on the outs. 玛丽和简闹翻了。</font>\n
on the part of	<font color=blue size=4>on the part of</font>\n<br>1. for the part of; on the side of 就…而言；在另一方面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The delay in payment was an error on the part of the accounts office. 延期支付是会计室的过失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have done nothing wrong on our part. 我们这方面没有任何地方做错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a very queer conduct on the part of Smith. 就史密斯而言，那是一个十分古怪的举动。</font>\n<br>2. proceeding from; done by 由…做出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think it necessary to fear any interference on the part of those who objected to the proposal. 我想我们不必害怕那些反对此项提议的人所进行的干涉。</font>\n
on the point of	<font color=blue size=4>on the point of</font>\n<br>ready to begin 立即；马上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baby was on the point of crying when her mother came home. 婴儿正要哭，正在这时妈妈回家了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were on the point of callin you when your telegram arrived. 我们正要给你打电话时，你的电报来了。</font>\n
on the quiet	<font color=blue size=4>on the quiet</font>\n<br>secretly 私下地；秘密地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hushshop is a place where beer and spirits are sold on the secret. 没执照的酒店就是私卖啤酒和烈酒的地方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teachers got the principal a present on the quiet. 老师们秘密地送给校长一份礼物。</font>\n
on the road	<font color=blue size=4>on the road</font>\n<br>1. travelling 旅途中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My letter will soon reach him; it is on the road. 我的信正在路上，他很快就能收到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How long will you be on the road? 你在路上要花多长时间？</font>\n<br>2. changing; going from one condition to another 转变；朝…方向发展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane was very sick for several weeks, but now she is on the road to recovery. 简前几个星期病得很厉害，现在正在恢复中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Conscientious study put the student on the road to success. 勤奋学习使那学生即将获得成功。</font>\n
on the rocks	<font color=blue size=4>on the rocks</font>\n<br>1. ruined 毁坏；垮台\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His plan has landed itself on the rocks. 他的计划遭到失败。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In a brief space of time the company went on the rocks. 这家公司很快就破产了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By the time I've paid all the bills I owe I shall be on the rocks. 当我付清所欠的全部账单时，我在经济上将处于困境。</font>\n<br>2. with ice only（饮料）只加冰块\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They went to the restaurant and ordered whisky on the rocks. 他们在饭店要了份冰镇威士忌。</font>\n
on the run	<font color=blue size=4>on the run</font>\n<br>1. active; moving 活动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With three young children to take care of, she is kept on the run every minute of the day. 她每分钟都在忙，因为她要照看3个孩子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been on the run getting ready for the performance. 他们一直在为准备演出而四处奔波。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are so busy at the office that we generally have to eat our lunch on the run. 我们在办公室非常忙，常常一面工作一面吃午饭。</font>\n<br>2. in flight; running away 逃走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The reports say that the rebels are on the run. 有报道说，叛乱者正在溃逃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Four men broke out of gaol last night. Three were caught, but one is still on the run. 昨晚有4个人越狱，其中3人被逮住，但一人还在逃亡之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is on the run from the police. 他正在逃避警察的追捕。</font>\n
on the shelf	<font color=blue size=4>on the shelf</font>\n<br>laid aside; not useful any more 搁在一边；不再使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Maurice was put on the shelf when he reached the age of 65. 莫里斯65岁时，他的公司便不再用他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some women think that if they've not got their man by the age of 20they're on the shelf. 有些妇女认为如果到了20岁还找不到对象，那么结婚就无希望了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She never married; she has been left on the shelf. 她从未结过婚，现在也嫁不出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question was put on the shelf. 这个问题被束之高阁。</font>\n
on the side	<font color=blue size=4>on the side</font>\n<br>in addition to a main thing, amount or quantity 此外；额外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His job at the hospital did not pay much, so he found another on the side. 他在医院工作的报酬不多，所以他另外找了一份兼职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Besids fruit, he bought some candies on the side. 除了水果，他还买了些糖。</font>\n
on the side of	<font color=blue size=4>on the side of</font>\n<br>supporting 支援；辅助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was on the side of the oppressed. 他站在被压迫者一边。</font>\n
on the sly	<font color=blue size=4>on the sly</font>\n<br>secretly 偷偷地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy smoked on the sly. 这男孩偷偷地抽烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She recerived letters, on the sly, from young men. 她暗地里收到一些男青年的来信。</font>\n
on the spot	<font color=blue size=4>on the spot</font>\n<br>1. just there 正在那里；在场\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police were on the spot within a few minutes of hearing about the crime. 警察在接到犯罪消息的几分钟内就赶到了现场。</font>\n<br>2. without waiting 立刻；当即\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of important events is often broadcast on the spot over television. 重要事件的新闻总是通过电视立即广播。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone breaking the rules will be asked to leave on the spot. 任何人违反规则，立即勒令退场。</font>\n<br>3. in trouble, difficulty or embarrassment 在困难中；在危险中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question put me on the spot; I couldn't make an excuse or lie. 这个问题搞得我很尴尬，我既无法推托，又无法撒谎。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob was on the spot because he was unable to pay the money he owed. 鲍勃陷入了困境，因为他无力偿还欠下的钱。</font>\n<br>4. in danger of being murdered 有被暗杀的危险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After he talked to the police, the gangsters put him on the spot. 他报告警察后，歹徒们就决定置他于死地。</font>\n
on the spuare	<font color=blue size=4>on the spuare</font>\n<br>honest 诚实的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You need have no doubt of Jack's honesty. He is completely on the square. 你不必怀疑杰克是否诚实，他绝对忠实可靠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must act on the square when negotiating for contracts. 在签订谈判合同时，你必须处事公道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can we trust them to act on the square? 我们能够相信他们处事公正吗？</font>\n
on the spur of the moment	<font color=blue size=4>on the spur of the moment</font>\n<br>1. in a sudden impulse 一时高兴或冲动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had not planned to take the trip; he just went on the spur of the moment. 他事先没有计划这趟旅行，只是一时高兴就走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've accepted the offer of a job abroad. I decided on the spur of the moment to go. 我已接受了国外的工作并决定马上就走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He acts on the spur of the moment. 他凭一时冲动行事。</font>\n<br>2. on the spot 当场；即席\n<br>He can invent any number of excuses on the spur of the moment.\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>他能当场诌出许多托辞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though quite unprepared, he was nevertheless able to sing a folk songon the spur of the moment. 尽管毫无准备，他还是能即席演唱一首民歌。</font>\n
on the stage	<font color=blue size=4>on the stage</font>\n<br>in or into the work of being an actor or actress 当演员；登台演戏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has been on the stage for many years. 她已经当了多年演员了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He went on the stage shortly after he left high school. 他中学一毕业就当了演员。</font>\n
on the strength of	<font color=blue size=4>on the strength of</font>\n<br>with faith or trust in 依靠；凭借\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the strength of the Committee's report, we have decided to carry out the reforms proposed. 根据委员会的报告，我们决定实行所建议的各项改革。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the strength of Bill's promise to guide us, we decided to climb the mountain. 由于比尔答应带我们，我们才决定登山。</font>\n
on the string	<font color=blue size=4>on the string</font>\n<br>under sb. 's influence or control 唯命是从；在…支配下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was pretty and popular, with two or three boys on the string all the time. 她漂亮又活跃，始终有两三个男孩围着她转。</font>\n
on the track of	<font color=blue size=4>on the track of</font>\n<br>trying to find 寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lawyer is on the track of new proof in the case. 律师正在这桩案子中寻找新的证据。</font>\n
on the trot	<font color=blue size=4>on the trot</font>\n<br>1. in a state of continuous activity 忙个不停\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could do with a rest for a while; I've been on the trot all the morning. 我真想休息一会儿，整个上午我一直在忙个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The job kept me on the trot most of the week. 我大半个星期都在忙着这件工作。</font>\n<br>2. one after another 接连地；一个接一个\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have won three races on the trot. 他们在赛跑中接连赢了3次。</font>\n<br>She didn't sleep well for four\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>nights on the trot. 她已连续4个晚上没睡好觉了。</font>\n
on the turn	<font color=blue size=4>on the turn</font>\n<br>1. about to turn or change 正在转变中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tide will soon be on the turn and then we can make a start. 形势马上会变，然后我们就可以开始干了。</font>\n<br>2. (of milk) on the point of becoming sour（牛奶）正在变酸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The milk is on the turn; you'd better not drink it. 牛奶变味了，最好别喝它。</font>\n
on the upandup	<font color=blue size=4>on the upandup</font>\n<br>1. honest 诚实的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can take his word for it. He has always been on the upandup. 你可以相信他的话，他一向老实可靠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This information is on the upandup. 这消息完全可靠。</font>\n<br>2. improving; succeeding 走上坡路的；越来越好的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From now on, everything is on the upandup. 从现在起，一切事情都会好转。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guy's on the upandup and I know it. 这小伙子步步高升，这我是知道的。</font>\n
on the verge of	<font color=blue size=4>on the verge of</font>\n<br>near; close to 快要；濒于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I went into her room I found her on the verge of departure. 当我走进她房间时，发现她正准备出发。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was on the verge of bankruptcy. 他濒临破产。</font>\n
on the warpath	<font color=blue size=4>on the warpath</font>\n<br>1. very angry 非常生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police are on the warpath because the suspect is at large. 警察当局极为恼火，因为嫌疑犯还逍遥法外。</font>\n<br>2. fighting; making an attack 攻击；作战\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government is now on the warpath against pollution. 政府现在正着手解决污染问题。</font>\n
on the watch	<font color=blue size=4>on the watch</font>\n<br>alert; watchful 留心；警戒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The customs inspector was on the watch for diamond smugglers. 海关检查人员留心是否有宝石走私犯。</font>\n
on the way	<font color=blue size=4>on the way</font>\n<br>while travelling or going 在途中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train left and Bill was on the way to New York. 火车离开了，比尔踏上了去纽约的路途。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These machines are already on the way out. 这些机器很快就要过时了。</font>\n
on the whole	<font color=blue size=4>on the whole</font>\n<br>1. usually; in most cases 通常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the whole, children begin walking when they are about one year old. 一般来说，小孩1岁左右开始走路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the whole, men are stronger than women. 一般来说，男人比女人强壮。</font>\n<br>2. generally speaking; in the most important things 大体上；总的说来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the whole our stay there was quite enjoyable. 总的说来，我们待在那里是很开心的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On toe whole we're happy living here, but it is a long way away from my parent'home. 总的说来，我们住在这儿很愉快，但就是离我父母家太远了。</font>\n
on the wing	<font color=blue size=4>on the wing</font>\n<br>1. always very busy 忙碌不停\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Susan was on the wing doing things to get ready for her trip. 苏珊忙个不停，为旅行作准备。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was on the wing early. 他很早就起来活动了。</font>\n<br>2. travelling; going somewhere 在旅行中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stayed in Britain for a week and then we were on the wing again. 我们在英国逗留了一个星期，然后又上路了。</font>\n
on time	<font color=blue size=4>on time</font>\n<br>punctually; promptly 准时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They forecast the weather accurately and on time. 他们预报天气既精确又准时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the train is on time, I should reach home before dark. 如果火车不误点，我应该在天黑前到家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train left on time. 火车准点发车。</font>\n
on tiptoe	<font color=blue size=4>on tiptoe</font>\n<br>1. on one's toes with the rest of the feet raised above the ground 以趾尖（行走、站立）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He left the room on tiptoe so as not to disturb his roommates. 为了不打扰同室的人，他轻手轻脚地离开了房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the crowd stood on tiptoe to have one more look at her. 所有的人都踮脚站着，希望能多看她一眼。</font>\n<br>2. eager; excited 渴望的；殷切期望的；激动的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the Spring Festival coming, the children were on tiptoe. 春节快到了，孩子们殷切地盼望着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was on tiptoe on the morning of her wedding. 举行婚礼的那天早晨，她非常激动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were on tiptoe to learn the result of the election. 我们迫切希望知道选举结果。</font>\n
on top of	<font color=blue size=4>on top of</font>\n<br>1. above 在…之上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A submarine is a ship that can run under water as well as on top of water. 潜水艇可行水下，亦可行水上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just put the dictionary on top of those books. 把这本字典就放在那堆书上。</font>\n<br>2. very close to 靠近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The elevator was so crowded that everybody was on top of each other. 电梯非常拥挤，大家你挤我，我靠你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I turned the corner, I was right on top of the post office. 我一转弯，邮局就在我眼前。</font>\n<br>3. in control of 管理；控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although his new job was very complicated, John was on top of it within a few weeks. 尽管约翰的新工作非常复杂，但他几星期之内就掌握了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He acted like a man on top of his job. 他装得象对自己工作很内行一样。</font>\n<br>4. in addition to; along with 此外；还有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He promised to help us and on top of that he lent us many reference books. 他答应帮助我们，并把许多参考书借给我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came late, and on top of that he didn't bring the papers. 他迟到了，而且也没有把文件带来。</font>\n<br>5. knowing all about 通晓；十分了解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always on top of the latest developments in his field of work. 他总是通晓自己业务领域内的最新发展情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joan stays on top of the news by reading newspapers and magazines. 琼看报纸与杂志，所以了解各种新闻。</font>\n
on top of the world	<font color=blue size=4>on top of the world</font>\n<br>feeling pleased and happy; feeling successful 非常高兴；觉得成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sea and the warm sun made them feel on top of the world. 大海和温暖的阳光使他们感到无比的快乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having won the first prize, he is on top of the world. 他得了一等奖，欣喜若狂。</font>\n
on trial	<font color=blue size=4>on trial</font>\n<br>1. on probation 试验；试用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new clerk was found on trial to be incompetent. 这个新职员试用后被发现不合格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may take it on trial; if you like it, then buy it. 你可以把它拿去试用，要是你喜欢，就买下来。</font>\n<br>2. in a court of law 受审\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John White was on trial for murder. 约翰•怀特因谋杀罪受审。</font>\n
on trust	<font color=blue size=4>on trust</font>\n<br>1. without proof or close examination 不加深究地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took all he said on trust, for I thought he was telling the truth. 他说的我都相信，因为我认为他是在讲真话。</font>\n<br>2. in credit 赊账\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have known the family for years and you may safely supply the goods on trust. 我们认识这一家已有多年了，你可以放心地赊销商品。</font>\n
on view	<font color=blue size=4>on view</font>\n<br>showing publicly 展览；供人观赏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you seen the photo placed on view? 你看过那张供人观赏的照片吗？</font>\n
open its doors	<font color=blue size=4>open its doors</font>\n<br>1. allow sb. or sth. to enter or join 开门接纳；开放\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That college was started for women only, but a few years ago, it opened its doors to men. 那所学校原先只收女生，数年后兼收男生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The art exhibition has opened its doors to both professional and amateur artists. 艺术展览馆对专业的和业余的艺术工作者开放。</font>\n<br>2. begin doing business 开张；开门\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new department store opened irs doors last week. 那家新百货商店上星期刚开张。</font>\n
open onto	<font color=blue size=4>open onto</font>\n<br>have an opening or outlet to; give access to 通往；有出口和…相通\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the rooms open onto a long hall. 所有房间都和长廊相通。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The French windows open onto the garden. 落地长窗通往花园。</font>\n
open out	<font color=blue size=4>open out</font>\n<br>1. become wider, esp. of a road, river, etc. 变宽；打开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the foot of the mountain, the river suddenly opens out into a broad estuary. 这条河流经山脚时突然向宽阔的港湾伸展开去。</font>\n<br>2. develop 发展；发育\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the warmth of the room, the roses opened out in a few days. 在室内温暖的空气中，玫瑰几天内就开花了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her good qualities opened out as she grew in years. 她的优秀质量随着年龄的增长而更趋完美。</font>\n<br>3. become visible over a wider area 展现；显示\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As we climbed higher, a wonder ful view opened out before us. 当我们再爬高一些时，一派美好的风光展现在我们眼前。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just over the hill the countryside began to open out, and we had our first glimpse of the sea. 就在山那边我们看到了乡村的景象，而且第一次看见了那片大海。</font>\n<br>4. become less shy or nervous in public 变得不那么害羞；直言；畅谈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's opened out a lot since he went to university. 上大学后他健谈多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They opened out to each other. 他们相互畅谈。</font>\n
open sb's eyes	<font color=blue size=4>open sb's eyes</font>\n<br>make sb. see 使某人明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That incident opened my eyes to the trur character of the man. 那次事件使我认清了这个人的真正质量。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary didn't believe that her cousin could be mean until the cousin opened Mary's eyes by scratching and biting her. 玛丽不相信她堂弟如此卑鄙，直到他抓伤并咬了她，她才看清事实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She couldn't understand that until her brother opened her. eyes. 她不能领会，后来还是她哥哥使她明白了。</font>\n
open tne door	<font color=blue size=4>open tne door</font>\n<br>give a chance 提供机会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The success of the operation on his legs opened the door to a whole new life for him. 他腿部手术的成功给他带来了新生活的希望。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This agreement opens the door to advances in every field. 这个协议为各方面的发展创造了条件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Higher education opens the door to a better jobs. 高等教育为寻求较好职业创造了条件。</font>\n
open to	<font color=blue size=4>open to</font>\n<br>liable to 易接受…的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is open to temptation. 他容易受诱惑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His remark is open to misinterpretation. 他的话容易被人曲解。</font>\n
open up	<font color=blue size=4>open up</font>\n<br>1. unwrap; undo (a parcel, etc.) 打开；解开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The surgeon opened up the man's stomach to get at the source of the trouble. 外科医生切开了这个人的胃来查清病源。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Open up the boot of the car, and let me look inside. 打开汽车的行李箱，让我看看。</font>\n<br>2. begin to fire 开火；发动攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We held our ears as the machine guns opened up. 机枪开火时我们堵住了耳朵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our players opened up with forward passes. 我方球员向前传球，发动了攻势。</font>\n<br>3. make clear; reveal 揭示\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After hours of grilling the prisoner opened up. 几小时的审讯后，犯人终于把秘密说了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Einstein's theories opened up a whole new area for study. 爱因斯坦的理论揭示了一个全新的研究领域。</font>\n<br>4. make sth. available for use or development 开发；开辟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building of the railway opened up new land to the pioneers. 铁路的建成为先驱者们开辟了新的土地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're being forced to move because the council wants to open up the whole area for redevelopment. 我们只好搬家，因为委员会准备对这个地区再开发。</font>\n<br>5. talk frankly and honestly 直率、坦诚地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a few drinks he opened up and told us all his problems. 酒下肚后，他才开口说话，把他所有的问题都告诉了我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After John trusted Mr. Jones, he opened up and told him how he felt. 约翰信任琼斯先生之后，便与他直言相谈，告诉他自己的感受。</font>\n<br>6. develop, arise or emerge, esp. of possibilities, prospects, opportunities 变得有可能；出现（机会）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Quite unexpectedly a chance has opened up for Henry to go and work abroad. 出乎意料，亨利得到了去国外工作的机会。</font>\n<br>7. open the door 开门\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother, open up！I'm home. 妈，开门！我回来了。</font>\n<br>8. speed up 加速\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He opened up and drove straight towards the stadium. 他加快车速，直驶体育场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When they got out on the highway, the driver opened up and drove at 60 miles per hour. 他们一上公路，司机便加快车速，车速竟达每小时60英里。</font>\n
operate on	<font color=blue size=4>operate on</font>\n<br>perform a surgical operation on 给…开刀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They operated on him for a tumour. 他们为他施行了切除肿瘤手术。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How many wounded soldiers are there who haven't been operated on yet? 那儿还有多少伤员没有动过手术？</font>\n
order about/around	<font color=blue size=4>order about/around</font>\n<br>keep giving orders or instructions 不断差遣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't like being ordered about by anyone. 他不喜欢受任何人的驱使。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I mean, he's got no right to order me about the place. 我的意思是，他没有权利指派我在这儿干这干那。</font>\n
or else	<font color=blue size=4>or else</font>\n<br>if not; otherwise 否则\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do what I tell you, or else you'll be sorry. 照我的话做，否则你要后悔的。</font>\n
or other	<font color=blue size=4>or other</font>\n<br>used to emphasize indefinite words or phrases beginning with“some” (as sb. , sth. , somewhere, somehow, sometime) （用以表示不肯定或不准确之意）某一\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall be coming again some day or other. 我总有一天还会来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've read the story before in some book or other. 我以前在哪本书上读过这个故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Somehow or other, John managed to get a wellpaid job in the bank. 不知怎么地，约翰在银行找到了一份薪水高的工作。</font>\n
or rather	<font color=blue size=4>or rather</font>\n<br>it would be better to say 更确切地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came home very late last night, or rather very early this morning. 他昨天深夜，或者更确切地说，今天凌晨才回家。</font>\n
or so	<font color=blue size=4>or so</font>\n<br>about 大约\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll return in a week or so. 我大约一星期后回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There will be thirty or so people at the party. 约有30人左右参加聚会。</font>\n
or something	<font color=blue size=4>or something</font>\n<br>showing that the speaker is not sure（不能十分肯定）或是什么；或是做点什么\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't idle away your time; do some writing or something. 别虚度光阴，写点东西或是做点别的什么事儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Haven't seen you for a long time. Have you been on business or something? 好久没见你了。是出差了还是怎么的？</font>\n
other than	<font color=blue size=4>other than</font>\n<br>1. except 除…以外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has no books other than the Bible. 除了《圣经》以外，他没有别的书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has visited every country in Asia other than Japan. 除了日本以外，他访问了所有的亚洲国家。</font>\n<br>2. different from 不同于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I do not wish him other than he is. 我不希望他改变现状。</font>\n
out and out	<font color=blue size=4>out and out</font>\n<br>extreme; complete; thorough 完完全全；彻头彻尾\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was an opportunist out and out. 他是个彻头彻尾的机会主义者。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was out and out robbery to charge twice the usual price for eggs just because they were scarce. 因为缺货，鸡蛋就索价两倍之高，简直是抢劫。</font>\n
out cold	<font color=blue size=4>out cold</font>\n<br>unconscious; in a faint 失去知觉；陷入昏迷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A brick hit him in the head and he was out cold for half an hour. 一块砖砸到了他的头，他昏迷了半小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried to lift Julie when she fell down, but she was out cold. 他们想把倒下的朱丽扶起来，但她已经昏迷了。</font>\n
out for	<font color=blue size=4>out for</font>\n<br>taking part in 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out for the basketball team. 他加入了篮球队。</font>\n
out from under	<font color=blue size=4>out from under</font>\n<br>free from sth. that worries sb.;finished 摆脱困境的；完结的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With so much work to do, I feel I'll never be out from under. 我要做的事太多了，总感到没完没了的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George had so many debts that he couldn't get out from under. 乔治债务累累，简直无法还清。</font>\n
out in left field	<font color=blue size=4>out in left field</font>\n<br>1. far from the right answer; wrong 错的；错得离谱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to answer the teacher's question, but she was way out in left field. 她想回答好老师的问题，可她答非所问。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Philip tried to guess what the surprise was but he was way out in left field. 菲利浦想猜出是什么惊喜，但他猜错了。</font>\n<br>2. speaking or acting very queerly; crazy 疯的；举止怪异的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After her father was killed by a group of bandits, the girl was out in left field. 自她父亲被一群匪徒杀害后，那女孩就疯了。</font>\n
out in the cold	<font color=blue size=4>out in the cold</font>\n<br>alone; not included 被忽视；孤单\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone made plans for the National Day but he found himself out in the cold. 每个人都计划国庆节怎么过，只有他一个人孤零零的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was so talkative that she was often left out in the cold. 她太饶舌了，常常搞得没有人愿搭理她。</font>\n
out like a light	<font color=blue size=4>out like a light</font>\n<br>1. fast asleep 酣睡；很快睡着的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as the lights were turned off the little boy was out like a light. 灯一关，那小男孩就呼呼入睡了。</font>\n<br>2. in a faint; unconscious 昏迷；失去知觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she heard that her son died in the war, she was out like a light. 当听到儿子在战争中死去的消息时，她昏了过去。</font>\n
out of	<font color=blue size=4>out of</font>\n<br>1. from 从…中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Choose one out of these paintings. 从这些画中选一幅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He picked the girl out of the crowd. 他从人群中把这女孩挑了出来。</font>\n<br>2. from the inside to the outside of 自内而出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She walked out of the room, all smiles. 她笑容满面地从屋子里走了出来。</font>\n<br>3. from (a source) 从；自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His dog and cat eat out of the same dish. 他的狗和猫从同一盘子里进食。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher gave a test to see what the students got out of the lesson. 老师测验学生从课上学到了多少。</font>\n<br>4. in a place away from 不在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of town this week. 他这星期不在城里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our house is ten miles out of town. 我们家离镇上有十里路。</font>\n<br>5. beyond sb. 's reach 在…达不到的地方；非…所能及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The target is out of reach of the gun. 那靶子在枪的射程以外。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train is out of sight now. 火车已看不见了。</font>\n<br>6. without; not having 没有；缺乏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of work. 他失业了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are out of firewood; let's go and gather some. 没柴禾了，我们去捡一点吧。</font>\n<br>7. not; no; used up 没有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car has run out of gas. 车子没有汽油了。</font>\n<br>8. because of 因；为了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They helped us out of pity. 他们出于同情帮助我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She asked the question out of curiosity. 她出于好奇提出了这个问题。</font>\n<br>9. by the use of 用…做材料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She made a hat out of bits of old materials. 她用零碎的旧料子做了一顶帽子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house is built out of stone. 房子是用石头造的。</font>\n<br>10. beyond 超出；不容\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The machine is out of control. 这台机器失控了。</font>\n<br>11. from a particular condition or situation; not in 脱离某状况；脱离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They finally talked him out of his fears. 他们终于使他克服了恐惧心理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sick man was out of danger at last. 病人最后终于脱险。</font>\n
out of action	<font color=blue size=4>out of action</font>\n<br>not working; not functioning 不能工作；失（去）效（能）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three trains went out of action yesterday when the severe cold ruined the engines. 昨天因天气奇冷致使发动机冻坏, 3趟列车停止运行。</font>\n
out of bounds	<font color=blue size=4>out of bounds</font>\n<br>1. outside of the boundary lines in a game; not on or inside the playing field 越轨；超出规定范围\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was out of bounds when he called his opponent names in the debate. 他犯规了，在辩论中谩骂了对方。</font>\n<br>2. outside of the place where sb. may go 禁止入内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told the students that the new gymnasium being built on the school grounds was out of bounds. 老师告诉同学们正在兴建中的体育馆是禁止进去的。</font>\n
out of breath	<font color=blue size=4>out of breath</font>\n<br>not breathing easily 喘不过气来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fat man was out of breath after climbing the stairs. 那个胖子爬完楼梯就喘不过气来。</font>\n
out of character	<font color=blue size=4>out of character</font>\n<br>not in agreement with sb. 's character or personality; unsuitable for a part or character 不符合（某人的一贯习性等）；（与所演的角色）不适合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of his traits is his honesty; few people have ever seen him out of character. 他的特性之一是诚实，几乎没有人发现他不是这样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young actress said that it was out of character for her to play an old woman. 那位青年女演员说她不适合扮演老太的角色。</font>\n
out of circulation	<font color=blue size=4>out of circulation</font>\n<br>not out in the company of friends, other people, and groups; not active 不和（朋友等）在一起；不活跃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John was out of circulation with his friends when he was ill. 约翰生病时没有和朋友们来往。</font>\n
out of commission	<font color=blue size=4>out of commission</font>\n<br>1. retired from active military service 退役；不再执行任务\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the war was over, many warships were placed out of commission. 战争结束后，许多战舰都退役了。</font>\n<br>2. not in use or working 不能使用；损坏\n<br>Some of the bridges were out of commission. 有一些桥梁不能使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had to go to school on foot because her bike was out of commission. 因为自行车坏了，她只得步行去学校。</font>\n
out of condition	<font color=blue size=4>out of condition</font>\n<br>not healthy 不健康；身体不好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is out of condition. 她身体不好。</font>\n
out of date	<font color=blue size=4>out of date</font>\n<br>unfashionable 陈旧的；过时的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The furniture is out of date. 这家俱过时了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your methods have long gone out of date; you will have to modernize or risk failure. 你的这些方法早已陈旧，你应当用现代化的方法，否则有失败的危险。</font>\n<br>out of favor (with) \n<br>not well regarded (by sb.) 失宠（于…）；不受（…的）欢迎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sir Walter is out of favor with the King. 瓦特爵士已在国王面前失宠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was out of favor in Paris and went to London. 他在巴黎不受欢迎就到伦敦去了。</font>\n
out of hand	<font color=blue size=4>out of hand</font>\n<br>1. promptly 立即\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The situation needs to be dealt with out of hand. 这个情况需要立即加以处理。</font>\n<br>2. out of control 失控\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting was broken up by the chairman when the discussion got out of hand. 当讨论失控时，主席宣布休会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The difficult class got out of hand when an inexperienced teacher was put in charge. 一位缺乏经验的老师任教时，这个差班就失控了。</font>\n
out of humor	<font color=blue size=4>out of humor</font>\n<br>not pleasant; not in good mood 不高兴的；情绪不高的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was probably still out of humor over the affair of this morning. 他大概还在为早上的事闷闷不乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why is she so out of humor today? 她今天为什么不高兴？</font>\n
out of keeping	<font color=blue size=4>out of keeping</font>\n<br>not proper 不协调；不合适\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Loud talk is out of keeping in the library. 高声交谈不符合图书馆的规定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These actions are out of keeping with his character. 这些行为同他的性格不符。</font>\n
out of kilter	<font color=blue size=4>out of kilter</font>\n<br>1. not balanced right 不均衡；不平直\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wheels of my bike were out of kilter after it hit the wall. 我的自行车撞在墙上后，前后轮失去了均衡。</font>\n<br>2. needing repair; not working right 需要修理；失灵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My watch is going too fast; it must be out of kilter. 我的表走得太快，肯定出毛病了。</font>\n
out of line	<font color=blue size=4>out of line</font>\n<br>1. not in a straight line; away from the true line 不直的；不成一直线的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The official ordered the soldier who was out of line to get properly lined up. 军官命令未对齐的士兵排好。</font>\n<br>2. not obeying or agreeing with what is right or usual 不守常规；越轨的；不适宜的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must say your behavior at the meeting was a bit out of line. 老实说，你在会上的举止有点不恰当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We told him not to tell the joke for it was out of line. 我们告诫他别开那玩笑，因为太过火了。</font>\n
out of line with	<font color=blue size=4>out of line with</font>\n<br>not in agreement with 不同意；与…不一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The price of the bicycle was out of line with what Bill could afford. 自行车太贵，比尔买不起。</font>\n
out of luck	<font color=blue size=4>out of luck</font>\n<br>unfortunate; unlucky 不幸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Baker missed his train and was out of luck in getting to the ball game on time. 贝克先生误了火车，没能及时赶去看球赛，他的运气真不佳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When it comes to getting theatre tickets, we're usually out of luck. 每次买戏票，我们的运气总是不好。</font>\n
out of one's blood	<font color=blue size=4>out of one's blood</font>\n<br>separate from sb. 's feelings, interests or desires 忘怀；驱除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Tom moved to the city, he couldn't get the country out of his blood. 汤姆搬进城以后，对农村仍无法忘怀。</font>\n
out of one's element	<font color=blue size=4>out of one's element</font>\n<br>outside of one's natural surroundings 在不适宜的环境里；不得其所\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wild animals are out of their element in cages. 野生动物不习惯笼中生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm out of my element when people start talking about music. 人们一谈起音乐，我就是外行了。</font>\n
out of one's head/mind/senses	<font color=blue size=4>out of one's head/mind/senses</font>\n<br>acting in a crazy way 行为疯狂；特别地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He must have been out of his mind to say something like that. 他说出那样的话来，一定是精神错乱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient was feverish and out of his head and had to be watched. 病人发高烧，神志不清，需要守护。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sam was out of his senses with grief and rage. 山姆由于悲痛和愤怒而失去理智。</font>\n
out of one's shell	<font color=blue size=4>out of one's shell</font>\n<br>out of one's shyness or silence 不羞怯沉默；开怀畅谈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John wouldn't come out of his shell and talk to the boys and girls at the party. 约翰放不开羞怯沉默的性格，无法与聚会中的人交谈。</font>\n
out of one's wits	<font color=blue size=4>out of one's wits</font>\n<br>1. mad 发疯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of his wits. 他疯了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His provocative remark nearly drove me out of my wits. 他的挑衅性的话简直把我气疯了。</font>\n<br>2. greatly upset 不知所措\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was frightened out of his wits. 他被吓得不知如何是好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy, scared out of their wits, were routed, and all of us laughed for joy. 敌人吓得惊慌失措，溃不成军，而我们却高兴得放声大笑。</font>\n
out of order	<font color=blue size=4>out of order</font>\n<br>1. in the wrong order 次序错了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter wrote the words of the sentence out of order. 彼得写的句子词序不对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The room was out of order. 整个房间乱七八糟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I checked the papers that were to be printed and noticed that one or two were out of order. 我检查要印的文件，发现有一两处次序混乱。</font>\n<br>2. in poor condition 坏了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our television set is out of order. 我们的电视机坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Because the lift was out of order, we had to walk up the stairs. 由于电梯坏了，我们只好走上楼去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is no use phoning. The line is out of order. 打电话没有用，线路坏了。</font>\n<br>3. against the rules; not suitable 违反规则；不宜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such attire is out of order for an occasion like this. 这种场合穿这衣服不适宜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“You are out of order, ”shouted the Chairman. “Kindly sit down. ” 主席喊道：“你违反了规则，请坐下。”</font>\n
out of place	<font color=blue size=4>out of place</font>\n<br>1. in the wrong place 位置不对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your books are out of place. 你的书放错了位置。</font>\n<br>2. improper 不合适\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was out of place for Russsell to laugh at the old lady. 拉赛尔取笑这位老太是不对的。</font>\n
out of practice	<font color=blue size=4>out of practice</font>\n<br>unable to do sth. well because of lack of practice 久不练习；荒疏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is out of practice, so she can't sing as well as before. 因久不练习，她歌唱得不如以前好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He used to be good at cricket, but now be's out of practice. 他过去擅长于打板球，可现在已荒疏了。</font>\n
out of print	<font color=blue size=4>out of print</font>\n<br>no longer obtainable from the publisher because the printed copies have been sold out; no longer printed 绝版；停印\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book you want is out of print, but you may get a copy from a dealer in used books. 你要的那本书已绝版，不过你或许可以从旧书商那里买到一本。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sure the work you mention is out of print. 我可以肯定你提到的那部著作已绝版了。</font>\n
out of question	<font color=blue size=4>out of question</font>\n<br>undoubtedly 无疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is out of question that he will work his way through college. 毫无疑问，他会完成大学学业的。</font>\n
out of sb's hair	<font color=blue size=4>out of sb's hair</font>\n<br>rid of as a nuisance 摆脱；甩开烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Harry got the children out of his hair so he could do some reading. 哈里摆脱了孩子们的纠缠，可以读点东西了。</font>\n
out of sb's reach	<font color=blue size=4>out of sb's reach</font>\n<br>beyond sb. 's ability 力所不及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Reading twenty pages a day is simply out of his reach. 一天读20页对他来说简直不可能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prices are rising so fast that the kind of house we want to buy keeps getting out of our reach. 价格上涨太快，我们想买的房子老是买不起。</font>\n
