out of sb's/the way	<font color=blue size=4>out of sb's/the way</font>\n<br>1. making room for sb. or sth. 给…让开路\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the fire engine came down the street, all the traffic got out of its way. 当消防车沿街驶来时，所有的车辆都为它让路。</font>\n<br>2. not bothering 不要打搅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom wishes that his little brothers were out of his way, so that he can finish his paper. 汤姆希望他的弟弟不要打搅他，这样他就可以完成他的论文。</font>\n
out of season	<font color=blue size=4>out of season</font>\n<br>not in the time for hunting, fishing, etc. 不适时\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys were caught fishing out of season. 孩子们在禁止钓鱼时间钓鱼被抓住了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peaches are out of season now. 现在桃子下市了。</font>\n
out of shape/condition	<font color=blue size=4>out of shape/condition</font>\n<br>1. not looking the same; changed 不成形；走样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The box was crushed out of shape. 箱子已被压得歪歪斜斜了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The front wheel of the bicycle was out of shape; and several spokes were broken. 自行车前轮变形了，还断了好几根钢条。</font>\n<br>2. not able to perform well 竞技状态不好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of shape, that's why he can't play as well as he used to. 他竞技状态不佳，所以打得不如从前那么好了。</font>\n<br>3. not in good condition 身体不佳；生病\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I get tired easily; I must be out of shape. 我动不动就感到疲倦，一定是病了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went to school as usual though she had been out of shape for several days. 尽管身体不舒服已好几天了，她还是照常上学。</font>\n
out of sight	<font color=blue size=4>out of sight</font>\n<br>not to be seen 看不见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plane was soon out of sight. 飞机很快就看不见了。</font>\n
out of sorts	<font color=blue size=4>out of sorts</font>\n<br>1. not in good condition 身体不舒服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm a little out of sorts today. 我今天有点儿不舒服。</font>\n<br>2. in an angry or unhappy mood 心情不好；发脾气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I really enjoy my work and if I miss it I am out of sorts. 我确实很喜欢我的工作，假如我不做它，我就不痛快。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom was out of sorts and would not say goodbye. 汤姆心情不好，不想说再见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob was out of sorts because he didn't get a bicycle for his birthday. 鲍勃因过生日时没有得到一辆自行车而发脾气。</font>\n
out of spirits	<font color=blue size=4>out of spirits</font>\n<br>worried 忧愁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was out of spirits as if he had something on his mind. 他忧心忡忡，好像有什么心事。</font>\n
out of step	<font color=blue size=4>out of step</font>\n<br>1. not keeping pace with 步调与…不一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George always marches out of step with the music. 乔治的步子总是和音乐不合拍。</font>\n<br>2. out of harmony 不协调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just because you don't smoke, it doesn't mean you are out of step with other boys and girls your age. 不抽烟，并不意味你就跟不上和你同龄的少男少女。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His methods are out of step with the times. 他的那些方法与时代不适应。</font>\n
out of stock	<font color=blue size=4>out of stock</font>\n<br>sold out 缺货\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So many children have bought balloons that the store is now out of stock. 买气球的孩子太多，那家商店现已缺货。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We do sell this item, but it is out of stock at the moment. 我们确实出售这种商品，但目前脱销。</font>\n
out of style	<font color=blue size=4>out of style</font>\n<br>unfashionable 过时的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My dress is out of style. 我的衣服过时了。</font>\n
out of temper	<font color=blue size=4>out of temper</font>\n<br>angry 发脾气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is out of temper. 他发脾气了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is clearly out of temper and you should have a talk with him. 他显然是生气了，你应该找他聊聊。</font>\n
out of the blue/a clear sky	<font color=blue size=4>out of the blue/a clear sky</font>\n<br>without any warning; unexpectedly 出其不意地；忽然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may want to spend time with a longlost friend who drops in out of the blue. 如果有一位久已失去联系的朋友突然来访，你会很想同他多呆一会儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cowboy thought he was alone but suddenly out of a clear sky there were Indians all around him. 牛仔以为只有自己一人，谁知忽然间身旁出现了许多印第安人。</font>\n
out of the corner of one's eye	<font color=blue size=4>out of the corner of one's eye</font>\n<br>without looking at sb. or sth. directly or openly 从眼角处看；窥伺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cat looked at the mouse out of the corner of its eye. 猫暗地里注视着老鼠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the little boy spoke to his mother, he looked out of the corner of his eye at his elder brother waving to him from outside the window. 那个小男孩在跟他母亲说话时，用眼梢瞟着站在窗外向他招手的哥哥。</font>\n
out of the hole	<font color=blue size=4>out of the hole</font>\n<br>1. with a score better than zero in a game; eyen with an opponent 打破零分；扳回平手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took us a long time to get out of the hole in the card game. 我们打牌打了很长时间才没得零分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The team played very hard, but could not get out of the hole. 该队打得很卖力，但仍然不能打成平手。</font>\n<br>2. out of debt 不欠债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The first year was bad, but after that he got out of the hole. 第1年情况不太好，但第2年他就还清了债。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack got out of the hole after he found a job in the bank. 杰克在银行找到工作后很快就还清了债务。</font>\n
out of the ordinary	<font color=blue size=4>out of the ordinary</font>\n<br>outside or beyond common experience; unusual 不同凡响；出众：不寻常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is indeed out of the ordinary and unheard of. 这真是闻所未闻的咄咄怪事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In our grand father 'time it was quite out of the ordinary for a woman to go to college. 在我们祖父的时代，妇女上大学是很不寻常的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has anything out of the ordinary happened since I've been away? 我不在的时候，有没有发生什么不寻常的事？</font>\n
out of the question	<font color=blue size=4>out of the question</font>\n<br>impossible 不可能的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To get there before seven is out of the question. 7点以前赶到那儿是不可能的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you say is out of the question. 你说的那事是办不到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An expensive holiday abroad was out of the question on his salary. 按他的工资水平，要花很多钱去国外度假是不可能的。</font>\n
out of the running	<font color=blue size=4>out of the running</font>\n<br>having no chance to win 无取胜的希望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was clear from the start that Enoch was out of the running in the Congressional race. 一开始就很明显，伊诺先生在这次议会竟选中是没有获胜希望的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His sudden illness put him out of the running in the contest. 他突然病倒了，使他在比赛中获胜的希望成了泡影。</font>\n
out of the swim	<font color=blue size=4>out of the swim</font>\n<br>not doing what others are doing; not active in business or social affairs 不熟悉情况；不合潮流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're new to the district and out of the swim. 我们是新来这个地区的，情况还不熟悉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The toy manufacturer who is out of the swim will lose money. 玩具制造商如果赶不上潮流，就要亏本。</font>\n
out of the way	<font color=blue size=4>out of the way</font>\n<br>1. not where people usually go; difficult. to reach 偏僻的；人迹罕到的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This village is very much out of the way. 这个村子非常偏僻。</font>\n<br>2. not what is usual or proper; strange 不寻常的；奇特的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I did not notice anything out of the way. 我没有注意到有什么不寻常的事。</font>\n<br>3. not in sb. 's way 不妨碍人的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please put these odds and ends out of the way. 请把这些零碎东西放到一边去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll stand this box in the corner, it will be out of the way there. 我来把这个箱子竖放在角落里，这样就不会碍手碍脚了。</font>\n<br>4. not proper 不恰当的；不礼貌的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you heard him say anything out of the way? 你听他说过不恰当的话吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To leave before the guest of honour would be out of the way. 先于主客离去是很不礼貌的。</font>\n<br>5. not able to stop or bother sb. 离开（不烦某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill wished the visitors were out of the way so that he could have time to study. 比尔希望来访者离去，这样他就有时间学习了。</font>\n
out of thin air	<font color=blue size=4>out of thin air</font>\n<br>from nowhere 没有根据；无出处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher criticized Dick because his story was made out of thin air. 老师批评了狄克，因为他编的故事毫无根据。</font>\n
out of this world	<font color=blue size=4>out of this world</font>\n<br>wonderfully good; satisfying 十全十美；极其优美\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dress in the store window was out of this world. 商店橱窗里的那件女服实在太好看了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her cooking is really out of this world. 她的烹调技术确实太出色了。</font>\n
out of touch	<font color=blue size=4>out of touch</font>\n<br>losing touch 没有联系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fred has got out of touch with people in his hometown. 弗雷德与他家乡人失去了联系。</font>\n
out of tune	<font color=blue size=4>out of tune</font>\n<br>1. out of proper musical pitch 音调不准；走调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The band sounded terrible because some instruments were out of tune. 乐队演奏得太差劲了，因为有些乐器走调了。</font>\n<br>2. not in agreement; not going well together 不协调；不一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His ideas were out of tune with the period in which he lived. 他的思想同他所处的那个时代格格不入。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech at the meeting was out of tune with the remarks of the other speakers. 他在会上的讲话同其他几位发言者所说的精神不一致。</font>\n
out of turn	<font color=blue size=4>out of turn</font>\n<br>1. out of the correct order 不按顺序的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll get your chance. Just wait and don't speak out of turn. 你会有机会的。等一等，不要抢先发言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students were told not to enter the meeting room out of turn. 学生们被要求依次进入会议室。</font>\n<br>2. at an unsuitable time or in an unsuitable way 不合时宜地；鲁莽地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack loses friends by speaking out of turn. 杰克说话轻率，因此失去了朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope I haven't spoken out of turn; I didn't know it was supposed to be secret. 我希望我没说漏嘴，我不知道这是该保密的。</font>\n
out of whack	<font color=blue size=4>out of whack</font>\n<br>1. needing repair; not working right 需修理；出故障的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My stomach is out of whack. 我的胃不舒服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't do any typing today; my typewriter has got out of whack. 我今天打不了字，我的打字机坏了。</font>\n<br>2. not going together well; not in agreement 不相称；不一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The things he does are out of whack with what he says. 他的言行不一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The TV report on the weather is always out of whack with the weather we actually get. 电视天气预报总是和实际天气有出入。</font>\n
out on a limb	<font color=blue size=4>out on a limb</font>\n<br>1. in a dangerous position 处境危险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company overextended itself and was soon out on a limb. 该公司扩展得太快，很快便陷入困境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll be putting yourself out on a limb if you undertake to defend such an unpopular act. 如果你同意为这样一种不得人心的行为作辩护，就会使自己陷于困境。</font>\n<br>2. with one's beliefs and opinions openly stated 公开发表\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President went out on a limb and supported a foreign aid bill that many people were against. 总统公开表示自己的见解，对许多人反对的援外法案表示支持。</font>\n
outside of	<font color=blue size=4>outside of</font>\n<br>1. except for 除…以外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Outside of Johnny, all the boys on the basketball team are over six feet tall. 篮球队里除约翰尼外，所有男孩的个儿都超过6英尺。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Outside of his secretary, no one knew his views. 除了他的秘书外，没人知道他的观点。</font>\n<br>2. out of 在…外面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives outside of the city. 他住在城外。</font>\n
out to lunch	<font color=blue size=4>out to lunch</font>\n<br>inattentive; daydreaming 心不在焉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What't wrong with him? He seemes to be out to lunch today. 他怎么了？他今天似乎心不在焉。</font>\n
over age	<font color=blue size=4>over age</font>\n<br>too old; above the legal age 太老；超龄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father wanted to fight in World War Ⅱ, but he couldn't because he was over age. 二战时父亲想参军，但因年纪太大而未成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wasn't allowed to sit for the college entrance exams as she was over age. 她因超龄而未获准参加大学入学考试。</font>\n
over and above	<font color=blue size=4>over and above</font>\n<br>besides 此外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We gave them two tons over and above the amount agreed to. 除了商定的数字外，我们又多给了他们两吨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The basic cost will be＄1, 000. Over and above this there will be my expenses—say another＄300. 基本的费用将是1000美元。除此之外，我还花费了300美元。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Over and above injured, he was also insulted. 他不仅受了伤，还遭受到了侮辱。</font>\n
over and over (again) 	<font color=blue size=4>over and over (again) </font>\n<br>repeatedly 一遍遍地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor has warned him over and over again to stop smoking, but he doesn't take any advice. 医生多次告诫他戒烟，可他就是听不进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have warned you over and over again not to do that. 我已再三警告过你不要做那事。</font>\n
over a/the barrel	<font color=blue size=4>over a/the barrel</font>\n<br>in a helpless condition; trapped 受牵制的；无能为力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have to obey him because he's got me over a barrel. 我被他所控制，只好服从他。</font>\n
over sb's head	<font color=blue size=4>over sb's head</font>\n<br>1. not understandable 不可理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lesson today was too hard; it went over my head. 今天的课太难，我不懂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His writings go over my head. 他写的东西太深，我理解不了。</font>\n<br>2. to a more important person in charge; to a higher official 越级报告或请求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thing was settled over his head. 这事没与他商量就处理了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Going over the head of his editor, the auther appealed to the publisher. 作者越过编辑，直接向出版者申诉。</font>\n
over the hill	<font color=blue size=4>over the hill</font>\n<br>past one's prime; unable to function as one used to 在衰退中；上了年纪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old Peter is no longer what he used to be; he's over the hill. 老彼得今非昔比了，毕竟上了年纪了。</font>\n
over the hump	<font color=blue size=4>over the hump</font>\n<br>past the most difficult part 度过危机\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very sick in the last few weeks, but he's over the hump now. 前几个星期他病得很厉害，但现在已脱离了危险期。</font>\n
over with	<font color=blue size=4>over with</font>\n<br>finished with 结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were over with the meeting by ten o'clock. 他们10点钟会议结束。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm glad I've got that operation over with. 我很高兴，手术总算做完了。</font>\n
owing to	<font color=blue size=4>owing to</font>\n<br>because of 由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Owing to your assistance, he finished the job in only two hours. 由于你的帮助，他仅用两小时就把活干完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The steady rise in the quality of our products owes much to the improvement of our equipment. 我们产品质量的稳步提高在很大程度上是由于设备有所改进。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I owe my present accomplishment to your timely assistance. 我现在的成就多亏你的及时帮助。</font>\n
own up	<font color=blue size=4>own up</font>\n<br>take the blame; admit one's guilt 坦白；爽快地承认\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The headmaster promised not to punish whoever broke the window if he owned up. 校长保证说只要承认打破窗户就不受到惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He finally owned up to having told the lie. 他最后承认自己说了谎。</font>\n
pace off/out	<font color=blue size=4>pace off/out</font>\n<br>measure by paces or strides 步测\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you want to know how far it is from the school to the post office, just pace it off. 如果想知道从学校到邮局的距离，你步测一下就行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engineer asked his assistant to pace out 40 metres. 工程师叫助手用脚步测出40米来。</font>\n
pack away	<font color=blue size=4>pack away</font>\n<br>store sth. , as in a box 存放（在盒子里等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll try to find that old book, for it's been packed away for years. 我要设法找到那本旧书，因为它存放在箱子里多年了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pack away your books, children. It's time for break. 孩子们，把书收起来，课间休息时间到了。</font>\n
pack in	<font color=blue size=4>pack in</font>\n<br>1. stop 停止；放弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That noise is awful. Pack it in immediately！那嘈杂声太可怕了，赶快住手！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why don't you pack it in? 你为什么还不停止？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't like her job at all and was thinking of packing it in. 她一点也不喜欢她的工作，正打算辞掉呢。</font>\n<br>2. push in 把…塞入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They packed the people in as tightly as they could. 他们尽量把人们推挤进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He packed all his clothes in after much trouble. 他费好大劲才把所有衣服塞了进去。</font>\n<br>3. attract large audiences to a theatre, concert, etc. 吸引大批（听众或观众）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new pop group is really packing in the teenagers. 新的流行乐队确实吸引了大量的青少年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The singer packed the crowds in. 歌唱家吸引了大批听众。</font>\n
pack off	<font color=blue size=4>pack off</font>\n<br>send away; dismiss abruptly 送走；突然解除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always packs the children off to bed at about nine. 她总是在9时左右打发孩子们上床睡觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She packed him off with a bottle of lemonade. 她给了他一瓶柠檬，把他打发走了。</font>\n
pack up	<font color=blue size=4>pack up</font>\n<br>1. bundle 包装；捆扎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you packed up your things? 你的东西装好了没有？</font>\n<br>2. get ready for a journey 整理行装；准备出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must pack up and get ready to start. 我们得整装待发了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's pack up and spend a week in the countryside. 咱们收拾东西到乡下去玩一个星期吧。</font>\n<br>3. stop or abandon an activity 停止工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you haven't learned how to drive after ten years, you may as well pack up. 要是你10年后还不知道如何开车，那最好别开了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had worked hard all day, so at four we decided to pack up. 我们苦干了一整天，所以下午4点钟就决定收工了。</font>\n<br>4. cease to function（机器等）出故障\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had only just got the car out of the garage when the engine packed up. 我们刚把车开出车库，引擎就出故障了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My watch has just packed up. 我的表刚停。</font>\n<br>5. be dismissed 被解雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Helen was told by her boss to pack up. 老板告诉海伦她被解雇了。</font>\n
pad out	<font color=blue size=4>pad out</font>\n<br>1. fill out with extra material 用额外的材料充填\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor padded out the shoulders of the coat. 裁缝给这上衣做垫肩。</font>\n<br>2. make a sentence, story, etc. longer by adding unnecessary detail 用不必要的材料拉长；添凑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her letter to her aunt was not long enough, so she padded it out with information about the weather. 她给她姨妈的信不长，她又添加了些有关天气的内容。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My advice is not to pad out your story with irrelevant details. 我的意见是别用不相干的细节来拉长你的故事。</font>\n<br>paddle one's own canoe work without help; earn one's own living 独立自主；依靠自己\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After his father died, he had to paddle his own canoe. 他父亲死后，他只好自己谋生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry about your son. He's old enough to paddle his own canoe. 不要为你儿子担心，他已到了足以自力的年龄了。</font>\n
paint in	<font color=blue size=4>paint in</font>\n<br>add sth. to a picture by painting 加画；添画\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He painted in a house to add some human interest. 他添了一座房子以增加这幅画的人情味。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The standing figure on the right was painted in after the rest of the picture was completed. 右边那个站立的人像，是在图画的其它部分画完以后加上的。</font>\n
paint out	<font color=blue size=4>paint out</font>\n<br>cover sth. by putting paint over it 用漆覆盖；涂掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They painted out the old name of the street before they put in the new one. 在刷上新的路名前他们先把旧路名涂掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Parts of old painting which appear unpleasing to later artists are sometimes painted out. 古画中某些为后世艺术家所不喜欢的部分，有时就被涂掉了。</font>\n
paint the town (red) 	<font color=blue size=4>paint the town (red) </font>\n<br>go out to drink and have a good time 狂欢；痛饮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's painting the town red in celebration of his good luck at the track. 他为庆祝自己在田径场上的好运气而狂欢痛饮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was the sailors'first night ashore; they painted the town red. 那是水手们上岸的第一夜，他们酗酒狂欢。</font>\n
paint up	<font color=blue size=4>paint up</font>\n<br>improve by using paint 用涂料整饰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school has been painted up for festival celebrations. 为庆祝节日，校容已整修一新。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have painted the place up after I left there. 我走后他们把那地方油漆了一遍。</font>\n
pair off/up	<font color=blue size=4>pair off/up</font>\n<br>join or cause sb. to join sb. else to make a pair or couple（使）成对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told the children to pair off. 老师让孩子们分成两人小组。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John paired up with Mary to play tennis. 约翰和玛丽配对在网球中打双打。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two eventually paired off after having been friends for several years. 他们俩交了几年朋友后终于结婚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This shoe does not seem to pair up with that. 这只鞋似乎跟那一只不成对。</font>\n
palm off	<font color=blue size=4>palm off</font>\n<br>1. get rid of sth. one does not want by persuading sb. to accept or buy it 用欺骗手段把…处理掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He palmed his old washing machine off on his aunt, even though he knew it was always breaking down. 他把他那台旧洗衣机硬给他姑妈，尽管他知道这机器老出毛病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There should be alaw against people palming off rubbish like this. 应该有一项禁止人们兜售这类劣质品的法令。</font>\n<br>2. deceive by a trick or lie 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to palm his boss off with the story that he had been to the dentist. 他企图欺骗他老板说他去看牙医了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has palmed off all that rubbish on the public. 他以一派胡言欺骗了公众。</font>\n
pal up	<font color=blue size=4>pal up</font>\n<br>become friends with sb. 和…要好；结交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should pal up with him. He'sthe man to help you. 你应该和他交朋友，他会帮助你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John and Bill palled up on their first day at school and they have been friends ever since. 约翰和比尔在入学第一天就要好了，打那以后他们一直是好朋友。</font>\n
pan out	<font color=blue size=4>pan out</font>\n<br>turn out; succeed 结果；成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Things didn't pan out well for them. 事情的结果对他们并不妙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Edison's efforts to invent an electric light bulb did not pan out until he used tungsten wires. 爱迪生致力于发明电灯泡，直到采用钨丝才获成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't predict how things will pan out. 我们无法预言事情会有什么样的结果。</font>\n
pant for	<font color=blue size=4>pant for</font>\n<br>have a strong wish for 渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give him the icecream; he's panting for it. 给他冰淇淋吧，他非常想吃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Working in the fields under the scorching sun, they were all panting for a cold drink. 烈日下在地里干活，他们都渴望喝点清凉饮料。</font>\n
paper over	<font color=blue size=4>paper over</font>\n<br>1. cover over with paper 用纸遮盖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A number of stains on the wall were papered over. 墙上的一些污迹被纸糊盖起来了。</font>\n<br>2. conceal 掩盖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried to paper over the differences between union and management, but the agreement did not last for long. 他们试图掩盖工会和资方的差异，但协议并没延续多久。</font>\n
parallel to	<font color=blue size=4>parallel to</font>\n<br>running side by side with but never getting nearer to 与…平行的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This line is parallel to that. 这条线与那条线平行。</font>\n
parcel out	<font color=blue size=4>parcel out</font>\n<br>divide sth. into parts, shares or portions 把…分成几份\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After his death, his land was parcelled out among his family. 他死后，他的土地分成了几份给了他的家人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He parcelled out the remaining food to the workers. 他将剩余的食物分给工人。</font>\n
parcel up	<font color=blue size=4>parcel up</font>\n<br>make into a parcel 把…包起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He parcelled up some games and toys to take to the Children's Home. 他包起一些游戏用具和玩具，拿到儿童之家去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They parcelled up the books and posted them. 他们把书包好寄出去了。</font>\n<br>pare down reduce or minimise sth. , esp. costs, expenditure, etc. 削减；削掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If we're going on holiday, we must pare down all our other expenses. 如果要去度假，我们就得削减其它一切开支。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With less money coming in they had to pare down their household expenses. 收入减少了，他们不得不紧缩家庭开支。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With a knife he pared down the stick. 他用刀子把那根木棒削细。</font>\n
partake of	<font color=blue size=4>partake of</font>\n<br>1. eat or drink some of 分享\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's partake of a meal before we part. 我们离别前，一起吃顿饭吧。</font>\n<br>2. have the same qualities as;show the characteristics of 有…相同的性质\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She partakes of her mother's character. 她的性格有些象她母亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her way of cooking partook of both Italian and American habits. 她的烹调既带有意大利风味又带有美国风味。</font>\n
part company	<font color=blue size=4>part company</font>\n<br>1. part; leave each other 分手；分开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was reluctant to part company with her. 他不愿同她分手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They quarrelled violently and after that parted company . 他们大吵了一架，从此就分手了。</font>\n<br>2. be different in opinion or action 意见不同；迥异\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They parted company with us on that question. 在那个问题上，他们和我们意见不一致。</font>\n
part from	<font color=blue size=4>part from</font>\n<br>leave 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's hard to part from friends you love. 要离开你所爱的朋友是很难过的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy wouldn't be parted from his pet rabbit. 这小男孩舍不得离开他心爱的兔子。</font>\n
participate in	<font color=blue size=4>participate in</font>\n<br>join (in) 参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob would not participate in the other children's games. 鲍勃不愿参加其他孩子的游戏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How many people participated in the inaugural ceremony? 多少人参加了开幕典礼？</font>\n
part with	<font color=blue size=4>part with</font>\n<br>1. separate from 分手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He parted with us at the end of the trip. 旅行结束时他与我们分手了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I parted with my friend on the pier yesterday. 我昨天在码头上和我的朋友告别。</font>\n<br>2. spend; sell (esp. at a very low price) 花掉；卖掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's not the sort who's happy to part with hardearned cash. 他不是那种舍得把辛辛苦苦赚来的钱随便花掉的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In order to raise money Cathy had to part with some of her jewels. 为了筹款，凯茜只好卖掉自己的一些珠宝。</font>\n<br>3. give up; dispense with 放弃；省掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were sorry to part with the old house. 他们对让出旧房子感到很惋惜。</font>\n<br>4. cease to employ 辞退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I parted with him for dishonesty. 因他不老实我把他辞退了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to part with his secretary when she got married. 他的秘书结婚了，他只好让她走。</font>\n
pass away	<font color=blue size=4>pass away</font>\n<br>1. go by 度过；过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had so much fun that the weekend passed away before we realized it. 我们玩得非常开心，周末不知不觉就过去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed the evening away playing caras. 他打了一晚的牌。</font>\n<br>2. end; disappear 结束；消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When automobiles became popular, 汽车普及后，人们就不再用马了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt dizzy after the accident, but the doctor assured him the dizziness would soon pass away. 事故以后他感到头晕，可医生告诉他说这种现象很快就会消失的。</font>\n<br>3. die 逝世\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to hear that your grandmother has passed away. 听说你奶奶不在了，我很难过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary passed away in her sleep last night. 玛丽是在昨晚睡觉时去世的。</font>\n
pass by	<font color=blue size=4>pass by</font>\n<br>1. go past 走过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed by without greeting me. 他经过我面前时没打招呼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bus passed by just a moment aso. 一辆公共汽车刚开过去。</font>\n<br>2. (time) elapse ： (chance or opportunity) slip by（时间）过去；（机会）错过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The patient grew steadily better as the days passed by. 一天天过去了，病人逐渐好转起来。</font>\n<br>3. overlook; ignore 忽略\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll pass that matter by for the moment. 我们暂时不去考虑那件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In making the selection we passed this short piece by quite inadvertently. 在挑选时我们完全由于疏忽而漏过了这篇短文。</font>\n
pass down	<font color=blue size=4>pass down</font>\n<br>hand or transfer sth. (from one generation to another) 把…往下传递\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The craft of candlemaking has been passed down for mang generations. 蜡烛制作的工艺流传了许多代人。</font>\n
pass for	<font color=blue size=4>pass for</font>\n<br>be taken for 被当作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you think he will pass for a cook wearing that hat? 你以为他戴上那顶帽子就会被当作厨师了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He would never pass for an Englishman; his pronunciation gives him away. 人们决不会把他当成英国人，他的发音就听得出来。</font>\n
pass into	<font color=blue size=4>pass into</font>\n<br>1. go into 进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed into the college by the narrowest possible margin. 他十分勉强地考进了这个学院。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Patients under hypnosis pass into a trancelike state. 被催眠的病人都进入昏睡状态。</font>\n<br>2. become gradually 逐渐变成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When water boils it passes into steam. 水沸腾后变成蒸汽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His words may pass into a proverb. 他的话可能会流传为谚语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On his death, the farm passed into the hands of the state. 他死后，农场归国家所有。</font>\n<br>3. record into 载入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The general's brilliant military achievements have passed into history. 将军的辉煌军事成就已成了历史。</font>\n
pass muster	<font color=blue size=4>pass muster</font>\n<br>pass a test or check up; be good enough 通过考核；及格；符合要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such excuses will not pass muster with him. 这种借口在他面前是通不过的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a period of practice, he was able to pass muster as a qualified lawyer. 他实践了一段时间以后，便成了一名合格的律师。</font>\n
pass off	<font color=blue size=4>pass off</font>\n<br>1. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed himself off as a doctor until someone checked his record. 在人们查阅他的档案之前，他一直伪装成医生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They resorted to the trick of passing off fisheyes as pearls. 他们使用了鱼目混珠的伎俩。</font>\n<br>2. disappear 消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. White's headache had passed off by that night. 怀特太太到了夜里头痛便消失了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A few minutes after we started, the fog began to pass off. 我们动身后几分钟，雾就开始散去。</font>\n<br>3. reach an end; last through to completion; take place 完成；举行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The party passed off well. 聚会开得很成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The organisers were pleased that the demonstration passed off without any police arrests. 组织者们很高兴警察没有在这次游行中抓人。</font>\n<br>4. ignore; treat as unimportant 忽视；把…看作无关紧要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She hated his familiarity, but passed it off as a joke. 她讨厌他那种亲昵的态度，但一笑置之。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His rude remark was passed off by the host. 主人并没有把他的粗鲁的话放在心上。</font>\n
pass on	<font color=blue size=4>pass on</font>\n<br>1. hand…on 传授；传递\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was a simple man, content to pass on his learning to new generations. 他是一位纯朴的人，以传授学问给后辈为满足。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please read this notice and pass it on to others. 通知看后请传给其他人。</font>\n<br>2. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed on quietly at his home last night. 昨天他在寓所安详地死去。</font>\n<br>3. move on; go on 继续下去；前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have said enough o this subject, now let me pass on. 关于这个问题，我已经谈了不少，现在我接着谈下面的问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time passed on like an arrow. 光阴似箭。</font>\n<br>4. give an opinion about; judge 提议；审核\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The jury will pass on the case next week. 陪审团将在下星期对这个案件作出裁决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you pass on the authenticity of this painting? 请你鉴定一下这幅画是不是真的？</font>\n
pass out	<font color=blue size=4>pass out</font>\n<br>1. lose consciousness; faint 昏迷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The atmosphere in the crowded hall became so stifling that two of the women passed out. 拥挤不堪的大厅里闷得令人窒息，两个妇女晕了过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She passed out while we were waiting for the doctor. 我们正在等大夫时，她晕过去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She went back to work while she was still sick, and finally she just passed out. 她带病重返工作，最后晕了过去。</font>\n<br>2. distribute 分发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The salesman passed out cigarettes to everyone in the restaurant. 推销员给饭店里所有的人发了香烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The exhibitors at the trade fair pass out free samples to stimulate interest. 参加交易会展出的厂商免费赠送样品以引起人们的兴趣。</font>\n<br>3. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. White passed out last, night. 怀特先生昨晚去世。</font>\n<br>4. graduate 毕业（尤指军事院校）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just over fifty students will be passing out at the end of the semester. 有50多名学生在本学期末将学成毕业。</font>\n
pass over	<font color=blue size=4>pass over</font>\n<br>1. cross 横过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must take care in passing over the road. 我们过马路时必须小心。</font>\n<br>2. forgive 宽恕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot pass over his fault. 我不能宽恕他的过失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll pass it over this time; but don't do it again. 这回我饶恕你，但下次不可这样。</font>\n<br>3. overlook; pay no attention to 对…置之不理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot pass the matter over. 我不能对此事置之不理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't pass over these painful sources of conflict and hope they'll naturally disappear. 你不能回避这些令人痛苦的冲突根源而希望它们会自然消失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wonder what made the reviewer pass over this aspect of the book in silence. 我不知道书评作者为什么只字不提该书的这一方面。</font>\n<br>4. review or summarise sth. briefly 回顾；浏览\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He quickly passed over the decisions which had been made at the last meeting. 他很快把上次会议作出的决定回顾了一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have read the first two chapters and passed over the rest of the book. 书的第1、2章我已阅读过了，其余部分我只粗看了一遍。</font>\n<br>5. not promote or choose sb. who feels he should be promoted 不予考虑（提升、任命）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you hear that they've passed over poor old Henry for a newcomer? 你听说了吗，他们没考虑提升可怜的老亨利，而提升了一个新来的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was passed over by the Army Promotion Board. 他未被陆军晋级委员会考虑提升。</font>\n
pass the buck	<font color=blue size=4>pass the buck</font>\n<br>make sb. decide sth. or accept a responsibility or give orders instead of doing it oneself 推诿；推卸责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The favorite game in that office is passing the buck. Everybody refers you to somebody else. 那个办公室的拿手好戏是推诿责任，大家都叫你去问别人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although it was his fault, he tried to pass the buck on to someone else. 虽然那是他的过错，可他却竭力推卸责任，怪罪别人。</font>\n
pass the time of day	<font color=blue size=4>pass the time of day</font>\n<br>say hello to sb. 寒暄；打招呼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is so haughty that she will scarcely condescend to pass the time of day with people when she meets them. 她非常傲慢，每次碰到人几乎都不愿和他们打招呼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They met at the corner and paused to pass the time of day. 他们在拐角处相遇，停下来寒暄了几句。</font>\n
pass through	<font color=blue size=4>pass through</font>\n<br>1. experience 经历；经过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country is passing through an economic crisis. 这个国家正在经历一场经济危机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This soldier passed through many dangers. 这个士兵经历了许多危险。</font>\n<br>2. travel through 经过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I passed through a picturesque village on my way here. 在来这里的路上，我经过一个风景如画的乡村。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed through the doorway and entered the room. 他穿过门口进入室内。</font>\n<br>3. complete a course of training at 在…学完训练课程\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed through a university course in Beijing. 他在北京修完了大学的课程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After passing through college, he was assgned to work in a big factory. 大学毕业后，他被分配到一家大工厂工作。</font>\n
pass up	<font color=blue size=4>pass up</font>\n<br>1. let go 放弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John was offered a good job in California, but he passed it up because he didn't want to move. 约翰在加州得到一份好工作，可他放弃了，因为他不想搬家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed up the chance of going to New York for a year. 他放弃了去纽约一年的机会。</font>\n<br>2. hand to sb. above oneself 把…向上递\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pass up the paint pot and brush, and I'll put another coat on the ceiling. 把油漆桶和刷子递给我，我要把天花板再上一层漆。</font>\n<br>3. decline; reject 谢绝；拒绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary passed up the dessert because she was on a diet. 玛丽没吃甜食，因为她在节食。</font>\n
paste up	<font color=blue size=4>paste up</font>\n<br>fasten with paste to a surface 用浆糊把…贴在上面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have pasted up a notice on the wall. 他们在墙上贴了一张布告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The printer pasted up the first chapter to show the author what his book would look like. 印刷工把书的第1章粘贴好了，让作者了解他的书会是什么样的。</font>\n
patch up	<font color=blue size=4>patch up</font>\n<br>1. mend 修补；修理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man patched up the broken vase before his wife noticed it. 那人在妻子发现花瓶被打破之前，把它修补了一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His clothes were patched up very neatly. 他的衣服补得很整齐。</font>\n<br>2. solve or settle an argument, disagreement, etc. 解决（纠纷、争吵等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We decided to patch up our differences and become friends again. 我们决定消除分歧，言归于好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They soon patched up their disagreement. 他们很快平息了他们之间的纠纷。</font>\n
pat on the back	<font color=blue size=4>pat on the back</font>\n<br>clap lightly on the back in support, encouragement or praise 赞许；鼓励\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sometimes it's a good thing to pat the children on the back for their achievement. 有时，对孩子们的成绩表示称赞是件好事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach patted the player on the back and said a few encouraging words. 教练拍拍选手的背说了几句鼓励的话。</font>\n
pause (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>pause (up) on</font>\n<br>think about 思考\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me pause on these matters be fore I make a decision. 在做出决定之前让我想一下。</font>\n
pave the way	<font color=blue size=4>pave the way</font>\n<br>make preparations 准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good education paves the way to success. 良好的教育为成功奠定基础。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Aviation paved the way for space travel. 航空为太空旅行铺平了道路。</font>\n
pay as one goes	<font color=blue size=4>pay as one goes</font>\n<br>pay cash; pay at once 当场付清；银货两讫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's best to pay as you go; then you will not have to worry about paying debts later. 最好能当场付清，这样就不必担心日后负债了。</font>\n
pay attention to	<font color=blue size=4>pay attention to</font>\n<br>place importance on 注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please pay attention to the use of this word. 请注意这个词的用法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Economists are paying close attention to the latest developments in the Middle East. 经济学家们正密切注视着中东的最新发展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pay attention to uniting and working with those who differ with you. 注意团结那些和自己意见不同的人一道工作。</font>\n
pay a visit to	<font color=blue size=4>pay a visit to</font>\n<br>call on 访问\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I paid a visit to Mr. and Mrs. Smith yesterday afternoon. 昨天下午我去拜访了史密斯夫妇。</font>\n
pay back	<font color=blue size=4>pay back</font>\n<br>1. return punishment 报复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He paid me back by not coming. 他采取不来的方式向我报复。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll pay them back for their insults one day. 总有一天，我们将对他们的恶意中伤进行报复。</font>\n<br>2. return (money) 还钱；还债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm certain that he will pay back every cent he owes you. 我敢肯定他会分文不差地把欠款还给你。</font>\n
pay down	<font color=blue size=4>pay down</font>\n<br>1. pay in cash; pay on the spot 付现款；当场支付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She pdid the money down and took the goods. 她当场付了钱，并取走了货物。</font>\n<br>2. pay (part of the purchase price) at the time of purchase as a deposit 先支付（部分货款）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How much did you have to pay down on the car? 你买这部汽车得先付多少货款？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You pay down only ten dollars and then you pay five dollars a month for eight months. 你只需先付10美元，然后分8个月每月付5美元。</font>\n
pay for	<font color=blue size=4>pay for</font>\n<br>1. give money for 付钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have paid for these pens. 我已付过这些钢笔的钱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You pay for it at the time you order it. 你订购时就得付款。</font>\n<br>2. have trouble because of 因…而付出代价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When Bob could not get a good job, he realized he had to pay for all the years of fooling around instead of working hard in school. 当鲍勃找不到理想的工作时，他意识到了这些年来他游手好闲，在学校不用心读书，因而得付出代价。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't work now, you'll pay for it later when you fail your exams. 你现在不好好学，到考试不及格时就得为此而付出代价。</font>\n
pay off	<font color=blue size=4>pay off</font>\n<br>1. pay the wages of 付工资\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men were paid off just before the holiday. 刚好放假前，这些人领到了工资。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They're usually paid off at weekends. 他们一般在周末领工资。</font>\n<br>2. discharge a debt completely 偿清（债务）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took them three years to pay off their debts. 他们付了3年才付清了债务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must pay off your old loan before you can obtain a new one. 你必须还清旧债才能再借款。</font>\n<br>3. be rewarding 有报偿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John studied hard before the examination, and it paid off. 约翰考试前学习很刻苦，因而得到了回报。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It has been rather costly to install the machinery, but it should pay off in the long run. 安装机械的代价很高，但从长远看是划算的。</font>\n<br>4. pay and discharge from a job 发薪遣散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The manager paid off the redundant employees. 经理将冗员的工资付清后把他们解雇了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole ship's crew were paid off at the end of the voyage. 远航结束时全船员工拿到工资后就被遣散了。</font>\n<br>5. get revenge on 报复；报仇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll be paid off for negligence. 你将因失职而受到处罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joel wanted to pdy William off for backbiting him. 乔尔因威廉在背后说他坏话而要对他进行报复。</font>\n<br>6. give money to sb. to stop him from threatening 给（某人）钱使其不做危害自己的事；贿赂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He agreed to pay the gang off if they promised not to burn down his shop. 如果匪徒们答应不烧毁他的商店，他同意给他们钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The inspector won't be paid off to let that go through. 检查员是不会受贿而让那件事通过的。</font>\n
pay one's way	<font color=blue size=4>pay one's way</font>\n<br>1. pay one's daily expenses without going into debt 付清日常消费；不负债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I paid my way through college by acting as a guide. 我靠当导游自己负担上大学期间的全部费用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He earns barely enough money to pay his way. 他赚钱仅足糊口。</font>\n<br>2. meet one's obligations 尽自己的责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is useful and goodnatured; he is a man who pays his way. 他很能干，个性又好，是一个尽职的人。</font>\n<br>3. be profitable; be valuable to an employer 有盈利；值得雇佣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to offer our new manager a high salary, but he was a capable man and paid his way. 我们只得给新经理高薪，不过他很能干，请他值得。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It will take time for the restaurant to begin paying its way. 这家餐馆还要经营一段时间才能盈利。</font>\n
pay out	<font color=blue size=4>pay out</font>\n<br>1. give money 付出钱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can either draw the money in monthly installments until it is exhausted, or you can be paid out here and now. 你可以把钱分月提取，直到取完为止，也可以当场一次提完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He must have paid＄ 50 out on repairing that house this month. 他这个月一定已经付了50美元来修理这所房子。</font>\n<br>2. take revenge on 向…报复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wrongdoers are usually paid out in the end. 干坏事的人通常到最后会受到惩罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've paid him out for the trick he played on me. 他捉弄了我，我已进行了报复。</font>\n<br>3. cause a rope, cable, etc. to run throngh one's hands 放松；放出（绳子）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The kite climbed steadily higher until there was no more string to pay out. 风筝平稳地越飞越高，直到手上再也放不出线来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fish which was hooked darted away so rapidly that we were obliged to pay out the line fast. 我们钓住的那条鱼逃得很急，我们只好加快速度放长钓线。</font>\n
pay the piper	<font color=blue size=4>pay the piper</font>\n<br>suffer the results of being foolish 自作自受；承担责任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wasted much of the fund owing to mismanagement, so now he must pay the piper. 由于管理不善，他浪费了大量资金，所以现在他必须承担后果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack had spent all his money and got into debt, so now he must pay the piper. 杰克把钱花光并欠了债，现在他可要自作自受了。</font>\n
pay through the nose	<font color=blue size=4>pay through the nose</font>\n<br>pay at a very high rate; pay too much 付出高价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was a shortage of cars; if you found one for sale, you had to pay through the nose. 汽车缺货，如果有卖，也得出高价。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had wanted experience, but this job seemed like paying through the nose for it. 他想取得经验，但是这个工作的代价太大了。</font>\n
pay up	<font color=blue size=4>pay up</font>\n<br>pay in full 付清\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The monthly installments on the car were paid up. 为买汽车按月应付的款已经付清。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My goods have vanished and the insurance company will have to pay up. 我那批货丢失了，保险公司要偿付保险金。</font>\n
peck at	<font color=blue size=4>peck at</font>\n<br>1. bite at with short sharp movements 啄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children watched the birds pecking at the corn. 孩子们看着那些小鸟啄玉米。</font>\n<br>2. eat very little of 少量地吃；一点一点地吃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No wonder he is losing weight. He hardly eats. He just pecks at the food. 难怪他瘦了。他简直吃不下东西，只吃一点点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pecked at his breakfast of egg and bacon. 早餐时，他只吃了一点咸肉和鸡蛋。</font>\n<br>3. strike with repeated small blows 连续轻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy started perking at the keys of the piano. 那男孩开始在钢琴键上乱弹一气。</font>\n<br>4. find fault with constantly 屡次找岔子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no good pecking at one another. 互相找岔子没有好处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop pecking a him. It was only a small thing after all. 不要老是责备他，毕竟这只是件小事。</font>\n
peculiar to	<font color=blue size=4>peculiar to</font>\n<br>belonging only to (a particular person, place, time, etc.) 为…所特有的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That way of speaking is peculiar to people in this part of the country. 那种说话方式是这个国家这一地区的人所特有的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a custom peculiar to the region. 这是该地区所特有的风俗。</font>\n
peel off	<font color=blue size=4>peel off</font>\n<br>1. remove (the outer layer or covering) 去掉（外层或覆盖的）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can peel the skin off with my fingers. 我可以用手指把皮剥掉。</font>\n<br>2. remove (clothing) 脱衣服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so hot that he peeled off his jacket. 他热得把茄克衫脱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She peeled off and dived into the water. 她脱了衣服潜入水中。</font>\n<br>3. come off; scale off 剥落；脱落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The paint on our house is peeling off in several places. 我们的屋子有几处油漆脱落了。</font>\n
peep/peek at	<font color=blue size=4>peep/peek at</font>\n<br>look at sth. secretly 偷看；窥视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Through a keyhole he peeped at what was happening inside. 他从锁眼里窥视室内的动静。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She felt she was constantly being peeped at. 她感到自己一直受人监视着。</font>\n
peg away	<font color=blue size=4>peg away</font>\n<br>work hard and steadily at sth. 坚持不懈地工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He found maths difficult but he pegged away at it every evening and passed the exam. 他觉得数学很难，但他每天晚上都用功，最后通过了考试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To write a novel, one must keep pegging away at it consistently. 要写小说，必须不断地辛勤劳动。</font>\n
peg down	<font color=blue size=4>peg down</font>\n<br>1. fasten down with pegs 用木桩固定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They pegged down their tent, ready for the night. 他们用木桩把帐篷固定，准备过夜。</font>\n<br>2. make sb. keep to a certain line of action; restrict sb. to the rules 约束（某人）的行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's proving very difficult to peg him down to a definite date for completion. 硬要他定期完成任务，显然是很困难的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When it comes to getting a clear promise, he's very hard to peg down. 想叫他明确答应下来，那实在很难。</font>\n
peg out	<font color=blue size=4>peg out</font>\n<br>1. mark out the boundaries of with pegs fixed in the ground 用木桩在地上标出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The surveyor pegged out the plot of land. 测量员用木桩标出这块地。</font>\n<br>2. faint or collapse from exhaustion 精疲力尽；晕倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll never give up work; he'll go on until he pegs out. 他决不中途放下工作，定要干到精疲力尽为止。</font>\n<br>3. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At this height, a climber can peg out from lack of oxygen. 在这样的高度，爬山者会因缺氧而死去。</font>\n
pep up	<font color=blue size=4>pep up</font>\n<br>give energy to 使有劲；使活跃起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A holiday in the sun will pep you up and you 'll soon feel better. 阳光下的假日会使你活跃起来，你很快就会感到有所好转。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pepped me up a lot with his comments. 他的话使我大为振奋。</font>\n
perk up	<font color=blue size=4>perk up</font>\n<br>1. raise (the head, tail, ears, etc.) briskly or spiritedly 昂（首）；翘（尾）；竖起（耳朵等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog perked up its ears. 狗竖起了耳朵。</font>\n<br>2. become or cause to become lively and active 活跃起来；振作起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She perked up when I suggested that we go to the theatre that evening. 当我建议我们那天晚上去看戏时她可来劲了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the spring came on, the patient began to perk up. 春天一到，病人的精神就开始好起来了。</font>\n
permit of	<font color=blue size=4>permit of</font>\n<br>admit of 有…的可能\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The travel arrangements do not permit of any change whatsoever. 旅行安排一点变更的可能性也没有。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This passage permits of more than one interpretation. 这段文字可能有几种解释。</font>\n
persist in	<font color=blue size=4>persist in</font>\n<br>continue resolutely 继续；坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She persisted in wearing that oldfashioned hat. 她坚持要戴那顶旧式的帽子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He persisted in carrying on his work in spite of great fatigue. 他虽然疲倦极了，可是仍然坚持工作。</font>\n
persuade of	<font color=blue size=4>persuade of</font>\n<br>convince 使相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can I persuade you of my sincerity? 我如何才能使你相信我是真诚的呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am persuaded of his honesty. 我相信他是诚实的。</font>\n
pertain to	<font color=blue size=4>pertain to</font>\n<br>be connected or associated with sth. 从属；附属\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire and dash pertaining to youth are not much in evidence among these people. 年轻人固有的热情和锐气在这些人身上不很明显。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The other questions pertaining to this matter have yet to be answered. 关于这事的其它问题还有待于回答。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have got the documents pertaining to the case. 我们已经得到了该案件的有关文件。</font>\n
peter out	<font color=blue size=4>peter out</font>\n<br>steadily weaken or decrease and come to an end 渐趋消失；逐渐停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her enthusiasm for dancing petered out and she stopped going to lessons. 她对舞蹈的热情已渐趋消失，而且已不再去上课了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy's supplies petered out. 敌人的给养耗尽了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As he thought of her, his anger slowly petered out. 一想到她，他的怒气就慢慢平息了。</font>\n
phase in	<font color=blue size=4>phase in</font>\n<br>introduce sth. gradually or in stage 逐步采用；分阶段引入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They phased in the new course by accepting just five students in the first year, and ten in the second. 他们逐步发展新专业，第一年只收5个学生，第二年收了10个学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've decided to phase the new techniques in. 他们已决定逐步引进那些新技术。</font>\n
phase out	<font color=blue size=4>phase out</font>\n<br>withdraw sth. gradually or in stage 逐步停止；逐步撤去；逐步淘汰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will that country phase out its oil exports? 那个国家会逐步停止输出石油吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The agreement called for the phasing out of troops in the area. 协议要求从那个地区逐步撤出军队。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old machinery here will be phased out. 这里的旧机器将被逐步淘汰。</font>\n
pick and choose	<font color=blue size=4>pick and choose</font>\n<br>select with much care 挑三拣四\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people pick and choose to get something perfect, and some just because they can't make up their minds. 有些人挑剔是想得到完美的东西，而有的人只是因为拿不定主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You haven't time to pick and choose from among so many pictures. 这么多的图片，你是没有时间从中细选的。</font>\n
pick apart	<font color=blue size=4>pick apart</font>\n<br>1. tear into pieces 撕成碎片；拆散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As this skirt fits badly, I'll pick it apart and remake it. 这条裙子不合身，我要把它拆了重做。</font>\n<br>2. criticise harshly; find fault with 猛烈批评；找岔子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always picking apart every girl he meets. Naturally ever yone has some faults. 他每遇到一个姑娘总爱挑剔，其实每个人都会有缺点的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the dance, the girls picked Mary apart. 舞会后，女孩们都责备玛丽。</font>\n
pick at	<font color=blue size=4>pick at</font>\n<br>1. eat without appetite 挑食\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop picking at your food, Janet！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Eat it all up or you won't have any pudding！珍妮，不要挑食！全部吃下去，否则就不给你吃布丁了！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had no appetite and only picked at food. 她食欲不振，只吃了一点点食物。</font>\n<br>2. find fault with 对…吹毛求疵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They showed their displeasure by continually picking at her. 他们不断挑她的毛病以示他们的不满。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'd been picked at so often by parents and teachers that she didn't know how to behave. 家长和老师经常对她吹毛求疵，她简直不知怎么办才好。</font>\n
pick off	<font color=blue size=4>pick off</font>\n<br>1. take off; remove with the fingers 脱下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The insecticide might harm the flowers Let's pick off the insects by hand. 杀虫剂可能会伤害花朵。我们还是用手把虫捉下来吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't pick off any of these flowers. 这些花一朵也不要摘。</font>\n<br>2. shoot or bring down singly or selectively 逐个地或有选择地射中或打下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They picked off the officers first, so as to throw the enemy troops into confusion. 他们首先把军官一个个地击毙，使敌军陷入混乱。</font>\n
pick on	<font color=blue size=4>pick on</font>\n<br>1. annoy 使烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children picked their father on until he agreed to have a ride. 孩子们一直缠着父亲，直到他同意开车出去兜风。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Little Tom complained that his mother was always picking on him. 小汤姆抱怨说，妈妈老是挑他毛病。</font>\n<br>2. choose 选择\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He visited a lot of universities, and finally picked on Stanford. 他去了许多大学，最后选择了斯坦福大学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why do they always pick on her to do the difficult tasks? 他们为什么老是找她去干困难的工作？</font>\n
pick one's way	<font color=blue size=4>pick one's way</font>\n<br>advance with care 谨慎前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After nightfall we drove slowly along, picking our way until we found the right building. 天黑后，我们驾车慢慢地往前开，直到发现了我们要找的大楼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver picked his way across the rough and rocky hillside. 司机小心地越过崎岖的山坡。</font>\n
pick out	<font color=blue size=4>pick out</font>\n<br>1. choose 挑选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took Mary a long time to pick out a new dress at the store. 玛丽在商店里花了好长时间才挑中一件新衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may pick out any two books listed here. 你可以在这图书目录中任选2本。</font>\n<br>2. tell from others 区分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We could pick out different places in the city from the airplane. 从飞机上我们可以辨认出这座城市里的不同地方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although he had not seen his sister for twenty years, he picked her out as soon as she got off the plane. 尽管他和妹妹有20年没见了，可她一下飞机他就认出了她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has such a distinctive appearance that I could pick him out anywhere. 他的样子非常特别，不论在哪里我都可以认出他来。</font>\n<br>3. tell the meaning 领会；弄明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of the difficulty of the passage, we succeeded in picking out its sense by our concerted efforts. 这段文字虽然难懂，但我们通过共同努力还是弄懂了它的含义。</font>\n<br>4. play a tune by ear on a musical instrument 凭听觉记忆在乐器上奏出曲调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as she'd sung the first verse, he picked out the tune on the piano. 她一唱完第一部分，他就在钢琴上把它弹奏了出来。</font>\n<br>5. relieve (the ground color) with another color（用不同的颜色）衬托（底色）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ancient cloister was a structure of red brick picked out with white stones. 这个古老的修道院是一座白石衬托红砖的建筑物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the important passages in the article were picked out in red. 该文的重要段落均用红笔勾出。</font>\n
pick over	<font color=blue size=4>pick over</font>\n<br>select the best of 选出最好的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She picked the apples over and threw out the bad ones. 她把好苹果挑出来，把坏的扔掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We picked over the cotton seeds before sowing. 我们将那些棉籽经过挑选之后才播种。</font>\n
pick sb's pocket	<font color=blue size=4>pick sb's pocket</font>\n<br>steal 扒窃（某人的东西）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thieves pick the pockets of unwary people. 小偷扒窃粗心大意的人口袋里的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guy was given a good talkingto when he was found picking a customer's pocket in the shop. 那家伙在商店里行窃时被当场发现，挨了一顿训斥。</font>\n
pick up	<font color=blue size=4>pick up</font>\n<br>1. lift; take up; raise after a fall 拾起；拿起；跌倒后爬起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children picked up many sea shells at the seashore. 孩子们在海边拾到很多贝壳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the morning Mrs. Carter picked up sticks in the yard. 早上卡特太太在院子里拾柴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He fell but at once picked himself up. 他跌了一跤，但马上又爬了起来。</font>\n<br>2. pay 支付\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After lunch in the restaurant, Uncle Bob picked up the check. 在餐馆吃完饭后，鲍勃叔叔付了饭钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They offered to pick up the bill for all the expenses of the trip. 他们表示愿意把全部旅行费用的账单接受下来。</font>\n<br>3. take on（开车）带人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train stopped to pick up passenger. 火车停下来让乘客上车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll pick you up at your office. 我到办公室来接你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the corner the bus stopped and picked up three people. 在街拐角处汽车停下来让3个人上车。</font>\n<br>4. collect 收集\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They picked up some rumours that the firm was going to close down. 他们听到一些关于公司要倒闭的谣传。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are trying to pick up information. 他们在设法收集情报。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He picked up rare coins in seaports all over the world. 他在世界各港口收集稀有硬币。</font>\n<br>5. gather together 收拾；整理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's almost dinner time, children. Time to pick up and get ready. 快到吃饭时间了，孩子们。收拾收拾，准备开饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's pick up the room before everyone arrives. 我们在大家来之前把房间整理好吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time to pick up tools and go home. 现在是收拾工具回家的时候了。</font>\n<br>6. get, learn accidentally 偶然得到（或学到、找到）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never studied Japanese; what he knows is what he picked up while living in Japan. 他从未正式学过日文，他所懂的一些日文是他居住在日本时随便学来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He picked up a beautiful statue when he was in Rome. 他在罗马时买到了一尊美丽的塑像。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I picked up that volume in a secondhand book shop. 那本书是我偶然在一家旧书店里找到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has picked up some bad habits at that club. 他在那个俱乐部沾染上了一些坏习气。</font>\n<br>7. make friends with 与…交朋友\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother told Mary not to walk home by herself from the party be cause some strangers might try to pick her up. 妈妈告诉玛丽舞会后不要独自步行回家，因为会有陌生人与她搭讪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think she picked him up at a dance. 我想她是在舞会上与他认识的。</font>\n<br>8. arrest 逮捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The main suspect in thr murder case was finally picked up by police in London yesterday. 谋杀案中的主要嫌疑犯昨天在伦敦被警察抓住了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>police picked the man up for burglary. 警察因这男子盗窃而逮捕了他。</font>\n<br>9. receive radio signals 收到信号\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With my new radio I can pick up stations all over Europe. 我的新收音机可接收到欧洲所有的电台。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy planes are picked up by our radar installations. 敌机被我们的雷达发现了。</font>\n<br>10. rescue sb. from the water 从水上救起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>AirSea Rescue picked up the downed airman after receiving an SOS message. 空海营救队接到呼救信号后，在海上救起了被击落的飞行员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They picked up the survivors in the lifeboat. 他们救起了救生艇里的幸存者。</font>\n<br>11. find and travel along (a route, a trail, etc.) 发现（道路、踪迹等）并沿着走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>State police picked up the bandits'trail. 州警察发现了土匪的踪迹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We picked up the trail of the fugitives and soon overtook them. 我们找到逃亡者的踪迹，不久就追上了他们。</font>\n<br>12. continue or return to sth. after a break or interruption 重新开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He picked up the story where he had left it the day before. 他接着往下讲前天没讲完的故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I found it difficult to pick up the discussion again after lunch. 我发现午饭后再继续讨论很困难。</font>\n<br>13. make sb. feel better 使感觉好些\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Catherine was feeling very bad yesterday but has picked up a lot today. 凯瑟琳昨天身体很不好，但今天觉得好多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A bit of exercise will pick you up. 你稍微运动运动会恢复健康的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A little food will pick you up. 吃点东西会使你感觉好些。</font>\n<br>14. become faster 加快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>About a mile out of the station the train began to pick up speed. 出站大约一英里，火车开始加速。</font>\n
piece of cake	<font color=blue size=4>piece of cake</font>\n<br> (a) very easy thing 非常容易的事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't think this job is a piece of cake. You'll have to rack your brains once you start on it. 别以为这事很容易，你干了就知道它是很伤脑筋的。</font>\n
piece out	<font color=blue size=4>piece out</font>\n<br>1. put together from many different pieces 拼凑；使…连起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must piece out the full story from your own imaginations. 整个故事情节得通过你的想象才能串连起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They pieced out a meal from leftovers. 他们把剩余的饭菜拼凑出一餐来。</font>\n<br>2. make larger or longer by adding one or more pieces 加长；加大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy grew so fast that his mother had to piece out his coat. 孩子长得太快了，他母亲只好把他的衣服接长。</font>\n
piece together	<font color=blue size=4>piece together</font>\n<br>put together piece by piece 一片片拼合；拼凑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She pieced together a blanket from odds and ends of wool. 她用零碎毛料拼凑成一床毛毯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One cannot write a good narrative simply by piecing together the details. 只是把细节拼凑起来并不能写出一篇好的记叙文。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I managed to piece together what had happened frow what he told me. 我终于按他讲的情况把事情经过贯穿了起来。</font>\n
piece up	<font color=blue size=4>piece up</font>\n<br>patch up 修补；接合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's piece up this broken tyre. 我们来把这个破轮胎修补一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was trying to piece up those fragments. 他在设法把那些碎片拼合起来。</font>\n<br>pile in (to) \n<br>1. push, crowd into (a car, room, football ground, etc.) 挤进；拥入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All five of us piled into George's car. 我们 5个人全都挤进了乔治的汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Reports of bumper harvests came piling in from all parts of the country. 丰收的消息从全国各地涌来。</font>\n<br>2. eat 吃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meal is ready, pile in. 饭好了，吃吧。</font>\n<br>3. attack violently 猛烈攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John piled into his opponent, almost knocking him down at the first assault. 约翰猛击对手，第1次攻击就几乎把他打倒在地。</font>\n
pile it on	<font color=blue size=4>pile it on</font>\n<br>exaggerate; stretch the truth 夸大\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop piling it on; it's not half as bad as you make it appear. 别夸大其辞了，情况远没有你描述的那么糟。</font>\n<br>pile on (to) \n<br>put on in a heap 堆上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why is it that all the extra work gets piled onto me at Christmas time? 为什么圣诞节期间把所有额外工作都堆在我身上？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pile on more coal; the fire is going out. 火快灭了，再加些煤。</font>\n
pile out	<font color=blue size=4>pile out</font>\n<br>push out (of a car, room, etc.) 挤出去；蜂涌而出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We piled out of the back of the car and stretched our cramped limbs. 我们争先恐后地从后面下车，活动一下被挤得动弹不得的四肢。</font>\n<br>\n<br>pile up\n<br>1. grow into a big heap 积聚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't go into his office for three days and his work kept piling up. 他3天没去上班，工作积了一大堆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let your work pile up; never leave till tomorrow what you can finish today. 不要积压工作，今天能处理的决不要拖到明天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They had piled up a lot of earth in one corner of the garden. 他们在花园一角堆积了很多土。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has piled up a lot of troubles for himself. 他给自己找了一身麻烦。</font>\n<br>2. crash 冲撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several cars and lorries piled up on the motorway in thick fog this morning. 今天早上，高速公路上有好几辆小汽车及卡车在大雾中相撞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One car made a sudden stop and the two cars behind it piled up. 一辆小汽车突然停住，后面的两辆撞了起来。</font>\n
pin down	<font color=blue size=4>pin down</font>\n<br>1. fix by means of a pin; fix immovably 用针固定住；压住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They seemed to have pinned his legs down under a heavy weight. 他们似乎用很重的东西把他的双腿压得不能动弹了。</font>\n<br>2. bind 使受约制；使受限制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They managed to pin him down to a particular time and place. 他们设法给他规定一个时间和地点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He agreed to lecture here next year, but I couldn't pin him down to a firm date. 他答应明年来讲学，但我无法叫他定出一个具体的日期。</font>\n<br>3. get sb. to make a definite statement 使表明态度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We did try to pin him down on his plans for the swimming pool, but he remained evasive. 我们的确想要他对他所拟订的游泳池计划表明态度，但他总是闪烁其辞。</font>\n<br>4. accurately define or determine sth. 确定；证实\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was impossible to pin down exactly what it was that he was trying to say. 不可能完全弄明白他想说的是什么。</font>\n<br>pin one's faith on／upon／to trust 信任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't pin your faith on his promises; he is known to be a rogue. 不要相信他的诺言，大家都知道他是个无赖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shouldn't pin my faith to what he says. 我不该盲目相信他的话。</font>\n
pine away	<font color=blue size=4>pine away</font>\n<br>waste away with grief 憔悴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After her son went into the army, she pined away for him to such an extent that her health began to suffer. 她的儿子参军以后，她很为他忧伤，身体日渐虚弱。</font>\n
pin one's hope (s) on	<font color=blue size=4>pin one's hope (s) on</font>\n<br>expect 寄希望于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shopkeeper pinned his hopes on a revival of trade. 店主希望生意再度兴隆起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some of the old people pinned their hope on government relief. 有些老年人把整个希望寄托在政府的救济上。</font>\n
pipe down	<font color=blue size=4>pipe down</font>\n<br>1. call (sailors) away from work with a whistle 吹哨唤（水手们）下班\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He piped the men down after boat drill. 航行实习后他吹口哨解散队员。</font>\n<br>2. stop talking; be quiet 停止讲话；安静\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do pipe down！I'm trying to work. 务请安静下来！我要干活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy kept interrupting the speaker with questions, and every one of us had to pipe him down. 那男孩老是发问，打断发言人的话，我们大家只得叫他住口。</font>\n<br>pipe up speak up 大胆地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was afraid to talk to the police, but a small child piped up. 大家都怕同警察说话，可是一位小男孩大胆地站出来开了腔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He piped up near the end of the meeting. 会议临近结束时，他起来发了言。</font>\n
pitch in	<font color=blue size=4>pitch in</font>\n<br>1. start work eagerly 努力投入工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If everyone pitched in we'll soon have the job finished. 如果每个人都拼命干，我们很快就能把活干完。</font>\n<br>2. give help or money for sth.;contribute 帮助某事；捐献\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wouldn't have finished the painting if his wife hadn't pitched in. 如果没有他妻子尽力协助，这幅画他就完不成了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all pitched in 5 yuan to buy her a present. 我们每人都捐5块钱买了一份礼物送给她。</font>\n
pitch into	<font color=blue size=4>pitch into</font>\n<br>1. work hard at 投身于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She pitched into the work and had the house cleaned up by noon. 她拼命地干，到中午前后便把房子打扫干净了。</font>\n<br>2. attack with blows or words 大骂；攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys had to be separated once they had pitched into each other. 男孩子们一旦打架就得把他们分开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pitched into the idea of raising taxes. 他对增加税收的建议大肆攻击。</font>\n<br>3. begin to eat heartily 开始大吃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After walking on the hills all day, they could hardly wait to pitch into their dinner. 在山上走了一整天后，他们等不及地大吃了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children pitched into the meal as though they hadn't eaten any thing for days. 孩子们开始大吃起来，好象几天没有吃东西似的。</font>\n
pitch (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>pitch (up) on</font>\n<br>select by chance; single out 选出；挑出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whenever there's an unpleasant job to be done the chief pitches on me. 每当有讨厌的工作要干，头头就选中我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I pitched upon the very house that suited me. 我选中了使我最满意的房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why did he pitch on the poor little boy as the one who broke the cup? 他为什么偏偏要说是这个可怜的小男孩打破杯子呢？</font>\n
place in the sun	<font color=blue size=4>place in the sun</font>\n<br>a good condition 顺境；显要的地位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's found himself a place in the sun now and doesn't want to start off on any new ventures. 他现在已经有了一定地位，不再想冒什么风险了。</font>\n
plain sailing	<font color=blue size=4>plain sailing</font>\n<br>easy 不费事；一帆风顺\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Life is by no means plain sailing. 生活决不是一帆风顺的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Revolution is never plain sailing, it's full of twists and turns. 革命从来都不是一帆风顺的，而是充满了艰难曲折。</font>\n
