plan on	<font color=blue size=4>plan on</font>\n<br>1. intend 打算\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We plan on visiting your city next month. 我们打算下个月访问你们的城市。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I plan on going to the movies after I finish my homework. 我打算做完作业后就去看电影。</font>\n<br>2. count on 指望；确定；预期\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm hoping to go away for the weekend, but I'm not planning on it. 我想外出度周末，但没定下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't plan on my going with you, for I expect to be busy this weekend. 不要以为我会陪你一块去，因为本周末我会很忙的。</font>\n
play about/around	<font color=blue size=4>play about/around</font>\n<br>1. amuse oneself in a lighthearted way 轻松愉快地玩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children are playing around in the garden. 孩子们在园子里玩耍。</font>\n<br>2. toy; meddle 玩弄；瞎弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school told him that if he didn't stop playing about, he would fail in his exams. 校方告诉他，要是他还瞎混的话，他考试会失败的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is playing around with a man twenty years younger than she is. 她跟一个比她年轻20岁的男人鬼混。</font>\n
play along	<font color=blue size=4>play along</font>\n<br>1. keep sb. waiting for an answer or a decision 使（某人）焦急地等候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've played him along for some time now, without telling him what you really want. 你们没告诉他你们需要什么，使他焦虑地等待了许久。</font>\n<br>2. cooperate 合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We felt that the best way to get what we wanted was to play along with them. 我们觉得要达到我们的愿望，最好的办法是同他们合作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plays along with his boss all the time, but I'm sure he does not really agree with him. 他跟他老板一直合作着，但我敢肯定他并不真正与他老板意见一致。</font>\n
play at	<font color=blue size=4>play at</font>\n<br>1. play (ball, card, etc.) 打（球、牌等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are playing at hockey. 他们正在打曲棍球。</font>\n<br>2. play the game of makebelieve of 作假装…的游戏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's play at being pirates. 让我们来假装海盗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We watched the kindergarteners playing at camping out this afternoon. 今天下午我们看了幼儿园的孩子们做野营游戏。</font>\n<br>3. do sth. in a halfhearted way 不认真做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must settle down and concentrate. You're only playing at doing your homework. 你做作业一点也不认真，你要定下神来专心做你的作业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is a job that needs to be tackled wholeheartedly—not played at. 这件工作需要全神贯注认真对待，不能敷衍了事。</font>\n
play back	<font color=blue size=4>play back</font>\n<br>replay 放录音\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We recorded our English lesson and then played it back. 我们把英语课内容录了下来，然后就放录音听。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm going to play back the first half of Act One. 我打算重放第 1幕上半部的录音。</font>\n
play ball	<font color=blue size=4>play ball</font>\n<br>1. begin play in a ball game 开始赛球\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the umpire calls“play ball, ”the game begins. 裁判一叫“开始比赛, ”球赛就开始了。</font>\n<br>2. join in an effort; cooperate 合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They said if we would play ball with them, this could be brought off with great success. 他们说如果我们注意与他们合作，这件事情就能出色地完成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We need the Committee's approval for this scheme. Do you think they'll play ball with us? 我们这项计划需要委员会批准。你认为他们会跟我们合作吗？</font>\n
play by ear	<font color=blue size=4>play by ear</font>\n<br>1. play a musical instrument by remembering the tune 凭听觉记忆演奏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She plays the piano entirely by ear. 她不用乐谱，完全凭听觉记忆演奏钢琴。</font>\n<br>2. decide what to do as one goes along 酌情而定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't know what may crop up, so you'll have to play it by ear. 我们不知道会出现什么情况，因此你得见机行事。</font>\n
play cat and mouse	<font color=blue size=4>play cat and mouse</font>\n<br>tease or fool by pretending to let sb. go free and then catching him again 欲擒故纵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman decided to play cat and mouse when he saw the woman steal the dress in the store. 警察发觉那女人在商店偷衣服时，他欲擒故纵，暂时先不抓她。</font>\n
play down	<font color=blue size=4>play down</font>\n<br>make sth. less important 贬低；缩小\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He gave all the credit to the others and played down his own part in the work. 他把功劳都归于别人，而对自己的作用则轻描淡写，一带而过。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctors thought it necessary to play down the serious nature of her illness. 医生认为把她的严重病情说得轻一些是必要的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspaper reports played down the actor's unattractive past. 新闻报道对于该演员不光彩的过去很少提到。</font>\n
play down to	<font color=blue size=4>play down to</font>\n<br>deliberately talk to or behave towards so that sb. doesn't feel inferior in order to win support or favor 故意摆出平易近人的样子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Right before the election, the Labour candidate played down to the voters in order to win their support. 就在大选前夕，工党竞选人装出一副平易近人的姿态，以取得选民的支持。</font>\n
play fair	<font color=blue size=4>play fair</font>\n<br>do what is right to others; act in a fair and truthful way 公平；举止正派\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a hardnosed man, but you can be sure that he'll play fair with you. 他虽是一个顽固的人，但是你放心，他一定会公平对待你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It wouldn't be playing fair if you were to break your promise at the last minute. 你如果在最后关头失信的话，那就不近情理了。</font>\n<br>play false cheat; deceive 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't try to play me false; I can see you don't mean what you said. 别想骗我，我看得出来你讲的跟你想的不是一回事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Good faith was not in him; he played anyone false who trusted him. 他一点也不老实，专门欺骗那些信任他的人。</font>\n
play fast and loose	<font color=blue size=4>play fast and loose</font>\n<br>repeatedly change one's attitude 反复无常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He played fast and loose with several women's affections. 他玩弄了好几位女士的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one can place any reliance on a person who plays fast and loose. 没有人能够信赖反复无常的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He should not play fast and loose with the company's good name. 他不应该拿公司的好名声当儿戏。</font>\n
play jokes/tricks on	<font color=blue size=4>play jokes/tricks on</font>\n<br>make sb. the victim of a trick or joke; make fun of 和…开玩笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mark Twain liked very much to tell funny stories and he also liked to play jokes on his friends. 马克•吐温很喜欢讲有趣的故事，他也喜欢开朋友的玩笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though he knew they were playing tricks on him, he pretended not to notice it. 他心里明白他们是在捉弄他，但他佯装不知。</font>\n
play off	<font color=blue size=4>play off</font>\n<br>1. put sb. in competition with sb. else, so to benefit from it 在…之间挑拨以从中获利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was always playing her two brothers off against each other. 她总是在她两个兄弟之间挑起争端。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The practice of playing off one great power against another is not new. 挑拨一个强国对抗另一个强国并不是什么新的手法。</font>\n<br>2. play or complete the playing of (an interrupted or delayed match) ; break (a tie) by playing once more 举行或完成（中断了的比赛）；（平局后）再赛以决胜负\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smith and Peter will play off next week. 史密斯和彼得下周举行决赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The visitors came back the next Saturday to play off the game stopped by rain. 客队下星期六来进行因雨天而停止的比赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When each player had won two matches, the championship was decided by playing off the tie. 两个选手都各赢两局后，再赛一局以决定冠军。</font>\n<br>3. make fun of 取笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jones always tried to play off poor old Smith who stammered badly. 琼斯总想嘲弄可怜的老史密斯，因为他口吃得很厉害。</font>\n<br>4. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man is not ill; he is playing off. 这人没病，他是在装病。</font>\n
play out	<font color=blue size=4>play out</font>\n<br>1. perform to the end 把…进行到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of the heavy rain they managed to play out the football match. 尽管雨下得很大，他们还是坚持把球踢完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actors played out the comedy and the audience applauded. 演员们演完喜剧后，观众拍手喝采。</font>\n<br>2. exhaust 疲倦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm always played out by the time I finish work on Fridays. 每到星期五这时候，所有的事情都做完了，我总会感到精疲力竭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work was strenuous for John, and each day he would arrive home all played out. 对于约翰来说，这工作实在太吃力了，他每天回到家里，总是精疲力尽。</font>\n<br>3. become ineffective 已不适用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such methods soon played out. 这些方法很快就不适用了。</font>\n
play politics	<font color=blue size=4>play politics</font>\n<br>play tricks for one's own gain 玩弄权术；操纵\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The attorney for the union accused the Mayor of playing politics in the strike. 工会律师谴责市长在这次罢工中玩弄权术。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In order to get elected, he had to play politics with both the unions and the bosses. 为了要当选，他得同时与工会和老板们达成协议。</font>\n
play possum	<font color=blue size=4>play possum</font>\n<br>1. pretenb to be asleep 装睡；装傻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy seemed to be fast asleep, but I knew he was playing possum. 这孩子看上去象是睡熟了，但我知道他是装的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let his silence fool you; he's just playing possum. 别被他的沉默骗了，他只不过是装傻。</font>\n<br>2. stay quiet for selfprotection; try to escape attention by inactivity 不动声色；不引起注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rabbit played possum under the bushes, hoping the hunter would not see him. 兔子静待在灌木丛中，希望猎人看不见它。</font>\n
play safe	<font color=blue size=4>play safe</font>\n<br>be very careful 求稳；不冒险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom didn't know what the other driver would do, so he played safe and stopped his own car. 汤姆不知道另一个司机要干什么，为安全起见他就停下车子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think it will rain today, but I'd better play safe and take a raincoat. 我看今天不会下雨，不过为稳妥起见，我还是带件雨衣好。</font>\n
play second fiddle	<font color=blue size=4>play second fiddle</font>\n<br>act a smaller part 居次要职位；当副手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm tired of playing second fiddle to George—why can't I run the business? 老是给乔治当副手我烦死了，为什么我就不能管事呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was only too glad to play second fiddle to Professor Smith at the symposium. 他非常乐意在讨论会上当史密斯教授的助手。</font>\n
play the devil with	<font color=blue size=4>play the devil with</font>\n<br>cause confusion in; upset 扰乱；破坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The high winds played the devil with my new hairstyle. 大风吹乱了我的新发型。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother's illness played the devil with our party. 由于母亲生病，我们取消了聚会。</font>\n
play the game	<font color=blue size=4>play the game</font>\n<br>obey the rules; do right 符合规则；做事公道\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom told the teacher what had happened, but all his friends thought he had been unfair and that he hadn't played the game properly. 汤姆把所发生的一切告诉了老师，但他的朋友都认为他不公正，太不光明磊落了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hold her in high esteem, since she is an honest person and has always played the game. 我非常尊敬她，因为她是个诚实的人，一向办事公道。</font>\n
play the market	<font color=blue size=4>play the market</font>\n<br>try to make money on the stock market by buying and selling stocks 玩股票\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sometimes Mr. White makes a lot of money when he plays the market, and sometimes he loses. 怀特先生玩股票有时赚大钱，有时则赔本。</font>\n
play to the gallery	<font color=blue size=4>play to the gallery</font>\n<br>try to get the approval of the audience 讨好（低级趣味的）观众；迎合大众的口味\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the past few years, television has been playing to the gallery. 过去几年里，电视一直在迎合大众的口味。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker played to the gallery by indulging in vulgar jokes. 为了哗众取宠，那位演讲者大讲粗俗的笑话。</font>\n
play up	<font color=blue size=4>play up</font>\n<br>1. emphasize 强调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach played up the possibilities of success. 教练竭力强调成功的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the article he plays himself up and plays the others down. 在文章中他抬高自己，贬低别人。</font>\n<br>2. play well; do one's best 赛好；加油\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I expect them to play up this afternoon. 我希望他们今天下午赛出水平来。</font>\n<br>3. behave mischievously; cause trouble 调皮；折磨；制造麻烦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new teacher didn't know what to do when the class started playing up. 班级开始乱哄哄时，新来的老师不知该怎么办。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old wound has been playing up again lately. 近来旧伤又在折磨人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those children do play their parents up. 那些孩子确实给父母惹麻烦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engine began playing up. 引擎开始出毛病了。</font>\n<br>4. (a band) begin to play（乐队）开始演奏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The band played up the national anthem. 乐队奏起了国歌。</font>\n
play (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>play (up) on</font>\n<br>1. perform on a musical instrument 演奏（乐器）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was playing an old tune on his flute. 他正用笛子吹奏一首老曲子。</font>\n<br>2. cause an effect on; influence 影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The TV film played on his feelings. 这部电视剧震撼了他的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cries of the baby at night played on my nerves. 夜间婴儿的哭声闹得我烦躁不安。</font>\n<br>3. utilize 利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He played on her good nature to borrow some money from her. 他利用她的善良向她借了些钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker knew how to play on the audience's feelings. 这位演说者懂得怎样利用听众的情绪。</font>\n
play up to	<font color=blue size=4>play up to</font>\n<br>flatter 讨好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is always playing up to the pretty girl students. 他总是向那些长得漂亮的女学生献殷勤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always plays up to his political boss. 他总是对他的政界上司献媚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is the sort of man who dislikes being played up to. 他是那种不愿被奉承的人。</font>\n
play with	<font color=blue size=4>play with</font>\n<br>1. have fun with 和…玩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy is playing with his new toys. 这小男孩在玩他的新玩具。</font>\n<br>2. trifle with 轻率对待；玩弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's not a woman to tolerate being played with. 她不是一个容忍别人玩弄的女人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been playing with the idea ofleaving his job and buying a farm, but he'll never do it. 他一直在考虑离开现在的工作，去买一个农场，但他永远也不会这样做。</font>\n
play with fire	<font color=blue size=4>play with fire</font>\n<br>take risks; put oneself in danger 冒险；引火烧身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He loved driving fast, even though he knew he was playing with fire. 即使他知道开快车是很危险的，但他还是喜欢这么干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He who plays with fire gets burned. 玩火者必自焚。</font>\n
play…for	<font color=blue size=4>play…for</font>\n<br>treat sb. as 把…看作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He played the man for a fool. 他把那人当作傻瓜。</font>\n
plead guilty	<font color=blue size=4>plead guilty</font>\n<br>declare in official language that one is guilty 服罪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the face of so much evidence, the thief was forced to plead guilty. 在大量证据面前，那小偷只得低头认罪。</font>\n
plead with	<font color=blue size=4>plead with</font>\n<br>make an appeal to 向…恳求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pleaded with them to give him more time to pay. 他恳求他们给他更多的时间来付钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With that kind of man you will plead in vain. 你向那种人恳求是无济于事的。</font>\n
pleased with	<font color=blue size=4>pleased with</font>\n<br>happy about 因…而满意或快慰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Are you pleased with your new clothes? 你喜欢你的新衣服吗？</font>\n
plod away at	<font color=blue size=4>plod away at</font>\n<br>work slowly and steadily at 缓慢而辛勤地干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plods away at his studies every night, but he doesn't enjoy the work. 他每天晚上都认真看书，但他一点也不喜欢这样做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plods away at his lessons until he learns them. 他刻苦钻研功课，直到弄通为止。</font>\n
plough into	<font color=blue size=4>plough into</font>\n<br>1. begin work vigorously into 干劲十足地投入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On his return to the office, he ploughed into his work. 一回到办公室，他就干劲十足地开始工作。</font>\n<br>2. crash into with force 撞上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car ploughed into a wall and was completely damaged. 汽车猛撞在一堵墙上，给撞得一塌糊涂。</font>\n
plough through	<font color=blue size=4>plough through</font>\n<br>1. pass through with difficulty 费力地在…前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many boats ploughed briskly through the sea. 许多条船在海上破浪前进。</font>\n<br>2. read or study with difficulty 艰难地阅读或研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've ploughed through all the documents that can possibly have a bearing on your case. 我们费了不少力气，才把同你的案子可能有关的全部文件看完。</font>\n
pluck up one's courage	<font color=blue size=4>pluck up one's courage</font>\n<br>have courage 鼓起勇气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The small boy plucked up his courage and went upstairs in the dark. 那个小男孩鼓起勇气摸黑上了楼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plucked up his courage to ask her to marry him. 他鼓足勇气向她求婚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In times of difficulty we must not lose sight of our achievements, must see the bright future and must pluck up our courage. 我们在困难的时候，要看到成绩，看到光明，要提高我们的勇气。</font>\n
plug away	<font color=blue size=4>plug away</font>\n<br>work persistently 坚持工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been plugging away at his new novel for nearly a year. 一年来他一直在坚持写一部新小说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Despite the difficulty of the task and the slowness of progress, they continued to plug away at it manfully. 尽管任务艰巨，进展迟缓，他们仍顽强地继续干下去。</font>\n
plume oneself on	<font color=blue size=4>plume oneself on</font>\n<br>be proud of oneself about; boast of 自夸；因…沾沾自喜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She plumes herself on the fact that she was educated in Europe rather than in the United States. 她以不在美国而在欧洲受教育为荣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plumed himself on belonging to the aristocracy. 他以自己是个贵族而洋洋自得。</font>\n
plump for	<font color=blue size=4>plump for</font>\n<br>1. offer strong support for 支持；拥护\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He plumped for the Liberal candidate. 他投自由党候选人的票。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone plumped for his suggestion. 大家都赞成他的建议。</font>\n<br>2. choose 选中；选定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We couldn't decide which car to buy, but we finally plumped for the red one. 我们定不下来买哪辆车，但最后还是选中了那辆红的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always plumps for the best that's going. 他总是挑选现有最好的东西。</font>\n
plump/plunk/plonk down	<font color=blue size=4>plump/plunk/plonk down</font>\n<br>1. drop down; fall 落下；倒下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he reached the armchair, he plumped down into it. 他手刚摸到扶手椅就蓦地倒入椅中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After walking a mile we plunked down on a bench to rest. 我们走了一英里路以后，一屁股坐在长凳上休息。</font>\n<br>2. drop sth. noisily or firmly 砰地放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She plumped down the heavy trunk and sat on a stone bench for a rest. 她吃力地把那只沉重的箱子放下，然后坐在一张石凳上休息。</font>\n
plump up	<font color=blue size=4>plump up</font>\n<br>1. fatten 养肥；变丰满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have really plumped up these chickens. 我们确实把这些鸡养肥了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child's cheeks are beginning to plump up. 孩子的面颊丰满起来了。</font>\n<br>2. fluff out; make appear fat 拍松软\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every evening she plumps up the cushions before she goes to bed. 每天晚上睡觉前她都要把垫子拍松。</font>\n
plunge into	<font color=blue size=4>plunge into</font>\n<br>1. begin work or an activity eagerly or abruptly 投入（行动）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She plunged into her new assignment the moment she got it. 她一接到新工作就立即投入了进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the subject was brought up, everybody plunged into the discussion. 问题一提出，大家都投入了讨论。</font>\n<br>2. throw oneself into some state 陷入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She switched off the light and plunged the room into darkness. 她把灯关了，房间一下子就黑暗了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was plunged into despair by the terrible news. 听到可怕的消息后他陷入了绝望中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They plunged deeper into debt. 他们负债更多了。</font>\n
point at	<font color=blue size=4>point at</font>\n<br>1. hold out a finger towards sb. or sth. 用手指\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was pointing at me. 她用手指着我。</font>\n<br>2. aim 用（枪）瞄准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She pointed a gun at his head. 她用枪瞄准他的头。</font>\n<br>3. indicate（意思）指\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What's he pointing at? 他指的是什么意思？</font>\n
point of view	<font color=blue size=4>point of view</font>\n<br>a way of considering or judging a thing, person, event, etc. 观点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From my point of view it would be better if you could come tomorrow, but you may not want to. 从我的观点看，你明天最好来，但你可能并不想来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've given me quite a new point of view. 你给我提供了一个新的看法。</font>\n
point out	<font color=blue size=4>point out</font>\n<br>1. explain 解释\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pointed out that it was not his fault. 他解释说这不是他的过错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I pointed out the advantages of the plan. 我说明了这计划的优点。</font>\n<br>2. call to attention 唤起注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman pointed out that the law forbids public sale of firecrackers. 警察指出法律禁止公开销售鞭炮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was pointed out to him that his application had arrived too late. 有人向他指出，他的申请交来太晚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the mistake was pointed out to him he hastened to correct it. 人们向他指出错误时，他赶紧纠正。</font>\n
point to	<font color=blue size=4>point to</font>\n<br>1. direct to 指向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The needle of a compass points to the north. 罗盘的指针指向北方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not far from there, you'll see a signpost pointing to the town you want to go to. 离那儿不远，你就可以看到一个路标，指明你所要去的那个镇的方向。</font>\n<br>2. direct attention to 指明；表明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything points to his guilt. 一切表明他有罪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everything points to a bright future for us all. 种种迹象表明我们都有光明的前途。</font>\n
point up	<font color=blue size=4>point up</font>\n<br>show clearly 清楚地表明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Johnny's report card points up his talent for math. 约翰尼的成绩单显示他在数学方面很有才华。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His rudeness just points up her good manners. 他的鲁莽更显出她的彬彬有礼。</font>\n
poke about/around	<font color=blue size=4>poke about/around</font>\n<br>1. search about 寻找\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Those people are poking about for the lost child. 那些人正在寻找丢失的孩子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you doing poking about my private papers? 你在我私人文件里乱翻些什么？</font>\n<br>2. move slowly or aimlessly; do little things 闲逛；做些小事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've poked about for an hour in the secondhand bookstore looking at all kinds of English books. 我们在旧书店里转了一个小时，翻看各种英语书籍。</font>\n
poles apart/asunder	<font color=blue size=4>poles apart/asunder</font>\n<br>completely different 相差甚远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were in agreement on most world issues, but they were poles apart about the war. 他们对于多数世界大事意见是一致的，但对于战争的看法却截然相反。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their opinions are poles asunder. 他们的意见截然相反。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two brothers are poles apart in character. 这兄弟二人性格迥异。</font>\n
polish off	<font color=blue size=4>polish off</font>\n<br>1. finish quickly 很快用完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were so hungry that it took them only a few minutes to polish off the pie and chips. 他们太饿了，只用了几分钟就吃完了馅饼和炸土豆片。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He polished off his work before leaving. 他在离开前，匆匆干完了自己的活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fighter polished off his opponent in the first round. 那拳击手在第1回合就把对手打倒了。</font>\n<br>2. complete the decorating work of 装饰竣工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is a delight for him to polish off every room. 将每间屋子都装修一新对他来说是件乐事。</font>\n
polish the apple	<font color=blue size=4>polish the apple</font>\n<br>try to win favor by flattery 逢迎；拍马\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry has been polishing the apple too much. I think the boss knows that his enthusiasm for the project is not sincere. 亨利的拍马奉承太过火了，我认为老板知道他对这方案的热心并不是真诚的。</font>\n
polish up	<font color=blue size=4>polish up</font>\n<br>1. become bright and clean with polishing 擦亮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He polished up the silverware till it shone. 他把银器擦得铮亮。</font>\n<br>2. improve 改善；润色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have to polish up my French before the holidays. 度假前我得温习一下法语。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think this article needs polishing up before we print it. 我认为这篇文章还需润色一下才能复印。</font>\n
pooped out	<font color=blue size=4>pooped out</font>\n<br>worn out; exhausted 精疲力尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone was pooped out a fter the hike. 徒步旅行以后大家都精疲力尽了。</font>\n
pop along/in/over	<font color=blue size=4>pop along/in/over</font>\n<br>pay a visit casually 顺便经过；顺道来访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll pop along to the post office and mail the package for you. 我顺便去邮局帮你把包裹寄走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I may pop in to see you next month. 我也许下个月来看你。</font>\n
pop off	<font color=blue size=4>pop off</font>\n<br>1. go away hurriedly 赶紧离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must pop off now. 我得走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where has he popped off to? 他匆忙去哪里了？</font>\n<br>2. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not going to pop off just now, so you needn't worry. 我还不会死，你不用着急。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He popped off at the age of twenty. 他在20岁时突然死去。</font>\n<br>3. fire 放（枪、炮等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children were running about popping off their toy guns. 孩子们奔跑着，劈哩啪啦地放玩具枪。</font>\n
pop out	<font color=blue size=4>pop out</font>\n<br>1. go out hurriedly 匆匆出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to have kept you waiting; I just popped out for a few moments. 抱歉，劳你久等了。我刚才匆匆出去了一会儿。</font>\n<br>2. come out with a sharp explosive sound 砰地一声出来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cork popped out and the champagne gushed from the bottle. 软木塞扑地一声跳出来，香槟酒从瓶里涌了出来。</font>\n<br>3. protrude from the sockets 突出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His eyes popped out in surprise. 他惊讶得眼睛瞪得大大的。</font>\n
pop the question	<font color=blue size=4>pop the question</font>\n<br>ask sb. to marry one 求婚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the dance, he popped the question. 舞会后，他向她求婚。</font>\n
pop up	<font color=blue size=4>pop up</font>\n<br>rise or appear suddenly or unexpectedly; show up 突然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I haven't seen him for weeks, but I'm sure he'll pop up one of these days. 我好几个星期没见他了，不过我肯定他这几天会来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pops up all over the place, so you never know where to look for him. 他什么地方都去，所以你不知道去哪里找他。</font>\n
pore over	<font color=blue size=4>pore over</font>\n<br>study carefully 仔细研究\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have been poring over my new scheme. 我一直在仔细推敲我的新方案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pored over the book the whole morning and made careful notes. 整个上午他都在钻研那本书，并仔细地做笔记。</font>\n
possessed of	<font color=blue size=4>possessed of</font>\n<br>in possession of 拥有\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is possessed of great natural ability. 他天赋很高。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was possessed of a big vocabulary. 他的词汇量很大。</font>\n
potter about/around	<font color=blue size=4>potter about/around</font>\n<br>move about from one little job to another 鬼混；闲逛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm a fraid you've spent too much time pottering about in the garden. 你在花园里东摸西逛，恐怕花的时间太多了吧。</font>\n
pounce at	<font color=blue size=4>pounce at</font>\n<br>seize 抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She pounced at the first opportunity to ask questions. 她一有机会就问问题。</font>\n
pounce (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>pounce (up) on</font>\n<br>1. make a sudden attack on 突然袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wolf pounced savagely on the lamb. 狼凶残地扑向小羊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Field was walking in the street when he was pounced on by some ruffians. 菲尔德在街上行走时，突然遭到几个歹徒的袭击。</font>\n<br>2. grasp (a chance) eagerly 紧紧抓住（机会）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children pounced on the chance of visiting the television studios. 孩子们抓住了去电视演播室参观的机会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is the kind of careless mistake on which her teacher loves to pounce. 她的老师喜欢抓这一类粗枝大叶造成的错误。</font>\n
pound away at	<font color=blue size=4>pound away at</font>\n<br>1. work hard continuously at 连续努力地干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you pound away at the job, you'll have finished it before dark. 如果你拼命干，不到天黑你就能干完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been pounding away at the job for the last two days. 这两天来他一刻不停地在干这件事。</font>\n<br>2. persistently attack 连续猛击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two fleets pounded away at each other until night fall. 两支舰队互相轰击直到天黑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his speech he kept pounding away at his opponent's inefficiency. 他在演说中不断攻击他的对手不称职。</font>\n
pour down	<font color=blue size=4>pour down</font>\n<br> (rain) fall hard and steadily（雨）倾盆而下；往下流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain poured down all day. 大雨整整下了一天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Creeks pour down from the uplands. 小河从高地流下。</font>\n
pour in	<font color=blue size=4>pour in</font>\n<br>cause to flow in; flow in continuously 大量涌入；源源而来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Messages of congratulations poured in on her birthday. 她生日那天，贺信源源不断。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The commander poured men in to reinforce the slaughtered battalions. 指挥官投入大量士兵增援被打败的部队。</font>\n
pour oil on the flames	<font color=blue size=4>pour oil on the flames</font>\n<br>make the quarrel severe 火上加油\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You pretended that you were helping them out of difficulty, but actually you were pouring oil on the flames and making matters worse. 你假装帮助他们克服困难，而实际上你是在火上加油。</font>\n
pour oil on the waters	<font color=blue size=4>pour oil on the waters</font>\n<br>quiet a quarrel 平息风波；调解争端\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The groups were nearing a bitter quarrel until the leader poured oil on the waters. 要不是领导人出面调解，双方很快就会大吵起来。</font>\n
pour out	<font color=blue size=4>pour out</font>\n<br>1. tell everything about; talk all about 倾吐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary poured out her troubles to her friends. 玛丽向朋友们诉说自己的苦恼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He poured his heart out to us. 他向我们推心置腹。</font>\n<br>2. stream out 倾泻；涌出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The people poured out of the building when they heard the fire alarm. 听见火警后，人们从大楼里蜂涌而出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water poured out. 水涌了出来。</font>\n

praise up	<font color=blue size=4>praise up</font>\n<br>praise fully 盛赞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been praising you up to everyone they meet. 他们见到谁都赞扬你。</font>\n

press for	<font color=blue size=4>press for</font>\n<br>urge; keep requesting 催促（回答）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newspaper reporters have been pressing the government for details. 新闻记者一直在敦促政府提供细节。</font>\n
press on	<font color=blue size=4>press on</font>\n<br>1. make one's way with violence or effort 挤进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They pressed on in spite of the strong wind. 他们不顾风大仍急速向前。</font>\n<br>2. cause worry 使烦恼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can see that the new responsibility is pressing on the young father. 我看得出这个新的责任让这位年轻的爸爸感到为难。</font>\n<br>3. force acceptance 强迫接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I do hope she wouldn't press more food on us. 我确实希望她不要逼我们再吃了。</font>\n
pretend to	<font color=blue size=4>pretend to</font>\n<br>profess to have 自称\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Certainly I can pretend to no special knowledge of electronics. 我当然不能说已经掌握了电子学的专门知识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pretended to abilities which he didn't actually possess. 他自称有这样那样的才能，但实际上并不是那么回事。</font>\n
prevail upon	<font color=blue size=4>prevail upon</font>\n<br>persuade 说服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After dinner he prevailed upon me to take a walk in the park. 晚饭后，他劝我去公园散散步。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We finally prevailed upon her to enter the association. 我们终于说服了她加入协会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He prevailed upon me to believe in his innocence. 他劝我相信他是无辜的。</font>\n

previous to	<font color=blue size=4>previous to</font>\n<br>before 在…之前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They made full investigations previous to reaching a conclusion. 他们在下结论之前做了充分的调查研究。</font>\n
prey on	<font color=blue size=4>prey on</font>\n<br>1. hunt and kill (animal) for food 捕食\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cats prey on mice. 猫捉老鼠。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What does the owl prey on? 猫头鹰捉什么东西吃？</font>\n<br>2. rob; take advantage of 劫掠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The robbers living in the mountains preyed on any traveller who wandered into their land. 住在山里的那帮强盗对进入他们地区的任何游人都要抢劫。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was hard to believe that these little boats were being preyed on by pirates. 很难相信海盗对这些小船都要抢劫。</font>\n<br>3. trouble or worry sb. 使痛苦；折磨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His fears and worries preyed so much on his mind that eventually he committed suicide. 恐惧和焦虑经常折磨着他，最后他自杀了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ill health has preyed on him for years. 疾病折磨了他许多年。</font>\n
prick up one's ears	<font color=blue size=4>prick up one's ears</font>\n<br>come to attention; begin to listen closely 侧耳倾听；警觉起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The woman pricked up her ears when she heard them talking about her. 当听到他们在谈她时，这妇女竖起耳朵倾听。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sentry pricked up his ears at the strange sound. 耳边传来奇怪的声响，哨兵顿时警觉起来。</font>\n

pronounce on	<font color=blue size=4>pronounce on</font>\n<br>give a considered opinion on 对…发表意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's too ready to pronounce on matters of which she really knows very little. 她太喜欢对自己实际上几乎一无所知的问题发表意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has every right to pronounce on this matter. 他完全有权对这件事发表意见。</font>\n
