pucker up	<font color=blue size=4>pucker up</font>\n<br>come or draw together into small folds or wrinkles 皱起；缩拢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child's face puckered up and she began to cry. 小女孩脸一皱，哭了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His eyes were puckered up against the strong sunlight. 在强烈的阳光照射下，他眯起了眼睛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young father puckered up his lips and gave the baby a fond kiss. 年轻的爸爸噘起嘴唇，亲热地吻了一下婴儿。</font>\n
puffed up	<font color=blue size=4>puffed up</font>\n<br>full of pride 自满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wouldn't have become so puffed up if you hadn't given her too much praise. 如果当初你没有过多地赞扬她，她决不会象现在这样骄傲。</font>\n
puff out	<font color=blue size=4>puff out</font>\n<br>1. cause to swell 使胀起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The toothache puffed out one side of his face. 牙疼使得他的半边脸肿了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy confidently puffed out his chest. 男孩信心十足地挺起胸膛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She puffed out the story quite a lot. 她把这件事大肆渲染。</font>\n<br>2. blow out 吹灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A sudden gust of wind from the open window puffed the candle out. 从窗口突然吹进来一阵风，把蜡烛吹灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She puffed out the candle as soon as the child went to sleep. 孩子一睡着，她就吹熄了蜡烛。</font>\n<br>3. cause to become short of breath 使气喘\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Climbing up the long staircase to his office quite puffed me out. 爬这么高的楼梯到他办公室，简直使我喘不过气来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We ran so hard that we were all puffed out when we got there. 我们拼命跑，跑到那儿一个个气喘吁吁的。</font>\n
pull about/around	<font color=blue size=4>pull about/around</font>\n<br>1. pull in different directions 拖来拖去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled the flowers about until he ruined them all. 他把那些花拖过来拽过去，结果全搞坏了。</font>\n<br>2. handle roughly 猛力推搡；虐待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They pulled him about rather violently. 他们相当凶狠地推搡着他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He got angry when people started pulling him about. 人们开始粗暴待他时，他恼火了。</font>\n
pull ahead	<font color=blue size=4>pull ahead</font>\n<br>overtake sb. or sth. 超前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The winner of the men's 400 metres pulled ahead in the last 50 metres. 男子400米的获胜者在最后50米冲到了最前面。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That driver's trying to overtake. Slow down a bit and let him pull ahead. 那个司机想超车，开慢一点让他超过去吧。</font>\n
pull apart	<font color=blue size=4>pull apart</font>\n<br>1. separate by pulling 把…撕开；拆开；扯断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The table is so made that you can easily pull it apart. 这张桌子是可以随意拆开的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the curtains were pulled apart, we saw the actors on the stage. 帷幕拉开时，我们看到了台上的演员。</font>\n<br>2. criticize sb. or find serious faults in an idea, plan, piece of work, etc. 把…批评得一无是处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled my argument apart and made me feel very stupid. 他把我的论点说得一无是处，使我感到像是个傻瓜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The professor proceeded to pull apart the student's paper. 教授进而指出那个学生作业中的许多错误。</font>\n
pull at/on	<font color=blue size=4>pull at/on</font>\n<br>1. drag forcibly at 用力拉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary pulled at his sleeve and led him boldly upstairs. 玛丽拉了拉他的袖子，大胆地领他上楼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog pulled at the rope as though he knew alife depended on his exertions. 这条狗用力拉绳，好象知道它用力与否关系到一条性命似的。</font>\n<br>2. take a drink from; draw from by sucking 深吸（烟）；大口喝（酒）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man sat in the corner, pulling at his pipe. 老人坐在角落里，抽着烟斗。</font>\n
pull down	<font color=blue size=4>pull down</font>\n<br>1. cause to be down from its place by pulling 把…拉下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His hat was pulled well down over his eyes so that nobody would guess his true identity. 他把帽沿拉得很下，几乎遮住了眼睛，使人猜不清他是谁。</font>\n<br>2. destroy; demolish (a building) 破坏；拆毁（建筑物）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is easy to pull down the old world than to build the new. 破坏旧世界容易，但要建设新世界就难了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They pulled down the old shop and built a supermarket. 他们拆掉了旧商店，建起了一个超级市场。</font>\n<br>3. earn 挣得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulls down quite a lot of money in his new job. 新工作使他挣了许多钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom always pulled down the highest grades in school. 汤姆在学校总得最高分。</font>\n<br>4. weaken (sb.) in health 使身体虚弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A really bad cold pulls you down and leaves you feeling very miserable. 重感冒会使你身体虚弱，让你感到很难受。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That long spell in hospital pulled him down a lot. 那次长时间生病住院使他的体质大大变差了。</font>\n<br>5. humiliate 羞辱；批评；降低地位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They intend to pull him down a bit. 他们想挫挫他的锐气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One is not sorry to see the proud pulled down. 看到自高自大的人被拉下来，谁都不会惋惜。</font>\n
pull in one's horns	<font color=blue size=4>pull in one's horns</font>\n<br>1. reduce one's boast; calm down from a quarrel 收敛言语；停上吵架\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled in his horns when he realized that his boasting was not impressing me. 当他意识到他的自吹对我不起作用时，就缩回去了。</font>\n<br>2. reduce spending or activity 缩减开支或活动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the business failed, father had to pull in his horns. 经营失败后，父亲只得缩减开支。</font>\n
pull in (to) 	<font color=blue size=4>pull in (to) </font>\n<br>1. arrive 到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lorry driver pulled into the side of the road to get a cup of tea. 卡车司机把车子停靠在路边去喝杯茶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train from Edinburgh pulled in five minutes late. 从爱丁堡开出的列车晚点5分钟进站。</font>\n<br>2. seize (a possible criminal) 抓获（嫌疑犯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police pulled those youths in for questioning after the robbery. 抢劫案发生后，警察把这些年轻人拘留起来审问。</font>\n<br>3. attract 吸引\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Beatles always pulled in enormous crowds. 甲壳虫乐队总是吸引成千上万的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They need to have a high rate of interest in order to pull in money from investors. 他们需要高利率来诱使投资者投入资金。</font>\n<br>4. reduce one's expenses; restrain 紧缩开支；限制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must pull in now, or you'll be asking for trouble. 你应当节约，不然你会自找麻烦。</font>\n<br>5. earn 挣得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulls in quite a lot as a milkman. 他当牛奶工挣了不少钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They're pulling in a lot of overtime on that job. 他们做那工作得了很多加班费。</font>\n
pull into pieces	<font color=blue size=4>pull into pieces</font>\n<br>criticize very badly; find serious fault with 驳得体无完肤；说得一无是处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Politicians always try to pull their opponents'ideas to pieces. 政治家们总是把他们对手的观点驳得体无完肤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The famous scientist pulled the new theory to pieces because it was very unscientific. 这位著名的科学家把这条新理论说得一无是处，因为它很不科学。</font>\n
pull off	<font color=blue size=4>pull off</font>\n<br>complete or perform (sth.) successfully 使（某事）成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has pulled off some remarkable shots in the match. 在比赛中，他几次因精彩的投篮而得分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How did you manage to pull off the deal without offering them more money? 没有出更多的钱，你是怎样把这笔生意做成的？</font>\n
pull oneself together	<font color=blue size=4>pull oneself together</font>\n<br>get control of oneself; get into a mood of preparedness 振作起来；做好…的思想准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop crying and pull yourself together！ You're not a baby any more. 别哭了，冷静点！你不再是个小毛孩了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Pulling himself together, he dismissed the matter from his mind. 他振作起来，不再想这件事。</font>\n
pull out	<font color=blue size=4>pull out</font>\n<br>1. take (sth.) out 拿出；拔出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Putting his hand in his pocket, he pulled out a handkerchief. 他把手伸进口袋掏出一块手帕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled out the pistol and aimed at the enemy officer. 他拔出手枪，对准敌军官。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have to have this tooth pulled out. 我的这颗牙要拔掉。</font>\n<br>2. move away 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We reached the station too late, just as the train was pulling out. 我们到达车站太迟了，当时火车正出站。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train for Beijing will pull out in 10 minutes. 去北京的火车还有10分钟就要开了。</font>\n<br>3. leave; cause to leave 离开；退出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim saw that the firm was going to be ruined, so he pulled out. 吉姆眼看公司即将垮台，于是就退了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government pulled the army out of the troublespot. 政府把部队撤出有争端的地区。</font>\n<br>4. recover from illness 恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John did not feel very well, but soon he pulled out. 约翰感到身体不太舒服，但不久就康复了。</font>\n
pull over	<font color=blue size=4>pull over</font>\n<br>drive towards the roadside 开向一边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone pulled over to let the ambulance pass. 大家都把车子开到路边，让救护车开过去。</font>\n
pull through	<font color=blue size=4>pull through</font>\n<br>1. help (sb.) to pass safely through a difficulty 帮助…度过难关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their courageous spirit pulled them through the darkest days of the war. 他们的勇敢精神使他们度过了战争中最黑暗的日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Good nursing will pull him through. 好好护理可以使他恢复过来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company was in great difficulties this year until a gift of money from the government pulled it through. 今年那家公司一直困难重重，直到政府资助后才度过难关。</font>\n<br>2. recover from an illness 恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very ill but he eventaully pulled through. 他病得很重，但最后还是康复了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The competent doctor pulled the patient through his serious illness by giving him the best possible attention. 那位能干的医生给病人以无微不至的关怀，使其从重病中康复了。</font>\n
pull together	<font color=blue size=4>pull together</font>\n<br>1. cooperate 合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People often pull together in a crisis. 人们在危机中往往是团结一致的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must pull together, or we will fail. 我们必须齐心协力，否则就会失败。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must all pull together if we are to win this election. 如果我们想在这次选举中获胜，就必须通力合作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's hoped that the new coach may be able to pull the football team together. 希望新教练能使这个足球队重振雄风。</font>\n<br>2. make oneself regain one's courage 振作起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took some time for him to recover from the shock and pull himself together. 过了一些时候，他才从震惊中恢复过来，重新镇静下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After breaking down and weeping, she tried hard to pull herself together. 失声痛哭一阵之后，她竭力振作起来。</font>\n
pull up	<font color=blue size=4>pull up</font>\n<br>1. raise (sth.) by pulling 拔出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll find my mother in the garden as usual, pulling up weeds. 你会象平时一样在花园里找到我的母亲，她在拔草。</font>\n<br>2. (cause to) come to a stop（使）停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lorry pulled up as I was walking along the footpath, and the driver asked me the way to the soft drinks factory. 我沿着小路散步时，一辆卡车停了下来，司机问我去软饮料厂的路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman pulled up the motorist and asked to see his licence. 警察让那个驾驶员停车，要看他的执照。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car pulled up when the light turned red. 红灯亮时，那辆轿车停了下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wanted to keep on speaking but the chairman pulled me up short. 我想继续讲下去，但会议主席把我打断了。</font>\n<br>3. improve 提高\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mark in English pulled him up several places. 他的英语成绩使他的名次提前了好几名。</font>\n
pure and simple	<font color=blue size=4>pure and simple</font>\n<br>simply stated; basic 简而言之；根本的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's the truth pure and simple. 这是不折不扣的真理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The problem, pure and simple, is finding a babysitter. 根本的问题是要找个临时照看婴儿的人。</font>\n
push about/around	<font color=blue size=4>push about/around</font>\n<br>bully; order about 驱使；摆布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not going to be pushed about by anybody. 我不准备受任何人的摆布。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Paul is always pushing the smaller children around. 保尔总欺侮比他年纪小的孩子。</font>\n
push ahead/forward/on	<font color=blue size=4>push ahead/forward/on</font>\n<br>1. go on resolutely 坚决前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's getting on for noon; we must push ahead to our destination as quickly as possible. 快中午了，我们必须尽快到达目的地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you want to push on with the decorating, we can leave dinner until later. 你要是想继续装饰的话，晚饭我们可以晚点吃。</font>\n<br>2. ambitiously draw attention to (oneself) 故意引人注目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He doesn't like pushing himself forward on public occasions. 他不喜欢在公开场合抛头露面。</font>\n
push along	<font color=blue size=4>push along</font>\n<br>1. impel along; continue one's way 继续前进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pushed the work along. 他抓紧进行工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were tired but managed to push along to the next village. 虽然我们很疲劳，但还是竭力赶到了下一个村子。</font>\n<br>2. leave; go 离开；去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time for us to push along now. 我们该走了。</font>\n
push for	<font color=blue size=4>push for</font>\n<br>strive for 争取；强烈要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The miners are pushing for more money and less work. 矿工们强烈要求增加工资，减少工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People living near the airport are pushing for new rules about night flights. 机场附近的居民正在强烈要求制订新的夜航规则。</font>\n
push off	<font color=blue size=4>push off</font>\n<br>1. set sail in a small boat 乘船出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We pushed off frow the shore and were soon out to sea. 我们乘船驶离岸边，不久就到了海上。</font>\n<br>2. leave or go away 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must be pushing off now！ It's getting late. 现在我得走了！天已很晚了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Push off！ Can't you see I'm busy? 走开！你难道看不见我很忙吗？</font>\n
push through	<font color=blue size=4>push through</font>\n<br>1. make a passage through 挤过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried in vain to push through the crowd. 他怎么也无法从人群中挤过去。</font>\n<br>2. gain acceptance of a bill, proposal 使…被通过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of a lot of resistance, we managed to push the proposal through. 虽然有许多阻力，我们还是设法使这个议案通过了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're trying to push the legislation through before the Christmas recess. 我们力争在圣诞节休会前通过这法令。</font>\n<br>3. cause sb. to pass or succeed in doing sth. 设法完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By giving him extra lessons, we managed to push him through his exams. 通过给他额外加课，我们终于使他通过了考试。</font>\n
push up	<font color=blue size=4>push up</font>\n<br>cause sth. to rise or increase 上升；提高\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wage increases keep pushing up the cost of living. 工资的增加使生活消费不断上涨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hot bath has pushed her temperature up. 热水澡使她身上暖和多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't reach the branch. Will you push me up? 我够不到那树枝。你把我托上去好吗？</font>\n
put about	<font color=blue size=4>put about</font>\n<br>1. spread a rumor, piece of news, story, etc. 传播；散布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've put it about that the Government's going to resign. 他们谣传说政府将集体辞职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has been putting rumors about that we are leaving. 有人散布谣言说我们要走了。</font>\n<br>2. trouble; distress 麻烦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't put yourself about because of me. 请别为我麻烦了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was very much put about by the news of the illness of his fellow worker. 听到同事生病的消息他很难过。</font>\n<br>3. cause to change direction 改变方向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain put the ship about and headed for safety. 船长将船转航，驶向安全水域。</font>\n
put across	<font color=blue size=4>put across</font>\n<br>1. fulfil sth. successfully 做成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director put the business deal across in record time. 厂长在极短的时间内就把生意做成了。</font>\n<br>2. make understood 使…被理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was too full of emotion to put across his ideas properly. 他太激动了，没有把他的意思表达清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was having difficulty putting his case across. 他当时很难讲清自己的情况。</font>\n
put an end to	<font color=blue size=4>put an end to</font>\n<br>1. make sth. end; cause to end 使…停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's up to the police to put an end to these robberies. 杜绝这类抢劫案是警察的事。</font>\n<br>2. destroy or kill 毁掉或杀死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new highway took most of the traffic from the old road and put an end to Mr. Hanson's motel business. 旧路上的大部分车辆都转移到新公路上，汉森先生的汽车旅馆生意也因此而终止。</font>\n
put aside	<font color=blue size=4>put aside</font>\n<br>1. place sth. on one side 放在一边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put her sewing aside when the telephone rang. 电话响时她把缝纫活放在一边。</font>\n<br>2. save or reserve 节省或存储\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tries to put aside a little money every month. 每月他都努力省些钱下来。</font>\n<br>3. ignore 不予理会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the war everyone put their political differences aside and worked together. 战争期间大家都放弃政治分歧通力合作。</font>\n
put away	<font color=blue size=4>put away</font>\n<br>1. put sth. in a proper place 收拾（东西）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please put those tools away after you finish the work. 干完活后请把那些工具收起来。</font>\n<br>2. save (money) 存（钱）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have put some money away in the bank. 我已在银行里存了点钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How much have you put away for your holiday? 你为度假存了多少钱？</font>\n<br>3. stop thinking about 停止考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Put away those foolish ideas. 放弃那些可笑的想法吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put away the idea of going home on holiday. 她放弃了回家度假的念头。</font>\n<br>4. place in prison 监禁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The judge put the criminal away for ten years. 法官判这名罪犯服10年刑。</font>\n<br>5. eat or drink 吃或喝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put away nearly half a bottle of whisky last night. 昨晚他喝了近半瓶威士忌酒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can they put away so much rice? 这么多的饭，他们怎么能吃光？</font>\n<br>6. kill; kill to prevent suffering 处死；杀掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog was so old and ill that it had to be put away. 那条狗年老多病，只好处死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Douglas put away Collins in cold blood. 道格拉斯蓄意杀死了柯林斯。</font>\n
put back	<font color=blue size=4>put back</font>\n<br>1. reset the hands of a clock or watch to an earlier time 拨回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My watch was ten minutes too fast, and I put it back. 我的表快了10分钟，我把它拨回去了。</font>\n<br>2. put off 推迟；延误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting has been put back until next week. 会议已推迟到了下个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had iniended to get married in April but we had to put the wedding back to September. 我们原打算4月份结婚，但后来只好推迟到9月份。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The strike has put back production considerably. 罢工已经大大地耽误了生产。</font>\n
put/bring into effect	<font color=blue size=4>put/bring into effect</font>\n<br>cause sth. to operate 使生效；实现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers of this factory have put many new measures for health protection into effect. 这家工厂的工人们实行了很多新的保健措施。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must put this policy into effect. 我们必须把这个政策付诸实施。</font>\n
put by	<font color=blue size=4>put by</font>\n<br>1. lay aside 储备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should put by something for a rainy day. 我们应该未雨绸缪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have put by some medicine for emergencies. 我们储存了一些药品，以备急用。</font>\n<br>2. leave out of consideration; evade sth. 把…搁在一边；回避\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We may shelve the difficulties for a while, but they cannot be put by inde finitely. 我们可以暂时不考虑这些困难，但要永远回避是不可能的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put the idea by until he was at leisure to consider it carefully. 他把这个想法搁在一边，直到有空时再去仔细考虑。</font>\n
put down	<font color=blue size=4>put down</font>\n<br>1. stop by force; crush 武力镇压\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In 24 hours the general had entirely put down the rebellion. 在24小时内，这位将军就把叛乱完全镇压下去了。</font>\n<br>2. write a record of 记录\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make sure that you put down every word she says. 务必记下她所说的每一个字。</font>\n<br>3. name sth. as a cause 归因于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would put his bad manners down to tiredness. 我认为他的无礼是因为他太疲劳了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think you can put all his success down to pure luck. 我认为你不能把他所取得的全部成就归结为侥幸。</font>\n<br>4. charge sth. to a particular account 把（开支）记在…帐上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put the dress down to her mother's account. 她把买衣服的钱记在母亲帐上。</font>\n<br>5. stop and let a passenger get out of a vehicle 让乘客下车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where would you like me to put you down? 你要我在哪儿让你下车？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus stopped at the station to put down one or two passengers. 公共汽车到站停下，让一两位乘客下车。</font>\n<br>6. land or cause sth. to land 使…降落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pilot put the plane down safely, despite the storm. 尽管有暴风雨，飞行员还是安全地降落了飞机。</font>\n<br>7. humiliate sb. 驳斥；使哑口无言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to enjoy putting his wife down in public. 他似乎喜欢在大庭广众之下把妻子弄得哑口无言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was put down in the argument. 他在辩论中被驳得无言以对。</font>\n<br>8. dig; drill 挖；掘\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They're engaged in putting down a well. 他们正在挖一口井。</font>\n<br>9. pay a deposit 付定金\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put down ＄100 on some furniture. 她买家俱付了100美元定金。</font>\n<br>10. kill an animal 杀死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the horse't leg is broken, it'll have to be put down. 要是马腿断了，那只能把它杀了。</font>\n<br>11. regard sb. as 认为…是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man looked so uneasy that I put him down for a criminal. 那个人看上去非常不安，我便以为他是个罪犯。</font>\n<br>12. write the name of sb. as willing to give (an amount of money) 写出…名字以示愿出（多少钱）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have put you down for￡5, is that all right? 我已记下你的名字，你愿出5镑，对吗？</font>\n<br>13. put on a waiting list for 申请\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If only he had put down for that job, he might have been a director now. 要是他申请了那个工作，他现在或许就是个主任了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to put down for government housing well in advance. 你必须提前申请政府住房。</font>\n
put forth	<font color=blue size=4>put forth</font>\n<br>1. produce (leaves) 长出（叶子）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spring the trees put forth new leaves. 树在春天长出新叶子。</font>\n<br>2. bring (strength) into action; show; display 使出劲；做出努力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Putting forth a great effort, he uprooted the tree. 他费了好大劲才把那棵树连根拔起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Students who put forth much effort will get ahead. 勤奋的学生是会取得进步的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the contest, our team was trying for the prize, so we put forth a lot of effort. 在比赛中，我们队力争要得奖，所以我们作了很大努力。</font>\n<br>3. state; propose; offer (a plan) 陈述，提出（计划等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heads of government of many countries have put forth a better system for preventing world war. 许多国家的政府首脑提出了阻止世界大战爆发的更好办法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President put forth his best plan for cutting down on in flation. 总统提出了控制通货膨胀的最佳方案。</font>\n
put forward	<font color=blue size=4>put forward</font>\n<br>1. propose or suggest 提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students put forward new proposals on the running of the college to the College Education Committee. 学生们向学院教育委员会提出了管理学院的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have put your name forward as the best for the job. 我已提议你为这项工作的最佳人选。</font>\n<br>2. move the hands of (a clock or watch) to a later time 往前拨（钟表）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My watch was slow so I put it forward three minutes. 我的表慢了，因此往前拨了3分钟。</font>\n<br>3. move an event, appointment, etc. to an earlier time or date 把…提前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to put our holiday forward one month. 我们不得不把我们的假期提前一个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The warm weather has put the crops forward by a month. 暖和的天气使庄稼早熟了一个月。</font>\n
put in	<font color=blue size=4>put in</font>\n<br>1. cause to be in; add 使加入；使进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You find the tea too strong? Just put in more water. 你觉得这茶太浓吗？多加些水进去就是了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put his head in at the window. 他把头伸进窗口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a pity that he forgot to put in some of the important details in his report. 很可惜，他忘了把一些重要细节写进报告里。</font>\n<br>2. spend time doing sth. 花费（时间）；度过（时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Altogether, he has put in about four years'work on his thesis. 他总共用了4年时间研究他的课题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's still a quarter of an hour to put in before the class begins. 还要过一刻钟才上课。</font>\n<br>3. make a request or application 提出申请或要求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If any of the goods arrive in a damaged condition, you must put in a claim within three days. 如果到的任何货物有受损情况，你必须在3天内提出赔偿要求。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You won't get the money if you don't put in for it. 你如果不提出要求，这笔钱你就得不到。</font>\n<br>4. recommend sb. for sth. 推荐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His commanding officer is putting him in for the Victoria Cross. 他的司令官推荐授予他维多利亚十字勋章。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are thinking of putting John in for the 100 metres. 我们考虑提名约翰参加百米赛跑。</font>\n<br>5. do; perform 干；做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always puts in an hour's piano practice after supper. 她每天晚饭后练一小时的钢琴。</font>\n<br>6. install; fix or supply sth. 安装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We put central heating in when we moved into our new house. 我们搬新家时安装了中央供暖装置。</font>\n<br>7. elect 使人当选；选举\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Voters put a Conservative government in at the last election. 上次选举中，保守党入选了。</font>\n<br>8. appoint 任命；委派\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A security man was put in to check on doors and windows. 委派了一个安全人员检查门窗。</font>\n<br>9. enter sb. or sth. in a competition 参加比赛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put herself in for the marathon. 她报名参加马拉松比赛。</font>\n<br>10. enter a port 进港\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vessel put in at Xiamen during the storm. 船进厦门港躲避暴雨。</font>\n<br>11. cut in 插话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Don't forget us, ”she put in. “别忘了我们。”她插话说。</font>\n
put in a word for	<font color=blue size=4>put in a word for</font>\n<br>say sth. in favor of sb. or sth. 为某人或某事说话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you have a chance to put in a word for me when you speak to the boss, I'll appreciate it. 你和老板交谈时，如果能为我美言几句，我会非常感激。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His uncle put in a good word for him and he got the job. 他叔叔为他说情，他才得到这份工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was so unpopular that on one could be found to put in a word for her. 她太不得人心了，替她说情的人一个也找不到。</font>\n
put in mind of	<font color=blue size=4>put in mind of</font>\n<br>remind sb. of 使…想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She puts me in mind of my sister. 她使我想起了我的姐姐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The way he behaves when he is angry puts me in mind of his father. 他发脾气时的那付样子使我想起他的父亲。</font>\n
put into practice	<font color=blue size=4>put into practice</font>\n<br>perform; fulfil 实施\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have made our plans; now we must put them into practice. 我们已经制定计划，现在该付诸实施了。</font>\n
put it on	<font color=blue size=4>put it on</font>\n<br>1. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He says he's unwell, but I think he is putting it on. 他说他有病，可我认为他是在装病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a pretty good dancer, but he was putting it on to impress his girlfriend. 他跳舞跳得相当不错，但为了给女朋友留下深刻印象，他故意卖弄了一番。</font>\n<br>2. boast 吹牛；夸张\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's rather putting it on. 那是夸大其词。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It wasn't as hard as you claimed; you were putting it on. 这并不象你说的那么难，你在夸大其词。</font>\n
put off	<font color=blue size=4>put off</font>\n<br>1. take off 脱去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As it got warmer, I put off my overcoat. 天气暖和了些，我脱去了大衣。</font>\n<br>2. postpone 推迟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never put off till tomorrow what may he done today. 今天可以干的事绝不要拖到明天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The concert had to be put off because the main singer was ill. 由于主要歌唱演员病了，音乐会不得为延期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to put off his trip to Japan for two weeks. 他只好把去日本的行期推迟两周。</font>\n<br>3. distract 使分散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The slightest noise puts me off when I am concentrating. 当我精神高度集中的时候，很轻的声音都会使我注意力分散。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like people talking when I'm writing a letter; it puts me off. 我写信时不喜欢别人谈话，那会使我分心。</font>\n<br>4. embarrass; displease 使为难\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be put off by his appearance; he's nice when you get to know him. 不要对他的外表反感，当你与他熟悉后，你会觉得他为人很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let his rough manners put you off. 不要对他的粗鲁态度不高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was very hungry but the smell of rotten eggs put me off. 我非常饿，但臭鸡蛋味使我倒胃口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was rather put off by the shamelessness of his proposal. 我对他的无耻建议深感不安。</font>\n<br>5. move out to sea 出海航行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They put off in small boats to meet the coming ship. 他们分乘小船出海去迎接那只大船。</font>\n<br>6. avoid 推脱；回避\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put her off with the excuse that he had too much work to do. 他以有很多工作要做为借口来搪塞她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They refused to have their demands put off. 他们不许人家对他们的要求加以搪塞。</font>\n<br>7. discourage sb. or cause sb. to lose interest in sth. 使泄气；阻止；劝阻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wanted to say something, but her face quite put me off. 我本来要说几句，但看到她的神情，又没有勇气开口了。</font>\n<br>8. let or make sb. get out of a vehicle 让人下车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ask the conductor to put you off at the next stop. 告诉售票员在下一站让你下车。</font>\n<br>9. get rid of 丢弃；抛掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He decided to put off all personal considerations and accept the task assigned to him. 他决定抛弃一切个人打算，接受交给他的任务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had put off all personal cares. 他已摆脱了一切个人的烦恼。</font>\n<br>10. send to sleep; anaesthetize 使入睡；使麻醉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This medicine will soon put you off. 这种药会使你迅速入睡。</font>\n
put on	<font color=blue size=4>put on</font>\n<br>1. dress oneself in 穿戴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put his coat on hurriedly and ran out of the house. 他匆忙穿上外套，冲出了屋子。</font>\n<br>2. turn on 开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He opened the door and put on the light. 他开了门，打开了灯。</font>\n<br>3. pretend 假装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was not really angry. He was putting it on. 他并不真生气，他是假装的。</font>\n<br>4. present (a performance) 上演\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actor put on a fine performance. 这位演员的表演非常精彩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The senior class put on a dance. 高年级学生举行了一次舞会。</font>\n<br>5. gain (weight); increase 增加（体重）；增添；上涨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put on a lot of weight last winter. 去年冬天她体重增加了很多。</font>\n<br>6. force acceptance of sth. on sb. 强迫某人接收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In those days various sorts of exorbitant taxes and miscellaneous levies were put on the people from time to time. 那时候，不时有各种苛捐杂税加在人民的身上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why do you put the blame on me? 你为什么责怪我呢？</font>\n<br>7. deceive 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't believe you; you are just putting me on. 我不相信你，你不过是在骗我。</font>\n<br>8. move forward (a clock or the hands of a clock) 往前拨（钟表）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He forgot to put the clock on last night. 他昨晚忘了把钟往前拨了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The English people will put on their clocks one hour for summer time the day after tomorrow. 英国人后天实行夏令时间，将把钟往前拨一小时。</font>\n<br>9. bet or risk money on sth. 下…赌注\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Richard put on＄5 and lost it all. 理查德德押了5美元，结果全输了。</font>\n
put on airs	<font color=blue size=4>put on airs</font>\n<br>pretend to be very grand 摆架子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She puts on airs all the time to try to inpress new acquaintances. 她总是摆架子，以期给新结识的人留下印象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm tired of those who put on airs. 我讨厌摆架子的人。</font>\n
put one's finger on	<font color=blue size=4>put one's finger on</font>\n<br>find exactly 准确查出；找到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The engineers couldn't put their fingers on the reason for the rocket's failure to orbit. 工程师们查不出火箭没能进入轨道的原因。</font>\n
put one's foot down	<font color=blue size=4>put one's foot down</font>\n<br>make a strong resolution 下决心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have to put my foot down and stop this nonsense. 我将下决心阻止这种胡闹。</font>\n
put one's foot into it	<font color=blue size=4>put one's foot into it</font>\n<br>make a foolish remark or make an awkward mistake 说错或犯了令人困窘的错误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You certainly put your foot into it when you told the teacher that you hated homework. 你对老师说你讨厌家庭作业，你这是犯了一个愚蠢的错误。</font>\n
put out	<font color=blue size=4>put out</font>\n<br>1. extinguish (a fire) 扑灭（火）；熄灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fire brigade soon put out the fire. 消防队员很快就把火扑灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put out the light and closed the door. 她关掉灯，然后带上了门。</font>\n<br>2. force to leave 逐出；赶走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you keep talking in class, I'll have to put you out. 如果你上课再讲话，我就把你赶出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put out the cat. 他把猫赶了出去。</font>\n<br>3. make angry 使生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never compromises on matters of principle and doesn't care who he puts out. 在原则问题上他从不妥协，不怕得罪人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was so put out by the man's rudeness that she didn't know what to say. 那个男子的无礼使她非常生气，以致于不知该说什么是好。</font>\n<br>4. stretch out 伸出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is rude to put out your tongue at people. 对别人伸舌头是不礼貌的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put out her hand in welcome. 她伸出手来欢迎。</font>\n<br>5. set sail 出航\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship put out to sea at dawn. 这条船在黎明时启航了。</font>\n<br>6. publish; broadcast 出版；广播；发表\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For years he had put out a weekly newspaper. 多年来他一直在出版一种周报。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government is about to put out a statement on its wages policy. 政府将对工资政策发表声明。</font>\n<br>7. exert (strength, etc.) 使出力量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's put out all our strength to do it. 让我们全力以赴去做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never had our supporters put out so much effort. 支持我们的人从来没有出过这么大的力。</font>\n<br>8. produce; generate; provide 生产；产生；供应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company puts out 900 cars a week. 这家公司一星期生产900辆汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enging of a fighter puts out more than one thousand horsepower. 一架战斗机的发动机输出功率高达1千多匹马力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This eatinghouse puts out meals at moderate prices. 这家餐馆供应廉价饭菜。</font>\n<br>9. sprout new shoots, leaves, etc. , esp. of a tree or plant（植物）长出（芽、叶）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trees start putting out their fresh green shoots in the spring. 春天，树木开始长出鲜嫩的绿芽。</font>\n<br>10. cause sb. to become unconscious 使昏迷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put out his opponent in the seventh round. 在第7回合中他把对手击昏倒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was put out by acupunctural anaesthesia. 针刺麻醉使他失去了知觉。</font>\n<br>11. dislocate a part of the body 使脱臼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She fell down and put her shoulder out. 她摔了一跤，把肩膀跌脱了臼。</font>\n<br>12. cause figures, results, calculations, etc. to be wrong or inaccurate 使误差\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rise in transportation costs has really put our estimate out. 运输费的上涨使我们的预算产生了误差。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The final totals can have been put out by as much as five per cent. 最后的总数可能误差达百分之五。</font>\n<br>13. inconvenience sb. 麻烦（某人）；使某人不便\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're not putting us out at all！On the contrary, we're glad to see you. 你一点也没打搅我们！相反，见到你我们真是很高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It won't put us out a bit if we drive you home. 我们开车送你回去，一点都不麻烦。</font>\n<br>14. lend money to sb. in order to get interest on it 放款；投资\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The banks have started putting out money to people wanting to buy their own houses. 银行已开始借款给那些想买房子的人。</font>\n
put out of the way	<font color=blue size=4>put out of the way</font>\n<br>kill 杀死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old dog was very sick, and Father had the animal doctor put him out of the way. 那条老狗病得很厉害，父亲就请兽医把它弄死。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many patriots were put out of the way because of their opposition to the government. 许多爱国者由于反对政府而被杀害了。</font>\n
put over	<font color=blue size=4>put over</font>\n<br>1. (a boat, etc.) go across（船等）开到对面去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boat has put over to the other side of the harbour. 小船已开到港口的对面去了。</font>\n<br>2. postpone 推迟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The discussion of this problem will be put over to next week. 这个问题将推迟到下周讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weekly meeting was put over because of the bad weather. 周会因天气不好而推迟了。</font>\n<br>3. cause sth. or sb. to be accepted or understood 表达思想；使受欢迎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wasn't elected because he didn't put his ideas over clearly enough. 他没有当选，因为他没有把自己的主张说清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has put herself over the audience. 她博得了观众的欢迎。</font>\n<br>4. deceive 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not the sort of man you can put something over on. 他不是你能随便骗得了的那种人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Wang believed everything the antique dealer told her until she discovered that nothing he said was true. “He tried to put something over on me, ”she said. 王太太起先非常相信这个古玩商，后来发现他所说的全是假话。她说：“他骗了我。”</font>\n
put right	<font color=blue size=4>put right</font>\n<br>1. mend 修理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The washing machine broke down again, so I called the repairman to see if he could put it right. 洗衣机又坏了，我请修理人员看看能否把它修好。</font>\n<br>2. correct 纠正错误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I make a mistake when I read out the results, please put me right. 我在宣读结果时如果有误，请帮我更正。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She likes to put other people right, but will, never admit making an error herself. 她喜欢找别人的错，但从来都不承认自己有错。</font>\n<br>3. make sb. feel better 使身体变好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This medicine will quickly put you right after your illness. 这药会使你病后的身体很快恢复健康。</font>\n
put sbin his place	<font color=blue size=4>put sbin his place</font>\n<br>criticize sb. for impolite boldness; deflate 使（某人）不敢越轨；使（某人）守本分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was a teacher who could put an impolitely bold boy in his place with just a glance. 她是个瞪一眼就能叫无礼的男生听话的老师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he dares to be impudent with me again, I'll put him in his place. 要是他再敢对我无礼，我就要对他不客气了。</font>\n
put through	<font color=blue size=4>put through</font>\n<br>1. complete successfully 顺利完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put through an important business deal yesterday. 昨天他做成了一笔大生意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can put this task through tomorrow. 我们明天可以完成这项工作。</font>\n<br>2. cause to pass or succeed 使通过；使成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ten U. S. senators helped to put the bill through Congress; the president was very grateful for this special support. 10个美国参议员使这项议案在国会里通过了，总统对此特殊的支持深表感激。</font>\n<br>3. connect sb. by telephone 接通电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you put me through to this number? 你能替我接通这个电话吗？</font>\n
put to	<font color=blue size=4>put to</font>\n<br>1. submit a question, belief, proposal, etc. to sb. for consideration 提出（问题等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would like to put a question to the speaker, if I may. 如果可能的话，我很想向演讲者提个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I put it to you, Minister, that unemployment will continue to rise. 部长，我提请您注意，失业率将继续上升。</font>\n<br>2. ask sb. to decide sth.;resolve sth. by voting or discussing 把…委托…表决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>May we put the proposal to the meeting? 我们能把这个提议在会上表决吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee will put your proposal to a vote. 委员会将把你的建议付诸表决。</font>\n<br>3. subject sb. to a lot of worry, trouble, distress, etc. 使遭受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't imagine the trouble we've been put to by him. 你很难想象他给我们带来的麻烦。</font>\n

put to (good) use	<font color=blue size=4>put to (good) use</font>\n<br>make effective use of; utilize well 充分利用；使用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smart businessmen put their money to use in the best investment. 精明的商人把钱用在最赚钱的投资上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you want to draw value from your education, put your study time to good use. 如果你想从教育中得益，就要充分利用你的学习时间。</font>\n

put up	<font color=blue size=4>put up</font>\n<br>1. build; construct 建造；搭起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are putting up several new buildings in that block. 他们正在那一街区建几幢楼房。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several tents have been put up to accommodate the party. 搭起了几个帐篷来给这一行人住。</font>\n<br>2. provide food and lodging for sb. 为…提供食宿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Yes, we can put you up for a night or two. 是的，我们可以安排你住一两夜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall be happy to put you up when you come to town next month. 你们下个月到城里来时我们将很乐意为你们提供膳宿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're welcome to put up in my home for the night. 欢迎你们在我家过夜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They put Frank up at a good hotel. 他们安排弗兰克住在一家很好的旅馆里。</font>\n<br>3. preserve (food); lay aside 保存（食品）；把…搁置起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fans have been put up for the winter. 冬天人们把扇子收了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmers put up the apples in barrels. 农民用桶保存苹果。</font>\n<br>4. provide (money needed) in advance 预先提供（所需的钱）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He promised to put up the money for the scheme. 他许诺要为这项计划提供资金。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is willing to put up money on the local team. 他乐意把赌注下在本地球队上。</font>\n<br>5. offer for sale 出售\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She put the house up for sale. 她的这幢房子待售。</font>\n<br>6. increase the price of sth. 提高价格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Universities have just put up their fees. 大学刚提高了收费标准。</font>\n<br>7. offer oneself as a candidate for an election 参加竞选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is putting up for Parliament next year. 他准备明年参加议会选举。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has your father been put up to serve on the committee? 你父亲已被选为委员会成员了吗？</font>\n<br>8. pack up 包装\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They usually put up six packs to a carton. 他们通常把6包装成1盒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They're busy putting fish up in barrels. 他们正忙着装鱼入桶。</font>\n<br>9. offer a struggle, resistance, defence, etc. 进行斗争、抵抗等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The militia put up a stout resistance. 民兵进行了顽强的抵抗。</font>\n<br>10. display; show 显示出；表现出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think he's only putting up a bluff. 我想他不过是虚张声势。</font>\n<br>11. place (a notice, etc.) so as to be seen 张贴；公布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The names of the successful candidates will be put up on the College notice board. 录取名单将公布在学院布告栏里。</font>\n<br>12. put to the original place 放回原处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you have done with the book, please put it up in its place. 书用完后，请放回原处。</font>\n<br>13. put forward 提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to put up an idea for your consideration. 我想提个意见供你考虑。</font>\n<br>14. make up sth. 准备（饭菜）；配制（药品）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you be so kind as to put up a quick meal for me? 劳驾来一份快餐好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The druggist put up the medicine that the doctor had prescribed. 药剂师把医生开的药配制出来。</font>\n
put up to	<font color=blue size=4>put up to</font>\n<br>1. encourage; entice 唆使；鼓动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They put me up to it！It wasn't my idea to make trouble. 是他们煽动我闹事的，这本不是我的主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Older boys put us up to painting the statue red on Halloween. 大些的男孩鼓动我们在万圣节前将雕像漆成红色。</font>\n<br>2. offer sth. to sb. for consideration 将…提交考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your idea is good; I'll put it up to the manager tomorrow. 你的想法不错，我明天提请经理考虑。</font>\n
put up with	<font color=blue size=4>put up with</font>\n<br>suffer or bear patiently; tolerate 容忍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot put up with all this noise. 我无法忍受这些噪音。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't put up with their bad behavior any longer. 我再也不能忍受他们的恶劣行为了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No longer able to put up with my toothache, I went to consult a dentist. 我再也忍受不住牙痛，于是就去请牙科医生诊治。</font>\n
puzzle out	<font color=blue size=4>puzzle out</font>\n<br>understand; find the answer to (sth. difficult) by thinking hard 理解；设法解决难题\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I managed to puzzle out the code. 我设法破译了密码。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't puzzle out his intentions. 我琢磨不出他的意图。</font>\n
puzzle over	<font color=blue size=4>puzzle over</font>\n<br>try to understand sth. difficult or confusing 思索\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't disturb her; she is puzzling over something important. 别打扰她，她正专心考虑一件重要的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I quite puzzle over the present situation. 我对于目前的形势迷惑不解。</font>\n
qualify for	<font color=blue size=4>qualify for</font>\n<br>1. make eligible for 使有资格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This degree will qualify you for teaching. 这个学位将会使你有资格任教。</font>\n<br>2. be fitted for 适合于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not qualified for the job. 他不适合做这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The player was disqualified for breaking the rules. 那个运动员因犯规而被取消了参赛资格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was disqualified for army service because of his weak eyesight. 他因视力不佳而不能参军。</font>\n
queue up	<font color=blue size=4>queue up</font>\n<br>be in a line 排队\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People are queuing up for tickets for the concert. 人们正排队购买音乐会的票。</font>\n
quite a few	<font color=blue size=4>quite a few</font>\n<br>a large number of; more than a few; many 许多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We didn't expect many to be present but quite a few people came to the meeting. 我们并未指望有多少人出席，但还是很多人来参加了会议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Quite a few went to the game. 有不少人去看球赛。</font>\n
rack one's brains	<font color=blue size=4>rack one's brains</font>\n<br>try one's best to think; try to remember sth. one has known; think hard with little or no result 绞尽脑汁；努力思考仍无结果；尽力回忆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He racked his brains during the test trying to solve the difficult problem. 考试时他绞尽脑汁试图把难题解出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry racked his brains trying to remember where he left his key. 亨利想来想去，试图回忆起他把钥匙放在什么地方了。</font>\n
rack up	<font color=blue size=4>rack up</font>\n<br>score; acquire; gain; win 获胜得分；获得；赢得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He racked up a large number of points. 他得了很多分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That bright student racked up 10scholarships during his college years. 那个聪明的学生在大学时代获得10次奖学金。</font>\n
rail at	<font color=blue size=4>rail at</font>\n<br>reproach; abuse; complain bitterly of 责骂；辱骂；对…大发牢骚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's no use your railing at fate. 抱怨命运不好是无济于事的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must not simply rail at a comrade when he makes mistakes, but we should help him correct them. 当一个同志犯了错误时，我们不要仅仅责骂他，而应该帮助他改正。</font>\n
rail in	<font color=blue size=4>rail in</font>\n<br>enclose with rails or a railing 用围栏围起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They railed the area in. 他们把那块地用栏杆围起来了。</font>\n
rail off	<font color=blue size=4>rail off</font>\n<br>mark off or separate with rails or a railing 用栏杆隔开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The end of the garden was railed off to stop the children straying into the road. 花园的尽头用栏杆隔开，不让孩子们走到大路上去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They railed the meadows off from the new railway. 他们用栏杆把草地和新修的铁路隔开了。</font>\n
rain cats and dogs	<font color=blue size=4>rain cats and dogs</font>\n<br>rain very hard 下大雨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the middle of the picnic it started to rain cats and dogs and everyone got soaked. 野餐中途下起了大雨，每个人都淋透了。</font>\n
rain in	<font color=blue size=4>rain in</font>\n<br>pour in 纷至沓来；涌进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Invitations rained in on all sides. 各方请柬纷至沓来。</font>\n
rain or shine	<font color=blue size=4>rain or shine</font>\n<br>1. whatever the weather is like 无论天气如何\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sports meet will be held, rain or shine. 无论天晴或下雨，运动会都将举行。</font>\n<br>2. whatever happens 无论什么情况\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sam knows he can depend on his family, rain or shine. 山姆知道，无论发生什么情况，他都可以依靠家庭。</font>\n
rain out	<font color=blue size=4>rain out</font>\n<br>postpone or call off on account of rain (said of a football game or any other outdoor activity) (usn. used in passive voice) 因雨而推迟或停止举行（通常指足球或其它户外活动，常用被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The baseball game that we had planned to watch on TV was rained out. 棒球赛因雨而取消，我们就看不成电视实况转播了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We didn't know that the outdoor hockey match had been rained out and so we had to drive back home without seeing it. 我们不知道那场室外曲棍球赛因雨而取消，所以只好开车回家没看成。</font>\n
rainy day	<font color=blue size=4>rainy day</font>\n<br>a time of need, esp. a time when money may be needed 困难的时候，尤指缺钱的时候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't spend my whole salary. I put some in the bank for a rainy day. 我不花光全部工资，在银行里存些钱以备不时之需。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Each week he saved a little money for a rainy day. 每周他节省点钱以备急用。</font>\n
raise (one's) eyebrows	<font color=blue size=4>raise (one's) eyebrows</font>\n<br>feel shocked; cause surprise or disapproval（使）震惊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all raised our eyebrows when we heard that two young men had beaten a tiger to death barehanded. 当听到两个年轻人赤手空拳打死一只老虎时，我们不禁为之愕然。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news that the princess was engaged to a commoner raised eyebrows all over the kingdom. 公主与平民订婚的消息使全王国为之震惊。</font>\n
raise the roof	<font color=blue size=4>raise the roof</font>\n<br>1. make a lot of noise 吵闹\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gang raised the roof with the singins. 这帮人唱歌唱得吵死人。</font>\n<br>2. scold loudly 大声批评；严厉指责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother raised the roof when she saw the dog's muddy footprints on her new bed spread. 看到新床单上有狗的泥脚印时，母亲便高声训斥。</font>\n
rather than	<font color=blue size=4>rather than</font>\n<br>more willingly…than; instead of 宁可…也不；而不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dictator relied on abuse of his opponents rather than on sound reasoning. 那个独裁者对他的反对者宁可大骂也不愿采取说理的办法。</font>\n
rattle/reel off	<font color=blue size=4>rattle/reel off</font>\n<br>say quickly without having to stop to think; recite easily and rapidly 不用思考而滔滔不绝地说出；背诵如流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We asked the waitress what flavors of ice cream she had, and she rattled them off. 我们问女服务员有些什么样的冰淇淋，她不加思索地说出了一大串。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The professor rattled off a list of books that would be useful in studying the topic. 这位教授报出了一串对研究这个专题有用的书籍。</font>\n
rattle through	<font color=blue size=4>rattle through</font>\n<br>say or do rather quickly 迅速地说出；迅速地做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rattled thuough his work in half an hour. 他很快地在半小时内做完了工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker rattled through his speech, failing to keep the interest of the crowd. 那位演讲者很快就讲完了话，但是没能把握住听众的兴趣。</font>\n
rave about	<font color=blue size=4>rave about</font>\n<br>1. speak about sth. with great admiration; talk about sth. with exaggerated enthusiasm 大声赞扬；狂热地谈论某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the girls raved about the new singer. 所有女孩都盛赞这位新歌手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot understand why teenagers rave about some of these pop singers. 我真不明白为什么十几岁的年轻人会如醉如痴地谈论那些流行歌手。</font>\n<br>2. give a display of uncontrollable anger or indignation about 对…表现出极度的愤怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thinking that I might be a ready and sympathetic listener, she started raving about the shameful way she had been treated by her husband. 她认为我可能愿意听而且会表示同情，所以就开始愤怒地诉说她丈夫对她的种种不体面的行径。</font>\n
reach for	<font color=blue size=4>reach for</font>\n<br>stretch one's hand so as to touch or hold 伸手拿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was no time for me to reach for my own gun. 我来不及掏出枪。</font>\n
read between the lines	<font color=blue size=4>read between the lines</font>\n<br>find a meaning that is not expressed 体会字里行间的意思\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you read between the lines, this letter is really a request for money. 如果你细心体会一下，这封信实际上是要钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Read between the lines, and you'll find out what's at the back of his mind. 从字里行间去体会他的言外之意，你就会发现他头脑里究竟在考虑什么。</font>\n
read into	<font color=blue size=4>read into</font>\n<br>give an interpretation to (a statement, a situation, etc.); add more than is justified 对（声明、形势等）加以解释；自以为有某种含意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He read into the statement a deep insult. 他认为该声明含有极大的侮辱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are reading into the situation more than the facts warrant. 你对形势的估计比实际情况夸大了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Too much should not be read into the minister's statement; we can't expect a sudden easing of the situation. 不要对部长的讲话乱加解释；我们不能指望形势会突然缓和下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't read things into what I say. 不要对我讲的话妄加解释。</font>\n
read out of	<font color=blue size=4>read out of</font>\n<br>expel from, or declare no longer to belong to (some organization) by proclamation of any kind 宣布除名；自（政党等）逐出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was read out of the club for violation of its rules. 他因违反俱乐部规章而被开除。</font>\n
read sb's mind	<font color=blue size=4>read sb's mind</font>\n<br>know what sb. is thinking 知道某人在想什么；猜透某人的心思\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have known John so long that I can read his mind. 我跟约翰已认识很久了，因此我知道他在想什么。</font>\n
read up	<font color=blue size=4>read up</font>\n<br>1. collect information by reading 通过阅读获取知识或情报\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was reading up what Roberts had written on the history of India. 他正在研究罗伯茨所写的关于印度历史的著作。</font>\n<br>2. read carefully for an examination or other special purposes 为准备考试或其它目的仔细攻读\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm going to read up on statistics before the exam. 我打算在考试前攻读统计学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been reading the subject up. 他一直在攻读这门课程。</font>\n
ready for	<font color=blue size=4>ready for</font>\n<br>prepared and fit for 准备好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took us several hours to gat the gymnasium ready for the school dance. 为办学校舞会，我们花了几个小时才把体育馆布置好。</font>\n
reckon on	<font color=blue size=4>reckon on</font>\n<br>1. trust 信赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can always reckon on me. 你总是可以信赖我。</font>\n<br>2. expect (sth. to happen); base one's assumption on 盼望（某事发生）；没想到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't reckon on seeing him. 你不要指望能见到他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't reckon on six dinner guests. 她没有预料来赴宴的客人会有6个。</font>\n
reckon with	<font color=blue size=4>reckon with</font>\n<br>1. deal with 对付；处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have to reckon with many problems every day. 我每天必须处理许多问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wouldn't like to reckon with the director when he is in a bad temper. 主任脾气不好时我不想与他打交道。</font>\n<br>\n<br>2. consider carefully; include in consideration or planning 认真考虑；考虑到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must reckon with all possible difficulties when we are considering the contract. 在考虑合同时，我们要把所有可能的困难都估计到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before you do anything, you must reckon with the danger that may arise there from. 无论做什么事，都必须估计到可能因此而产生的危险。</font>\n<br>3. settle accounts or claims with 结算账目；结账\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is a long time since I reckoned with the merchant. 我已经很久没有和那个商人结账了。</font>\n<br>4. punish 惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All those who opposed us have now been reckoned with. 所有反对我们的人都已受到了惩罚。</font>\n
reconciled to	<font color=blue size=4>reconciled to</font>\n<br>prepared to accept 甘心接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not reconciled to his defeat. 他不甘心失败。</font>\n
recover from	<font color=blue size=4>recover from</font>\n<br>regain health from 恢复健康\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A healthy child quickly recovers from a fever. 健康的孩子发烧后康复很快。</font>\n
refer to	<font color=blue size=4>refer to</font>\n<br>1. make reference of allusion to; mention 谈到；提到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was unwise in your speech to refer to rising unemployment. 你在讲话中谈到失业率上升的情况，这是不明智的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The veteran fighter referred to his experiences during the Long March. 那位战士提到他在长征中的经历。</font>\n<br>2. look at sth. for information 查阅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't know what it means, refer to the dictionary. 如果你不知道它的意思，可以查字典。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In drawing up the plan, they went to the library to refer to many books. 在制订计划时，他们到图书馆查阅了许多书籍。</font>\n<br>3. concern; relate or apply to 涉及；关于；有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new law does not refer to the land used for farming. 这项新法律不涉及农业用地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have examined all the documents referring to the matter. 我翻阅了所有关于此事的文件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What I have to say refers to all of you. 我要讲的话与你们大家都有关。</font>\n<br>4. send to sb. for decision or action 提交…处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop referred the complaint to the maker of the article. 那家商店将投诉意见转给了制造商。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We referred the matter to the Finance Committee. 我们把这事提交财务委员会处理。</font>\n
refer to…as	<font color=blue size=4>refer to…as</font>\n<br>speak of…as 将…称作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smoking is usually referred to as a bad habit. 抽烟通常被认为是坏习惯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I heard them refer to her as“Big Sister”. 我听见他们称她为“大姐”。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since gases and liquids are capable of flowing, they are commonly referred to as fluids. 气体和液体都能流动，所以统称为流体。</font>\n
refine (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>refine (up) on</font>\n<br>1. make better; improve 改进；改造\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can refine on our plan if we consider the problem carefully. 如果我们仔细考虑一下这个问题，我们是能把计划改进一下的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was asked to refine on her first outline to make it clearer and more exact. 他被要求对她的最初提纲进行修改，使之更清楚更确切。</font>\n<br>2. be better than; surpass 胜过；比…更好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Modern farming techniques refine on those of the past. 现代农业技术比过去强。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall have to refine on our methods of advertising if we are to reach a wider public. 我们如果想要造成更广泛的影响，就必须更加完善我们做广告的方法。</font>\n
reflect (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>reflect (up) on</font>\n<br>1. consider carefully 认真考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I reflected on all he had said to me. 我仔细考虑了他对我说的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As you get older you begin to reflect on the uncertainty of life. 随着年龄的增长，你会开始意识到生活是不稳定的。</font>\n<br>2. bring sth. into disfavor or question 带来不利影响或造成问题；使…名誉不好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lie that you told reflects on your honesty. 你的谎言有损于你的诚实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His arrogance only reflects on himsdlf. 他的傲慢无礼只能使自己丢脸。</font>\n<br>3. discredit or doubt; blame 怀疑；不信任；责备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't wish to reflect upon your sincerity. 我并不愿意怀疑你的诚实。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man made recommendations which reflected on their efficiency. 那个人提出了一些建议，指责了他们的工作效率。</font>\n
refrain from	<font color=blue size=4>refrain from</font>\n<br>1. hold oneself back from; keep oneself from 克制使自己不做；自制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must refrain from spitting in the street. 你不能在街上随地吐痰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Plesse refrain from smoking. 请勿吸烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I pur posely refrain from arguing with him. 我有意克制自己不和他争辩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I refrained from further words. 我忍住没有再说下去。</font>\n<br>2. prevent from 阻止；防止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fortunately he was refrained from wrongaoing. 很幸运，他被阻止没有做出蠢事来。</font>\n
regain one's feet	<font color=blue size=4>regain one's feet</font>\n<br>get back up again after falling down 跌倒后重新站起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy fell while he skied down the hill but he regained his feet quickly. 这男孩滑雪下坡时摔倒了，但他很快又爬了起来。</font>\n
regardless of	<font color=blue size=4>regardless of</font>\n<br>paying no attention to 不考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Regardless of the danger, he climbed the tower. 他不顾危险，爬上了那座塔。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He insisted on trying, utterly regardless of the possible grave consequences. 他全然不顾可能产生的后果，执意要试一试。</font>\n
regard…as	<font color=blue size=4>regard…as</font>\n<br>consider sb. or sth. to be 认为…是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I regard him as my brother. 我把他当作自己的兄弟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is regarded as impossible. 这事被认为不可能。</font>\n
relate to	<font color=blue size=4>relate to</font>\n<br>1. tell sth. to sb. 向…讲述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children enjoyed relating their imaginary adventures to the visitors. 孩子们喜欢向来客讲述他们幻想中的冒险故事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He related to his students his adventures vividly. 他向学生们生动地叙述了他的奇遇。</font>\n<br>2. understand and like sth. 理解并且喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't relate to loud modern music. 我不喜欢喧闹的现代音乐。</font>\n<br>3. have a friendly and sympathetic relationship with sb. 与…有友好和谐的关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This boss is best at relating to his employees. 这位老板很善于和他的雇员们相处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A good teacher is one who can relate to the students, not just one who has a lot of information. 一个好老师应该能够与学生和谐相处，而不仅仅是个知识的拥有者。</font>\n<br>4. be concerned with; be in relationship with 关于；涉及；与…有关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sent me a letter relating to his son's marriage. 他给我来信讲了关于他儿子的婚事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is only concerned with things relating to herself. 她只关心与她自己有关的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The unemployment figures are not necessarily related to the rise in prices. 失业数字不一定与物价上涨有关。</font>\n<br>5. connect by family 与某人有亲戚关系\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are you related to her? 你和她是什么亲戚关系？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim is related to Jack; Jack is his uncle. 吉姆和杰克是亲戚，杰克是吉姆的叔叔。</font>\n
relieve of	<font color=blue size=4>relieve of</font>\n<br>1. take from sb.;free sb. from 替…拿；使某人免于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me relieve you of that heavy parcel. 让我替你提那个重包。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better relieve Mary of some of the housework. 你最好减轻一点玛丽的家务活。</font>\n<br>2. dismiss from (a position) 解除（某人职务）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The captain was relieved of his post when his guilt was proved. 证明有罪之后，船长被解除了职务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was relieved of her post at her own request. 她要求辞职并被批准了。</font>\n<br>3. rob sb. of sth. 抢劫（某人的东西）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A thief relieved me of￡5. 小偷偷了我5英镑钱。</font>\n
rely (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>rely (up) on</font>\n<br>1. trust 信任；相信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may rely on me. 你可以信任我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I rely upon your words absolutely. 我绝对相信你的话。</font>\n<br>2. depend on 依赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't always rely on others'help. 你不能总是依赖别人的帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't rely on chance; rely on yourself. 不要靠机会，要靠你自己的努力。</font>\n
remind of	<font color=blue size=4>remind of</font>\n<br>make sb. remember 使…想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This hotel reminds me of the one we stayed in last year. 这家旅馆使我想起了去年我们住过的那家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rather reminds me of his brother. 见了他就使我想起了他的哥哥。</font>\n
resort to	<font color=blue size=4>resort to</font>\n<br>turn to (sth. , often bad) for help; employ 求助于（某物，常指不好的）；诉诸于；用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When his wife left him, he resorted to drinking. 他妻子离开他之后，他就开始酗酒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never resort to mean tricks to serve your end. 千万不可用欺诈的手段来达到你的目的。</font>\n
respond to	<font color=blue size=4>respond to</font>\n<br>1. answer or react to 回答或反应\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would anyone care to respond to the last question? 谁愿意回答最后一个问题？</font>\n<br>2. get better as a result of (medicine) （药物）有效；因（药物）起作用而变好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The disease failed to respond to drugs. 药对这病无效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most patients respond to this treatment. 这种治疗对大部分病人有效。</font>\n
responsible to/for	<font color=blue size=4>responsible to/for</font>\n<br>legally or morally liable for carrying out a duty 有责任的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who is responsible for the project? 谁负责这项工程？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pilot of an airliner is responsible for the safety of the passengers. 飞行员对乘客的安全负有责任。</font>\n
rest assured	<font color=blue size=4>rest assured</font>\n<br>do not doubt; be certain 毋需置疑；放心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rest assured, Mr. Wang will do his best to make your visit pleasant. 请放心，王先生会尽力使你们的访问愉快的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may rest assured that everything possible will be done. 你放心好了，凡能做到的，一定去做。</font>\n
restrain…from	<font color=blue size=4>restrain…from</font>\n<br>hold back; keep under control; prevent from doing sth. 克制；抑制；阻止于某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog was restrained from attacking the man. 那狗被挡住，不让它咬人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had difficulty in restraining the children from rushing into the hall. 我们很难不让孩子们冲进礼堂来。</font>\n
restrict to	<font color=blue size=4>restrict to</font>\n<br>limit; keep within certain limits 限制；约束；使在限度内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our club membership is restricted to twenty. 我们俱乐部的成员限制在20人以内。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Discussion at the meeting was restricted to the agenda. 这次会议的讨论只限于议程上的内容。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are restricted to a speed of 30miles an hour in builtup areas. 建筑物林立地区，我们的车速限制为每小时30英里。</font>\n
rest up	<font color=blue size=4>rest up</font>\n<br>have a complete rest 充分休息；彻底休息；歇足\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the exam, I'm going to rest up for a few weeks. 考试结束后，我要好好休息几个星期。</font>\n
rest (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>rest (up) on</font>\n<br>1. lean on; be supported by 依靠；支撑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bridge rests upon stone arches. 石拱支撑着桥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The roof rests on eight columns. 这屋顶时8根圆柱支撑着。</font>\n<br>2. (of eyes) stay on; fix at（眼睛）凝视；注视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His eyes rested on the peaceful valley below. 他注视着下面宁静的山谷。</font>\n<br>3. depend on; rely on; be based or founded on 依据；相信；以…为基础\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His decision to sail west rested on his belief that the world was round. 他决定向西航行，因为他相信地球是圆的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I rest on your promise. 我相信你的诺言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our hope rests on you. 我们的希望寄托在你们身上。</font>\n
rest with	<font color=blue size=4>rest with</font>\n<br>lie with; be the responsibility of 取决于…；由…负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fate of these prisoners rests with the judge. 这些囚犯的命运掌握在法官手中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It rests with you to decide. 这要看你决定了。</font>\n
result from	<font color=blue size=4>result from</font>\n<br>be the effect of sth. 由…引起；由…产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Success results from hard work. 成功来自于努力工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Any damage resulting from negligence must be paid by the borrower. 因疏忽引起的任何损坏须由借方负责赔偿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His illness resulted from bad food. 他的病是由于吃了变质的食物引起的。</font>\n
result in	<font color=blue size=4>result in</font>\n<br>cause; lead to; bring about the result that 导致；造成…成果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The accident resulted in the death of two passengers. 这场事故造成两名乘客死亡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Compulsion will never result in convincing them. 压制决不可能使他们信服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His carelessness results in a serious blunder. 他的粗枝大叶致使他犯了一个严重错误。</font>\n
return the compliment	<font color=blue size=4>return the compliment</font>\n<br>1. say or do the same to sb. that he has said or done to one 回敬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary said：“I love your new hairdo. ” and Julie returned the compliment with“what a pretty dress you're wearing, Mary. ”玛丽说：“我喜欢你的新发型。”朱丽回答说：“玛丽，你穿的衣服好漂亮啊。”</font>\n<br>2. Pay sb. back 回报；报复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry hit Jerry on the head, and Jerry returned the compliment. 亨利打了杰里头上一拳，杰里也对亨利报以一拳。</font>\n<br>revenge oneself (up) on… (for) get even with…for 为…而向…报仇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hamlet revenged himself on his uncle, for his father's death. 哈姆雷特向叔父报了杀父之仇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is sure to revenge himself on anyone who dares to bully or insult him. 对胆敢欺负和侮辱他的人，他是一定要报复的。</font>\n
rich in	<font color=blue size=4>rich in</font>\n<br>full of 充满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city is rich in ancient buildings. 这个城市里有很多古建筑。</font>\n
right away	<font color=blue size=4>right away</font>\n<br>without delay; at once 毫不迟疑；马上；立即\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry I forgot to bring your medicine down; I'll go upstairs and get it right away. 很抱歉我忘记把药给你拿下来了，我马上上楼给你拿来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She says that dinner will be ready right away. 她说晚饭马上就准备好了。</font>\n
right now	<font color=blue size=4>right now</font>\n<br>immediately 即刻；马上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please stop right now . 请立即停下来。</font>\n
ring down	<font color=blue size=4>ring down</font>\n<br>1. give signal for lowering (the curtain) 鸣铃闭幕；落幕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the curtain was rung down on the first performance, the audience broke into enthusiastic applause. 当第一个节目演完，鸣铃落幕时，观众报以热烈的掌声。</font>\n<br>2 . bring about a conclusion 告终；完毕；竣工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to hear that they have decided to ring down the curtain on their marriage. 听说他们要离婚，我感到很遗憾。</font>\n
