ring in	<font color=blue size=4>ring in</font>\n<br>1. bring in sb. or sth. from the outside dishonestly or without telling; often hire and introduce under a false name 以不正当的手段引进；雇用或介绍冒名顶替的人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No wonder their team beat us; they rang in a professional to pitch for them under the name of Dan Smith. 难怪他们队打败了我们，他们雇用了一个冒名丹•史密斯的职业投手替他们投球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They will surely try to ring in an unqualified delegate. 他们肯定想塞进一名不合格的代表进来。</font>\n<br>2. come or participate without being invited 不请自来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nobody invited him, but he works in our office and somehow managed to ring in on our party. 他在我们办公室工作，但谁也没有邀请他，不知怎么的来参加我们的晚会了。</font>\n<br>3. ring a special clock that records the time one begins to work 揿考勤钟记录上班的时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to ring in at the shop before eight o'clock in the morning. 我们必须在早上 8点前揿考勤钟记下自己到店里的上班时间。</font>\n<br>4. usher in by ringing 鸣钟迎来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Scots like to ring in the New Year. 苏格兰人喜欢鸣钟迎新年。</font>\n<br>ring off end a telephone conversation 挂断电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd better ring off now—the baby is crying. 我现在得挂电话了，孩子在哭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll have to ring off now but I'll ring you back tomorrow. 我要挂电话了，我明天再给你去电话。</font>\n
ring out	<font color=blue size=4>ring out</font>\n<br>1. ring a special clock that records the time you leave work 揿考勤钟记录下班的时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Charles can't leave early in his new job; he has to ring out. 查尔斯在新的工作岗位上不能早退，因为他要揿考勤钟记录他下班的时间。</font>\n<br>2. usher or lead out by ringing 鸣钟送出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Firecrackers rang the Old Year out and the New Year in. 爆竹声送走了旧岁，迎来了新年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ring out the old, ring in the new！送旧迎新！</font>\n<br>3. sound out loud and clear 发出响亮、清晰的响声\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Cheers rang out from the assembly hall. 大礼堂里响起了欢呼声。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His voice rings out across the whole school. 他的声音响彻整个学校。</font>\n
ring up	<font color=blue size=4>ring up</font>\n<br>1. call up 打电话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you rung up your mother recently? 你最近给母亲打电话了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We rang up Henry but got no reply. 我们给亨利去过电话，但没人接。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rang me up immediately after his, arrival. 他到达后立刻给我来了电话。</font>\n<br>2. add and record on a cash register 用收款机结算\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The supermarket clerk rang up Mrs. Smith's purchases and told her she owed＄33. 超级市场的职员在收款机上结算了史密斯太太购买的东西，告诉她需付33美元。</font>\n<br>3. give signal for raising (the curtain) 鸣铃启幕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We rang up the curtain on a new show. 我们启幕演出了一个新节目。</font>\n
rip off	<font color=blue size=4>rip off</font>\n<br>1. steal; rob 偷窃；抢劫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was caught ripping off books from the library. 那个家伙在图书馆偷书时被抓住了。</font>\n<br>2. tear off with an effort 用力撕掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ripped the paper off. 他用力把纸撕掉。</font>\n<br>3. defraud; exploit 诈骗；敲诈；剥削\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't shop at that small store any more; they're known for ripping off the customers whenever they get a chance. 我再也不在那家小店买东西了，他们一有机会就敲诈顾客已经出了名了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are really ripped off by the baker who gave us zero nutritional value for our money. 我们确实上了那家面包商的当，他用毫无营养价值的东西来骗我们的钱。</font>\n
rip out	<font color=blue size=4>rip out</font>\n<br>1. utter angrily, as with an oath or exclamation 愤然说出；诅咒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a hot temper and is likely to rip out with unseemly language; you would do well not to say anything at all. 他脾气急躁，很可能破口说出不体面的话，你最好什么都不说。</font>\n<br>2 . tear out with an effort 撕碎；拆除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ripped out the pockets of the coat. 他撕掉了上衣的口袋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminals have ripped the telephone wires out, so we can't call the police. 罪犯把电话线拉断了，因此，我们无法给警察打电话。</font>\n
rip up	<font color=blue size=4>rip up</font>\n<br>1. bring to recollection; recall 回忆；追想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ripped up all he had done in the past. 他回忆自己过去所做的一切。</font>\n<br>2. tear up with an effort; vigorously renounce or tear up (a treaty, etc.) 撕毁（条约等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ripped up the documents. 他把文件撕碎了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whoever rips up the agreement will be condemned. 不管谁撕毁协议都要受到谴责。</font>\n<br>rise in sb. 's opinion improve or go up in sb. 's estimation 获得某人的重视或好评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has risen in my opinion. 我对她的评价有所提高。</font>\n
rise in the world	<font color=blue size=4>rise in the world</font>\n<br>prosper; attain wealth or honor 发迹；功成名就；飞黄腾达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's honest and diligent; I 'm sure he'll rise in the world. 他诚实勤奋，我相信他会有出息的。</font>\n
rise to the occasion	<font color=blue size=4>rise to the occasion</font>\n<br>prove to be adequate for the purpose or situation 证明能做某事或应付某局面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the invited speaker did not arrive, the chairman rose to the cocasion and gave an excellent unprepared speech. 当被邀请的演讲者没有到时，主席随机应变，作了一个非常出色的即席演讲。</font>\n
rob…of	<font color=blue size=4>rob…of</font>\n<br>1. take sth. from sb. unlawfully 抢劫（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They knocked him down and robbed him of his watch. 他们把他打倒在地，然后抢走了他的手表。</font>\n<br>2. deprive sb. of 剥夺；使…丧失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They robbed the people of all liberty of thought. 他们剥夺了人民的一切思想自由。</font>\n<br>roll about (a spectator, a listener, etc.) enjoy oneself or laugh hilariously（观者、听者等）欢笑；笑得前俯后仰；捧腹大笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience were rolling about in their seats as the clown roped around on the stage. 小丑在台上蹦来跳去，逗得观众在座位上捧腹大笑。</font>\n
roll back	<font color=blue size=4>roll back</font>\n<br>1. reduce (the price of a commodity) to a former level 使（物价等）全面回落；降到原有水平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Drastic measures have been taken to roll back commodity prices. 已采取有力措施全面回落物价。</font>\n<br>2. repel; cause to fall back 击退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were confident that we could roll back the enemy forces that barred our way. 我们深信能击退堵击我们的敌军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new administration is confident of rolling back the tide of unrest which is sweeping the country. 新政府自信能击退这股席卷全国的动乱浪潮。</font>\n<br>3. (a time in the past) return steadily to sb 's consciousness 回到某人记忆中；渐渐回忆起过去某一段时间的事情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the grandmother spoke, the years rolled back and she saw herself as a small girl again. 当祖母讲话时，过去的岁月逐渐回到记忆中来，她仿佛看到自己又是一个小孩子了。</font>\n
roll in	<font color=blue size=4>roll in</font>\n<br>1. come in great volume or quantity 滚滚而来；大量涌进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Good news keeps rolling in from our scientific and technological fronts. 我国科技战线上捷报频传。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Offers of help are rolling in. 大量的援助滚滚而来。</font>\n<br>2. luxuriate in; abound in; have a good deal of (money, etc.) 沉溺于；富于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's rolling in money, since he's inherited his rich father 's fortune. 由于继承了富有的父亲的遗产，他成了腰缠万贯的富翁。</font>\n<br>3. go to bed 就寝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old professor rolled in late every night. 这位老教授每天很晚才睡觉。</font>\n<br>roll off print, duplicate by passing paper etc. through the rollers of a machine 通过（机器）印出；复制出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can quickly roll off a few copies of the exercise on the duplicating machine. 你可以在复印机上很快地把这个练习复印几份。</font>\n
roll out	<font color=blue size=4>roll out</font>\n<br>1. make flat and smooth by pressing with a roller, or rollingpin 碾平；擀平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She rolled out the dough in order to make a few pies. 她把面团压平做了几个馅饼。</font>\n<br>2. come forth copiously; make a deep and sonorous sound 滔滔不绝地说出；洪亮地讲出或唱出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The actor rolled out his words so that everyone in the theatre could hear. 那位演员声音洪亮地朗诵台词，以使剧场里的每一个人都能听到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She rolled out these verses emotionally. 她充满激情地朗诵这些诗句。</font>\n
roll out the red carpet	<font color=blue size=4>roll out the red carpet</font>\n<br>1. welcome with ceremony 正式欢迎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They rolled out the red carpet for the visiting president and his party. 他们隆重欢迎前来访问的总统一行。</font>\n<br>2. greet with great respect and honor;give a hearty welcome 热烈接待；恭敬地迎接\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jerry 's family rolled out the red carpet for his teacher when he called. 杰里的老师来家访时，全家人都热情地欢迎他。</font>\n
roll up	<font color=blue size=4>roll up</font>\n<br>1. wrap up 包起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rolled himself up in a blanket. 他用毯子把自己裹了起来。</font>\n<br>2. accumulate; collect; increase 积累；增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thrift and diligence make him roll up a fortune. 勤俭使他积累了很大一笔钱财。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His debts rolled up as he couldn 't pay them in time. 他无力及时还清债务，因此债台越垒越高。</font>\n<br>3. arrive, appear on the scene;come up in large numbers;arrive in a vehicle 到场；出现；涌来；乘车到达\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole family rolled up to their daughter 's first appearance on the stage. 全家人都到场观看他们的女儿初次登台演出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The visitors rolled up to the hotel at eight sharp. 参观者 8点整到达旅馆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just when we had given up all hope of their coming, they rolled up in a taxi. 正当我们放弃了希望，以为他们不会来时，他们却乘坐出租车到了。</font>\n<br>4. make into or form a roll 卷起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rolled up his sleeves and set to work at once. 他卷起袖子，立即开始工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rolled up his umbrella. 他收起了伞。</font>\n<br>root about/around search about 到处搜查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rooted around for his notebook. 他到处寻找他的笔记本。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has been rooting about for her lost daughter. 她一直在寻找她失踪的女儿。</font>\n
root out	<font color=blue size=4>root out</font>\n<br>1. remove by the roots 连根拔除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We rooted out the weeds in our garden. 我们清除园子里的草。</font>\n<br>2. destroy completely 肃清；灭绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must root out this evil. 我们要根除这种弊病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It is necessary to root out corruption in government. 有必要根除政府的腐败行为。</font>\n<br>3. discover and bring to light 翻出；找出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Julie rooted out some reference books from the library. 朱丽从图书馆里找了一些参考书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you root out some good players for the team? 你能为队里物色几个优秀选手吗？</font>\n
rope in/into	<font color=blue size=4>rope in/into</font>\n<br>1. use a trick to make sb. do sth.;deceive; fool 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The swindler had roped in a number of gullible persons. 这骗子已经骗了许多轻信的人。</font>\n<br>2. get sb. to join or help; persuade to do sth. 使（某人）参加；劝（某人）做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't want the job of selling tickets for the dance, but I was roped in because everyone else was too busy to do it. 我不想做卖舞会门票的事，可是我被拉来了，因为别人都太忙了。</font>\n<br>rough in/out get out sth. in a rough form 草拟；画出…轮廓\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've roughed out the direction that we should take. 我粗略地画出了我们应该走的方向。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The architect roughed in some trees and flowers to give some idea ofhow the area would look when the building was finished. 建筑师在草图上画了些花草树木，让人们了解该地区建设好以后将是个什么样子。</font>\n
rough it	<font color=blue size=4>rough it</font>\n<br>1. live like primitive people;live with little comfort and equipment 过原始生活；过野外生活\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're going to rough it on this trip. We bought a tent, and we're going to cook all our meals over a campfire. 这次旅行我们要过艰苦的生活。我们买了一顶帐篷，打算每餐饭都用营火做。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For almost half a year, these geologists lived in the mountains, roughing it in their tents. 这几位地质学家在山里住了几乎有半年，他们以帐篷为家，过着艰苦的生活。</font>\n
rough up	<font color=blue size=4>rough up</font>\n<br>1. attack or hurt physically;treat roughly; beat 粗暴地对待；殴打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gang decided to rough him up, as a warning to others. 暴徒们决定揍他一顿，以此来警告他人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While Jerry was walking in a strange part of town, some boys roughed him up and told him tostay out of their territory. 当杰里在城里一个陌生的地区行走时，有几个男孩子把他打了一顿，并且叫他不要进入他们的地盘。</font>\n<br>2. make rough 弄乱；使毛糙\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He roughed up her hair. 他把她的头发弄乱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you rough up the surface a bit, the paint will stick better. 你如果把表面弄粗糙一些，漆会粘得更牢。</font>\n
round about	<font color=blue size=4>round about</font>\n<br>1. along the circumference of; all around 在（…的）四周\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lives somewhere round about. 他就住在这附近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The white building contrasts pleasantly with the green pines round about. 那幢洁白的楼房同四周葱翠的松树相互辉映，赏心悦目。</font>\n<br>2. backward; in the opposite direction 向相反方向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They turned round about and left. 他们转身朝相反的方向走了。</font>\n<br>3. at approximately about 大约\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please come round about 2 o'clock in the afternoon. 请于下午 2点左右来。</font>\n<br>4. indirectly; in a circuitous manner 间接的；委婉的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came round about and slowly to 526these conclusions. 他委婉地而且慢慢地得出了这些结论。</font>\n
round off	<font color=blue size=4>round off</font>\n<br>1. shape as an edge in a round form 把…弄成圆形；弄光滑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Round off the corners of the table please. 请把桌子的角刨成圆形。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take a piece of sand paper and round off the edges of the frame. 拿一张砂纸把这个框架的边擦光滑。</font>\n<br>2. finfish off well; bring to completion, esp. in a fit manner 圆满结束；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We rounded off the party by singing popular songs. 我们唱着流行歌曲结束了晚会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thry have rounded off their work and will write a detailed report. 他们圆满结束了工作并将写出详细的汇报。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their day's outing was rounded off with a visit to the theatre. 他们到一家戏院看了一场戏，从而圆满结束了这一天的外出游玩。</font>\n
round out	<font color=blue size=4>round out</font>\n<br>1. complete or perfect; finish very fully 完成；使圆满；完全结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rounded out his education by spending a year in Paris. 他在巴黎住了一年，完成了学业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He needs only one or two more stamps to round out his collection of postwar Chinese stamps. 他还需要一两张邮票即可将战后中国的邮票集全了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They intend to round out their work be fore presenting their final analysis. 他们打算在全部工作完成之后再提出最终分析。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scheme was rounded out with suggestions from the veteran technicians. 由于采纳了经验丰富的技术员的建议，这个计划就更完善了。</font>\n<br>2. fill out; become rounder 使饱满；使变圆；使胖起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was very thin a fter her illness, but is rounding out nicely now. 她病后很瘦，可是现在胖起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As she grew older, she rounded out in the right place. 随着年龄的增长，她的身材变得丰满匀称起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wind rounded out the sails as the little boat rushed along. 小船疾驰而行，风把帆吹得鼓鼓的。</font>\n
round up	<font color=blue size=4>round up</font>\n<br>1. gather together 聚集\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmer rounded up the cows for milking. 那农夫把奶牛赶拢来挤奶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please round up the rest of the class; it's time to go back to the school. 请把班上其他人集合起来，该回学校了。</font>\n<br>2. capture (criminals) 抓住（罪犯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police finally rounded up the criminal. 警察终于抓住了那名罪犯。</font>\n
round (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>round (up) on</font>\n<br>1. turn on/against sb. in anger;attack suddenly either verbally or physically 对某人发怒；突然用语言或行动攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Listen patiently to what I've got to say first. Don't round on me just because I don't agree with you. 不要因为我不同意你就发火，先耐心听完我的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rounded on her fiercely. 他突然气势汹汹地向她扑去。</font>\n<br>2. inform against; betray 出卖；告密\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was not so bad as to round on his comradesinarms. 他不是坏得会出卖自己战友的那种人。</font>\n
rub along	<font color=blue size=4>rub along</font>\n<br>1. (of a person) manage to exist; pass one's time with too much difficulty; live day to day in a more or less satisfactory but unexciting manner（指人）无太大困难地过活；马马虎虎度日；平平淡淡过日子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the money my mother earned we just managed to rub along. 靠妈妈挣来的钱，我们马马虎虎地凑合着过日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not a good student; he can only just rub along in class. 他学习并不好，在班上只是勉强过得去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“How are you getting on nowadays? ”“Oh, just rubbing along. ”“你近来好吗？”“哦，马马虎虎过得去。”</font>\n<br>2. (of two or more persons) live without quarrelling, etc. 和谐相处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We manage to rub along together. 我们相处得还算不错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Except for the first two months they rubbed along quite happily. 除了头两个月以外，他们相处得颇为融洽。</font>\n
rub down	<font color=blue size=4>rub down</font>\n<br>1. clean and dry the body (of an animal or person) by rubbing 擦干\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The athletes rubbed themselves down with coarse towels. 运动员们用粗毛巾擦身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She rubbed the horse down. 她把马梳洗干净。</font>\n<br>2. rub and press with the fingers on the body (of a person) to loosen muscles or prevent stiffness; massage 按摩（人体）使肌肉放松\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The athletes were rubbed down after the training. 训练结束后，运动员们都要按摩一下，以放松肌肉。</font>\n<br>3. reduce by friction or abrasion;take off roughness 磨光；磨平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rubbed the chair down with sandpaper. 他用砂纸把椅子磨光。</font>\n<br>4. search sb. by passing the hand all over the body and limbs 遍身搜查（某人）；对（某人）搜身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman rubbed down the suspicious stranger, who turned out to be a spy. 警察搜查了那个陌生人的全身，原来他是个间谍。</font>\n
rub it in	<font color=blue size=4>rub it in</font>\n<br>keep talking about sth. that another person wants to forget 反复讲别人不愿听的事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“I am really surprised that you failed exams. ”“OK, don't rub it in！”“我没想到你会考试不及格。”“好啦，别再提啦！”</font>\n
rub off	<font color=blue size=4>rub off</font>\n<br>1. remove with a rubber; erase 擦掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rubbed off the finger mark from the painting. 他擦去了画上的指印。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rubbed off what he had written and started again. 他把他所写的擦掉后又开始重写。</font>\n<br>2. appear or cause to appear less bright, remarkable or praiseworthy （使）减色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the passing of time some of the glitter of the champion's success has rubbed off. 随着时间的推移，这位冠军的成绩已不那么惊人了。</font>\n<br>3. stick to sth. touched（接触时）粘住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His dress touched the door that the worker was painting, and some paint rubbed off on it. 他的衣服碰到了工人正在油漆的那扇门，沾上了油漆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't touch that charcoal; it will rub off. 不要碰那煤炭，会弄脏你的手。</font>\n<br>4. pass to sb. near as if by touching 传给别人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all hoped he would stay with us longer so that some of his good qualities might rub off on us. 我们都希望他能和我们在一起多呆些日子，这样我们可以从他身上学到一些优秀质量。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Li is very lucky; I wish some of his luck would rub off on me. 李先生运气真好，我希望他的运气能传些给我。</font>\n
rub out	<font color=blue size=4>rub out</font>\n<br>1. destroy completely; kill; eliminate 毁灭；杀死；消除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gangsters rubbed out four policemen before they were caught. 匪徒们在被捕前打死了4名警察。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city was rubbed out in the earthquake. 这座城市在地震中毁灭了。</font>\n<br>2. erase ; obliterate 擦去；把…磨掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ink won't rub out. 这种墨水擦不掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rubbed out his name and wrote his father's name in its place. 他擦去他自己的名字，写上了他父亲的名字。</font>\n<br>rub shoulders/elbows be in the same place (with others); meet and mix 互相接触；在一起；与他人往来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We don't rub shoulders with such arrogant people. 我们不和这种狂妄自大的人来往。</font>\n
rub up	<font color=blue size=4>rub up</font>\n<br>1. polish by rubbing 擦光；把…磨光滑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you have put the polish on the silver, rub it up with a clean dry cloth. 在银器上打上擦光剂后，要用块干净的干布把它擦亮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rubbed the vase up until it shone. 他把花瓶擦得铮亮。</font>\n<br>2. excite; rouse to action; revive or refresh one's knowledge of 激起；唤起；复习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your French needs rubbing up. 你的法语需要复习一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I cannot find a recipe which I cut from the paper;I must rub up my memory and recall where I laid it. 我从报上剪下来的一张配方找不到了，我得好好想想放在哪里了。</font>\n
rub up against	<font color=blue size=4>rub up against</font>\n<br>1. rub against sth. in passing 擦上；相磨擦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Look at the spot on your skirt！You must have rubbed up against wet paint somewhere 看看你裙子上的脏斑！你一定是在什么地方碰上没干的油漆了。</font>\n<br>2. meet or come into contact with by accident 偶然相遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You occasionally rub up against most interesting people in unlikely Places. 有时在意想不到的地方会遇上很有趣的人。</font>\n
rule out	<font color=blue size=4>rule out</font>\n<br>1. declare the impossibility of; exclude 排除；表示不可能；不把…考虑在内\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can not rule out the possibility that he'll come after all. 我们不排除他最终会来的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone who has entered for the same competition before is ruled out according to the regulations. 凡以前参加过同样比赛的人，按照规则均不得参加。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor took Xrays to rule out the chance of broken bones. 医生拍了X 光片，以排除骨折的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That idea can be completely ruled out. 那种想法可以完全排除。</font>\n<br>2. not allow;decide against; prevent 不允许；反对；阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The principal ruled out dances on week days. 校长不允许在周末以外的时间跳舞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A sudden storm ruled out the boat race. 突然来的暴风雨使划船比赛无法进行了。</font>\n
run across	<font color=blue size=4>run across</font>\n<br>1. find or meet by chance 偶然发现；偶遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I ran across the article in yesterday's newspaper. 我在昨天的报纸上偶然发现了这篇文章。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran across an excellent book on the subject in the library. 他在图书馆偶然找到了有关这个题目的一本极好的书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I ran across my old classmate in the street yesterday. 昨天我在街上偶然碰到了我的老同学。</font>\n<br>2. convey across 让…乘车穿过；运送…到对面去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran us across to the other side of the bay in his private launch. 他用私人汽艇送我们到海湾彼岸。</font>\n<br>3. cross (by running) （跑着）穿过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Burning with curiosity, she ran across the fields after the dog. 她充满了好奇心，跟在那条狗后面奔过田野。</font>\n
run after	<font color=blue size=4>run after</font>\n<br>1. chase 追赶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog ran after a cat. 那只狗追赶着一只猫。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bother running after the bus; you'll never catch it. 别费劲去追赶那辆公共汽车了，你怎么也赶不上的。</font>\n<br>2. try to gain attention and company of (an opposite sex) 追求（异性）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's always running after women. 他总是追求女性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been running after her for months, but she isn't interested in him at all. 他追求她好几个月了，可她对他根本不感兴趣。</font>\n<br>3. serve; care for 服务；关照\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't expect me to run after you all your life！别指望我会伺候你一辈子！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She often runs after my child. 她常照料我的孩子。</font>\n
run against	<font color=blue size=4>run against</font>\n<br>1. hit with a quick movement 猛撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse hurt its knee by running against the fence. 马撞在围栏上，伤了膝盖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Driving in a hurry he ran his car against a tree. 由于开得太急，他把汽车撞到一棵树上去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While walking along the sidewalk, he was so absorbed in thought that he ran against a passerby. 他走在人行道上时，全神贯注地想心事，以致和一个过路人撞了个满怀。</font>\n<br>2. meet accidentally 偶遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I ran against an old friend in the street. 我在街上偶遇一位老友。</font>\n<br>3. be unfavorable to; disfavor 对…不利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time is now running against us in this affair. 在这件事上时间于我们不利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fortune seems to run against me. 命运似乎与我作对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She never does anything that would run against the interests of the collective. 她从不会做任何损害集体利益的事情。</font>\n<br>4. compete with by running in a race;compete with for an elected office 与…赛跑；与…竞选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is prepared to run against the world's best runners. 她准备同世界上最优秀的赛跑选手比赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Roosevelt ran against Hoover in 1932. 1932年罗斯福同胡佛竞选美国总统。</font>\n
run along	<font color=blue size=4>run along</font>\n<br>1. go away; be off; depart 走开；离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Run along now, children！I'm busy. 孩子们，走开。我正忙着呢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She said she had something urgent to do and must run along. 她说她有急事要办，得走了。</font>\n<br>2. convey along (usu. in a car) 运送（常指用汽车）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll run you along to the station in a few minutes. 我立即用车送你去车站。</font>\n
run around	<font color=blue size=4>run around</font>\n<br>1. be unfaithful to one's wife or husband; seek amusement or companionship restlessly or incessantly 在外寻欢；有外遇；鬼混作乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When is he going to stop running around and settle for one girl? 他什么时候才不到处和女人鬼混，而倾心于一个姑娘呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She suspected her husband of running around. 她怀疑她丈夫有外遇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was sorry that he had wasted his youth running a around. 他很后悔浪费了青春年华。</font>\n
run away/off	<font color=blue size=4>run away/off</font>\n<br>1. leave and not plan to come back; go without permission 远走高飞；擅自离开；逃跑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She ran away and left her family. 她弃家出走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guards in jail make sure that none of the prisoners run away. 监狱守卫确保没有一个犯人逃跑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran away from school. 他逃学了。</font>\n<br>2. go away (not necessarily by running) 离去；走掉（不一定是逃跑）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't run away; I've something to say to you. 别走，我有话要跟你讲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bother me while I'm studying;run away and play. 我学习时不要打搅我，到一边玩去吧。</font>\n
run away with	<font color=blue size=4>run away with</font>\n<br>1. get (sb.) out of control 使（某人）失去控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he saw his dead son, his grief ran away with him and he shot himself. 他看到儿子死了，悲痛至极开枪自杀了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let your enthusiasm run away with you . 不要让你的热情使你失去了控制。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must not let your feeling runaway with you. 你不要感情用事。</font>\n<br>2. take away (sb. of opposite sex); elope with 与（异性）私奔\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran away with his master's wife. 他与主人的妻子私奔了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was a romantic girl, and gave the impression that she would be quite willing to run away with any young man that flattered her. 她是一个浪漫的姑娘，并且给人以这种印象：只要有什么年轻男人去奉承她，她就愿意和他私奔。</font>\n<br>3. steal and carry off 携…潜逃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has run away with all my jewels. 他携带我所有的珠宝潜逃了。</font>\n<br>4. believe easily; accept hastily without consideration 轻易相信；匆匆接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't run away with the idea that you needn't work. 不要轻易认为你无须工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran away with the impression that it was out of the question. 他未好好考虑就认为那是办不到的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't run away with the idea that you can always do this kind of thing with impunity. 不要轻易认为你总能老干这类事情而不受惩罚。</font>\n<br>5. consume;cost 消耗；花费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His new car just runs away with petrol. 他的新车耗油量很大。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Not only is smoking bad for your health; it also runs away with your money. 吸烟不仅损害你的健康，而且费钱。</font>\n<br>6. do far better than others in;get (a prize, honor, etc.) by surpassing others; win easily ( a prize, etc.) 在…方面做得远比别人好；胜过其他人而获得（奖品等）；轻而易举地获得（奖品等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He surprised others by running away with academic honors. 他在学术方面所获得的荣誉使别人为之吃惊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl from Shanghai ran away with the first set in the tennis tournament. 那位上海姑娘在网球赛的第1轮比赛中获胜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She easily ran away with the women's title in the singles at the tabletennis tournament. 在乒乓球锦标赛中，她轻而易举地夺得了女子单打冠军。</font>\n
run back over	<font color=blue size=4>run back over</font>\n<br>look back in the mind 回顾；重温\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I let my thoughts run back over my childhood. 我在回顾我的童年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's run back over the events of the last few days to see if we can find out what went wrong. 我们来回顾一下这几天的情况，看看能否找到毛病出在什么地方。</font>\n
run circle around/run rings around	<font color=blue size=4>run circle around/run rings around</font>\n<br>show that one can do a task much better than; do better than sb. very easily 轻而易举做某事；举手之劳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Frank ran rings around the other boys on the basketball team. 在篮球队中法兰克的球技远远超过其他队友。</font>\n
run down	<font color=blue size=4>run down</font>\n<br>1. (of watch or clock) slow down or stop（钟表）走慢或不走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The kitchen clock ran down because we forgot to wind it. 厨房里的钟停了，因为我们忘了上发条。</font>\n<br>2. speak ill of; criticize unkindly 贬低；不客气地批评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is jealous of your success; that's why she's always running you down. 她嫉妒你的成功，这就是她总是讲你坏话的原因。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will flatter a person to his face, and then run him down behind his back. 他会当面吹捧一个人，而在背后却造谣中伤。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That man doesn't like me;he's always running me down. 那人不喜欢我，他总是诽谤我。</font>\n<br>3. chase and catch 追捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police were able to run the jewel thieves down after a long search. 警察经过长时间搜查，终于抓获了盗窃珠宝的小偷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After hunting for him for over a week, the police ran the escaped prisoner down in a public house. 在追捕了一个多星期后，警察终于在一家酒店里捉住了逃犯。</font>\n<br>4. knock down and hurt 撞伤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor boy has been run down by a bus. 这个可怜的男孩子被汽车撞伤了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was afraid she would run someone down while driving. 她害怕在开车时撞伤人。</font>\n<br>5. ill; in poor health or condition 体力衰弱；身体垮掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father caught a cold because he was run down from loss of sleep. 父亲由于缺乏睡眠，体力衰弱而感冒了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old worker was run down after all those years of hard work. 这位老工人因多年辛勤劳动而身体垮下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His health ran down to a dangerous level. 他的健康状况已恶化到危险的程度。</font>\n<br>6. find by hard and thorough search; trace the source of 追根究底；探出…的根源\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman ran down proof that the burglar had robbed the store. 警察追查小偷抢店铺的证据。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had quite a time running down the technical words. 他为查出这些术语的来源花了相当多的时间。</font>\n<br>7. (cause to) diminish in number, quantity, size, etc. 减少；缩小；降低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coal industry is running down as coal deposits are used up. 由于煤藏枯竭，煤炭工业正在衰落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farm labor force in this country is running down steadily. 这个国家的农业劳动力正持续减少。</font>\n<br>8. slowly bring to a halt 使慢慢地停止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The management are running this factory down. 管理部门正在慢慢使这个工厂停产。</font>\n<br>run errands act as an errandboy; go to a store to buy things for sb. 跑腿；为别人办事；买东西\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have no time to run errands for you. 我没时间替你跑腿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rufus runs errands for all the neighbours. 鲁福斯为所有的邻居跑腿买东西。</font>\n
run for	<font color=blue size=4>run for</font>\n<br>1. try to get elected; compete for an elected office 竞选（公职）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Who will run for President next year ？明年谁将竞选总统？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He runs for mayor again. 他再次竞选市长。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>More people than ever before are running for the city council. 这次参加市议会竞选的人比以往任何时候都多。</font>\n<br>2. hasten to fetch 匆匆去拿或去请\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One of my classmates was seriously ill, so we ran for the doctor. 我的一位同班同学病得厉害，我们急忙去请医生。</font>\n
run in	<font color=blue size=4>run in</font>\n<br>1 . (of a new car or one with a new engine) drive it slowly and carefully until the engine runs freely and easily（指新汽车或换上新引擎的汽车）缓慢而谨慎地试开；试车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had better allow plenty of time, as I can't drive fast ; the car isn't run in yet. 我们最好把时间留宽裕些，我不能把车子开得很快，因为还没有试过车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are running in the new machines. 工人们正在试开那些新机器。</font>\n<br>2. visit casually 非正式地访问；顺便看望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Run in and see me this evening. 今晚请到我家来坐坐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She lived close by and was used to running in whenever she was free. 她住在附近，一有空就过来看我们。</font>\n<br>3. convey in (usu. in a car) 把…送到；送入（通常指用汽车）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll run you in to the station in a few minutes. 我马上就用车送你到车站去。</font>\n<br>4. introduce 引进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ran the liquid through a tube. 他们把液体通过试管引进来。</font>\n
run into	<font color=blue size=4>run into</font>\n<br>1. meet by chance 偶然碰见；巧遇；碰上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I unexpectedly ran into him on the street yesterday evening. 昨天晚上我在街上偶然碰见了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their ship ran into a strong gale at sea. 他们那条船在海上遇到了大风。</font>\n<br>2. collide with 与…碰撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Suddenly he lost control of his bike and ran into a lamppost. 他突然控制不住自己的自行车，一下子撞到了电线杆上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran into the back of a bus. 他撞上了一辆公共汽车的尾部。</font>\n<br>3. be affected by;get into; encounter 遭遇到；陷入；经历\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will certainly run into many difficulties, but you must not give up. 你一定会遇到很多困难，但不能放弃。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I ran into a problem while making my model airplane, I asked my father for help. 当我在做飞机模型遇到困难时，我请我父亲帮忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has run into trouble in his job. 他在工作中遇到了困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you travel alone in that forest, you may run into danger. 如果你独个儿在那片森林里行走，你会遇到危险的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has run heavily into debt. 她负债累累。</font>\n<br>4. add up to; amount to; total 总计为；累计达到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new dictionary has run into several editions. 那部新词典已经再版好几次了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The number of people killed on the highways during holidays runs into hundreds. 高速公路上伤亡人数在假期里高达数百人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Losses ran into millions of U. S. dollars. 损失达几百万美元。</font>\n<br>5. mix with; join with 与…混合；与…相会合\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rivers on the other side of the mountains run into the Atlantic. 山另一侧的河流都流入了大西洋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The small brook runs into a big river in the valley below. 这条小溪在下边的山谷里流入一条大河。</font>\n<br>6. continue into 延续到；接连；跟着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>One year ran into the next, and still there was no change. 年复一年，依然如故。</font>\n
run into the ground	<font color=blue size=4>run into the ground</font>\n<br>1. do or use sth. more than is wanted or needed 把（某事）做过头；做得过分；用得太多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Caution is necessary in doing any work, but it's not advisable to run it into the ground. 做任何事情谨慎是必要的，但过分谨慎也是不可取的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's all right to borrow my dictionary once in a while, but don't run it into the ground. 偶尔借用我的词典可以，但总来借就不好了。</font>\n<br>2. win over or defeat sb. completely 彻底打败（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I lost the game today, but tomorrow I'll run you into the ground. 这次我输了，可明天我一定要打败你。</font>\n<br>3. manage badly till the result is a complete failure 经营不善以致于一败涂地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has run his business into the ground. 他因经营不善，以致生意一败涂地。</font>\n
run off	<font color=blue size=4>run off</font>\n<br>1. escape; run away 逃走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy soldiers ran off at night. 敌军夜里逃走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man has run off with all the funds. 那人带了全部款子逃跑了。</font>\n<br>2. make or print (copies) 印制；印刷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you've finished typing this letter, could you run off four copies for me, please? 这封信你打完后请帮我印4份好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Has the article been run off yet? 这篇文章印好了没有？</font>\n<br>3. dash off; recite or compose rapidly 匆匆完成；快速地背出或写出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's a remarkable writer;he can run off a novel a week. 他是位才华出众的作家，能在一周内赶写出一部小说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can run off the list from memory. 他能把清单倒背如流。</font>\n<br>4. allow to flow away 使流掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There isn't much wine left in the bottle just run it off. 瓶里的酒剩下不多了，全部倒光吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ran off the excess liquid. 他们把多余的液体排掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scolding ran off him like water off a duck's back. 责备对他毫无作用，就好比水浇在鸭背上，瞬间就流掉了。</font>\n<br>5. cause (a match, a tournament, etc.) to be played to a finish 使（比赛等）赛完；进行决赛以决定（比赛等的）胜负\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ran off the heats and selected their representatives for the big competition. 为了选出参加这次大赛的代表，他们进行了预赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When will the race be run off? 该项比赛的决赛什么时候进行？</font>\n<br>6. drive off 撵走；赶走；逐出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy saw a dog digging in mother's flower bed, and he ran it off. 这男孩看到一条狗在妈妈的花坛上乱扒，就把它赶走了。</font>\n
run on	<font color=blue size=4>run on</font>\n<br>1. continue 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The war could run on for another year yet. 这场战争有可能还要延续一年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This disease can run on for months. 这种病可以拖好几个月。</font>\n<br>2. talk without pause 不停地交谈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man ran on for hours about his childhood. 那位老人连续几小时讲述他的童年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He kept running on and on, telling me the same story over and over again. 他喋喋不休地反复向我讲那个同样的故事。</font>\n<br>3. involve; touch; dwell on 关于；涉及；老是想着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our talks ran on current political news. 我们的谈话涉及到当前的政治新闻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mind ran on his own troubles. 他老在想自己的烦恼事。</font>\n<br>4. press with Jokes or ridicule; abuse with sarcasm 讽刺；嘲讽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It shows an ungenerous and unfeeling disposition to run on those who are in an inferior or dependent position. 讽刺挖苦下级人员是一种不大方、无同情心的表现。</font>\n
run out	<font color=blue size=4>run out</font>\n<br>1. come to an end by using 用完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their food was running out fast so the climbers had to return. 食品很快就要用完了，因此登山者只好返回。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'd just reached the motorway when the petrol ran out. 我们刚开到高速公路上，汽油就耗完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My patience is running out. 我已失去耐心。</font>\n<br>2. expire 期满无效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My employment contract runs out at the end of this month. 我的雇佣合同本月底期满。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lease for that property will soon run out. 那批房产的契约很快就要到期。</font>\n<br>3. convey out, usu. in a car 运送（通常指用汽车）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll happily run you out to see them. 我很愿意用车送你去见他们。</font>\n
run out of	<font color=blue size=4>run out of</font>\n<br>1. have no further supply of 用完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car ran out of petrol after ten miles. 这辆小汽车跑了10英里就没油了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have run out of money. 我把钱用光了。</font>\n<br>2. force to leave 赶走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you refuse to leave of your own free will, the boys will run you out of town. 如果你不肯自动离开的话，这些男孩会把你赶出城的。</font>\n
run out on	<font color=blue size=4>run out on</font>\n<br>1. leave or desert sb. 抛弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His former allies ran out on him. 他原来的伙伴们抛弃了他。</font>\n<br>2. fail to fulfil; withdraw one's support from 不履行；遗弃；不予支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can not run out on the contract, or you could be taken to court. 你不能不履行合同，否则你要上法庭的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would help us, but at the last moment he ran out on us. 他说他要帮我们的忙，但最后他却不管我们了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No one could accuse him of running out on his friends. 没人可以责备他不帮朋友忙。</font>\n
run over	<font color=blue size=4>run over</font>\n<br>1. overflow 溢出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The river is running over its banks and we shall be flooded. 河水正在漫过河岸，我们就要受淹了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone must have left the tap on, for the water was running over and flooding the bathroom. 一定是有人忘了关水龙头，水都溢出来了，浴室里尽是水。</font>\n<br>2. knock down and pass over with a moving vehicle（车辆）辗过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go slower;you might run over those children playing on the road. 慢点儿！当心压了在路上玩耍的孩子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The motorist admitted that he ran over a woman on a pedestrian crossing. 开车人承认他的车子在人行横道上压过一位妇女。</font>\n<br>3. repeat for practice; go over (a subject) cursorily 温习；扼要复述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just run over the notes before the examination. 考前把笔记复习一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I 've explained the subject pretty fully; now I'll run over the main points again. 对于这个问题，我已经做了相当详尽的解释，现在我将重复一下要点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the lunch hour, Mary ran over her history facts so she would remember them for the test. 午餐时玛丽匆匆地把历史笔记复习了一下，以便考试时记住。</font>\n<br>4. visit briefly 短暂串门\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She ran over to her neighbour's to borrow some milk. 她到邻居家去借些牛奶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He often runs over to my office to talk about his work. 他常来我办公室谈他的工作。</font>\n<br>5. go beyond; exceed a limit 超过；超出限度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid time is running over;we'll have to end it now. 时间快要到了，我们该收工了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech ran over the time limit. 他的讲话超过了规定的时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The amount collected in taxes ran over the estimate. 收的税金超出了预算。</font>\n<br>6. play (a tape, etc.) 放（磁带）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran the tape over again and again and listened carefully. 他一遍又一遍放磁带并仔细听着。</font>\n<br>run short be in short supply; not have enough 缺少；不足\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The world is gradually running short of oil. 世界上的石油正越来越少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Drinking water was running short before the voyage was over. 饮用水在航海完成之前就用完了。</font>\n<br>run the risk of be open to danger; put oneself in danger 易遭危险；冒险；使自己身处险境\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A baseball umpire wears a mask and chest protector so he won't run the risk of being hit by the ball. 棒球裁判戴着面具和胸护，以免遭球击。</font>\n
run through	<font color=blue size=4>run through</font>\n<br>1. use up wastefully 挥霍尽；乱花光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rich man's son quickly ran through his money. 这位富人的儿子很快就把钱挥霍光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran through the family fortune in a year. 他一年之内耗尽了全部家产。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We run through ten gallons of petrol a week. 我们一个星期用10加仑汽油。</font>\n<br>2. repeat 重复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll run through the main points of the news again. 我将回放一下新闻的主要内容。</font>\n<br>3. review; rehearse 复习；预演；排练\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran through his lecture in his mind. 他在心里默诵他的演讲词。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should run through the whole play once more before we actually present it on the stage. 我们在公演前应该把整个剧再排练一遍。</font>\n<br>4. pierce or stab, as with a sword 刺入；贯穿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran his opponent through with a sword. 他用剑刺穿了他的对手。</font>\n<br>5. peruse or examine quickly; deal with in rapid succession 迅速阅读或检查；很快地处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you run through this essay for me, and tell me what you think of it? 请你把这篇文章看一下，并把意见告诉我，好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have run through the headlines in today's newspapers. 今天报纸的大标题我都浏览过了。</font>\n
run to	<font color=blue size=4>run to</font>\n<br>1. afford; have sufficient money, ability, etc. for 买得起；有足够的钱、能力等做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On my salary I can't run to a colour television. 靠工资我买不起彩电。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid we can't run to a holiday abroad this year. 恐怕今年我们没钱出国度假了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chapel needs redecorating, but funds won't run to it. 教堂需要重新装饰一番，但资金不足。</font>\n<br>2. amount to; extend to 总额达到；伸展到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book runs to 300 pages. 该书多达300页。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The casualties ran to more than a hundred thousand. 伤亡人数达10万以上。</font>\n<br>3. tend to 倾向于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She naturally runs to fat. 她天生会发胖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was annoyed that I had let myself run to fat, so I made efforts to lose weight. 真烦人，我长得太胖了，所以我努力减肥。</font>\n
run to earth/ground	<font color=blue size=4>run to earth/ground</font>\n<br>hunt to its hiding place, home, starting point or origin 追根究底；追查到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the men who helped to run to earth the criminals were richly rewarded. 所有协助追查罪犯的人都获重赏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book was out of print but he eventually ran it to earth at a secondhand bookshop. 那本书绝版了，但他终于在一家旧书店里买到了。</font>\n
run true to form	<font color=blue size=4>run true to form</font>\n<br>follow a usual way; act as expected; agree with how a person usually acts 一如往常；一贯；不失…之本色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His action ran true to form; he bothered his mother until she let him have his way. 他和往常一样，缠着他妈妈直到她依了他才罢休。</font>\n
run up	<font color=blue size=4>run up</font>\n<br>1. raise 升起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ran up the national flag in honor of the victory. 他们升起国旗，庆贺胜利。</font>\n<br>2. make quickly by sewing ; build or erect quickly 很快地缝；迅速地造起或架起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They ran up the shed in a very short time. 他们一会儿就把棚子搭好了。</font>\n<br>3. amass; incur; accumulate 累积；积聚；招致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is running up huge debts. 他债台越筑越高。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran up a big bill during his stay in town. 他在城里逗留期间，欠了一大笔债。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've run up an overdraft and now the bank's stopped my credit. 我的透支剧增，所以银行停止了我的信贷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The extra grant will only just cover the deficit that we've run up already. 额外的拨款将勉强弥补我们已经积欠下来的亏空。</font>\n<br>4. cause to increase; raise; increase by bidding; bid up, as at an auction or sale 抬高（价格）；提高；（在拍卖时）迫使（对方）出高价\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The special packaging will run up the price of the item. 特殊包装会抬高这种商品的价格。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sales of the book ran up. 这书的销售量迅速上升。</font>\n<br>5. add or count up quickly 迅速把… 加起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ran up this column of figures in a few minutes. 他在几分钟内就把这一行的数字加起来了。</font>\n
run up against	<font color=blue size=4>run up against</font>\n<br>1. meet by chance;encounter 碰到；偶遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I thought we would be successful, but we ran up against a lack of money. 我本以为我们会成功，但因资金短缺而受阻。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Could you help me? I've run up against a few problems. 你能帮我一下吗？我碰上了几个问题。</font>\n<br>2. collide with 与…相撞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the dark he ran up against a big tree. 黑暗中，他撞到一棵大树上去了。</font>\n
run up to	<font color=blue size=4>run up to</font>\n<br>1. amount to 总额达到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bill for the repairs might run up to ￡300. 修理费可能会多达300 英镑。</font>\n<br>2. come near to as by running 跑近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child ran up to the teacher to show her his drawing. 这个孩子跑到老师身边，让她观看他的画。</font>\n<br>run wild get out of control 失去控制；胡闹\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new teacher lets the children run wild. 这位新教师听任孩子们胡闹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Prices were running wild all over the country. 全国物价普遍在上涨。</font>\n<br>rush at run towards so as to attack 向…冲去；扑向…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He rushed at his enemy with a drawn sword. 他拔出刺刀，向敌人冲去。</font>\n
rush through	<font color=blue size=4>rush through</font>\n<br>1. complete hastily 匆忙做完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We rushed through the last few orders so as to close the shop early. 我们匆忙地做完了最后几笔生意，以便早点打烊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even though they had to rush through their job, they still saw to it that high quality was guaranteed. 尽管他们得赶紧做完那项工作，但还是注意保证质量。</font>\n<br>2. transport as quickly as possible 尽快地运输\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are rushing workers through to the factories. 他们正忙于把工人尽快送去工厂上班。</font>\n
sack in/ out	<font color=blue size=4>sack in/ out</font>\n<br>go to sleep for a prolonged period 睡觉；睡个够\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shut up and sack in. 别讲话，睡觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where are you going to sack in for tonight? 你今晚睡哪儿？</font>\n
safe and sound	<font color=blue size=4>safe and sound</font>\n<br>not hurt; unharmed 平安地；安然无恙地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They returned safe and sound from a dangerous expedition. 他们冒死探险，现已平安归来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite the storm, the plane landed at the airport safe and sound. 那架飞机在大风雨中安全降落。</font>\n
sail in	<font color=blue size=4>sail in</font>\n<br>1. enter a port 进港\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was on June 3rd that our ship sailed in. 我们的船是6月3日进港的。</font>\n<br>2. (ladies, etc.) enter in a stately or dignified manner（贵妇人）仪态万方地走进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were talking of Mrs. Swift when she sailed in. 他们正谈论着斯威夫特夫人时，她风姿绰约地走了进来。</font>\n<br>3. take decisive action 采取断然行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sailed in and finished the job. 他一鼓作气，完成了任务。</font>\n<br>4. enter an argument or dispute energetically 起劲地参加争论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just as we thought the heat had gone out the discussion, Mrs. Hughes sailed in. 在我们感到讨论陷入冷场时，休斯太太兴致勃勃地加入了讨论。</font>\n
sail into	<font color=blue size=4>sail into</font>\n<br>1. enter in a dignified or stately manner 大摇大摆地走进来；仪态万方地走进来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sailed into the hall with her head held high. 她昂着头傲慢地走进了大厅。</font>\n<br>2. attack with great strength 猛击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George grabbed a stick and sailed into the dog. 乔治抓过一根棍子，猛打那条狗。</font>\n<br>3. criticize hard 严厉批评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could hear Mother sailing into the children for bringing mud into the house. 我听见母亲在狠狠责备孩子们把泥带进了屋里。</font>\n
sail under false colors	<font color=blue size=4>sail under false colors</font>\n<br>pretend to be what one is not 冒充\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I had so much wisdom as to sail un der false colors in this foolish jaunt of mine. 我居然能在这次愚蠢的漫游中机智地更名改姓，真是聪明。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are not real merchants. They are political spies sailing under false colors. 他们不是真正的商人，他们是伪装的政治间谍。</font>\n

save one's breath	<font color=blue size=4>save one's breath</font>\n<br>keep silent because talking will not help 省点力气别开口；免开口\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What you are saying will not make any difference to me, so you may as well keep your breath. 你所说的对我不会产生任何作用，所以你最好是免开尊口。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Save your breath. There is no chance that he will agree. 省点力气吧，他是决不可能同意的。</font>\n
save one's neck/skin	<font color=blue size=4>save one's neck/skin</font>\n<br>save from danger or trouble 免于遭殃；使摆脱困境\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's saved his neck, thanks to his counsel, but people will always suspect him. 多亏他的辩护律师才使他免受绞刑，但人们将永远以怀疑的眼光来看他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You really saved my neck by help ing me check up on many details in my paper; otherwise I couldn't have got the work done in time. 你替我核对了这篇论文中的许多具体细节，真是帮了个大忙，否则我根本不可能及时完成这篇论文。</font>\n
save the day/situation	<font color=blue size=4>save the day/situation</font>\n<br>bring about victory or success, esp. when defeat is likely 反败为胜；转危为安\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The forest fire was nearly out of control when suddenly it rained heavily and saved the day. 森林火灾几乎无法控制，但一场瓢泼大雨，把它浇灭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were ready to retreat, but re inforcements arrived in time and saved the situation. 他们正准备撤退时，增援部队及时赶到，一下扭转了局势。</font>\n

see out	<font color=blue size=4>see out</font>\n<br>1. accompany to the door, etc. 送…到门口\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't get up, I'll see myself out. 请不必起来，我自己能出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Miss Jones will see you out of the building. 琼斯小姐将送你出这座大楼。</font>\n<br>2. stay and witness (sth.) to the end 看完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We saw out the long play. 我们看完了那个长剧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter's assignment was hard but he saw it out to the end. 彼得的作业很难，但他坚持把它做完。</font>\n<br>3. last until the end of sth. 干到底；用到底；坚持到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have enough food to see out the winter. 我们的食物足够过冬了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am ninety on my next birthday, but I hope to see a few more years out yet. 下次过生日我就满90岁了，我希望再多活几年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It may take a long time, perhaps five years, but we will see it out. 这也许要花很长的时间，可能要5年吧，但我们要干到底。</font>\n

see the light	<font color=blue size=4>see the light</font>\n<br>1. publish 出版；问世\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These famous letters first saw the light about fifty years ago, when they were discovered and pub lished. 这些著名的信件大约是50年前问世的，那时候它们被发现并出版了。</font>\n<br>2. understand or agree; accept sb. 's explanation or decision 领悟；接受别人的意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've been telling him all along that he ought to make the store more attractive, I guess he's finally seen the light. 我们一直对他说他应该把商店搞得更吸引人一些，我想他终于明白了这个道理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wouldn't agree, no matter how hard we argued, but eventually he saw the light and changed his mind. 不管我们怎么讲，他总是不同意，但后来终于领悟并改变了自己的主张。</font>\n

see through	<font color=blue size=4>see through</font>\n<br>1. understand or not be deceived by (a trick) 识破（诡计）；不上当\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother saw through Johnny's ex cuses not to go to bed on Christmas Eve. She knew he wanted to stay up to see Santa Claus. 母亲看穿了约翰尼在圣诞夜不睡觉的借口。她知道他是想等着看圣诞老人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We easily saw through the man and his lies. 我们轻而易举地看破了这人和他的谎言。</font>\n<br>2. do until sth. is finished 做完（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once Charles started a job, he saw it through until it was finished. 查尔斯一旦开始一项工作，就要把它做完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before I leave, I would like to see the project through. 我要把这任务完成后再走。</font>\n<br>3. help (sb.) through difficulty 帮助（某人）度过难关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His business was about to fail, but his banker saw him through. 他的生意行将失败，但他的财东帮助他度过了难关。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was very upset when her hus band died but her friends saw her through. 丈夫的去世使她非常难过，但她的朋友们帮她度过了悲伤时期。</font>\n<br>4. be enough for or last 够用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This money will see us through the week. 这笔钱够我们用一个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think we have enough bread to see us through the weekend. 我看现有的面包足够我们吃到周末了。</font>\n
see to	<font color=blue size=4>see to</font>\n<br>attend to or deal with 照料或处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>While Donna bought the theatre tickets, I saw to the parking of the car. 唐娜买戏票，我则负责停车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The telephone out of order again? Why, it was only last week that it was seen to. 电话又出毛病了？嗨，上个星期刚刚找人看过。</font>\n
see to it	<font color=blue size=4>see to it</font>\n<br>make sure; take the responsibility 务必使；负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>See to it that the door is safely locked. 务必锁好门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We saw to it that the child was fed and bathed. 我们负责给孩子喂饭、洗澡。</font>\n
seize up	<font color=blue size=4>seize up</font>\n<br>stop working suddenly (as of a machine) （机器）突然停止运转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you fail to oil the engine regu larly, it would seize up without any warning. 如果你不定时给发动机加油，它就会突然停止运转。</font>\n
seize (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>seize (up) on</font>\n<br>take and use eagerly 抓住并积极利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to seize on every chance of success as it is not likely to be re peated. 你必须抓住每个成功的机会，因为这种机会不大可能再来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She seized on the chance of going to New York to work. 她抓住了去纽约工作的机会。</font>\n
sell out	<font color=blue size=4>sell out</font>\n<br>1. sell all of 卖光\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop sold out all their shirts. 商店卖完了所有的衬衫。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day after the blackout, most stores sold out their entire stock of flashlights within a few hours. 停电后的这一天，大部分商店在几个小时之内就卖光了他们所有库存的手电筒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tickets for the football match were sold out in two hours. 足球比赛门票两小时内就售完了。</font>\n<br>2. be disloyal or unfaithful to 背叛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can't be trusted not to sell out his friends if he is in a position to make a profit. 我们不要指望他在有利可图的情况下不出卖朋友。</font>\n
sell up	<font color=blue size=4>sell up</font>\n<br>1. sell one's major assets 变卖主要财产\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new supermarket has been so successful that some small shop keepers have had to sell up. 那家超级市场经营非常成功，使得一些小店主不得不歇业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After farming for over ten years in Britain he sold up and went abroad. 他在英国务农10多年后，变卖财产出国去了。</font>\n<br>2. sell sb. 's property for payment of debt 将某人的财产变卖抵债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old Williams went bankrupt, and was sold up by his creditors. 老威廉斯破产了，他的全部财产被债权人变卖了。</font>\n
send away	<font color=blue size=4>send away</font>\n<br>1. cause to depart 使离开；送走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sent his son away to school in America. 他把儿子送往美国念书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The letter was sent away in the evening mail. 那封信是夜间邮班送出的。</font>\n<br>2. dismiss 开除；赶走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Send the boy away, Mary; he is a little nuisance. 玛丽，把孩子打发走，他是一个小讨厌鬼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss sent little Jack away on some pretext or other. 老板用某种借口把小杰克开除了。</font>\n
send away for	<font color=blue size=4>send away for</font>\n<br>request by post 写信索要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sent away to one of the daily papers for a free calendar. 他写信向一家日报社免费索取一份年历。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wants to send away for some books. 他想写信邮购一些书。</font>\n
send down	<font color=blue size=4>send down</font>\n<br>1. expel a student from a universi ty 开除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As a result of the inquiry, two stu dents have been sent down. 调查结果，两个学生被勒令退学。</font>\n<br>2. cause to go down 使下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Perhaps that will send her temper ature down. 那样或许会使她的热度降下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The glut of apples sent the prices down. 苹果大量上市使价格降了下来。</font>\n
send for	<font color=blue size=4>send for</font>\n<br>1. ask sb. to attend 请…来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Send for a doctor; a man has been hurt. 去请医生，有人受伤了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police were sent for immedi ately the disturbance began. 骚乱刚一开始，警察就被叫来了。</font>\n<br>2. send an order for sth. 订购\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have sent for a dozen copies of the book. 这书我订购了12本。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you wish to see the book, I'll send for a copy. 你要是想看这本书，我就去订购一本。</font>\n
send forth	<font color=blue size=4>send forth</font>\n<br>1. produce 长出（枝、芽等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Trees send forth new leaves in spring. 春天里树木长出新叶。</font>\n<br>2. emit; pour out 发出；使流出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun sends forth light and heat. 太阳发出光和热。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plant sends forth billows of smoke and steam. 那家工厂放出滚滚浓烟和蒸汽。</font>\n<br>3. issue; dispatch 寄发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The parcel must be sent forth at once. 这包裹必须马上寄出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They sent forth lots of people into the harvest. 他们派出许多人参加收割。</font>\n
send in	<font color=blue size=4>send in</font>\n<br>1. hand in 递送；呈送\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have they sent in the accounts? 他们把账单交上来了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has already sent in his resigna tion. 他已提出了辞职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Applications must be sent in by May 5. 申请书必须于5月5日前交上来。</font>\n<br>2. send for a competition or an ex hibition 送…参加比赛或展出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Send in your contest entries to this station. 把参加比赛的名单送到本站来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We sent in two pictures for the show. 我们送去两幅画参展。</font>\n

send up	<font color=blue size=4>send up</font>\n<br>1. cause to go upward 使上升；提高；加大；发射\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Any increase in production costs is bound to send up prices. 生产成本一提高就必然引起物价上涨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The climbers sent two men up to in vestigate the rockfall. 登山者派两个人上去调查滚石情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The distressed ship sent up a flare. 遇难的船向空中发出了闪光信号。</font>\n<br>2. destroy 毁坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The terrorists sent the bridge up. 恐怖分子炸毁了大桥。</font>\n<br>3. ridicule sb. or sth. esp. by imi tating 讽刺性模仿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play sends up the advertising industry. 该剧是讽刺广告业的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students here love to send up the staff. 这里的学生爱模仿教职员的动作取笑。</font>\n<br>4. sentence sb. to imprisonment 判…入狱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you know that Milton was sent up for fifteen years? 你知道弥尔顿被判刑15年吗？</font>\n

It served him right because he had not studied. 他考试不及格活该，因为他没有学习。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It serves you right to have lost your purse. You were always too care less about leaving it around. 你丢了钱包活该，因为你总是粗心，到处乱放你的钱包。</font>\n
