set about	<font color=blue size=4>set about</font>\n<br>1. begin 开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Benjamin Franklin set about learn ing the printer's trade at an early age. 本杰明•富兰克林早年就开始学习印刷术。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll set about preparing supper. 我去做晚饭。</font>\n<br>2. attack 袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I refused to give him mon ey, he set about me with a stick. 我不给他钱，他就用棍子打我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set about each other furious ly. 他们使劲地扭打起来。</font>\n
set against	<font color=blue size=4>set against</font>\n<br>1. balance against sth. 用（某物）抵消\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Certain business losses can be set against taxes. 有些经营损失可以用来抵税。</font>\n<br>2. oppose sth. firmly 坚决反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary's father was set against the marriage from the beginning. 玛丽的父亲从一开始就坚决反对这桩婚事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All those who set themselves against the people will come to no good end. 一切与人民为敌的人，都没有好下场。</font>\n
set apart	<font color=blue size=4>set apart</font>\n<br>1. reserve 留出；拨出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided to set a day apart for the work. 他们决定拨出一天的时间来干这项工作。</font>\n<br>2. make sb. or sth. special or dif ferent from others 使突出；使…不平常\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His intelligence set him apart from the other boys in his class. 他的才华在班上的男孩中很突出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her bright red hair sets her apart from her sisters. 她头发绯红，同姐妹们迥然不同。</font>\n
set aside	<font color=blue size=4>set aside</font>\n<br>1. keep or choose (money or time) for some purpose 特意留出（钱或时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The busy executive set a weekend aside for a small trip with his family. 这位繁忙的官员腾出一个周末和家人一起作了一次短途旅行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every month we tried to see aside a few dollars. 每个月我们都设法积蓄几美元。</font>\n<br>2. pay no attention to; reject 不理睬；拒绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The complaint was set aside as of no importance. 这个投诉被认为不重要，因而不被理睬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid we must set aside your request fot more equipment. 恐怕我们要拒绝你要求更多设备的申请了。</font>\n<br>3. annul 废止；宣告无效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Supreme Court set aside the decision of the lower courts. 最高法院驳回了下级法院的判决。</font>\n
set back	<font color=blue size=4>set back</font>\n<br>1. delay the progress of sth. 延期；耽搁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The snow this winter set back the building of our new house by two months. 今冬的一场雪使得我们新房子的修建耽搁了两个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The harvest was set back by bad weather. 由于天气恶劣，收割推迟了。</font>\n<br>2. put back 拨回；使回转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's set back the clock half an hour. 咱们把钟拨回半个小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's impossible to set back the clock of history. 要使历史车轮倒转是办不到的。</font>\n<br>3. cost 花费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her new boots set her back 70 dol lars. 她花了70美元买了双靴子。</font>\n<br>4. position well back 使缩进去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house is set back some distance from the street. 这房子造得离街面有一段距离。</font>\n
set down	<font color=blue size=4>set down</font>\n<br>1. let sb. out of a bus or other ve hicle 让…下车\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver will set you down just outside our house. 司机会送你到我们家门口的。</font>\n<br>2. place; put down 把…放下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She set down the tray on the table and went out. 她把盘子放在桌上就出去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Set down your bags and take a rest. 把包放下来，歇一会儿吧。</font>\n<br>3. write down 定下；记下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will set down the story as it was told to me. 我将按我听说的情况写。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was good at setting his thoughts down on paper. 他善于把自己的想法记录在纸上。</font>\n<br>4. consider; attribute 认为；把…归因于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set her attitude down to shy ness. 他把她的态度归因于害羞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>when he heard the man speak, he set him down as a fool. 他听了那个人讲话后，认为他是个傻瓜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The failure was set down to bad planning. 这次失败是由于计划不周全而造成的。</font>\n
set eyes on	<font color=blue size=4>set eyes on</font>\n<br>see 看到；望到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>None of us had ever set eyes on a generator before. 我们过去谁也没有见过发电机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she set eyes on the green hills, she felt deep excitement. 当她见到了翠绿的小山时，感到异常激动。</font>\n
set fire to	<font color=blue size=4>set fire to</font>\n<br>cause to burn; start a fire 使燃烧；点燃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sparks set fire to the carpet. 火花燃着了地毯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>NO one knows who set fire to the building. 没人知道是谁放火烧了那栋楼。</font>\n
set foot in/on	<font color=blue size=4>set foot in/on</font>\n<br>arrive at; step into 进入；踏上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From the moment you set foot in this house you've been grumbling—now what's wrong? 你进屋后就一直在唠叨，到底出了什么事？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Armstrong was the first man to set foot on the moon, in July 1969. 阿姆斯特朗是第1个登上月球的人，时间是1969年7月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I left him, determined never to set foot in that house again. 我离开了他，决心再也不进那屋了。</font>\n
set forth	<font color=blue size=4>set forth</font>\n<br>1. explain exactly or clearly 阐明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President set forth his plans in a television talk. 总统在电视讲话中阐明了他的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She willingly set forth her opi nions. 她主动提出了她的意见。</font>\n<br>2. start to go somewhere 出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The troops set forth on their tenmile hike early. 部队一大早就进行10英里的行军去了。</font>\n
set forward	<font color=blue size=4>set forward</font>\n<br>1. promote 推动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their enterprise was set forward by the increase of capital. 资本的增加促进了他们企业的发展。</font>\n<br>2. put forward 提出；宣布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set forward his proposition in no uncertain terms. 他毫不含糊地提出了自己的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The proposal she set forward is practicable. 她提出的建议是可行的。</font>\n<br>3. cause to indicate a later time 拨快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set his watch forward five min utes in order not to be late. 为了不迟到，他把表拨快了5分钟。</font>\n
set free	<font color=blue size=4>set free</font>\n<br>release; give freedom 释放；使获自由\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone has slipped into the prison cell and set the prisoners free. 有人溜进牢房，放走了犯人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Following the Civil War, the Southern slaves were set free. 美国内战后，南方奴隶获得了解放。</font>\n
set in	<font color=blue size=4>set in</font>\n<br>begin; start 开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before the boat could reach shore, a storm had set in. 小船还未靠岸，暴风雨就来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rainy season has set in. 雨季开始了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't keep the wound clean, so infection set in. 由于没有保持清洁，伤口开始发炎了。</font>\n
set off	<font color=blue size=4>set off</font>\n<br>1. decorate through contrast 衬托\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bright colors of the birds were set off by the white snow. 白雪的衬托使这些鸟的颜色显得更加鲜艳。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A red flower needs to be set off by green leaves. 红花还需绿叶扶持。</font>\n<br>2. balance 弥补\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her great wealth, as he thought, set off her plain face. 正如他所想的那样，她的巨大财富弥补了她相貌平淡的不足。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can set the heavy expenses off against a probable increase in sa lary. 薪水可能会增加，这样你就能弥补开支的严重不足。</font>\n<br>3. start to go 出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set off for the West in a wagon. 他们乘马车去西部。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having said farewell to their friends, they set off for home. 向朋友们告别后，他们动身回家。</font>\n<br>4. cause to begin 引起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A letter from home set off an at tack of homesickness. 一封家信一下子唤起了他的思乡之情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't mention Italy; you'll set him off on his holiday adventures again. 不要提意大利，这会使他又谈起他度假时的冒险经历。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She had stopped crying but his shouting set her off again. 她已止住了哭，可他的叫喊使她又哭了起来。</font>\n<br>5. cause to explode 使爆炸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On July 4 we set off firecrackers in many places. 7月4日这一天，我们在许多地方燃放爆竹。</font>\n
set one's heart (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>set one's heart (up) on</font>\n<br>1. want very much 很想要（或很想得到）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set his heart on that bike. 他很想要那辆自行车。</font>\n<br>2. hope very much to succeed in doing sth. 很希望成功地做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set his heart on winning the race. 他很希望能赢得这场比赛。</font>\n
set one's mind to/on	<font color=blue size=4>set one's mind to/on</font>\n<br>pull all one's efforts into doing sth. 专心于；一心想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind to it. 世上无难事，只怕有心人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he sets his mind on doing some thing, it takes a lot to dissuade him. 如果他下决心要做某事，要花很大努力才能说服他不去做。</font>\n
set on fire	<font color=blue size=4>set on fire</font>\n<br>cause to burn 使燃烧；点燃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be careful with the candle, you will set those curtains on fire. 当心蜡烛，你会把帘子烧着的。</font>\n
set on foot	<font color=blue size=4>set on foot</font>\n<br>begin; cause to start 开始；使开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Plans have been set on foot for a party for Miss Jackson, because she is retiring. 已经计划为杰克逊小姐举行一个聚会，因为她要退休了。</font>\n
set out	<font color=blue size=4>set out</font>\n<br>1. leave on a journey or voyage 启程或启航\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Pilgrims set out for the New World. 英国清教徒们启航驶向“新大陆”。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will set out tomorrow on his journey to Beijing. 他明天动身去北京。</font>\n<br>2. attempt 试图\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George set out to improve his pitch ing. 乔治试图提高他的投球技术。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set out to do a lot of things, but didn't succeed. 他原打算做许多事，但都未成功。</font>\n<br>3. plant in the ground 种植\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gardener set out some tomato seedlings. 这位园丁种植了些西红柿苗。</font>\n<br>4. display 陈列；布置\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The goods are set out in the shop window. 商品陈列在商店的橱窗里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took them an hour to set out the room ready for the reception. 他们花了一小时把房间布置好，准备开招待会。</font>\n<br>5. start to do sth. 开始；着手\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set out to perform the opera tion. 他们开始动手术。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are setting out on a new ex periment. 他们正着手进行一项新的试验。</font>\n<br>6. state; describe; define 陈述；叙述；说明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set out his ideas in simple Eng lish. 他用简单的英文表达了他的想法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He carefully set out all the facts. 他仔细陈述了全部事实。</font>\n
set sail	<font color=blue size=4>set sail</font>\n<br>begin a sea voyage 启航\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship set sail for Europe. 这船启航驶往欧洲。</font>\n
settle accounts with	<font color=blue size=4>settle accounts with</font>\n<br>pay what one owes 同…算清账\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He used to settle accounts with the grocer at the end of each month. 他总是每月底同杂货商结账。</font>\n
settle down	<font color=blue size=4>settle down</font>\n<br>1. have a regular place to live and a regular job; begin a normal, sta ble life 生活和工作安顿下来；安居乐业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John will settle down after he gets a job and gets married. 约翰在找到工作并且结婚以后才会安顿下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many people settle down in San Diego because of the fine weather. 许多人在圣地亚哥安居下来，因为那儿的气候宜人。</font>\n<br>2. become calm, quiet or peaceful 安静下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house settled down for the night after the children were put to bed. 夜晚孩子们被安顿上床后，这所房子就平静下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children settled down when their teacher entered. 老师进来以后，孩子们就安静下来了。</font>\n<br>3. begin to concentrate on 开始专心于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were so many distractions that we were unable to settle down to studying. 有那么多令人分心的事，我们无法安下心来学习。</font>\n<br>4. sit or lie comfortably 舒服地坐着或躺着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She settled down in the back of the car and fell asleep quickly. 她舒服地坐在汽车后座上，很快就睡着了。</font>\n
settle for	<font color=blue size=4>settle for</font>\n<br>accept sth. which is not as good as one hoped for 接受；满足于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wanted to be a lawyer but she had to settle for being a secretary. 她想当一名律师，但后来甘愿当了名秘书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is so keen to sell his houses that he is willing to settle for less than the asking price. 他急于想出售他的房子，所以他愿意接受低于开价的价格。</font>\n
settle in	<font color=blue size=4>settle in</font>\n<br>move in and put things in order 迁入新居并安顿好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must come and see our new house when we've settled in. 等我们安顿好了，你一定来看看我们的新居。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They got into Dolon and settled in at an outoftheway inn. 他们来到多伦，在一家偏僻的旅店里住了下来。</font>\n
settle on	<font color=blue size=4>settle on</font>\n<br>1. decide or agree on 决定或达成一致意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wanted blue and I wanted yel low, so we settled on green. 她要蓝的，我要黄的，最后我们决定要绿的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know what dress she finally settled on. 我不知道她最后选定了什么样的衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We finally sttled on Greece for our holiday. 我们最后决定去希腊度假。</font>\n<br>2. land on 降落于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bird settled on the branch and folded its wings. 鸟落在树枝上，收起了翅膀。</font>\n<br>3. give (money or property) for mally to sb. 正式把（钱、财）给予\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She settled a small sum on each of her children. 她给每个孩子一小笔钱。</font>\n
settle up	<font color=blue size=4>settle up</font>\n<br>pay a bill or debt 结账或付债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked the waiter for the bill, and settled up. 他向侍者要来了账单，结了帐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You paid for the theatre tickets and the meal. I'd better settle up with you now. 你付了戏票和饭钱，现在我们最好把帐结了。</font>\n
settle with	<font color=blue size=4>settle with</font>\n<br>take revenge on 向…报复\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll settle with him one day for telling people I am a thief. 我总有一天会向他报复的，因为他对别人说我是个小偷。</font>\n
set to	<font color=blue size=4>set to</font>\n<br>1. start to do sth. eagerly 积极地做某事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set to and cleaned the whole house in two hours. 他们开始打扫屋子，两个小时就打扫完了。</font>\n<br>2. begin arguing or fighting 开始争吵或打架\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys set to and the teacher could hardly separate them. 男孩们打架了，老师简直无法把他们分开。</font>\n
set up	<font color=blue size=4>set up</font>\n<br>1. put upright; raise 竖立；升起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set up some stones as land marks. 他们竖起一些石头当界碑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An improvised platform was set up in the market square. 集市场上搭起了一座临时讲台。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set up a notice on the wall. 他们在墙上贴出一张通告。</font>\n<br>2. construct; found 建立；设立；创立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They set up a committee to investi gate the matter. 他们成立了一个委员会来调查这件事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school has set up a special class to help poor readers. 学校专门办了一个班来帮助阅读能力差的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government has set up a tri bunal to examine the problem. 政府设置了专门法庭来审查这个问题。</font>\n<br>3. achieve or establish 创造（纪录等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The French team set up a new record at tonight's meeting. 在今晚的会上法国队创了一个新纪录。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have set up a new record for the flight to Beijing. 他们创造了一项飞往北京的飞行纪录。</font>\n<br>4. put forward; propose 提出；提议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have set up a new opinion re garding the case. 他们对此事提出了一个新的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What defence did his counsel set up in the trial? 审判时他的律师提出了什么辩护？</font>\n<br>5. extol as a model 树立；推崇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is setting up an example by persisting in manual labour. 他在坚持体力劳动方面树立了榜样。</font>\n<br>6. help sb. start a business by pro viding the money required 帮助（某人）从事（某种）职业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His father set him up in a restau rant. 他父亲帮他开了个饭店。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack was set up in business by a rel ative. 杰克在一个亲戚的资助下开始经商。</font>\n<br>7. make proud or vain 使居高自傲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be set up about your success. 不要有了成就就骄傲自满。</font>\n<br>8. make a claim 自称；自命为…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sets himself up as an expert in this field. 他自认为是这个领域的专家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set himself up to be a graduate of a medical school, but he was not. 他自称是医科毕业生，其实不是。</font>\n<br>9. cause or produce sth. 引起；产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy rain set up dangerous conditions on the motorway. 大雨造成了公路上的危险状况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ocean tides are set up by the pull between the earth and the moon. 海潮是地球与月球之间的引力引起的。</font>\n<br>10. cause to be heard 大声发出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She set up a shout that might have frightened anyone. 她扯开嗓子大喊了一声，声音之大真会把人吓一跳。</font>\n<br>11. make sb. feel healthier, hap pier, etc. 使振作；使高兴\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My holiday really set me up for the winter. 我的休假确实让我在冬天变得强壮。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was set up by the unex pected praise. 意想不到的表扬使这个男孩感到振奋。</font>\n<br>12. make a gift of; treat 馈赠；请…客\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He set me up to a nice dinner that night. 那天晚上他请我吃了一顿丰盛的晚饭。</font>\n<br>13. put in type 排版；印刷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has set the text up. 他把文稿排完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book will be published shortly; the type is being set up now. 这本书正在排印，不久就可以出版。</font>\n
set (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>set (up) on</font>\n<br>1. attack 袭击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom was walking through the park when a gang of boys set on him. 汤姆穿过公园时，一群男孩袭击了他。</font>\n<br>2. cause to attack 使袭击；唆使\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some boys want to steal melons but the farmer set his dog on them. 有些男孩想偷瓜，那个农民就放出狗去咬他们。</font>\n<br>3. be determined on 决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John is set on playing cricket for England. 约翰已决定为英格兰打板球。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My wife is set on having that fur coat. 我妻子一心想买那件皮大衣。</font>\n
sew up	<font color=blue size=4>sew up</font>\n<br>1. mend completely by sewing 缝合；缝补好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sewed the tear up. 她缝好了撕破的口子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cut in his finger was sewn up with a piece of fine silk. 他手指上的伤口是用细丝线缝合起来的。</font>\n<br>2. complete or settle 解决；顺利完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was determined to sew up the deal defore the meeting ended. 他决定在会议结束前做成交易。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the details of the project are sewn up. 这项工程的细节已经全部定了下来。</font>\n
shake down	<font color=blue size=4>shake down</font>\n<br>1. cause to fall by shaking 摇落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He shook some pears down from the tree. 他从树上摇落下几个梨子。</font>\n<br>2. become used to a new place of work, way of living, etc. 适应下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll soon shake down at the new post. 你很快就会适应新的工作岗位的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy will soon shake down at his new school. 孩子很快就会适应他的新学校。</font>\n<br>3. take up temporary quarters; sleep 临时寄宿；睡觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's spread the blankets on the floor; we can shake down on them for the night. 我们在地板上铺了几条毯子，这样就能在地铺上过夜了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's shake down here. 我们就睡这儿吧。</font>\n
shake off	<font color=blue size=4>shake off</font>\n<br>1. remove by shaking 抖落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stamped his feet to shake the snow off his boots. 他跺了跺脚，把靴子上的雪抖掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog shook off the drops of water. 那狗抖落掉身上的水珠。</font>\n<br>2. escape from sb. 逃脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a threemile chase through the woods, he was able to shake off the police. 他在树林中被警察追了3英里，终于把他们甩掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our pilot dived into a bank of cloud and shook off the enemy fighters. 我们的飞行员驾机钻入云层，甩掉了敌人的战斗机。</font>\n<br>3. free oneself from (trouble, ill ness) 摆脱（麻烦、病）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't seem to shake off this fever. 这次发烧我似乎好不了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only in this way can we shake off their evil influence. 只有这样我们才能摆脱掉他们的恶劣影响。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She found it difficult to shake off this feeling. 她感到很难摆脱这种情绪。</font>\n
shake up	<font color=blue size=4>shake up</font>\n<br>1. shake as fully as possible 摇匀；摇松\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must shake up the medicine each time before you take it. 每次服药前都必须把药摇匀。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shake them all up together. 把它们摇匀。</font>\n<br>2. disturb; agitate 干扰；震动；震惊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The notice about a cut in pay shook up everybody in the office. 减薪的通知使办公室里人人忧心忡忡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news shook him up a bit. 那消息使他有点震惊。</font>\n<br>3. rouse by shaking 激励；使振作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Shake yourself up, young man. 振作起来，年轻人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope her closeness to failure in the exam will shake her up. 我希望她这次考试几乎失败能使她清醒起来。</font>\n
shape up	<font color=blue size=4>shape up</font>\n<br>1. assume a shape 形成；成型\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Try to shape up your work in the next few weeks. 设法在下几周内把你的工作搞出个样子来。</font>\n<br>2. make progress 取得进步\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How are the new boys in your team shaping up? 你们队里新来的小伙子现在取得了什么进展？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These students are shaping up well. 这些学生正在顺利成长。</font>\n
share in	<font color=blue size=4>share in</font>\n<br>have a share or part in 分享；分担\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wished we were there to share in his joy. 他希望我们在那儿共享他的喜悦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She shares in his troubles as well as in his joy. 她与他同患难，共欢乐。</font>\n
share out	<font color=blue size=4>share out</font>\n<br>divide and assign in portions 分配；分摊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The money has been shared out. 钱已经分了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>See that these things are shared out fairly. 设法使这些东西得到公平分配。</font>\n

shoot out	<font color=blue size=4>shoot out</font>\n<br>emerge quickly and suddenly from somewhere 猛然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rice was shooting out into ears. 稻子已经抽穗了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The snake shot out its tongue. 蛇猛地伸出舌头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was shot out of the seat as the two cars collided. 两车相撞时，他被甩出了座位。</font>\n
shoot up	<font color=blue size=4>shoot up</font>\n<br>1. grow rapidly 迅速成长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he was thirteen years old, Billy began to shoot up. 贝利从13岁起，个子就开始猛长。</font>\n<br>2. arise suddenly 突然升起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As we watched, flames shot up from the roof of the house. 我们看着看着，火焰突然从屋顶窜起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rents in that city have shot up in the last few months. 最近几个月那城市的房租又涨了。</font>\n<br>3. shoot recklessly and hurt badly 乱枪射伤（射坏）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gunfighters shot up the town. 持枪者开枪扫射整个城镇。</font>\n

I'm short of breath. 我得歇一歇，我喘不过气来了。</font>\n<br>2. away from 远离…；距离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The day's drive still left us a hun dred miles short of the ocean. 车跑了一天，我们离海边还有一百英里。</font>\n

show up	<font color=blue size=4>show up</font>\n<br>1. make known the real truth about 使了解真相；揭露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man said that he was a mind reader, but he was shown up a fake. 那人说他能知道别人在想什么，但他实际上是一个骗子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All their deceptions have been shown up by their own deeds. 他们的种种欺骗都被自己的行为揭穿了。</font>\n<br>2. become or make easy to see 使显露\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The detective put a chemical on the paper, and the fingerprints showed up. 侦探在纸上涂了化学试剂，指纹就显示了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sun shows up the dirt on the windows. 阳光下，窗户上的污迹都显露了出来。</font>\n<br>3. appear; come 出席；到来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had agreed to meet at the gym, but Larry didn't show up. 我们商量好在体育馆见面，但拉里没有来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We thought that you were never going to show up. 我们以为你永远都不会露面了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He showed up an hour late. 他来了，迟到了一小时。</font>\n<br>4. make sb. feel shame 使…难堪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When we go to dinner parties my husband always shows me up with the rude jokes he tells. 每次我们去参加宴会，我丈夫总是开些粗俗的玩笑，使我很难堪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He showed his parents up rather badly. 他给他父母丢尽了脸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My friend always shows me up by laughing too loudly in the theatre. 我朋友总在电影院里放声大笑，使我很尴尬。</font>\n
shrug off	<font color=blue size=4>shrug off</font>\n<br>dismiss sth. as not worth worrying about 轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't shrug off all your re sponsibilities onto other people. 你不能对你的职责置之不理，而全推到别人身上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She just shrugged the whole matter off. 她对整个这件事不屑一顾。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Adam shrugged off our questions; he would not tell us what had hap pened. 亚当回避我们的问题，不愿告诉我们发生了什么事。</font>\n

shut away	<font color=blue size=4>shut away</font>\n<br>lock away; isolate 锁住；隔绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They feel very shut away in that remote little cottage. 他们觉得在那座偏远的小屋里非常闭塞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim shut himself away for a month to catch up on his academic work. 杰姆为赶写他的学术著作闭门谢客一个月。</font>\n

shut in	<font color=blue size=4>shut in</font>\n<br>lock in; enclose 禁闭；围住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She feels rather shut in in this house. 她觉得简直是被关在这屋子里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town is shut in by high hills on everyside. 这城镇四面环山。</font>\n
shut off	<font color=blue size=4>shut off</font>\n<br>1. make (water or electricity) stop coming 切断（水、电）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please shut off the hose before the grass gets too wet. 请及时关掉水管，以免草地太湿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have shut off the water sup ply. 他们已切断了水源。</font>\n<br>2. be apart; be separated from 被隔绝；被隔离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our camp is so far from the highway that we feel shut off from the world when we are there. 我们的营地离公路很远，所以我们在那儿时有种与世隔绝的感觉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They feel shut off from all human contact on this island. 他们觉得在这岛上与人世隔绝了。</font>\n<br>3. separate…from 使…隔开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pig was so bad tempered that we had to shut it off from its young. 那头猪脾气很坏，我们只好把它与猪仔分开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The road is shut off from traffic. 此路禁止车辆行驶。</font>\n

shut out	<font color=blue size=4>shut out</font>\n<br>1. exclude; lock out 排斥；遮住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The late comers werer shut out. 晚到的人都被关在门外。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you close the door, you can shut out the noise. 关上那扇门，你就能把噪音隔在外边。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They shut out the dust by having double windows. 他们安装双重窗来挡尘土。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He pulled down the blinds to shut out the sunlight. 他拉下百叶窗挡住阳光。</font>\n<br>2. prevent from scoring in a game （在比赛中）使（对方）不能得分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our team hasn't shut out once this season. 本赛季我们球队每场都赢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our school basketball team shut out the visiting team at the game yesterday. 在昨天的比赛中，我校篮球队击败了客队。</font>\n
shut up	<font color=blue size=4>shut up</font>\n<br>1. prevent from coming in; block 阻止进入；阻拦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During World WarⅡ Malta managed to shut up most of the Italian and German bombers by throwing up an effective antiaircraft screen. 在第二次世界大战期间，马耳他通过建立有效的防空屏障，成功地阻止了意大利和德国轰炸机的袭击。</font>\n<br>2. prevent (an opposing team) from scoring throughout an entire game 使对方在整个比赛中得不到分\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dodgers shut up the Reds, 5∶ 0. 道乔队以5∶0打败红队。</font>\n<br>3. (cause to) stop talking（使）停止讲话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Little Ruthie told Father everything before Mother could shut her up. 母亲还来不及阻止小鲁思，她就把什么都告诉了父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He shut up when he realized nobody was listening to him. 当意识到没人在听时，他住嘴了。</font>\n<br>4. cease or suspend an operation or business 停止或暂停工作或营业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There'll be an important meeting this evening, so we'll shut up early today. 晚上有一个重要会议，因此今天我们将提前下班。</font>\n<br>5. close the doors and windows of 关好门窗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We got the house shut up only minutes before the storm came. 暴风雨来临之前几分钟，我们才把屋子的门窗关好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The shop was shut up at nine at night. 商店晚上9点关门。</font>\n<br>5. confine 禁闭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog bites. It should be shut up. 这狗咬人，该把它关起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He shut the girl up in the house and refused to allow her to leave. 他把女孩关在屋里，不许她离开。</font>\n
shy away/off	<font color=blue size=4>shy away/off</font>\n<br>avoid sth. which is unpleasant, difficult, etc. 回避；离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After one term as City Councilman, Smith shied away from politics. 当了一任市议员后，史密斯就离开了政界。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She shies away from anybody touching her. 她总是避开碰她的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The horse shied off when I tried to mount it. 正当我想骑上那匹马时，它却惊得连连后退。</font>\n
shy of	<font color=blue size=4>shy of</font>\n<br>1. not bold; nervous in the company of others; not putting oneself forward 羞怯的；畏缩的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Small children are often shy of anyone they do not know. 儿童在生人面前往往显得腼腆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't be sky of telling me what you want. 不要有顾虑，需要些什么，尽管告诉我。</font>\n<br>2. lacking 不足的；缺乏的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They need a loan because they are shy of funds now. 他们手头资金短缺，正需贷款。</font>\n
sick of	<font color=blue size=4>sick of</font>\n<br>tired of; disliking 厌腻；不喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sick of winter; why doesn't spring come? 我讨厌冬天，春天为什么还不来呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone got sick of his smoking in the classroom. 大家都讨厌他在教室里抽烟。</font>\n
side by side	<font color=blue size=4>side by side</font>\n<br>close together 在一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two boys played side by side all afternoon. 这两个男孩整个下午一直在一起玩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must stand side by side in our days of trouble. 在困难的日子里，我们一定要并肩站在一起。</font>\n
side with	<font color=blue size=4>side with</font>\n<br>agree with; help 赞同；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Adam always sides with John in an argument. 争论时亚当总是支持约翰。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Actually very few people sided with their reform plan. 事实上，很少有人赞同他们的改革计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always sided with his mother. 他总站在母亲一边。</font>\n
sigh for	<font color=blue size=4>sigh for</font>\n<br>long for 渴望；怀念\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is sighing for home and friends. 他在思念家人和朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Old men quite often sighed for the happy days of their youth. 老年人往往思慕他们青年时代的愉快岁月。</font>\n
sign away	<font color=blue size=4>sign away</font>\n<br>formally give up rights, property, money, etc. by signing a document 签字放弃（权利等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He signed away his share of the house to his daughter. 他签字把他那份房产让与女儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He later regretted that he signed away his right to his mother's estate. 他后悔他签字放弃了继承他母亲遗产的权利。</font>\n
sign in	<font color=blue size=4>sign in</font>\n<br>indicate one's arrival by signing a register 签到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Teachers go to the office and sign in each morning before going to their classrooms. 教师们每天早晨先到办公室签到，然后去教室上课。</font>\n
sign off	<font color=blue size=4>sign off</font>\n<br>1. mark the end of a radio or television programme for the day 结束广播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is your favorite announcer signing off for tonight. 这是你最喜欢的播音员在结束今晚的广播。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The local station signs off at midnight. 地方台午夜停止广播。</font>\n<br>2. end a letter 结束书信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must sign off now. Love, Mary. 就止停笔。爱你的，玛丽。</font>\n<br>3. stop work for the day 停止工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Because of the snow, we signed off at three o'clock. 由于下雪，我们3点钟就下班了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man signed off work at half past six. 那人在6点半下班。</font>\n
sign on	<font color=blue size=4>sign on</font>\n<br>1. sign an agreement to work for a company; join a team 签约受雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He signed on yesterday and will start work on Monday. 他昨天签订了合同，星期一就要上班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He signed on for another six years. 他签约再工作6年。</font>\n<br>2. begin a radio programme for the day 电台开始广播\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The BBC signs on at six o'clock every morning. BBC 广播每天早上6点开始广播。</font>\n<br>3. register as unemployed at an office of the Department of Health and Social Security in Britain 在英国就业部地方办事处办理失业登记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the steel works closed, a thousand men had to sign on . 当钢铁厂关闭时, 1000名工人只得去办理失业登记手续。</font>\n
sign out	<font color=blue size=4>sign out</font>\n<br>indicate one's departure by signing a register 签名登记离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We signed out of college on Friday evening and returned on Monday morning. 我们星期五晚上登记离校，星期一早上回校。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll sign them out and guarantee their good behavior. 我给他们签字放行，保证他们行为端正。</font>\n
sign up	<font color=blue size=4>sign up</font>\n<br>1. join by signing 签约受雇；招收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our factory signed up a number of young workers last week. 上周我厂招收了一批青年工人。</font>\n<br>2. arrange a contact with 跟…安排合同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They managed to sign up all the best performers. 他们设法跟所有最佳演员签订了合同。</font>\n
similar to	<font color=blue size=4>similar to</font>\n<br>like; resembling 类似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His views are similar to mine. 他的看法和我相似。</font>\n
single out	<font color=blue size=4>single out</font>\n<br>select one person or thing from among many for special treatment 挑选出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all did well, but the teacher singled him out for praise. 我们都做得很好，但老师就表扬了他一个人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seems to have been singled out for all the nasty jobs. 他似乎是被挑出来专干脏活的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know why they keep singling me out for abuse? 我不知道他们为什么专喜欢骂我。</font>\n
sing out	<font color=blue size=4>sing out</font>\n<br>1. sing loudly 大声唱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children sang out lustily. 孩子们拉开嗓门使劲地唱。</font>\n<br>2. call out loudly 大声叫喊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you need anything, just sing out and I'll come. 如果你要什么的话，就大声喊我，我会来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bell sang out the hour of midnight. 钟声报出了午夜12点。</font>\n
sink/soak in	<font color=blue size=4>sink/soak in</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) sink into 陷入；沉入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the ink sinks in it'll be hard to remove the spot from the cloth. 布一沾到墨水，墨迹就很难洗净。</font>\n<br>2. be absorbed, understood or acknowledged 被充分理解或领会\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think it has finally sunk in that she must be more careful: she won't forget her passport again！我想她终于领悟到她必须更加小心，她再也不会忘了她的护照！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everybody laughed at the joke but Joe; it took a moment for it to sink in before he laughed too. 除了乔每个人都被这笑话逗乐了，过了一会儿他完全理解过来也笑了。</font>\n
sit about/around	<font color=blue size=4>sit about/around</font>\n<br>sit and do nothing 懒洋洋地闲坐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sat around all day and watched me clean the house. 她整天闲坐着看我打扫房子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't just sit about and dream！不要只是呆坐着梦想！</font>\n
sit back	<font color=blue size=4>sit back</font>\n<br>1. relax and do nothing 休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's marvellous to be able to sit back after a day's hard work. 一天辛劳工作后能坐下来休息休息真是太美妙了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Get on with the work; this is not time to sit back. 干活吧，这会儿可不是坐下来休息的时候。</font>\n<br>2. be inactive; become a spectator 不采取行动；旁观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's happy just to sit back and let others make the decision. 他真乐意袖手旁观而让别人作决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you expect me to sit back and do nothing? 你希望我袖手旁观什么也不干吗？</font>\n
sit by	<font color=blue size=4>sit by</font>\n<br>1. stay near; watch and care for 守护照料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother sat by her sick baby all night. 母亲通宵在生病的婴儿身边照料。</font>\n<br>2. observe but fail to act as needed 袖手旁观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even when his daughter was in trouble, he just sat by and did not help. 即使他女儿陷入困境时，他也袖手旁观不予支持。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't just sit idly by while the other children are all busy. 别的孩子都正忙着，你不要闲着什么也不干。</font>\n
sit down	<font color=blue size=4>sit down</font>\n<br>1. sit on a seat or resting place 坐下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the gym class Jim was tired and was glad to sit down and rest. 体育课结束后，吉姆很累，因此很高兴能坐下来休息。</font>\n<br>2. sit on the ground to express opposition 静坐反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the students sat down and refused to leave the building. 所有的学生都静坐，拒绝离开大楼。</font>\n<br>3. suffer without protest or complaint 逆来顺受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I couldn't sit down any longer. 我再也无法忍受下去了。</font>\n
sit for	<font color=blue size=4>sit for</font>\n<br>1. take an examination 应（考）；参加（考试）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His teachers said he should sit for university. 他老师都说，他应该参加高考。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sat for a scholarship and got one. 他参加了争取奖学金的考试，并得到了奖学金。</font>\n<br>2. be a member of parliament for a certain place 代表…在议会占一个席位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sits for a town in Cambridgeshire. 他是剑桥郡一个市镇选区选出的议员。</font>\n
sit in	<font color=blue size=4>sit in</font>\n<br>1. sit in a place, for a special purpose 为某一特殊目的而坐在某处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sits in with the patients while the nurse has a rest. 护士休息的时候，他坐在那儿照看病人。</font>\n<br>2. replace 临时代替\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The president is ill tonight so the secretary will be sitting in for her as chairman at the meeting. 主席今晚生病，因此秘书将代她主持会议。</font>\n<br>3. demonstrate by sitting in a place 坐某处示威\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students have been sitting in for the last two weeks. 上两个星期学生一直在静坐示威。</font>\n<br>4. babysit 替人临时照看婴孩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When her son and daughter-in-law went to the cinema, she had to sit in with their child. 她儿子、儿媳去看电影时，她得替他们照看孩子。</font>\n
sit in on	<font color=blue size=4>sit in on</font>\n<br>attend as a visitor or an observer 作为来访客人参加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The professor said I could sit in on his linguistics lectures. 教授说我可以旁听他的语言学课程。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our teacher was invited to sit in on the conference. 我们的老师应邀列席会议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sat in on the whole debate. 整个辩论她都在场。</font>\n
sit on	<font color=blue size=4>sit on</font>\n<br>1. continue to sit 继续坐着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sat on until someone agreed to help. 她一直坐到有人同意帮忙为止。</font>\n<br>2. delay taking action on sth. 搁置；压下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have been sitting on my job application for weeks. 他们把我的求职申请压了好几个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For weeks they did nothing about my case; they just sat on it. 他们好几个星期拒不审理我的案子，他们就是拖。</font>\n<br>3. serve as a member of 当…的一个成员\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mr. Brown sat on the jury at the trial. 布朗先生担任陪审员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been sitting on the English committee ever since he came to university. 一进大学他就成了英语协会的一员。</font>\n<br>4. quickly subdue sb. who behaves rudely or impertinently 申斥；压制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her brother sat on her firmly whenever she was too noisy or silly. 每当她太吵或太蠢时，她哥哥都要训斥她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher sat on Jack as soon as he began showing off. 杰克一开始卖弄小聪明，老师就马上加以制止。</font>\n
sit out	<font color=blue size=4>sit out</font>\n<br>1. remain seated during a dance 坐着不跳舞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think I'll sit out the next dance; I'm tired. 下一个舞我不想跳了，我很累。</font>\n<br>2. stay until the end of (a play) 看完（戏）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I decided to sit out the rest of the film although I was not especially enjoying it, but my friends were. 虽然我并不太喜欢这部电影，可是我的朋友们喜欢，因此我决定还是把它看完。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was a tedious show and very few people sat it out. 那部电影冗长乏味，很少有人坚持看完的。</font>\n<br>3. stay longer than 比…留得久\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was her turn to leave, but she decided to sit the other women out. 该她走了，可她却决定等其他妇女都走后再离开。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wonder which of the visitors will sit out the other. 我不知道两位客人中哪一位坐得更久。</font>\n<br>4. sit out of doors 坐在室外\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Isn't it nice when the sun is warm enough for us to sit out? 太阳暖洋洋，我们坐到室外去不是很好吗？</font>\n
sit through	<font color=blue size=4>sit through</font>\n<br>watch or listen until sth. is finished 看完或听完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though he was busy, he sat through the performance of the play. 尽管忙，他还是坚持看完这剧的演出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to sit through the first half of the film without the sound. 电影的前半部分我们是在无声中看完的。</font>\n
sit tight	<font color=blue size=4>sit tight</font>\n<br>1. make no move or change 坐着不动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother told her little son to sit tight until she came back. 母亲告诉孩子坐着不要动，等她回来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sit tight; I'll be ready to go in a few minutes. 等等，我一会儿就走。</font>\n<br>2. stick to one's opinion 坚持意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was unable to dissuade him. He is still sitting tight with regard to his opinion that he ought to leave his present job. 我无法劝阻他，他仍然固执己见，要辞去他现在的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Both of them sat tight with their own arguments. 他俩各执己见，互不相让。</font>\n
sit up	<font color=blue size=4>sit up</font>\n<br>1. move into a sitting position 坐起身来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe sat up when he heard the knock on his bedroom door. 乔听到有人敲寝室的门，就坐起身来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sat the old man up in bed. 她扶老人起来坐在床上。</font>\n<br>2. stay awake instead of going to bed 迟睡；熬夜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. Jones will sit up until both of her daughters get home from the dance. 琼斯夫人要等到她两个女儿跳舞回来后再休息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll be late tonight. Don't sit up for me. 今晚我回来得迟，不要等我。</font>\n<br>3. be surprised 惊讶\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Janice really sat up when I told her the gossip about Tom. 当我把有关汤姆的流言蜚语告诉詹妮丝时，她确实很惊讶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should have seen them all sit up as soon as I mentioned money. 你应该注意到，当我一提起钱的时候，他们个个都警觉了起来。</font>\n
sit with	<font color=blue size=4>sit with</font>\n<br>1. be accepted by 被接受（常用于否定句或疑问句中）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did your story sit with your mother? 你编造的假话你母亲相信吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob's poor sportsmanship does not sit well with the coach. 鲍勃不守运动道德，教练对此很恼火。</font>\n<br>2. nurse or attend sb. who is ill 照看病人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You go to bed for an hour; I'll sit with your mother while you are asleep. 你去睡一小时，我来帮你照看你母亲。</font>\n
size up	<font color=blue size=4>size up</font>\n<br>decide what one thinks about or form an opinion about 考虑或估量\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Give Joe an hour to size up the situation and he'll tell you what to do next. 给乔一个小时分析一下形势，然后他会告诉你下一步该怎么办。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the outlook sizes up at this time, we are going to have another good harvest this year. 照目前的情况看来，我们今年又将获得丰收。</font>\n
skate on thin ice	<font color=blue size=4>skate on thin ice</font>\n<br>take a chance; risk danger 如履薄冰；冒险\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A politician would be skating on thin ice if he took a stand in opposition to a popular cause. 一个政治家如果反对群众欢迎的事，那将是十分危险的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If I were you, I wouldn't do it that way. As it is, I think you're skating on thin ice. 要是我，我决不会那样干。就眼下情况看，我认为你是在冒险。</font>\n
skeleton in the closet	<font color=blue size=4>skeleton in the closet</font>\n<br>a shameful secret in a family 家丑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The skeleton in our family closet was Uncle Willie. No one mentioned him because he drank too much. 我们家见不得人的是威利叔叔，他喝酒太多，因此没有人提起他。</font>\n
sketch out	<font color=blue size=4>sketch out</font>\n<br>draw roughly, 草拟；概略地叙述\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sketched out his plan, so that we had some idea of what he would do. 他概略地叙述了他的计划，使我们对他的打算有所了解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sketched out the general picture first. 他先把整幅画粗略地画了出来。</font>\n
skim through	<font color=blue size=4>skim through</font>\n<br>read quickly through 浏览\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have just skimmed through the book; I intend to read it thoroughly when I get more time. 这本书我只是浏览了一下，打算以后有充裕的时间再精读它。</font>\n
skip off/out	<font color=blue size=4>skip off/out</font>\n<br>leave without attracting attention 悄悄离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He skipped off quickly when the waiter brought us the bill. 侍者拿来账单时，他很快溜走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is always skipping out when there is washingup to be done. 当要洗碗时，她总是悄悄溜走。</font>\n
skip over	<font color=blue size=4>skip over</font>\n<br>pass over; omit; ignore 略过；遗漏；忽视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's skip over these points and come to the main argument. 我们略过这几点来看看主要论点吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll skip over your rudeness. 我不会计较你的粗鲁。</font>\n
slap down	<font color=blue size=4>slap down</font>\n<br>1. slam down 砰地摔下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A boy in uniform came into the shop, slapped a telegram down on the counter, and went out without waiting for a reply. 一个穿制服的小伙子走进店铺，把一封电报啪地一声放在柜台上，不等答话就走了。</font>\n<br>2. firmly prevent sb. from doing sth. 坚决阻止；斥责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He soon slapped her down when she wanted to speak. 她想说话时，他很快阻止了她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone who speaks out of turn in the Old Man's presence is liable to be slapped down. 谁要是在老板面前随随便便说话都会遭到严厉训斥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Any attempt at reform was quickly slapped down. 进行改革的任何企图都很快地遭到压制。</font>\n<br>3. reduce in stature or humiliate, as if by slapping 灭…的威风；羞辱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time someone slapped him down. 该是杀杀他威风的时候了。</font>\n
slap in the face	<font color=blue size=4>slap in the face</font>\n<br>1. an insult; a disappointment 侮辱；失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The minister's decision was a slap in the face to those who had tried to change his mind. 部长的决定等于是在那些企图使他改变主意的人的脸上打了一记耳光。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Susan thought it was a slap in the face when her boyfriend invited another girl to the dance. 苏珊认为她男友邀另一女孩去跳舞对她是一种侮辱。</font>\n<br>2. insult; embarrass; make feel bad 侮辱某人；使某人不快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't want to slap her in the face by not coming to her party. 我不想由于不参加她的晚会而使她扫兴。</font>\n
sleep off	<font color=blue size=4>sleep off</font>\n<br>get rid of by sleeping 以睡眠消除；以睡眠治愈\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is suffering from headache and I tell her to sleep it off. 她头痛，我告诉她睡一睡就会好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is in a bad mood today, but he'll sleep it off. 他今天情绪不好，不过睡一觉就会好的。</font>\n
sleep on	<font color=blue size=4>sleep on</font>\n<br>have a night's sleep before making a decision about sth. 把某事留待第2天解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't decide what to do. I'll sleep on it and let you know tomorrow. 我现在定不下来该怎么做，今天晚上好好想想，明天告诉你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's sleep on it and try again tomorrow. 我们把问题留待明天再设法解决吧。</font>\n
slide over	<font color=blue size=4>slide over</font>\n<br>pass over quickly; barely touch upon 略过；稍为触及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is not a matter that can be slid over; let's discuss it openly. 这不是一个可以随便滑过去的问题，还是让我们坦率地加以讨论吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may slide over the problem now, but I'm quite sure it will crop up again one day. 眼下你可以回避这个问题，不过，我相信这问题有一天还会出现的。</font>\n
slip away	<font color=blue size=4>slip away</font>\n<br>1. leave quietly 悄悄离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to slip away before the end of the meeting, so I'll sit at the back. 我想在会议结束前溜走，因此我要坐在后排。</font>\n<br>2. (of time) pass quickly（时间）过得很快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The summer has simply slipped away, but we've had such fun！夏天就这么过去了，可我们玩得真痛快！</font>\n
slip by	<font color=blue size=4>slip by</font>\n<br>pass away quietly（时间）悄悄过去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the years slipped by, I thought less about her. 随着岁月的流逝，我越来越不想她了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The afternoon slipped by very pleasantly. 一个下午很愉快地就过去了。</font>\n
slip into	<font color=blue size=4>slip into</font>\n<br>1. enter by sliding 滑过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car turned on the wet road and slipped into the fence. 汽车开上潮湿的路面，滑进了围栏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the door closes the catch slips into place. 门一关上，门扣就自动扣紧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be careful not to let errors slip into the proofs. 注意不要让校样中出现差错。</font>\n<br>2. enter silently or secretly 悄悄溜进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have to come late, so I'll slip into the room at the back if you will save me a place. 我会来迟一点，如果你愿意给我留个位子，我就从后面溜进屋去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Later, Mother slipped into the children's room to make sure they were all asleep. 过了一会儿，母亲悄悄走进孩子们的房间，看看他们睡着了没有。</font>\n<br>3. pass…into secretly 悄悄把…放入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She slipped a note into my hand when the teacher wasn't looking. 老师没注意看的时候，她把一张条子悄悄地塞进我的手里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He slipped a coin into the old man's hand. 他把一枚硬币塞入老人手中。</font>\n<br>4. put on quickly 匆忙穿上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After supper, he slipped into his overcoat and went out. 一吃完晚饭，他就披上大衣，出去了。</font>\n
slip off	<font color=blue size=4>slip off</font>\n<br>1. fall off by sliding unintentionally 不慎滑落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I thought I was safe on the branch, until my foot slipped off and I fell to the ground. 我本来认为我在树枝上很安全，但没想到我的脚滑了一下，摔到了地上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The blanket slipped off the bed. 毯子从床上滑落下来。</font>\n<br>2. leave quietly 悄悄溜走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary couldn't bear the party, so she slipped off while no one was looking. 玛丽不想再在晚会上呆下去，于是她趁没人注意时溜走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He slipped off without waiting for a reply. 他不等答复就溜走了。</font>\n<br>3. remove (clothes) quickly 急急脱掉（衣服）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He slipped his coat off and jumped into the river to save the drowning child. 他匆忙脱掉外套，跳入河中去抢救落水儿童。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He slipped off his clothes and went into the bathroom. 他迅速脱掉衣服走进浴室。</font>\n
slip of the pen	<font color=blue size=4>slip of the pen</font>\n<br>the mistake of writing sth. different from what one should or what one planned 笔误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That was a slip of the pen, I meant to write September, not November. 那是笔误，我原意是要写9月，不是11月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was by a slip of the pen that his letter was addressed to Hanzhong Road instead of Hankou Road. 由于笔误，他的信寄到了汉中路而没有寄到汉口路。</font>\n
slip of the tongue/lip	<font color=blue size=4>slip of the tongue/lip</font>\n<br>the mistake of saying sth. one had not wanted or planned to say; an error of speech 一时说错；失言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't mind what he said, because I knew it was only a slip of the tongue. 对他的话我并不介意，我知道他不过是一时说漏了嘴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't mean to tell our secret; it was a slip of the lip. 她无意泄漏我们的秘密，她是不小心说漏了嘴。</font>\n
slip on	<font color=blue size=4>slip on</font>\n<br>put on (clothes, etc.) quickly 迅速穿上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She slipped her shoes on. 她迅速穿上了鞋子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Slip your clothes on and come with me. 快穿上衣服跟我走。</font>\n
slip through one's fingers	<font color=blue size=4>slip through one's fingers</font>\n<br>escape without sb. 's knowing how 从某人指缝中溜掉；失去（机会）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mike earns a good wage, but he doesn't save a penny. Money just slips through his fingers. 迈克收入不错，但他不存一分钱，钱都被他花掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The opportunity will slip through your fingers if you do not seize it. 这个机会你不抓住的话，就会错过的。</font>\n
slip up	<font color=blue size=4>slip up</font>\n<br>make a mistake 失误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he had not slipped up on the last question, his score on the test would have been perfect. 最后一个问题如果他没出现失误的话，他的考试成绩就是满分了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be careful you don't slip up through overconfidence. 小心，别因过分自信而犯错误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He slipped up over that problem. 他在那个问题上搞错了。</font>\n
slow burn	<font color=blue size=4>slow burn</font>\n<br>a slowly increasing feeling of anger 渐渐的发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys kept teasing John, and watched him do a slow burn. 男孩们一直戏弄约翰，看他逐渐愤怒起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her slow burn ended when I explained everything that led to the misundersanding. 我讲明误会的来由后，她脸上的愠色渐渐退去。</font>\n
slow down	<font color=blue size=4>slow down</font>\n<br> (cause to) go more slowly than usual 减速\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The road was slippery so Mr. Jones slowed down the car. 路面太滑，于是琼斯先生就放慢车速。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There were signs at every curve in the road warning motorists to slow down. 每个转弯处都有要司机减速的标志。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should slow down a bit and lead a less hectic life. 你应该悠着点，过比较安静的生活。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has slowed down a lot since his heart attack, 自从心脏病发作以来，他行动迟缓多了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their objections are slowing down the progress of the engotiations. 由于他们的反对，谈判进展缓慢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should find some way to slow him down; he is taking on far too much work. 我们必须设法让他放松一点，他的工作太重了。</font>\n
slow in one's wits	<font color=blue size=4>slow in one's wits</font>\n<br>stupid; dull 愚笨\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is somewhat slow in his wits. 他有点笨。</font>\n
slow up	<font color=blue size=4>slow up</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) go more slowly（使）放慢速度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The truck slowed up as it approached the toll gate. 临近收费门时，卡车减了速。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's over sixty, but he shows no signs of slowing up. 他年逾六旬，但并不衰老迟钝。</font>\n<br>2. (of business) become less busy （生意）变得清淡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Business slows up at the stores after Christmas. 圣诞节后商店的生意就清淡下来。</font>\n
small talk	<font color=blue size=4>small talk</font>\n<br>informal conversation; idle chat 闲谈；聊天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A little small talk between strangers can sometimes lead to a longlasting relationship. 陌生人之间简短的聊天有时可能会导致长久的友谊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Havinng small talk with him is no fun because his mouth never stops moving. 跟他聊天没意思，因为他一直喋喋不休地谈个不停。</font>\n
smash up	<font color=blue size=4>smash up</font>\n<br>1. break up violently 打碎；破坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The place was badly smashed up in the airraids. 这个地方在空袭时被炸成一片废墟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole shop was smashed up. 整个商店都被捣毁了。</font>\n<br>2. crash and wreck 碰撞出事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car has been smashed up. 车被撞毁了。</font>\n
smell of	<font color=blue size=4>smell of</font>\n<br>strongly suggest sth. rather unpleasant 有…的气味；带有…的意味\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He smells of strong tobacco. 他身上有一股浓烈的烟草味。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole affair smells of plotting. 这整个事件都含有阴谋。</font>\n
smell out	<font color=blue size=4>smell out</font>\n<br>discover sth. by noticing certain signs 嗅出；察觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The trackerdog soon smelt the murderer out. 警犭很快就跟踪查出了凶手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We succeeded in smelling out the plot. 我们成功地侦破了那起阴谋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He says he can smell out trouble before it starts. 他说他能在麻烦事发生之前察觉出来。</font>\n
smile at	<font color=blue size=4>smile at</font>\n<br>1. direct a smile towards 对…微笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It often prevents an argument if you smile at people who are rude to you. 朝那些对你无礼的人微笑，就可以避免争吵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is smiling at me. 她在向我微笑。</font>\n<br>2. be amused by 对…觉得好笑；被…逗笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher smiled at my answer. 老师对我的回答笑了笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary smiled at John's menace. 玛丽对约翰的威胁一笑置之。</font>\n
smile on	<font color=blue size=4>smile on</font>\n<br>1. favor 对…有利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Fate smiled on him. 他运气好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>May fortune smile on you in your new life together！祝你们新婚幸福！</font>\n<br>2. smile at 对…微笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He smiled on the happy scene. 看到这令人高兴的情景他笑了。</font>\n
smile through one's tears	<font color=blue size=4>smile through one's tears</font>\n<br>smile while weeping 破涕为笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hearing of his arrival, she smiled through her tears. 听说他来了，她破涕为笑。</font>\n
smoke out	<font color=blue size=4>smoke out</font>\n<br>find out the facts about 查出；使…水落石出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took the police only a few days to smoke out the real criminal. 警察只花了几天时间就把真正的罪犯查出来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The object is to smoke out the instigators of the riots. 目的就是要查出暴乱的煽动者。</font>\n
smooth away	<font color=blue size=4>smooth away</font>\n<br>get rid of difficulties or problems 消除（困难）；排除障碍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With a bit of effort, we will smooth away any problems we encounter. 只要花一点努力，我们就能克服面临的任何困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her touch seemed to smooth away all his problems. 她的抚摸似乎消除了他所有的疑虑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The attendant smoothed away the slight irregularities in the running track. 跑道稍有一点不平，勤务人员就给平整过来。</font>\n
smooth down	<font color=blue size=4>smooth down</font>\n<br>1. make smooth 把…弄平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She smoothed her hair down. 她把头发抚摸平整。</font>\n<br>2. make calm; calm down 使平静；安静下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She tried to smooth down his temper. 她尽量使他心平气和下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope he can smooth the whole matter down. 我希望他能使这件事完全平息下去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sea gradually smoothed down. 海面逐渐平静下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Affairs have smoothed down since the cause of trouble was removed. 自从纠纷的起因消除后，事态就缓和下来了。</font>\n
smooth out	<font color=blue size=4>smooth out</font>\n<br>1. smooth until flat 弄平\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother brushed off the breadcrumbs and smoothed out the cloth. 母亲把面包屑刷掉，把桌布拉平。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child was told to fold up the quilt and smooth out the bedsheets, after he got up in the morning. 孩子被要求早上起床后，自己把被子迭好，把床单铺平。</font>\n<br>2. remove (difficulties, etc.) 消除（困难等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is good at smoothing these little problems out. 她善于解决这些小问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are some technical problems to be smoothed out before we can fly. 我们起飞前，还有一些技术问题要解决。</font>\n
smooth over	<font color=blue size=4>smooth over</font>\n<br>make smooth; put right 调停；解决；掩饰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was asked to smooth things over between them. 他被请来给他们调解纠纷。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill tried to smooth over his argument with Mary by making her laugh. 比尔试图逗玛丽发笑，以缓和他俩之间的争吵。</font>\n
snap at	<font color=blue size=4>snap at</font>\n<br>1. grab eagerly 急切地抓住（接受）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She snapped at the chance of going to America. 她急不可待地抓住了去美国的机会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He snapped at the offer I made him. 他连忙接受了我提供给他的东西。</font>\n<br>2. answer rudely 无礼地回答\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't try to be friendly to him; you'll only be snapped at. 对他不要客气，他只会对你很无礼。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She snapped at him when he asked her what she was going to do. 当他问她要干什么去时，她厉声回答了他。</font>\n<br>3. make a biting movement towards 对着…咬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog snapped at the stranger. 那狗朝着陌生人咬。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fish snapped at the bait. 鱼咬住了鱼饵。</font>\n
snap one's fingers at	<font color=blue size=4>snap one's fingers at</font>\n<br>show contempt for; show no respect for 蔑视；漠视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't snap your fingers at his proposal; I think it at least merits our consideration. 不要小看他的建议，我认为至少值得我们考虑考虑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John snapped his fingers at the sign that said″ Don't enter″, and he went into the door. 约翰漠视“不准进入”的牌子，进去了。</font>\n
snap out of	<font color=blue size=4>snap out of</font>\n<br>change quickly from a bad habit, mood, or feeling to a better one 摆脱某种精神状态；打起精神来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The coach told the lazy player to snap out of it. 教练要这个懒惰的球员改变作风。</font>\n
snap up	<font color=blue size=4>snap up</font>\n<br>1. take or buy sth. quickly and eagerly 把…抢到手；争购\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She snapped up a lot of bargains in the sales. 在拍卖中她抢到了许多便宜货。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't marry me soon, I'll be snapped up by somebody else！如果你还不快点娶我，我就会被别人抢走了！</font>\n<br>2. interrupt sb. sharply 抢白；突然打断（某人）的话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't mind a person criticizing me, but I do object to being snapped up in that fashion. 人家批评我，我没意见；可象那样抢白我，我反对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The counsel snapped up the witness who had made a slight slip in his statement. 当证人的证词略有差错时，律师就狠狠地打断了他的话。</font>\n
snatch at	<font color=blue size=4>snatch at</font>\n<br>try quickly and eagerly to seize or take advantage of 攫取（某物）；抓取（某物）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She snatched at the chance she was being offered. 她紧紧抓住提供给她的机会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He snatched at the letter but was not quick enough. 他想夺取那封信，但动作慢了点。</font>\n
sneer at	<font color=blue size=4>sneer at</font>\n<br>1. smile unpleasantly, curling the lip at sb. 对（某人）冷笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fighter sneered at his opponent, trying to make him feel threatened. 那拳击手朝他的对手冷笑，想镇住他。</font>\n<br>2. express a low opinion of sb. or sth. in strong words 轻视；嘲笑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't sneer at a child's efforts, however weak they may seem. 孩子的努力无论多么不起眼，也不要轻视。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's very discouraging to be sneered at all the time. 成天受讥笑是很令人泄气的。</font>\n
sneeze/sniff at	<font color=blue size=4>sneeze/sniff at</font>\n<br>think of as not important 认为不重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John finished third in a race with twenty other runners. That's nothing to be sneezed at. 约翰在有其他20名选手参加的赛跑中获得第3名，这是很了不起的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're silly to sniff at such a good opportunity. 你真蠢，这么个好机会被你拒绝了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His opinion is not to be sneezed at. 他的意见不可轻视。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't sniff at his effort. He's made great progress. 不要瞧不起他的努力，他已经取得了很大的进步。</font>\n
sniff out	<font color=blue size=4>sniff out</font>\n<br>discover or detect sth. 查出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to sniff out the reason for the unpleasant feelings between them. 他试图弄清造成他们两人不愉快的缘由。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's his job to sniff out abuses of power. 他的职责就是查究滥用权力的行为。</font>\n
snow under	<font color=blue size=4>snow under</font>\n<br>1. cover with snow; bury in snow 使盖满雪；把…埋在雪里\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cars were snowed under by drifts. 车辆被积雪盖没了。</font>\n<br>2. overwhelm with a large amount (of work, etc.) 压得喘不过气来；压倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm snowed under with work at the moment. I'm afraid I can't accept any more jobs. 这阵我工作忙得不可开交。恐怕我不能再接更多的活了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We really are snowed under with new orders. 我们对于新的订货确实忙不过来。</font>\n
snuff out	<font color=blue size=4>snuff out</font>\n<br>1. extinguish (a candle, a lamp, etc.) 熄灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A gust of wind snuffed out all the candles in the room. 一阵风吹灭了房里所有的蜡烛。</font>\n<br>2. put to an end 结束；扑灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The Government quickly snuffed out the rebellion in the army. 政府迅速镇压了部队里的叛乱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His hopes were nearly snuffed out. 他的希望几乎破灭了。</font>\n<br>3. die 死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will snuff out one of these days if he is not careful. 他如果不小心 , 总有一天会送命的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thousands of lives were snuffed out during the war. 战争夺去了成千上万人的生命。</font>\n
soak in	<font color=blue size=4>soak in</font>\n<br>absorb as much of sth. as possible 沉浸于…；专心致志于…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For a whole year, he soaked himself in the history of the Roman Empire. 整整一年，他专心于对罗马帝国历史的研究。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Study this document until you have soaked in all the details. 好好研究一下这份文件，把所有的细节都记住。</font>\n
soak up	<font color=blue size=4>soak up</font>\n<br>absorb; learn or remember 吸收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Charles soaks up facts as fast as the teacher gives them. 老师讲的东西，查尔斯一下子就能领悟记住。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've never known a child who can soak up so much information. 我从没听说过能吸收那么多东西的孩子。</font>\n
so/as far as	<font color=blue size=4>so/as far as</font>\n<br>1. to the place mentioned 到达某个提及的地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked as far as the post office. 他一直走到邮局。</font>\n<br>2. the same distance as 象…一样远\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We didn't go so far as the others (did) . 我们走得没有其他人那么远。</font>\n<br>3. to the extent that 在…范围内；就…而言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So far as I know he will be away for three months. 就我所知，他要外出3个月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The experiment is going on smoothly, so far as I know. 据我所知，实验正在顺利进行。</font>\n
so as to	<font color=blue size=4>so as to</font>\n<br>in order to 以便\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We picked apples so as to make a pie. 我们摘苹果来做馅饼。</font>\n
so far	<font color=blue size=4>so far</font>\n<br>until this time or to this place 到现在为止；到这里为止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So far no further news had been obtained. 至今没有得到进一步的消息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the water has risen so far the pumps will be brought into action. 水涨到这么高时，就要开动水泵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather has been hot so far this summer. 今年夏天天气一直很热。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This is a lonely road, we have not met another car so far. 这是一条很冷僻的路，到现在我们还未遇到任何其它车子。</font>\n
so far, so good	<font color=blue size=4>so far, so good</font>\n<br>until now things have gone well 顺利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So far, so good; I hope we keep on with such good luck. 到目前为止一切顺利，希望我们继续能有这种好运气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work is difficult, but so far, so good. 这项工作相当困难，可是到目前为止还算顺利。</font>\n
soften up	<font color=blue size=4>soften up</font>\n<br>1. weaken an enemy before a major attack（在进攻前用轰炸等）削弱（敌方的）抵抗力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our aeroplanes bombed the enemy and softened up their defences before the army landed and attacked. 我们的飞机在部队登陆进攻前，对敌阵地进行了一番轰炸，削弱了敌军的防御能力。</font>\n<br>2. make soft（使）软化\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you talk to her nicely, you may manage to soften her up. 你要跟她好好谈，可能会软化她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sent her a huge box of chocolates to soften her up before he asked her to marry him. 在向她求婚前，他送了她一大盒巧克力来讨好她。</font>\n
soldier on	<font color=blue size=4>soldier on</font>\n<br>continue or persevere, in spite of difficulties 迎着困难坚持下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In spite of feeling ill, he soldiered on and finished the job. 尽管感到不舒服，他还是坚持完成了工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll soldier on whatever happens. 不管发生什么情况，他都决心坚持下去。</font>\n
so long as	<font color=blue size=4>so long as</font>\n<br>provided that 只要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may use the room as you like, so long as you clean it up afterwards. 你可以随便使用这个房间，只要你用过后把它打扫干净就行了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You may stay here so long as you like. 你高兴在这儿呆多久就呆多久。</font>\n
some day	<font color=blue size=4>some day</font>\n<br>at some time in the future 在将来某个时候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Perhaps some day I'll be rich. 也许将来有一天我会富起来。</font>\n
somehow or other	<font color=blue size=4>somehow or other</font>\n<br>1. by some means; in some way not yet known or stated 以某种尚不知晓的方式\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must get the work finished somehow or other by tomorrow morning. 无论如何我们要在明天早晨以前完成这项工作。</font>\n<br>2. for some reason that is not clear 由于某种未弄清楚的原因\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Somehow or other he again made a mistake in solving the mathematical problem. 不知由于什么原因，他那个数学题又做错了。</font>\n
something like	<font color=blue size=4>something like</font>\n<br>1. rather like 有点象\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The building looked something like a church. 这座大楼看上去有点象教堂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's something like his brother. 他有点象他哥哥。</font>\n<br>2. approximately 大约\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It must be something like seven o'clock. 一定是7点钟左右。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It takes you something like two hours to get there by train. 坐火车去那里大约要两小时。</font>\n
something of an event	<font color=blue size=4>something of an event</font>\n<br>an important thing 一件大事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A trip of forty miles in those days was something of an event. 那时, 40英里的旅行就是件大事了。</font>\n
so much as	<font color=blue size=4>so much as</font>\n<br>1. even 甚至\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't so much as thank me for returning his money that I found. 我把捡到的钱交还给了他，他竟然连谢都不谢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did not so much as glance that way. 他甚至没有向那边看一眼。</font>\n<br>2. almost 差不多；几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By running away he so much as admitted that he had taken the money. 他逃跑了，这无异于承认他拿了钱。</font>\n<br> so much…as\n<br>rather than 与其说是…不如说是…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is so much ill as depressed. 与其说他病了，倒不如说他情绪不好。</font>\n
so much for	<font color=blue size=4>so much for</font>\n<br>enough has been said or done about…就到此为止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This rain looks as if it will continue all the afternoon. So much for our game of tennis. 看来整个下午雨都停不了，咱们的网球就打到这里为止吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>So much for the sentence pattern drills. Now let's move on to the passage. 句型练习就到这里。现在我们看文章。</font>\n
so much…as	<font color=blue size=4>so much…as</font>\n<br>rather than 与其说是…不如说是…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is so much ill as depressed. 与其说他病了，倒不如说他情绪不好。</font>\n<br> so much as\n<br>1. even 甚至\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't so much as thank me for returning his money that I found. 我把捡到的钱交还给了他，他竟然连谢都不谢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He did not so much as glance that way. 他甚至没有向那边看一眼。</font>\n<br>2. almost 差不多；几乎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By running away he so much as admitted that he had taken the money. 他逃跑了，这无异于承认他拿了钱。</font>\n
