sooner or later	<font color=blue size=4>sooner or later</font>\n<br>one day whether soon or late; eventually 迟早；早晚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will repent it sooner or later. 你迟早会后悔的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Even if you are suffering ups and downs, things will improve sooner or later. 尽管你现在命运坎坷，但是事情早晚是会向好的方向发展的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although people would like to live forever, everyone has to die sooner or later. 虽然人们都想永远活下去，但是每个人最终都是要死的。</font>\n
sort of	<font color=blue size=4>sort of</font>\n<br>rather; to some extent 有点；在某种程度上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I sort of thought this would happen. 我有点儿觉得这件事会发生。</font>\n
sort out	<font color=blue size=4>sort out</font>\n<br>1. arrange things neatly or into groups 分类\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child was sorting out the bricks into different colors. 那孩子在把砖分成不同的颜色种类。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These things will take some sorting out. 这些东西要清理一阵子呢！</font>\n<br>2. resolve an argument 解决；澄清\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to sort out your differences yourselves. 你们得自己解决你们的分歧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better send somebody over there to sort the situation out. 你最好派个人去那儿把情况弄清。</font>\n<br>3. organize 整顿（人员等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took just one month to sort out his new office and the secretarial staff. 他仅用了一个月就整顿好了他的新办公室及秘书人员。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She told him to sort himself out or she would leave him. 她告诉他把自己管好，否则她将离开他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school was sorted out in a matter of two months. 那所学校用了差不多两个月的时间就整顿好了。</font>\n<br>4. attack sb. either verbally or physically 惩处；惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you don't stop fighting, I shall come and sort you out. 你们要是继续打架，我就要出来惩治你们了。</font>\n
so that	<font color=blue size=4>so that</font>\n<br>1. in order that 以便\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bring it nearer so that I may see it better. 拿近一些，好让我看得更清楚些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He saved up his money so that he might go abroad for his summer holiday. 他把钱积蓄起来，以便暑期能出国度假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get ready now so that we can leave when Father comes. 我们现在就准备好，等父亲一来我们就可以走了。</font>\n<br>2. with the result that 以致于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George often told stories that weren't true, so that no one believed him when he told ahout a deer in the school yard. 乔治经常讲些不真实的故事，因此当他说校园里有只鹿时，没人相信他的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He injured his foot, so that he was unable to play in the match. 他脚扭伤了，无法出场比赛。</font>\n<br> so… that\n<br>如此…以致（一般表示结果）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has done so much in so short a time that almost everyone thinks that it is a miracle. 他在这么短的时间里取得了这么大的成就，几乎每个人都认为这是奇迹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so ill that he couldn't go to school today. 他病得很厉害，今天无法上学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The generation growing up with TV spend so much of their time in front of TV that they hardly have enough time to study. 伴随着电视机长大的一代人在电视机前花的时间太多，没有足够的时间用来学习。</font>\n
so to speak/say	<font color=blue size=4>so to speak/say</font>\n<br>say it in this way 可以说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is, so to speak, the brain of the organization. 他可以说是该组织的智囊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His book is truly the last word on the subject, so to speak. 他的书可以说是有关这个问题的最有权威性的著作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pet is, so to speak, a member of the family. 这宠物可以说是家庭的一员。</font>\n
sound off	<font color=blue size=4>sound off</font>\n<br>tell what one knows or thinks in a loud, clear voice, esp. to brag or complain 高声发表意见（尤指吹牛或抱怨）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George sounded off about how the game should have been played. 乔治高声谈论这场比赛本来应该如何进行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do we have to listen to her sounding off again about her holiday? 我们是不是又要听她抱怨她的假期？</font>\n
sound out	<font color=blue size=4>sound out</font>\n<br>try to discover the opinion or intention of sb. 努力发现…的观点或意图；刺探\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Could you sound the director out on the question of the new appointment? 你能从主任那儿打听到对新的任命的看法吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not sure what he intends to do. Will you try to sound him out? 我不清楚他打算干什么。你能去探探他的口气吗？</font>\n
so… that	<font color=blue size=4>so… that</font>\n<br>如此…以致（一般表示结果）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has done so much in so short a time that almost everyone thinks that it is a miracle. 他在这么短的时间里取得了这么大的成就，几乎每个人都认为这是奇迹。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so ill that he couldn't go to school today. 他病得很厉害，今天无法上学。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The generation growing up with TV spend so much of their time in front of TV that they hardly have enough time to study. 伴随着电视机长大的一代人在电视机前花的时间太多，没有足够的时间用来学习。</font>\n<br> so that\n<br>1. in order that 以便\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bring it nearer so that I may see it better. 拿近一些，好让我看得更清楚些。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He saved up his money so that he might go abroad for his summer holiday. 他把钱积蓄起来，以便暑期能出国度假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's get ready now so that we can leave when Father comes. 我们现在就准备好，等父亲一来我们就可以走了。</font>\n<br>2. with the result that 以致于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George often told stories that weren't true, so that no one believed him when he told ahout a deer in the school yard. 乔治经常讲些不真实的故事，因此当他说校园里有只鹿时，没人相信他的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He injured his foot, so that he was unable to play in the match. 他脚扭伤了，无法出场比赛。</font>\n
space out	<font color=blue size=4>space out</font>\n<br>place things apart from one another 按一定间隔安排\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their four children were spaced out two years apart. 他们家4个孩子之间都相差两岁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The foresters spaced the seedlings out in rows. 林务员把树苗一行行等距栽种。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can I space out payments over five months? 我可以分5个月偿还货款吗？</font>\n
spark off	<font color=blue size=4>spark off</font>\n<br>1. cause sth. to erupt or explode 点爆\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just one match sparked off a terrible forest fire. 仅仅一根火柴就引起了一场可怕的森林火灾。</font>\n<br>2. be the immediate cause of sth. violent or frightening 导致；为…直接原因\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have no idea what sparked their quarrel off this time. 我不知道这次又是什么引起了他们之间的争吵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The management's attitude may spark off a series of strikes. 厂方的态度可能会引起一系列的罢工。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His proposal sparked off a heated debate, 他的建议引起了一场激烈的辩论。</font>\n
speak about	<font color=blue size=4>speak about</font>\n<br>talk about 谈及；谈论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We won't speak about the unfortunate period in your family history. 我们不会谈及你家的那段不幸历史。</font>\n
speak for	<font color=blue size=4>speak for</font>\n<br>1. support 支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the meeting John spoke for the change in the rules. 约翰在会上支持改变规则。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was asked to speak for the motion that nuclear weapons should be abolished. 他被要求支持废除核武器的动议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although most members of the committee spoke for the bill, a few still held different views. 虽说委员会中的多数成员赞同这项议案，但还有一些人持不同看法。</font>\n<br>2. act as a representative for sb. , so as to give his views 代表…发表意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I speak for my wife as well as myself when I thank you all for your great kindness. 我代表我妻子和我本人感谢你们大家的巨大帮助。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just be quiet a minute and let Johnspeak for himself. 静一会，让约翰为他自己辩解。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you got anyone to speak for you? 你找到人代表你发言了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What others think I do not know; I can only speak for myself. 别人怎么想我不知道，我只能代表我自己讲话。</font>\n<br>3. ask for 索要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher was giving away some books• Fred and Charlie spoke for the same one. 老师正在分发书，弗莱德和查理要的是同一本。</font>\n<br>4. give an impression of 留下…印象；证明；表明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Facts speak for themselves. 事实本身就是很好的说明。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His patient nursing speaks for his comradeship. 他的耐心护理足以说明他的同志情谊。</font>\n<br>5. book or reserve 订购\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the rooms in the hotel have been spoken for by the organizers of the conference. 旅馆所有的房间都被会议的组织者们预订了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have spoken for five tickets in the front row at the theatre. 他们已预定了5张前排戏票。</font>\n
speak ill of	<font color=blue size=4>speak ill of</font>\n<br>express a bad opinion of 讲…的坏活；贬损；中伤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never speak ill of people behind their backs. 千万别在背后说人家坏话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't speak ill of the dead. 不要贬损死者。</font>\n
speak of	<font color=blue size=4>speak of</font>\n<br>1. mention; talk about 提及；谈到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The book speaks of the writer's childhood. 这本书谈到了作家的童年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He speaks very highly of the boy's behaviour. 他高度赞扬那男孩的行为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his lecture, he spoke of the increasing use of computers. 他在演讲中谈及了计算器日益广泛的使用。</font>\n<br>2. suggest the idea of 说明；表明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This gift of money speaks of your generosity. 你捐赠这笔钱说明你很慷慨。</font>\n<br>3. be worth mentioning 值得一提\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The town had no industry to speak of before liberation. 解放前这个小镇没有工业可言。</font>\n
speak one's mind	<font color=blue size=4>speak one's mind</font>\n<br>say openly what one thinks 说心里话；畅所欲言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When we asked the students what they thought of the new plan, they spoke their minds freely. 当我们征求学生们对新计划的意见时，他们都畅所欲言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John thought it was wrong to keep Jack out of the club and he spoke his mind about it. 约翰坦率指出摒杰克于俱乐部门外是不对的。</font>\n
speak to	<font color=blue size=4>speak to</font>\n<br>1. talk to 对…说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't speak to that rough boy. 不要跟那个无礼的男孩讲话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She sometimes blushes when spoken to in the street. 当有人在街上跟她打招呼时，她有时会脸红。</font>\n<br>2. talk about 谈论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We haven't much time; please speak to the subject. 我们时间不多了，请谈正题吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll speak to that point later. 我在后面会说到那一点。</font>\n<br>3. scold 责备；批评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was late again today; it's time you spoke to him. 那男孩今天又迟到了，你该批评批评他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll speak to him about his rudeness at the meeting. 他在会上太不礼貌了，我非责备他不可。</font>\n<br>4. be attractive to 对…有吸引力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am afraid this kind of art doesn't really speak to me. 恐怕这种艺术对我没有吸引力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Great music speaks directly to the emotions. 伟大的音乐能直接打动感情。</font>\n
speak up/out	<font color=blue size=4>speak up/out</font>\n<br>1. speak in a loud or clear voice 大声而清楚地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher told the shy boy to speak up. 老师叫那个腼腆的男孩讲得响一点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you please speak up, as we can't hear you? 我们听不清楚，请大声点说，行吗？</font>\n<br>2. express one's opinion fearlessly 大胆发表意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ed spoke up against letting girls join the club. 艾德反对让女孩参加俱乐部。</font>\n<br>3. say for sb. 为某人辩护；替某人说好话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since he was a complete stranger in the town, there was no one to speak up for him when he was brought into court. 因为他在这个镇上是一个完全陌生的人，所以当他受到控告时，没有人替他讲好话。</font>\n
speak well of	<font color=blue size=4>speak well of</font>\n<br>express a good opinion of 称赞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone that knows him speaks well of him. 了解他的人都称赞他。</font>\n
specialize in	<font color=blue size=4>specialize in</font>\n<br>study in detail; work or be knowledgeable in 详细研究；专门从事或专长于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After he had worked as a doctor for some years, he decided to specialize in children's diseases. 做了几年医生之后，他决定专门研究儿科疾病。</font>\n
speed up	<font color=blue size=4>speed up</font>\n<br>go faster or cause to go faster（使）加快\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are driving very slowly. Do speed up a bit or we'll never get to Edinburgh. 你开得太慢了。开快点，否则我们永远也到不了爱丁堡。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new government has speeded up the building of houses. 新政府加快了房屋建设的速度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I asked them to speed the delivery up. 我要求他们加快交货。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The time saved speeded up production and released workers for other jobs. 省下的时间加快了生产进度，解放出了劳动力于其它工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll be late unless we speed up. 我们要不加快点就要迟到了。</font>\n
spell out	<font color=blue size=4>spell out</font>\n<br>1. read sth. very slowly and with difficulty 缓慢而费力地读\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is eight now, but he still has to spell out nearly everything he reads. 他已8岁了，可他看书的时候，还是要费力地才能把所看的东西读出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took the boy an hour to spell out a page of French. 那男孩花了1小时才吃力地读完一页法文。</font>\n<br>2. explain sth. in a very clear and simple way 清楚地说明；讲清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is so stupid that you have to spell out the most basic things to him. 他真笨，连最基本的东西都得给他解释。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech spelt out the Government's plans for the army. 他的演说清楚地讲明了政府对军队的计划。</font>\n<br>Must I spell out ever ything to you? \n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>我有必要把每件事情都一五一十地跟你讲吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish someone would spell proposals out for us. 但愿有人能给我们把这些建议讲明白。</font>\n
spill out	<font color=blue size=4>spill out</font>\n<br>scatter out; pour out 撒落；溢出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cotents of the box spilled out on the floor. 箱子里的东西撒落在地上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mind how you carry that pot; you'll spill some of the water out. 端那只锅的时候当心一点，不然会把水泼出来的。</font>\n
spill over	<font color=blue size=4>spill over</font>\n<br>overflow 溢出；溢满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The milk in the pot boiled up and spilled over. 锅里的牛奶煮沸溢了出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The populations of many big cities have spilled over into the ad joining countryside. 许多大城市的居民已外流到毗邻的乡村。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The controversy has spilled over into other fields. 这场争论已扩大到其它领域。</font>\n
spin out	<font color=blue size=4>spin out</font>\n<br>make sth. last as long as possible 把…拉长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That's all the money there is, so you'll just have to spin it out for the rest of the week. 所有的钱都在这儿了，因此你得尽可能地在这星期剩下的日子里节约用钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spun out his story for twenty minutes. 他把故事延长了20分钟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spun the project ort for over three years. 这个工程他拖了3年多。</font>\n
spirit away/off	<font color=blue size=4>spirit away/off</font>\n<br>make sb. or sth disappear quickly or in a mysterious way 使…不翼而飞；使…神秘地消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pop star was spiried off through the back door. 那位流行歌星通过后门神秘地消失了。</font>\n<br>We caught just one glimpse of him and then he was spirited away by his friends. 我们只看见他一面,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>以后他就给朋友们悄悄拖走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone seems to have spirited the documents away. 似乎有人把文件偷偷地弄走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was sure I left my umbrella in the office, but when I returned to get it. it had been spirited away. 我确信我把伞放在办公室里的，可当我回去取时，伞已经不翼而飞了。</font>\n
spit out	<font color=blue size=4>spit out</font>\n<br>say sth. angrily or sharply 愤怒地说；尖刻地说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll never forget the way he spat out our names. 我永远也不会忘了他喊我们名字时的那种愤怒样子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spat the story out with bitter anger. 他愤怒地讲述这段故事。</font>\n
splash down	<font color=blue size=4>splash down</font>\n<br>land in the sea（宇宙飞船在返回地球时在海洋中）溅落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lunar capsule splashed down in the Pacific. 登月密封舱降落在太平洋上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The returing astronauts splashed down safely. 返航的宇航员安全降落。</font>\n
split second	<font color=blue size=4>split second</font>\n<br>a very short time; less than a second 一瞬间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lightning flash lasted a split second, and then disappeared. 闪电一下子就消失了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It all happened in a split second, so nobody knows what really did occur. 一切都在一瞬间发生，所以没有一个人知道到底是怎么回事。</font>\n
sponge on	<font color=blue size=4>sponge on</font>\n<br>live on as a dependent or parasite 依赖…生活；寄生于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is too lazy to work and prefers to sponge on his brother. 他懒得去工作，宁可让兄弟来养活他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's done no work for years, and lives by sponging on his relations. 他几年没有做事，依赖亲戚过日子。</font>\n
spread out	<font color=blue size=4>spread out</font>\n<br>1. extend 伸展；铺开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The wood spread out in all directions. 树林向四面八方延伸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spread out his arms and legs. 他伸展开了四肢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He spread out a map. 他摊开了一幅地图。</font>\n<br>2. disperse; scatter 分散；散布\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The men spread out over a wide area. 人们分散在一块很宽阔的区域里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work has to be spread out over several weekends. 这项工作不得不分散到几个周末去做。</font>\n<br>3. develop 发展\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our foreign trade is spreading out in all directions. 我们的对外贸易正向各方面发展。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A scene of prosperity spreads out before us. 一幅欣欣向荣的景象展现在我们面前。</font>\n<br>spread over\n<br>1. cover; scatter over 覆盖；散布于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The water spread over the floor. 水溢到了地板上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His interests now spread over several subjects. 眼下他的兴趣遍及好几门学科。</font>\n<br>2. (cause to) last for (a period of time) （使）持续（一段时间）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their friendship spread over many years. 他们的友谊持续了许多年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The grammar lectures spread over into the next term 语法课延续到下个学期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You don't need to pay back the money you borrowed all at once; the repayment can be spread over a number of years. 你借的钱不用一次全部还清，可以分几年偿还。</font>\n
spring from	<font color=blue size=4>spring from</font>\n<br>1. appear suddenly from (somewhere) 突然从（某处）出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wasn't here a minute ago. Where on earth did he spring from? 刚才他还不在这儿，他是从哪儿冒出来的？</font>\n<br>2. be the result or outcome of 由…造成；出于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her happiness springs from the love of her family. 她的幸福源于对家庭的爱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He springs from a peasant's family. 他出身于农民家庭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What unhappiness can spring from the love of money！贪财会造成多大的不幸啊！</font>\n
spring on	<font color=blue size=4>spring on</font>\n<br>tell sth. to sb. so that he is surprised by it 突然提出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sprang the news on us without a warning. 没有任何暗示，他突然告诉了我们这一消息。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just as we sat down to dinner, they sprang the news on me that I was scheduled to make a speech. 我们刚坐上宴席，他们突然告诉我，已经排定我讲话了。</font>\n
spring to one's feet	<font color=blue size=4>spring to one's feet</font>\n<br>rise quickly, as from a sitting position 很快站起身来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole crowd sprang to their feet and cheered the victorious team. 整个人群都霍然站起来为获胜队欢呼。</font>\n
spring up	<font color=blue size=4>spring up</font>\n<br>suddenly appear, arise, or develop 涌现；发生；迅速长出；迸发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>New factories are springing up like mushrooms. 新工厂如雨后春笋般地涌现。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Doubts sprang up in his mind. 他心中开始产生怀疑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A breeze suddenly sprang up. 突然吹起一阵微风。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A new custom has sprung up. 一种新的风尚出现了。</font>\n
spruce up	<font color=blue size=4>spruce up</font>\n<br>make sb. or sth. clean and tidy 修饰；打扮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Go and spruce yourself up, Mary, before you go to the party. 玛丽，去聚会前，打扮一下自己。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She spruced up the children because their grand father was coming. 她把孩子们收拾干净，因为他们的爷爷就要来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the parks have been spruced up for National Day. 为庆祝国庆，所有的公园都已装饰一新。</font>\n
spur on	<font color=blue size=4>spur on</font>\n<br>encourage sb. to try harder 鼓舞；鞭策\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father spurred us on to do even better at school. 父亲鼓励我们在学校表现得更好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This success will only serve to spur her on. 这一成功只会鼓舞她继续前进。</font>\n
spy into	<font color=blue size=4>spy into</font>\n<br>examine or investigate carefully and secretly 侦查\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's his nature to spy into other people's affairs. 他生性好打听别人的私事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The press raised a hue and cry against Feds spying into people's business through wiretapping. 报界掀起一阵喧嚷，反对联邦调查局人员通过窃听电话刺探别人的私事。</font>\n
spy on	<font color=blue size=4>spy on</font>\n<br>watch secretly what sb. else is doing 监视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our neighbours are always looking out of their windows, spying on us. 我们邻居总是透过他们自己的窗户窥视我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom is paid by the police to spy on other students. 警方雇用汤姆秘密监视其他学生的活动。</font>\n
square up	<font color=blue size=4>square up</font>\n<br>pay sb. money that one owes 结账；付账\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you square up with the waiter while I go and get the car? 我去把车开过来，你来和侍者结账好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's square up, how much is the bill? 我们结账吧，账单金额多少？</font>\n
square up to	<font color=blue size=4>square up to</font>\n<br>1. stand as if ready to fight sb. 摆好架势\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys squared up to each other, but the teacher stopped them. 男孩们摆好架势准备打架，但老师制止了他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The fighters squared up and began to trade blows. 拳击手面对面站好，接着就开始对击。</font>\n<br>2. acknowledge or accept misfortune in a courageous way 勇于面对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He squared up to the possibility of losing his job. 他正视失业的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy squared up to his tormentors. 小男孩勇敢地面对折磨他的人。</font>\n
square with	<font color=blue size=4>square with</font>\n<br>1. agree with 与…一致（或协调）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His actions do not square with his principles. 他的行为与他的原则不一致。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His theory squares with the facts. 他的理论与事实相符。</font>\n<br>2. finish paying sth. 付清…的帐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I should be able to square with you at the end of the month. 我在月底就能付清你的帐。</font>\n<br>3. arrange (things) with sb. 与…把…安排好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you square things with the director so that the worker won't be punished for his accidental damage? 你与主任商量一下，不要使这个造成意外损失的工作人员受到处罚，行吗？</font>\n
stab sbin the back	<font color=blue size=4>stab sbin the back</font>\n<br>say or do sth. unfair that harms sb. 诽谤或陷害…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Owen stabbed his friend Max in the back by telling lies about him. 欧文背后造谣中伤他的朋友麦克斯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is the sort of man to stab you in the back. 他是那种会在背后给你下毒手的人。</font>\n
stake out	<font color=blue size=4>stake out</font>\n<br>mark an area of land with tall pieces of wood 立桩标出（界限）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They've set aside a small area as a children's playground, and staked ut out. 他们划出一小块空地作为孩子们的游戏场，四周立柱为界。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They staked out the area on which they intended to build. 他们在准备建房的地方钉了标桩。</font>\n
stamp out	<font color=blue size=4>stamp out</font>\n<br>destroy completely and make disappear 根绝；毁灭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the last few years, we have nearly stamped out polio by using vaccine. 在过去的几年里，我们通过接种疫苗几乎杜绝了小儿麻痹症。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy stamped out the fire. 那孩子把火踏灭了。</font>\n
stand a chance	<font color=blue size=4>stand a chance</font>\n<br>have a possibility or opportunity 可能；可能获得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Weak and lame in one leg, Tom never stood a chance of getting that job. 身体较弱，一条腿又拐的汤姆永远不可能找到那份工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stand a good chance of seeing Mary at the party. 我们很有可能在晚会上见到玛丽。</font>\n
stand against	<font color=blue size=4>stand against</font>\n<br>1. (cause to) lean or take a position against 倚靠着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ladder stood against the wall, making it easy for thieves to enter the house. 椅子靠在墙上，这使小偷很容易就能进入屋子。</font>\n<br>2. oppose 反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I stand against all forms of cruelty, especially cruelty to children. 我反对各种形式的残暴行为，尤其是对儿童的摧残。</font>\n
stand aside	<font color=blue size=4>stand aside</font>\n<br>stand out of the way 站到一边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The crowd were asked to stand aside to let the players go in. 人群被要求站到一边让运动员们进去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never stands aside when he is needed to lend a helping hand. 无论什么时候需要他帮助，他从不袖手旁观。</font>\n
stand back	<font color=blue size=4>stand back</font>\n<br>1. stand to the rear 向后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stand back and let the car pass. 退后一点，好让汽车开过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman asked the spectators to stand well back. 警察要求围观者靠后站。</font>\n<br>2. be situated some distance from sth. 位于后一点的地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house stands back from the main rood. 那房子离干道有一段距离。</font>\n<br>3. distance or detach oneself from sth. 退让；摆脱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sometimes an administrator must stand back from daytoday business to grasp the wider pattern of events. 有时一个行政管理人员必须摆脱日常事务以便掌握大局。</font>\n
stand by	<font color=blue size=4>stand by</font>\n<br>1. be close beside or near 紧靠在旁边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary could not tell Jane the secret with her little brother standing by. 玛丽不能把秘密告诉简，因为她的弟弟当时站在旁边。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house stands by the river. 房屋位于河边。</font>\n<br>2. watch sth. and do nothing 袖手旁观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not stand by and watch the boy being beaten. 他不能袖手旁观孩子被打。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't just stand by. Can't you lend a hand? 别袖手旁观，你不能帮一下忙吗？</font>\n<br>3. be near; wait to do sth. when needed 在附近等待做某事；准备行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman in the patrol car radioed the station about the robbery, and stood by for orders. 巡逻车里的警察用无线电向总部报告有关抢劫案的情况，然后等待行动命令。</font>\n<br>4. follow or keep (one's promise) 信守（诺言）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a boy who always stands by his promises. 他是个信守诺言的男孩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I stand by every word I said. 我信守我说的每一句话。</font>\n<br>5. be loyal to; support 忠于；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is the sort of person who will always stand by a friend. 他是那种永远忠实于朋友的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When three big boys attacked Bill, Ed stood by him. 当3个大男孩袭击比尔时，艾德帮助了他。</font>\n
stand down	<font color=blue size=4>stand down</font>\n<br>1. leave the witness box in a court of law 离开证人席\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there are no more questions, the witness may now stand domn. 没有更多问题的话，证人可以退席了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He asked the witness to stand down. 他要求证人离席。</font>\n<br>2. withdraw from sth. , esp. in favor of sb. else 退出竞争或竞赛\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stood down as a candidate because he felt a younger man would be more suitable. 他退出了竞选，因为他觉得年纪轻一点的人更合适。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not going to stand down for him. 我不打算给他让位。</font>\n
stand for	<font color=blue size=4>stand for</font>\n<br>1. represent; mean 象征；代表；意指\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The letters“U. S. A. ”stand for “United States of America”. 字母U. S. A. 表示美利坚合众国。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hate the woman and everything she stands for. 我恨那个女人以及她所代表的一切东西。</font>\n<br>2. speak in favor of sth. 支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John always stands for what is right. 约翰总是支持正确的事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stand for equality among all nations, big or small. 我们主张大小国家一律平等。</font>\n<br>3. try to be elected for 竞选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Three men from London are standing for Parliament. 3 位伦敦人参加议会竞选。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's standing for governor in the next election. 她准备参加竞选下一任州长。</font>\n<br>4. permit; tolerate 允许；容忍\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher will not stand for fooling in the classroom. 老师不允许在教室里开玩笑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will not stand for behavior of that kind in my house. 我不允许在我家出现那种行为。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stands for a lot of abuse from those children. 她忍受了那些孩子的许多辱骂。</font>\n
stand in	<font color=blue size=4>stand in</font>\n<br>take sb. 's place or job for a short time 代替\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>she often stands in before a scene is being fimed. 在正式拍摄一个场景前，她经常充当演员的替身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said be would stand in for me any time. 他说他随时都愿意来替代我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm standing in for the secretary while she is sick. 秘书生病了，我在顶她的位置。</font>\n
stand in line	<font color=blue size=4>stand in line</font>\n<br>line up 排队\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children stood in line until the teacher said they could move. 孩子们列队站着，直到老师说他们可以走动了才解散。</font>\n
stand in with	<font color=blue size=4>stand in with</font>\n<br>1. be in conspiracy with; go shares with 与…合谋；同…分担\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stands in with those people. 他跟那些人勾结。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me stand in with you if it is expensive. 如果贵的话，我来同你分担。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The politicians stand in with the saloonkeepers. 政客与酒吧老板有勾结。</font>\n<br>2. be on good terms with 和…友好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John stands in well with the teacher. 约翰和老师相处得很好。</font>\n
stand off	<font color=blue size=4>stand off</font>\n<br>1. stay apart 不靠近；呆在远处.\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At parties Mr. Jones goes around talking to everyone but Mrs. Jones is shy and stands off. 晚会上琼斯先生走来走去与大家交谈，可琼斯夫人却总是很腼腆地呆在一边。</font>\n<br>2. keep sb. or sth. from coming near or winning 使…不能靠近；使…不能赢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The other schools wanted to beat our team and win the championship, but our boys stood them all off. 别的学校想击败我校球队而夺取冠军，但我校球员们把他们打得无一得逞。</font>\n<br>3. dismiss, esp. for a short time, when there is no work to do 解雇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The management had to stand off a hundred men this week. 资方本周不得不临时解雇100个员工。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the slump continues, more will be stood off. 如果继续不景气的话，就会有更多的人被解雇。</font>\n
stand one's ground	<font color=blue size=4>stand one's ground</font>\n<br>1. stay and fight instead of running away 坚守阵地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy attacked in great numbers but our men stood their ground. 敌人大举进攻，但我方战士仍坚守阵地。</font>\n<br>2. insist on one's opinion 坚持自己的观点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's friends said he was mistaken, but he stood his ground. 约翰的朋友说他错了，但他仍坚持自己的观点。</font>\n
stand on one's own feet	<font color=blue size=4>stand on one's own feet</font>\n<br>depend on oneself 独立；不依赖别人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After his father's death, Bob had to stand on his own feet and earn his own living. 父亲死后，鲍勃只得自立谋生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He offered to help me, but I said I would rather stand on my own feet. 他提出帮我，但我说我宁愿自己干。</font>\n
stand on one's rights	<font color=blue size=4>stand on one's rights</font>\n<br>stick to one's rights 坚持自己的权利\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although the teacher criticized her, she stood on her rights and argued back. 尽管老师批评她，但她坚持自己的权利并予以反驳。</font>\n
stand out	<font color=blue size=4>stand out</font>\n<br>1. project 伸出；突出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pot has two handles standing out. 这个壶有两个突出的柄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her pale face stood out in the lamplight. 在灯光下，她脸色显得特别苍白。</font>\n<br>2. be noticeable; outstanding 引人注目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were all pretty, but she stood out among them. 她们都很漂亮，但她却特别突出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The primary colors stand out clearly from the others. 主色衬着其它颜色特别醒目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is a tall, distinguished looking man who stands out in any crowd. 他是一个魁梧英俊的人，在任何人群中都很突出。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It stands out a mile what has to be done. 应该做什么再也明显不过了。</font>\n<br>3. go on resisting or refuse to yield 坚持抵抗或拒不妥协\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stands out against all persuasion. 他坚持不听一切劝说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soldiers stood out against the enemy as long as they could. 战士们全力抵抗敌人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are standing out for higher wages and better conditions. 工人们正在坚持争取提高工资和改善生活条件。</font>\n
stand over	<font color=blue size=4>stand over</font>\n<br>1. watch closely 严密监视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ted's mother had to stand over him to get him to do his homework. 泰德的母亲得监督他做家庭作业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hate having someone standing over me all the time. 我讨厌别人总监督我。</font>\n<br>2. be held over for later action 推迟处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee decided to let the proposal stand over until its next meeting•委员会决定把这项建议推迟到下次会议讨论。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The project is to stand over till next yedr. 这项工程将延期到明年。</font>\n
stand to	<font color=blue size=4>stand to</font>\n<br>1. prepare for action 准备行动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The troops were ordered to stand to in case of attack. 为了防备敌人的袭击，部队已接到命令准备行动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told his men to stand to. 他告诉他的属下准备行动。</font>\n<br>2. keep (one's promise) 信守（诺言）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll stand to my promise and tell you everything about her. 我会信守诺言，把她的情况全都告诉你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always stands to his promise. 他一贯遵守诺言。</font>\n<br>3. stick to (one's post, duty, etc.) 坚守（岗位、职责等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Everyone of us should stand to his duty. 我们每一个人都应坚守自己的职责。</font>\n<br>4. persist in; give support to 坚持；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We always stand to the oppressed nations. 我们永远站在被压迫民族一边。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In defiance of public opinion he stood to his guns. 他无视公众舆论，固执己见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stand to it that whatever work we do, we must do it well. 我们认为，无论做什么工作，都要把它做好。</font>\n
stand to reason	<font color=blue size=4>stand to reason</font>\n<br>follow as a matter of course 理所当然地（会）做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he supports the trade unions, then it stands to reason that he will vote Labour. 如果他支持工会的话，那么他理所当然会支持工党。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe is intelligent and studies hard; it stands to reason that he will pass the examination. 乔既聪明又用功，他考试肯定会及格的。</font>\n
stand up	<font color=blue size=4>stand up</font>\n<br>1. rise to or be on one's feet 起立\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stand up when the judge enters the court. 法官到庭时要起立致意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told the men to stand up straight. 他要那些人站直。</font>\n<br>2. remain upright 耸立；立起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The church tower stands up very well. 教堂的尖塔高高地耸立着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stood the statue up in a corner. 他把塑像竖在屋角。</font>\n<br>3. withstand use or wear 耐用（穿）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>De you think this dress material will stand up well under such conditions? 你认为这种衣服料子在这样的环境下是否很耐穿？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The leather in these shoes will stand up much better than the leather in those you just tried on. 这双鞋子的皮质比你刚才试穿的那双鞋的皮质要耐穿得多。</font>\n<br>4. fail to appear; leave sb. waiting at an appointment 失约\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim said he'd be at the station, but he stood me up. 吉姆说他要去车站的，但他失约了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After waiting for two hours, John began to realize that Helen had stood him up. 等了两个小时以后，约翰开始意识到海伦失约了。</font>\n<br>5. be accepted as true or be able to withstand an investigation 站得住脚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The charges against him will not stand up in court. 对他的指控在法庭上将站不住脚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What is false can never stand up. 假的东西总是站不住脚的。</font>\n
stand up for	<font color=blue size=4>stand up for</font>\n<br>1. support; speak in favor of 支持；替…说话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you stand up for me? 你会支持我吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the boss wanted to dismiss Bill the other workers all stood up for him. 当老板要开除比尔时，其他工人全部为他说话。</font>\n<br>2. defend; insist upon 保护；坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always stands up for women's rights. 他一贯维护妇女的权益。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must stand up for truth and correct mistakes. 我们必须坚持真理，修正错误。</font>\n
stand up to	<font color=blue size=4>stand up to</font>\n<br>1. resist; face 抵抗；勇敢地面对；经受住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary finds it difficult to stand up to her husband. 玛丽发现她很难对付得了她丈夫。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will the chair stand up to your weight? 这椅子能吃得住你的重量吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They launched fierce attacks on Mary, but she stood up to this undaunted. 他们对玛丽进行了猛烈攻击，但她毫不畏惧地顶住了。</font>\n<br>2. match in quality 同…相抗衡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This doesn't stand up to the products of other firms. 这种产品无法与其他公司的产品抗衡。</font>\n
stare at	<font color=blue size=4>stare at</font>\n<br>look at with fixed eyes 凝视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why are you staring at me? 你为什么盯着我看？</font>\n
stare in the face	<font color=blue size=4>stare in the face</font>\n<br>1. be about to happen to sb. 迫在眉睫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Grandfather became very sick and death was staring him in the face. 祖父病情严重，生命危在旦夕。</font>\n<br>2. be easy to see; be plain 显然易见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The facts stare us in the face. 事实明摆在我们面前。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You said you couldn't find the key, but it's staring you in the face. 你说找不到钥匙，可它就在你的面前。</font>\n
start back	<font color=blue size=4>start back</font>\n<br>begin a return journey 开始返回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What time do we have to start back? 我们必须什么时候回去？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They started back immediately when they got the news. 他们听到消息后就立即返回去了。</font>\n
start for	<font color=blue size=4>start for</font>\n<br>1. begin a journey to a place 出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When do you start for london? 你何时动身去伦敦？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He started for home at 6 p.m. 他下午6时动身回家。</font>\n<br>2. become a candidate for 参加…的竞选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has started for a seat in the National Assembly. 他已开始竞选国民大会代表。</font>\n
start from	<font color=blue size=4>start from</font>\n<br>1. come out of quickly 从…很快出来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Blood started from the wound. 血从伤口流出。</font>\n<br>2. begin a journey from 从…出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The climbers started from the village at daybreak. 登山队员们黎明前从那村庄出发了。</font>\n
start in	<font color=blue size=4>start in</font>\n<br>1. set to work, etc. 开始（工作等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She started in as a typist but soon became a secretary. 开始她当打字员，不久就任秘书了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It started in to rain again. 又下起雨来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He started in drinking again. 他又开始喝酒了。</font>\n<br>2. give a first job to（使）开始任职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bank started him in as a clerk. 这家银行雇他先当办事员。</font>\n<br>3. begin to criticize, scold, etc. 开始批评、责备等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys were hardly settled in the classroom when the monitor started in on them for coming late. 男孩们还没在教室里坐定，班长就开始责备他们，说他们来迟了。</font>\n
start off/out	<font color=blue size=4>start off/out</font>\n<br>1. begin a journey; depart 离开；出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having missed the last bus, we had to start off walking. 我们没有赶上最后一班车，只得步行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We started out at 8 a.m. and arrived at7p.m. 我们早上8点出发，下午7点到。</font>\n<br>2. begin doing sth. 开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whatever you do, don't start off crying again. 不管干什么，可别再哭了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The writer started out to write a novel. 那位作家着手写一部长篇小说。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dictionary starts off with the letter A. 词典是从字母A开始的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let him Start off on his holiday stories again or we'll be here all night. 不要让他再谈他的假期经历，否则我们又得在这儿呆一个晚上。</font>\n
start up	<font color=blue size=4>start up</font>\n<br>1. make a sudden movement due to surprise, alarm, pain, etc. 惊跳起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A hare started up at his feet and raced off. 有只兔子突然从他脚边一蹦就跑掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He started up from his seat. 他一惊，从椅子上跳起身来。</font>\n<br>2. begin to function 开始运转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At six o'clock the moter started up. 6点钟马达开动起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The factory will start up tomorrow. 工厂明天开工。</font>\n<br>3. come into existence suddenly or unexpectedly 突然出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many difficulties have started up. 一下子冒出了许多困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He seemed to have started up from nowhere. 他似乎是忽然从天而降。</font>\n<br>4. begin a career, business, working life, etc. 开始从事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The merchant from New York was thinking of starting up in the fruit and vegetable trade. 这个纽约商人正在考虑经营蔬菜水果业。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's thinking of starting up as a private consultant. 他在考虑当一名私人顾问。</font>\n
start with	<font color=blue size=4>start with</font>\n<br>begin with 以…为开端\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In teaching English, we usually start with listening and speaking. 学习英语我们往往从听说开始。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His illness started with a slight cough. 他的病开始只是一点咳嗽。</font>\n
starve for	<font color=blue size=4>starve for</font>\n<br>need very much; be hungry for 非常需要；极需\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor children in the streets are starving for bread. 街上穷苦的孩子非常需要食物。</font>\n
starve out	<font color=blue size=4>starve out</font>\n<br>force sb. to surrender or leave a hiding place by preventing food from reaching him 用饥饿迫使出来投降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Instead of attacking the town the enemy surrounded it with the intention of starving the inhabitants out. 敌人对这座城市围而不攻，企图用饥饿迫使居民出来投降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took just a week to starve the prisoners out. 只用了一星期就使囚犯因饥饿而投降。</font>\n<br>stay away remain away; be away 离开；不接触\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you'll stay away from those rough boys. 我希望你不要同那些粗野的孩子在一起。</font>\n
stay behind	<font color=blue size=4>stay behind</font>\n<br>remain after other people have left 留在后面；留下来不走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Several students stayed behind after the lecture to ask questions. 有几个学生课后留下来问问题。</font>\n
stay in	<font color=blue size=4>stay in</font>\n<br>remain indoors 留在家中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll stay in to wait for his telephone call. 我将留在家中等他的电话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's stay in tonight and read instead of going to a movie. 咱们今晚不去看电影，呆在家里看书吧。</font>\n
stay off	<font color=blue size=4>stay off</font>\n<br>1. continue to be at a distance from 保持距离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell the children to stay off the road. 叫孩子们离开公路远点。</font>\n<br>2. avoid 避开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor advised him to stay off fattening. 医生建议他不要吃高脂肪食物。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll have to stay off beer if you really want to lose weight. 如果你真想减肥，就不能再喝啤酒了。</font>\n<br>3. not go to school, work, etc. 不上学；不上班\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't feel very well. I think I'll stay off tomorrow and have a day in bed. 我今天感到不舒服，明天我不去上班了，在床上躺一天。</font>\n
stay on	<font color=blue size=4>stay on</font>\n<br>prolong one's stay 继续呆下去；继续留下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll stay on this evening and help you, if you like. 如果你愿意，我今晚留下来帮你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is staying on at school for another year. 他在学校还要再呆一年。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came for a week's holiday and stayed on a month. 他来度假，假期只有一周，他却住了一个月。</font>\n
stay out	<font color=blue size=4>stay out</font>\n<br>1. remain away from home 不在家\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stayed out last night until four o'clock. 她昨夜4点才回家。</font>\n<br>2. continue to refuse to work 继续拒绝工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the workers are staying out until their demands are met. 所有工人都拒绝复工，直到满足他们的要求。</font>\n
stay put	<font color=blue size=4>stay put</font>\n<br>remain in the same place 呆在原处；停留在原处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There, I've fixed the handle, and it should stay put now. 现在我已经把把手固定好了，它不会再掉下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Harry's father told him to stay put until he came back. 哈里的父亲吩咐儿子不要离开，等他回来。</font>\n
stay up	<font color=blue size=4>stay up</font>\n<br>1. continue to be high 不下降\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If his temperature stays up all day, call the doctor. 假如他的体温居高不下，就请医生吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The temporary roof won't stay up much longer. 那临时屋顶挺不了多久。</font>\n<br>2. remain late out of bed 迟睡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't stay up for me, I may be late. 不要迟睡等我，我可能会晚回来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stays up late most nights, reading business reports. 他常常熬夜看业务报告。</font>\n
stay with	<font color=blue size=4>stay with</font>\n<br>1. live with 与…住在一起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom is now staying with us. 汤姆现在与我们住在一起。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stayed with her aunt while she was in Shanghai. 她在上海时住在她姑妈家里。</font>\n<br>2. hold out (a task, a contest, etc.); last out 使…持续下去；使维持下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must stay with the task as long as we can. 这个任务我们能坚持多久就要坚持多久。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ted stayed with his homework until it was done. 泰德坚持把作业做完。</font>\n<br>3. be together with sb.;not leave 与…留在一起；不离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stay with me until we get out of the crowd. 不要分开，跟着我走出人群。</font>\n<br>4. continue to listen even though one may be tempted to go away 继续听…说下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just stay with me a minute longer. I'm sure l can convince you. 再听我讲一下，我肯定可以说服你们。</font>\n
steal away	<font color=blue size=4>steal away</font>\n<br>leave quietly and often secretly 溜掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stole away while everyone else was watching the film. 别人都在全神贯注看电影时，他悄悄溜走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy stole away under cover of night. 敌人趁夜黑逃遁。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time stole away. 时问不知不觉地过去了。</font>\n
steal into	<font color=blue size=4>steal into</font>\n<br>walk into quietly and secretly 偷偷进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stole into the room while I was writing a letter. 我写信时，他悄悄地进了房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thief stealthily stole into the house. 小偷悄悄地潜入房子。</font>\n
steal off	<font color=blue size=4>steal off</font>\n<br>leave silently and secretly 偷偷走开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim stole off without anyone seeing him. 吉姆偷偷地走开了，谁也没看见。</font>\n
steal over	<font color=blue size=4>steal over</font>\n<br>slowly and quietly take hold of 不知不觉地袭来；悄悄地呈现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A feeling of happiness stole over the girl when she thought about the days ahead. 当女孩想到未来的日子时，脸上不禁露出了一种幸福感。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A smile stole over his face. 他脸上隐隐现出笑容。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mist stole over the valley. 雾渐渐弥漫了整个山谷。</font>\n
steal sb's thunder	<font color=blue size=4>steal sb's thunder</font>\n<br>do or say sth. that sb. has planned to do or say 先人一着\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John announced the news before Peter had a chance, stealing his thunder. 约翰在彼得之前宣布了那则消息，抢了个先。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stole his oppoent's thunder by proposing a toast for the distinguished visitor. 他抢在对手之前向贵宾祝酒。</font>\n
steal the show/spotlight	<font color=blue size=4>steal the show/spotlight</font>\n<br>attract attention away from sb. or sth. that people should be watching 抢镜头；引起注意力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was on the stage for only a few minutes, bat I thought she stole the show. 她仅出场几分钟，不过我认为她抢先出了风头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just as the speaker began, a little dog ran up the aisle, and stole the spotlight from him. 正当演说者开始演说时，一只小狗跑上通道，把人们的注意力吸引了过去。</font>\n
steal up on	<font color=blue size=4>steal up on</font>\n<br>approach sb. slowly and quietly 悄悄地走近；偷袭\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her friend stole up on her and made her jump. 她的朋友悄悄走近她，使她跳了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A small party stole up on the bridge under cover of darkness. 一支小分队趁黑夜偷袭这座桥。</font>\n
steam up	<font color=blue size=4>steam up</font>\n<br>1. cover or become covered with steam 有蒸汽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rain steamed up his glasses and he could hardly see. 雨水蒙住了他的眼镜，因此他几乎什么也看不见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The windows have steamed up. 窗户上凝结了水汽。</font>\n<br>2. make angry or excited 使激动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's all steamed up about losing the contract. 他因合同吃了亏而大发雷霆。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bill was all steamed up about the movie had just seen. 比尔对他刚看的电影感到非常激动。</font>\n
steer clear of	<font color=blue size=4>steer clear of</font>\n<br>steer a safe distance from; go around without touching 绕开；躲避\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't steer clear of us; nobody is going to hurt you. 不要躲着我们，没人会伤害你的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A ship steers clear of a rocky shore in stormy weather. 船在暴风雨中绕开多岩石的海岸。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You would be better to steer clear of so much jargon in your talk. 你的讲话里要是少用些专门术语就会更好。</font>\n
stem from	<font color=blue size=4>stem from</font>\n<br>be traceable to or caused by sb. or sth. 来自；由…产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their hatred of him stemmed from fear. 由于恐惧他们对他产生了仇恨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This idiom stems from an ancient Greek fable. 这个成语源自一则古代希腊寓言。</font>\n
step aside	<font color=blue size=4>step aside</font>\n<br>1. move to one side 让到一边\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you mind stepping aside to let this old lady off the bus? 请让一让，让这位老太太下车好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Step aside and make room for us. 靠边，给我们腾个地方。</font>\n<br>2. move from a position of authority 让位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They expect him to step aside and make way for a younger man. 他们希望他让位，好给一个年轻些的人接班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was willing to step aside in favor of a more dynamic leader. 他愿意让位给更强有力的领导人。</font>\n
step back	<font color=blue size=4>step back</font>\n<br>1. yield ground by moving to the rear; recede 后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stepped back to admire the painting. 他退了几步来欣赏这幅画。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stepped back politely to let the ladies pass. 我们礼貌地后退，让女士们过去。</font>\n<br>2. move backwards from surprise, shock, etc. 由于吃惊而后退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he saw it, he stepped back in surprise. 他一看到它，就吃惊得往后退。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stepped back, hardly able to believe her ears. 她吃惊地往后退缩，简直不能相信自己的耳朵。</font>\n
step by step	<font color=blue size=4>step by step</font>\n<br>gradually 逐步地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Step by step I'll learn to do the work. 我将逐步地学会干这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A foreign language can't be learned rapidly; it must be learned step by step. 学外语不能急，只能按部就班地学。</font>\n
step down	<font color=blue size=4>step down</font>\n<br>1. walk down 走下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as the train stopped, the conductor stepped down to help the passengers off. 火车一停，列车员就下火车帮乘客下车。</font>\n<br>2. move to a lower level; retire or leave a top position 降低；辞职；让位\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've spent so many years as chairman that I feel it's time I stepped down. 我当了这么多年的董事长，现在我觉得该退下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Next May our company's president will step down, and we will have to elect a new one at the next stockholders'meeting. 明年5月我们公司的总经理任职期满就要退下来了，我们将要在下一次的股东会议上选举一个新的总经理。</font>\n<br>3. slow down 放慢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For lack of raw materials they had stepped down production. 由于原料缺乏，他们不得不放慢生产进度。</font>\n
step in	<font color=blue size=4>step in</font>\n<br>1. walk in 走进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Would you mind stepping in for a moment? 进来坐一会好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The clerk stepped in and asked for Mr. Black. 办事员走进来要找布莱克先生。</font>\n<br>2. intervene either to help or hinder 插进来（帮助或阻止）；干预\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If the government does not step in, there will be no trains on Monday. 政府要是不干预的话，星期一将没有任何火车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police are reluctant to step in. 警察不愿插手干预。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Father stepped in and forbade me to go campimg. 父亲进来干预不准我去野营。</font>\n
step out	<font color=blue size=4>step out</font>\n<br>1. go out from a place 走出去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He just stepped out for a breath of fresn air. 他只是出去换换新鲜空气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm just going to step out for a minute. 我正要出去一会儿。</font>\n<br>2. walk fast 快走；加快步伐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As it was getting dark we stepped out so as to reach the village. 天快黑了，我们快点走，好赶到村里。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Step out, you still have a long way to go. 走快点，你还得走很长一段路呢。</font>\n<br>3. engage in social activities; enjoy oneself socially 出去娱乐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She'really stepping out these days: the theatre last night, dinner tonight and dancing tomorrow. 她这几天确实交际很多：昨天去看戏，今晚参加晚宴，明天又要去跳舞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're all dressed up, Mary; you must be stepping out tonight. 你穿得这样漂亮，玛丽，今晚想必有什么约会。</font>\n
step up	<font color=blue size=4>step up</font>\n<br>1. increase; accelerate 增加；促进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Trade has been stepping up recently, since the weather turned warmer. 因天气转暖，最近贸易不断增加。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Radio and television have stepped up the tempo of the news. 收音机和电视机加快了新闻的传送速度。</font>\n<br>2. walk up; go or come near 向上走；走近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John stepped up onto the plat form and began to speak. 约翰走上讲台开始发言。</font>\n<br>3. be promoted 晋升；提升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has stepped up into the management of the firm. 他升入了公司的管理部门。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He soom stepped up to the chief executive's chair. 不久他就爬上了总经理的位子。</font>\n
stick at	<font color=blue size=4>stick at</font>\n<br>1. continue to do 继续做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sticks at his work ten hours a day. 他每天不间断地工作10小时。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll stick at it till he succeeds. 他一定会坚持到成功。</font>\n<br>2. hesitate at 犹豫；迟疑；顾虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't stick at trifles. 不要为小事犹豫不决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll stick at nothing to get complete power. 为了揽取全权，他什么都干得出来。</font>\n
stick by	<font color=blue size=4>stick by</font>\n<br>continue to help and support 忠于；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His wife sticks by him whatever he does. 不管他做什么他妻子都支持他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They vowed to stick by one another no matter what happened. 他们发誓，不管发生什么事，他们都要互相支持。</font>\n
stick down	<font color=blue size=4>stick down</font>\n<br>1. put sth. down on the floor 放下…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Just stick those books down over there. I'll put them away later. 那些书就放在那边吧，我以后再拿走。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stick it down anywhere you like. 随便放在什么地方都行。</font>\n<br>2. write down 写下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better stick down the address. 你最好把地址记下来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'd stuck the formula down on the back of a used envelope. 他在一只用过的信封后面写下了那个公式。</font>\n<br>3. fasten with an adhesive, pins, etc. 粘住；别住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stick the flap down with tape or glue or something. 把这信封口盖用纸条或胶水之类的东西粘上。</font>\n
stick in sb's throat	<font color=blue size=4>stick in sb's throat</font>\n<br>1. be hard to accept 难以接受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having to pay out￡50 for such a small thing really sticks in my throat. 为这个小东西要付50英镑的钱太让我难以接受了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's his treatment of his aged mother that really sticks in my throat. 他对待自己年迈母亲的那种做法实在使我很反感。</font>\n<br>2. be hard to say 难以启齿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jane wanted to ask the teacher's pardon, but the words stuck in her throat. 简想请求老师原谅，却又难以说出口。</font>\n
stick out	<font color=blue size=4>stick out</font>\n<br>1. protrude or make sth. protrude or project 突出；伸出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't stick your tongue out at me. 不要对我伸舌头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>An arm was sticking out from the hole. 有只胳膊从洞中伸出。</font>\n<br>2. be noticeable 醒目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The author's outlook sticks out on every page. 书的每一页都清楚地显示出作者的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My house is the only brick one on the street. It sticks out and you can't miss it. 我的房子是这条街上唯一的一栋砖房，它很显眼，你不会找不到的。</font>\n<br>3. endure or tolerate sth. to the end 坚持…到底；忍受\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Try to stick out the party for another hour and then we can go home. 设法在聚会上再坚持一个小时，然后我们就回家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you can stick it out a bit longer, everything will be all right. 如果你能再忍耐一会儿，一切都会正常的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mathematics is hard, but if you stick it out you'll understand it. 数学是困难的，但如果你努力学习，坚持到底，自然就会了解它。</font>\n<br>4. wait stubbornly for sth. that has demanded to be allowed or given 坚持要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The union are sticking out for a twenty per cent increase. 工会要求工资增加百分之二十。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They say she's too young but she's sticking out for the job. 他们说她太年轻了，可她还是坚持要做这件工作。</font>\n
stick to	<font color=blue size=4>stick to</font>\n<br>persevere; adhere to 坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shall stick to my decision. 我将坚持我的决定。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you stick to it long enough you can find the answer to that problem. 如果你坚持一段时间，你就会发现那个问题的答案。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hate listening to him; he never sticks to the point. 我不喜欢听他说，他从不坚持自己的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you will stick to the point in the debate. 我希望你在辩论中能抓住要害。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you stick to the truth, you've nothing to fear. 你要是坚持真理，就可以无所畏惧。</font>\n
stick together	<font color=blue size=4>stick together</font>\n<br>remain close together in a situation 团结\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stick together, and don't let anything divide you. 要互相支持，不要让任何东西影响团结。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They stuck together through thick and thin. 不管有什么艰难险阻，他们都紧密团结在一起。</font>\n
stick up	<font color=blue size=4>stick up</font>\n<br>1. protrude 突出；竖起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stick up your hand if you know the answer. 知道答案请举手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her hair keeps sticking up no matter how often she combs it. 不管她怎么勤梳头，她的头发总是竖着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The pillars of the wharf are still sticking up in the water. 码头的桩子仍在水中竖着。</font>\n<br>2. rob 抢劫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The owner of that store was stuck up three times in the last six months. 那家商店老板在过去6个月中曾3次遭抢劫。</font>\n
stick up for	<font color=blue size=4>stick up for</font>\n<br>defend; support 保护；支持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always sticks up for her friends. 她总是支持她的朋友。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can't you stick up for yourself sometimes? 有时候你难道不能为自己辩护一下吗？</font>\n
stir up	<font color=blue size=4>stir up</font>\n<br>make more active 煽动；激动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Stop stirring up troubles again. 不要再惹麻烦了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She loves to stir people up. 她爱挑唆别人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss is in a bad mood today, so don't stir him up with any more customer. 老板今天情绪不好，不要再让顾客去激怒他。</font>\n
stock up	<font color=blue size=4>stock up</font>\n<br>store a large amount of supplies 采购；囤积\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stocked up with food and drink for the Christmas party. 她为圣诞聚会储存了许多食物和饮料。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has stocked the shop up very well. 他给商店办货办得很充裕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the early part of the war many people tried to stock up on scarce items. 战争初期，许多人争着囤积一些供应紧张的商品。</font>\n
stop at	<font color=blue size=4>stop at</font>\n<br>1. stay in a place 逗留在；停在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For two days we stopped at a lovely inn in the mountains. 我们在山区一个迷人的小酒店里逗留了两天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car stopped at the gas station. 车子停在加油站。</font>\n<br>2. hesitate at 对…有所踌躇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is one of those women who stop at nothing to get what she wants. 她是那种为了满足个人欲望而不顾一切的女人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The greedy boss stopped at nothing to gain profit. 贪婪的老板为了攫取利润而无所不为。</font>\n
stop away	<font color=blue size=4>stop away</font>\n<br>stay away 不在；不出席\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Why did you stop away from the meeting? We expected to see you there. 你怎么没去开会？我们原指望能在那儿见到你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stopped away from the lecture when he found out it wasn't interesting. 他发现那讲座没意思，便走了。</font>\n
stop by	<font color=blue size=4>stop by</font>\n<br>make a brief call 顺便访问\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were passing your house, so we thought we would stop by for a few minutes. 我们路过你家，所以就想顺便进来坐一会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We suggested that she stop by that evening to talk things over. 我们建议她在那晚顺便来找我们，把事情商量一下。</font>\n
stop from	<font color=blue size=4>stop from</font>\n<br>prevent from 使…停止；阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How do you stop children from playing with matches? 你是如何阻止小孩玩火的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be careful to stop the instrument from falling down. 注意防止仪器掉下来。</font>\n
stop in	<font color=blue size=4>stop in</font>\n<br>1. stay at home 留在家里\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm stopping in tonight to wash my hair. 今晚我不出去，我要洗头。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll stop in and look after the kids. 我要留在家看孩子。</font>\n<br>2. remain at school late as a punishment 留在学校以示惩罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If there is any more trouble, you will all stop in for two hours. 如果还出问题，那你们放学后都将留两个小时。</font>\n
stop off	<font color=blue size=4>stop off</font>\n<br>pay a short informal visit, usu. in passing 顺便造访\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do stop off on your way home and have a cup of tea with me. 回家途中请你务必顺便来我家喝茶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They stopped off to pick up some food. 他们在半路上停下来弄点吃的。</font>\n
stop out	<font color=blue size=4>stop out</font>\n<br>1. remain out of doors or away from home 在外面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stopped out until one o'clock and her father was furious. 她在外面一直呆到一点钟，她父亲非常生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't stop out too long. 不要在外面呆得太久。</font>\n<br>2. remain on strike 继续罢工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers decided to stop out until their conditions of work were improved. 工人们决定继续罢工，直到他们的工作条件得到改善。</font>\n
stop over	<font color=blue size=4>stop over</font>\n<br>break a journey 中途停留\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stopped over in Paris for a day. 他途中在巴黎停留了一天。</font>\n
stop up	<font color=blue size=4>stop up</font>\n<br>1. not go to bed 不睡觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We will be home late, so please do not stop up for us. 我们回来得迟，请不要为我们守夜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She often stops up till he gets home. 她常等他回家后才睡。</font>\n<br>2. seal up 封住；堵住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The gutter was stopped up with fallen leaves and the rain water could not flow away. 水沟被落叶塞住了，雨水流不出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stopped up her ears to keep the noise out. 她堵住耳朵隔绝噪音。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My nose is stopped up with the cold. 我的鼻子因感冒不通气。</font>\n
store up	<font color=blue size=4>store up</font>\n<br>save a supply for the future 储存\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should store up vegetables for the winter. 我们应该为冬天储存些蔬菜。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the summer months squirrels store up nuts to eat during the winter. 松鼠在夏季储存冬季吃的坚果。</font>\n
straight away/off	<font color=blue size=4>straight away/off</font>\n<br>right away 立即\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go there straight away. 我们马上就去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I told him straight off what I thought of the matter. 我毫不迟疑地把我对这个问题的看法告诉了他。</font>\n
straighten out	<font color=blue size=4>straighten out</font>\n<br>1. solve; make less confused 解决；使清楚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope the misunderstanding will soon be straightened out. 我希望误会很快就会澄清。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said we needed some straightening out on one or two points. 他说我们需要澄清一两点问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could not grasp the theory until Dr. Rose straightened me out on it. 罗斯博士解释后，我才弄懂了那种理论。</font>\n<br>2. put right 恢复正常；使好转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll try to straighten the matter out once and for all. 我要竭力把这事情办好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm only a little tired; a night's sleep will straighten me out. 我只是有点累了，睡一晚就会好的。</font>\n
straighten up	<font color=blue size=4>straighten up</font>\n<br>1. become erect or upright; make straight 挺直身子\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I told him to straighten up. 我叫他要挺直身子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He straightened himself up and looked them squarely in the eye. 他直挺挺地站着，瞪着眼睛盯着他们。</font>\n<br>2. make tidy 整理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mrs. White straightened up the house before the guests came. 怀特太太打扫好房子准备接待客人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He straightened up the papers. 他把文件弄整齐。</font>\n<br>3. clarify 阐明；澄清\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like you to straighten a few things up for me. 我想请你给我澄清几件事情。</font>\n
strain after	<font color=blue size=4>strain after</font>\n<br>strive laboriously for 竭力追求；拼命争取\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workers are straining after quality as well as quantity. 工人们力求保质保量。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no straining after effects in this writer's work. 在这个作家的作品里，没有追求表面效果的痕迹。</font>\n
strange to say	<font color=blue size=4>strange to say</font>\n<br>not what sb. might think 说也奇怪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Strange to say, Jerry doesn't like candy. 奇怪，杰瑞不喜欢糖果。</font>\n
stray from	<font color=blue size=4>stray from</font>\n<br>move from; leave 走离；偏离\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't stray from the point. 不要离题乱扯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Seeing that the speaker was straying away from the subject, the chairman reminded him to keep to the point. 看到发言者在离题乱扯，会议主席提醒他要扣住主题来讲。</font>\n
stretch out	<font color=blue size=4>stretch out</font>\n<br>1. extend 伸出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy stretched out his hands to catch the toy. 小男孩伸出双手去抓玩具。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stretched out his arms and embraced me tightly. 他伸出双臂紧紧拥抱了我。</font>\n<br>2. extend one's body or part of it for relaxation 伸直四肢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stretched out on the grass in the sunshine. 他舒展着身子躺在阳光下的草地上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cat stretched out in front of the fire. 猫伸直身体躺在炉前。</font>\n<br>3. be enough or cause sth. to be enough 使够用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will the food stretch out? Tonight we've got three extra guests for dinner. 饭菜够吃吗？今晚我们多了3个客人吃饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't see how I can stretch out the housekeeping to the end of the month. 我不知道家用钱要怎么安排才能维持到月底。</font>\n
strike at	<font color=blue size=4>strike at</font>\n<br>1. attack 进攻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many newspapers struck at his latest plan. 许多报纸都攻击他的最新计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck at me but missed. 他动手打我，但是没打着。</font>\n<br>2. attempt to destroy 企图毁坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Each of the two theories seems to strike at the foundation of the other. 这两种理论似乎从根本上相互排斥。</font>\n
strike back	<font color=blue size=4>strike back</font>\n<br>return an attack 还击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In reply to last night's bombing attack, our planes this morning struck back at the enemy port. 为了回敬昨夜的空袭，我机今晨对敌机场进行了还击。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he attacked me, naturally I struck back. 他既然攻击我，我当然还击。</font>\n
strike down	<font color=blue size=4>strike down</font>\n<br>1. cause to fall by a blow 击倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man struck down by lightning during the storm was taken to the hospital. 在暴风雨中被雷电击中的人被送进了医院。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With one blow he struck down his opponent. 他一拳就把对手击倒。</font>\n<br>2. make sb. unable to lead a full, active life 使受到摧残\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was struck down by a heart attack at the age of forty. 他40岁时得了心脏病。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is struck down with flu. 他患流感。</font>\n
strike dumb	<font color=blue size=4>strike dumb</font>\n<br>make unable to speak 使哑口无言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His eloquence struck them dumb. 他的雄辩使他们哑口无言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of his financial losses struck him dumb. 他财务损失的消息使他目瞪口呆。</font>\n
strike in	<font color=blue size=4>strike in</font>\n<br>interrupt suddenly 突然插话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone struck in with a question. 有人插进来提出了一个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“I know where she was. ”Jane struck in. 简突然插话说：“我知道她在哪儿。”</font>\n
strike off	<font color=blue size=4>strike off</font>\n<br>1. remove 删去；除去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He promised to strike off the interest of the first debt. 他答应免去第1笔债的利息。</font>\n<br>2. remove by cutting 斩去；砍去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy was striking off all the flowers with a stick. 小男孩在用棍子把花全部打落。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck off the enemy's revolver. 他一拳打掉了敌人的左轮手枪。</font>\n<br>3. print 印刷\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They struck off 5, 000 copies of the election leaflet. 他们印了5000张关于选举的传单。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Another hundred thousand copies of the novel have been struck off since last yedr. 自去年以来，那部小说又印了10万册。</font>\n
strike on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>strike on/upon</font>\n<br>think of or get suddenly or unexpectedly 偶然想起；偶然得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck on a way of making diamonds. 他突然找到了一种制造钻石的方法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We struck on the idea when at work yesterday. 我们昨天上班时忽然想到了这个主意。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck upon the book in a secondhand bookstore. 他在一家旧书店里偶然发现了这本书。</font>\n
