strike out	<font color=blue size=4>strike out</font>\n<br>1. remove 删去；涂去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You had better strike out the fourth paragraph. 你最好删去第4段。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She struck out the sentence she had just written and added a new one. 她把刚写的那句话删掉了，另加了一句。</font>\n<br>2. dawn on 想起；明白\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck out a plan of doing the work well. 他想出一个做好该工作的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck out a plan for himself for the next year. 他为自己拟订了下一年的计划。</font>\n<br>3. start to do sth. new and different, esp. on one's own 自成一路；创新\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He decided to leave his father's firm and strike out on his own. 他决定离开父亲的公司，出去开创一条自己的路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He struck out a path through the thicket. 他开辟了一条穿过灌木林的新路。</font>\n<br>4. try to hit sb. in a wild or uncontrolled way 用力打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The little boy was frightened and struck out madly. 孩子非常害怕，用手乱打。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He lost his temper and struck out wildly. 他动了肝火，大打出手。</font>\n<br>5. move quickly in a certain direction 向…快速走去；用手脚使劲划水\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He dived off the boat and struck out for the island, 他从船上跃入水中，朝岛上用力游去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stood hesitant for a minute and then struck out for the bus stop. 她站在那儿迟疑了片刻，然后拿定主意向汽车站疾步走去。</font>\n
strike up	<font color=blue size=4>strike up</font>\n<br>1. begin playing 开始演奏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People won't get up to dance until the band strikes up. 音乐声起，人们开始跳舞。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The band struck up as soon as the Queen stepped on the shore. 女王一登岸，乐队就开始奏乐。</font>\n<br>2. begin a friendship with sb. 建立起友谊\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They struck up an acquaintance with each other on the beach and soon became very friendly. 他们是在海滩上相互认识的，而且很快就建立起了友谊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By degrees they struck up a friendship. 他们逐渐建立了友谊。</font>\n
string along	<font color=blue size=4>string along</font>\n<br>1. deceive sb. , esp. by giving him false hopes 欺骗；愚弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She's been engaged to him for five years, but she'll never marry him. She's just stringing him along. 她跟他订婚有5年了，可她永远也不会嫁给他。她只是愚弄他而已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The governors felt that they were being strung along by their advisers. 州长们发现顾问们一直在欺骗他们。</font>\n<br>2. accompany sb. 陪伴；跟随\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We're going to John's party too. You can string along with us if you like. 我们也去约翰的聚会。如果你愿意你就跟我们一起去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some ragged children strung along behind, hoping for money. 有些衣衫褴褛的孩子跟在后面要钱。</font>\n
string out	<font color=blue size=4>string out</font>\n<br>1. be spread or spread sth. at intervals in a line 按一定距离分散在一条在线\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was stringing out the clothes on the washing line when it started to rain. 她正把衣服晾在晒衣绳上的时候，天开始下雨了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police strung out across the field looking for clues. 警察按一定距离散开，在田里寻找线索。</font>\n<br>2. prolong; extend 延长；拖长\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The refugees were strung out along the dusty roads for miles. 难民们沿着尘土飞扬的道路连成几里长的人流向前走着。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The promised three days strung out to six weeks. 原先答应3天，结果延长到6个星期之久。</font>\n
string up	<font color=blue size=4>string up</font>\n<br>1. hang sth. high 把…挂起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They strung up colored lights all over the room. 他们在整个房间里挂起了彩灯。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They strung up the ham for the winter. 他们把火腿悬挂起来留到冬天吃。</font>\n<br>2. kill sb. by hanging 绞死（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Two of the rebel leaders were strung up as a warning to the others. 叛变首领中的两名被绞死，以做效尤。</font>\n<br>3. make tense, excited 使紧张；使振奋\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On the evening of his big speech he didn't seem at all strung up. 他在作重要讲话的那天晚上似乎一点也不紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He strung up his nerves to do it. 他打起精神来干那件事。</font>\n
strip down	<font color=blue size=4>strip down</font>\n<br>take sth. to pieces 拆下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is never happier than when he is stripping down the car. 没有比拆卸车子更能使他开心的了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll have to strip down the mechanism to trace the fault. 只有把机械装置拆开才能找出毛病。</font>\n
strip of	<font color=blue size=4>strip of</font>\n<br>rob of 抢劫；剥去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thieves stripped the house of its valuables. 小偷偷走了房间里的贵重物品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Man has been stripped of his superstitions by science. 科学使人破除迷信。</font>\n
strip off	<font color=blue size=4>strip off</font>\n<br>1. take one's clothes off 脱去衣服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She stripped off and went for a swim. 她脱了衣服去游泳。</font>\n<br>2. remove 剥去（伪装）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Sham is sham and the mask must be stripped off. 假的就是假的，伪装应当剥去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workmen stripped the old paper off the walls. 工人们把墙上的旧纸撕掉。</font>\n
strive for	<font color=blue size=4>strive for</font>\n<br>make great efforts for 努力谋求\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government is striving for improvements in public housing. 政府正努力改善公众的住房条件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Personal freedoms are worth striving for. 人身自由是值得为之而奋斗的。</font>\n
stroke down	<font color=blue size=4>stroke down</font>\n<br>cause to be no longer irritated 平息…的怒气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall have to stroke the old people down before we go out tonight. 今晚我们出去前，得先宽慰一下老人们，让他们平平气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was so infuriated that it took them a long time to stroke him down. 他怒不可遏，他们花了好长时间才使他平静下来。</font>\n
stuck up	<font color=blue size=4>stuck up</font>\n<br>conceited 自负\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is very pretty, but that is hardly sufficient reason for her to be so stuck up. 她非常漂亮，但这不足以成为她自负的理由。</font>\n
stuff up	<font color=blue size=4>stuff up</font>\n<br>press tightly into 塞满；塞紧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We had to stuff the ventilator shafts up to stop the smoke entering the room. 为了阻止烟进入室内，我们只好把通风道堵起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've got a bad cold and my nose is terribly stuffed up. 我得了重感冒，鼻子塞得很厉害。</font>\n
stumble along	<font color=blue size=4>stumble along</font>\n<br>walk in an unsteady way 蹒跚而行\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He stumbled along the muddy road. 他在泥泞路上蹒跚而行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We stumbled along the broken path, fearful of tripping up. 我们在一条凹凸不平的小道上踉踉跄跄，生怕跌倒。</font>\n
stumble over	<font color=blue size=4>stumble over</font>\n<br>hesitate and make mistakes when sb. is speaking or reading 结结巴巴地说或读\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She speaks English so well that she never stumbles over her words. 她英语讲得很好，从不结结巴巴的。</font>\n
subject sb/sth. to	<font color=blue size=4>subject sb/sth. to</font>\n<br>1. bring under control 使遭受；使受制于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are all subjected to the law of nature. 我们全都受自然规律的支配。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Women have been subjected to unjust treatment for too long. 很长时间以来，妇女一直受到歧视。</font>\n<br>2. make sth. undergo a test, treatment, etc. 使…经历\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All cars are subjected to various tests before they leave the factory. 在离办厂前，所有的车辆都要经过各种各样的测试。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such an action would subject you to severe criticism. 这种行动将使你遭受到严厉批评。</font>\n<br>3. under the control of 受制约的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are subject to the laws of this country. 你得遵守这个国家的法律。</font>\n<br>4. likely to get or have 易遭受的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John is in rather poor health and is subject to colds. 约翰身体很弱，易患感冒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The western plains are subject to tornadoes. 西部平原常遭受龙卷风的袭击。</font>\n<br>5. depending on some change, happening or need 有待…的；须经…的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our plans may change subject to the weather. 我们的计划可能因气候而会改变。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The treaty is subject to ratification. 该条约须经批准。</font>\n
submit to	<font color=blue size=4>submit to</font>\n<br>1. place before a court, judge, etc. 呈交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I submitted a case to the court. 我把一个案子提交给了法院。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question was submitted to the commission for its consideration. 这个问题被提交到委员会审议。</font>\n<br>2. surrender 甘受；屈服于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy submitted to the punishment without a sound. 这孩子甘受处罚，一声不吭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The general refused to submit to the enemy. 将军拒绝向敌人投降。</font>\n
subordinate to	<font color=blue size=4>subordinate to</font>\n<br>make less important than 使次于；使从属于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All considerations had to be subordinated to the needs of the family. 一切要考虑的事情均应服从家庭的需要。</font>\n
subscribe to	<font color=blue size=4>subscribe to</font>\n<br>1. pay regularly to receive a newspaper, magazine, etc. 订阅；订购\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many teachers subscribe to that periodical. 许多老师都订那份杂志。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He subscribes to many journals concerned with his subject. 他订阅了许多与他学科有关的杂志。</font>\n<br>2. agree with sth. that is said or done 赞同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I subscribe to your opinion. 我赞同你的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We all subscribe to the resolution adopted at the meeting. 我们全都赞同会上作出的决议。</font>\n
subsist on	<font color=blue size=4>subsist on</font>\n<br>live on 以…为生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The poor man subsisted on charity. 这穷汉靠救济过日子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can the poor woman subsist on such a small income? 这位贫穷的妇女靠如此微薄的收入怎么能生活下去呢？</font>\n
substitiute for	<font color=blue size=4>substitiute for</font>\n<br>take the place of 取代\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you substitute for the singer who is ill? 你能替代那个生病的歌唱演员吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you think sugar will substitute for honey? 你认为砂糖可以替代蜂蜜吗？</font>\n
succeed in	<font color=blue size=4>succeed in</font>\n<br>be successful at 在…获得成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He succeeds well in his profession. 他在事业上非常成功。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To succeed in politics requires an actor's abilities now. 今天要在政治上获得成功就要求具有演员般的本事。</font>\n
succeed to	<font color=blue size=4>succeed to</font>\n<br>become heir to 继承\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has succeeded to his uncle's plantation. 他继承了伯父的种植园。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has succeeded to his father's estate. 他继承了父亲的全部产业。</font>\n
such as	<font color=blue size=4>such as</font>\n<br>like 象…一样\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Metals are such things as iron, gold and silver. 金属是诸如铁、金和银这类的东西。</font>\n
suck in	<font color=blue size=4>suck in</font>\n<br>deceive 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The uneducated farmer was sucked in by a clever crook. 那个不识字的农民给一个滑头的骗子骗了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was sucked in as a partner in his venture. 他受骗参与了这项投机活动。</font>\n
suck up	<font color=blue size=4>suck up</font>\n<br>1. absorb 吸收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plants suck up a lot of water. 植物吸收大量的水分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He sucks up all the information you give him. 他把你教给他的知识都吸收进去了。</font>\n<br>2. try to make sb. like you, esp. by using flattery 巴结；讨好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is always sucking up to her teachers but they do not like her for it. 她总是巴结老师，但他们并没因为她的巴结而喜欢她。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He shamelessly sucks up to important people. 他无耻地向重要人物讨好。</font>\n
suffer from	<font color=blue size=4>suffer from</font>\n<br>1. have pain or bad health because of 患（病）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always suffers from stomach trouble. 他经常胃痛。</font>\n<br>2. be troubled by 因…受困扰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She suffers from poverty. 他为贫困所扰。</font>\n
summon up	<font color=blue size=4>summon up</font>\n<br>gather the necessary courage, strength to do sth. 鼓起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had to summon up all his courage before he dared enter the room. 他得鼓起勇气才敢进房间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He found it impossible to summon up enough strength to finish the marathon. 他觉得要鼓起力量跑完马拉松是不可能的。</font>\n
sum up	<font color=blue size=4>sum up</font>\n<br>1. express briefly the chief points of what has been said 总结；归纳\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please sum up the main points of the text in three sentences. 请用3句话总结这篇课文的主要观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To sum up, for the reasons I have just given, I think my plan is better. 从我刚才所述的理由综合起来看，我认为我的计划比较好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The judge summed up for twenty minutes. 法官作了20分钟的概述。</font>\n<br>2. form a judgement or opinion of 判断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could sum up situations at a glance. 他只要看一眼就能对形势作出判断。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he walked in, I quickly summed him up. 他走进来时，我很快就对他有所品评。</font>\n
superior to	<font color=blue size=4>superior to</font>\n<br>1. better than 比…好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This article is superior to that one in style. 这篇文章在文体上要比那篇好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This watch is superior to that one. 这块手表比那块好。</font>\n<br>2. strong enough in character 不屈服于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Always modest and prudent, he is superior to flattery. 他总是谦虚谨慎，从来不为谄媚所动。</font>\n<br>3. excelling 胜过；超过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In playing football, Tom is superior to Smith. 在足球方面，汤姆要比史密斯强。</font>\n
supply with	<font color=blue size=4>supply with</font>\n<br>provide with 提供\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The government has promised to supply the farms with power next year. 政府答应明年给农场供电。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They supplied the whole brigade with all the bedding and towels they needed. 他们向全旅人员提供了他们所需要的被褥和毛巾。</font>\n
supposed to	<font color=blue size=4>supposed to</font>\n<br>obliged to 应该\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is supposed to come by this time. 她这时该到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the present moment he is supposed to be in town. 估计现在他是在城里。</font>\n
sure of	<font color=blue size=4>sure of</font>\n<br>certain of 确信；深信\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sure of success. 我相信能成功。</font>\n
swallow up	<font color=blue size=4>swallow up</font>\n<br>take in; use up 吞没；耗尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The aircraft was swallowed up in the clouds. 飞机没入云海中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sea waves eventually swallowed up the tiny craft. 海浪终于吞没了那条小船。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His expenses swallowed up all his earnings. 他的费用耗尽了他的所有收入。</font>\n
swear at	<font color=blue size=4>swear at</font>\n<br>curse 咒骂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mind your language！Don't swear at him. 说话要小心，不要恶语伤人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He resented being sworn at. 他憎恨别人骂他。</font>\n
swear by	<font color=blue size=4>swear by</font>\n<br>praise or recommend 极力推荐；极其信赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She swears by aspirin as the best remedy for a headache. 她极力推荐阿斯匹林治头痛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I always swear by their products. 我一贯信赖他们的产品。</font>\n
swear in	<font color=blue size=4>swear in</font>\n<br>make sb. take an oath to be truthful, loyal, obedient, etc. 宣誓就职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new president was sworn in last week. 新总统上星期宣誓就职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was sworn in shortly after the election. 选举后不久他就宣誓就职了。</font>\n
swear off	<font color=blue size=4>swear off</font>\n<br>vow to abstain from 发誓不再；发誓戒掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He finally made up his mind to swear off smoking. 最后他决心戒烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since his illness, he has sworn off drinking. 生病以后，他已发誓戒酒。</font>\n
swear to	<font color=blue size=4>swear to</font>\n<br>assert with great conviction 断言；发誓肯定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't swear to it, but I don't think he would lie to me. 我不敢断言，但我认为他不会对我撒谎的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was sure I locked the door when I left the room, but I can't really swear to it. 我离开房间时肯定是锁了门的，但我不能把话说死。</font>\n
sweat out	<font color=blue size=4>sweat out</font>\n<br>1. get rid of an illness by sweating 出一身汗以去掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you feel flu coming on, get into bed and sweat it out. 当你觉得开始有点感冒时，赶快上床去睡，出身汗就好了。</font>\n<br>2. bear; endure until the end 忍受；坚持\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They'll just have to sweat it out until help comes. 他们只好坚持下去，直到有人前来帮助。</font>\n
swing round	<font color=blue size=4>swing round</font>\n<br>1. turn round quickly 猛转身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He swung round to see who had pushed him. 他赶紧回头看谁推了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He swung round to confront the man who had been shadowing him. 他急忙转过身子，正视着尾随他的那个家伙。</font>\n<br>2. change (opinion) 改变（观点等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he realized the truth of the situation, he completely swung round to our position. 他了解到事情真相后，就完全转到我们这方面来了。</font>\n
switch on/off	<font color=blue size=4>switch on/off</font>\n<br>turn on/off 开/关\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please switch the light on; it's getting dark. 天黑了，请开灯。</font>\n
switch to	<font color=blue size=4>switch to</font>\n<br>shift; change 转变；改变\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As he didn't like that radio play, he switched to another programme. 因他不喜欢那个电台节目，就换了另一个节目。</font>\n
sympathize with	<font color=blue size=4>sympathize with</font>\n<br>1. feel sorry for 同情\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always sympathizes with the poor people. 她总是同情穷人。</font>\n<br>2. be interested in and approve of 赞同\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her brother doesn't sympathize with her idea to be a waitress. 她的哥哥不赞成她当女招待。</font>\n
tag along	<font color=blue size=4>tag along</font>\n<br>follow closely along; follow in the rear 尾随；紧紧跟在后头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She always tags along her husband. 她与丈夫形影不离。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many children tagged along behind the band. 许多孩子紧紧跟在乐队后面走。</font>\n
tag oneself on to	<font color=blue size=4>tag oneself on to</font>\n<br>follow closely 紧跟在后\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't tag on to us all the time. 别老是跟着我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the interual a young fellow tagged himself on to me, and I could not get rid of him for the rest of the evening. 在中间休息的时候，一个年轻人跟过来和我搭讪，后半个晚上我一直没法摆脱他。</font>\n
tail away/off	<font color=blue size=4>tail away/off</font>\n<br>1. diminish; grow progressively smaller in number, size, etc. 变得越来越少、越来越小等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The numbers in the procession began to tail away. 队列中的人数开始减少。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Orders for goods of this kind usually begin to tail off towards the end of the year. 这类货物的订单通常在临近年终时就开始渐渐减少了。</font>\n<br>2. lessen; decline in quality; grow progressively fainter or more scattered 降低；质量下降；变得越来越轻、越来越弱、越来越分散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work of some students begins to tail off as they approach their examination. 在快要考试的时候，有些学生的作业质量在下降。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My enthusiasm has tailed off. 我的热情越来越低了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was too shy to speak, and after a few words her voice tailed off into silence. 她腼腆得话也说不出来，讲了几句话，话音就越来越低，最后干脆不吭声了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your work has been tailing off this year; we expect you to keep up your former standard. 今年你的工作质量在下降，我们期望你保持原来的工作水平。</font>\n
take aback	<font color=blue size=4>take aback</font>\n<br>surprise; astonish 使…吃惊；使…惊异\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were taken aback by his unexpected appearance. 他的突然出现使他们大为吃惊。</font>\n
take a back seat	<font color=blue size=4>take a back seat</font>\n<br>accept a poorer or lower position; be second to sth. or sb. else; take second place 接受较差或较低的位置；成为次要的人或事情；退居其次\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With no hope of winning, he had to take a back seat in the contest. 眼看自己在比赛中无望获胜，他只得甘拜下风。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>During the war all manufacturing had to take a back seat to military needs. 在战争期间，一切生产都要服从军事需要。</font>\n
take about	<font color=blue size=4>take about</font>\n<br>show round a place 领…参观\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is no need to take me about seeing the sights. 不必领着我去观光了。</font>\n
take account of	<font color=blue size=4>take account of</font>\n<br>take into consideration 考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll take account of your suggestion. 我们将考虑你的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't take much account of myself, but I have never let myself be duped. 我不大考虑我自己的利益，可是我也从来不肯受骗。</font>\n
take a chair	<font color=blue size=4>take a chair</font>\n<br>sit down 坐下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After she had taken a chair, we started to watch TV. 她坐下来以后我们就开始看电视。</font>\n
take a dim view of	<font color=blue size=4>take a dim view of</font>\n<br>1. be against; disapprove of 反对；不赞成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the family members took a dim view of his rash action. 所有家庭成员都反对他的轻率举动。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John's father took a dim view of his wanting to borrow the car. 约翰的父亲不肯将车借给他用。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Helen approves of many things her sister does, but she takes a dim view of the way Edith is raising her children. 海伦赞成她妹妹做的许多事情，但是她不赞成埃狄斯扶养孩子的方法。</font>\n<br>2. have doubts about; feel unsure or anxious about 对…持怀疑或悲观的看法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom took a dim view of his chances of passing the exam. 汤姆对通过这次考试的可能性持悲观态度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They hope to go on a picnic, but they take a dim view of the weather. 他们希望去野餐，但是又怕天气有问题。</font>\n
take advantage of	<font color=blue size=4>take advantage of</font>\n<br>use for one's own benefit 利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He takes advantage of his fine secretary by leaving all the work to her and doing nothing himself. 他利用他那位能干的秘书，把所有工作都丢给她干，自己却什么也不干。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always takes full advantage of the mistakes made by his rivals. 他总是充分利用对手的失误。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided to take advantage of the beautiful weather and go to the country. 他们决定利用这么好的天气到乡村去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was always good to people, and there were those that took advantage of him. 他总是待人很好，所以有人总想占他的便宜。</font>\n
take a fancy to/for	<font color=blue size=4>take a fancy to/for</font>\n<br>like 喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>From the start, he took a fancy to Mary. 从一开始，他就喜欢玛丽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the students have taken a fancy to their new teacher. 所有的学生都喜欢他们的新老师。</font>\n
take after	<font color=blue size=4>take after</font>\n<br>1. resemble sb. in appearance, personality or character（在外貌、品格和性格方面）与…相似\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He takes after his father in mathematical ability. 他在数学方面的才能很象他的父亲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter doesn't seem to take after either of his parents; the person he resembles most is his uncle John. 彼得长得似乎不象他的父母亲，而最象他的叔叔约翰。</font>\n<br>2. follow as an example; imitate 学…的榜样；仿效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though he is fairly well off, he is very frugal; he takes after his father in that respect. 虽然他相当富裕，但他非常节约，在这方面他是向他父亲学习的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Try to take after your mother who is an honest hardworking woman. 向你妈妈学学，她诚实而且勤劳。</font>\n
take a hand in	<font color=blue size=4>take a hand in</font>\n<br>participate in 参与；介入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wanted to take a hand in the activity. 他想参与这项活动。</font>\n
take amiss	<font color=blue size=4>take amiss</font>\n<br>misunderstand; interpret (remarks, conduct, etc.) unfavourably 误解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think you have taken my word amiss; that was not my meaning. 我想你误解了我的话，那不是我的意思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His joke was taken amiss by some of the company. 他开玩笑得罪了几个同伴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope you will not take it amiss that I venture to make a few criticisms of your article. 我冒昧地对你的文章提出几点批评意见，希望你不至于生气。</font>\n
take a/one's chance	<font color=blue size=4>take a/one's chance</font>\n<br>accept the risk of failure or loss (as in planning or starting sth.); gamble on; venture on 打赌；冒险；碰运气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Won't you take a chance on the price? 你愿对这个价格打赌吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You're taking a chance if you go out in weather like this without an umbrella. 这样的天气出门不带伞，你有点侥幸心理。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't think I'll get the job but I'm willing to take my chance and ask for it. 我想我难以谋得那份工作，但我想碰碰运气提出申请。</font>\n
take apart	<font color=blue size=4>take apart</font>\n<br>1. separate into parts 拆开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to take the whole engine apart to discover the cause of the trouble. 我们必须将整个发动机拆开，查明故障的原因。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took the machine apart to clean and oil the parts. 他拆开机器，把所有的部件都擦净并上了油。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's much easier to take a clock apart than to put it together again. 把钟拆开比重新装上要容易得多。</font>\n<br>2. treat roughly or rudely; defeat utterly; punish severely; criticize harshly 粗暴对待；彻底打败；严厉批评\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He had a rough time in his first fight. He was drawn opposite a real old pro who took him apart inside two rounds. 他在第1场拳击比赛中吃了不少苦头，他抽签碰上的对手是一名副其实的职业选手，不到两个回合他就被打得一败涂地。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The critics really took the novel apart, but I thought it quite good. 那些批评家简直把这部小说说得一无是处，不过我觉得还可以。</font>\n
take (a) pride in	<font color=blue size=4>take (a) pride in</font>\n<br>be proud of 以…为自豪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He takes pride in the success of his children.他为孩子们的成功而感到自豪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She takes a pride in her library. 她以自己的藏书而自豪。</font>\n
take a stand	<font color=blue size=4>take a stand</font>\n<br>make a firm decision; hold a strong opinion 作出有力的决定；持有明确的意见\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The lazy man didn't want to deal with the problem, so he refused to take a stand on it. 那个懒人不想处理那个问题，因此他拒绝表态。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The American people expect the President to take a stand on every important national issue. 美国人民希望总统对国家的每一个重要问题都有明确的意见。</font>\n
take back	<font color=blue size=4>take back</font>\n<br>1. withdraw 收回；撤销\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I take back what I said just now. 我撤回刚才说的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He would neither apologize nor take back what he had said. 他既不肯道歉，又不肯收回他说过的话。</font>\n<br>2. regain possession of 重新获得；取回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Do you mind taking the children back in your car? 你可以让孩子们搭你的车回来吗？</font>\n<br>3. agree to receive back again; permit to come back 同意收回；同意退回；允许…回去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This shop promises to take back any good that don't satisfy the person who buys them. 这家商店允许顾客退回他所不满意的商品。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The chair was defective and the dealer was obliged to take it back. 这把椅子有毛病，商人不得不同意把它收回。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Lindsay was fired twice but both times taken back under the pressure from the union. 林赛两次被解雇，但在工会的压力下，两次都被允许回去工作。</font>\n<br>4. remind of earlier time; cause to remember 使回想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This picture took me back to my own childhood. 这张照片使我回忆起我的童年。</font>\n
take by surprise	<font color=blue size=4>take by surprise</font>\n<br>1. fill with surprise or amazement; astonish 使吃惊；使惊奇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your good examination results have taken all the teachers by surprise. 你考试的好成绩使得所有老师都感到吃惊。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When our teacher quit in the middle of the year to work for the government, it took us all by surprise. 我们的老师在年中辞职去政府部门供职时，我们都感到吃惊。</font>\n<br>2. appear in front of sb. suddenly; come before sb. is ready 出其不意地出现；在（某人）未准备妥当之前来到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The passenger took the thief by surprise. He caught the latter's hand as it sneaked into his pocket. 那位旅客在扒手刚把手伸进他的口袋里的时候，突然抓住了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our guests came half an hour early, taking my mother by surprise. 我们的客人提前半小时来了，弄得我妈妈措手不及。</font>\n
take care	<font color=blue size=4>take care</font>\n<br>be careful 当心；注意；小心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In busy city streets special care should be taken. 在繁忙的城市街道上，应该特别小心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Care should be taken to see that a letter is properly addressed. 要注意把信封上的地址写对。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take care that you don't slip on the icy roads. 注意，不要在结了冰的路上滑倒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take care not to make the same mistake again. 当心，不要再犯同样的错误。</font>\n
take care of	<font color=blue size=4>take care of</font>\n<br>1. take charge of; look after 照顾；照看\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The nurse takes good care of the baby. 保姆把婴儿照顾得很好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“Don't worry about me while you're away; I'll be taken good care of by our neighbours. ”“你外出期间不要挂念我，邻居们会很好地照顾我的。”</font>\n<br>2. be responsible for 负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you take care of buying the wine for tonight's party? 你负责为今晚的聚会买酒好吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't worry about this. I'll take care of it. 这事不要担心，我会负责处理的。</font>\n<br>3. be careful of 当心；注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must take much care of your handwriting; it's so illegible. 你得特别注意书法，你的字迹太潦草了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She never takes care of her wording. 她从来不注意自己的措辞。</font>\n
take charge of	<font color=blue size=4>take charge of</font>\n<br>1. take the management of; become responsible for 负责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Professor Smith takes charge of the literature class. 史密斯教授负责文学班。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The secretary took charge of the matter until her boss returned. 秘书负责这件事直到老板回来为止。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She offered to take charge of all the arrangements for the conference. 她主动提出来负责会议的一切安排。</font>\n<br>2. assume control of 控制\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the fire started, the police and firemen quickly took charge of the situation. 着火时，警察以及消防队员很快就控制了火势。</font>\n
take delight in	<font color=blue size=4>take delight in</font>\n<br>find delight in 喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people take delight in harming others. 有些人以害人为乐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our monitor takes delight in helping others. 我们的班长乐于助人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He takes delight in playing chess. 他喜欢下棋。</font>\n
take down	<font color=blue size=4>take down</font>\n<br>1. remove; get by lifting down 移动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please take down the books from the shelf. 请把书从架上取下来。</font>\n<br>2. write in shorthand; write down; record 用速记记录；记录；速记\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The policeman took down all particulars of the accident. 警察把事故的所有细节都记录下来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took down the speech in short hand. 她用速记法把演讲记了下来。</font>\n<br>3. diminish the pride or arrogance of; humiliate 挫某人的傲气；挫锐气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A person who is always trying to take other people down gets himself disliked. 老是企图让别人丢面子的人不讨人喜欢。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Margaret has too high an opinion of herself. Someone must take her down a bit. 玛格丽特太自负了，应当有人挫一挫她的傲气。</font>\n<br>4. dismantle; pull or take apart 拆卸；拆散\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The workmen are now taking down the scaffolding round the building. 工人们正在拆卸建筑物周围的脚手架。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Carpenters took down the old house in order to build a new one. 木工们拆掉那老房子，以便建一幢新房。</font>\n<br>5. fall sick; become ill 病倒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was taken down with fever. 他因发烧而病倒了。</font>\n<br>6. cheat 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plausible rogue took me down over that bargain. 这花言巧语的流氓在那宗交易中欺骗了我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Only when he got the camera home and began to examine it did he realize that he had been taken down at the pawnbroker's. 当他回家检查买回来的照相机时，才发觉自己在当铺里受骗了。</font>\n<br>7. swallow with difficulty 困难地吞下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take the medicine down and do not stop to think about it. 把药吞下去，吞的时候不要停下来想它。</font>\n
take effect	<font color=blue size=4>take effect</font>\n<br>1. become effective 生效\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine took effect two hours ago. 药两小时前就产生了效果。</font>\n<br>2. go into operation 实施\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new rule took effect last month. 新规则上个月开始实施了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does the new law take effect? 这项新法律什么时候生效？</font>\n
take exception to	<font color=blue size=4>take exception to</font>\n<br>disagree with; dislike 不同意；不喜欢；对…表示异议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his speech, the economist put unemployment above inflation but other experts took exception to his statement. 在演讲中，这个经济学家把失业问题看作比通货膨胀问题更重要，但是其他专家不同意他的观点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Great exception was taken to his remarks by all the older members of the family. 家里的老人对他的谈话很不高兴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was nothing in the speech that you could take exception to. 这篇演讲无可非议。</font>\n
take for	<font color=blue size=4>take for</font>\n<br>1. mistake for 误认为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am sorry, I took you for your brother. 对不起，我把你误认为你哥哥了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What does he take us for? 他把我们当作什么人？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he worked in the countryside, he used to take wheat for barley. 当他在农村劳动时，经常把小麦看成大麦。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first they took him for a foreigner. 最初他们把他当成了外国人。</font>\n<br>2. assume to be 假定是；认为是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took it for the truth. 我认为那是真的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Make no mistake. Don't take him for a fool; he is anything but that. 别搞错了，不要把他当傻瓜，他决不是那种人。</font>\n
take for a ride	<font color=blue size=4>take for a ride</font>\n<br>play a trick on; fool 愚弄（某人）；欺骗（某人）；寻开心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he told me I had passed the exam, he was actually taking me for a ride. 他告诉我说我已通过了考试，其实他是在骗我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girls told Mary that her mother had come to see her, but she did not believe them; she thought they were taking her for a ride. 女生们告诉玛丽说她妈妈来看她了。但她不相信，认为她们是在拿她开玩笑。</font>\n
take for granted	<font color=blue size=4>take for granted</font>\n<br>1. suppose or understand to be true 假定是真的；对…信以为真\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took for granted that the invitation included himself. 他认为他自己一定是在被邀请之列。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A teacher cannot take it for granted that students always do their homework. 老师不能假定学生们一定会做家庭作业。</font>\n<br>2. assume; accept as a fact that does not need any confirmation or verification 假定；认为理所当然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I take it for granted that he will come. 我认为他当然会来的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We take it for granted that they would consent. 我们认为他们一定会同意的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Excuse me for not introducing you to Kermit. I took it for granted that you two knew each other. 对不起，我没有把你介绍给凯米特，我想当然地认为你们互相认识。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All particulars should be carefully checked and verified; nothing should be taken for granted. 所有的细节都应当仔细查对、核实，任何一点都不能想当然。</font>\n
take/go to the trouble	<font color=blue size=4>take/go to the trouble</font>\n<br>put oneself to trouble 不辞辛苦；不怕麻烦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't take the trouble to write, if you are not quite well. 你要是身体不好，就不要费神写信了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must thank you for the trouble you have taken to collect all the necessary data for me. 你为我收集了所有必要的资料，我得向你表示感谢。</font>\n
take hold of	<font color=blue size=4>take hold of</font>\n<br>1. grasp; seize 紧紧抓住\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please take hold of the rope. 请抓紧绳子。</font>\n<br>2. take advantage of 利用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We will take hold of this good opportunity. 我们将利用这个好机会。</font>\n
take ill	<font color=blue size=4>take ill</font>\n<br>be hurt or offended 受…伤害；对…生气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he heard of his dismissal, he took the news ill. 听说被解雇，他受到很大刺激。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't take it ill. 不要生气。</font>\n
take in	<font color=blue size=4>take in</font>\n<br>1. attend 出席\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's have lunch here and then take in a movie. 我们在这儿吃午饭，然后去看场电影。</font>\n<br>2. deceive; cheat 欺骗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The salesman finds it easy to take in old ladies. 营业员发现很容易欺骗老年妇女。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He certainly took us in with his stories about his experiences in Mexico. 他一定是用他在墨西哥的经历来欺骗我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't trust that fellow; he'll take you in if he gets the chance. 别相信那个家伙，他一有机会就会使你上当。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We were completely taken in by his story. 我们完全被他的谎言欺骗了。</font>\n<br>3. receive and accommodate as a guest or as a boarder in one's house; give shelter to 在家里接待客人或搭伙者；收容\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our hotel is full, we can't take in any more guests. 我们的旅馆已经客满，不能再接待客人了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the death of her husband she had to take in boarders. 在她丈夫死后，她不得不接纳搭伙的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The kind old lady offered to take in the poor homeless child. 这位好心的老太太主动提出收留那个无家可归的穷孩子。</font>\n<br>4. understand; grasp 理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We need some time to take the situation in. 我们需要一些时间来弄清情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This book is so difficult that I'm tired; I can't take in what the author means. 这本书很难，我无法理解作者的意思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I tried my best to explain the matter to him, but he still couldn't take in what I was saying. 我尽最大努力向他解释这件事，但他仍然不能理解我在说什么。</font>\n<br>5. accept (work) into one's house to be done for pay 接活在家做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She scraped along by taking in sewing. 她在家替人做针线活勉强糊口。</font>\n<br>6. include 包括\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The study of physics takes in many different subjects. 物理学的研究包含了很多不同的科目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think this list takes in everybody. 我想这个名单是包括了所有的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This love of our country takes in our families, relations, friends and acquaintances. 这种对我们国家的爱也包括了对我们的家庭、亲戚、朋友以及我们所认识的人的爱。</font>\n<br>7. make narrower; make smaller; reduce the size or measurement (of garments) 改小（服装）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This skirt is too loose at the waist; I shall have to get the dressmaker to take it in. 这条裙子腰围太宽了，我要让裁缝改小一点。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This dress needs to be taken in a bit at the neck. 这件衣服的领子要改小一些。</font>\n<br>8. see at a glance; observe keenly 一眼看清；敏锐地观察到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took in what was happening and decided to get away quickly. 他一眼就明白了是怎么回事，于是决定立即脱身。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police officer took in every detail of the room at a glance. 警官一眼就把屋里的每个细小的地方都敏锐地看到了。</font>\n<br>9. subscribe to; receive and pay for regularly 订阅\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Which newspaper do you take in? 你订阅什么报纸？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I take in China Daily. 我订《中国日报》。</font>\n<br>10. accept without question; believe 毫不怀疑地接受；轻信\n<br>The poor man takes in all the lies\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>she tells him. 那可怜的人相信了她告诉他的所有谎言。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The magician did many tricks, and the children took them all in. 魔术师变了许多魔术，孩子们都信以为真。</font>\n
take into account	<font color=blue size=4>take into account</font>\n<br>consider seriously; take account of 仔细考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you are planning a picnic, you will have to take weather into account. 准备野餐时必须考虑到天气情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know I was wrong to do that, but please take the special circumstances into account before you decide on the punishment. 我知道我做错了，但你在决定给我惩罚之前请考虑当时的特殊情况。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When deciding what to do we must take into account all the difficulties. 在决定做某件事情的时候，我们必须把所有的困难都考虑进去。</font>\n
take it easy	<font color=blue size=4>take it easy</font>\n<br>relax; avoid hard work or worry; have an easy time; live in comfort 轻松一点；不要太紧张；不要太劳累；不要操心；放心；休息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take it easy, there is no need to be nervous. 放松一点，没有必要紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've been working hard all afternoon, Steve. Sit down and take it easy for a few minutes. 斯蒂夫，你已经辛苦了一个下午，坐下放松一会儿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor said that Bob would have to take things easy for a while after he had his tonsils out. 医生说鲍勃割过扁桃腺之后要休息一段时间，不要劳累。</font>\n
take it out in	<font color=blue size=4>take it out in</font>\n<br>obtain an equivalent for a loss sustained 获得等值补偿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The salesgirl could find no small change to give me, so she let me take it out in some sweets. 那个女售货员找不出零钱，就给了我一些糖果。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The laborer has worked for the merchant a month, and now he will take it out in articles for the store. 那个工人已经替这家商店工作了一个月，他要在店中取得等值的商品作为工资。</font>\n
take it out of	<font color=blue size=4>take it out of</font>\n<br>1. administer castigation; beat 揍；打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He threatened to take it out of the boy's, hide. 他威胁说要揍那小孩一顿。</font>\n<br>2. exact payment for; penalize 向…报复；惩罚；找…出气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They took it out of his pay. 他们扣了他的薪水作为处罚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If he has been annoyed by anything at the office, he takes it out of his wife and children. 如果上班时被什么事情惹火了的话，他就找妻子和孩子出气。</font>\n<br>3. exhaust; tire 使疲劳；使体弱无力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That long climb took it out of me. 爬那么高的山使我精疲力竭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hot weather takes it out of me; all I want to do is to sit about doing nothing. 炎热的天气使我疲乏不堪，我只想坐着什么也不干。</font>\n
take it out on	<font color=blue size=4>take it out on</font>\n<br>cause sb. else to suffer for one's own misfortune or dissatisfaction 向某人发泄自己的不幸或不满足的感情；向…出气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having had a quarrel with his wife John left home in a bad temper, and then took it out on his subordinates at the office. 约翰跟妻子吵了一架以后，怒气冲冲地离开了家，到办公室对自己的部下出气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came home angry upon losing his job and took it out on his children. 他失业了，很生气地回到家，在孩子身上发泄自己的怒气。</font>\n
take (it) (up) on oneself	<font color=blue size=4>take (it) (up) on oneself</font>\n<br>assume powers beyond what one should 超出个人权力范围承担（某事）；擅自\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took it upon himself to cancel the contract without consulting any of his colleagues. 他不同任何同事商量就擅自取消了合同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That fellow takes too much upon himself; anyone would think he was the manager. 那个家伙太会自作主张多管事，任何人都会以为他是经理。</font>\n
take leave of	<font color=blue size=4>take leave of</font>\n<br>say goodbye to 告别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Before he went back home, he took leave of all his friends. 他回家之前向朋友们一一道别。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was going to be very difficult, after such a close working partnership, to take our leave of each other. 我们经过一段亲密无间的合作以后，一旦要分别，实在是令人难受。</font>\n
take liberties with	<font color=blue size=4>take liberties with</font>\n<br>be free with 对…举止随便；调戏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rascal was punished for taking liberties with a girl. 那个流氓因调戏一位姑娘而受到了惩处。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must stop taking liberties with her. 你切勿对她太随便。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't take liberties with the young lady. 不要调戏那位小姐。</font>\n
take note of	<font color=blue size=4>take note of</font>\n<br>notice; pay attention to 注意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Did you take note of the man speaking at the meeting this morning? 你注意到今天上午在会上发言的那个人没有？</font>\n
take notice of	<font color=blue size=4>take notice of</font>\n<br>pay attention to; heed 注意；留意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He passed by me without taking any notice of me. 他从我旁边走过，一点也没有注意到我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you hear the fire alarm at ten o'clock this morning, don't take any notice of it; the engineers are merely testing it. 如果你们今天上午10点钟听到火警，请不要在意，工程师们只是在做试验。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She passed me in the street, but took no notice of me. 她在街上碰到我，但是她不理我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never takes notice of what I say. 他从不理会我所说的话。</font>\n
take off	<font color=blue size=4>take off</font>\n<br>1. remove 脱下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Help me to take this handle off. 帮我取下这个把手。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Take your coat off and sit down. 脱掉外衣坐下吧。</font>\n<br>2. leave the ground and go up（飞机）起飞\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plane is taking off. 飞机要起飞了。</font>\n<br>3. imitate; give an amusing imitation of 模仿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary can take off her English teacher perfectly. 玛丽模仿她的英文老师维妙维肖。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He takes that comedian off beautifully. 他学那个喜剧演员学得极象。</font>\n<br>4. reduce; subtract as a discount; deduct 减少；减去；打折扣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They took off 25 per cent discount for each. 他们每一个都打七五折。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the cover of the book was torn, the bookseller took 50p off. 因为那本书的封皮已破，店主把书减价50便士。</font>\n<br>5. remove from service or circulation; discontinue 取消班车等服务；中止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some local trains have been taken off, as there was no demand for them. 一些区间火车已被取消，因为用不着了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The 7 a.m. express to London will be taken off next month. 上午7点开往伦敦的快车下月将取消。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The play was taken off after six performances. 这出戏演了6场后停演了。</font>\n<br>6. amputate 截除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The surgeon took off his arm. 外科医生截除了他的手臂。</font>\n<br>7. lead away 带走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child was taken off by kidnappers. 那孩子被绑匪拐走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guard took him off to prison. 看守人员把他带到监狱去了。</font>\n<br>8. leave hurriedly; depart 急忙离开；启程\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took off yesterday for Beijing. 他昨天启程去北京了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The sharp criticism made him take off in a fit of temper. 尖锐的批评使他忿然离去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He grabbed his bag and took off for the meeting. 他抓起包就匆匆忙忙地去开会了。</font>\n<br>9. reduce (weight) 减轻（体重）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took off three pounds last month. 她上个月体重减轻了3磅。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To take off pounds, you don't have to cut down the amount of food you eat, but the number of calories. 为了减轻体重，你不必减少食量，只需减少饮食中的热量就行了。</font>\n<br>10. remove by death; kill 杀死；致死\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was taken off by cholera. 他被霍乱送掉了性命。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Millions were taken off by the plague. 那场瘟疫夺走了成百万人的生命。</font>\n<br>11. have (a period of time) as a break from work or as a holiday; absent oneself from work; ask for leave 有（一段时间）的休息或休假；不去上班；度假；请假\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took a week off in March and I'm taking Easter off, too. 我在3月份休息了一周，还要在复活节休假。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was tired out, so I took the day off. 我疲劳极了，所以那天我休息了一天。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to take next Monday off to visit my sister in hospital. 我想下星期一请假去医院看我姐姐。</font>\n<br>12. drink off; swallow 饮尽；吞下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took off a bottle of beer at one draught. 他一口气喝完了一瓶啤酒。</font>\n
take offence (at) 	<font color=blue size=4>take offence (at) </font>\n<br>become angry with 对…发怒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took offence at what he did. 她对他的所作所为感到恼火。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always takes offence at any kind of criricism. 他总是对批评意见感到生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took offence at what I said, but I meant no offence. 她对我的话生了气，但我无意冒犯她。</font>\n
take off one's hat to	<font color=blue size=4>take off one's hat to</font>\n<br>give honor, praise and respect to 向…致敬；称赞；颂扬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was indeed a courageous man and I took off my hat to him. 他确实是个勇敢的人，我佩服他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You've done a remarkably fine job—I take off my hat to you. 你干得太出色了，我向你致敬。</font>\n
take on	<font color=blue size=4>take on</font>\n<br>1. employ 雇佣\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our factory will take on twenty more workers next month. 我们厂下个月将再雇用20名工人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>No more workers are being taken on at present. 眼下不再招收工人。</font>\n<br>2. undertake 承担\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She takes on extra work on Sundays. 她星期天还承担了额外工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Is he willing to take on the responsibility? 他愿意承担责任吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll take the work on, but I can't tell you exactly when I'll finish it. 我会承担这项工作，可我不能确切地告诉你什么时候完成。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should never take on more than you can do. 你切莫承担力不能及的工作。</font>\n<br>3. become excited; show great emotion (excitement, grief or anger) 激动；表现出强烈的感情（激动、悲痛、气愤等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At the news of her husband's death she took on like a mad woman. 听到丈夫逝世的消息，她伤心得象疯了一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took on something dreadful when she was accused of telling lies. 当被指控说谎时，她的脸部表情很可怕。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took on terribly when her sister was so badly hurt. 妹妹受伤这么厉害，她伤心得不得了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The indignant passenger took on about the rudeness of the bus conductor. 愤怒的乘客对公共汽车售票员的粗鲁无礼发起火来了。</font>\n<br>4. put on; take the appearance of; start to have the look of 披上；带上；呈现面貌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our institute has taken on a new look recently. 我们学院最近面目一新。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city took on a festive air. 全市呈现出一派节日景象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the students put up Christmas decorations, the classroom took on a holiday appearance. 同学们挂上圣诞装饰后，教室里呈现出一片节日的景象。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His writing has taken on a very peculiar style. 他写的作品体现了一种非常独特的风格。</font>\n<br>5. be generally adopted; become popular 被普遍接受；受大家的欢迎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The idea somehow failed to take on. 那主意不知为何未被大家接受。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new style didn't take on, so it was quickly dropped. 这种新式样没有能够流行，于是很快就被淘汰了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I didn't expect pointed shoes to take on, but they have. 我原来以为尖头皮鞋不会流行，可还真的流行了。</font>\n<br>6. accept as an opponent in a contest; accept the challenge of（在竞赛中）接受…作为对手；接受…的挑战\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We knew their football team was bigger and stronger, but we took them on anyway and beat them. 我们知道他们的足球队比我们强大，但是我们仍然和他们比赛，而且把他们打败了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't mind playing against a beginner, like myself, but I'm not going to take on someone who has been playing chess for years. 跟一个象我自己一样的初学者比赛我不反对，但是我不会接受和一个下了多年棋的对手进行比赛。</font>\n<br>7. load; receivefor carrying; be loaded with; allow to enter 装载；接纳；允许进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tanker took on water at that port. 油船在那个港口加了水。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A big ship was at the dock taking on automobiles in crates to carry overseas for sale. 一艘大船停在码头上装载用板条箱运送的汽车，将它们运到海外去销售。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus driver stopped to take the children on. 公共汽车停下让孩子们上车。</font>\n<br>8. absorb; acquire 吸收；获得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cloth took on red from the skirt that was washed in the same tub. 那块布跟裙子在一个盆里洗染上了红色。</font>\n
take one's medicine	<font color=blue size=4>take one's medicine</font>\n<br>accept punishment without com plaining 愿受处罚\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having admitted that he failed to do his part, he was willing to take his medicine and pay for the resulting damage. 他承认自己没有尽到责任，甘愿受罚并赔偿损失。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy said he was sorry he broke the window and was ready to take his medicine. 那个男孩说他打碎了窗户感到很抱歉，并甘愿受罚。</font>\n
take one's revenge	<font color=blue size=4>take one's revenge</font>\n<br>get one's revenge 报仇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At last he took his revenge on the enemy. 最后，他向敌人报了仇。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He felt it his duty to take revenge on his uncle for the murder of his father. 他感到向他叔叔报杀父之仇是他的责任。</font>\n
take one's time	<font color=blue size=4>take one's time</font>\n<br>do sth. without hurrying 不急；慢慢来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can take your time writing the article. 写这篇文章你不要抢时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's sit down. Take your time and tell me all about it. 咱们坐下来，不着急，你慢慢讲，把事情全部告诉我。</font>\n
take one's turn at	<font color=blue size=4>take one's turn at</font>\n<br>do…in allotted order 轮流做…\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Like the other workers, he takes his turn at household chores. 就象别的工人一样，他也轮流做些家务。</font>\n
take out	<font color=blue size=4>take out</font>\n<br>1. accompany; lead or carry forth into the open air, or from a private to a public place or into society 陪伴；带…出去或到公共场所等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am going to take Smith out this evening. 今晚我要陪史密斯出去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bob takes his wife out to the theatre every weekend, but my husband hasn't taken me out for months. 鲍勃每逢周末都陪同夫人去看戏，可我丈夫有好几个月没带我出门了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you go overseas, will you take the family out with you? 假如你出国，你会带全家一同去吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather is perfect for taking the family out for a walk. 这种天气带全家出来散步好极了。</font>\n<br>2. take from a place where sth. is kept 取出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students took out their textbooks and started reading. 学生们拿出课本，开始阅读。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His tooth had such a large hole in it that it had to be taken out. 他的牙齿上有个大洞，一定得拔掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The surgeon took out his appendix.外科医生切除了他的阑尾。</font>\n<br>3. purchase; apply for and obtain 领取；申请并得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must take out fire insurance on our home. 我们务必要给家产保火灾险。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took out a licence the day before yesterday. 他前天领到了执照。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As soon as he got married he took out an insurance policy which would grarantee his wife a regular income for the rest of her life,should he die. 他一结婚就申请得到一张保险单，保证在他死后他的妻子在晚年有定期的收入。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary and John took out a marriage licence. 玛丽和约翰领了结婚证。</font>\n<br>4. remove (stain, colour, etc.) 去掉（污渍、颜色等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you anything that will take out this inkstain from my dress?你有什么东西可以去掉我衣服上的墨水污渍吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This liquid is good for taking out stains. 这种液体去污渍很灵。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took out the pencil marks from his drawing. 他擦掉了他的画上的铅笔记号。</font>\n<br>5. begin to run 开始跑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the window broke, the boys took out in all directions. 窗子打破时，孩子们四处跑开了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the wind blew his hat off, Charlie took out affter it. 当帽子被风刮走时，查理跟在后面追。</font>\n<br>6. set out; start 出发\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will take out for home next month. 他下月启程回家。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They took out for the nearest beach. 他们出发去最近的一个海滩。</font>\n<br>7. take as an equivalent; obtain or receive the value of in another form 用（物）抵债\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The firm agreed to take part of the debt out in goods. 这家商行同意用货物来抵掉一部分债务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I owe you ＄50; can I take it out in beet and cigarattes? 我欠你 50美元，可以用啤酒和香烟来抵充吗？</font>\n
take over	<font color=blue size=4>take over</font>\n<br>1. take the ownership or control of; assume management of or responsibility for 接管；接收\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he retired, his eldest son took over the farm. 他退休时，他的长子接管了农场。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry's taken over the running of the family firm from his old father. 亨利从年迈的父亲手里接管了自家的商行。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We will take over thefactory. 我们将接管这家工厂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new department head took over yesterday. 新的系主任昨天接任。</font>\n<br>2. borrow; imitate; adopt 借用；模仿；采用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have taken over many European ways of life. 他们已袭用了许多欧洲的生活方式。</font>\n

take the floor	<font color=blue size=4>take the floor</font>\n<br>address a public meeting 发表演说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When our representative took the floor, a hush fell over the audience. 我们的代表发言时，听众席鸦雀无声。</font>\n
