take to	<font color=blue size=4>take to</font>\n<br>1. begin to apply ordevote oneself to 开始从事；养成（某种习惯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Itook to smoking ten years ago. 我10年前开始抽烟。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some of the plants formerly producing machines have taken to making parts. 有些工厂原来生产整部机器，现在开始生产零件。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If a man once takes to gambling,it's difficult for him to break the habit. 一个人一旦染上赌博的习惯，是很难戒掉的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have taken to playing golf at weekends. 我养成了在周末打高尔夫球的习惯。</font>\n<br>2. be fond of 喜欢\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has really taken to that child. 他确实喜欢那孩子。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took to stampcollecting last year.我是去年爱上集邮的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How has Billy taken to his new school? 贝利是如何喜欢上他的新学校的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I tried to teach him to type, but he didn't seem to take to. 我试图教他打字，但他似乎对此不感兴趣。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I took to him immediately we met. 我们一见面我就喜欢上他了。</font>\n<br>3. have recourse to (usn. for safety) 求助于（常出于安全原因）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the ship was wrecked, the passengers on board took to the life boats. 轮船失事时，船上的旅客们乘上了救生艇逃生。</font>\n<br>4. go to; betake oneself to 去；往\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thousands of people took to the streets to welcome the returningcombat heroes. 成千上万的人涌上街头，欢迎归来的战斗英雄们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he is in a bad mood, he usually takes to his room without saymg anything. 他情绪不好时，通常去他自己的房间，什么话也不说。</font>\n
take to one's heels	<font color=blue size=4>take to one's heels</font>\n<br>begin to run or run away 逃走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The criminal took to his heels but was soon caught by the police. 罪犯逃跑了，但很快就被警察抓了起来。</font>\n
take turns	<font color=blue size=4>take turns</font>\n<br>do sth. in turn 轮流\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All his children take turns in looking after him. 他的孩子轮流照顾他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There was only one dictionary so the three students had to take turns using it. 只有一本词典，因此 3个学生只好轮流用。</font>\n
take up	<font color=blue size=4>take up</font>\n<br>1. allow ( passengers, etc.) to mount; stop and accept 停车接纳乘客\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cars took their passengers up outside the hotel. 那些汽车在旅馆外面接纳乘客。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The bus stopped to take up passengers. 公共汽车停下来让乘客上车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The train stops here to take up more passengers, and then goes fast all the way to London. 火车在这里停下来，再让一些乘客上车，然后就直抵伦敦。</font>\n<br>2. occupy (time, space, etc.) 占有（时间，空间等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This work will take up a lot of my time. 这项工作将占去我很多时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must get rid of this large table;it takes up too much room. 我得把这个大桌子拿走，它太占地方。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm sorry to have taken up so much of your valuable time. 占用了你那么多宝贵时间，真抱歉。</font>\n<br>3. continue; resume 继续做；接着…讲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I put the telephone down and took up the work again. 我放下电话继续工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took up her sewing after the visitor had gone. 客人走后她继续做她的针线活。</font>\n<br>4. assume (a position, office, atti tude, etc.) 担任；承担（职位）；采取态度\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When does the new director take up his post? 新的主任什么时候走马上任？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He will take up his new post on October 1. 他将在10月1日就任新职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new president took up office yesterday. 新总统昨天就职。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A most aggressive attitude was taken up by the next speaker. 第 2个发言人采取了非常放肆的态度。</font>\n<br>5. adopt sth. as a profession, hobby, subject for study, etc. 从事某种职业；对某事有爱好；从事一项研究或学习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he left school he took up journalism. 离开学校以后，他就从事了新闻工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Rich people can afford to take up whatever hobbies they like. 富人有能力从事他们所喜欢的任何爱好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I think I'll take up oil pointing in my spare time. 我想我将要在业余时间练习油画。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The scientist has taken up a new subject. 这位科学家已开始研究一个新的课题。</font>\n<br>6. pull and make tight or shorter;shorten 缩紧；减短\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The tailor took up the legs of the trousers. 裁缝把裤子改短了。</font>\n<br>7. gather in (a contribution, etc.) ; collect 募捐；收集（钱等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girls will take up a collection at the end of the concert. 这些女孩子在音乐会结束后要募捐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All the tickets were taken up at the exit. 所有的车票都在出口处被收去了。</font>\n<br>8. take away; lift up; raise 拿走；拿起；举起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The driver has had his license taken up for violating traffic regulations. 因为违反交通规则，那个驾驶员的执照被吊销了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took up the telephone receiver and asked a number. 他拿起电话询问一个电话号码。</font>\n<br>9. remove by taking in 把…吸进去；溶解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This kind of paper claims to be able to take up more liquid than any other kind. 这种纸据说比其它任何纸吸水性都强。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The vacuum cleaner took up the dirt from the rug. 吸尘器把地毯上的灰尘吸掉了。</font>\n<br>10. raise consideration of 提出商讨；提出考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They decided to take the matter up at the plenary meeting. 他们决定在全会上把这件事提出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The question of public housing should be taken up with the Minister whose responsibility it is. 公众的住房问题应该提交负责这项工作的部长考虑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would take up my difficulties with the headmaster. 他说要把我的问题提出来和校长商量解决。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The matter will be taken up at the next Party branch meeting. 下一次党支部会议将着手处理此事。</font>\n<br>11. arrest 逮捕\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The police took him up on a drugs charge. 警察以吸毒的罪名逮捕了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Within two hours the arsonist was taken up by the police. 纵火犯在两小时内就被警察抓住了。</font>\n<br>12. establish oneself in 在…安居下来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took up his permanent residence in Beijing after graduation. 他毕业后在北京定居下来。</font>\n<br>13. interrupt by dissent; interrupt andcorrect; rebuke; reprimand （为表示异议等）打断（某人的话）；打断并更正；指责；责备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took me up short on that point. 我讲到那个问题时他突然打断了我的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She said something very absurd and we immediately took her up.她说了些非常荒谬的话，我们立即打断了她的话。</font>\n<br>14. understand 理解\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't take me up wrongly.请别误解我的意思。</font>\n<br>15. adopt sb. as a protege 提携；把…当作被保护人；帮助\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Though a busy and successful nowelist, he was willing to take up any promising young writer and give him all the help he could. 虽然他是一个很忙而又很有成就的小说家，但他愿意提携任何有前途的青年作家并给予一切可能的帮助。</font>\n
take…along with	<font color=blue size=4>take…along with</font>\n<br>go with 带…一块去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll take her along with me. 我将带她一道走。</font>\n
take…at one's word	<font color=blue size=4>take…at one's word</font>\n<br>believe what sb. says is true 相信某人的话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't take him at his word because I think he's leading us on. 我不信他的话，因为我认为他在骗我们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You shouldn't take him at his word. 你不该信他的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you say that I can leave all my work to you while I'm out, I'll take you at your word. 如果你说我走后把我的所有工作都能交给你，我将相信你的话。</font>\n
take…to heart	<font color=blue size=4>take…to heart</font>\n<br>be seriously affected by; have deep concern or grief over 深为…影响；对…非常担心或悲伤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took his brother's death very much to heart. 他哥哥的死对他打击很大。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't take your loss to heart; you can always start again. 不要把失败放在心上，你总是可以再干的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She took her failure in the examination to heart. 她因考试不及格而非常伤心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He took his friend's advice to heart. 朋友对他的劝告对他影响很大。</font>\n<br>2. take seriously 认真对待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I hope they will take to heart the warning I have given them. 我希望他们能认真对待我对他们的警告。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have not much hope that my words will be taken to heart. 他们对我的话是否会认真对待，对此我不抱多大希望。</font>\n
talk away	<font color=blue size=4>talk away</font>\n<br>spend time in talking 在谈话中度过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young lovers talked the night away. 这对年轻的情人谈了一夜。</font>\n
talk big	<font color=blue size=4>talk big</font>\n<br>speak boastingly; make exaggerated statements or excessive claims in order to impress people 说大话；吹大牛；言过其实以期引人注目\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always talked big, but never amounted to anything. 他总是夸口，但毫无成就。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We dislike those who talk big and do nothing. 我们不喜欢那些专讲大话而不做事的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't believe all he says about the profits he is making; ever since I have known him he has liked to talk big. 我不相信他说他正在赚钱的那一套话，自从我认识他起，我就知道他爱吹牛。</font>\n
talk down	<font color=blue size=4>talk down</font>\n<br>1. make silent by talking louder or longer 高声压过（别人的话）；使哑口无言\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to argue back but his opponent talked him down. 他想反驳，但他的对手高声压倒了他的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Such an eloquent man will easily talk us down. 这样一个有口才的人，很容易把我们驳得哑口无言。</font>\n<br>2. speak disparagingly of; belittle 说…坏话；贬低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The hostile newspapers talked down the importance of the Minister's arrival here. 持敌对态度的报纸对部长来此访问的重要性加以贬低。</font>\n<br>3. give radio instructions for landing an airplane because of instrument failure or poor visibility（因仪器故障或能见度低）用无线电通讯引导飞机降落\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His flying instruments have all been destroyed by enemy gunfire, so the air traffic controllers will have to talk him. 他的飞行器械都给敌人的炮火击毁了，所以机场导航员只能通过无线电讲话引导他降落。</font>\n<br>4. use words or ideas that are too easy 用太简单的字或观念\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The speaker talked down to the students, and they were bored. 演讲者讲的内容太简单，学生们都听得不耐烦了。</font>\n<br>5. speak in a condescending or superior manner 以高人一等的口吻说话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She talks down to everyone, particularly young people. 她对谁讲话都摆出高人一等的样子，特别是对青年人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The audience do not like being talked down to. 听众不喜欢听人用高人一等的口吻同他们讲话。</font>\n
talk into	<font color=blue size=4>talk into</font>\n<br>persuade by talking 说服（某人）干（某事）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you talk father into buying a new car? 你能说服父亲买一辆新车吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A clever salesman can talk a person into buying something he does not really want. 一个聪明的售货员能说服一个人买他并不真正想买的东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At last we talked him into consent. 最后我们说服了他，他表示同意。</font>\n
talk of/about	<font color=blue size=4>talk of/about</font>\n<br>1. mention 谈到；说到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his lecture, Professor Wang talked of peaceful uses of atomic energy. 在讲座中，王教授谈到了和平利用原子能。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have talked of what we shall do next. 我们讨论了下一步该干什么。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are just talking of the most exciting book that we have tead recently. 我们正在谈论最近读过的一本十分动人的书。</font>\n<br>2. debate as a possibility; discuss 讨论…之可行性；讨论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two companies have been talking about a merger. 这两家公司一直在讨论合并的可能性。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What are you talking of? 你们正谈论什么？</font>\n
talk of the town	<font color=blue size=4>talk of the town</font>\n<br>sth. that has become very popular or of great prominence 家喻户晓的事情；大家谈论的话题\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their love affair has become the talk of the town. 他俩谈恋爱的事成了众所周知的事情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Recent nudity on the New York stage has been the talk of the town.最近纽约舞台上出现裸体的事情已经成为街谈巷议的话题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His success has become the talk of the town.他的成功已成为大家谈论的话题。</font>\n
talk out of	<font color=blue size=4>talk out of</font>\n<br>persuade; dissuade sb. from doing sth. 劝阻…不做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim wants to give up his job; can you talk him out of such a foolish idea? 吉姆想辞职，你能否劝他放弃这个愚蠢的想法？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He planned to have a duel with John, but we talked him out of it.他打算和约翰决斗，但我们劝阻了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Once he has set his mind on a course of action he is not to be talked out of it. 一旦他下决心采取某一个行动，谁也说服不了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd like to go camping, but my wife's trying to talk me out of it. 我想去野营，可是我妻子竭力劝阻我。</font>\n
talk over	<font color=blue size=4>talk over</font>\n<br>1. consider; discuss in detail 考虑；讨论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Come to my office and we will talk it over. 请到我办公室来讨论一下这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jim always talks things over with his parents before he makes an important decision.吉姆在做重要决定之前总是先与父母商量一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I suggest we talk the matter over in earnest. 我建议，我们认真讨论一下这件事。</font>\n<br>2. cause sb. to change his opinion; convince by talking 说服（某人）改变立场；说明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is very good at talking opponents over to his viewpoing.他善于说服对方改变立场赞成他的观点。</font>\n
talk round	<font color=blue size=4>talk round</font>\n<br>1. persuade; convince 劝说；说服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At first my friend refused to fall in with the scheme we had suggested, but eventually I managed to talk him round. 起初我的朋友不同意我们提出的计划，但我终于设法说服了他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't know whether I can talk him round. 我不知道我能否使他回心转意。</font>\n<br>2. avoid approaching (a subject) directly 兜圈子谈（问题）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't really come to the point; he just talked round it. 他其实并没有讲到点子上，而只是在兜圈子。</font>\n
talk sb's bead off	<font color=blue size=4>talk sb's bead off</font>\n<br>speak to sb. at great length 对某人讲得太多\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's been talking my head off. 他一直跟我唠叨不休。</font>\n
talk to	<font color=blue size=4>talk to</font>\n<br>1. speak to 同…谈话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't talk to that rough boy any more. 不要同那个粗野的男孩再谈下去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher is talking to some students on the campus. 老师正在校园里和一些学生谈话。</font>\n<br>2. reprove 责骂\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll talk to him when he gets home. 他回来时我会教训他的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He talked to them very sharply.他严厉地训斥了他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy needs to be talked to. 这男孩需要好好教训一下。</font>\n
talk up	<font color=blue size=4>talk up</font>\n<br>1. speak loudly and clearly 大声而清晰地讲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked the student to talk up. 老师叫那个学生大声说清楚。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please talk up a bit; we can't hear you. 请大声点，我们听不见你的话。</font>\n<br>2. speak without hesitation; speak distinctly and openly 坦白地说；直率地讲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you thought that wasn't fair, why didn't you talk up? 如果你认为那不公平，为什么不坦率地说出来？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>George isn't afraid to talk up when he disagrees with the teacher. 乔治不同意老师的意见时，就直言不讳。</font>\n<br>3. speak in favor of; discuss enthusiastically 为…说好话；赞扬；热烈讨论\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This dictionary was talked up by the students. 这本词典受到学生们的好评。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The committee talked up late last night. 昨晚委员会讨论热烈，直到深夜。</font>\n
tall order	<font color=blue size=4>tall order</font>\n<br>a requirement or undertaking which makes excessive demands 过高的要求；难办的事\n<br>Repairing the machine in half an hour is a tall order,\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>but we can try. 半小时之内修好这台机器是很难的，但我们可以试试。</font>\n
tamper with	<font color=blue size=4>tamper with</font>\n<br>1. handle ignorantly or foolishly;busy oneself rashly with 胡乱处理；瞎弄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tampered with the insides of his watch and ruined it. 他瞎弄手表里的机件，以致把它弄坏了。</font>\n<br>2. secretly get sb. to do or say wrong things (esp. by giving him money or by threatening to hurt him) （用不正当的手段）使某人做坏事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The candidate tried to tamper with the voters but in vain. 候选人企图收买投票人，但未能得逞。</font>\n<br>3. make unauthorized changes in 篡改\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The document doesn't seem genuine; it must have been tampered with. 这文件不象是真的，肯定被篡改过了。</font>\n
taste of	<font color=blue size=4>taste of</font>\n<br>have a taste like 吃起来有…味\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This water tastes of sugar. 这水有甜味。</font>\n
team up	<font color=blue size=4>team up</font>\n<br>work together as a group 与…合作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a pleasure to team up with such excellent workers.与这么好的工人合作是令人愉快的。</font>\n
tear apart	<font color=blue size=4>tear apart</font>\n<br>1. divide painfully; upset; disturb severely 把…痛苦地分开；使心烦意乱；使心碎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The country was torn apart by fierce intertribal hostilities. 种族间的激烈冲突把这个国家弄得四分五裂。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The news of his father's stroke tore him apart. 他父亲中风的消息使他非常痛苦。</font>\n<br>2. tear with considerable force 扯开；撕开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He's always tearing motors apart and putting them back together again. 他总是把发动机拆开再装上。</font>\n
tear down	<font color=blue size=4>tear down</font>\n<br>take to pieces; demolish (old things, etc.) 拆下；拆除（破旧东西等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall have to tear the engine down completely and oil every part. 我们得将发动机全部拆开，给每个部件上油。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tore down the old building and built a new one. 他们拆除了旧楼，盖起了新楼。</font>\n
tear off	<font color=blue size=4>tear off</font>\n<br>1. remove by puling roughly 撕下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child tore the wrapping off his birthday present. 那孩子撕下了生日礼物上的包装。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I caught the pocket of my coat on a nail. It was nearly torn off. 我的上衣口袋给钉子钩住，差一点给撕了下来。</font>\n<br>2. perform or do, esp. rapidly or casually 草率地做；匆匆地做\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tore off a letter to his family while waiting in the airport lounge. 他在候机楼等飞机时，匆匆写了一封家信。</font>\n
tear up	<font color=blue size=4>tear up</font>\n<br>1. tear completely into small pieces 撕碎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tore up the letter and threw it into the waste paper basket. 他把信撕碎并扔到废纸篓里去了。</font>\n<br>2. cancel (a contract, an agreement, etc.) 撕毁；取消（合同、协议等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He told the lawyer to tear up the old contract and to prepare a new one. 他告诉律师把老的合同作废，准备一个新合同。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Neither the buyer nor the seller should tear up this contract. 不论买方或卖方都不得毁约。</font>\n
tell apart	<font color=blue size=4>tell apart</font>\n<br>distinguish between; tell one from the other 识别；辨别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Most new cars look so similar that it's impossible to tell them apart. 许多新汽车看上去象是一样的，不大可能把它们区别开来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I confused Jim with Mike becauseI can't tell them apart. 我把吉姆和麦克混淆了，因为我分不清他们。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The two brothers are so much alike that their mother can hardly tell them apart. 这兄弟俩长得太相象了，连他们的母亲都难以辨别。</font>\n
tell by	<font color=blue size=4>tell by</font>\n<br>know by; judge by 根据…判断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In England, it's easy to tell a person's class by his speech. 在英国，根据一个人的言谈就很容易判断出其所属的社会阶层。</font>\n
tell from	<font color=blue size=4>tell from</font>\n<br>tell apart 辨别；识别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people can't tell blue from green.在些人分辨不出蓝色与绿色。</font>\n
tell off	<font color=blue size=4>tell off</font>\n<br>reprove 训斥；斥责\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The director told off Jim for being late for work again. 吉姆又一次迟到了，受到主任的训斥。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boss told his secretary off for making private telephone calls from the office. 老板训斥了他的秘书，因为她从办公室往外打私人电话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't like being told off in front of other people, so she gave in her notice. 她不愿意当众挨批评，于是递交了辞职通知书。</font>\n
tell (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>tell (up) on</font>\n<br>1. disclose; inform against 告密\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll tell on you when the teacher gets back. 老师回来时，我将把你的事汇报给老师。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jimmy told on his brother for breaking the vase. 吉姆把弟弟打碎花瓶的事告诉了妈妈。</font>\n<br>2. have bad effect on 对…有恶劣影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All those late nights are beginning to tell on his health. 他熬了那么多夜，身体受到了影响。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All this smoking and drinking will tell on his health in later life. 这样地抽烟喝酒将对他今后的健康不利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The noise pollution is telling on her nerves. 噪音污染使她的神经受不了。</font>\n
ten to one	<font color=blue size=4>ten to one</font>\n<br>ten chances to one for or against sth. happening 十有八九；大概\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Ten to one he'll succeed. 他十有八九会成功的。</font>\n
thanks to	<font color=blue size=4>thanks to</font>\n<br>owing to; because of 由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Thanks to your help, we succeeded. 由于你的帮助，我们成功了。</font>\n
that is to say	<font color=blue size=4>that is to say</font>\n<br>in other words 换句话说；也就是说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He runs after her; that is to say, he has fallen in love with her. 他追求她，也就是说，他爱上了她。</font>\n
the last straw	<font color=blue size=4>the last straw</font>\n<br>the last of a succession of irritations that strains one's patience to the limit 导致失败或令人失去耐心的最后一件事；又一使人生气和无法忍受的事\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I told Sam I needed the money he owed me for six months he said he couldn't pay; instead he asked to borrow an additional ten dollars. That was the last straw. 当我告诉山姆我需要用他6个月前从我处借走的钱时，他说他没有钱还。反而又要向我借10美元，这简直使我很生气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>First Tom, Dick and Mary refused to help me; then my best friend, Joe, also refused, and that was the last straw.起初汤姆、狄克和玛丽不愿意帮助我，后来我的最好的朋友乔也拒绝了我，这简直使我无法忍受。</font>\n
the minute	<font color=blue size=4>the minute</font>\n<br>the moment 刚…就\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll give him your message the minute he arrives. 他一到我就把你的信给他。</font>\n
the other day	<font color=blue size=4>the other day</font>\n<br>a few days ago 日前\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wrote a letter to him the other day. 日前我给他写过一封信。</font>\n
they say	<font color=blue size=4>they say</font>\n<br>It is said; people say 人们说；据说\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They say that Mr. Li will stay in Beijing for a week. 据说李先生将在北京呆一周。</font>\n
think about	<font color=blue size=4>think about</font>\n<br>consider; recall 考虑；回想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's certainly an offer well worth thinking about. 这当然是很值得考虑的报价。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is thinking about her childhood days. 她在回想童年时代的生活。</font>\n
think highly of	<font color=blue size=4>think highly of</font>\n<br>respect greatly 对…以高度评价；赞扬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His students think highly of his teaching. 学生对他的教学十分赞赏。</font>\n
think little/nothing of	<font color=blue size=4>think little/nothing of</font>\n<br>consider unimportant 轻视\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They think little of the difficulties and setbacks on their way forward. 他们对前进道路上的艰难险阻视若等闲。</font>\n
think of	<font color=blue size=4>think of</font>\n<br>1. consider; give attention to 考虑；关心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have many things to think of at the moment. 目前，我有许多事情要考虑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I said that, I was not thinking of her feelings. 我讲那话时，并没有考虑到她的感情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The department leadership is thinking of adding another recording room to the phonetics lab. 系领导正在考虑给语音实验室增加一个录音室。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are many things which have to be thought of before we finally make up our minds to emigrate. 在下决心移居国外之前，我们有很多事情不得不考虑。</font>\n<br>2. imagine 想象\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you think of why she should do such a thing? 你能想象得出她为什么干这样一件事吗？</font>\n<br>3. have an opinion about; form or have an idea of 思索；认为；对某事持某种看法\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You said nothing at the meeting. What were you thinking of then? 你在会上一言不发，当时在想些什么？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What do you think of my new shoes? 你认为我的新鞋子如何？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They don't think much of his work. 他们认为他的工作不怎么样。</font>\n<br>4. take into account; have in one's mind 为…着想；关心\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He always thinks of other people first, never of himself. 他总是先想到别人，从不想到自己。</font>\n<br>5. remember 记得；想起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know his face, but I can't think of where I've met him. 我看他面熟，可想不起在哪儿见过他了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Will you think of me sometimes? 你有时会想起我吗？</font>\n<br>6. consider as a possibility; anticipate 认为有一种可能；预料\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'd never think of asking someone to lend me so much money！我从未想过要向别人借这么多钱！</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We just wouldn't think of going without you. 我们决不会想到把你丢下就走。</font>\n
think out	<font color=blue size=4>think out</font>\n<br>work out; reason out 想出；推想出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I must think out a way of solving the problem. 我必须想出一个解决这个问题的办法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His arguments have obviously been well thought out. 他的论点很明显是经过周密思考而产生的。</font>\n
think over	<font color=blue size=4>think over</font>\n<br>consider carefully 仔细考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll think over what he suggested. 我将仔细考虑他的建议。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When you've thought things over, you'll probably realize that my idea is quite good after all. 你把情况认真加以思考之后，就可能会意识到，我的想法毕竟是相当不错的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must think it over before you answer. 你得先考虑一下再回答。</font>\n
think through	<font color=blue size=4>think through</font>\n<br>think about until one reaches an understanding or conclusion 想通；想透\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Think it through carefully before you give me your final decision. 把事情仔细想好以后再把你的最后决定告诉我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You must think a problem through before acting. 在采取行动之前你必须把问题仔细考虑好。</font>\n
think twice	<font color=blue size=4>think twice</font>\n<br>think again before acting; hesitate 再三考虑；犹豫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You need to think twice before you make a decision. 在作出决定以前，你需要三思。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I would think twice before taking on such a responsibility. 在担负这个责任之前，我得要反复考虑。</font>\n
think up	<font color=blue size=4>think up</font>\n<br>invent; find 想出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must think up a new way of dealing with him. 我们必须想出一个对付他的新办法。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That was a clever idea. Who thought it up? 那是一个聪明的主意。是谁想出来的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Jack's very good at thinking up excuses for not working. 杰克很善于为自己不干活找借口。</font>\n
through with	<font color=blue size=4>through with</font>\n<br>1. having no more to do with 和…断交；同…不来往\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is through with that mean fellow. 他同那个卑鄙的家伙绝交了。</font>\n<br>2. having done one's work, etc. 完成（工作等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She will be through with his work by the end of the week. 她到周末就会把工作做完了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have so much work to do that I don't know how I shall get through with it. 我要做的工作大多了，我不知道该怎样完成。</font>\n
throw away	<font color=blue size=4>throw away</font>\n<br>1. discard; lose or let slip by foolishness or neglect 抛弃；因愚蠢或疏忽而失去或放弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has thrown away a good opportunity. 他已经失去了一个良好的机会。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are throwing away your chance of becoming a success. 你在错过成功的机会。</font>\n<br>2. fail to use 弃而不用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My advice was thrown away upon him. 我的忠告被他当作耳边风。</font>\n<br>3. use in a foolish or wasteful manner 浪费\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are throwing your money away, buying such useless things. 你买这些没有用的东西是在浪费钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He thinks nothing of throwing away a thousand dollars at the gambling house.他在赌场里一掷千金满不在乎。</font>\n
throw back	<font color=blue size=4>throw back</font>\n<br>1. straighten 挺直\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We should throw back our ahoulders and accept the challenge. 我们应该挺起胸膛，接受挑战。</font>\n<br>2. delay the progress or advance of; check; repulsevigorously 推迟；阻止\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His illness threw him back a year at school. 他因病耽误了一年在校学习时间。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cold he caught threw back his recovery from rheumatism.感冒拖延了他风湿病痊愈的时间。</font>\n<br>3. push back; force to go back to;cause to rely 使回到；使依靠\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has been thrown back on her savings. 她又不得不依靠自己的积蓄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After this failure to get help we were thrown back upon our own resources. 这次求援失败后，我们只有回过头来依靠自己的力量了。</font>\n
throw behind	<font color=blue size=4>throw behind</font>\n<br>delay 延误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heavy snow threw the train behind. 那场大雪使火车误了点。</font>\n
throw off	<font color=blue size=4>throw off</font>\n<br>1. get rid of 摆脱掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She finds it difficult to throw off her pursuers. 她发现很难摆脱追求她的人。</font>\n<br>2. overthrow 推翻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They attempted to throw off the government. 他们企图推翻政府。</font>\n
throw out	<font color=blue size=4>throw out</font>\n<br>eject 逐出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll throw him out of the club. 我们将把他逐出俱乐部。</font>\n
throw/shed light on	<font color=blue size=4>throw/shed light on</font>\n<br>make sth. clearer; provide new information 帮助弄清楚；供给新信息\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These facts throw new light on the matter. 这些事实有助于说明此事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The diary has some interesting light to throw on the last point. 日记对最后这个问题提供了一些有趣的线索。</font>\n
throw up	<font color=blue size=4>throw up</font>\n<br>1. vomit 呕吐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smith suddenly began to throw up all over the place. 史密斯突然吐得到处都是。</font>\n<br>2. resign 辞职\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My job was very boring, so I threw it up last week. 我的工作枯燥无味，所以我上星期就辞掉了。</font>\n
thrust into	<font color=blue size=4>thrust into</font>\n<br>push forcefully into 推入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The guard thrust another prisoner into the room. 卫兵将另一个囚犯推入牢房。</font>\n
thrust through	<font color=blue size=4>thrust through</font>\n<br>push through 挤过去；刺穿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We have to thrust through the crowd. 我们得从人群中挤过去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The prisoner thrust a knife through the guard's bosom. 囚犯用刀刺穿了卫兵的胸部。</font>\n
tie down	<font color=blue size=4>tie down</font>\n<br>limit or restrict sb.'s freedom to do sth. 束缚或限制某人的自由活动；捆住（引申含意）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tom's serious illness tied him down in the hospital for three weeks. 汤姆的重病使他在医院呆了3个星期。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many parents can't get around freely because their children tie them down. 许多父母亲不能自由自在地去旅行，因为小孩把他们给捆住了。</font>\n
tie up	<font color=blue size=4>tie up</font>\n<br>1. put in good order 收拾整齐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll tie up the study today. 我们今天要收拾书房。</font>\n<br>2. delay 延误\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The rainstorm tied up all the traffic along the highway. 暴风雨阻塞了公路交通。</font>\n
time and again	<font color=blue size=4>time and again</font>\n<br>repeatedly; again and again 一次又一次；再三\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Time and again he tried to act like a big shot, but each time we ignored him. 他一次又一次地试图充当重要人物，但每次我们都不理睬他。</font>\n
tired of	<font color=blue size=4>tired of</font>\n<br>weary of 对…厌倦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>All those present were tired of his long and dull speech. 所有与会者都对他的冗长发言感到厌倦。</font>\n
tired out	<font color=blue size=4>tired out</font>\n<br>extremely tired 疲倦不堪\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After getting back from the picnic,we were tired out.野餐归来我们疲惫不堪。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A long walk tired her out. 长时间的步行使她非常疲劳。</font>\n
to a certain extent	<font color=blue size=4>to a certain extent</font>\n<br>somewhat 在某种程度上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You are right to a certain extent. 在某种程度上你是对的。</font>\n
to all appearances	<font color=blue size=4>to all appearances</font>\n<br>apparently 显然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he said was to all appearances correct. 他所说的显然是正确的。</font>\n
to a man	<font color=blue size=4>to a man</font>\n<br>all without exception 全体；一致\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whole class, to a man, took part in the discussion. 全班每个人都参加了讨论。</font>\n
to and fro	<font color=blue size=4>to and fro</font>\n<br>back and forth 来回地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I saw him walking to and fro in his room at that time. 我看见他那时在房间里来回踱着步。</font>\n
to a turn	<font color=blue size=4>to a turn</font>\n<br> (cooked) to just the proper degree （煮得）恰好\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The food was cooked to a turn and was very delicious. 饭菜烹调得当，非常好吃。</font>\n
to begin with	<font color=blue size=4>to begin with</font>\n<br>in the first place 首先；第一点\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To begin with, there must be close cooperation between them. 首先，在他们之间要有密切的合作。</font>\n
to be sure	<font color=blue size=4>to be sure</font>\n<br>certainly 当然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is not pretty, to be sure, but she is very intelligent. 她固然不漂亮，但她非常聪明。</font>\n
to little/no purpose	<font color=blue size=4>to little/no purpose</font>\n<br>of no avail 毫无结果\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He worked to no purpose. 他只是徒劳而已。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We spoke to little or no purpose. 我们说话作用不大或者毫无作用。</font>\n
to my knowledge	<font color=blue size=4>to my knowledge</font>\n<br>as far as I know (usu. used in negative form) 就我所知\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To my knowledge, there is no such a saying in Chinese. 就我所知，汉语中没有这种说法。</font>\n
tone up	<font color=blue size=4>tone up</font>\n<br>become stronger and more effective 使强壮；加强\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Swimming is the best way to tone up your muscles. 游泳是锻炼肌肉的最好方法。</font>\n
to one's feet	<font color=blue size=4>to one's feet</font>\n<br>to a standing position 站立着；起身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His wife's call brought him quickly to his feet. 他夫人的呼唤使他急忙站起身来。</font>\n
to one's heart's content	<font color=blue size=4>to one's heart's content</font>\n<br>to one's greatest satisfaction 尽兴地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They played to their heart's content. 他们痛快地玩了一场。</font>\n
tooth and nail	<font color=blue size=4>tooth and nail</font>\n<br>with all one's efforts 尽全力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must work tooth and nail for the country. 我们必须全力为国家工作。</font>\n
top up	<font color=blue size=4>top up</font>\n<br>fill to the top 加满\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let me top up your drink; it's half gone. 只剩下半杯了，让我给你加满。</font>\n
to sb's credit	<font color=blue size=4>to sb's credit</font>\n<br>to sb.'s honor 是某人的荣誉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's greatly to your Creait that you succeeded. 取得成功是你莫大的光荣。</font>\n
to sb's disappointment	<font color=blue size=4>to sb's disappointment</font>\n<br>resulting in sb. 's disappointment 使某人失望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To her great disappointment, it rained on the day of the picnic. 野餐那天下了雨，使她大失所望。</font>\n
to sb's mind	<font color=blue size=4>to sb's mind</font>\n<br>in sb.'s opinion 某人以为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To my mind, he will fail in the examination. 我认为他考试不会及格的。</font>\n
to sb's race	<font color=blue size=4>to sb's race</font>\n<br>in sb.'s presence 当某人的面\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can ever say that to his face.我甚至可以当他的面说那件事。</font>\n
to sb's taste	<font color=blue size=4>to sb's taste</font>\n<br>to sb.'s liking 投某人所好；适合某人口味\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The food he cooks is to my taste.他做的饭菜合我的口味。</font>\n
to start with	<font color=blue size=4>to start with</font>\n<br>first; for one thing 首先；第一；开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>To start with, I haven't enough reference books. 首先，我没有足够的参考书。</font>\n
to the contrary	<font color=blue size=4>to the contrary</font>\n<br>to the opposite effect 相反地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I will come on Monday unless you write me to the contrary. 我将于星期一来，除非你写信叫我不要来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have heard nothing to the contrary. 我还没有听到任何相反的情况。</font>\n
to the effect that	<font color=blue size=4>to the effect that</font>\n<br>to the import that; meaning 大意是；含意是\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have received a cable to the effect that someone would come to see me. 我收到一封电报，大意是说有人要来看我。</font>\n
to the full	<font color=blue size=4>to the full</font>\n<br>entirely 完全\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am very busy and my time is occupied to the full. 我很忙，没有一点空闲时间。</font>\n
to the last	<font color=blue size=4>to the last</font>\n<br>to the end 到最后；到底\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They fought to the end. 他们战斗到最后。</font>\n
to the point	<font color=blue size=4>to the point</font>\n<br>relevant 中肯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech was very long and not to the point. 他的演讲冗长而且不切题。</font>\n
to this day	<font color=blue size=4>to this day</font>\n<br>up to this time 直到现在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I still don't know her name to this day. 直到现在我还不知道她的姓名。</font>\n
touch up	<font color=blue size=4>touch up</font>\n<br>repair; restore 修整\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is touching up her car. 她正在修整车子。</font>\n
touch (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>touch (up) on</font>\n<br>mention 说到；谈及\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In his lecture, the professor touched on the importance of studying English. 教授在演讲中谈到英语学习的重要性。</font>\n
trace back	<font color=blue size=4>trace back</font>\n<br>follow a chain of evidence 追溯\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The custom can be traced back to the fifth century. 这个习俗可以追溯到5世纪。</font>\n
triumph over	<font color=blue size=4>triumph over</font>\n<br>win victory over 战胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He triumphed over his rivals. 他战胜了对手。</font>\n
trust in	<font color=blue size=4>trust in</font>\n<br>have confidence in 信任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We can't trust in what he said. 我们不能相信他的话。</font>\n
trust to	<font color=blue size=4>trust to</font>\n<br>rely upon 依赖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You trust to your memory too much. 你过于相信自己的记忆力了。</font>\n
try on	<font color=blue size=4>try on</font>\n<br>put on to test 试穿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never buy shoes without trying them on.买鞋时务必要先试穿一下。</font>\n
try out	<font color=blue size=4>try out</font>\n<br>test; use during a trial period 试验；试用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The new kind of engine must be tried out before they are sold. 新型发动机在销售之前一定要进行试验。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They let me try out the sewing machine for several days before buying. 他们让我先试用几天这台缝纫机再买。</font>\n
tune in	<font color=blue size=4>tune in</font>\n<br>adjust（收音机）调谐\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some nights I can tune in that station. 有些晚上，我能够接收到那家电台的广播。</font>\n
tune up	<font color=blue size=4>tune up</font>\n<br>begin to sing or play 开始演（唱、奏）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Birds tune up on early spring mornings. 春天的早晨，鸟儿都放开了歌喉。</font>\n
turn a deaf ear to	<font color=blue size=4>turn a deaf ear to</font>\n<br>refuse to listen to 对…置之不理；对…置若罔闻\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has turned a deaf ear to what his parents said. 他对父母的话置之不理。</font>\n
turn against	<font color=blue size=4>turn against</font>\n<br>oppose (often after earlier support) 对…采取敌对态度；反抗\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He turned against his best friends. 他对最好的朋友也采取了敌对态度。</font>\n
turn around	<font color=blue size=4>turn around</font>\n<br>make a complete turn in order to face in the opposite direction 转身；转向\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>please help me to turn the car around. 请帮我将车调过头来。</font>\n
turn away	<font color=blue size=4>turn away</font>\n<br>1. turn in a different direction 转向别处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please don't turn your head away while I am talking to you. 我和你谈话时，请不要把脸转过去。</font>\n<br>2. refuse to admit 不许进入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hundreds of people were turned away from the theatre. 数以百计的人未能获准进入剧场。</font>\n
turn back	<font color=blue size=4>turn back</font>\n<br>return 返回\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They walked for two hours and then turned back. 他们走了两小时后又返回来了。</font>\n
turn down	<font color=blue size=4>turn down</font>\n<br>1. refuse to accept; reject 拒绝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am afraid your request for a pay rise was turned down again. 恐怕你们要增加工资的要求又一次被拒绝了。</font>\n<br>2. reduce in speed or volume 减弱；调低\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please turn the radio down; I am trying to sleep. 请将收音机音量调小，我想睡觉了。</font>\n
turn in	<font color=blue size=4>turn in</font>\n<br>1. deliver 送交\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't forget to turn in your gun when you leave the army. 离开部队时，别忘了把枪交上来。</font>\n<br>2. go to bed 睡觉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel very tired and want to turn in now. 我觉得很累，想现在就睡。</font>\n
turn into	<font color=blue size=4>turn into</font>\n<br>1. enter by making a turn 转入\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There is a strange vehicle turning into our street. 有一辆陌生的车子拐入了我们这条街。</font>\n<br>2. transform into 变成；译成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Turn the following Chinese into English. 将下列汉语译成英语。</font>\n
turn off	<font color=blue size=4>turn off</font>\n<br>switch off 关掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please turn the lights off when you leave the room. 离开房间时请把灯关掉。</font>\n
turn on	<font color=blue size=4>turn on</font>\n<br>1. switch on 打开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please turn the lights on for me; it's getting dark. 天黑了，请帮我打开灯。</font>\n<br>2. turn against 攻击；反对\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dog turned on me and bit me in the leg. 这狗向我扑来，咬了我的腿。</font>\n
turn one's back on	<font color=blue size=4>turn one's back on</font>\n<br>1. turn rudely away; refuse to speak to 不理睬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Never turn your back on backward students. 决不能漠视落后的学生。</font>\n<br>2. refuse to help 拒绝帮忙\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't turn your back on those who really need help. 对那些确实需要帮助的人不要拒绝。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He never turned his back on his neighbors when they needed help.他的邻居需要帮助时，他从未置之不理。</font>\n<br>3. abandon 放弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He turned his back on the old working method. 他放弃了老的工作方法。</font>\n<br>\n<br>\n<br>turn over\n<br>1. give control to; give ownership to 移交（管理权、业务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since the original owner was now too old to hold on to his business, he turned it over to his son. 原来的主人因年迈而不能继续从业，就转交给他儿子了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When the company president resigned, he turned control over to his associate. 公司总裁辞职时，把管理权让给了副总裁。</font>\n<br>2. hand over; turn in (to the police) 上交（警察等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I turned the thief over to the police. 我把窃贼交给了警方。</font>\n<br>3. turn upside down 翻转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car turned over three times after the crash. 撞车后，小汽车翻了3个跟斗。</font>\n<br>4. think about carefully 考虑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'd better turn the matter over. 你最好考虑一下此事。</font>\n
turn out	<font color=blue size=4>turn out</font>\n<br>1. result 结果证明\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What he had said turned out false.他的话结果证明是假的。</font>\n<br>2. produce 生产\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The school has turned out some good scholars. 该校培养出了一些优秀的学者。</font>\n<br>3. appear 出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A lot of people turned out for the rally. 许多人参加了集会。</font>\n
turn round	<font color=blue size=4>turn round</font>\n<br>1. move so as to face the other way 转脸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Turning round, Isaw a snake crawling toward me.回过头时，我看见一条蛇正向我爬来。</font>\n<br>2. revolve 旋转\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The earth turns round the sun. 地球绕太阳运行。</font>\n
turn to	<font color=blue size=4>turn to</font>\n<br>apply oneself to 致力于；专心于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Yes should turn your thoughts to study. 你应该致力于学习。</font>\n
turn up	<font color=blue size=4>turn up</font>\n<br>1. appear 出现\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He said he would come, but hasn't turned up yet. 他说他会来的，但是还没有到。</font>\n<br>2. increase 增加\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please turn the radio up;I'd like to listen to the news. 请把收音机音量开大一些，我想听听新闻。</font>\n
turn upsidedown	<font color=blue size=4>turn upsidedown</font>\n<br>throw into confusion 混乱一团\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house was turned upsidedown by the burglars. 屋子里被盗贼弄得乱七八糟。</font>\n
under a cloud	<font color=blue size=4>under a cloud</font>\n<br>1. under suspicion; not trusted 被怀疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With the theft of the jewels cleared up, he was no longer under a cloud. 由于珠宝盗窃案已经查清，他不再受到怀疑了。</font>\n
under age	<font color=blue size=4>under age</font>\n<br>too young; not old enough; below legal age 未成年的；未到法定的年龄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could not join the army because he was under age. 他不能参军，因为他不够年龄。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The son cannot have the control of his property, for he is under age. 儿子因为尚未成年，所以不能占有他的财产。</font>\n
under colo (u) r of	<font color=blue size=4>under colo (u) r of</font>\n<br>on the pretext of 以…为借口；在…的幌子下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There are infamous hypocrites who promote their own advantage under color of the public good. 有些无耻的伪君子假公济私，谋取私利。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man extorted money under color of philanthropy from quite a number of people. 那人打着慈善的幌子，从不少人那儿捞取钱财。</font>\n
under consideration	<font color=blue size=4>under consideration</font>\n<br>being considered; given careful thought 在考虑中；在研究中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your proposals are still under consideration. 你的建议仍在考虑之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The matter is at present under consideration. 那件事目前正在考虑。</font>\n
under control	<font color=blue size=4>under control</font>\n<br>under authority; under restraint 在…控制之下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have got flood waters under control. 他们已使泛滥的洪水受到了控制。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I noticed that my legs are not well under control. 我发觉我的两条腿不听使唤。</font>\n
under correction	<font color=blue size=4>under correction</font>\n<br>knowing that one may need to be corrected 不一定全对；有待指正\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>That is my opinion, but I speak under correction. 那只是我的看法，请指正。</font>\n
under cover	<font color=blue size=4>under cover</font>\n<br>hidden; concealed 隐藏；掩蔽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He kept his invention under cover until it was patented. 在取得专利权以前，他对他的发明一直保守秘密。</font>\n
under lock and key	<font color=blue size=4>under lock and key</font>\n<br>securely kept 妥善保管；置于极安全之处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The important documents are all under lock and key. 重要文件都已妥善保存起来了。</font>\n
under no circumstances	<font color=blue size=4>under no circumstances</font>\n<br>never; whatever may happen 决不；无论在何种情况下都不\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I made up my mind that under no circumstances would I agree to such a decision. 我决心在任何情况下都不同意这样的决定。</font>\n
under sb's nose/under the nose of	<font color=blue size=4>under sb's nose/under the nose of</font>\n<br>in an easily seen or noticeable place 在…眼前；在明显的地方\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The thier walked out of the museum with the painting, right under the nose of the guards. 那位小偷带著名画，就在守卫人员的众目睽睽之下走出了博物馆。</font>\n
under the sun	<font color=blue size=4>under the sun</font>\n<br>on earth; in the world (used for emphasis) 在世界上（用于强调）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nothing under the sun is too difficult if you set your mind to it. 世上无难事，只怕有心人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President's assassination shocked everyone under the sun. 总统的遇刺使全世界为之震惊。</font>\n
under the weather	<font color=blue size=4>under the weather</font>\n<br>unwell, although not seriously ill 不舒服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Brian is feeling under the weather, so he's going to bed early tonight. 布莱恩不舒服，因此今晚他睡觉很早。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I was a bit under the weather last week, but I'm all right now. 我上星期身体有点不舒服，但现在好了。</font>\n
under way	<font color=blue size=4>under way</font>\n<br>1. through the water; in motion (said of a vessel starting out) （指船）在航行之中；在前进途中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The ship is under way for London. 这艘船正在前往伦敦的途中。</font>\n<br>2. making progress or having started 正在进行中；已开始\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Preparations for the celebration of National Day are under way. 庆祝国庆的准备工作正在进行之中。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our plan is well under way. 我们的计划正在顺利地实施之中。</font>\n
up against	<font color=blue size=4>up against</font>\n<br>faced or confronted with 面临；遭遇\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In that type of business we will naturally be up against very stiff competition. 在那类经营中，我们会自然遇到激烈的竞争。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We'll be up against a much stronger team. 我们将面对的是一支强得多的队。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were up against a lot of difficulties, but managed to overcome them. 他们遇到了许许多多的困难，但还是设法克服了。</font>\n
up against it	<font color=blue size=4>up against it</font>\n<br>faced with a great difficulty or problem 面临极大的困难；经济拮据\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is very resourceful, but this time he was up against it. 他一向足智多谋，可这次还是遇到了极大的困难。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My family is up against it because I can't find a job. 由于找不到工作，我家经济拮据。</font>\n
up and about	<font color=blue size=4>up and about</font>\n<br>in good health; active after an illness 病后康复；病后起床活动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It feels good to be up and about after a week of being indoors with the flu. 患流感在家里呆了一周后，起床活动活动感觉挺好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The heart operation restricted him to the hospital for several weeks, but now he's up and about and as active as ever. 心脏病手术使他在医院呆了好几周，但是现在他已经康复而且象以前一样活跃了。</font>\n

up and down	<font color=blue size=4>up and down</font>\n<br>1. to and fro; backwards and forwards 来来回回；上上下下\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My father walked up and down the room, as if in deep thought. 我爸爸若有所思地在房间里踱来踱去。</font>\n<br>2. in every direction; everywhere 到处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where have you been just now? I have looked for you up and down for nearly half an hour. 你刚才在哪儿？我到处找你快有半个小时了。</font>\n<br>3. completely; thoroughly 完全地；彻底地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Here is his hometown which he knows up and down. 这儿是他十分熟悉的家乡。</font>\n<br>4. unstable 时好时坏\n<br>—How are things at your office? \n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>—Oh, up and down, you know. —你办公室的情况如何？—唉，时好时坏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I've been rather up and down recently. I think I need a holiday. 近来我身体时好时坏，我想该休假了。</font>\n
