up to	<font color=blue size=4>up to</font>\n<br>l. as far as; up to the present 直到现在\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He hasn't seen any elephant up to the present day. 他到现在也没有见过大象。</font>\n<br>2. doing (usu. sth. wrong); plotting 从事于；策划\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Some people believe those men are spies, but no one knows what they are up to. 有人认为那些人是间谍，但是没有人知道他们想干什么。</font>\n<br>3. dependent on the decision of sb. 由…决定\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's up to you to decide whether we buy this set of furniture or not. 由你来定我们是否买这套家具。</font>\n<br>4. able to do sth. 适合；胜任\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is not up to the work assigned to her. 她不胜任所干的工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't feel up to the work. 我觉得自己干不了这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not up to travelling. 我的身体不适合旅行。</font>\n
up to date	<font color=blue size=4>up to date</font>\n<br>modern; of the present time; of the newest sort 现代的；跟上时代的；最新式的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your skirt is quite up to date. 你的裙子款式是最时新的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mother, you must get more up to date with modern styles！You can't wear those things. 妈妈，你应该接受些时髦的东西，不能穿那些玩艺儿了。</font>\n
up to the elbows	<font color=blue size=4>up to the elbows</font>\n<br>deeply involved or engaged 孜孜于；忙于；专心致志于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They are up to the elbows in work; let's not disturb them. 他们工作很忙，我们还是不要打扰他们吧。</font>\n
use up	<font color=blue size=4>use up</font>\n<br>1. consume completely; use until nothing is left 用完；耗尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have used up their money. 他们已经把钱花光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't use up all the soap. Leave me some to wash with. 不要把肥皂用完，留些给我洗。</font>\n<br>2. tire completely; make very tired; exhaust 使精疲力尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has used up all his energy. 他已精疲力尽了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After rowing the boat across the lake, Robert was used up. 罗伯特把船划到对岸之后，累得精疲力尽。</font>\n
vamp up	<font color=blue size=4>vamp up</font>\n<br>1. make up; invent 拼凑；捏造\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He vamped up a few ugly rumors to discredit his colleague. 他捏造了若干卑鄙的谣言以中伤他的同事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can vamp up an excuse that sounds true. 他能炮制一个听起来象真的一样的借口。</font>\n<br>2. improvise 即席创造；临时凑成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They vamped up the music. 他们即席创作了那首乐曲。</font>\n
vary from…to	<font color=blue size=4>vary from…to</font>\n<br>differ from 在…到…之间变化；从…到…不等\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Opinions in the committee vary from approval to complete opposition. 委员会里的观点从赞成到坚决反对都有。</font>\n
verge (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>verge (up) on</font>\n<br>come close to 接近\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His manner verges on impoliteness. 他的态度近乎不礼貌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm afraid that his behaviour verges on madness. 他的行为恐怕接近于发疯。</font>\n
vice versa	<font color=blue size=4>vice versa</font>\n<br>conversely 反之亦然；反过来也是如此\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The man blames his wife and vice versa. 这人责备他的妻子，他妻子反过来又责备他。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Students should learn from teachers and vice versa. 学生应当向教师学习，教师也应当向学生学习。</font>\n<br>visit with 644\n<br>1. chat or talk with 与…聊天\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't visit with your friend on the telephone. 不要跟朋友在电话里聊天。</font>\n<br>2. visit 访问；看望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We hope you will visit with us sometime. 我们希望你什么时候来我们这儿作客。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She loves visiting with her neigh bours on Sundays. 她喜欢在星期天和邻居聊天。</font>\n
vote down	<font color=blue size=4>vote down</font>\n<br>defeat by voting against 投票击败；否决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>People have voted him down. 人们把他选掉了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone proposed that the proceedings of the meeting should be recorded on tape, but the suggestion was voted down. 有人建议会议讨论情况必须录音，但这个建议被否决了。</font>\n
vote in	<font color=blue size=4>vote in</font>\n<br>elect by vote 投票选举出（某人）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was voted in by an overwhelming majority. 他以压倒多数的选票当选了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The President has been voted in for the third time. 总统已第3次当选。</font>\n
vote out	<font color=blue size=4>vote out</font>\n<br>reject through voting 投票使某人落选\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They voted him out by a majority of 20. 他们以20票的多数使他落选。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wonder how he got voted out of office. 我不知道他是怎样被投票罢免的。</font>\n
vote through	<font color=blue size=4>vote through</font>\n<br>pass by voting 表决通过\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The assembly has voted the new reforms through. 大会投票通过了新的改革方案。</font>\n
wade in/into	<font color=blue size=4>wade in/into</font>\n<br>1. go busily to work; set to work with vigour 忙碌地工作；精神饱满地工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work won't wait; We'd better wade in now. 工作不能再拖下去了，我们还是现在就干起来吧。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The house was a mess after the party, but Mother waded in and soon made it clean again. 聚会以后屋内乱七八糟，母亲赶紧整理，使房间很快就又变得整齐了。</font>\n<br>2. attack 攻击\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When she had heard Jerry's argument, she waded in and tore it apart. 听完杰瑞的论点后，她给予了猛烈的抨击，把他的观点驳得体无完肤。</font>\n
wade through	<font color=blue size=4>wade through</font>\n<br>work steadily and slowly 缓慢而艰难地工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I shan't be home for dinner; I'm still wading through all those urgent letters. 我不回家吃晚饭了，我还在处理这些急信，进展很缓慢。</font>\n
wait about/around	<font color=blue size=4>wait about/around</font>\n<br>stay in a place (usu. idly and impatiently) 在某处等待（通常指无聊地和不耐烦地）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They waited about for another bus, but none came. 他们不耐烦地等着下一辆公共汽车，可是一直没有车来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Where have you been? I've been waiting around for you for more than an hour！你去哪儿了？我已等了你一个多小时！</font>\n
wait at/on table	<font color=blue size=4>wait at/on table</font>\n<br>serve food 侍候开饭；端菜送饭；（在餐馆）当服务员\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The girl earns her pocket money by waiting at table in a restaurant. 这女孩在一家餐馆当服务员以挣些零花钱。</font>\n
wait on/upon	<font color=blue size=4>wait on/upon</font>\n<br>1. serve; attend as a servant 侍候；吃饭时作招待\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She waited on us at dinner. 她在一旁侍候我们吃饭。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old lady does not like to be waited upon, because she thinks she is still capable of taking care of herself. 那位老太太不喜欢别人侍候，因为她认为她生活还能自理。</font>\n<br>2. follow as a consequence 为…结果；随…而产生\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Success waits on hard work. 成功来自于勤奋。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His whole future waits on the results of the examination. 他的整个前程都取决于这次考试的结果。</font>\n
wait out	<font color=blue size=4>wait out</font>\n<br>1. defeat by waiting 以等待的方式挫败\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We shall wait the enemy out, and watch them starve. 我们将按兵不动，等着敌人断粮挨饿。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The enemy are still advancing, but we can wait them out in this valley. 敌人还在前进，可我们可以按兵不动，使他们在这山谷里不战自败。</font>\n<br>2. await calmly and patiently the end of 安静而耐心地等待…结束\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The storm showed no sign of abating. We'd have to be patient and wait it out. 风暴丝毫没有减弱的迹象，我们只得耐心地等待它过去。</font>\n
wait up	<font color=blue size=4>wait up</font>\n<br>1. delay going to bed 熬夜等候\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll wait up for you tonight. 今天晚上我不睡觉也要等你。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I may be late, but please don't wait up for me. 我可能晚回来，你先睡，不要等我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>2. stop and wait for sb. to catch up 停下来等候别人赶上去。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't go fast！Wait up for me！别走那么快，等我一下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Hadn't we better wait up for theslower ones? 我们是不是等一下后面的人？</font>\n
wake up	<font color=blue size=4>wake up</font>\n<br>1. waken 醒\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Be quiet, my mother's asleep; don't wake her up. 不要讲话，我妈妈睡着了，别把她吵醒。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I usually wake up at five o'clock. 我通常5点钟醒。</font>\n<br>2. realize or make sb. realize what is happening（使）醒悟；觉醒；认识到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I wish I could wake them up to the danger they are in. 但愿我能使他们认识到他们所处的险境。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You should wake up to the fact that you are not working hard enough. 你应该认识到你并没有全力以赴地工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This event may wake him up. 这件事可能会使他醒悟。</font>\n<br>3. become stirred from an inactive state 活跃起来；振作起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>On holidays the little town wakes up. 每逢假日，这个小城镇就活跃起来了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll have to wake up if you wish to succeed. 如果你想获得成功，就必须振作起来。</font>\n<br>4. stir; excite 激起；引起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His heroic deeds woke up the whole neighbourhood. 他的英雄事迹轰动了所有的左邻右舍。</font>\n
walk away from	<font color=blue size=4>walk away from</font>\n<br>1. win easily in a race or competition 在比赛中轻而易举地获胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked away from all his competitors in the 3, 000metre race. 在3000米赛跑中，他遥遥领先于所有其他选手。</font>\n<br>2. survive (an accident) with little or no injury 从（事故中）平安脱身\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How could he walk away from a crash like that without a mark on him? 他在那次车祸中怎么会没受一点伤而平安脱险的？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked away from the shipwreck. 在这次沉船事件中他平安脱险了。</font>\n
walk away/off with	<font color=blue size=4>walk away/off with</font>\n<br>1. take and go away with; take away; steal 取走；偷走；顺手拿走\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Someone got in and walked awaywith the jewels while we were out. 我们不在的时候，有人进来顺手把珠宝偷走了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can a thief walk off with a safe in broad daylight? 一个小偷怎能在光天化日之下将一个保险箱偷走呢？</font>\n<br>2. take, get or win easily 轻而易举地获得或赢得\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked away with the election; his majority was about ten thousand. 他多得1万张左右的选票，轻而易举地赢了这场选举。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our team walked off with the championship. 我队轻而易举地得了冠军。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We expected Peter to walk off with the prize, but he didn't. 我们本来指望彼得会轻而易举地获奖，可他没有。</font>\n
walk into	<font color=blue size=4>walk into</font>\n<br>1. eat or drink greedily 大吃大喝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked into a dinner. 他狼吞虎咽地吃了一顿晚餐。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boy walked into a big bowl of chicken soup when the mistress was out visiting a neighbour. 那男孩趁女主人出去串门的时候，把一大碗鸡汤喝了个精光。</font>\n<br>2. scold; attack 责骂；申斥；攻击；殴打\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walks into us all as if it were our faults. 他把我们大家大骂了一顿，好象是我们的过错。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I could hear the director walking into Jim for being late again. 我可以听到主任在责骂吉姆又一次迟到。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry walked into his attackers. 亨利毫不畏惧地向袭击他的人冲去。</font>\n<br>3. meet with through inattention 由于疏忽而遭到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mind you, don't walk into a trap！小心，别上当！</font>\n
walk off	<font color=blue size=4>walk off</font>\n<br>1. get rid of by walking 用走路来消除\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I used to walk off my headache. 我常常以散步来消除头痛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He tried to walk off the effect of the drink. 他试图以散步来醒酒。</font>\n<br>2. depart 离开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My father said no more and walked off. 我父亲没有再说下去，转身离开了。</font>\n
walk of life	<font color=blue size=4>walk of life</font>\n<br>way of living; manner in which people live; occupation 生活方式；社会阶层；行业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The newsman interviewed people from all walks of life. 记者采访了各界人士。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The banker did not want his son to marry a girl in a different walk of life. 那个银行家不想让他儿子和一个不同社会阶层的女子结婚。</font>\n
walk one's chalks	<font color=blue size=4>walk one's chalks</font>\n<br>go away without notice 不告而别\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked his chalks and went to Shanghai. 他不辞而别去了上海。</font>\n
walk out	<font color=blue size=4>walk out</font>\n<br>1. go on strike 罢工\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Building workers walked out during the morning in protest of the sacking of a bricklayer. 建筑工人上午举行罢工，抗议解雇一名砌砖工人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There's another strike threatening; some of the workers walked out today. 又一次罢工迫近了，今天已有一些工人不干活了。</font>\n<br>2. leave in protest 退席抗议\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The representatives of the offended country walked out when the opposing speaker took the floor. 当对方发言时，受攻击的国家代表退席以示抗议。</font>\n<br>3. be in love 谈恋爱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>John and Mary are walking out. 约翰和玛丽在谈恋爱。</font>\n
walk out on	<font color=blue size=4>walk out on</font>\n<br>abandon; desert 遗弃；抛弃\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can't just walk out on us like this. 你不能这样丢下我们不管。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mike just walked out on his wife and family without saying a word. 迈克一句话也没说就丢下妻子儿女不管了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She treated him badly, but she never thought he'd walk out on her. 她待他很不好，可她从不认为他会抛弃她。</font>\n
walk over	<font color=blue size=4>walk over</font>\n<br>1. disregard the wishes or feelings of; treat like a slave; impose upon 无视（某人）的感情或愿望；把…当奴隶对待；欺侮\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He would walk over other people to get what he wanted. 他会无视别人的意愿来达到自己的目的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't let your husband walk over you like that. 别让你丈夫那样盛气凌人对你。</font>\n<br>2. defeat easily and by a wide margin 轻易地打败（而且分数相差甚多）；获胜全不费工夫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joans simply walked over Brown in billiards. 在台球比赛中，琼斯不费吹灰之力赢了布朗。</font>\n
walk the chalk	<font color=blue size=4>walk the chalk</font>\n<br>act exactly as you are supposed to; behave properly; obey 循规蹈矩；严格遵守；服从\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young teacher took great pains to make his students walk the chalk. 那位年轻教师费了好大的劲来使学生们遵守纪律。</font>\n
walk the hospital	<font color=blue size=4>walk the hospital</font>\n<br>practise as a student to observe the methods of physicians and surgeons 到医院实习\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You have to walk the hospital for a time as part of your medical course. 你必须在医院实习一段时期，作为医学课程的一部分。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Medical students are required to walk the hospital for a period of time before their graduation. 医科大学生毕业前必须到医院实习一段时间。</font>\n
walk through	<font color=blue size=4>walk through</font>\n<br>1. go through (a play, an acting part, etc.) in a perfunctory manner 马马虎虎地演或念台词\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He didn't like the script and walked through his part. 他不喜欢那个剧本，因此马马虎虎地扮演他的角色。</font>\n<br>2. deal with or carry out perfunctorily 敷衍了事地处理或做完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He walked through the test. 他草草地做完了试验。</font>\n
warm up	<font color=blue size=4>warm up</font>\n<br>1. become or make more excited or enthusiastic（使）变得热烈、活跃起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We arrived just when the party was beginning to warm up. 正当聚会开始热闹起来时，我们赶到了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He warmed up when I told him the good news. 当我把这好消息告诉他时，他兴奋了起来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Peter's jokes certainly warmed the party up. 彼得讲的笑话的确使晚会的气氛变得热烈起来。</font>\n<br>2. become friendly 变得亲热起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he found that we were railway workers just like him, he began to warm up. 当得知我们同他一样也是铁路工人时，他开始对我们亲热起来。</font>\n<br>\n<br>3. reheat cooked food 把（煮熟的食物）重新加热\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The milk is warming up on the store. 炉子上正热着牛奶。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My father was so late that his dinner got cold; my mother had to warm it up. 我爸爸回家太晚，晚饭都冷了，妈妈不得不把饭菜再热一下。</font>\n<br>4. become warm 变得暖和起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was very cold this morning, but it seems to be warming up. 今天早上真够冷的，现在好像变得暖和起来了。</font>\n<br>5. get ready for a game or other event by exercising or practicing 做准备工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The dancers began to warm up fifteen minutes before the performance. 舞蹈演员们在演出前15分钟开始做准备工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's warm up the car engine a bit before we start. 出发前我们先把汽车发动机预热一下。</font>\n<br>6. refurnish 重新修整；刷新\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have just warmed up the same old plan. 他们只不过是把原来的计划改头换面罢了。</font>\n
warn off	<font color=blue size=4>warn off</font>\n<br>tell to keep away 令…回避；叫…走开\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He warns everybody off who tries to be friendly with his girlfriend. 他不许任何人跟他女友亲近。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The road was closed to traffic after the accident, and the police were warning everyone off. 事故发生后，道路被封锁，不准通行，警察正通知人们此路不通。</font>\n
wash out	<font color=blue size=4>wash out</font>\n<br>1. remove by washing 洗掉\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Can you tell me how I can wash out these stains? 你能告诉我怎样洗掉这些污迹吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This stain didn't wash out. 这个污迹洗不掉。</font>\n<br>2. demolish by the action of water 冲掉；冲毁\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The embankment was washed out by the storm. 路堤被暴雨冲毁了。</font>\n<br>3. spoil by the action of rain, etc. 因雨等受影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Bad weather has washed the game out. 天气不好影响了比赛。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Today's football match has been washed out by a sudden downpour. 今天的足球赛因突然下了一场大雨而取消了。</font>\n<br>4. fail to qualify or continue; be eliminated 被淘汰；没有及格\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was washed out after one semester. 他读了一个学期就被淘汰了。</font>\n<br>5. deplete the strength or vitality of (usu. used in the passive voice) 使累极；使精疲力尽（常用被动语态）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I feel washed out; I shall stop working. 我感到累极了，我将不干了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is washed out after her recent illness. 最近她生了一场病，身体极其虚弱。</font>\n<br>6. lose color; drain off color 退色；因洗涤而掉色\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the skirt had been cleaned, its bright red was washed out. 这条裙子洗过以后，它那浅红色就退掉了。</font>\n
wash up	<font color=blue size=4>wash up</font>\n<br>1. clean the dishes after a meal 饭后洗餐具\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have the dishes been washed up? 餐具洗好了吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's your turn to wash up today. 今天该你洗碗了。</font>\n<br>2. wash one's face and hands; have a wash 洗手；洗脸；洗澡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She washed up before lunch. 她洗一洗才吃午饭。</font>\n<br>3. exhausted; finished 精疲力尽；完蛋\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After a day at the office I feel completely washed up. 在办公室干了一天下来，我感到精疲力尽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry and Julie aren't lovers any more; they've washed up. 亨利和朱丽已不再相爱，他们的恋爱关系已经结束了。</font>\n<br>4. carry to shore 将…冲上岸\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The body was washed up the following morning. 尸体第2天早上给冲到了岸上。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The incoming tide washed up cargo from the wrecked ship. 上涨的潮水将失事船只上的货物冲到了岸边。</font>\n
waste away	<font color=blue size=4>waste away</font>\n<br>lose flesh, strength or vitality 日渐消瘦；日渐衰弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Since her operation, she has simply been wasting away and may not last long. 自从她动手术以来，就日渐虚弱，也许活不长了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is wasting away from the disease. 他因病日渐瘦弱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She has wasted away to a skeleton. 她已骨瘦如柴。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After her husband died, she wasted away with grief. 她丈夫死后，她在悲伤中消瘦了。</font>\n
waste one's breath/words	<font color=blue size=4>waste one's breath/words</font>\n<br>speak pointlessly; speak or argue with no result 白费唇舌\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old man is so stubborn that you'd be only wasting your breath trying to make him change his mind. 那个老头子太固执，你去劝他改变主意，不过是白费口舌。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I saw that I was wasting my words; he refused to believe me. 我发现我是在白费口舌，他根本不相信我。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't argue with Frank any longer. You are only wasting your breath trying to get him to contribute to the Red Cross. 不要与弗兰克再争下去了，你要他给红十字会捐款只不过是白费口舌而已。</font>\n
watch one's step	<font color=blue size=4>watch one's step</font>\n<br>1. be careful not to make an error 小心；谨慎行事；留意不犯错\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Watch your step, young man！If you're late for work again you will lose your job. 当心，年轻人！如果你上班再迟到，你就会丢了工作。</font>\n<br>2. be careful not to fall or stumble 小心走路；留意不要跌倒或摔跤\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Watch your step; the roads are icy. 当心不要摔跤，路很滑。</font>\n
watch out	<font color=blue size=4>watch out</font>\n<br>look out; be on guard 小心；提防\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll be cheated if you don't watch out. 如果你不小心，就会上当受骗。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Watch out for cars when you cross the street. 过街时要注意来往车辆。</font>\n
watch over	<font color=blue size=4>watch over</font>\n<br>guard for protection or safekeeping 监视；保护；看守\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The farmers there use specially trained dogs to watch over their sheep at night. 那儿的农民用受过特殊训练的狗在夜间看守羊群。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They were watched over by the policemen. 他们由警察看守。</font>\n
water down	<font color=blue size=4>water down</font>\n<br>1. reduce in quality or value; weaken the strength or force of sth. (by addition or alteration) 降低质量或价值；（通过增加或删改）减弱\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher had to water down the course for a slowlearning class. 老师不得不降低课程的要求来迁就慢班的学生。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The story has been watered down. 故事的生动性被冲淡了。</font>\n<br>2. add water to 掺水以冲淡\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The whisky has been watered down. 那威士忌酒掺水了。</font>\n
wear away	<font color=blue size=4>wear away</font>\n<br>1. disappear gradually through wear 磨损\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The inscriptions on the stones have worn away. 石头上的碑文已经被磨损了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The footsteps of thousands of visitors had worn away the steps. 台阶已经被成千上万参观者的脚步磨平了。</font>\n<br>2. be reduced until it disappears 慢慢地消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could feel pain again as the medicine wore away. 药性消退后，他又感到疼痛了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My patience is almost worn away by her endless complaints. 她不停的抱怨已使我几乎无法忍耐了。</font>\n<br>3. (of time) pass slowly； (vigour, etc.) fade away（时间）慢慢地消逝；（精力等）衰退\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don'k wear away your youth in trifles！不要虚度年华。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The long winter wore away. 漫长的冬天过去了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Being in prison for many years has wore away the prisoner's resistance. 多年呆在监狱里已经把那个罪犯的反抗精神给消磨掉了。</font>\n
wear down	<font color=blue size=4>wear down</font>\n<br>1. reduce or impair by long wearing; erode 磨掉；侵蚀\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The soles of my shoes are already worn down. It's time I got a new pair. 我的鞋底磨破了，该换双新鞋了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wind and rain have worn the monument down. 风雨将那座纪念碑侵蚀了。</font>\n<br>2. exhaust; make or become weaker by constant pressure or attack 使衰弱；使精疲力尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His strength has been worn down by illness. 疾病已使他体质衰弱了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Many young mothers appear worn down with hard work, looking after children. 许多年轻的母亲因为工作辛苦和照料孩子而显得疲惫不堪。</font>\n<br>3. prevail by persistence; overcome 由于坚持而获胜；克服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Through perseverance, they gradually wore down opposition to the scheme. 通过坚持不懈的努力，他们逐渐克服了实施这项计划的阻力。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The general has decided to wear down the enemy's strength by a long slow campaign. 将军决定用持久战的打法来消耗敌人的力量。</font>\n
wear off	<font color=blue size=4>wear off</font>\n<br>1. lose power; diminish in effect; disappear 失效；效力减少；消失\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He could feel the wound aching again as the effect of the medicine wore off. 随着药性的渐渐消失，他感到伤口疼痛了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My headache isn't serious. It will wear off after an hour or so. 我的头痛不严重，一小时左右就会好的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His enthusiasm for the plan seems to have worn off; he never speaks about it any more. 他对这项计划的热情似乎已经消失了，他现在提都不提了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His displeasure wore off. 他的不愉快心情渐渐消失了。</font>\n<br>2. remove (nap, paint, etc.) through continuous pressure, fric tion, etc. 磨掉（绒毛、油漆等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The nap of your coat is worn off. 你外衣上的绒毛都磨光了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The brightness of the paint has worn off a little. 油漆的光泽已经有些磨损了。</font>\n
wear on	<font color=blue size=4>wear on</font>\n<br>1. pass gradually or slowly in time （时间）慢慢地过去；缓缓消逝\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The snow will melt as the day wears on. 雪随着白天时间的消逝而融化。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>As the hours wore on, he grew more and more impatient. 时间慢慢地过去，他越来越不耐烦了。</font>\n<br>2. continue 继续\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The boys'quarrel wore on all afternoon. 孩子们吵吵闹闹，持续了整个下午。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The battle wore on through the night. 战斗持续了一夜。</font>\n<br>3. become angry; irritate; tire 激怒；使恼火；使疲倦\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Having to stay indoors all day long is tiresome for the children and wears on their mother's nerves. 孩子们整天呆在家里很厌烦，也使得他们的母亲感到焦躁不安。</font>\n
wear out	<font color=blue size=4>wear out</font>\n<br>1. tire out; exhaust 使精疲力尽；耗尽\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Playing with little children really wears me out！跟小孩子们在一起玩真把我累坏了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She keeps wearing herself out for other people. 她总是为别人忙得精疲力尽。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After about an hour, my patience began to wear out. 大约一小时以后，我开始有点忍耐不住了。</font>\n<br>2. become useless 变得无用；用坏\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The machine has worn out. 那台机器已经报废了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Children's shoes wear out quickly. 孩子们的鞋很快就穿坏。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The child has worn out his clothes; will you get him another suit? 孩子已经把衣服穿破了，你给他再买一套好吗？</font>\n<br>3. consume (time, etc.) tediously 消磨（时间等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has worn out miserable days with patience. 他耐心地度过了悲惨的岁月。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The meeting wore out all afternoon. 会议消磨了整个下午的时间。</font>\n

wear well	<font color=blue size=4>wear well</font>\n<br>1. continue to be useful or liked for a long time 经久耐用；始终令人满意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Nylon is easy to wash and wears well too. 尼龙既好洗又耐磨。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Their marriage has worn well. 他们的婚姻一直美满幸福。</font>\n<br>2. carry, accept or treat properly 举止适当；妥善处理\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Murphy has won many honours, but he wears them well. 墨菲赢得了很多荣誉，但他对待荣誉谦虚而得体。</font>\n

what if	<font color=blue size=4>what if</font>\n<br>what will happen if; what is the difference if; suppose that 假设…；如果…, 该怎么办\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I don't like to have you go boating in such weather. What if a storm should come up? 我不想让你在这样的天气里去划船，要是刮起了大风暴怎么办？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What if he doesn't come? We can not do without him. 如果他不来怎么办？没有他，我们就无法干。</font>\n
what of	<font color=blue size=4>what of</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>1. what do you say or think of? 尊意如何；你认为…怎么样？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Today? But what of yesterday? 今天吗？昨天又如何呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>2. what importance can be assigned to 有什么关系？有什么要紧？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His speech may not be exactly standard English, but what of that? 他讲的可能不是地道的标准英语，但那有什么关系呢？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>“John missed the bus. ”—“What of it? He can take the next one. ”“约翰没赶上公共汽车。”“那有什么关系？他可以乘坐下一班车。”</font>\n<br>what with…and (what with) \n<br>partly because of…, partly because of 一方面因为…, 一方面又因为\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What with their inferior equipment and what with their outdated technique the workers in that plant failed to fulfil their annual production plan last year. 一方面因为设备差，一方面又因为技术落后，那个厂的工人去年没有完成年度生产计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>What with all this work and so little sleep at night, I don't think I can go on much longer. 工作这么多，再加上晚上睡得又少，我想我坚持不了多久了。</font>\n

whip up	<font color=blue size=4>whip up</font>\n<br>1. incite; arouse; stir 煽动；挑逗；激起\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The orator whipped the crowd up to a state of frenzy. 演讲者把听众的情绪煽动到了疯狂的程度。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>By his speech, he whipped up tremendous enthusiasm among the audience. 他用演说激发了听众的极大热情。</font>\n<br>2. plan or assemble quickly; prepare quickly 迅速地计划或聚集；迅速准备\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The reporter whipped up a story about the fire for his paper. 这位记者很快就为那家报纸写了一篇有关火灾的报道。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She can whip up a dress in an afternoon. 她能很快地一个下午做件衣服。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He can whip up a delicious dinner in half the time it takes another man. 他能用别人的一半时间备一席美味的酒宴。</font>\n
whistle for	<font color=blue size=4>whistle for</font>\n<br>demand or expect without success; fail to obtain 空想；徒然想得到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Mary didn't even thank us for helping her, so next time she needs help she can whistle for it. 我们帮了玛丽的忙，她连谢都不谢，下次她休想别人帮她忙。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'm not prepared to use any of the firm's money to pay this man; let him whistle for his money. 我不准备用公司的钱付给那个人，他休想得到钱。</font>\n
white lie	<font color=blue size=4>white lie</font>\n<br>kind untruth; small lie 善意的假话；不严重的撒谎\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When I said I liked her dinner, which really was terrible, I told a white lie because I didn't want to hurt her feelings. 我说我喜欢她的晚餐，其实晚餐实在是不怎么样，我言不由衷怕伤了她的心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I told a white lie when I told him that I liked his poor painting. 我告诉他我喜欢他那幅很一般的油画时，我说了假话。</font>\n

wind down	<font color=blue size=4>wind down</font>\n<br>1. relax; lose momentum 松懈；松劲；松口气\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I felt tense, but now I'm beginning to wind down a bit. 我原先觉得紧张，但现在开始放松一点了。</font>\n<br>2. move more slowly; cause a gradual lessening of 逐渐减慢；逐渐减轻；逐步缩小\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The business has wound down during the recent recession. 在最近的经济衰退期间，商业很不景气。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>At school, things start winding down a few weeks before the summer holiday. 放暑假前的几个星期，学校的各项工作开始逐渐告一段落。</font>\n
wind up	<font color=blue size=4>wind up</font>\n<br>1. bring or come to an end; conclude 结束；歇业\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's time he wound up his speech. 该是他结束演讲的时候了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's wind up the meeting; it's getting late. 咱们散会吧，天不早了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The case was wound up a year ago！那桩案子一年前就了结了！</font>\n<br>2. bring to a state of great tension; excite 使紧张；使兴奋；振作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was all wound up before the performance. 演出前她很紧张。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't get so wound up; there's nothing to get excited or nervous about！别那么激动，没有什么可激动和紧张的！</font>\n<br>3. tighten the spring of a machine; make it work or run 上发条\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wound up the toy train and let it run across the room. 她上紧了玩具火车的发条，让它在房间里跑。</font>\n
win in a walk/breeze	<font color=blue size=4>win in a walk/breeze</font>\n<br>win very easily; win without having to try hard 轻易获胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was expected to win in a walk, but he was badly beaten. 人们以为他会轻易获胜，但是他却被打得一败涂地。</font>\n
win one's spurs	<font color=blue size=4>win one's spurs</font>\n<br>win fame or honor 获得荣誉；成名\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Edison won his spurs as an inventor while young. 爱迪生很年轻时就因创造发明而一举成名。</font>\n
win one's way	<font color=blue size=4>win one's way</font>\n<br>advance by one's efforts 凭自己的努力而获得成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has at length won his way to the head of his profession. 他终于凭自己的努力而成为他那一行的带头人。</font>\n
win out/through	<font color=blue size=4>win out/through</font>\n<br>be victorous or successful after hard work or difficulty; win or succeed in the end 经过艰苦努力和克服了困难而取得成功；胜利；成功\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Although it was a difficult problem, in the end he won out. 虽然这个问题很棘手，最后他还是把它解决了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Correct ideas will certainly win out against erroneous ones. 正确的意见必将战胜错误的意见。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I know whatever you do you're sure to win through in spite of early difficulties. 我知道，不管你做什么，你最终总会成功的，尽管最初有许多困难。</font>\n
win over	<font color=blue size=4>win over</font>\n<br>persuade to change sides or opinions 说服；把…争取过来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have won over a number of opponents. 他们争取了一些反对者。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She didn't like me at first, but I was soon able to win her over by being especially considerate. 她一开始不喜欢我，可我很快就通过对她特别关心体贴而把她争取过来了。</font>\n
win the day	<font color=blue size=4>win the day</font>\n<br>be successful or victorious 战胜\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We've won the day. 我们获胜了。</font>\n
win (up) on	<font color=blue size=4>win (up) on</font>\n<br>gain favor or influence with 赢得…的欢心；得宠于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her beauty and amiadility won upon him. 她的美貌和温柔赢得了他的欢心。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has a softness and beneficence which wins on the hearts of others. 他待人和气善良，很得人心。</font>\n
wise up (to) 	<font color=blue size=4>wise up (to) </font>\n<br>finally understand what is really going on after a period of ignorance; become or make aware 恍然大悟；识破；使看透\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Joe immediately quit his job when he wised up to what was really going on. 乔得知底细后马上辞职不干了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>His mother tried to wise him up about the company he kept, but he wouldn't listen to her. 他母亲想提醒他弄清他交的朋友的底细，但他听不进她的话。</font>\n
wish for	<font color=blue size=4>wish for</font>\n<br>desire to possess; long for 想得到；渴望\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The city has everything that one could wish for, except good weather. 这个城市具有人们想要得到的一切，就是天气不好。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The weather was everything they could wish for. 这天气对他们来说是再好也没有的了。</font>\n
wishful thinking	<font color=blue size=4>wishful thinking</font>\n<br>interpretation of facts, actions, words, etc. as one would like them to be rather than as they really are 如意算盘；主观臆想\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's wishful thinking to imagine you can learn a foreign language without hard work. 不下苦功夫就想学好一门外语，那是痴心妄想。</font>\n
wish (off) on	<font color=blue size=4>wish (off) on</font>\n<br>get rid of sth. unwanted by passing it on to sb. else 把自己不想要的东西推给别人\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not like to do the dishes and wished the job on to her little sister. 她不喜欢洗盘子，就把这差事推给她的小妹妹了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The young couple wished their naughty son off on his grandparents for the summer holidays. 那对年轻夫妇在暑假中把他们玩皮的儿子交给了祖父母看管。</font>\n
with a grain/pinch of salt	<font color=blue size=4>with a grain/pinch of salt</font>\n<br>with reserve or doubt 半信半疑；可疑\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll have to take what he says with a grain of salt. 他说的话你不可全信。</font>\n<br>with a heavy hand oppressively 压制；苛刻；用高压手段\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He ruled his household with a heavy hand. 他在家里太专横了。</font>\n
with a high hand	<font color=blue size=4>with a high hand</font>\n<br>with power; in force; triumphantly; overbearingly; arbitrarily 有权；有势；得意扬扬；压制；专横\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was capable enough but he carried everything with a high hand that we got to detest him. 他相当能干，但是他太霸道，所以我们讨厌他了。</font>\n
with a light heart	<font color=blue size=4>with a light heart</font>\n<br>merrily; cheerfully 愉快；欣然\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He accepted the invitation with a light heart. 他欣然接受了这个邀请。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our English teacher stepped into the classroom with a light heart. 我们的英语老师兴高采烈地走进了教室。</font>\n
with all one's heart	<font color=blue size=4>with all one's heart</font>\n<br>with a will; most willingly 甘心情愿；十分愿意\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I love her with all my heart. 我全心全意地爱她。</font>\n
with all one's might	<font color=blue size=4>with all one's might</font>\n<br>as much as one can 尽全力；全力以赴地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They battled the drought with all their might. In the end, they were rewarded with a bumper harvest. 他们全力以赴地与干旱作斗争，终于获得了丰收。</font>\n
with an eye to	<font color=blue size=4>with an eye to</font>\n<br>having reference to; intending or purposing 目的在于；着眼于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He reads English every morning with an eye to improving his pronunciation. 他每天早晨朗读英语，目的在于改进自己的发音。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He constructed his house with an eye to architectural beauty. 他建造房屋时着眼于建筑之美。</font>\n
with an ill grace	<font color=blue size=4>with an ill grace</font>\n<br>reluctantly 勉强地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He accepted the job with an ill grace. 他勉强地接受了这工作。</font>\n
with a view to	<font color=blue size=4>with a view to</font>\n<br>for the purpose of 为了；为了…起见；鉴于；由于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>With a view to improving his ability to speak French, he spent most of his holidays in France. 为了提高法语口语能力，他的大部分假期是在法国度过的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>This subject is one that should be handled with a view to the longrange interests of the country. 这是一个应从国家的长远利益来考虑的问题。</font>\n
with a will	<font color=blue size=4>with a will</font>\n<br>with willingness and zeal; with all one's heart or strength; earnestly; heartily 甘心情愿；热切；尽心尽力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She threw herself into the work with a will. 她全身心地投入了这项工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Whatever he does, he does it with a will. 他不论干什么，都尽心尽力。</font>\n
with bells on	<font color=blue size=4>with bells on</font>\n<br>with enthusiasm; eager or ready and in the best of spirits for an event 热烈地；热情地；兴高采烈地\n<br>—Will you come to our English evening? \n<br>—I'll be there with bells on.\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>—你来参加我们的英语晚会吗？</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>—我很乐意参加。</font>\n
with flying colors	<font color=blue size=4>with flying colors</font>\n<br>with great or total success; victoriously 非常成功；取得好的成绩\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He came through the examination with flying colors. 他考试取得了优异的成绩。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our team won the game and returned with flying colors. 我们的球队比赛获胜而凯旋。</font>\n
with good grace	<font color=blue size=4>with good grace</font>\n<br>politely; willingly; without complaining 有礼貌地；心甘情愿地；毫不埋怨地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He accepted the principal's criticism with good grace. 他很有礼貌地接受了校长的批评。</font>\n
with half an eye	<font color=blue size=4>with half an eye</font>\n<br>at a glance; without effort 看一眼；一瞥；不费劲\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Anyone with half an eye could see that the young teacher was in love with the girl. 任何人一看就知道那位青年教师已爱上那位女孩了。</font>\n
within reach of	<font color=blue size=4>within reach of</font>\n<br>within practicable traveling distance; near 在近处\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our house is within reach of the school. 我们家在学校附近。</font>\n
within reason	<font color=blue size=4>within reason</font>\n<br>within the limits of good sense; in reasonable control or check; moderate 合情合理；有节制的；适度的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Your demands are within reason. 你的要求是合情合理的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's qiute within reason for them to be late today. 今天他们来迟了是情有可原的。</font>\n
with one's eyes open	<font color=blue size=4>with one's eyes open</font>\n<br>knowing all the circumstances or consequences (usu. used in an unfavorable sense) 明知（故犯）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We punished him because he had made the mistake with his eyes open. 因为他是明知故犯，所以我们惩罚了他。</font>\n
without color	<font color=blue size=4>without color</font>\n<br>without disguise 不隐瞒；无掩饰\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Tell me directly without color, whether it be so or not. 不管情况是否如此，都请直率地告诉我。</font>\n
with reference to	<font color=blue size=4>with reference to</font>\n<br>concerning 关于；说到\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have nothing to say with reference to this question. 关于这个问题我没有什么话要讲。</font>\n
with respect to	<font color=blue size=4>with respect to</font>\n<br>concerning; with regard to 至于；关于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I have something to say with respect to our business. 关于我们的业务，我想说几句。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must plan with respect to the future. 我们订计划时必须考虑到未来。</font>\n
with the exception of	<font color=blue size=4>with the exception of</font>\n<br>except 除了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They passed the examination withthe exception of two. 除了两人外，他们考试都通过了。</font>\n
word for word	<font color=blue size=4>word for word</font>\n<br>1. in exactly the same words 一字不差地，原话\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Please tell me what the teacher said, word for word. 请把老师的原话告诉我。</font>\n<br>2. one word at a time 逐字地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a mistake to transtate the sentence word for word. 一个字一个字地翻译这个句子就错了。</font>\n
work at	<font color=blue size=4>work at</font>\n<br>1. be engaged in 致力于；从事于；钻研\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is working at a new subject. 他正在研究一门新的学科。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You will have to work at the weak points if you want to pass the examination. 你要想考试过关就得在你的薄弱环节上下功夫。</font>\n<br>2. do sth. with effort 在…上下功夫\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You'll crack this problem if you really work at it. 只要你下功夫就能解决这个问题。</font>\n
work away	<font color=blue size=4>work away</font>\n<br>keep on working 继续干；一个劲地干下去\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has been working away without a rest ever since breakfast. 他从早饭后就一直在忙个不停。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is still working away at her homework. 她还在做作业。</font>\n
work in	<font color=blue size=4>work in</font>\n<br>1. bring or put in; insert; penetrate 带进去；插进；引进\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The author worked in a few lines about his own life. 作者插进了几笔自己的经历。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>When he wrote his essay, he worked in several quotations of Chairman Mao. 他写文章时引用了几句毛主席的话。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He worked in the key and opened the room. 他把钥匙插进去，打开了房门。</font>\n<br>2. arrange a time for 为…安排出时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The doctor might be able to work you in between his other appointments, if you will just wait a while. 你如果愿意稍等片刻，医生或许能把你插在其他预约的病人中间给你看病。</font>\n
work in with	<font color=blue size=4>work in with</font>\n<br>fit in with; cooperate with; work harmoniously with 与…合拍；与…协调\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>My plans did not work in with his. 我的计划跟他的计划不协调。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll try to work my timetable in with yours. 我将设法把我的作息时间与你的协调起来。</font>\n<br>work off 1. lose or dispose of sth. by exercise or labor; get rid of（通过运动或劳动）去掉；消除掉；发泄\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Dick's digging the garden. He's trying to work his lunch off. 狄克在花园里挖地，他在设法把吃的午餐消化掉。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He worked off his anger by chopping wood. 他用砍木头来发泄他的怒气。</font>\n<br>2. pay or fulfil by working 通过工作来抵偿（债务等）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He worked off his debt by doing odd jobs. 他用打零工的方式来抵偿债务。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has no money, but he is willing to work off his check by washing dishes. 他没有钱，但他愿意以洗盘子来付清债务。</font>\n<br>3. finish up; complete 干完；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has worked off these urgent letters. 他已经把这些急信处理完毕。</font>\n
work on	<font color=blue size=4>work on</font>\n<br>1. try to influence or convince 企图影响或说服\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't go abroad this summer because I haven't got enough money, but perhaps I can work on father to give me a loan. 今年夏天我不能出国了，因为我的钱不够，不过或许我可以说服我父亲借我一笔钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Senator Smith worked on the other committee members to vote for the bill. 史密斯参议员说服委员会的其他委员投票赞成该提案。</font>\n<br>2. be engaged in;continue doing 从事；忙于；继续工作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is working on a new dictionary. 她一直在忙着编写一本新词典。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How can you work on so Long without a rest? 你怎么能连续工作这么久而不休息呢？</font>\n<br>3. produce an effect on 对…产生影响\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The medicine the doctor prescribed worked on his illness. 医生开的那种药对他的病有效果。</font>\n
work out	<font color=blue size=4>work out</font>\n<br>1. plan; develop; devise 计划；发展；设计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We must work out a plan acceptable to all as quickly as we can. 我们必须尽快订出一个大家都能接受的计划。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They formed a special group to work out measures for labor protection. 他们成立了一个特别小组来制定劳保措施。</font>\n<br>2. arrive at by calculation 计算；估算\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I'll give you five minutes to work out this problem. 我给你5分钟来解答这个题目。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Have you worked out what I owe you yet? 你把我欠你的钱算出来了吗？</font>\n<br>3. understand the nature of 理解；看出；判断\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It's a very strange situation. I can't work it out 这是一种奇怪的情况，我弄不清是怎么回事。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't work out the meaning of this poem. 我弄不懂这首诗的含义。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For as long as I've known him, I've never been able to work him out. 我虽然认识他这么久了，但一直摸不透他。</font>\n<br>4. use up; exhaust through exploitation 用尽；枯竭；采掘完\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The old mine is completely worked out. 那座老矿山已经被开采尽了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The professor never seems to be worked out. 这位教授好象有用不完的精力似的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She was worked out, having done the experiment for seven hours running. 她连续做了7个小时的实验，已经精疲力竭了。</font>\n<br>5. solve; bring about by work, effort or action; prove effective, practicable or suitable 解决；通过努力得到圆满解决；证明有效或实用\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't work this puzzle out. 这个难题我解决不了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't despair！Everything will work out all right in the end. 别灰心！一切最终都会圆满解决的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The system seems to be working out well. 这个制度似乎很有效。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>How the experiment will eventually work out only time can tell. 试验最后结果如何，只有让时间来说话。</font>\n<br>6. amount to a total or calculated figure 总计\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The car repairs work out at￡57. 汽车修理费总共是57镑。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The cost works out at ＄8 each. 每人的费用是8美元。</font>\n<br>7. exercise 进行锻炼\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The athletes of our university work out at the gym for two hours every day. 我们学校的运动员每天在体育馆锻炼两小时。</font>\n
work over	<font color=blue size=4>work over</font>\n<br>1. study or examine thoroughly 仔细检查；钻研\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>For the term paper I worked over 30 volumes of American history. 为了写学期论文，我钻研了30卷美国史书。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I spent some time in working over those statistic figures. 我花了一些时间去仔细检查那些统计数字。</font>\n<br>2. do again or anew 重新加工；翻新\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Every time I work the sum over, I get a different answer. 每次我复查这笔帐，得出的数字都不一样。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>We are going to work over the old furniture. 我们打算翻新旧家具。</font>\n<br>3. beat sb. up very roughly (in order to intimidate him or extort payment, etc.) 痛打（为了威胁或勒索）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They threatened to work him over until he talked. 他们威胁说要打到他开口为止。</font>\n
work up	<font color=blue size=4>work up</font>\n<br>1. build up gradually by effort, industry, etc.;develop steadily 通过努力、勤奋逐步建立；逐渐发展起来\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Smith has worked the firm up from almost nothing. 史密斯几乎是白手起家，搞起了这家公司。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It took us several years to work up a market for this product. 我们花了好几年时间才为这个产品打开了销路。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The business was almost bankrupt when he took it over but within a few years he had worked it up to be a prosperous concern. 他刚接管这个企业时，企业已濒临破产，但经过几年的努力，他渐渐地把它发展成为一个欣欣向荣的企业。</font>\n<br>2. rise to a higher position; advance 晋级；步步高升\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>If you have what it takes, you can work up to the presidency of the company. 如果你有本事，你可以升到公司总裁的地位。</font>\n<br>3. stir up; rouse; excite 鼓动起来，激起；使激动\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I can't work up any enthusiasm for the project, I'm afraid. 我恐怕对这项计划鼓不起什么热情。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's go out for a walk to work up an appetite. 我们出去走走吧，这样会增加食欲。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Her words worked him up into a rage. 她的话使他大发雷霆。</font>\n<br>4. make into sth. ; elaborately prepare 精心做成；制订\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The craftsman is working up the mass of clay into a toy figure. 工匠正把一团泥捏成一个玩具。</font>\n<br>Work these facts up into an article for a weekly journal. 把这些事实整理成一篇文章，在周刊上发表\n<br>5. increase in numbers or strength; improve in efficiency 增加；加强；提高效率\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>You can surely work up your speed if you practice. 只要你坚持练习，就一定能提高速度。</font>\n
worm out	<font color=blue size=4>worm out</font>\n<br>find out by devious means 用不正当的手段探出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They have wormed out all the information out of him. 他们已经从他那里骗取了所有的情报。</font>\n
worry out	<font color=blue size=4>worry out</font>\n<br>1. work out with patience and effort 耐心而努力地解决；绞尽脑汁解决\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Don't bother about it; I'll worry out the answer. 别为这事操心了，我会想出解决办法的。</font>\n<br>2. obtain by worrying or distressing 费尽心机弄到手；缠着不放要得到某物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They intend to worry the money out of you. 他们打算纠缠你要钱。</font>\n
worse off	<font color=blue size=4>worse off</font>\n<br>in a worse condition 情况恶化；处境更糟\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>After the devaluation of the dollar, they are worse off than before. 美元贬值后，他们的日子更艰难了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>I am far worse off than you are. 我的处境比你糟得多。</font>\n
worth one's salt	<font color=blue size=4>worth one's salt</font>\n<br>capable; talented 有能力的；有才干的\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The work he did really showed that he was worth his salt. 他所做的工作的确表明他是位很能干的。</font>\n
worthy of	<font color=blue size=4>worthy of</font>\n<br>deserving 值得；配得上\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is worthy of our trust and expectation. 他没有辜负我们的信任和期望。</font>\n
would rather	<font color=blue size=4>would rather</font>\n<br>an expression used to indicate strong preference 宁愿\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He would rather be poor than get money by dishonest methods. 他宁可穷也不愿意用不诚实的手段获取金钱。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Henry would rather that his girl friend worked in the same department as he does. 亨利希望他的女朋友和他在一个部门工作。</font>\n
wrap up	<font color=blue size=4>wrap up</font>\n<br>1. dress warmly; put on warm clothes 穿暖和\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wrap up well today; it's very cold. 今天很冷，穿暖和点。</font>\n<br>2. bring to an end, esp. a successful conclusion 圆满结束；完成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They wrapped up the business deal in less than an hour. 不到一小时，他们那笔生意就成交了。</font>\n<br>3. disguise; conceal 掩饰；掩盖\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wrapped up his meaning in a fancy speech. 他把自己的意图隐藏在精心设计的措词里。</font>\n<br>4. be quiet; shut up 安静；别吵；住口\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Wrap up, you boys, We are having a meeting in the next room. 安静点，孩子们，我们正在隔壁房间开会。</font>\n<br>5. cover or roll up in; envelop; cover completely 包起来；包扎；裹紧\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wrapped up the little child in a thick blanket. 她用厚毛毯把孩子裹得严严的。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wrapped up the parcel. 他包好了包裹。</font>\n<br>6. involve deeply; cause to be absorbed completely 深深卷入；使全神贯注；埋头于；深陷在…之中\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is wrapped up in his scientific studies. 他全神贯注地进行他的研究工作。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She is so wrapped up in him that she can't see his faults. 她痴情地爱他，看不到他身上的缺点。</font>\n
write down	<font color=blue size=4>write down</font>\n<br>1. depreciate or disparage by writing; play down in writing 写文章贬低或诋毁；把…写得不重要\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They tried in vain to write down the movement. 他们试图写文章诋毁这个运动，可是枉费心机。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The critics wrote down the play and it was withdrawn. 评论家们贬低这个戏剧，它被停演了。</font>\n<br>2. describe; regard 描述；看作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They seem to have written him down as a fool. 他们似乎把他写成了一个傻瓜。</font>\n<br>3. reduce the book value of 减低…的账面价值\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>These shares should be written down, as we want to attract more buying at present. 既然我们目前想吸引更多的人买进这些股票，就应该降低它的票面价格。</font>\n
write home about	<font color=blue size=4>write home about</font>\n<br>comment on at length, esp. in a favorable manner; excellent 值得大书特书；很精彩；好极了\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The exhibition was nothing to write home about. 展览会并没什么吸引人的精彩东西。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The entertainment at the New Year's party was something to write home about. 新年晚会的娱乐节目真是好极了。</font>\n
write off	<font color=blue size=4>write off</font>\n<br>1. cancel an entry in an account, as an unpaid and uncollectable debt 注销；勾销（无法收回的债）\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The debt has been written off. 债务已被一笔勾销。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>There seems to be no hope of ever getting the money back from Harry. I think you can write it off. 看来没有希望把钱从哈利那里收回了，我想可以把它勾销了。</font>\n<br>2. reject as beyond repair 因不能修理而抛弃；报废\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They wrote the car off. 他们报废了那辆汽车。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The library writes off a certain quantity of books each year. 图书馆每年都要报废一定数量的图书。</font>\n<br>3. compose quickly and easily 迅速而容易地写出；一口气写成\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He wrote five letters in half an hour. 他半小时写了5封信。</font>\n<br>4. reckon 认为；把…看作\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He was written off by his family as a failure, so they were very surprised when he passed all the exams and went to university. 家里人都认为他没有出息，所以，当他通过所有考试并且上了大学时，他们都惊讶不已。</font>\n
write oneself out	<font color=blue size=4>write oneself out</font>\n<br>exhaust one's writing ability by writing too much 竭尽才智无可再写\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He has written himself out. 他已经竭尽才智，写不出东西来了。</font>\n
write out	<font color=blue size=4>write out</font>\n<br>write in full; prepare in writing 全部写出；开出\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The teacher asked her to write the whole thing out. 老师让她把事情的始末都写出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She wrote out a cheque for ￡50. 她开了一张50镑的支票。</font>\n
write up	<font color=blue size=4>write up</font>\n<br>1. put into writing, esp. in full detail 详细记叙或描写某物\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The students were asked to write the chemistry experiment up for homework. 学生被要求把那次化学实验的报告作为家庭作业详细写出来。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>They wrote him up on the front page. 他们在报纸的头版详细报道了他。</font>\n<br>2. praise in writing 写文章赞扬\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The critics wrote up the acting of the players. 评论家们写文章赞扬了演员们的演技。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He'll write the play up in the next edition of the paper. 他将在下一期报纸上评述这出戏。</font>\n
year after year	<font color=blue size=4>year after year</font>\n<br>one year after another; many years 年复一年；年年\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Our agricultural production has gone up year after year. 我们的农业生产年年上升。</font>\n
year in,year out/year in and year out	<font color=blue size=4>year in,year out/year in and year out</font>\n<br>regularly through the years; continuously 年复一年；不断地\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>In the old society he worked for a landlord year in and year out but he still lived a miserable life. 在旧社会他年复一年地给地主干活，但还是过着悲惨的生活。</font>\n
yearn for	<font color=blue size=4>yearn for</font>\n<br>be filled with a longing desire for 渴望；向往；思念\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He yearned for his native land. 他思念故土。</font>\n
yield to	<font color=blue size=4>yield to</font>\n<br>1. comply with; give way to; submit to 顺从；让步；屈服于\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He is not the kind of people to yield to threats. 他不是那种屈服于威胁的人。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He yielded to temptation. 他屈服于诱惑之下。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The disease yielded to treatment. 这病经过治疗好了。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>She did not yield to his advice. 她不听他的劝告。</font>\n
zero hour	<font color=blue size=4>zero hour</font>\n<br>1. the exact time when an attack or other military action is supposed to start 发动攻击的时间；采取军事行动的时间\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The company was told that their zero hour was 3 a.m. 连队奉命于凌晨3点开始行动。</font>\n<br>2. the time when an important decision or change is supposed to come; the time for a dangerous action 做出重要决定或重要变动的时间；关键时刻；危急关头\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>It was zero hour and the doctor began the operation on the patient. 那是个关键的时刻，医生开始为那个病人动手术了。</font>\n
zero in on	<font color=blue size=4>zero in on</font>\n<br>1. adjust a gun so that it will exactly hit a target; aim at 向…瞄准\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The plane zeroed in on the enemy's arms factory and destroyed it with one bomb. 飞机瞄准了敌人的军工厂，一枚炸弹就把它炸毁了。</font>\n<br>2. give full attention to 全神贯注于；集中注意力\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>Let's zero in on this problem today. 我们今天研究这个问题。</font>\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>The children zeroed in on the toy display. 孩子们聚精会神地观看玩具展览。</font>\n
zip up	<font color=blue size=4>zip up</font>\n<br>1. add life, zest or interest to 给…增加生气、风味或兴趣；增添滋味\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>A little garlic will zip up the salad. 加点蒜头能使色拉更加可口。</font>\n<br>2. fasten or close by means of a zipfastener 拉上拉链\n<br><font color=red>* </font><font color=darkgreen>He put the money into his briefcase and zipped it up. 他把钱放进了手提包，然后拉上拉链。</font>\n
